Island Survival: I Bound the 100x Amplification System and Turned a Deserted Island into a Kingdom!

Channel: Revel Manga Chronicles Published: 2026-02-21 307,737 words Source: auto_caption

Transcript

Linmo is an extreme athlete who has challenged extreme environments such as the world's highest peak, glaciers, and caves throughout his career and has succeeded many times. One day, he was surfing at the beach, racing against a ferocious shark behind him. Suddenly, a wave 2 m high crashed in, and in an instant, Lyno and everything on the shore were swallowed up by the wave. When he woke up again, he rubbed his eyes and found himself floating on a Greystone platform about 6 square meters in size, surrounded by an endless blue ocean. At first, Lyn Mo found it hard to believe, but he quickly slapped himself twice, the pain telling him it was real.

He realized he might have traveled to another world. Just then, a voice rang out. Linmo and all humans aged 18 to 50 worldwide have completed their migration. Each allocated six square meters of island space. The only tool is a fishing rod.

Supplies will be obtained through fishing. Lynn Mo's pupils suddenly contracted and he quickly looked down at his side. Sure enough, a simple wooden fishing rod lay there quietly. He realized that he had been transported into a survival game. He also noticed he was wearing a fitness tracker.

He touched the tracker and a light screen instantly appeared. Island level zero talent unawwakened resources none. Status mildly dehydrated hungry. Next, Linmo noticed features such as chat channels, world regional private chat, trading platform, and crafting interface. He opened the chat channels and found many people discussing and complaining.

Then when he switched to the regional channel to check the information, the systems mechanical voice sounded again. Daily check-in system activated. All survivors can check in once per day. Lynn Emmo silently said, "Check in." And then the system notification appeared. Check-in successful.

Congratulations on receiving 1x 500 ml purified water. 1x 200g white bread 100x amplification system successfully bound. The system also details the talent. The host will receive a 100fold increase in the quantity of resources acquired through any direct means. Note, resources acquired through trade or blueprints/ templates will not be eligible for this increase.

The next second, the water bottle in Lin Mo's hand multiplied into a 100 bottles and the bread into 100 pieces. Seeing this, he was overjoyed, but also became alert, guessing that the others might be short of food. He unscrewed a bottle of water, drank a third of it, and cleared his head. He then broke off a piece of bread and ate it, regaining some strength before starting to organize his thoughts. Lyn Mo quickly analyzed the rules.

Only resources obtained directly would enjoy a 100x increase, which meant he had to personally sign in and do the work. He quickly devised a plan. He opened the trading platform and found that no one was selling food. So he anonymously posted a sale notice selling 50 ml of pure water requirements. Would X5 or palm leaves X10 or stone X3? Feeling that he hadn't sold enough items, Lynn Mo chose to sell more.

For sale 50g of white bread, about a quarter of a loaf needs 20 fibers or one rope or one metal sheet. The transaction was completed quickly after seeing Lin Mo selling water on the regional channel. Many people commented and even praised him as a good person. But Lynn Mo knew in his heart that he was just doing business. After acquiring the supplies, Lynn Mo decided to try fishing.

He picked up his fishing rod and cast it into the water. 10 minutes later, he caught a wooden crate. Inside the crate were two foundation stones, one rope, and one rough island expansion blueprint. onetime use. The system prompted Linmo that he could increase the number of wooden crates he had obtained to 100.

Then 100 wooden crates fell onto the island. Linmo opened some of the crates and began to think about how to build a shelter. As the sea breeze grew cooler, Lin Mo knew he had to find a place to stay for the night. So, he built a simple thatched hut using wood and palm leaves and laid out dried palm leaves as a mattress inside. Although the shelter was very simple, Lin Moe's life was already considered luxurious compared to other players.

Now, Lynn Mo possesses 99 bottles of water, 99 loaves of bread, nearly 100 unopened supply boxes, and a pile of basic materials. The anonymous merchant, Mr. J, is officially born. As dawn broke, Lynn Emmo woke up in a Thatch hut. He first unscrewed a bottle of water and took a couple of sips, then broke off a piece of bread and chewed it slowly.

Next, he checked in and received 100g of compressed biscuits and 10 iron nails. He opted for a 100x multiplier, and immediately the original one bag of military grade compressed biscuits became 100 bags and a,000 rusty nails piled up in the corner. Next, he decided to accumulate raw resources through trading. Linmo entered the trading platform and found that the prices of food and water were becoming increasingly outrageous. He noticed that foundation stones appeared very infrequently.

So, he began to study how to obtain more foundation stones. A message caught his attention. Upgrading the island to LV1 requires 10 foundation stones, 20 wood, and 15 stones. The top 10 upgraders across the server will receive additional rewards. Lynmo felt both excited and wary.

Lynn and Mo decided to gather enough materials for the upgrade. So, he opened 10 wooden crates. Once he had enough materials, he decided to stop temporarily and take advantage of the information and resource gaps to complete the first round of harvesting. He started placing orders on the trading platform, offering to buy basic materials that he didn't really need, but that other players might desperately need at low prices, promising immediate payment. He also posted several sales listings.

For sale, 300 ml of purified water in exchange for two bay stones or one complete fishing rod or special blueprints. For sale, 200g of white bread in exchange for five metal materials or tool blueprints. Lynn Mo used water and bread, which cost almost nothing to acquire a large amount of basic materials at low prices and then used higher prices to acquire precious resources. thus quickly completing the acquisition. A few minutes later, Lynmo's inventory underwent a dramatic change.

About oneif of his food and water had been consumed, but in return, he had a mountain of materials such as wood, stone, and fiber. People on the regional channel gradually became aware of Lin Moe's trading methods, and some criticized him as a shrewd businessman, but Lynn Mo didn't care at all. Just 5 minutes later, he fished up another wooden supply crate. Upon opening it, he obtained four foundation stones, eight pieces of wood, two complete glass bottles, and one simple water purifier blueprint. One-time use.

Lynmo looked at the water purifier blueprints when the system notification sounded again. Triggered 100x amplification. Amplify. He chose to amplify without hesitation and then received 100 wooden boxes. He didn't open them all, but opened 21st, obtaining a rough arrow crafting template.

a template. Limo's eyes lit up because templates could be crafted infinitely. He roughly estimated that he had enough foundation stones to upgrade several levels and could start preparing for the upgrade. Lynmo looked at the edge of the island, thinking to himself, "But he must upgrade only after ensuring safety." Lynmo then opened the trading platform. He began using his abundant wood and stone to exchange for scarcer resources such as metal ingots.

Gradually, people started calling him a profiteer. Lynn Mo silently calculated his resources and planned his next move. At noon, he continued fishing. He caught a wooden box and obtained rough animal hide X1, Flynn X2, and unknown metal fragment X3. In the afternoon, Lynn Mo changed a strategy.

He started listing some non-essential but tempting items for sale. For example, he would exchange 50g of bread for a piece of information or intelligence. Want to test the value of information in this world. Soon, trade requests poured in. Someone traded 50g of bread for schools of bioluminescent fish in a nearby waters at night.

Another traded 100 ml of water for a sea shell with strange symbols engraved on it. Suddenly, a mysterious private message caught Linmo's attention. He opened the message and found that the sender's ID was no at all and the sender's asking price was 10 loaves of bread. Lyno thought for a moment and replied, "I'll pay two loaves of bread as a deposit first." After the transaction was completed, Linmo received a coordinate with the following note. I personally witnessed someone fishing up a locked box in this area.

Lynn Mo noted down the coordinate. He closed his private messages and instead checked the island upgrade requirements on his bracelet. He already had more than enough materials. Lynn Mo tallied up his day's gains. Most of his food and water were still there, and basic materials were piled up like a mountain.

Standing on the edge of the island, Lynn Emmo found the allure of being the first in the entire server to level up particularly tempting. He began to consider whether he should continue developing his character or first claim the system reward. After much deliberation, Linmo had made up his mind. He decided to choose the most opportune moment. Back under the thatched hut, he lit a small campfire.

The fire light dispelled the chill and illuminated his calm, deep eyes. In a regional chat, some people form alliances by sharing a piece of bread, while others become bitter enemies over a half- empty bottle of water caught by fish. This world is rapidly evolving into a multifaceted place. After dinner, Lynn and Mo added firewood to the campfire and then picked up his fishing rod. In the night, the fluorescent glow on the float twinkled and his arrow was quietly dawning.

On the morning of the third day, Linmo was awakened by the sound of heavy rain. He crawled out of Thatch hut and found the sky overcast and the air pressure so low it made him feel suffocated. He knew the weather had changed, so he began signing in. Soon the systems voice sounded. Acquired windproof tarpolin x1 tough hemp rope x2.

Then Lynn Mo's bracelet announced a storm will descend upon areas numbered SH 700 to SH 800 in 24 hours. Lynn Mo was instantly a buzz when he saw the regional channel. He knew a business opportunity had arrived. After 2 days of accumulation, he possessed a large quantity of building materials as well as 100 pieces of windproof tarpollen and animal hides. He quickly began to consider how to integrate these resources.

This time, Lyn Mo chose to put up a sell order first. He received a large number of transaction requests, and while processing them, he habitually checked the other party's ID to distinguish between the vulnerable and the malicious. Lynn Mo's attitude towards these two groups was completely different. This round of transactions brought him a large amount of valuable foundation stones, metals, and several decent blueprints, including a simple rainwater collector template. For Lyn Mo, this transaction was a huge success.

At this moment, a private message caught Lin Mo's attention. He checked the user ID and found that the sender was named Sue Chian. Linmo remembered that this person had professional marine knowledge and had saved many people. So, he carefully read the message and replied to the sender. Such an I need a piece of waterproof material for a 4 square meter shed.

She exchanged it for a simple herbal drying rack template and added a sentence. This storm may come early and its intensity may be higher than the system forecast. Linmo add another specific criterion for judgment. Su Chian, I saw seagulls flying toward the shore and I also observe long waves. Long waves are a sign of an approaching storm.

The deal was quickly struck and Su Chanhan sent another message. Thank you. Also, you said a high price, but the transaction was straightforward. Lynn Mo replied, "I'm just a businessman." And then into the chat. Lyn Mo continued his work.

As time went on, prices soared further while the materials he had accumulated didn't decrease. In fact, they increased. At this point, he decided to execute the second step of his plan. He created a new anonymous account and posted a new buy order. At this time, many people were quickly selling off their basic materials in order to exchange for waterproof cloth or upgrade their islands.

Lynmo, on the other hand, bought low and sold high, collecting these materials that were being sold off. Lynmo's total supply of basic materials not only didn't decrease, but actually increased. Meanwhile, the valuable hard currency began to draw more criticism with many accusing him of being a profiteer. After completing a transaction, Lin Moe's bracelet vibrated and the system reminded him that he could upgrade his island and that someone had already upgraded yesterday. He wasn't surprised, but he didn't choose to upgrade.

Lynn Mo planned to upgrade the island before or after the storm, which would divert everyone's attention. The newly upgraded island might be more vulnerable to the storm. So, he decided to postpone the upgrade. He began to reinforce his island himself. He secured the tarpollen to the thatched hot frame with ropes and did other necessary work.

After finishing, he boiled water and enjoyed dinner. After finishing dinner, Lynn Emmo looked out at the sea, lamenting that his reputation as a cunning businessman was now firmly established. His true test and opportunity, however, would arrive after the storm. The prelude to the storm intensified abruptly at midnight. The wind began to howl, but Lynn Mo remained awake.

Wrapped in an animal skin, he sat at the innermost edge of the thatched hut, his eyes glued to the chat channel. Lynn Emmo suddenly remembered that Sue Chanchian's judgment was correct. The storm had come early, but the Tempest still couldn't shake his island and sturdy cabin. He checked the competition leaderboard and found that the second and third place winners had almost collected enough upgrade materials. A glint flashed in Linmo's eyes, and he decided to upgrade his island.

At this moment, he chose to upgrade anonymously, and instantly the bracelet shone brightly. The 10 foundation stones, 20 pieces of wood, and 15 stones piled in the corner flew to the edge of the island. And after the island shook violently, the upgrade was successful. System notification: island has reached LV1 10 m. Gained buff.

Basic stability slightly increases the island stability in severe weather. Serverwide announcement coming soon. Lynn Emo typed a letter J. The announcement quickly rang out. Congratulations to Survivor J for becoming the first person globally to upgrade their island to LV1.

Rewards refined fishing ground beginner X1 Keystone X50 pure water 500 ml X10 white bread 200g X10. Subsequently, Lynn Emmo activated the 100x multiplier effect, gaining 100 times the resources. After the initial shock, he stored the resources back in the system warehouse. As for those who upgraded first and didn't receive the system reward, it's because they chose to remain completely anonymous. While Lin Mo used the name Jay to upgrade publicly, which is why he received the reward.

Lin Mo saw various jealous and attacking voices in the chat channel, but he didn't care. He took out the fish farm template, examined it, and began to consider whether to build it. After some thought, Lynn Mo realized that building a fish farm would not only provide a food source, but also bring in a large number of fish through a 100fold increase in yield. Taking all factors into consideration, he decided to begin construction at a suitable time. Amidst the raging storm at sea, Lynn Emmo leaned against the bedside, watching the changes on the leaderboard with a calm and composed mind.

for only those who upgraded their island for the first time could receive the huge reward. As the storm continued to rage, Linmo pondered how to leverage his number one status and the newly acquired fishing ground template to tap into more resources and rapidly develop the business after the storm subsided. The name J will henceforth become the target of countless people's speculation, fear, and yearning to emulate. And what Lyno wants to do is make this target unattainable. The storm gradually subsided in the early morning hours when the first pale rays of dawn pierced the leaden clouds and illuminated the ravaged sea.

Even one island was missing. He checked the chat channel and found that everyone was buying supplies, but Linmo remained unmoved. He knew that the important thing now was to check his own situation first. Lynmo checked the bracelet, storage space, thatch hut, and supplies. After confirming everything was all right, he began to eat bread and drink water to conserve his strength.

Only by staying in good condition could he do more. Next, he began to methodically clear away the debris on the island, collecting usable pieces of wood and buoys. He planned to sell these supplies in exchange for some resources. When he opened the trading platform, he found that the prices of all items had skyrocketed to outrageous levels. Not wanting to draw too much attention, he decided to sell his supplies in a different way.

Being high-profile wasn't a good option at this point. So, Lin Mo posted a thread titled some personal experiences on storm reinforcement and post- disaster emergency handling under the pseudonym an anonymous person who luckily survived the storm. Lynmo's post was concise and to the point, packed with essential information. He even included a diagram at the end illustrating the construction of the rainwater boiling device. Soon, a flood of replies poured in.

Several valuable private messages caught Lin Mo's attention. Su Chanchian asked him if he was interested in exchanging weather information. The Dragon Soul Squad expressed their desire to establish a communication channel with him, and Wings of Freedom expressed their desire to purchase anti-inflammatory herbs. Lynmo replied to Sue Chanchan first. We can exchange.

I need the wind direction and wave change forecast for the SH 739 area for the next 48 hours. I can provide a traditional remedy for quick heistasis using common seaweed. Then Lenmo replied to Dragon Soul Steel Gun. Thank you for your recognition. Information can be shared to a limited extent.

I need to know if the systems weather forecast has any patterns and if there is any other information related to achieving first place. Finally, Lynmo did not reply directly to Wings of Freedom, but instead posted a sale notice on his alternate account for sale core Essentials for Survival and Reconstruction after the storm price two X anti-inflammatory herbs any type. After the listing was posted, the comment section was once again filled with attacks and sarcasm directed at Lyn Mo, but he didn't care at all. Soon after, Lynn Mo saw numerous transaction requests. The first transaction was for a rough stone carding blueprint.

Following the first transaction, a second one followed immediately. This transaction yielded Lynn Emmo a small pile of scattered metal, a few blueprint templates, and several actual herbs. Combined with the recipe Sue Chanchian was about to exchange, he could attempt to make medicine. Subsequently, Lin Mo used the same anonymous account that had previously posted the knowledge listing to post a new transaction. He sold reinforced waterproof tarpollen and ultra tough composite rope at a 20% increase in price compared to what he sold before the storm.

At the same time, Lynn Mo began to slowly release the large amount of basic materials, timber, stone, fiber. He had previously stockpiled at prices slightly higher than the current market price, but still far lower than the prices he paid when he acquired them before the storm. Now, Linmo has completed yet another perfect resource cycle and value creation, and he's beginning to move towards becoming a capitalist. Meanwhile, the attacks against him in the chat room have not stopped. Lynn Mo counted his gains.

He had a small inventory of metal materials, a few more blueprint templates, and several portions of key herbs. More importantly, he had established information channels through his communication with Sue Chian and Dragon Soul. He walked to a corner of the island and looked at the pile of light blue fishing ground templates. He planned to build a fishing ground, creating a barrier that would make others beg for his services. After finalizing his plan, he began construction.

A new day has begun, and Lin Mo's business empire has just completed its first bloody initial accumulation and is about to enter the next stage. The road to rise is always fraught with skepticism. On this ocean, survival and thriving is the only truth and Linmo is steadily moving forward on this path. Chapter 6. Construction of the fish farm begins another turbulent turn.

The construction of Lin Mo's first sophisticated fish farm was more complex than he had anticipated. Although the steps were clear on the blueprints, careful attention and certain skills were required in actual operation. Lynn Emmo spent most of the morning building the main structure of the first fishing ground. This fishing ground was located on the leeward southwest corner of the island, covering an area of about four square meters with pebbles and sand laid on the bottom. Although the output of this fish farm is not expected to be high, Linmo looked at the other 99 templates in the corner and calculated that 100 fish farms could stably produce hundreds of fish every day, which would become his reliance to get rid of the food crisis.

Lynn Emmo built all of this. But while he had enough foundation stones, he lacked sufficient timber and stone, and water containers were even scarcer. He knew this task would take time and require meticulous planning. Linmo opened his bracelet and first dealt with the messages he received last night. Such Chanchian sent a timely weather forecast.

Next, Lin Mo saw the information about Dragon Soul Steel Gun, which revealed that Wings of Freedom was collecting fragments of some special relic. Lynmo replied, "Message received. Cooperation can be discussed." He then requested that the other party provide a list of wings of freedom personnel and their operational patterns in the SH739 area as a bargaining chip. The fish fry problem became a headache for Lyno. The system didn't explain how to obtain them, so he decided to solve it through trading.

He posted advertisements in the area and shops buying healthy saltwater fish. Each can be exchanged for fresh water or bread. Despite some skepticism, the lure of food and fresh water quickly brought in trading requests. Lynmo Mo's first trade was with a dying clown fish. He paid for 100 milliliters of water and released the clown fish into the fish farm.

Over the next few hours, Lynn Mo continued to acquire more than 20 small sea fish. Although most of them were not in good condition, at least they were alive and had entered the pond, and the expected output of the fish farm slowly increased. The trading not only allowed Linmo mo to acquire fish fry but also enabled him to observe the situation of some players which was equivalent to conducting small-cale intelligence gathering. As evening fell a shout caught everyone's attention. The speaker liu poisonous snake accused merchants of buying live fish and incited everyone to boycott these inscrupulous merchants ignored.

He switched back to his alternate account for buying fish and posted a short message. Not long after, transactions actually became more frequent than before. Lee Kuay's cursing was eventually drowned out by the flood of trade messages. Lynn and Mo continued processing the transactions, remaining calm and releasing small fish into the fish pond one by one. Gradually, the number of fish in the pond increased, and the fish pond began to come alive again.

As night fell, Lynn Emote sat by the fish pond, watching the fish swim among the water. This foreshadowed the beginning of his future plans in this sea area. Lyn Mo looked up at the starry sky, a vague plan forming in his mind. Should he continue buying fish fry tomorrow or start planning the construction of his second fish farm? Or perhaps what should he do with his first fish? Chapter 7. The first bucket of fish.

Undercurrents abound. On the morning of the third day, Lynn Mo caught his first mullet with a modified net, which then activated a 100fold amplification, granting him 100 portions of fish meat. Looking at the still wriggling live fish in the net, Lynn Mo pondered to himself that the timing of the amplification judgment was a product of the instantaneous action of acquiring. He released the live fish back, thinking that this fish could continue to grow and might even reproduce, leaving him with sustainable resources. He then continued to check in and received rough fish bait, one pack X1, and simple fish basket blueprint, disposable, X1.

After the boost, he obtained a large amount of fish bait and 100 fish basket blueprints. Lynn Mo began other tasks. Dragon Soul Steel Gun sent intelligence about the Wings of Freedom Squad. Lynn Mo recorded this information and by analyzing the data and channel information, deduced several possible locations where supplies would be found. Next, Lin Mo posted a purchase request using an anonymous alternate account, stating that he was a long-term buyer of live shrimp, small crabs, shellfish, and various edible seaweed.

Furthermore, he would only conduct fish and meat transactions with his previous partners. During the transaction, Lenmo also intentionally revealed that he needed a large amount of timber and stone to expand the experimental pool. In doing so, he once again traded fish for these basic building materials, successfully facilitating the flow of resources. By noon, the regional channel had changed and an urgent distress message dominated the screen. A large shark is attacking the island.

Lynn Mo noticed that rafts were starting to appear in the distress messages, meaning that someone had gained the ability to move. Lynn Emmo immediately contacted Sue Chanchen. Do you think this is an ordinary shark? Such Chian quickly replied, "It might be a sea monster that has been enhanced due to the rules of this world. This indicates that there will be an extremely powerful threat. New needs began to emerge.

Defense and weapons." Lynmo had some rough arrow templates, but what he needed more were ranged weapons, so he tried to obtain them from unopened chests. Lynmo then opened 20 chests, mostly containing foundation stones, wood, and stone. However, in the 17 chest, he obtained the simple crossbow crafting blueprint. Lynn Emmo immediately studied the blueprint and began crafting. Picking up a crossbow and a rough wood, Linmo tried to shoot.

Although his first shot missed the target, he used a secondary account to post procurement information related to the blueprints for long-range attack weapons. The purchase request didn't receive an immediate response, clearly indicating that weapons manufacturer knowledge was more valuable and sensitive in food. But Lin Mo was in a hurry. This was just a test. He knew the seed had been sewn.

In the afternoon, he continued tending to the fish pond and made several simple fish baskets using the blueprints, hoping to catch some shrimp and crabs. In the evening, he checked the regional channel again. There seemed to be no further news regarding the shark attack. Lee Kuay jumped in again, his encouragement for unity clearly aimed at winning over followers and establishing his authority. Linmo did not respond.

As night fell, Linmo sat in the fish farm. He knew that the first fish caught meant that a stable food supply was beginning to take off. While the shark attack foreshadowed a more direct threat that was about to come, the acquisition and purchase of the wooden crossbow blueprints signified his preparation for military force. While the forces operating in the shadows were quietly making their moves, Linmo gripped the crossbow tightly, feeling its heavy weight. In this sea, survival is no longer just a competition for resources, but a contest of strength and strategy.

And he will quietly carve out a place for himself in this game. He gazes southeast at the dark sharkinfested waters. What would come knocking next? Chapter 8. Fish meat enters the market, bidding in secrecy. After achieving a stable production of mullet, he chose a more discreet route to sell it.

using a rarelyused anonymous account to contact a user named Oldch Chun. He messaged Loud Chun through a secondary account. I have a reliable source for fresh fish, but it's not cheap and the source can't be revealed. Are you interested? La quickly replied, "What kind of fish? How fresh is it? How do we trade?" Lin Mo replied, "It's mullet. Each piece weighs about 3 ounces, and I can only provide a maximum of five pieces per day.

I only exchange it for hard currency or important information such as weapons. Oldchin finally replied 15 pieces of fish meat. He said he would exchange them for a rough wooden barricade templates. Lin Mo knew this was a defensive building template and finally agreed. He chose a neutral coordinate not far from the two islands and the transaction was completed an hour later.

The shark attacks remain a hot topic leading to a surge in demand for weapons and defenses. The previously quiet weapons trading posts are now appearing more frequently. Leo is very active in the channel, constantly promoting the concept of collective defense, which Lin Mo sneers inwardly. He switched back to his alternate account and a message caught his attention. The messages ID was a string of gibberish and it simply stated, "Reliable longrange weapon manufacturing technology available.

In-person verification required. Extremely high price." Lynn Mo replied, "How do I verify my qualifications?" The other party sent coordinates, which were far from Linmo, and said they would meet in 3 days. Lynn Emmo noted down the coordinates and contacted Dragon Soul Steel Gun. Dragon Soul Steel Gun replied, "It's a dangerous area. I don't recommend going there." Lynmo had an idea.

That garbled ID was either a reclusive master or a trap. After ending the communication, Lynn Mo stared at the distant coordinates filled with hesitation. At this moment, he was more inclined to profit from the hype surrounding the weapon purchases. He listed semi-finished weapons such as specially processed hardwood shafts and standard stone spearheads for sale on his alternate account. Linmo exchanged these semi-finish products, which cost almost nothing for a considerable amount of supplies and some intelligence.

One piece of information caught his attention. There was a rocky area that exposed a large beach at low tide, covered with oysters and barnacles. Lynn Mo noted the location and considered building a bamboo raft. As dusk fell, the fish in the fishing grounds swam peacefully. He hadn't caught his second fish today, and the systems expected yield remained zero to two portions, consistent with his unstable setting.

He checked the fish baskets next to the fishing grounds and found little catch. Lie Kuay was organizing a joint defense discussion meeting. Lynn Immo noticed that the wings of freedom remained silent, but their people were constantly acquiring supplies. Suchian made a rare public analysis post, listing the habits of sharks and receiving many thanks. There was no new information from Dragon Soul, but Lynn Mo sensed that the information network beneath the surface was rapidly being woven.

He returned to the Thatch hut and began making his first rough wooden shio friez. The next storm might not come from the sky, but from the seemingly calm yet actually treacherous sea of the human heart. Chapter 9. First exploration of the reef, an unexpected ally. Building the raft was far more difficult than Lynn and Mo had imagined.

It took him entire day to barely cobble together a usable raft. It moved forward entirely by hand. Lynn and Mo chose to set off at dawn. He dragged several barricades to the edge of the island and secured them in key positions. He then set off with a simple crossbow, five wooden arrows, weapons, and food on his back.

He paddled into the water and the raft slowly left the island. Using the simple compass on his wristband, Lynn Emmo adjusted his course. He paddled very slowly and about 2 hours later, he saw his destination. A cluster of dark gray reefs gradually rose from the water, resembling the spine of a giant beast. Lyn Mo stopped the raft and carefully observed the surrounding environment.

After waiting for about half an hour to confirm that it was safe, Lin Mo went ashore. Upon arriving on the island, Lin Mo first noticed a broken plastic bucket. To his surprise, he found an item wrapped in tarpollen nestled in a crevice of a rock. Carefully unwrapping the tarpollen, he discovered it was a fragment of a map. The map displayed several strange symbols, one of which, circled in red, stood out prominently, next to which were the characters for touch beard.

Search warm currents converge, school of fish. He quickly tucked the map fragments away from his body. Then he began collecting oysters and barnacles. These are excellent food supplements and relatively easy to store. Live ones can be kept in seawater.

He then heard the sound of splashing. Lynn and Mo quickly lowered his body, pressing himself against a rock. The sound of splashing grew closer, accompanied by heavy breathing and muffled curses. Damn it. Can't shake them off.

Lyn Mo's gaze swept across, and he saw two disheveled figures. Less than 20 m behind them, a rapidly approaching triangular dorsal fin sliced through the water. Lynn Moe's heart tightened. It seemed to be a juvenile bull shark, small in size, but noticeably faster. Just as the two men had dragged the raft halfway to the reef, the dark shadow closed in, accelerated, and slammed into the raft, which was still submerged in the water.

The two men quickly hid. Lynmo's pupils contracted slightly. He recognized one of them as Big Lou, the man who had sold him the live fish before, but who seemed very honest. He didn't know the other man. He was considering whether to save them.

If the bull shark succeeds in hunting here, this reef area will become its hunting ground, and all the resources he has painstakingly accumulated will be lost. Lynn Mo decided to take action. Lynmo quickly retrieved his makeshift crossbow and accurately aimed at the shark's dorsal fin, which was exposed above the water, its most vulnerable spot. Lynmo pulled the trigger. The shark was hit and its blood stained the surrounding seawater red.

After being shot, the shark swiftly fled, leaving the two people on the reef stunned. They stared in the direction the shark had disappeared, still shaken, then looked around blankly. Lynmo then quickly boarded a raft and left. Lynmo only slowed down slightly after leaving the reef area and confirming that the two people were not chasing him. His heart was still pounding.

The expedition yielded far more than expected. shellfish, potentially invaluable fragments of nautical charts, and a secret rescue. This act of kindness was far more valuable than any direct resource transaction. Lynmo glanced back at the receding reef area. It was as if nothing had happened.

It was still a potential source of food and materials. But after this experience, he knew he had to be much more careful next time. It was nearly noon when they rode back to their island. Lynn Mo hid the raft and immediately checked the barricades and fishing grounds. The fishing grounds panel showed that they had harvested another portion of fish meat today, bringing the total to 99 portions.

Lynn Mo processed the collected oysters and barnacles, then took out the three fragments of the nautical chart. The charts were marked with small blue dots, and next to them was written, "Erosion eddies may contain abundant resources." He memorized this information. In the afternoon, Lynn Mo handled some transactions as usual, mainly orders for special hardwood poles and composite ropes, continuing to quietly accumulate resources and intelligence. On the regional channel, Lee Kuay was extensively publicizing the achievements of their self-defense force. Su Chian posted a brief announcement.

The area of abnormal temperature in the southeastern sea is showing a trend of expansion. There was no new information from Dragon Soul. The mysterious invitation was still 2 days away. Lyno sat by the fish farm eating grilled oysters. His first proactive exploration, though somewhat risky, had been very fruitful.

But he knew this was just the beginning. He needed faster boats, better weapons, more comprehensive intelligence, and reliable teammates. He recalled the image of Doo and his companion back to back raising their wooden spears on the reef. The premise was that everything had to be completely under control. He wondered where he should go on his next sea voyage.

He knew that the next step required careful planning. Chapter 10. Ocean invasion videos sold as guides. Linmo did not attend the mysterious invitation. He crossverified the information about the vicinity of that coordinate point through different channels.

Combining this with a warning from the dragon soul, Linmo came to a conclusion. The risks of the adventure far outweighed the potential rewards. Lynn Mo analyzed that there were at least three different groups of forces active near the coordinates. The so-called non-blint technology was likely just a lure to attract people like him who were eager for advanced weapon technology and had certain strength and resources. He turned his attention back to the island's development.

He constructed three more barricades which together with the existing facilities formed a simple yet effective defensive line at the islands for corners. Meanwhile, the number of fish fry in his fish farm increased to over 30 and the expected yield rose to one to three portions. One morning, the sign-in light shone brighter than usual. Congratulations, you have obtained 1X archery skill book one-time use. 1x desalination plant template elementary.

Linmo immediately activated the amplification and 100 duplicate rewards appeared before him. He first picked up the basic archery skill book. He silently recited the instructions. Lynn Mo subconsciously picked up the simple crossbow beside him, knocked an arrow, and aimed at a floating object on the distant sea. The feeling was completely different.

Although it was only basic, his accuracy had increased by 30%. Next, he learned about desalination plant templates. He decided to make one to try it out. This would take some time. Around noon, a global announcement suddenly sounded.

A marine invasion event is about to begin. Event area. Area's sh to SH 800. Warning. A large number of aggressive marine creatures will attack all islands in this area.

The announcement was repeated three times and the regional channel exploded instantly. Linmo stood up abruptly, his eyes sharp. He didn't panic. Instead, he calmed down and quickly took stock of his defenses for a shioodaf, a simple crossbow equipped with basic archery skills, 20 wooden arrows, stone axes, and other supplies. He then found a waterproof electronic watch with a recording function.

He wanted to record the attack to sell it for money. According to the outline, Lynn Mo easily repelled the attack using weapons and defenses that were 100 times stronger. and then anonymously sold the recording for an exorbitant price. After preparing everything, Lin Mo received an urgent intelligence message from Su Chanchian. Key intelligence tells Lin Mo to reply immediately.

You also need to be careful. Such Chian replied, "I have the S-level talent heart of the ocean, which allows me to communicate with gentle creatures." They ended the communication. Finally, the countdown reached zero. The first to surge ashore were countless large sea cockroaches, each the size of a palm with shiny black shells. Like a black tide, Lyn Mo raised his makeshift crossbow and fired at the giant cockroaches.

Lyn Mo disrupted the rhythm of several large red cockroaches. And at the same time, the first wave of sea cockroaches finally crashed into the barricades. Lynmo seized the opportunity to switch to his stone ax, and he chopped with all his might. Blood splattering everywhere. Although the battle was brief, it was exceptionally fierce.

The second wave of attacks quickly followed. Dozens of slender silver gray barracudas, their mouths full of sharp teeth, lunge straight at Linmo. Lynn Mo immediately retreated, firing a barracuda in rapid succession. But one barracuda broke through the defenses, biting hard into the animal hide tied to his calf. Lynn Emmo swung his ax at the head of the pike.

He used the barricades and his agile movement to fight back. But just then, the pike that had rushed forward even began attacking its own kind. This was because Sue Chanchian's talent was coming into play. Lynn and Mo seized the opportunity, hurling two sharpened wooden spears that successfully pierced the other two barracudas. The barracudas began to retreat.

The sea temporarily returned to calm. He checked his digital watch. It should have recorded most of the events. Then came the third wave of attacks, the final test. The sea swelled and a giant red killer crab, the size of a water tank, slowly crawled onto the island.

This was a real test. Lynn Mo retreated repeatedly, his attacks temporarily ineffective, and he began to carefully observe the giant crab. While dodging, he fired his last few wooden arrows at its joints and compound eyes. Ultimately, Lin Montak emerged victorious. Suddenly, the system notification sounded.

Successfully repelled the marine life invasion. Received 30 foundation stones, 50 wood, 40 stones, one simple watchtowwer blueprint, one time use, three tough crab shells. A 100x reward was also triggered. After resting for a few minutes, he treated the wound on his leg, then put away his digital watch and check the video. Although the angle was fixed and the image was somewhat shaky, the intense struggle had been clearly recorded.

He carefully saved the video. Then he switched to his most secretive anonymous main account, Jay, which he only used at crucial moments, and posted an exorbitantly priced trade order. First ever Marine Invasion complete highdefinition video and strategy guide. Starting price, 1,000 milliliters of purified water. Trade method sealed auction ends in 1 hour.

Lynn Mo watched the stream of transaction information appear, knowing that this data could fetch an astronomical price. He leaned against the blood stained barricade, watching the gradually calming sea and the distant silhouettes of islands that had survived the catastrophe. Some bewildered, some weeping. The reputation of a cunning businessman will now spread even further, accompanied by a savior-like strategy. Crisis 2 is a stepping stone.

He has just taken another firm step up. Chapter 11. The scheme of ice and fire. The agent appears. The seal bid auction enters its final minute with prices fluctuating rapidly.

The price soarses to three units of refined iron ingots plus one rare reinforced fishing net blueprint plus 2,000 ml of purified water delivered in installments. Bidder code named Gray Fox. Without hesitation, Linmo confirmed Gray Fox as a successful bidder. When the countdown reached zero, the transaction was completed through the system, a highly secretive process. Lynn Mo received three fine iron ingots gleaming with a cold light along with other supplies.

Without hesitation, Lin Mo chose, "Amplify the refined iron ingots and purified water." A flash of light and 300 refined iron ingots and 100,000 ml, 1,000 bottles of purified water were stored. As for the blueprint for the reinforced fishing net, it was kept as a finished product. Linmo began to examine the blueprint carefully. He discovered that reinforcing the fishing net required two iron wires, a refined iron wire, and one magic dust or alternative energy powder. These were two things he had never heard of before.

He decided to learn about them if he had the chance. Having just finished a transaction, Lin Mo received a private message from Sue Chanchan, her tone urgent. I've detected some anomalies. I'm fine. Rating A.

What anomalies. Then Montac replied. Su Chanchian said she detected a drop in temperature. A cold wave. Linmo immediately thought of the extreme cold weather mentioned in the outline.

Can you predict the timing and intensity? Linmo asked. The data is insufficient, but we'll have clear results soon. Su Chanhan replied. Understood. Thank you.

This information is very valuable. What supplies do you need? I can provide some. Linmo offered his help. Such Chanchian directly listed her needs. He decided to send a batch of sturdy ropes and thick canvas fragments from a box to the coordinates specified by Sue Chanchan via an anonymous account.

This was a reward for her previous interference with the Barracuda school and a gesture of sincerity for future cooperation. Su Chanchian quickly received the supplies and replied briefly. I received the items. Thank you. I will continue to monitor the cold wave situation and let you know as soon as there are any new developments.

Take care. The communication ended and Lynmo's vigilance immediately heightened. The approaching cold wave was both a huge crisis and a business opportunity. He immediately began taking stock of his supplies. And after the inventory, he discovered that he had many items suitable for winter use.

The immediate priority is to stockpile raw materials for cold weather supplies and find effective heating methods as soon as possible. He switched to an anonymous account again, this time as a breeding experimentter, and posted new information. He was buying all types of fur, high prices. High prices for all types of furs, size, condition, etc. thick fabrics such as canvas, felt, oily wood such as pine, combustible minerals or pete information, any drawings, templates or oddities related to insulation or heating.

Prices will absolutely satisfy you and can be exchanged for food, fresh water or specified materials. The regional channels responded tepidly after the information was released. Most people were still gripped by the fear of casualties from the attack or busy repairing the island and had not yet fully reacted to the cold wave warning. Only a few people brought out tattered rabbit skins or wet wool trying to trade them for some food. Lynn Emmo wasn't in a hurry.

He knew that once the cold wind became biting and no one could bear the cold, the prices of these currently unwanted supplies would skyrocket. He began buying up first scraps and exchanging them for food and started working on transforming the island. He used more barricades and timber to build a closed auxiliary shed in a sheltered spot, connecting it to the existing thatched shed to minimize heat loss. The interior was lined with animal hides and oil cloth, creating a relatively insulated inner room. Next, he tried to hammer and assemble a simple iron stove using refined iron ingots.

Lacking specialized tools, he could only rely on a stone axe and his polishing skills. The finished product, though imperfect, had a firebox and a flu. Bamboo pipes and clay were used as temporary substitutes. He first tested it with ordinary wood as fuel. Although the smoke was plentiful, it was much more concentrated than an open air campfire, at least enough to provide warmth and heat food.

Just as he was sweating profusely while troubleshooting the broken furnace, a new private message caught his attention. Center ID: Money Manager. My friend who is anonymously buying winter supplies. I am a welloff and honest businessman. Seeing your clear intention to buy and your generous offer, you must have sensed some opportunity.

I'm not very capable, but I also sense that something is brewing. I happen to have a batch of good snow rabbit fur complete and tarwood long burning and produces little smoke. I wonder if you'd be interested. Chin duo duo. Lyn Mo was taken aback.

Wasn't this the core supporting character manager Chien mentioned in the outline? He had come to him on his own initiative. Lynn Mo cautiously replied, "How can I prove you have the goods? How can I guarantee the security of the transaction?" Chando duo quickly sent several clear pictures. A dozen or so snow white cleaned rabbit pelts and dozens of shiny heatresistant pieces of tarwood. The goods are on the island. Small batch inspections are possible.

For security, it's a system transaction, anonymous, with each party bearing their own risk. I value my reputation. It doesn't look fake. Tarwood is indeed a good thing, suitable for heating. Lynn Mo pondered for a moment, then decided to proceed.

Okay, first trade, five snow rabbit pelts and 10 pieces of tarwood. What do you want in return? Your offer to acquire items in exchange for food, fresh water, or specific materials? I urgently need reinforced ropes and standard planks to fortify my dwelling. Chandwood's goal was clear. These are precisely the semifinished products that Lynn Mo can mass-produce and exchanging them for winter supplies is a very worthwhile deal. Deal made.

What's the transaction method? Same as always. Message in a bottle. Coordinates swapped. Chi and Duodu suggested. The transaction was completed quickly.

Lynn Mo received the snow rabbit pelt and tar wood while Chin Duodo received the rope and planks he provided. After the transaction was completed, Chin Duo Duo sent a message. Pleasant cooperation. Just a reminder, your large-scale purchase of winter supplies has probably attracted the attention of Wings of Freedom. They are also secretly buying furs and fuel, and their actions are quite significant.

Wings of Freedom, they started making moves, too. Lin Mo felt the chill run down his spine. "Thanks for the reminder. How much of your goods can I take?" Lin Emo asked. "We still have over 30 pelts and over a 100 pieces of tarwood." Chin Duo Duo answered definitively.

"We can continue the transaction and deepen our cooperation depending on your performance." Lynmo gave a vague promise. "Understood. I will certainly not disappoint you." Chin Duo Duo did not ask any further questions. Lynn Mo gaze at the soft snow rabbit skin and the jet black tarwood in his hands. The shadow of the cold wave drawing ever closer.

The first potential ally and proxy has emerged. Wings of freedom has also begun its preparations. The market is about to boil over again due to the low temperatures. He walked to the crooked tin stove, added a piece of tar wood, and flames rose, emitting a fragrant aroma that dispelled the chill. The fire light illuminated his pensive face.

Next, it's time to stockpile winter supplies and prepare for the cold wave. In this new crisis, he will once again play the role of someone both hated and indispensable. Unscrupulous merchant, he spread out a snow rabbit skin and felt its soft, warm texture. Was he going to sell this time? For coats, fuel, or a warm-up guide on how to survive in this frozen world? Chapter 12. Cold wave warning.

Stockpiling frenzy. Su Chanchians warning finally came true on the third day. Lyn Mo woke up early in the morning and immediately sensed something was wrong with his surroundings. The sea breeze on his face no longer carried the warm damp scent of the sea, but rather a dry, cold, stinging sensation. The sky was grayish white, and the sun, like a yolk covered with frosted glass, hung weakly on the horizon.

The ambient temperature displayed on his wristband was 12Â° C. Compared to the comfortable temperature of over 20Â° C a few days ago, today's temperature has dropped by more than 10Â° C, and it is still slowly decreasing. Finally, someone on the regional channel began to notice the anomaly. What's going on? Why is it suddenly so cold? I couldn't sleep last night because it was so cold and the shed was drafty. The sea water doesn't seem that cold.

So, why is the wind so biting? This isn't right. This is definitely not right. Although panic has not yet spread widely, astute survivors have already noticed something a miss on trading platforms. The number of listings for previously unwanted items like tattered furs and old blankets has quietly increased and prices have begun to rise slightly. Lin knew that the window of opportunity was rapidly closing.

While accelerating the island's winterization efforts, he also considered how to maximize the use of the approaching cold wave. He tightly wrapped the two shacks on the island with more animal hides and oil cloth, carefully sealing the gaps with a mixture of seaweed and wet mud. After several adjustments, the crooked tin stoves flu was reinforced with clay and stones, making smoke extraction much smoother. Linmo filled the stove with tar wood, and the small interior quickly became warm and cozy. He tested it.

In this well-sealed room, a simple earthnware pot was placed by the stove and the water inside remained unfrozen throughout the entire night. This discovery was crucial to him as it meant he could maintain a supply of liquid drinking water even during cold snaps. Meanwhile, Lynn Emmo intensified his resource acquisition efforts through several anonymous accounts. This time, he not only bought furs and fuel, but also began to focus on anything that could generate heat. oily dried fish, rumored self-heating minerals, and even something that someone mentioned could be extracted from certain seaweed as warm-blooded mucus.

To maintain a low profile, Lynn Mo's acquisition price was 20% to 30% higher than the market price. He demanded that all transactions remain anonymous and be completed quickly. He paid with his own miscellaneous items from special ropes, standard planks, and hardwood poles to some less sensitive metal parts, and even some low-grade blueprint copies that he no longer needed. This barter method not only reduces the outflow of food and fresh water, but also keeps his secret. Not long after, Chin Duo Duo sent another private message, this time with an even more urgent tone.

Sir, the market trend has changed. This morning, the number of people asking about furs and tar would has increased several times over. Wings of freedom has already publicly listed their goods for purchase and the price has been raised very high. Our batch of goods. Linmo calmly replied, "Continue shipping as planned, but in batches over a longer period with a 5% price increase each time." He smiled slightly, knowing what these changes meant.

The more aggressively they buy, the higher our profit margin will be. The goods you have, excluding those reserved for your own use, will be shipped out in 10 batches, two batches per day. Prioritize transactions with individual buyers and small groups. For buyers from Wings of Freedom and suspected affiliates, double the price or require them to exchange them for special items. Wonderful.

You truly understand the ways of the market, Chen Duo Duo replied. In addition, IV obtained another batch of dried Adal vice leaves through some channels. This stuff is excellent for starting fires and produces a faint warmth when burning. Also, regarding warm-blooded mucus, I heard that knowledgeable information broker called Knowit All seems to know something about it, but he has very nervous and the price is exorbitant. A know-it-all that chatterbox from that regional channel.

Lynmo recalled the time he bought the coordinates. Looks like this guy is indeed quite well informed. I'll take the Adal vice 20% above the market price. Contact Bayong and sound them out. If the information is reliable, we can buy it outright.

You decide the price and we'll settle the accounts later. Lynn Mo gave Chin Duo Duo a certain degree of autonomy. Agents need training and trust and this trust must be within a controllable range. Understood. Chin Duo Duo replied with great enthusiasm.

After ending the communication, Lynn Emmo opened a regional channel. He saw Lee Kuay promoting his collective cold weather protection plan, calling on everyone to pull their resources and build a large bunker to share warmth. To Lynn Mo surprise, there were quite a few respondents, especially those survivors who had suffered heavy losses before the cold wave and were struggling to cope alone. Then Emmo sneered. This kind of model would almost certainly collapse in extreme environments.

Issues of resource allocation, trust, and power struggles would likely turn such a large bunker into hell once the harsh winter and resource shortages truly arrived. He wasn't interested in ignoring those pointless discussions and instead focused on another analysis posed by Suchian. This time she listed several simple methods for quickly assessing the intensity and speed of a cold wave, observing the fluffiness of seabird feathers, testing the temperature difference at different depths, and recording the closing reaction speed of specific intertital shellfish. These methods were professional and practical, earning the gratitude of many survivors. He sent Sue Chian a private message.

Is the temperature dropping faster than expected? Su Chanhan quickly replied, "Yes, the heart of the ocean sensory feedback shows signs of a large-scale cold current surging up from the deep sea. This is not an ordinary temperature drop, but a systemic climate change. At its coldest, nighttime temperatures may drop below zero or even lower. This could last for more than a week. Sub-zero for a week, Lynn Moshart sank.

This was far more severe than he had anticipated. Many people's makeshift shelters simply couldn't hold up. and the problems of heating and food could very well become fatal. Do you need a more complete heating solution? I have a rough stove design that I can share. Lyno offered a furnace.

You made it yourself. Such an a little surprised. I tried surrounding the fire pit with stones, but the heat dissipated too quickly and produced too much smoke. If there's a more efficient design, I'm willing to exchange it for the predicted data on the movement path of the cold flow core that I observe over the next 3 days. Deal.

Linmo responded decisively. Clearly, Su Chanchians value went far beyond just providing early warnings. Her survival skills and ability to continuously observe were extremely important to Linmo. Okay, I'll give you the data. Sue Chanchin agreed.

Also, you must be very careful. During a cold wave, people as hearts may be more dangerous than the low temperatures. Dot the same as you. After ending the conversation, Lynn Emmo walked out of the shed. In just that short time, his breath had turned in a white mist.

The temperature had probably dropped below 10Â° C. The sea still looked calm, but its color seemed to have become even deeper. He inspected the fish pond. The fish were noticeably sluggish, congregating in the deeper parts of the pond. He made a makeshift insulation cover for the fish pond using tarp pollen and animal hides, hoping it would hold out.

If the water froze, he would have to consider breaking the ice and increasing oxygen levels. In the afternoon, Chiian Duo Duo sent a new message. Beetang did indeed know about the warm-blooded mucus sourced from his informant on another regional channel. It said that a type of warm water sea slug inhabits certain special coral reef areas in the south where the impact of cold waves is less pronounced. Its secretions have a slight self-heating and insulating effect, but it's extremely difficult to obtain and its yield is very low.

Bashitang's offer was 10 standard ropes or equivalent food in exchange for specific coordinates and key points for catching it. Give him five ropes and first he needs the coordinates and half of the key points. Pay the rest after verification. Lynn Mo instructed. He didn't completely trust Bashang, but this investment was worth a try.

Soon the coordinates and some information arrived. The location was far away, situated on the southern edge of the SH739 area, close to the boundary with other areas. Although we couldn't go there now, we recorded this information first. As evening approached, the temperature neared 5Â° C. The sea breeze was biting cold and posts seeking to purchase winter supplies flooded the regional chat.

Prices refers thick cloth and fuel skyrocketed. The illusion of supply shortages created by Lynn Mo and Shindwa's previous secret acquisitions coupled with the surge in genuine demand had driven the market into a frenzy. Wings of Liberty publicly posted an exorbitant purchase order with a forceful tone and a hint of threat demanding priority supply to them. Some small teams have started to band together for mutual support which has intensified the competition for resources. Le Kuay's bunker project seems to have encountered difficulties with some people complaining in the channel about unfair distribution and accusing the managers of hoarding supplies.

Chaos began to emerge. Linmo sat in his warm inner room with a tar covered with stove flickering in front of him. He held a piece of warm smooth snow rabbit skin and on the screen in front of him was a detailed profit report sent by Chin Duo Duo for the batches of goods shipped out. Most of the transactions were through barter in exchange for metals, special materials, and even two decent defense blueprints. His bracelet space was already filled with a large amount of raw materials for keeping warm, and it was still growing.

Before the cold wave had fully arrived, the first wave of stockpiling had already been largely completed quietly. He took a sip of warm water, his gaze calm. This is just the beginning. When the temperature drops to freezing, when the first snowflake falls, when despair and cold choke most people, the warmth he has stockpiled will become incredibly precious and may even become a resource that everyone seeks. At that time, he will become the true master of this sea area.

Outside the window, the wind howled mournfully like the wailing of ghosts. The crackling fire in the warm fireplace inside reflected in Lin Mo's deep eyes. He is waiting. Wait until the cold wave is at its most intense. Also, waiting for those will soon come to buy life.

Chapter 13. Frozen World. Warm Deal. The real cold wave broke out suddenly and completely around 2:00 a.m. If the previous warnings were just of dry cold, then now extreme cold has officially arrived.

A chilling soul freezing wind howled across the sea, carrying fine salt-like ice crystals that lashed everything in its path. The mercury column actually dyed alcohol of the thermometer, a makeshift version Lynn Mo had created using glass tubes and alcohol visibly shrank to below -5Â° C and continued to drop. Lynmo was awakened by the cold. Even though he was in the inner room wrapped in layers of animal hides and with a fire still burning, his breath was so thick it was hard to breathe and he could feel the stinging air on his cheeks. He immediately added two pieces of charred wood to the stove and the fire blazed up again, dispelling some of the chill.

He put on the thickest snow rabbit skin with a layer of canvas sewn inside. Walked to the door of the shed and lifted a corner of the oilcloth curtain. The sight outside made him gasp for breath. Under the pale moonlight, the entire sea was covered with an eerie grayish white layer ice. Not a solid layer of ice, but countless tiny icicles, shards, and rapidly freezing thin ice, colliding with each other as the waves pushed them apart, producing a teeth grinding crunch.

At the edge of his island, the waves crashing and instantly froze into layers of ice. The air was terrifyingly clear and terrifyingly cold. The bracelet vibrated wildly, and the regional channel was completely flooded with desperate cries and pleas for help. Cold. So cold I can't feel my fingers.

Water. My fresh water has frozen and the bottle is cracked. Fire. Does anyone have a fire? My fire was blown out by the wind. Help.

My shed has collapsed. Who can save me? Wings of liberty leader. I'm in. I'll do anything. Give me something to keep me warm.

Chaos. Collapse. Despair. The frigid temperatures, more direct and brutal than storms and ocean intrusion, are rapidly robbing people of any hope of survival. Linmo quickly shut down the channel to avoid being distracted by negative emotions.

He first checked his critical equipment. A layer of frost had formed on the fish farm's insulation cover, but the water below was not completely frozen. The fish were gathered in the center of the pond, their activity almost completely still. He carefully broke through the thin ice at the edge and threw in a little crushed tar with chips. The residue from which burns also provides a small amount of heat.

The earth and wear jars containing fresh water were placed near the stove and the water temperature was acceptable. Food reserves were plentiful. The barricades and obstacles surrounding the island were covered with icicles, but the structure remained intact. Having confirmed that he was temporarily safe, he took a deep breath of the cold air, his eyes becoming sharp and calm. The time has come.

He switched to the anonymous account he used to contact Shiendu Duo and found that Shiendu Duo had sent several urgent messages 10 minutes earlier. Sir, the coal wave has fully erupted. The market is in complete chaos. The Wings of Liberty are offering exorbitant prices for all winter supplies, but they require sellers to personally go to their designated trading island. Many people are afraid of being ripped off and dare not go.

It seems there's something wrong with Li Kuaya's group's bunker. The heating inside is insufficient. A fight broke out and people died. Retail investors and small groups are the main buyers now, but they have little hard currency and mostly want to exchange it for information or labor. Dot.

How should we proceed? As originally planned, Lynn Mo quickly replied, "The original plan has been adjusted. Large-scale shipments of tarwood and high-grade furs are suspended. Instead, the following items will be sold. One, standard warming pack containing one portion of Adal vice, two small pieces of tar wood, and one palmsiz warm fur. Two, emergency warming roll, thick strips of cloth soaked in tar, which can burn slowly for about half an hour.

Three, hot drink pack, dried ginger root powder or pungent seaweed powder, which can temporarily raise body temperature when brewed. All items will be sold individually in small packages. What about the price? Shin Duo Duo asked immediately, "Don't fix prices. Use an auction or barter first model. Focus on acquiring high-grade medals, complete tools, skill book clues, any information about the Stonemason Brotherhood or ruins, and gold or gemstone items." Lin Mo instructed during the cold wave, the importance of food and basic materials decreases relatively, while items that can enhance long-term strength or contain secrets may be underestimated.

Understood. Ill handle the packaging and descriptions. The LL be sure to be appealing. Also, I suggest opening up pre-sale and reservation services, collecting deposits, and promising priority supply after the peak of the cold wave. This way, we can lock in future demand and recoup some resources, Chin Duo Duo added, demonstrating her indeed flexible business acumen.

Okay, you have full authority to handle everything and report the accounts daily. Be careful and try to conduct transactions through messages and bottles or designated neutral coordinates to avoid revealing your island's location. Then Montac authorized, "Don't worry. I've taken the opportunity to develop downlines in several small groups allowing them to conduct transactions separately, so it's very safe." Chandu Duo said confidently. After ending the call with Chin Duo Duo, Lyno thought for a moment and then sent a message to Sue Chian.

The cold wave has arrived. How's the situation on your end? Is the stove working? A few minutes later, Sue Chanchian replied, her tone tired but calm. The furnace is great. It's been a lifesaver. The temperature is -8Â° C and still dropping.

The sea ice is severe and heart of the ocean has detected a large number of shallow sea creatures dying or going dormant. Also, I sensed an abnormal heat source about 15 km to the southeast. It's very weak but persistent and doesn't seem to be any living organism or ordinary flame. Could it be some kind of geothermal leak or a special resource point set up by the system? A special resource point? Lynmo's heart skipped a beat. In the extreme cold, a stable heat source is invaluable, but 15 km is too far on the frozen sea.

It's currently impossible to reach. Mark the coordinates. Continue to monitor your condition and pay attention to your safety. If you feel unwell, let me know and I can provide some emergency supplies. Linmo replied.

I'm fine. I have enough supplies. Thank you. You start a business now, right? Are those new warm packs in the channel you're doing? Suchan asked astutely. It's just mutually beneficial, Lyn Mo said without denying it.

Be careful of Wings of Freedom. They seem to be investigating the source of these supplies. Also, Leoay might be finished soon. Some of his men are contacting me privately. Wanting to exchange some information about Wings of Freedoms stockpiling locations for warm supplies, Such Chian warned, "You can take the intelligence and give them a small amount of heating supplies to keep them hanging.

Don't worry about Leo." Linmo instructed. Lee Kuay's collapse was expected. His remaining forces might be able to extract some valuable information. After dealing with these matters, Linmo began to personally manage another aspect, the high-end market. He used the most mysterious J number to post a short message on the regional channel.

J buying all blueprints, templates, skills, or exact information on relics related to polar, cold resistance, geothermal, and permanent insulation can be exchanged for customized advanced cold protection suit or stable heat source solution. Private messages only with credible proof. The message, though brief, was like a drop of cold water into a boiling oil pan. Boss Jay has appeared. high-end winter clothing, stable heat source.

He really did have some in stock and even better ones. Looking to buy? I have a fragment of a constant temperature rune, but I don't know if it's genuine. The IDJ has become legendary due to its global first upgrade and strategy video. His buyin post immediately attracted the attention of high-end players who possessed truly valuable items, but struggled to monetize them or exchange them for urgently needed survival supplies. His inbox was quickly flooded with messages.

Most were either boasts or scams, but Lynn Mo quickly filtered them thanks to his exceptional memory and analytical skills. A private message caught his attention. The sender's ID was a string of hieroglyphic gibberish, and the message contained only one sentence. Path of eternity clue in exchange for a solution or equivalent that can maintain core body temperature for more than 24 hours. the path of eternal frost.

That sounds like a location or quest line. Lyn Mo replied, "How do I prove the value of this clue?" The other party sent a blurry picture which appeared to be an ice crystal containing a strangely shaped bronze key. The keys handle had a snowflake-shaped indentation. The key is 30 m below Ice Kiss Cliff in area SH71. The route information is in my mind.

Pay half the price up front, the rest after verification. Ice Kiss Cliff. That sounds like an extremely cold place. The other party is either an adventurer or a native if they are. The clues are hard to verify, but the picture doesn't look like a composite.

Lyn Mo thought for a moment and replied, "I can provide the recipe for the continuous heating agent, which requires specific seaweed to make and a preliminary set of materials in exchange for complete path information and a map showing the exact location of the key. The transaction method is information will be delivered in segments and exchanged simultaneously. Sure, the other party agreed readily. Lynn Mo combined the information about warm water sea slug that he had previously bought from Beayhatang with his own rudimentary knowledge of potions, his previous life's gaming experience to compile a half-true, half false basic warming potion recipe and sent it over along with a small amount of the seaweed powder that Sue Chanchian had mentioned earlier, which had a slight warming effect. The other party then sent a detailed text description on how to find the hidden crevice on a seemingly identical ice cliff as well as the ice cave structure to be aware of and the potential threat of frost eating worms once inside.

The location of the key was marked very specifically. The transaction is complete. Lenmo cannot verify for now, but we'll save it for later. If he has the ability to explore extremely cold regions in the future, this clue might be the key. For the entire day, Lin Mo stayed in the warm inner room, his fingers rapidly operating on the light screen like a calm operator, controlling the flow of resources and information at different levels.

Chindwood achieved brilliant results. The warm pack series was sold out and in return, they received a large amount of miscellaneous but useful supplies and intelligence. The pre-orders also have a long backlog. On the J side, several valuable private messages were also received. In exchange for some customized solutions, which were actually different levels and quantities of cold weather supplies according to the other party's needs, two clues to rare blueprints and a piece of vague information about the location of a secret reserve island of Wings of Freedom were obtained.

Night fell again, and the temperature dropped to -12Â° C. The wind howled like the wailing of ghosts on the regional channels. Cries for help gradually thinned out. Not because people were rescued, but because many were no longer able to speak out or had fallen silent forever. On Lin Moe's Island, the fire in the stove was stable and the food was warm.

He tallied up today's harvest. The variety of supplies had increased and the information network had been further expanded. Outside the window lies a frozen hell. Inside the window, a warm flame flickers alone, and in its reflection, a pair of calm eyes calculating everything. Cold waves are both disasters and filters, eliminating the weak and reshaping order.

And he, in this reshaping of order, is quietly occupying a crucial position. Not the most powerful overlord, but the one who holds the lifeline of warmth. The underground king. Chapter 14. Beneath the ice cliff, the stormy sailboat.

The plan to explore Ice Kiss Cliff lingered in Linmo's mind for 2 days. The cold wave has reached its peak in the past 2 days. Nighttime temperatures have plummeted to nearly -15Â° C and daytime temperatures rarely exceed -5Â° C. The sea is covered with ice flows, rendering most areas unnavigable but creating rugged ice roads. Regional channel activity has plummeted with survivors huddled in their barely maintained shelters, barely surviving.

Trade has almost come to a standstill with only sporadic barter messages appearing. Linmo's island became a rare warm island in this frozen sea. Ample fuel, excellent insulation, and a stable food supply. The fishing ground survived under careful care, and the low temperatures even made some fish meat firmer allowed him to plan with ease. He couldn't reach the coordinates of the abnormal heat source provided by Suchian for the time being.

However, Ice Kiss Cliff located on the edge of SH701 area was about 40 km away from his location. This distance under icy conditions meant that if he had a sled or any tool capable of rapid movement across the ice, he thought of the mountains of timber and animal hides. There were no metal rails, but a base made of smooth hardwood covered with tough animal hide could be used to reduce friction. Pulling it by hand was definitely not an option too slow and too strenuous. Perhaps wind power could be used.

He thought of the spare tarpolins. A simple ice sled. The structure can be even simpler. A triangular wooden frame with smooth wooden slats at the bottom. A mass directed and a piece of tarpolin hung as a sail.

On a relatively flat ice surface with the help of a stable crosswind, it should be able to achieve decent speed. He spent half a day hammering and tinkering, creating a barely presentable ice sled. He then used ropes and leftover animal hides to make a warm cabin and a heavy set of ice field gear. Once everything was ready, he contacted Sue Chian. I need to go to Ice Kisscliff to retrieve something.

I need your heart of the ocean to help me sense the biological activity in that area, especially underwater and sub ice threats, Linmo said bluntly. This exploration was quite risky and Su Chians perception abilities were crucial. Su Chian replied quickly, her tone filled with worry. Icekiss Cliff, I've heard of it. It's a notorious dangerous place in District 701, where there are often abnormal air currents and icing phenomena before cold waves.

It's too dangerous to go there now. My senses will be severely interfered with by the thick ice and extreme low temperatures, limiting their range and accuracy. I know the risks, but that thing is crucial to my next step of development. We ll provide as much perception as possible. The key being whether there are signs of large or group based aggressive biological activity underwater and on the ice.

In return, I could provide enough advanced fuel packs to sustain you through the remainder of the cold wave and a set of improved stove design blueprints that Linmo offered his bargaining chips. Su Chian was silent for a moment. Okay, I'll try my best. When are you leaving? I need time to concentrate on my senses, and I can't do it for too long. The low temperature is very mentally taxing.

Tomorrow at dawn, when the light is best and the wind may be relatively calm, you'll begin sensing half an hour in advance, covering a 1 km radius around Ice Kiss Cliff. Continuing until I send a safety signal or lose contact, Linmo planned. Understood. I will do my best. Take care, LinMo.

Such Chanchian said finally. Before dawn the next day, Linmo was fully armed. His inner layer was a sewn rabbit skin coat. The middle layer a thick canvas and a lining filled with dried seaweed and the outer layer a waterproof tarpolen. He wore goggles and a mask made from thin animal hide and glass shards.

His weapons included a simple crossbow and all the arrows. A new batch had been made with a straighter hardwood shaft, a stone axe, and a dagger at his waist, and a backpack containing food, fuel, tools, and emergency medicine on his back. He boarded the ice sled and adjusted the sail. A steady northwest wind was blowing today, which was a crosswind tailwind for his journey to the ice kiss cliffs in the northeast. He untied the securing ropes.
