The oil cloth sail billowed in the wind, and the ice sled began to slide. At first, it was a little stiff, but as he gained speed, it became smoother and smoother on the slippery ice. The cold wind whipped at his face, but his winter gear proved effective. He maneuvered the makeshift rudder, a movable tail plate, and headed towards the designated coordinates. The 40 km icy road took nearly 3 hours.

Along the way, he encountered several ice creasses and piles of ice, forcing him to slow down and detour. On one occasion, he heard a dull thud coming from beneath the ice, which gave him a fright, but ultimately nothing broke through the ice. As he approached the ice kiss cliff, the sight before him was breathtaking. It was a towering gray black cliff hundreds of meters high, as if cleaved by a giant ax, steep and jagged. The side of the cliff facing the sea was covered with a thick layer of ice, shimmering with a deep blue hue, like a waterfall frozen in time.

The surface of the ice was riddled with cracks and enormous icicles shimmering with a cold light in a morning glow. This was the ice kiss, a kiss that seemed to be frozen between the sea and the cliff in the extreme cold. According to the information obtained from the transaction, the key is hidden in a secluded ice cave 30 m below the cliff. The entrance is at a height close to sea level. Now, the ice surface obscured by a protruding canine tooth-shaped giant ice block.

Lin Mo stopped his ice sled about 500 meters from the cliff and secured it to a solid ice mound with ropes. He sent Su Chian a short message. Arrived at the outer perimeter. Su Chanhan quickly replied, her voice tired but clear. I sense several faint life signs in the waters below the ice cliff.

They resemble large jellyfish or mollisks moving slowly and their threat level is currently assessed as low. There are hollow echoes within the ice layer. It's uncertain whether they are natural ice caves or nests. Be aware that there are signs of loosening ice cones above the cliff. My perception can only last for a maximum of 20 minutes.

Received. That's enough. Lynn Mo replied. He took a deep breath, checked his equipment, and then walked towards the location of the giant fong ice block. The ice surface was uneven, covered with broken ice and slippery ice algae.

He walked carefully, trying to minimize the vibration of his footsteps. The cold wind howled between the cliffs, swirling up ice crystals that rustled against his body. Approaching the giant ice formation resembling a canine tooth, a narrow crevice barely wide enough for one person to bend over and pass through was indeed discovered behind it. It extended inwards, dark and emanating a chilling aura. The ice ridges along the crevices edge resembled sharp teeth.

This is the place. Lynn Mo lit a thin stick soaked in tar as a makeshift torch and bent down to crawl inside. It was a downward sloping ice tunnel, incredibly smooth. One had to use a dagger to carve out footholds before slowly descending. The cold was biting.

Even with winter gear, one could feel the chill that seemed to freeze to the bone. After descending about 20 m, the tunnel widened, leading into a small ice cave. Icicles hung from the ceiling and the floor was a smooth mirror-l like ice surface. In the fire light, the ice walls reflected a memerizing blue light. According to the information, the key was frozen deep inside the ice wall, directly opposite the entrance.

Then Mo approached, torch in hand, searching carefully. Sure enough, about half an arm's length inside the ice wall, a distorted shadow could be vaguely seen. He needs to break the ice. He can't be too forceful lest the ice cave collapse or knock down the icicles. He took the stone axe from his back and carefully little by little tapped the ice with the back of the axe.

The crisp clear sound echoed in the ice cave. Every few taps he would stop to listen and make sure there was no unusual noise. The ice was very hard and progress was slow. Time was ticking away and Suchian's perception time was probably running out. Just as he had dug a shallow pit and could vaguely see the outline of the bronze key, a sudden change occurred.

A faint crack sound suddenly came from the ice beneath his feet. It wasn't from where he was chiseling, but from the side ice wall. Then Monta retreated instantly. Almost simultaneously, the eyes where he had just stood shattered, and several pale semi-transparent tentacles resembling enlarged maggots suddenly emerged, their tips bearing sucker-like mouth parts and lunged towards his original spot. Frost eating bugs, the threat mentioned in the message.

They lurk in the ice and are extremely sensitive to vibrations. When the attack missed, the tentacles quickly retracted and a grading rustling sound like ice rubbing against ice filled the ice cave, causing more cracks to appear on the ice surface. More than one, Lin Mo's heart pounded wildly. Without hesitation, he turned and ran towards the entrance tunnel. The space here was too cramped.

If he were trapped or the ice cave collapsed, he would surely die. The sounds of ice cracking and rustling followed closely behind him. He scrambled into the narrow tunnel, climbing upwards with all his might. He used his dagger and stone axe to carve deep marks into the ice wall for leverage. Just as he was about to burst out of the crevice, his foot suddenly gave way.

A section of ice steps collapsed. He slid downwards. At the critical moment, he stabbed the dagger into the ice wall on the side with his backhand, stopping his slide, but his body was suspended in the air with pale tentacles breaking through the ice right under his feet. He could see the mouth parts wriggling at the tips of those tentacles and smell a strange odor mixed with decay and cold. "Don't panic," he gritted his teeth and reached for the simple crossbow at his waist with his other hand.

It was already loaded with arrows when he came down to make climbing easier. He painstakingly adjusted the angle, aimed at the spot below, where the ice was most concentrated and the rustling sound was loudest, and pulled the trigger. Whoosh! Thud! The wooden arrow pierced the ice crevice. It's unclear whether it hit its mark, but the movement below noticeably paused. Taking advantage of the opportunity, he braced his feet against the ice wall, forcefully pulled out the dagger, and leaped upwards using both hands and feet.

Finally, just as another tentacle was about to wrap around his ankle, he burst out of the crevice and tumbled onto the ice outside. Still shaken, he looked back and saw a pale shadow moving vaguely in the crack, but seemed to be affected by the light and temperature outside. It was - 10Â° C outside, and it was probably even lower inside the cave, so it did not chase after it and slowly retreated back inside. He slumped onto the ice, panting heavily, white steam billowing around him. The brush with death had left his back soaked in cold sweat, now chilly in a biting wind.

They didn't get the key, and they almost lost their lives. No, we can't give up like this. Are those frost eating insects afraid of light? Or perhaps afraid of the relatively high temperatures outside? They didn't chase after us through the crack just now. He calmed down and observed his surroundings. Seeing the backpack and tools scattered to the side, an idea flashed into his mind.

He reorganized his equipment, gathered all the remaining tar with shavings and adal vice, and wrapped them in oil cloth to form several small balls. Then he approached the crevice again, lit one of the oil cloth balls, and threw it in forcefully. The fireball rolled into the darkness, illuminating the ice tunnel, accompanied by hissing sounds of burning and a sharper, more rapid rustling. The frost eating insects seemed to be terrified of the flames and heat, retreating even deeper. Efficient Linmo followed the same method, throwing in a burning oilcloth ball every few meters, forcibly creating a passage with a fire light and heat and descending into the ice cave again.

This time, the ice cave was filled with the smell of burning and a faint warmth, relatively speaking. The frost eating insects on the ice walls were nowhere to be seen, probably hiding deeper inside. He dared not delay, rushing to the ice wall and striking it swiftly and powerfully with his stone axe. Soon the ice broke, and the ancient looking bronze key with snowflake-shaped dents on its handle fell out, feeling cold and heavy to the touch. Without taking a closer look, he stuffed the key into his pocket, turned, and ran, kicking away the remaining burning debris along the way to prevent any possible return of the frost eaters.

He burst through the crevice and it was already broad daylight outside. Without looking back, he ran to the ice sled, untied the mooring ropes, hoisted the sail, and sped off back the way he had come. Only after leaving ice kisscliffe for several kilome and confirming that nothing was chasing him, did he relax his tense nerves and take out the bronze key to examine it carefully. Besides the snowflake shaped dents, the key surface is also engraved with fine wavelike patterns, and it has a strange warmth to the touch, which is completely out of place with the surrounding extreme cold. Just as his fingertips brushed across the indentation in the snowflakes, another unexpected event occurred.

The key suddenly became scorching hot. The snowflake-shaped indentation glowed with a soft blue light. A surge of information forcefully flooded his mind. It wasn't words, but a series of dynamic images and structural diagrams. A streamlined sailboat with triangular sails and a unique ramming head sailing steadily through the raging waves.

The complex keel and hole structure decomposed and reassembled. Finally, the light condensed, transforming into a drawing, radiating a pale golden glow, deeply imprinted in the depths of his consciousness. obtained complete crafting blueprints for storm sailboat. Soulbound host detected obtaining the complete blueprint directly through exploration, triggering a 100x boost boost. Now the storm ship, it really is it.

The key mentioned in the outline, enabling him to be the first to reach level five island and obtain the title of king of the storm. Suppressing his excitement, Leno was silently chanted in his mind. amplification. Instantly, a 100 physical blueprints radiating the same pale golden light appeared in the bracelet storage space. Each one meticulously recorded every detail of the stormship's construction, from the keel to the rigging, requiring an astronomical amount of materials.

But at this moment, these blueprints represented limitless possibilities. He gripped the still warm bronze key and glanced back at the receding cliff face which resembled a frozen behemoth. Beneath the icy cliff lies more than just a key is also a ticket to a new era. He looked toward his island, his eyes blazing with an unprecedented light. The cold wave will eventually pass and his ship is about to set sail.

Chapter 15. The true intentions are revealed. Bartering is employed as the ice sled glided back to the vicinity of his island. Dusk was approaching. Lynn Mo was almost frozen, stiff, his limbs numb and rigid.

Each breath accompanied by a stinging pain in his lungs. But clutching the bronze key, now cold, but seemingly carrying some invisible weight, and with a crystal clear structural diagram of the storm sailboat, in his mind, a burning fire blazed within him. It took him a great deal of effort to drag the ice sled ashore and cover it with an oil cloth. He stumbled into the warm, cozy inner room. the heat from the fire almost making him dizzy.

He took off his heavy gear, gulped down several mouthfuls of warm water, and curled up in the animal skin for a while before he felt his blood begin to flow again. Once his body had recovered slightly, he couldn't wait to delve into his consciousness and examine the blueprint once more. Complex, extremely complex. It was a world apart from the rudimentary wooden rafts and ice sleds he had built before. The blueprints were outrageously detailed.

From a most crucial element, the keel material, which required special treatment, requiring hardwood over a hundred years old, or the skeleton of some deep sea behemoth, to the curvature and splicing method of each hole plate. From the cutting and sewing requirement to the triangular main sail and formass sail requiring high tenacity canvas, to the complex pulley system and cable system requiring numerous metal components and special ropes. There were also the rudder, ram, and even the reserve location for the energy core and basic rune inlay slots mentioned at the end of the blueprints that clearly involved areas he currently couldn't comprehend at all. The list of materials was astronomical. There were thousands of pieces of wood, hundreds of pieces of metal, and various sizes of ropes, canvas, special adhesives, and waterproof coatings.

He had never even heard of many of these materials before and they were marked with can be replaced by XX performance reduced. This is not a project that one person or even an ordinary team could complete in a short period of time. The requirements for the blueprints were so high that they were practically designed for a collective with complete logistical and industrial capabilities. But Lynn Mo's growth rate was 100fold. He doesn't need to collect a single material.

He needs to collect the type that material represents. Once he directly obtains one of those materials through any means, he will have 100. The key lies in how you obtain the first one. It must be obtained directly by personally gathering resources, fishing for it, obtaining it as a drop from a monster, or like in this exploration, directly acquiring the blueprint. Finished products purchased through trading will not benefit from the enhancement.

This means that he had to personally participate in the first acquisition process of almost all the core materials. It's impossible for him to do everything himself. He needs strategy. He needs agents. And he needs to leverage the power of the entire market.

He first listed the most basic but in- demand materials from the blueprints. Standard timber, ordinary stone, fiber, rope, iron ingots, and copper ingots. He could purchase the first batch of these through large-scale transactions and then rely on a 100fold increase to acquire a massive basic reserve. However, obtaining metal ingots, especially the first iron or copper ingot, might require special channels because most of the metals circulating the market is currently in fragments with very few ingots. Then there are the high-end materials, century old hardwood, high strength canvas, refined tar, deep sea beast senue, and monster crystal cores.

These either require exploring specific locations, hunting powerful creatures, or special processing techniques, and each one is extremely difficult to obtain. Finally, there are those unheard of materials. Star patterned steel, the stomach pouch of a basil whale, the tail feathers of a storm kite, and the condensation of tranquil seaweed. These are estimated to exist only in legends or in extremely dangerous and special areas. The task is arduous and the road ahead is long.

Lynn Mo composed himself and began the first step to digest the gains from the trip to Ice Kiss Cliff and to strengthen himself. He first contacted Sue Chanchan and sent her a message. I have returned safely and retrieve the items. Your perception was a great help accurately warning of the threat beneath the ice. The promised advanced fuel pack and improved Stow blueprints will be delivered to the designated coordinates later.

Additionally, as extra thanks, I'm including a high efficiency hot drink recipe. Such Chian replied quickly, her tone filled with relief. It's good that you're back safe and sound. Don't take such risks in places like Ice Kiss Cliff next time. I urgently need the fuel and blueprints.

Thank you. I'll also accept the formula. Consider it a favor I owe you. Also, the cold wave seems to be weakening and the abnormal heat source in the southeast is becoming clearer. Perhaps we can go and investigate after the cold wave passes.

Take care to rest and recuperate. After ending the communication, Linmo packed the promised supplies and sent them out anonymously. Such Chanchians favor and continuous intelligence capabilities were invaluable, albeit intangible assets. Next, he tallied up the other spoils of the expedition. Besides the key and blueprints, the frostworm attack had left behind some trophies, several pieces of pale white tentacles he had cut off or charred.

These fragments were cold to the touch, tough as rubber, and emitted a faint chill. He didn't know what they were for, but he'd keep them for now. Then he turned his attention to the real challenge, gathering materials for the stormship. Instead of using the overly conspicuous identity of Jay, he used a business anonymous account that was used to contact Chen Duo Duo as well as two other backup accounts. First, he gave Chen Duo Duo a series of complex instructions.

One, spreading the word and testing the waters. In several active trading sub channels, it is posted that an anonymous big shot, who could be an admirer or subordinate of Jay, is raising funds for basic materials for an epic project and is buying standard timber, stone, fiber, and ordinary rope in unlimited quantities for a long period of time at a price 10% higher than a market price, but with quality requirements and can pay in various ways, including food, freshwater, and semi finished tools. Two key breakthrough asterisk. Utilize all resources and connections to locate and acquire the first standard iron ingot and the first standard copper ingot at any cost but discreetly. Spreading false information can help confuse the public.

Three, intelligence gathering. Purchase all information at high prices regarding ancient trees over 100 years old, originating sites of special high strength fabrics, spots of large marine animals, and clues to rare mineral veins. regardless of its authenticity and filter it first. Four, market disruption. While acquiring basic materials, release previously stockpiled and surplus winter supplies such as intermediate grade fur and ordinary fuel in small batches in multiple batches in exchange for more durable metal parts or rare items, further recovering resources and cooling down the market to prevent material prices from soaring too fast due to his acquisitions.

Chin Duo Duo quickly understood the intention and replied, "Understood. We can start acquiring basic materials immediately using the groceries we earned earlier to pay for them, thus concealing our true objective. Iron and copper ingots are a bit troublesome. I heard that the Stonemason Brotherhood has some, but they only exchange them for knowledge or relic information." The know-it-all intelligence operative about large sea monsters seemed to have boasted a few days ago that he knew where to find the shed skin of a giant squid. I'll go and give him another nudge.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood, Lynn Emmo, pondered. This mysterious organization was indeed beginning to surface. We can make contact first, testing their interests. We can use the scraps of information we have about the eternal frost path, not the core details to exchange for it. As for the know-it-all, give them a little something, but verify it first.

Understood? Chin Duo Duo went off with great enthusiasm. After arranging things for Chien Duo Duo, Lynn Mo began to take action himself. Using another anonymous account, he directly contacted several survivors who had demonstrated professionalism or special skills in previous transactions. For example, one with the ID Old Carpenter who was skilled at handling wood. One named Furnace Jeang who seemed to have expertise in metal smelting and another named Weaver who had shown off her homemade coarse cloth in the channel.

Lynn Mo established initial contact with them on the condition of long-term cooperation and technical support in exchange for a stable supply of materials and raised several specific technical problems in material processing for consultation such as how to quickly air dry large logs without cracking, how to refine relatively pure iron under rudimentary conditions, and how to weave fabrics that are both lightweight and durable. He paid them some food or tools as a consultation fee. He doesn't need a perfect answer immediately. He's casting a wide net, learning and accumulating necessary knowledge. These artisans may become his technical advisers or junior processors in the future.

Just as he was busy weaving this invisible network of resources and intelligence, an urgent private message from Dragon Soul, Steel Gun shattered his immersive planning. Lynmo, do they know this alternate account corresponds to Jay or is it just a guess? Emergency. We have detected the main fleet of Wings of Freedom Gathering with their target suspected to be the area you are in. SH739. They have likely obtained intelligence about your large-scale transactions during the cold wave and your suspected possession of high value items, possibly referring to the source of winter supplies or your trip to Ice Kisscliffe.

Caesar is personally leading the team. Their intentions are hostile. We suggest you immediately go in a hiding or move to the safe coordinates we provide. Dragon soul can provide you with temporary shelter. Wings of liberty.

Caesar himself has arrived. Lynmo's eyes suddenly turned icy cold. Sure enough, the tallest tree in the forest catches the most wind. His recent activity, especially his near monopoly on commodity trading during the cold wave finally attracted the wolves. Hide transfer to the protection of the dragon soul.

that would be tanamount to handing your fate over to someone else and would also expose more to trump cards. He looked at the phantom of the sailboat standing firm in the storm in his mind and then at his own warm but fragile island. The storm came sooner than he had anticipated. But wasn't this ship born to conquer storms? He replied to Dragon Soul Steel Gun, "Thanks for the warning. I am prepared.

In addition, I need the specific size, composition, and possible landing points of the Wings of Freedom Fleet. In exchange, I could provide a predictive analysis of the possible forms of the second wave of the marine invasion based on in-depth analysis of the first video recording, as well as a preliminary speculation on the resource point regeneration patterns after the cold wave. What he wanted wasn't protection, but intelligence. He wanted to earn the support of his allies through his own value, not through handouts. Dragon's soul steel gun paused for a moment before replying, "I can give you the intelligence." But Caesar possesses the S-rank combat talent, Thunderous Fury, making him extremely powerful individually.

His core fleet is also equipped with far superior gear compared to ordinary survivors. Are you sure you want to confront him head-on? Not a direct confrontation, Lynn Emmo typed his reply, his gaze sweeping over the neatly stacked barricades and fishing grounds in the corner, as well as the extremely complex blueprints for the storm sailboat in his mind. It teaches them that some things cannot be taken simply by having a large number of people. By the way, let them be the first contributors of my ship building materials. Chapter 16, defending against the enemy in the icy sea.

An initial victory. The wings of Freedom's fleet appeared on the horizon at noon the following day. It wasn't the imposing fleet Lynn Mo had imagined, but rather a mixed group of five ships of varying sizes and styles. The largest was a dilapidated twomasted sailing ship. Its hole patched upon patched, but its sails were intact.

It was likely their flagship. Of the other four, two were in large versions of the rafts Lynn Mo had seen before, but with added rudimentary cabins and sails, while the other two were bizarre ships pieced together from various floating objects, looking as if they might fall apart at any moment. Even so, in this frozen sea where most survivors are still struggling with canoes and tattered rafts, such a fleet is enough to create an overwhelming deterrent. Lyn Mo stood behind a makeshift shelter made of ice and stones at the edge of the island, calmly observing through his homemade moninocular telescope, two glass lenses with different focal lengths, and a bamboo tube. The fleet stopped about a kilometer west of his island, seemingly wary of the ice flows and reefs near the shore.

At the bow of the largest two-masted sailing ship stood a tall figure in a heavy fur coat. His blonde hair still striking against the grayish sky. It was Caesar. Several men stood beside him pointing and gesturing clearly observing Lin Mos island. Lyn Mo's island reinforced and camouflaged by the cold wave looked unremarkable.

The shack were covered with tarpollins and animal hides blending in with the ice. The fishing grounds were also disguised. Only the deliberately exposed, seemingly randomly placed barricades and a few conspicuous piles of supplies, actually traps and bait, indicated that someone lived there and had some reserves. He was waiting, waiting for the other party to make the first move. Sure enough, soon after, a smaller sandpan-like boat separated from the fleet, carrying three people who were carefully rowing around the ice flows towards the island.

They were there to probe. Lynn Emmo didn't move. He had already marked the thinnest points in the ice around the island and set up some simple underwater traps sharpened wooden stakes connected by ropes hidden under the ice which would spring up and pierce the bottom of the boat when triggered. But these traps were only effective against small boats. The three people in the sandpan were very cautious, moving slowly and constantly probing the thickness of the ice with a long pole.

They circled around a small section of the ice before choosing a gap that appeared to be thicker and had no barricades blocking their way. Just as the sandpan was about to reach the shore, a sudden change occurred. Crack. The ice shattered. It wasn't a trap set by Lyn Mo, but rather the ice itself wasn't thick enough to withstand the weight of the sandpan and the combined trampling of the three people.

Amid cries of alarm, the sand pan tilted to one side and two people fell into the water. Instantly engulfed by the icy cold, the remaining person desperately clung to the gunnel, trying to stabilize the boat. Linmo's eyes were cold, devoid of any sympathy. Having chosen plunder, one must bear the consequences. He did not attack the person who had fallen into the water.

The icy seawater itself was a deadly weapon. A commotion arose from the fleet in the distance, but no immediate rescue was undertaken. Caesar appeared to be observing. The two people who fell into the water struggled, but their movements quickly slowed as their body temperature rapidly decreased. The one who grabbed the gunnel tried to pull his companion out, but he was too weak.

Finally, the sandpan capsized and all three fell into the water. After a few thrashings, they stopped moving and drifted slowly away with the ice flows. The first attempt ended with the Wings of Liberty losing three members. It was brutal, but an effective deterrent. Linimone knew that the real attack was coming.

Sure enough, two larger pointed boats with ironplated bottoms, possibly salvaged from other parts, were lowered from the brigant. Each boat carried six or seven men armed with a variety of weapons, harpoons, machetes, and even a homemade crossbow. Caesar himself boarded one of the boats, standing at the bow, his face ashen. The two ships stopped probing and headed straight for Lin Moe's designated main landing point, which appeared flat, but was actually covered by barricades, ice pits he had dug, and trip wires he had set up. The boat was fast, its bow reinforced with iron, easily smashing through the thin ice at the edge, gliding along the eyes for a while before coming to a stop.

A dozen men yelled and jumped off the boat, brandishing their weapons as they rushed through the gap between the barricades. Now Lin Mo emerged from behind cover. His simple crossbow already cocked. The muscle memory from his rudimentary archery skills allowed him to move smoothly and steadily. Swoosh.

Swoosh. Swoosh. Three wooden arrows were fired in quick succession. Their target wasn't the people charging at the front, but rather their feet. Puff, puff, puff.

The wooden arrow pierced the ice, triggering a trap. He had set several flexible hardwood logs bent and fixed under the ice, sprang up and swept across with sharp stone fragments. Ah, my leg. The four or five people at the front were caught off guard and cut their legs and feet by the stone fragments. They fell down with screams and their formation was immediately disrupted.

There's an ambush. Find cover, someone shouted. But what cover could be found on the bare ice except for a few piles of supplies that Lynn and Mo had deliberately left behind. Several people instinctively rushed towards the nearest pile of supplies, trying to hide behind it. Lynmo's lips curled into a cold smile as he pulled the trigger of the crossbow again.

This time, the arrow hit the supply pile. Boom! The tar with scraps and adal vise he had buried under the supplies were ignited, instantly bursting into a small fire and thick smoke. Although it did not cause much damage, the sudden explosion and fire made the wings of freedom even more panicked. thinking it was some kind of powerful weapon. Don't panic.

He's all alone. Archers suppress him. Caesar's roar rang out. He didn't charge in immediately, but instead directed from the rear. The enemy's homemade crossbow fired an arrow in Lin Moe's general direction, which landed crookedly on the ice in front of the cover, posing no threat whatsoever.

But Lin and Mo had already retreated behind cover. What he wanted was to create chaos. And by time, he quickly moved to another pre-selected firing position where the angle was better and he could see some of the enemies trying to flank him. Raised the crossbow again, aim, and fire. Another person was shot in the thigh with an arrow and fell to the ground screaming.

Lyn Mo was like a ghost on the ice field. He used his familiarity with the terrain and the ice tunnels he had dug in advance, covered with a thin layer of ice and snow, to move quickly between different bunkers. Each time he appeared, he would shoot one or two arrows. He did not seek to kill the enemy, but only to injure them and create panic. The wings of Liberty were stunned.

They outnumbered the crew, but crammed into the narrow landing zone. They were helpless against the unpredictable barrage of arrows and the unknown number of traps. Even Caesar's roar couldn't immediately turn the tide. Finally, Caesar could no longer restrain himself. "Useless trash! Get out of the way!" He roared, shoving aside his men who were blocking his path and strode forward.

Tiny crackles of electricity flickered around him, and the air crackled softly. Srra talent, thunderous fury. Lynn Mo's eyes narrowed, and he immediately aimed at Caesar and fired an arrow. Caesar didn't even look at it and simply waved his hand. Crack.

The wooden arrow was shattered by a leaping arc of electricity when it was still half a foot away from his arm. "Found you," Caesar grinned maliciously, his gaze locking onto the spot where Lynn Mo had just appeared. He clenched his fists and a much thicker blue white arc of electricity condensed in his palms, emitting a chilling buzz, ready to be unleashed. A warning screamed in Lynmo's mind. He couldn't take it head-on.

Without hesitation, he rolled into the pre-prepared ice ditch beside him. Almost simultaneously, a thick arc of electricity shot out and struck the bunker where Linmo had just been standing. Boom! Ice and rubble flew everywhere. A large gap was blasted open in the bunker made of ice and stones. Sparks flew and a large area of ice melted.

That's incredibly powerful. If you get hit, you'll be crippled or killed. Limo climbed out of the icy ditch. still shaken. But he didn't stop moving, continuing to shift between the bunkers while shouting, "Caesar, is that all you've got? A talent for missing shots? What's the difference between you and a firework?" He wanted to provoke Caesar, make him lose his mind, and deplete his strength.

You're asking for death." Caesar was indeed enraged, and another arc of electricity shot out, hitting the ice surface near Linmo and blasting a large crater. Ice shards flew everywhere, but Linmo had already dodged in advance and at his landing spot. Don't let him get away. Caesar roared behind him. Several henchmen armed with harpoons and machetes attempted to surround them.

Lyno fired another arrow, forcing the two back. But Caesar's continuous barrage of electric arcs made his space for dodging smaller and smaller, and his cover was destroyed one by one. The situation is critical. Lynn Mo's gaze swept over the two pointed ships of the Wings of Liberty in the distance and then looked at his subordinates who dared not get too close because of Caesar's indiscriminate bombardment. An adventurous plan flashed through my mind.

He feigned exhaustion and ran toward the other side of the island in what appeared to be an escape route where his ice sled was parked. He's trying to run chase him. Upon seeing this, Caesar immediately led his men in pursuit, believing that Lin Mo was about to escape on an ice sled. Lyn Mo ran to the ice sled, but instead of getting on, he gave it a hard push. Using its momentum, the ice sled glided toward the two pointed boats.

Honor were the last few bags of tarwood chips and adal vice that he had prepared beforehand, as well as several Molotov cocktails sealed in earthnware jars and filled with animal fat. Shoot that sled, Lyn Mo shouted to Caesar while simultaneously drawing his bow and firing a rocket with an oil soaked cloth strip attached toward the ice in front of the ice sled. The rocket ignited the tar and sawdust he had scattered on the ice beforehand, and a line of fire quickly spread toward the approaching ice sled. Caesar instinctively unleashed an arc of electricity at the ice sled. Boom! An electric arc struck burning tarcovered sawdust, triggering a violent explosion.

The clay pot shattered and animal fat ignited, transforming into a massive fireball that engulfed the ice sled and the surrounding ice. And the direction the ice sled was gliding was precisely those two pointed boats. The flames and the shock wave from the explosion affected the ship. Although it didn't directly ignite, the intense heat and shock wave caused the wings of Freedom members on board to scream and scatter, throwing their formation into disarray. More importantly, the violent explosion and tremors caused the ice surface, which was already fragile due to the collision of ships and stacking of heavy objects to emit a tooth grinding continuous cracking sound.

KC bomb large sections of ice collapsed. Two pointed boats and the few people on board who hadn't yet disembarked along with the wreckage of the ice sled fell into the icy sea. No. Caesar's eyes widened in horror. Those two ships were crucial to their transportation and a significant part of their fighting force.

This is exactly the effect Lynn Mo wanted. Destroy their ship and they'll become an isolated army trapped on this ice island. He took the opportunity to disappear back into the ruins and smoke. Caesar was furious, but his remaining men were terrified, having lost their ships and found themselves an unfamiliar surroundings, facing a cunning and ruthless opponent, they had lost their will to fight. Retreat.

Retreat to the big ship first. Although Caesar was unwilling, he was still rational and knew that further entanglement would result in greater losses. The eight or nine survivors, including the injured, helped each other and stumbled back along the broken ice, running back in the direction they had come from. Lynamo did not give chase. He stood at the edge of the ruins, watching them flee into the distance.

We won with his own strength, the advantage of terrain, and preparation. He repelled the raid by the wings of freedom, destroyed two of their ships, and killed or wounded nearly 10 people. But he also paid a price. Several bunkers were destroyed. The ice sled was gone and some traps were exposed.

More importantly, he forged a deep and irreconcilable enmity with the wings of Liberty and Caesar. However, Lynn Emmo didn't care. In this sea, weakness is the original sin. He walked to the collapsed ice and looked at the shipwrecks, bodies, weapons, tools, and packages floating in the sea. Spoils of war.

He spent some time using a hook and a net to retrieve everything he could. a few harpoons and machetes that were still in relatively good condition. Some metal parts and tools. Several soaked packages contained frozen bread, jerky, and his eyes lit up two metal ingots carefully wrapped in oil cloth. One was iron gray, the other dark red.

Iron ingots, copper ingots. The first piece was obtained just like that. Although it was stained with blood, it didn't matter. There are also some scattered materials, rope, scraps of canvas, and a few pieces of animal hide. Most importantly, he found a palmsiz hardcover notebook wrapped in a waterproof leather case in the wreckage of Caesar's pointed ship.

Opening it, what you find isn't a diary, but rather a hastily drawn map, resource point markers, personnel lists, and transaction records, a record of Wings of Liberty's activities, and intelligence summaries in and around SH 739. priceless treasure. Lynn Mo carefully put away the notebook and metal ingots, cleaned up the battlefield traces, and pushed the corpse into the deep sea. Back in a slightly better shed, he lit the fire and began to take stock of all the hardest materials, weapons, intelligence, especially those two metal ingots and that notebook. The construction of the storm ship has taken its most solid first step.

After this battle, the infamous name of the anonymous J will surely spread rapidly throughout this sea area as the remnants of the wings of Freedom flee back. Fear can sometimes be more effective at keeping people at a distance than friendliness. He looked into the distance. The wings of Freedom Fleet had already sailed away and disappeared into the gray sea and sky. But Lyno knew they would come back.

Next time it might not be a test, but a full-scale revenge. He has to be faster, become stronger quickly, and build that ship that can conquer the storm. Chapter 17. Secrets of the notebook. Route map revealed.

The embers of the battle cooled completely in the wind. Linmo spent most of the day clearing the island, repairing the bunkers and ice surfaces bombarded by Caesar's electric arcs. The bodies of the wings of freedom members had long since sunk into the deep sea, becoming insignificant footnotes to this icy landscape. Along with the shattered shipwrecks, the blood stains were covered by ice and snow, and the traces of the battle gradually blurred. Only the faint smell of burnt blood lingering in the air and the several conspicuous craters on the island reminded people of what had just happened.

Lyno didn't care about these superficial wounds. He was more concerned with the tangible gains. Back in a relatively intact hut, the fire in the hearth dispelled the bone chilling cold. He spread the hardcover notebook he had obtained from Caesar's ship out on the stone table covered with animal hides. The notebook's cover was made of some kind of thick tanned deep sea fish skin.

Its edges badly worn and stained with black and blood and salt. Opening the title page, there was no name, only a slogan hastily written in charcoal. The law of the jungle prevails. Caesar. The handwriting is flamboyant and forceful, penetrating the paper.

Lynmo flipped through the page expressionlessly. The following content was the important part. The first few dozen pages are like a nautical log, starting roughly a month after the global voyage. They record how Caesar awakened his S-rank talent, thunderous fury, how he uses overwhelming force to subdue his first group of followers, how he plundered the weak, consolidated resources, and gradually built Wings of Liberty. The log is filled with accounts of the bloody suppression of rebels and the ruthless distribution of spoils of war, including supplies and personnel, revealing a naked jungle law and a lust for power.

Lynn Mo quickly scan the screen, capturing key information. The Wings of Liberty currently has about 30 core members and over a 100 peripheral followers scattered across several outpost islands in the SH700 to SH 800 region. They control at least three known small resource points. A shallow shell rich in iron sand, a reef area with high oyster yields, and an island where special resin can be harvested regularly. Caesar's individual combat prowess is emphasized, but the log also subtly mentions that overuse of thunder fury can strain the body and require time to recover.

This is a potential weakness. After you get past these, the content that follows will be even more valuable. It is a handdrawn nautical chart. It's much more complete than the fragments lin mo obtained from the reef area. It covers most of the sea area from SH 700 to SH 800 and even slightly extends beyond the boundaries.

It's marked with different symbols and colors. A red cross indicates a dangerous area with small print indicating sea beast nest, abnormal vortex, or mysterious fog zone. Blue circles represent resource points including timber islands, quaries, fishing grounds, and freshwater springs. Black triangle represents other known islands occupied by strong survivors or forces. Sometimes a strength assessment or relationship note is marked next to it such as hostile tradable to be observed.

Green dash line presumes safe flight path. There are also some locations marked with special symbols such as keys, treasure chests, and question marks, which clearly represent unknown or secrets that need to be explored. Lynmo's gaze was fixed on a route marked with a striking gold dotted line. This route started from the edge of the SH739 area, meandered southeast, passed through a dangerous zone marked turbulent sea, and finally pointed to a location marked with a gold treasure chest symbol. Next to which were written three words, eye of the storm.

the eye of a storm. Could it be? He immediately thought of the stormship blueprints he had obtained. The name and characteristics of the blueprints were all closely related to storms. Could this eye of the storm be related to the construction of the storm ship or to something more important? Is Caesar also looking for this place? And has he already discovered part of the route? Lynmo's heart raced slightly. He carefully studied the golden route.

Several intermediate nodes and precautions were marked on the route. Bus number seven with an abandoned lighthouse where you can temporarily dock. Crossing the turbulency requires specific whole strength and wind and wave resistance and the outer edge of the eye of the storm has continuous thunderstorms and turbulence and there may be guardian creatures or ruins. The requirements are very high and the risks are extremely great. But the mark of the golden treasure chest means that in Caesar's eyes its value is immeasurable.

Lynn M and Mo etched this route firmly into his mind. This might be the first challenge he would face after building the storm ship. Continuing to flip through the notebook, there were some scattered records at the back. Contacts with other regional forces, mostly conflicts, scattered intelligence about the Stonemason Brotherhood, characterized as mysterious war avoiding knowledge first fear and hostility towards the dragon soul and a few speculations and bounty records about Jay. In recent pages, Caesar wrote in bold, "Jay confirmed to be hiding in area SH 739, suspected of possessing efficient resource acquisition channels and advanced defense technology.

Initial contact failed, resulting in losses of personnel and ships. A reassessment is necessary. Forces must be regrouped to capture it. Its island may hold significant secrets or treasure." Seeing this, Lynmo's eyes grew even colder. Sure enough, Caesar wouldn't let this go easily.

Next time, he might send his full force. He closed the notebook, his fingertips tapping on a rough cover. The value of intelligence can sometimes surpass that of a thousand troops. This notebook gave him an unprecedentedly clear understanding of the wings of freedom's inner workings, the landscape of the surrounding waters, and the potential dangers and opportunities. Now, the advantage is on his side.

He needs to take advantage of this information gap and race against time. First, the construction of a storm ship must be accelerated. The eye of the storm indicated by the golden route is likely the key or at least contains important resources that could speed up construction. He contacted Shin Duo Duo and shared some information about resource points from his notebook key and sensitive content omitted, instructing him, adjust the acquisition strategy. Focus on acquiring specialty materials from these locations at prices 15% higher than a market price.

At the same time, spread vague and dangerous rumors about Restless Sea and Eye of the Storm on several secondary channels. Mixing truth and falsehood to confuse the public, especially targeting Wings of Freedom's potential information gathering channels. Shiendo Duo was shocked by the detail of the intelligence, but immediately understood. Understood. Use the intelligence advantage to wage an information war, disrupt the opponent's judgment, and at the same time accurately acquire the resources we need.

Brilliant. In addition, the first batch of standard timber and stone you requested have been gathered through decentralized acquisitions and can be delivered at any time. Very good. I'll send you the delivery location and time separately. Be careful.

Wings of Liberty may increase monitoring of the movement of supplies in the near future. Lynn Emmo reminded him, "Don't worry. Our downline network is already taking shape. It's all one-way communication, making it very difficult to trace." Chandu Duo said confidently. After ending the call, Linmo sent Su Chian another message.

The attackers have retreated. I received some intelligence about the area that might be associated with the abnormal heat source in the southeast. It seems to be called Restless Sea and Eye of the Storm. Have you heard of them? Sue Chanchian replied quickly with surprise. Where did you get these names? Restless Sea is vaguely recorded in my inherited knowledge.

It said that the ocean currents in that area are turbulent. The weather is unpredictable and there are often abnormal electromagnetic phenomena. It's a no navigation zone. I haven't heard of Eye of the Storm, but the name sounds like the core of the restless sea. If the abnormal heat source is there, it might not be geothermal, but some kind of energy convergence or release phenomenon.

It's dangerous, but it might also contain huge opportunities. Do you want to go just to find out first? The construction of a storm ship requires a lot of special materials, and that might be a clue. Lynn Mo didn't completely hide anything. Suchan was silent for a moment, then sent a message. Heart of the ocean is sensitive to energy.

if you really decide to go and can ensure that your vehicle is sturdy enough. I can try to provide more accurate sensing and warnings as we approach. But the prerequisite is that you must have a boat that can withstand extreme sea conditions and potential energy impacts. Your current raft won't do. This was a subtle way of reminding him of the risks while also implicitly expressing a willingness to offer assistance.

Understand? I will build a ship, Linmo replied, then paused and added, "Thank you, Dot." You're welcome. The cold wave is receding rapidly, and the melting ice will bring new ocean current changes and rising water levels. Be sure to reinforce the edges of your island. Also, Lie Kuay's remnants have completely scattered. Some have joined the Wings of Freedom, and someone to trade supplies with me.

I'll keep them hanging on as he said. Such Chian changed the subject. Okay, Wings of Freedom may be making some big moves soon, so be careful and stay in touch. Lynn Emmo ended the conversation. After finishing these tasks, Lynn Emmo walked out of the shed.

As evening approached, the cold wind persisted, though was noticeably weaker than in the previous days. In the distance on the sea, grayish white ice flows began to loosen, colliding with each other and making a continuous cracking sound. The cold wave is really coming to an end. As the ice melts, the suppressed forces, the restless sea monsters, and the countless secrets and dangers hidden beneath the waves will all become active again. He looked southeast with a vast deep blue sea and the eye of the storm lay.

Then he looked at the heavy notebook in his hand. Finally, his gaze returned to his own 10 square meter island, which had weathered storms, cold waves, and bloody battles. from six square meters to 10 square meters. From having nothing to having some savings, from being unknown to gaining a reputation for infamy. The next step is to move from this small area to the vast raging sea.

The sailboat blueprints in his hand, the golden route in his mind, and the bronze key in his pocket with a foundation for his voyage. He turned and went back into the shed, spread out a new animal hide by the fire, and began to compile a list of the core materials that needed to be addressed most urgently based on the storm ship blueprints. High strength whole timber as the main material for the keel and the main sail fabric forming the prototype of the energy core. One by one, item by item, the sound of ice cracking outside the window seemed to be striking a rapid drum beat as a prelude to a new era. Lynn Emmo picked up the charcoal pencil and wrote four characters heavily on the tip of the animal hide.

Raised the sails and set sail. Chapter 18. The pinnacle of level 5, King of the Storm. The seventh day of check-in was completed in the soft morning light. Ding.

Sign in successful. Congratulations. You have received one standard iron ingot and one standard copper ingot. A flash of light and 100fold amplification activated. 100 iron ingots and 100 copper ingots appeared in the bracelet space, joining the two previously obtained from the wings of freedom, instantly making the metal reserves considerable.

Lynn Emmo calmly gazed at the cold metal blocks. Iron and copper were the basic structural materials for building the storm ship and also crucial for upgrading the island to higher levels and constructing more complex facilities. He now possessed 102 iron ingots and 102 copper ingots. If he extrapolated from the previous requirement of 10 foundation stones for upgrading a level one island, the materials needed to upgrade to level five would be astronomical. However, he might have already gathered the first most crucial portion of the core metal materials.

He didn't attempt to upgrade immediately. The system hadn't yet provided information on what materials were needed to upgrade the island from level one to level two. He needed to trigger that condition first. Upon opening the bracelet, the island information interface displays. Island level LV1, 10 square meters.

Materials required to upgrade to LV2. 50 foundation stones, 200 wood, 150 stone, five iron ingots, three copper ingots. Special requirement, island core stability must reach 100%, currently 87%. Note, core stability increases naturally with the improvement of island facilities, the integrity of defenses, and the duration of a lord's residence. It can also be rapidly increased by consuming specific materials or completing special events.

The requirements have indeed skyrocketed. 50 foundation stones, 200 pieces of wood, 150 stones, plus five iron and three copper. Core stability is also a completely new concept. Lynn Emmo glanced at the core stability of his island, 87%. It had likely decreased due to the battle and destruction.

However, according to the instructions, as long as he continued to live there and repair the facilities, it should gradually recover. As for this specific materials or special events that would rapidly increase stability, he had no clue at the moment. He was in a rush. His immediate priority was to use the resources he had, especially the massive amount of basic materials after the 100fold increase to exchange for other materials needed for the upgrade and further enhance his overall strength. He contacted Shen Duo Duo.

Initiate the basic materials for rare items program. Use our stockpiled standard timber, stone, fiber, and ordinary rope to exchange in large quantities for foundation stones, complete animal hides, high-quality hemp or plant fibers, special resins, bone glue, and any timber or stone samples labeled with strong, tough, or lightweight properties. Prices can be 50% to 10% lower than market prices with low profit margins and high sales volume for rapid turnover. In addition, focus on finding out how to quickly improve core stability. Write down any relevant information, no matter how absurd it may seem.

She and Duo Duo immediately understood. Got it. Use our almost unlimited basic materials to flood the market, exchange them for scarce and high-end goods, and gather intelligence at the same time. The demand for foundation stones is always high, and many people are stuck at level one to level two. If we release wood and stone at low prices, we can definitely get a lot in return.

I'll go arrange it right away. Also, Linmo added, "Keep an eye on the Stonemason's Brotherhood s movements. If possible, try to exchange our incomplete information about the eternal frost path for their knowledge of the island core stability or ancient building techniques. Be sincere and show that we are only seeking knowledge, not hostile. Those people from the Stonemason's Brotherhood are so secretive.

I'll get a try, Chin. and Duo Duo agreed. After ending the communication, Lynn Mo began to personally operate another line. Leveraging the credibility of the J identity, he posted a brief acquisition notice on the regional channel J. Acquire concrete intelligence or physical assets related to island core stability.

Customized defense solutions, advanced building materials, or equivalent resources can be exchanged. The message was brief, but the name Jay itself was eye-catching enough. Soon, private messages flooded in. Most were guesses and hearsay, but a few were noteworthy. A message from an ID calling themselves ruins Cleaner.

While exploring a shallow water ruin, I found a glowing blue crystal. When I touched it, the island vibrated slightly and the system prompted stable energy source detected. Absorb. I didn't dare to touch it at the time. I can tell you the location of the crystal, but you'll need a complete set of personal protective equipment and 3 days worth of food.

Blue crystal, a stable energy source. Lynn Emmo noted it down and replied, "Okay, first pay with the crystal's coordinates and a detailed description of its appearance. After verification, pay half of the equipment and food. The remaining balance will be paid after you successfully acquire and deliver the crystal or confirm the detailed reason why you cannot acquire it." Another message came from an ID called geologist written in a professional tone based on my observations and limited experiments. Core stability is related to the island's foundation structure, material homogeneity, and the presence of energy buildup or structural stress points.

Repairing obvious damage, optimizing the layout, and reinforcing with similar materials can all slowly improve it. Rapid improvement may require neutralizing energy buildup such as certain radioactive minerals or introducing stable resonators such as crystals of specific frequencies. I have a preliminary simple method for detecting island structural stress which is available for trade. This intelligence seems more reliable. Linmo traded a high efficiency heat insulation material formula and a batch of standard wooden boards for this testing method.

The method is very crude, mainly relying on observing the rate of water accumulation in different areas, the difference in ice layer thickness, and using a simple pendulum rope weight to test the ground's horizontal vibration feedback to roughly determine where there might be structural weaknesses or energy anomalies. Linmo immediately began testing it on his island. Sure enough, in the areas most severely bombarded by Caesar's electric arc, the pendulum swaying was noticeably irregular. And in one spot where the ice had melted and were frozen, the rate of water accumulation was different from other areas. These were likely structural stress points.

He noted down these locations, intending to focus on their restoration later. Over the next few days, Lynn Emmo entered a high-speed operating mode. During the day, he repaired the island, optimizing its layout according to the methods of a geologist, making the functional areas, residence, storage, fishing grounds, and defense more clearly defined and reinforcing weak points with similar materials. At the same time, he systematically carried out large-scale resource exchanges through Chin Duo and several smaller accounts. A massive influx of standard timber and stone into the market, though a to slightly lower unit price, was quickly exchanged from mountains of foundation stones, various types of fur and fibers, and many strange but potentially useful trinkets.

Almost every corner of the island was piled high with materials. Core stability increased slowly but steadily during this process. 89% 91% 94%. At the same time, through the J channel, he used some non-core defense knowledge and materials to obtain the specific coordinates of the blue crystal from the ruins cleaner located in a dangerous shallow reef area. He also obtained fragments of more mysterious information about energy resonance objects and structural stability runes from other channels.

Although most of them could not be verified immediately, they were all archived for future use. Good news also came from Su Chians side. The cold wave had basically subsided. Most of the sea ice had melted and shipping lanes were being restored. She used the heart of the ocean to help several small friendly groups avoid several dangerous ocean currents during the melting ice period, which improved her reputation.

At the same time, she confirmed that the abnormal heat source in the southeast direction was more clearly sensed and roughly matched the direction of the restless sea. in Caesar's notes. Dragon's soul steel gun contacted Lynn Mo again, informing him of the latest developments of the Wings of Freedom. After retreating to a stronghold, Caesar was frantically preparing, acquiring large quantities of weapons and ship materials while simultaneously intensifying his efforts to annex surrounding forces, clearly accumulating strength for the next large-scale operation. Dragon Soul strengthened its patrols and intelligence network in the SH739 area and again subtly offered to assist Linmo in relocating to a safer area if needed.

Lynn Emmo declined again but provided more information about the distribution of Freedom Wings outposts and resource points excerpted from his notebook in return thus solidifying this mutually beneficial intelligence alliance. On the evening of the seventh day, Lynn Emmo stood in the center of the island. The island information is clearly displayed on the wristbands light screen. Island level LV1 10 square meters. A serverwide announcement will be made upon upgrade and you will receive additional rare rewards. Hide your personal information. Hide. Upgrade. Lynn Mo said without hesitation.

A familiar tremor resounded stronger than before. The materials piled in the designated area transformed into streams of light, merging into the island. The stone platform expanded outwards again, growing from 10 square meters to 15 square meters, its edges becoming more regular and the stone subtly revealing a metallic sheen.
