The announcement resonated globally. The regional channel was in an uproar once again. But before people could recover from the shock of Jay taking first place again, something even more astonishing happened. Just 10 minutes later, another global announcement exploded.

Global announcement. Congratulations to Survivor J for becoming the first person in the world to upgrade the island to LV3. Award, double hit. Then came a triple attack, four hit combo. In the next two hours, announcements rang out from all over the world.

The name Jay streaked across the silent night sky like the most dazzling shooting star, soaring from LV2 to LV5 at a breathtaking speed. When a final announcement that Jay had become the world's first owner of a level five island rang out, the entire world channel fell into a brief silence followed by complete frenzy. What happened? Did they take a rocket? Promoted four ranks in a row. How'd he do that? Materials. Where did he get so many materials? Monster.

This is a monster. The title King of Storms is so awesome. Yes, with the final announcement, a brand new title shimmering with the emblem of thunderclouds and waves appeared before the name Jay, King of the Storm. Congratulations on obtaining the exclusive title, King of Storms. Beginner effect slightly increases your perception and adaptability to natural weather phenomena such as storms and waves within your island and a certain area of surrounding waters.

slightly increases your leadership ability. Linmo stood on the island, which had now expanded to 25 square meters, feeling the solid ground beneath his feet and the subtle newfound sensitivity to the surrounding air currents and water ripples in his mind. The island's layout was more rational with preliminary outlines of low walls appearing along the edges and a shallow depression automatically forming in the center to collect rainwater. The fifth level island brought not only an increase in area but also a qualitative change. He felt that his connection with the island had become even closer.

Inside the bracelet space, four waves of upgrade rewards piled up like a mountain. Hundreds of foundation stones, a large amount of metal, several precious blueprints, including the basic workshop, the upgraded version of the rainwater collector, etc., and several energy storage crystals that shimmerred with a faint light. More importantly, new features are unlocked as the island reaches level 5. Unlock basic communication tower buildable build unlocked. Area map rough expansion unlocked.

Level five island exclusive quest chain not yet available. Unlock group chat feature can create or join. Group chat function. This means he can more easily build his core team. Myuan pavilion should be established.

The basic communication tower and simple dock with a hardware foundations that enabled him to reach a wider world. The sea breeze caressed my face, carrying the moist scent of melting ice. Lyn Mo gazed into the distance, his eyes seemingly piercing through the gradually clearing night sky, landing on the distant restless sea. The king of storms is in position, and his ship will crush all the storms. Chapter 19.

Mo Yuan's initial establishment. Allies fall into the trap. The tidal king of storms shone brightly in the night sky like a brand heralding the beginning of a new era. Lin Mo stood in the center of the 25 square meter island. Feeling the unprecedented solidity and weight of the land beneath his feet.

A level 5 island brought more than just an increase in area. It brought a comprehensive qualitative change. The low walls, though short, were clearly defined. The shallow puddles indicated that he could begin planning a more systematic freshwater collection system. Most importantly, the subtle yet close connection he felt with the island made him feel more like an extension of this land than merely a sojourer.

On the wristband screen, the newly unlocked function icons shown brightly. He first tapped the most crucial one, the group chat function. A pop-up notification appears. Your title king of the storm has been detected and your reputation has met the requirements. You can create or join a group chat.

Creating a group chat requires one communication token already issued as an upgrade reward or equivalent resources. The size and functionality of the group chat are related to the creators island level and reputation. Create a group chat. Please name it. Create it.

Name it. Moan pavilion. Linmo. Didn't he hesitate? Mo means profound and strategic. Yuan symbolizes depth and inclusiveness and represents a relatively independent and orderly space.

This aligns with his original intention of establishing an elite small group and developing in a low-key manner. The group chat Moyuan Pavilion has been successfully created. This is currently a basic group chat with a maximum of 10 members. It features text and voice communication and allows sharing of basic map markers, but requires members to be within a certain communication range affected by island level and facilities. Cost daily maintenance requires a small amount of basic resources.

You have obtained pavilion master privileges. Almost the instant the group chat was created before the tsunami caused by JS as four-level jump and the title of King of Storms had subsided, new changes had already occurred in the regional channels and the wider world channels announcement of the creation of countless group chats began to flood the screen. Dragon Soul East China Sea branch officially established, uniting compatriots to jointly resist foreign aggression. Wings of freedom calling upon warriors, the law of the jungle prevails. The strong are respected.

The mutual a brotherhood welcomes all friends who trade honestly and help each other. Stonemason's workshop dedicated to exploration and construction cordially invites like-minded individuals. Food research society. Various factions and groups with different ideologies sprang up like mushrooms after rain. Reaching level five on the island unlocked not only new features, but also officially propelled the previously loose and anonymous world of survivors into an era of organization and factionalism.

Lynn Mo's Emo Yuan Pavilion was tucked among them, completely inconspicuous. He hadn't invited anyone yet. He was waiting and he was also selecting. First, he sent Su Chanchian a group chat invitation with a brief note. My group Emo Yuan Go is not open to the public yet.

You're the first one. A few seconds later, the invitation was accepted. Such Chanchians ID, Shallow Sea Scholar, appeared in the member list. Congratulations, Storm King. Such Chanchians private message followed closely with a hint of teasing, but more so with seriousness.

The commotion is too big. Now everyone's eyes are on you. Wings of freedom are probably going crazy. As expected, Linmo replied, "Let us talk in the group chat. I need you to use Heart of the Ocean to help me keep an eye on all unusual ship movements in the nearby waters, especially those of the Freedom Wings type.

In return, I will grant you partial access to the Mo Yuon Pavilion Source Library." Understood. I will continue to monitor it. Also, after the cold wave completely passed, the abnormal heat source signal in the southeast direction became stronger and more regular, which can almost certainly be confirmed to be related to the restless sea. I drew a preliminary graph of the change in induction intensity and sent it to the group file that Sue Chinshian quickly got into the swing of things and uploaded a simple line drawing to the group chat, which only had two people. The image shows that the heat source signal fluctuates regularly like a heartbeat and its intensity is slowly increasing.

It's like something is awakening or gathering energy. Line looked at the diagram thoughtfully. Continue to observe. Also, be careful yourself. Caesar probably hates me the most right now and he might take his anger out on people related to me.

I will be careful. My island is well hidden and its defenses have been strengthened. Su Chanchian replied. After ending his conversation with Su Chanchian, Lin Mo began processing other messages. Countless requests to join Mo Yuan Guu or to send private messages flooded in, but he ignored them and directly blocked messages from non-conts.

What he needs are elites, trustworthy, capable partners with shared ideals, not a mob of people just there for the ride. He thought of two people. First is sure how ID Iron Wall. This former veteran is upright and resolute. His few pronouncements on the regional channel revealed his commitment to keeping promises and prioritizing the overall situation.

More importantly, based on intelligence previously shared by Dragon Soul and Lin Mozone observations, Sherhow has performed exceptionally well in several small-cale conflicts and rescue operations, demonstrating considerable individual combat strength and expertise in defensive organization and on the spot command. This is precisely the shield and general Lynn Emmo urgently needs. He found Show's ID and sent him a brief private message. Ironwall, this is Jay. I find you to be methodical and trustworthy.

I have established the Inc. Abyss Pavilion with the aim of establishing order, protecting our fellow practitioners, and exploring a way out. We lack someone who can lead the defense and safeguard the rear. Would you like to discuss this further? Without promising benefits or exaggerating the crisis, he directly stated his intentions and needs. For someone like Sher How, being straightforward is more effective.

After sending a message, Lynn Mo didn't just wait. He contacted a second person, Shiendu Duo. The conversation with Chindo Duo was much more direct. The group chat is open. My faction is Moyuan Pavilion.

You have a great talent for business operations and I need an agent who can handle transactions, integrate resources and expand channels in the open. I am formally inviting you to join and be responsible for all external business affairs of my UN pavilion. You will enjoy profit sharing and decision-making participation rights, but you must abide by the core rules. Do not cheat the poor. Do not cross the bottom line.

And be completely transparent with me. Think about it. He also sent over a preliminary draft of a cooperation framework that clearly defined rights, responsibilities, and benefits. He emphasized that while providing Chin Duo Duo with sufficient benefits in space, it was also crucial to clearly define bottom lines and constraints. After dealing with these matters, Lynn Mo began planning the island's new construction.

A level five island could now build a basic communication tower and a simple dock. The communication tower requires wood, stone, and metal, as well as the rewarded energy storage crystals. Once built, it can expand the effective communication range of group chats, and may even unlock more advanced communication or reconnaissance functions in the future. A simple dock requires a large amount of stone and timber, as well as waterproofing and anti-corrosion treatment. With a dock, his future ships can dock safely, and goods can be loaded and unloaded easily.

Just as he was about to bring up the building interface, Su Chinshin suddenly sent a hurried voice message in the group chat with a background sound of howling wind and faint metallic clanging. Then Montac about 15 km to the southwest. There are three ships besieging a small island. The ships are wings of freedom. The energy reaction of the besieged island is familiar.

It's a small observation post that I exchanged intelligence with before. The person in charge is called Stargazer, and there are only two of them. Their combat strength is very weak. They won't last long. Caesar may not be on the ship, but the leader is a ruthless character.

Was the Wings of Liberty eliminating surrounding smaller factions? Or had they discovered the value of that observation post, which might also have reconnaissance capabilities? In any case, failing to help someone in distress was against Lin Moe's principles, especially such blatant bullying. Moreover, this could also be an opportunity to test his newly acquired power and potentially gain new allies or intelligence. "Send me the coordinates," Lyn Mo replied calmly while quickly checking his equipment. "A simple crossbow, arrows, a stone axe, a dagger, and several Molotov cocktails made from animal fat and clay pots." He glanced at the communications tower and dock, which were still just foundations under construction, and turned to walk towards the shore without hesitation. There, Morde was his only means of water, transport, a modified raft, slightly larger than his previous one, with a makeshift cabin, and a small sail.

Its power and defenses remained worrisome, but this was all he could manage for the time being. He leaped onto the raft, raised the sail, adjusted his course, and sped off towards the coordinates sent by Su Chanchchan. The sea breeze whipped at his forehead, revealing a pair of calm, deep-seated eyes beneath. The Storm King's first battle was not about defense, but about an expedition. The raft cut through the waves, moving slowly but resolutely toward the sea, where an unjust war was taking place.

Almost simultaneously, he received two replies. Sure. How? Mr. J, I have long admired you. I am committed to upholding integrity and protecting my fellow countrymen.

Could you please tell me about the specific charter and current goals of my UN pavilion? If our ideals align, I am willing to follow in your footsteps. Chin duo duo sect leader. I am willing to serve you like a dog. I have read the regulations and they are reasonable. I will strictly abide by the rules, expand the territory for you, and share your burdens.

When can I begin my duties? Lynn Mo juggled the raft with other tasks, trying to recover amidst the turbulence. For sure, how? The charter will be sent to you later. Current goals. One, defend our foundation and establish a safe zone. Two, integrate reliable forces to form a core.

Three, explore the turbulent sea and acquire key resources. There is only one principle in this chaotic world. Establish an order and fairness that we recognize. Welcome to the team. From this moment forward, you will be the external affairs steward of the Moan Pavilion.

Your first task, use existing channels to acquire all information and physical objects related to the restless sea, eye of the storm, ancient sea charts, and advanced ship building technology at any cost. Resources will be allocated to you later. After replying, he turned off the light screen and fixed his gaze on the faint outlines of ships and lights appearing on the horizon ahead. Though the raft is small, it is its first test of skill. Although the Miuan Pavilion has been established, its path has only just begun.

Meanwhile, the distant flames of war and cries of agony await him, the newly crowned king of the storm, to deliver judgment and bring an end to them. He gripped the crossbow tightly, the sail billowing in the sea breeze like wings about to unfurl. Chapter 20. Rescue. Amidst the raging sea, first signs of strength.

The speed of a raft is ultimately limited. When Lin Mo arrived at the vicinity of the coordinates, the battle seemed to be nearing its end. Three modified Freedom Wing ships surrounded a small rocky island in a triangular formation. A half collapsed shack and burning flames were faintly visible on the island. Two small boats had already docked and a dozen or so figures were searching and vandalizing the island.

Shouts and curses carried on the wind. The third larger ship patrolled the outer perimeter with a bald burly man wearing a fur vest standing at the bow, arms crossed, coldly observing the scene. Lynn Mo lowered the sail about 500 meters from the battlefield and used a protruding rock to conceal the raft. He took out his homemade moninocular telescope and observed carefully. The besieged island was small, not much larger than his initial island.

It was rugged and easily defensible, but the defenders were clearly outnumbered and outgunned, and their defenses have been breached. Besides the burning shacks, there was a small area enclosed by stones, where some rudimentary observation equipment appear to be set up several wooden poles at different angles with metal plates and glass mirrors hanging from them, reflecting the fire light. This was probably the observation post Su Chanchian had mentioned. Two figures were forced behind rocks at the edge of the island. They could be vaguely made out to be a man and a woman.

The man held a harpoon and the woman seemed to be holding a sharpened wooden stick, making a lastditch effort. The attacking Freedom Wings members numbered about seven or eight, armed with various weapons, laughing and joking as if playing cat and mouse. The bald, burly man on the outer boat must be the leader of this operation. Judging from his calm and composed demeanor, he clearly believes victory is assured. Lynn Emmo quickly assessed the situation.

A direct assault wouldn't work. His raft and equipment were far inferior. He had to outsmart them, create chaos, and rescue them amidst the confusion. His gaze swept over the patrolling ship on the outer perimeter, then looked at the freedom wing members on the island who were wreaking havoc and whose attention was completely focused on their prey. A plan took shape in my mind.

He quietly tied the raft of the rocks. Took a simple crossbow, all the arrows, and three Molotov cocktails, took off his heavy winter coat to lighten his load, wearing only close-fitting leather armor and waterproof trousers, and slid into the icy sea with a dagger in his mouth. The seaater was icy cold, but he moved swiftly like a fish, silently diving towards the patrolling ship on the outer edge. Thanks to the gradual improvement in his physique brought about by the hundfold increase in strength, as well as the tempering he had undergone in the harsh environment during this period, his endurance and underwater breath holding ability far exceeded those of ordinary people. He circled around to the stern below the rudderblade, a blind spot.

There were only two people on board, one on guard at the bow and the other adjusting ropes near the cabin, neither of them noticing the subtle underwater movements. Linmo took out a small piece of rope soaked in grease from the leather pouch of his waist, quickly carved a deep groove in the wooden plank near the water line at the stern of his dagger, stuffed the rope in, lit it, and then quickly submerged, swimming towards the other side of the island. The grease rope burned slowly but produced thick smoke. A few seconds later, black smoke billowed from the stern. "What's going on? The stern is on fire!" the watchman at the bow exclaimed in alarm as he was the first to notice.

The people tidying up the ropes were also startled and rushed over to check. Just then, Lynn Emmo emerged from behind a reef on the other side of the island, far from where the wings of freedom had landed. He took a deep breath, raised his simple crossbow, and aimed at the wings of freedom member on the island who was holding a machete with his back to him and shouting the loudest. The distance is about 80 m. There is wind and the target is moving.

It's very difficult. Linmo held his breath. his muscle memory and wind sense from his rudimentary archery skills, automatically adjusting in his mind. He slightly raised his arm, anticipating the wind direction and adjusting his lead. Whoosh! The wooden arrow left the bowring, tracing a low flat arc up.

The wings of freedom member screamed as the wooden arrow pierced deep into his shoulder. The machete in his hand clattered to the ground and he fell forward. Enemy attack behind us. Chaos erupted on the island. The wings of freedom turned around in shock only to see an empty sea and reefs.

Over there behind the rocks, someone with sharp eyes spotted the splash of water Emmo made as he retreated. Damn it, there are accompllices. Send three men to kill him, roared a man who looked like the leader. Immediately, three people jumped onto a small boat mored at the shore, cursing and rowing towards the reef where Linmo was. This was exactly the effect Lynn Mo wanted to disperse the enemy's forces and create chaos and panic.

He quickly moved behind another reef and watched the small boat approach. There were three people on the boat, one rowing and two carrying harpoons and short spears, looking menacing. Limo calmly cocked the bowring again. This time the distance was closer, about 30 m. He aimed at the rower.

Shoot the horse before the man. The second arrow was fired. The rower was hit in the chest, groaned and fell backward. The earth slipped from his hand, and the small boat spun sideways on the sea. The other two were shocked, and before they could react, Lynmo's third arrow had already arrived.

Another man was hit in the shoulder and fell into the sea with a cry of pain. The remaining man with a short spear was terrified and lay prone in the cabin, too scared to show his face. The large ship on the outer perimeter was also in chaos. Although the fire at the stern had been extinguished, the smoke had not yet dissipated. Coupled with the attack on the island, the bold, burly man roared as he directed the ship to turn and provide support, but his movements were slowed by the reefs and shallows.

On the island, a man and a woman whose pressure had suddenly eased seized their opportunity. The man burst out from behind the rocks, harpooning a freedom wings member who was facing away from him and gazing out at the sea into the back of the heart. The woman screamed and stabbed another man in the back of the knee with a wooden stick. The wings of Liberty were attacked from both sides. And with their leader wounded by an arrow and reinforcements from the sea blocked, their morale collapsed instantly.

"Retreat! Retreat to the ship first!" the leader shouted horsely, clutching his bleeding arm. The survivors frantically abandoned the wounded and the bodies of their companions, scrambling towards the small boats on the shore. Some slipped and fell into the sea in the chaos, but no one paid them any attention. The large ship finally drew closer and lowered a rope to provide assistance. The bald burly man stood at the bow, his face ashen, staring intently at the direction of the reef where Lin Mo was hiding.

He then glanced at the couple on the island who were finishing off the enemy and collecting their spoils, his eyes filled with a chilling malice, but he did not order a full-scale attack. The situation was unclear. His own side had suffered heavy losses, and continuing the entanglement would be counterproductive. Go. He finally managed to squeeze out the word through gritted teeth.

Three ships, one of which was a small boat and was unmanned, carrying the remnants of the defeated army sailed away from the area in a sorry state. Only after the ship's silhouette completely disappeared off the horizon did Lynn and Mo swim back to his raft from behind the rocks. He climbed onto the raft, soaked to the bone. cold sea water dripping from his hair. He quickly dried himself, put on his outer robe, and then steered the raft slowly toward the ravaged island.

On the island, a man and a woman supported each other, wearily watching the approaching raft. The man was about 30 years old with a thin face, wearing a pair of homemade glasses made of wooden frames and glass, one lens broken, and several abrasions on his body. The woman was in her early 20s, her hair disheveled, her face covered in soot, clutching the bloodstained wooden stick tightly in her hand, her eyes defiant. Halt, who are you? The man raised his harpoon, his voice, but firm. Just passing by, I couldn't stand seeing them ganging up on us.

Lyno stopped a few meters away in the shallow water, not immediately going ashore. He showed off the simple crossbow in his hand, then placed it on the raft, indicating that he meant no harm. So Kyangen sent me. Upon hearing Su Chanchians name, the two visibly relaxed, but their vigilance remained. Sister Chen, how does she know about us? The woman murmured.

She sensed the energy fluctuations and the battle here. Lynn Emmo explained simply. Are you stargazers? The man and woman exchanged a glance and nodded. I am Leewi and this is my sister Leewinio. We were indeed trying to do some astronomical and marine meteorological observations.

Thank you for saving us. Leewi put down the harpoon, his tone much gentler, filled with exhaustion and gratitude from surviving the ordeal. Why did the wings of freedom attack you? Lynmo asked. Leewi smiled. Riley, it's probably because we previously observed some abnormal ocean currents and meteorological data which we shared on the regional channel and that caught their attention.

They think we might have special value or they simply think we're easy to bully and want to seize our pitiful equipment and accumulated data. Has the data been stolen? I had the important core record book and they smash some peripheral instruments. Lee Winio said her eyes reening. Those instruments were made by them by saving every penny and collecting materials bit by bit. Lynn Emmo glanced at the burning ruins and broken wooden poles on the island, but said nothing.

He maneuvered the raft to the shore and jumped aboard. It's not safe here anymore. The wings of freedom might come again or send someone else. Linu said bluntly, "What are your plans?" Lewi and Lee Wangis faces showed bewilderment and despair. Their small island had been almost destroyed by this calamity, and it seemed nearly impossible for the two of them to rebuild it and defend against possible retaliation.

Lyn Mo was silent for a moment before speaking. I've created a small group called Amo Yuon Pavilion. There aren't many people there yet, but our goal is to establish a relatively safe and orderly place where we can explore the truth of this world. If you're willing, you can join temporarily and contribute your observation techniques and knowledge. We will provide protection and basic survival resources.

Of course, you're free to leave. He didn't use a condescending tone, but rather laid out the cooperation openly. The ability to observe meteorological and oceanographic data will be of immense value for his future exploration of the restless sea and even wider ocean areas. Leewi and Lee Wincio looked at each other again. Lee Wangiu asked in a low voice, "Brother, what about us?" Leeway pushed up his broken glasses, took a deep breath, and looked at Lin and Mo.

We need to discuss this. Also, may I ask who you are? He noticed Lin Mo's simple but practical equipment on the raft, as well as his precise and deadly archery skills just now, which indicated that he was no ordinary passer by. Lyn Mo thought for a moment, but instead of directly revealing the name Jay, he said, "Just call me Mo. I'm one of the founders of Mo Yu." Just then, Lin Mo's bracelet vibrated. It was Sue Chanchians voice message in the group chat filled with concern.

Lynmo, how's the situation over there? I sense that the battle fluctuations have stopped and the energy reaction from the Wings of Freedom is moving away. Linmo replied directly in the group chat. It's resolved. Wings of Freedom has withdrawn. We rescued two people, Leewi and Lee Wio, the stargazers you mentioned.

They suffered considerable losses and I'm inviting them to temporarily join the Mo Yuan Pavilion. Su Chian, that's great. They're very reliable and their observation data is invaluable. Welcome to the team. Leeway Wang Xiu, this is Sue Chen.

I'm glad everything's all right now. When Leewi and Lee Wio heard Su Chanchians familiar voice coming from Linmo's bracelet, they finally let down their guard and their faces showed surprise and excitement. Sister Chanchian, it really is you. We almost. Leewio's voice choked with emotion.

It's all right. Come back with Mo first and we'll discuss this further. Su Xian comforted her. Leewi nodded heavily, looked at Linmo, and said solemnly, "Mr. Mo, my sister and I are willing to join the Mo Yuan Pavilion.

We dare not say anything else, but we will do our best to observe celestial phenomena and see conditions and record and analyze data. Welcome, Lin Monted. Pack up anything usable and let's leave as soon as possible. Half an hour later, Lynn Mo's raft carrying Leewi and his sister and a waterproof package containing valuable observation records and several core instrument parts sailed away from the rocky island still bearing the marks of war and sorrow. On the raft, Leewencio carefully wiped a broken piece of glass while he eyes silently watched his homeland gradually recede into the distance, becoming a small black dyno stood at the stern, steering the ship.

The sea breeze made his robes flutter loudly. The Mayuan pavilion welcomed its third and fourth members, a brother and sister scholar with special skills. The storm king's first external operation ended with a lightning rescue and the defeat of the wings of freedom. The news soon carried by the fleeing soldiers would spread throughout the sea. Lyn Mo's name Emo will also enter the field of vision of various forces for the first time.

He looked southeast towards the direction of the restless sea. The ship needs to be built. The people need to be gathered. The road ahead is still long, but the first step has already been taken firmly. Chapter 21.

Mo Yuan assembles. Division of labor and set sail. It was late at night when he brought Leewi and his sister back to his island. The 25 square meter island appeared more crowded than usual in the night, but it also felt more lively. Linmo cleared out the corner where materials have been stored and temporarily built two simple shelters with wood and tarpollen.

He also took out spare animal hide blankets and a simple cooking set from a storage which serve as a temporary accommodation for the new members. The conditions are basic, so let's make do for now. Safety first, Linu said succinctly. Looking at this place, which was more solid and well organized than their original island, Leewi and Lee Wanchio were particularly struck by the sight of the tin stove glowing warmly in the corner and the neatly stacked supplies beside it. A look of amazement and relief flashed in their eyes.

This was far from rudimentary compared to their recently destroyed home. This place was practically a fortress. That's already very good, Mr. Mo. Thank you.

Leeway sincerely thanked him and Leewin show also bowed quickly. No need to be polite. Just call me Linmo from now on. Or you can call me Pavilion Master like they do. Lin Mo waved his hand.

Rest first and recover your strength. You can boil water in the stove and there's clean water in the jar over there. The food is in the box over there. Help yourself. We'll talk in detail tomorrow.

After making the arrangements, Lin Mo returned to his reinforced shed. First, letting Su Chinshin know he was safe via group chat and then began processing the backlog of messages. Sure. how and Shin Duo Duo both sent more detailed replies expressing their willingness to join and inquiring about the next steps. Lynn Mo posted the first official announcement in the Mo Yuan group chat.

The first core meeting of the Mouan Pavilion will be held at 8:00 a.m. tomorrow. Location, main island. Agenda one, establishment of the charter. Two, division of responsibilities.

Three, recent goals. Attendees: Lin Mo, Pavilion Master, Su Chian, Shallow Sea Scholar, Sherhow, Iron Wall, Chin, Do Manager, Chiian, Leewi, Stargazer, Leewia, Recorder. Please reply upon receipt. The team's execution ability was beginning to show. Caesar was furious and executed two ring leaders who led the escape. He believes the attackers are Jay or someone closely associated with them has issued the highest bounty and provided some characteristics of the area where Jay might be hiding which differs from the earlier information on your island. Lynn Mo replied, "The bounty information is known. Caesar is unlikely to dare to easily attack well-defended strongholds in the short term and is more likely to resort to harassment, cutting off resources, or seeking allies to exert pressure. I will strengthen my vigilance." The movements of the Stonemason's Brotherhood are worth paying attention to. If there is any further information, we can share it.

In exchange, I can provide a high efficiency seawater desalination equipment improvement idea based on optimization of existing templates. After ending the communication, Lynn Mo leaned back on the animal hide cushion, gazing at the ceiling. The pressure was invisible yet expected. The Mo Yuan pavilion must be established and become combat ready as soon as possible. and the construction of the storm ship must be accelerated.

The next morning, as dawn broke on Lin Moe's Island, the six of them gathered together for the first time. Suchinian was the first to arrive, riding in a small but sturdy looking single kayak. She was still dressed neatly, her long hair tied up and carrying a waterproof bag that seemed to contain her tools and documents. Sherhow arrived almost simultaneously, rowing a sturdy wooden raft made of logs and ropes. He was tall and robust with a buzzcut, a square face, and calm eyes.

He carried a simple shield reinforced with heavy planks and iron sheets on his back, and a short-handled ax hung at his waist. After landing on the island, he first nodded to Lynn Emmo and then silently began to observe the defensive arrangements around the island, his expression focused. Chandu Duo arrived a little later. His raft was equipped with a simple sun shade. He was wearing a merchant's robe made of several different colors and textures of fabric.

He had a habitual smile on his face that said, "Amicable business brings wealth." His eyes were narrowed. As soon as he arrived on the island, he greeted everyone with a cupped hand, but his eyes had already quickly scanned the piles of supplies and the new faces on the island. Leewi and Lee Wangziu had already stood up and stood to the side, looking somewhat reserved. Lyno didn't exchange many pleasantries. He pointed to a cleared area in front of the shed where seats had been arranged around a circle of stones.

Sit down. Time is limited. Let's get straight to the point. Everyone took their seats. The atmosphere became slightly solemn.

The Mo Yuan Pavilion is officially established today. Lynmo got straight to the point. We are not a disorganized group, nor are we a plundering gang. Our goal is to establish an order that we can control in this chaotic sea. to gain space for survival and development and to explore the truth behind this world.

To do this, we need power, resources, intelligence, and mutual trust. He glanced at the crowd. The charter is simple. Externally, we share the benefits and risks. Internally, everyone performs their duties and shares information.

Major decisions are made through democratic consultation, but in times of crisis, I have the final say. You may raise any objections now. Sure house said in a deep voice that's how it should be in a crisis. There needs to be a leader. I have no objection.

He valued order and efficiency. What she cared more about was being able to study the marine environment with peace of mind and whether this group could provide corresponding support and protection. Chandu smiled and said, "It's only right that the pavilion master sets the course and we row the boats." Lewi and his sister exchanged a glance and quickly agreed. They were seeking asylum, so naturally they had no objections. Okay.

Linmo continued. Next is the division of labor. Sure. How? Yes. Sure.

How straightened his back. You are responsible for all defense affairs of the Mo Yuan Pavilion, personnel combat training, and the planning and command of external military operations. You are fully responsible for the further improvement of the island's defense system. the establishment of an early warning mechanism and the basic combat skills training of core members. Provide me with a list of the required resources.

Lenmo entrusted him with this important task. A glint flashed in Sherhow's eyes and he clased his hands in a deep fist salute. Sure how obeys. I will certainly live up to your expectations. You will serve as the chief researcher and intelligence officer of the Mo Yuan Pavilion.

You will be responsible for marine environmental monitoring, biological behavior analysis, weather and sea condition forecasting and detection of special energy points. I will establish a monitoring system as soon as possible. That is exactly what we ll be discussing next. Lyno looked at Shin Duo Duo. Shin Duo Duo, your subordinate is here.

Shen Duo Duo responded immediately, striking a very confident pose. You will serve as the foreign affairs steward responsible for all external commercial trade, resource procurement, information acquisition, and some diplomatic liaison for the Mo Yuan pavilion. Utilize your channels and connections to obtain all necessary materials and intelligence for the pavilion. Your mission is to obtain the greatest benefit at the lowest cost while maintaining the secrecy and security of the Mo Yuan pavilion. Accounts must be settled daily and major transactions must be reported in advance.

Lynn Mo granted Shin Duo Duo considerable commercial autonomy, but also set clear boundaries. Chandoo's eyes lit up. This was his area of expertise. Rest assured, Pavilion Master, I Chen will do my utmost to expand the Inc. Abyss Pavilion's revenue streams and manage its finances well.

Leewi Leewio. Lenmo looked at the scholar brother and sister. The two immediately tensed up. You will be responsible for establishing and maintaining the astronomical and meteorological observation station of Mayuan Pavilion and assisting Sue Chian in data recording and analysis. At the same time, you will be responsible for organizing and archiving all the drawings, documents, and map information we obtain and establishing a knowledge base.

Your work is the cornerstone of our long-term development and exploration. Lyno gave them positions that were relevant to their majors and relatively safe. Leeway excitedly pushed up his glasses. We will definitely live up to our mission. We will rebuild the observation station as soon as possible.

Leewin Shio also nodded vigorously. Finally, it's my turn. Lynamo said calmly. I'm responsible for overall planning, allocation of core resources, major decisions, and resolving the most difficult problems. At the same time, I'm preparing to build a ship capable of long-d distanceance voyages, which is crucial for the future development of Moan Pavilion.

Your full cooperation is needed. Building a long range ship, apart from Sue Chian, who had only vaguely heard of it, everyone else showed surprise, but then became excited. Having a ship meant true mobility and a wider world to explore. There are three short-term goals that Lynn Mo held up one finger. First, consolidate the foundation.

Shh will lead the effort to complete the island s defense upgrades and basic personnel training within a week. Su Chian will establish an early warning network. Shin Duo Duo will ensure a continuous supply of resources. Leewi and his sister will assist in establishing an observation station. Second, prepare for ship building.

I will compile a list of the core materials needed for the first phase. Chiian Duo Duo will be responsible for collecting or trading them through all available channels. Sherhow and Sue Chian will provide risk assessments of potential acquisition sites. Leewi and his sister will research materials and provide technical support. Third, intelligence infiltration focus on the movements of the Wings of Liberty, the objectives of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, and all information related to the restless sea and the eye of the stormed.

The task was clearly assigned and everyone understood their responsibilities. Now each of you please state your most pressing needs and difficulties. Lynn Mo concluded Sherhow needs personnel and materials to reinforce the defenses. Such Chian needs some specific materials to make sensor buoys. Chin Duo Duo needs startup capital and a list of safer trading channels.

Leewi and his sister need tools and materials to repair the observation instruments. Lynn and Mo noted everything down, allocated some resources on the spot, and agreed on the subsequent handover method. The meeting was brief and efficient. After it ended, Sherhow immediately began to inspect the island and plan defensive fortifications. Such Chian and Lewi, the siblings, huddled together to discuss the site selection for the observation station and the instrument repair plan.

Chandu duo meanwhile rubbed his hands together starting to plan how to make the most of his newly acquired authority and resources. Lynmo felt somewhat relieved after seeing the scene before him. yuan pavilion. This small boat has finally had its keel erected and its mast raised. Next, it's time to brave the winds and waves and sail into the deep blue sea.

He walked back to the shed, spread out the blueprints for the storm sailboat, and his eyes fell on the keel main material item. It's time to go and meet the mentor of this stonemason's brotherhood and see if we can exchange some knowledge for this most important first bone. Chapter 22 dragon bones are hard to find. Undercurrents converge. The gears of Moan Pavilion began to turn, each performing its function, bringing a long lost sense of efficient order.

Sherhal planned the island's defenses with near obsessive standards. Using the timber and stone supplied by Lin Mo, he built a halfperson high breast work on top of the existing low wall along the island's edge with footh holes on the inner side for observation and firing. Firing holes were pre-drilled at key locations on the breast work and it was reinforced with a mixture of clay and gravel. Simple wooden observation platforms began to be built at the four corners. Although currently only frames, they were already taking shape.

He also enlisted Lee Weii's help using his observational knowledge to set up simple warning lines with buoys and ropes at different distances around the island. If any ship or large creature touched these lines, it would trigger a bell connected to the island as an alarm. Su Chian and her brother Leeway set up a new observation station on a slightly higher sheltered spot on the island. Leeway carefully assembled the surviving instrument parts and considering Su Chian's need for energy sensing, designed a composite device using lenses and metal plates at different angles to focus light or reflect energy fluctuations, then amplifying subtle changes through simple mechanical transmission and recording them on animal hide coated with carbon powder. Although rudimentary, it was the best they could achieve under the current conditions.

Leewin was responsible for meticulously recording each observation and comparing the data with Su Chians previous records. Chin Duo Duo thrived. Having gained partial control over basic resources authorized by Lyn Mo, he immediately sprang into action. Instead of openly and aggressively acquiring the advanced materials needed for the storm sailboat, he adopted a more indirect strategy. First, he posted listings for large quantities of highquality, lowpric standard timber, stone, and rope on several secondary trading channels under the name of the Emmo Yuan Merchant Guild, quickly attracting the attention of many small and medium-sized survivors and establishing his reputation.

Simultaneously, he privately contacted several reputable medium-sized teams, exchanging stable supplies of basic materials for special materials they might have idle or temporarily in used, such as highly resilient vines, a type of lightweight driftwood, and strange glowing ore. For the truly core items like century old hardwood and star pattern steel, he merely announced a high price offer and strictly limited the trading partners and methods to avoid attracting too much attention. Lynn and Mo himself focused on the toughest challenge, finding the main material for the keel, making contact with the Stonemason's Brotherhood. The keel of a storm ship was specified in the blueprints as either a hardwood rich in oil that is over a hundred years old or the spine of a deep sea behemoth. The former required finding an ancient forested island, while the latter required hunting a terrifying creature that seemed almost unbeatable at present.

Both were far beyond reach. Lynn Emmo pinned his hopes on the Stonemason's Brotherhood. This mysterious organization specializing in ruins and ancient knowledge might know where to find this material or have an alternative. Instead of making direct contact, he spread the word through Chin Duo's channels. He had a complete exploration record of the path of eternal frost and the bronze key under ice cliff.

The key to the storm sailboat blueprints were omitted and he was willing to exchange knowledge about the core loadbearing materials of ancient large-scale buildings or lost shipb building techniques with truly knowledgeable people. This is a carefully designed lure. Both the path of ever frost and the ice kiss cliff are extremely cold and dangerous places. Bringing back information from them demonstrates strength and exploratory ability. The ancient large-scale architecture and lost shipb building techniques hint at directions the other party might be interested in.

2 days after the news was released, nothing unusual happened. Just as Linmo was considering whether to adjust his strategy, an unexpected visitor appeared at the edge of Mo Yuan Pavilion's warning range in a very peculiar way. It was a small boat, very small, more like a meticulously calculated raft made of several planks of wood and pontoons than a boat. It had no power, simply drifting with the ocean currents to a small reef about 300 m from Lima Island. There was no one on the raft, only a square object tightly wrapped in a waterproof tarpollen.

The first person to discover it was Leewi, who was adjusting the observation mirror. He immediately reported it to Lin Mo and Sue Chanchan. Linmo personally rode the small boat closer. He used a long pole to lift the package onto the boat, and after checking that there were no traps, he brought it back to the island. The package contained no letters, only three items.

A palmized dark brown block would cover with fine growth rings, heavy to the touch, and emitting a faint pine set. A rough leather map with simple lines and symbols, and a simple gray white badge, neither gold nor stone, engraved with a chisel and compass cross pattern. The wooden block was a sample of century old hardwood. Although it was only a small piece, it was enough for Linmo to verify. He was almost certain that the characteristics of this wooden block closely matched the main material of the keel required by the blueprints in his mind.

On the map, a complex body of water is outlined with simple lines, a whirlpool shaped mark in the center, and ancient barely legible symbols beside it. At the edge of the map, a line of small print in common script reads, "Sleeping forest, dragon's backbone here. Risk assured, sleeping forest abyss, dragon spine. Does it refer to the keel material? That badge clearly represents the stonemason's brotherhood." The other party did not show up or engage in conversation, but responded directly with physical objects and a map. This meant that first, they knew Lin Mo's needs.

Second, they had samples and even knew the origin. Third, they were willing to exchange, but on the condition that they would exchange the map and any subsequent possible contact in exchange for complete information on the path of Eternal Frost and Ice Kisscliffe. And fourth, they were extremely cautious and unwilling to reveal their identities and locations. It fits the mysterious, knowledgeoriented, and anti-combat style of the Stonemason's Brotherhood very well. Su Chian Xian analyzed Sleeping Forest Abyss.

I've heard this name in some fragments of ancient ocean legends. It is said to be a group of ancient wooden islands shrouded in mist with an abnormal flow of time, giant creatures, and many dangers. But it's just a legend, and no one has ever confirmed its exact location. Lynn Emmo stroked the hardwood sample. Its texture was dense, its grain beautiful, truly extraordinary.

The vortex mark on the map might be the entrance or a key location. They're offering this as both a sign of sincerity in a test. If we can't even find a location on the map or dare not go there, we naturally don't deserve anything more. Should we send someone to investigate? Sure, how asked in a deep voice. I can lead a small team.

No rush. Lin mo shook his head. Our defenses are not yet secure and the wings of freedom are watching us closely. It has not wise to split our forces and take risks. Besides, we need to verify whether this map is real or fake, and whether it is complete.

He decided to pay part of the reward first. He compiled a detailed report on the surrounding environment of the eternal frost path, the structure of the ice kiss cliff, and the characteristics of the frost eater. The key and blueprints were omitted, wrapped it in waterproof material, placed it on the unmanned raft, pushed it back into the sea, and let it drift away with the current. This is a silent dialogue. I have demonstrated my knowledge and exploratory abilities, and I have received your map and will verify it.

After dealing with the Stonemason's Brotherhood, Lynn Emmo summoned the core members and reported another important piece of intelligence that Shin Duo Duo had gathered. The Wings of Freedom are acquiring weapons and ship reinforcement materials on a massive scale, far exceeding usual quantities. Caesar seems to be personally overseeing the modification of several large galleys, adding iron rams to the bows and firing platforms to the sides. Chin Duo Duo reported his usual smile fading considerably. In addition, several of our peripheral trading points have reported that the Wings of Freedom have recently been inquiring about the locations of resourcerich areas and neutral observation stations, and their attitude is quite aggressive.

Leewi and his sister turned pale, clearly recalling their previous encounter. They are gathering strength, preparing for the next large-scale operation. Sure, how judged. The target could be a known resource island, or it could be us. Dragon Soul has also sent a warning.

Caesar's bounty has tripled and they've started recruiting some small and medium-sized rating groups, offering them benefits in an attempt to form a broader anti-J alliance, Lenmo added. However, there aren't many who respond. Caesar's reputation is too bad, and many people are afraid of being swallowed up. We need to speed up ship building. Sue Chian looked at Lynn Mo.

Only by having stronger mobility and naval combat capabilities can we break the passive defense situation. Whether it as acquiring resources or dealing with conflicts do Lynn Emmo nodded. That's right. So we must get rid of the dragon bone material as soon as possible. No matter how dangerous sleeping forest abyss is, we have to go and explore it.

But before we go, we need to make full preparations. He looked at sure how the construction of a defense system cannot stop and we must also strengthen maritime vigilance and rapid response training. Looking at Sue Chin and Leeway use the observation station to analyze the possible marine climate and ocean current patterns of a sleeping forest abyss as much as possible even if it's just speculation. Looking at Shien Duo Duo continue to acquire all possible exploration supplies. high strength ropes, climbing tools, protective gear, antidotes, lighting equipment.

At the same time, closely monitored the flow of freedom wing supplies, and determined their possible attack targets and timing. The group accepted the order and dispersed to prepare. Lynn Emmo walked alone to the edge of the island, gazing at the vast sea. The sample of century old hardwood in his hand was cold and heavy. The stonemason's fraternity handed over knives and honey.

The wings of Liberty are sharpening their knives. The shadows are closing in. But his ship is missing the most crucial backbone. He gripped the wooden block tightly, his eyes calm and deep. It seems that an expedition into unknown and dangerous territory and an inevitable maritime conflict are about to follow one after another.

The small boat that has just set sail, Moan Pavilion, is about to face a real test of wind and waves. He turned and walked toward the defensive fortifications that were being constructed with great fanfare and were being worked on at a rapid pace. Time is running out. Chapter 23. Misty Forest Clash of Sentinels.

The map of Sleeping Forest was spread out on the stone platform. Its edges weighed down by a few small stones. The sea breeze was light, but it made the edges of the leather tremble slightly, and the simple lines and strange symbols on it seemed to wrigle along with it. Linmo Su Chian and sure how gathered around the map. She du duo was counting a batch of tough vines and metal fasteners he had just brought back not far away while I and his sister were adjusting the newly installed weather vein at the observation station a little further away.

There do such lightly tapped the curve representing water ripples on the map with her fingertip. Judging from the curvature and density of the lines, this body of water may have complex ocean currents, numerous reefs, and is prone to forming eddies and fog. If Sleeping Forest Abyss is indeed an ancient tree island group under certain climate conditions, the transpiration of the huge trees could very well lead to year-round fog, which combined with the complex terrain would form a natural labyrinth. Everyone accepted the order and got to work. Over the next 2 days, the atmosphere on the island was tense yet orderly. Sher House selected six people from more than 30 peripheral members and several former Dragon Soul warriors to form an expedition reserve team which he personally led. They underwent highintensity acclimatization training in a complex reef area near the island, climbing slippery rock walls, securing ropes in the undercurrents, orienting themselves at night, making and dismantling simple traps, and team-based coordinated attacks and defenses. The training was tough, but no one complained.

Making it into the reserve team was a recognition in itself and everyone understood what the future expeditions meant. Su Chanchian and Leewi practically lived at the observation station and surrounded by data. Based on a few lines on the map, combined with Lewio's recent ocean current log and Sue Chanchian's experience with energy sensing, they repeatedly calculated and finally delineated a fan-shaped search area with a radius of about 50 nautical miles and predicted the weather windows that might appear in the next week. that would be relatively favorable for navigation and exploration. Chen Duo Duo, like a mole scurrying into the market, secretly smuggled back batches of essential expedition supplies through various overt and covert channels.

These included highquality ropes, lightweight yet durable waterproof fabric, speciallydesed non-slip shoe saws, water filtering bladders, concentrated food, first aid medicine, and even several well-maintained fine steel short knives from the black market. Meanwhile, his spies were constantly reporting on the wings of freedom's movements. The three large galleys personally overseen by Caesar were nearing completion, their rams gleaming coldly. Several combat squads under his command were frequently seen near resource points on the edge of the SH 739 area, seemingly clearing out the area and establishing outposts. On the afternoon of the third day, just as Shure sure how was preparing to conduct the final comprehensive drill, the observation station that had been responsible for perimeter security suddenly rang its alarm.

Northeast, about 2 km away, an unidentified raft is rapidly approaching. It's moving very fast and seems to have extra power. Leeway's voice came through the newly set up makeshift megaphone connected by bamboo tubes filled with tension. The island instantly went on high alert. The reserve soldiers, still in training, immediately grabbed their weapons and rushed to their designated defensive positions.

Sherhow climbed to the highest observation post and raised his binoculars. Lanimo also quickly walked out of the shed and came to the breast wall. Through the telescope, a long, narrow, and oddly shaped raft was cutting through the waves. A rudimentary, constantly swinging wheel-like device was attached to the stern, propelled by human pedaling, and indeed much faster than ordinary rowing. There were three people on the raft, all dressed in variegated fur clothing, carrying harpoons, their faces painted with grease paint, looking fierce and savage.

It wasn't a standard vessel of the Liberty Wings. It was more like a pirate or a wandering raider. They not Caesar s main force to sure how put down his binoculars and calmly assess the situation. They might be small fry who have caught wind of the situation and want to take advantage of it. Or they might be cannon fodder sent out by wings of liberty to test the waters.

Thought the raft stopped about 300 m from the island just at the edge of the effective range of the makeshift crossbow. A oneeyed burly man led the raft. He stood up, brandishing a harpoon towards the island, and shouted in a gruff voice, "Hey, listen up, islanders. This area is now blood shark gang territory. If you know what's good for you, hand over 30% of your food and water, and that woman, too." He pointed vaguely at Sue Chanchan, who is watching from the observation post window.

Otherwise, we'll raise this wretched island to the ground. Blatant extortion and provocation. Shhal looked at Linmo with a questioning gaze. Lyno shook his head slightly and said in a low voice, "Let the reserve team practice. You take command and I'll bring up the rear." A knowing glint flashed in Shure House's eyes, and he then made a hand gesture to those below.

Behind the breast work, six reserve team members gripped their weapons tightly, their breathing slightly rapid, but their eyes resolute. Having gone through previous training and sure how's indoctrination, they knew this was their first real combat test. Sherha did not immediately order the crossbowmen to fire. Instead, following the pre-arranged plan, he first had two men raise makeshift shields made of wooden planks and sheet metal to block the gap in the breast work. Then, he personally picked up a simple megaphone made of bamboo tubes and animal hides and responded in a deep voice.

This is the territory of the Mayuan pavilion. Those not involved must retreat immediately. Take another step and you will be killed without mercy. His voice was loud and clear, carrying an unquestionable air of authority. The oneeyed giant paused, seemingly surprised by the other party's forceful stance.

He spat and sneered. Emo Yuan pavilion. Never heard of it. Men in charge. Take the island.

And the goods and women are all ours. The raft started up again. The wheellike mechanism pedalling at breakneck speed, hurtling straight toward the island. The other two also raise their harpoons, yelling loudly. Archers target the drive wheel fire freely.

Sure how ordered. Two reserve team members armed with simple crossbows immediately peaked out from between the shields, aimed and pulled the triggers. Whoosh whoosh. One arrow missed and plunged into the water. The other, however, struck precisely at the point where the wooden axle at the stern of the raft was constantly rotating.

crack. The axle was not metal, but hardwood. When the crossbow bolt hit the key part, a crack appeared, and the rotation immediately became sluggish, and the speed dropped sharply. Damn it, they have crossbows, the oneeyed giant exclaimed in shock and rage. Speed up, charge.

Their crossbows will be useless once we get close. Although the raft slowed down, its inertia still carried it closer to about 100 m. Spearman, prepare. Sure, how ordered again. The other four reserve members put down their shields, which were then taken by the people behind them, picked up hardwood spears that were more than 3 meters long with the spearheads secured with sharpened metal plates or hard animal bones, and extended them from the firing ports in the breastwork, pointing diagonally forward.

The three people on the raft also became enraged, raising their harpoons and preparing to board and fight the moment they crashed into the island. Just as the raft was making its final 50 m, the oneeyed giant had already raised his harpoon, ready to throw it. Release. Shouse shouted in a low voice for spears simultaneously thrust out of the firing ports. Not at people, but at the front of the raft and near the waterline.

With the support of the breast work and the combined strength of the reserve team members, the spears were driven deep into the gaps between the planks of the raft. The raft's forward momentum suddenly halted and it was even slightly lifted up by the force of the thrust. Hold on. The oneeyed man stumbled and almost fell. Just then, Sherhow personally picked up a simple crossbow that was already loaded, aimed at the oneeyed man who was swaying due to the rocking of the raft and calmly pulled the trigger.

Whoosh! The arrow was swift and deadly. The oneeyed giant only had time to tilt his head slightly before the arrow grazed his cheek, leaving a trail of blood, and then embedded itself deeply in the shoulder of the man behind him. "Uh!" A scream rang out. The successive blows completely threw this rabble into a panic. The raft was stuck with spears, unable to move forward or backward, and the threat of crossbow bolts was imminent.

"Retreat! Retreat now!" The oneeyed giant covered his face, his previous arrogance gone, and shouted horarssely. The remaining uninjured man frantically tried to reverse the wheel-like device, but the damaged axle wouldn't cooperate. Finally, the three of them jumped off the raft and swam desperately back the way they came, abandoning the raft and their weapons. Sure, how to not order a pursuit. One should not pursue a desperate enemy, especially at sea, where the situation is unclear.

The reserve team members looked at the fleeing enemy in disarray, then at the enemy raft stuck on the shore, still swaying slightly. Their faces showed a mixture of excitement, tension, and a hint of lingering fear. They had won. In their first real battle, they had repelled the enemy with zero casualties. Sure house stepped down from the lookout tower and patted several team members on the shoulders.

Well done. But remember, this is just the beginning. Clean up the battlefield. Drag the raft up and inspect it. See if there's anything of value.

Be vigilant about your surroundings in case there are any accompllices. Yes, the team members responded in unison, their morale soaring. Lyn Mo walked to Shure House side and whispered. It was handled very well. I've never heard of the blood shark gang.

News of Mo Yuan Pavilion's 03 victory over the invaders and a capture of a raft equipped with a makeshift propulsion system quickly spread within certain circles. The construction of the storm ship was now urgent. The captured raft was towed ashore for careful examination. The rudimentary wheel-like drive mechanism inspired Linmo. Although inefficient and prone to damage, it proved that a propulsion method other than human power was feasible. The news of the covert auction acted like bait thrown into the dark web, silently touching certain hidden nerves in SH 739 and the surrounding area. The next night, it was dark and windy.

Threeforked reef is a relatively calm body of water surrounded by three huge reefs arranged in a triangular formation. At this moment, seven or eight boats of varying sizes and styles quietly entered and stopped at their designated positions, maintaining a cautious distance from one another. Each boat was illuminated only by a dim lantern, casting indistinct shadows of people on board, but their faces were not clearly visible. Chi and Duo Duo stood on the largest central rock platform with two reserve members of the Mayuan pavilion standing behind him, both dressed in matching dark waterproof suits and expressionless. Today he had changed into a more formal dark silk robe.

He had somehow acquired it, his face bearing his usual amiable smile, but his eyes appeared exceptionally shrewd under the dim light. Welcome distinguished guests to the inaugural secret appraisal event of the Mo Yuan Chamber of Commerce. Shind Woodwa's voice wasn't loud, but it carried clearly through a metal megaphone to every ship. The rules are simple. Three rare items will be displayed in turn, and bids will be made anonymously.

Only exchanges of the listed items or equivalent rare intelligence will be accepted. The highest bidder wins with immediate payment and no further questions asked upon departure. any unusual activity. He paused, his gaze sweeping over the other reefs, faintly visible in the darkness will be at your own risk." As soon as he finished speaking, silence fell over the surroundings, broken only by the gentle lapping of waves against the rocks. No one questioned that those who had received the invitation and come here were novice.

First, the blueprint for the basic fishing net and key auxiliary materials. Chi and Doduo waved his hand and one person behind him raised a waterproof tube while another person unfolded a processed copy of the blueprint. Under the light, the detailed structural diagram and material list on it were clearly visible. After a brief silence, people on the various boats began to write, then placed the tinder documents in a small wooden boxes, which were then transported by small boat to the rocky platform. Shend Duo Duo inspected them one by one without revealing his expression.

Ultimately, the blueprints were traded to a medium-sized sloop for 200 units of standard timber, 50 units of stone, plus the precise coordinates of a small, highly productive oyster reef. The offer wasn't the highest, but the accompanying coordinate information was valuable and aligned with Linmo's intention to obtain intelligence. The second item is a guide to quality fuel packs and efficient stoves. Tar wood and adal vice were displayed and key sections of the stove guide were read aloud. The competition became noticeably fierce.

Warmth and cooked food are crucial for the cohesion of any team. Several boats went back and forth in bidding. And finally, a long, narrow, fast boat that looked unassuming, but whose crew moved with agility won the bid at the cost of 10 complete sets of climbing ropes and safety harnesses, five portable high brightness lanterns, and three different regional proven formulas of insect repellent herbs. Lynn Mo silently observed from a higher reef in the distance through binoculars. The speedboat didn't resemble ordinary survivors.

It had a military feel to it. Were they from Dragon Soul or some other similar group? He noted this characteristic down. The last item, Chandua's voice rose slightly with a hint of semnity. The rough bronze armor plate forging technique fragment. Those who know its value will understand.

When a metallic sheen leather paper was unfolded, the atmosphere visibly froze for a moment, then intensified. Defense technology in any era is a strategic resource. The bidding was fierce. No one was mentioning timber or stone anymore. The bids were all for rare physical items and highle information.

Five refined iron ingots, plus a record of the quarterly variation patterns in the southern magnetic storm zone. A complete set of diving equipment, 30% damaged, plus a piece of unknown hardwood core collected from the edge of the ghost algae forest. Some training tips for the S-rank talent, Swift Step, verified. plus an ancient coin salvage from 200 meters deep in the sea. The pattern on which appears to be a nautical chart.

The bids were increasingly astonishing. Lynmo was secretly shocked. He hadn't expected so many strange and unusual items and information to be circulating in the market. Srank talent training notes, ancient deep sea coins. Behind these things lay untold adventures and profound secrets.

Just as the bidding was stabilizing and seemed to be won by the ship that offered its level talent experience plus ancient coins, a two-masted ship that had been silent from the beginning with a dark gray hull and no markings suddenly submitted a bit. Chin Duo Duo took it, opened it, and his pupils contracted slightly. He looked up at the gray ship where a figure shrouded in a cloak stood at the bow, nodding slightly. Chin Duo Duo took a deep breath and announced loudly, "The final winner bids a section of the core of a century old ironwood tree about 2 ft long and half a foot in diameter, plus a 3-day measure map of the ocean currents surrounding the sleeping forest abyss. Centuries old ironwood core.

This is precisely one of the candidate materials needed for the keel. Although not as good as a whole century old hardwood, it is definitely an excellent alternative or auxiliary material. And the value of the actual test results is self-evident. A suppressed commotion and disappointed whispers arose from the other ships, but no one dared to question it. The piece of dark brown, densely grained, iron-like with core that had been hastily displayed, along with a nautical chart marked with detailed dates and data, were enough to prove its value.

The three items were successfully sold. The process was swift and quiet. The boats that won the bids quickly extinguished their lanterns and quietly sailed away. Most of those who didn't win the bids also left in silence. A few who lingered to observe after noticing the faint reflections in the surrounding darkness.

The crossbow bolts set up by Sher How wisely chose to retreat as well. With their harvest, Chandu Duo returned to the reef where Linmo was located in a small boat. Master, I have accomplished my mission. Chindwood was face was a mixture of excitement and exhaustion as he handed several heavy packages. The precious ironwood core and a nautical chart to Lin Mo.

Besides the supplies on the list, we also got quite a few good things in exchange. That gray ship must be from the Stonemason Brotherhood. They were indeed watching us and they came out with a bang for their money. Lynn stroked the cold, hard ironwood core, then looked at the incredibly detailed ocean current map and felt reassured. This covert auction had yielded far more results than expected.

Have the wings of freedom arrived? He asked. They reheared. Dachshin duo duo lowered his voice. That small galley with a ram in the southeast corner is it. They kept a low profile the whole time only participating in the bidding for the armor craftsmanship.

But they couldn't he beat the stonemason's brotherhood in the bidding. Their people have been observing our handover with that gray ship dot. As expected, Linmo looked in the direction where the wings of freedom ship disappeared into the darkness. They should be even more certain that we have something to do with this. However, we can worry about them for now.

With this piece of wood core and the measurement map, the success rate of the expedition can be increased by 20%. Notify sure how and sue Chian that as originally planned, the expedition team will set off at sunset tomorrow. Yes, with the covert auction concluded, Emmo Yuan Pavilion not only obtained muchneeded supplies, but also acquired crucial materials and intelligence. The eye of the storm has quietly shifted to the sleeping forest shrouded in mist and legend. Chapter 25.

The mystery begins. Shadows lurk across the land. At sunset, the expedition team set off on time. The team consists of six members. Linmo Shirhao Such Chian Leewi and two reserve members who performed best in previous training and the blood shark gang attack a Wu skilled in climbing and close combat and Shiao Chun with excellent eyesight adept at observation and setting traps.

Leewinio and Shien Duodo remain on the island to be responsible for defense and support. The vessel they were on was a relatively large raft that had been hastily modified. The main body was constructed of sturdy logs bound together with added side panels for protection against waves and stray arrows. A makeshift cabin built in the center using wooden poles and a waterproof tarpollen was used to store supplies and provide resting places for the crew. The stern retained a captured and modified wheel drive system which could be operated by two people to provide auxiliary power in calm conditions or when maneuvering was needed.

A detachable metal ram made from materials exchanged during a covert operation was added to the bow and there were three firing ports on each side. This is the best vessel that could be prepared under the current conditions. It is not fast enough, not maneuverable enough, but it is sturdy enough and carries everyone's expectations for this expedition. Following the measured map provided by the Stonemason's Brotherhood and the weather window calculated by Sue Chanchian, the ship departed Muan Pavilion Island at dusk heading southeast. The initial voyage was calm and peaceful with the sea surface shimmering with fragmented moonlight under the night sky.

Apart from the monotonous sound of oars and the occasional cry of seabirds, all was quiet. Shirhao was in charge of steering and keeping watch while Such Chanchian constantly sensed the energy fluctuations in the surrounding sea and compared them with the ocean current data recorded by Leewi, making minor adjustments to the course. Lin Mo, A Woo, and Shiao Chun took turns paddling and resting to conserve their energy. The first half of the night passed peacefully. As the night progressed, fog began to quietly spread over the sea.

At first, it was just a thin veil, not obstructing visibility. But the fog thickened further ahead, its color gradually changing from grayish white to a strange pale blue. Visibility rapidly decreased to less than 50 m. We've entered the fog zone marked on the chart, Leeway said in a low voice, referring to the nautical chart. The chart says, perennial fog, easy to lose sense of direction, occasional unusual sounds.

It is recommended to maintain a straight course and rely on instruments for navigation. Everyone stay alert, Shir said in a deep voice, slowing the boat down. Woo! Shiao Chan, watch out for any movement on either side and under the boat. Miss Sue, do you sense anything unusual? Su Chian closed her eyes and concentrated for a moment, her brows furrowing slightly. The fog itself doesn't have any obvious malicious energy, but it's very heavy, creating a sense of obstruction, and my perception range is severely compressed.

In addition, there are some scattered life forms underwater, not very large, but very fast, seemingly swimming around us without showing any intention to attack. Lenmo took out the precise compass he had obtained in the exchange, and confirmed the direction. Maintain course. The speed can be slower. Safety first.

The raft moved slowly through the thick blue fog as if sailing into a secluded dreamland. Apart from the sounds of the oars cutting through the water and the creaking of the rudder, the world was silent. Even the wind seemed to be swallowed by the fog. This absolute silence was unsettling. There is a sound.

Shiao Chun suddenly perked up his ears and lowered his voice. It is very faint to the left front like a lot of claws scraping with duck. Everyone immediately held their breath. Sure enough, a faint but dense rustling sound came from the mist to the left, growing louder as it approached. Sure, how made a gesture, and a Woo and Shiao Chun immediately picked up the crossbows and aimed them in the direction of the sound.

Lyno also gripped his modified crossbow tightly. The fog swirled, and several dark shapes gradually emerged. Were they not boats, but floating logs? No, they were the carrapase of some kind of creature. There were several strange creatures similar in size to sea turtles, but with dark green shells covered in wart-like protrusions and edged with fine barbs. They floated slowly in the foggy sea, paddling with their short, thick limbs.

Their heads were small, their eyes were cloudy white, and they seemed to have no interest in the raft. They just mechanically swam in a certain direction, their shells rubbing against each other, making a rustling sound. It s a mist walking crab turtle sue chian breathed the sigh of relief. It s an inert creature that lives in specific foggy sea areas. It feeds on microorganisms and floating algae in the fog and it almost never attacks.

Its shell is very hard but its flesh is said to be poisonous. Their appearance means that we are on the right track and that this foggy sea has a stable ecosystem. Dot. It was a false alarm, but the strange creature and the oppressive environment made the atmosphere even more tense. The raft continued its journey.

A little over an hour later, just as dawn was breaking and the fog was at its thickest, the color of the sea ahead seemed to change. It was no longer a deep blue, but rather shimmerred with a hazy grayish green glow. We're almost there. Leeway's voice was a little excited. According to the actual measurement map, the seawater in the core area of the Fog Sea will appear fluorescent gray green due to the secretions of a large number of ancient tree roots and special minerals.

The edge of the sleeping forest abyss is nearby. Sure enough, the fog soon began to thin and visibility gradually returned. The first thing to catch the eye was a series of landscapes that abruptly appeared on the sea. They weren't islands at all, but rather the incredibly massive root systems of trees. Like gnarl dragons, they intertwined, some above the surface, some submerged, forming a complex labyrinth forest of roots.

Seawater flowed among the roots, producing a murmuring hollow echo. The main trunks of these roots extend upwards, disappearing into the still thick fog, completely obscuring the treere's crown. Each exposed root is so thick that it takes several people to encircle it. The bark is a deep iron gray covered with heavy moss and parasitic vines. The air becomes damp and heavy filled with a strong complex aroma of decaying wood earth and some kind of crisp resin.

My god, how big must this tree be? A Woo murmured looking up. A thousand years or even longer? Leeway stroked a nearby cold slippery route. his eyes gleaming behind his glasses. This grain, this density far surpasses ordinary hardwood. If the main trunk, find a main trunk or sufficiently thick and suitable branch.

Lynn Mo suppressed the shock in his heart and ordered, "Sue Chian, sense which direction has the most concentrated life, energy, or wood essence." Leewi, pay attention to recording the distribution pattern of these roots and find the path leading inward. Such Chian closed her eyes again to sense, this time taking even longer.
