Lyn Mo gazed at the ship's hull, which gleamed with a metallic sheen in the setting sun, and then looked at the busy yet hopeful figures around him. Even if it's too late, it has to be just in time, he said firmly. Notify everyone to speed up the construction.

Two shifts a day and night. Sure. How? Raise the defense level to the highest level and prepare to deal with the sea monsters attack. Shin duo duo. Spare no effort to ensure the supply of materials, especially arrows, oil, and reinforcement materials.

A sense of crisis lashed at everyone like an invisible whip. The construction site was brightly lit all night, and the shouts and hammering grew more urgent. Everyone understood that they were racing against disaster. On the third day after the warning of the marine mammal tide, the hole was mostly laid and the base of the main mast was fixed. The ship on which high hopes were placed was already showing its fierce yet beautiful prototype, a streamlined hole, towering mast base, and many reserved firing ports and ballista positions.

On that very day, Su Chian's warning came true. The alarm bell at the observation station blared piercingly at noon. Leeway's roar echoed across the entire island through the megaphone. Southeast southwest. Massive high-speed life reactions.

The numbers are incalculable. It's a marine mammal tide. A real marine mammal tide. Everyone stopped what they were doing and looked out at the sea. At first, the horizon was just a rolling white line.

But soon that white line transformed into a surging boiling black tide. Not seaater, but a death tide of countless marine creatures, diverse in species and size, yet all radiating a ferocious hostility. There were enormous bony fish with monstrous backs, octopuses and squid with waving tentacles and glowing red eyes, sea crabs with black shells as large as millstones, and even the dorsal fins of several large predators could be seen faintly visible amidst the horde. Their target seems to be all the islands in this sea area that exude an aura of civilization. All personnel to defensive positions, non-combat personnel to take cover.

Sherhow's roar overwhelmed the initial panic. Almost at the same time the order was given, the vanguard of the first wave of beasts crashed hard into the defenses of Muan Pavilion Island. Boom! Crash! The breast works trembled violently and waves carrying ferocious sea creatures crashed onto the shore. Crossbow bolts whistled, boulders tumbled down, and oil canisters exploded into seas of fire. The battle instantly intensified.

This time, the sea monsters were even more ferocious and reckless than the last invasion. They seemed to be driven by some invisible force, charging forward wave after wave. Lynmo, crossbow in hand, stood behind the breast work, firing continuously, targeting the largest individuals that seemed to have a commanding role. Sure, how like a pillar of strength, appeared wherever the defense was drained. each swing of his battle axe, claiming the lives of several sea beasts.

Ziaoai, Luong, Au, Shiao, Chun, and other core combatants also held their ground fiercely on the front line. However, the number of sea monsters was simply too great. The defenses were in dire straits in many places, and casualties began to appear. Worse still, the observation station where Sue Chanchian was located due to its high position seemed to have attracted the attention of more flying sea creatures such as giant sea bats and mutated seabirds and was besieged in an imminent danger. Linmo saw the critical situation and his eyes sharpened.

He suddenly turned around and shouted to the team members behind him who were operating the heavy crossbows, "Turn the cannons around. Lynn Mo. With everything arranged, everyone dispersed." Lynn Emmo stepped out of the council chamber, the sea breeze brushing against his face. He walked along the newly built pier toward the gradually taking shape giant ship.

The craftsman stopped what they were doing when they saw him, casting a look of awe in their eyes. Lynn Emone nodded to them, signaling them to continue. He stroked the cool, smooth hull, feeling the unique resilience of the wood under his fingertips and the meticulously carved riveting marks. This was not merely a combination of wood and metal. It was the crystallization of the sweat, wisdom, and even blood of everyone in the Mo Yuan pavilion.

He climbed to the deck of the still under construction Stern Tower and looked down over the entire island. Fortifications stretched out in all directions. Watchtowers towered high and construction sheds dotted the landscape with people bustling about. A heavy sense of responsibility welled up within him. Secaster Shau's voice came from behind and he walked up to stand beside Lyn Mo after the ship is built.

Where's the first step? Lynmo didn't answer directly, but instead asked, what do you think? The wings of freedom must be dealt with or there will never be peace. Sure house said without hesitation, but attacking their stronghold directly is too risky. I suggest that we take advantage of our mobility to first eliminate their resource points and outposts on the periphery, cut off their claws, and force their main force to go out to sea for a decisive battle. At the same time, we should search for the entrance to the restless sea where there may be the highle materials we urgently need, and we can also verify Miss Sue's senses, just like Lyno had thought. And there's the stone masters brotherhood.

Lynn Mo added, "They gave us maps and wooden cores, then went silent. I always felt that cube was key. We need more information about the truth of this world. They might know." The two men stared silently at the sea. In the distance, several small boats, clearly not belonging to the Moan Pavilion, lingered outside the cordon, seemingly spies from various factions who had come spy on them.

"Sure how's eyes turned cold. Should we send him away? No need, Linimo shook his head. Let them see. The clearer it is, the more some people will think twice. Deterrence is sometimes more effective than concealment.

Three days flew by under extreme pressure. The island was brightly lit almost day and night. Everyone was exhausted, but their eyes burned with a fire. The fire of witnessing the birth of a miraculous ship. Finally, at noon on the third day, all the main structures were installed.

Although many details were still incomplete and the interior was completely empty, the two masted sailing ship over 20 m long with its streamlined hull, towering main mast and menacing ram stood majestically in the expanded dock. Its hull was entirely dark brown except for the newly carved simple yet imposing wave and wind pattern totem on the bow which stood out vividly in the sunlight. The two characters, Emo Yuan, freshly painted on the stern, were powerful and imposing. On the riverbank, all members of the Muan Pavilion, whether or not they had participated in the construction, gathered. The craftsmen's faces were covered in oil, but their eyes shown with an astonishing light.

The soldiers stood at attention, weapons at their sides. Non-combatants helped the wounded, craning their necks in anticipation. Even Su Chian supported by Lee Wio stood at the very front of the crowd. Linmo stood at the bow of the ship facing the crowd. The sea breeze billowed his robes making them flutter loudly.

Gentlemen, his voice transmitted clearly through the tin megaphone reached everyone's ears. This ship has no name because its name will be written by every voyage we make, every victory we achieve. It is not merely wood and iron. is an arc forged from the will, sweat, and sacrifice of all of us. Today, it will embrace the ocean for the first time.

He paused, his gaze sweeping over each face, whether weary, excited, or expectant. I know that many people are still doubting, fearing, and watching. They doubt whether we can survive under the threat of the wings of freedom and countless sea monsters. They fear this world full of unknowns and dangers. They watch how far a little boat which has just set sail can go to.

But I stand here today only to tell you and to everyone watching us. Lynn Emmo slammed his hand heavily on the cold ship side. From this day forward, Emo Yuan Pavilion will fear no storm. This ship will be our sword and shield as we cleave through the waves. Our goal is not to survive, but to conquer.

To conquer this raging sea, to unveil the mysteries of this world and to carve out a place where we can truly stand for ourselves and for all those who are willing to follow us. Now he turned to face the sea, took a deep breath, and declared loudly. I hereby announce that the flagship of the Muan Pavilion is launched and set sail. Roar! Amidst deafening cheers, the ropes to the massive wooden sliding rails were simultaneously cut. The dot gates opened and seawater poured in.

Under the watchful eyes of hundreds of people, the dark brown behemoth emitted a deep ancient grinding sound as it slowly and steadily slid into the azure sea along the greasecoated slide. The waves splashed. The boat sank slightly, then rose steadily and swayed gently with the waves. It was a success. The crowd on the shore erupted in even louder cheers and applause, and many people were moved to tears.

Lynn, Emo, it did not linger. He turned around and nodded to Shao, A Wu, Shiao Chun, and the first batch of 10 selected sailors, including Xiao, Thai, and Lu Fong, who were already waiting at the ship's side. Board, raise the sails, see trials begin. The sailors, well-trained, climbed the rope nets and took their positions. Sherh Howal personally took the helm.

On the main mast and fore mast, huge triangular sails made of high strength canvas were slowly raised, making a full rustling sound in the seab breeze. The auxiliary paddle wheel at the stern was also started by manpower to provide initial power. The dark brown sailboat, as if imbued with a soul, slowly began to leave the dock, gliding along the coastline of Moyuan Island and heading towards the vast open sea. The crowd on the shore chased and cheered, reluctant to disperse for a long time. As Su Chanchian watched the ship's silhouette gradually shrink, feeling the extremely weak yet real connection established through the heart of the ocean.

A relieved smile appeared on her pale face. She and Dodu, meanwhile, had already begun to plan how to use this successful launching ceremony and the reputation of the king of storms to gain more benefits and development space for pavilion. On the distant sea, the spying ships hurriedly turned around, spreading the news that Mayuan Pavilion possesses a large sailing ship and has successfully launched it to all directions as quickly as possible. The king of storms has boarded the ship with his sword. The curtain of a new era is being slowly drawn back by this giant black sailed ship on a deep blue sea.

The sails receded into the distance, leaving only a straight white contrail, as if announcing the arrival of the conquerors to this boundless raging sea. Chapter 34, First Battle triumphs, new rules for the coast. The storm sailing ship's first sea trial did not go far. Sherhow carefully maneuvered the giant ship, which he was not yet fully familiar with, and conducted various basic tests within a range of about 10 nautical miles from Muan Pavilion Island. steering flexibility, speed under different wind conditions, pressure resistance of the sail and rigging system, efficiency of the propeller auxiliary power, and overall stability of the hull.

The results were exhilarating, although the hollow interior resulted in a high center of gravity and slight tilting during sharp turns. The keel's strength and the hull's streamline design provided excellent resilience. With the main sail and jib working together, it could reach speeds of nearly 8 knots in moderate winds. And with manual propulsion, it could break 10 knots in shore bursts. This was an astonishing speed in an era when rowing and rudimentary sails were the norm.

Good boat. Sure, how gripped the helm tightly, feeling the steady and powerful feedback from the waves beneath his feet. A rare hint of admiration appeared on his usually stern face. It's just that I still need to get used to the handling, especially the turning, which is much slower than a small raft. Lynmo stood at the bow, letting the sea breeze caress his face, his sharp gaze sweeping across the surrounding waters.

In his field of vision, besides a few curious seabirds following him, there were only a few small boats observing from a far spies from various factions, seemingly intimidated by the imposing presence of this massive black sailed ship, dared not approach. "The testing is almost complete. Return a port," Lin Mo ordered. Let everyone familiarize themselves with the coordination between their respective positions on the ship. Starting tomorrow, we will conduct tactical drills.

The sailboat traced a graceful arc across the sea before turning back. Although the sailors were still somewhat clumsy, their training was beginning to show results. Raising and lowering the sails, adjusting the mooring lines, and relaying commands were gradually becoming more methodical. Just then, Shiao Chan, who was in charge of lookout, suddenly issued a warning from the main mass lookout basket right front about five nautical miles. Smoke and fire.

It looks like ships are fighting. Everyone immediately became alert. Lyn Mo raised his binoculars and looked. Sure enough, on the southeastern horizon, the outlines of several ships could be vaguely seen, intertwined, black smoke rising, and occasional flashes of light from explosions. The distance was too great to discern which force it belonged to, but it seemed to be quite large.

Shall we go take a look? Sure, how asked. Lin Mo pondered for a moment. A newly launched ship unaccustomed to combat, risked greatly by rashly engaging in unfamiliar battles. But this also presented an opportunity to test its combat capabilities, observe the movements of surrounding forces, and perhaps even move closer, maintain distance, and observe from outside the engagement zone, Linmo decided. Everyone, level one combat readiness.

Load the ballisti. Archers on deck. Do not fire without my order. Yes. The sailboat adjusted its course and quietly headed towards the battle zone.

As the distance closed, the battlefield situation gradually became clear. For ships are besieging one. The ship under attack is a medium-sized two-masted merchant vessel. Its hold damaged in several places, its sails ablaze, and it is desperately putting up a fight. The four attacking ships are of different styles, but all of them fly a black flag with crossbow knives and lightning bolts on their prow the wings of liberty.

They're plundering merchant ships. The merchant ship was clearly no pushover either. Its deck was teeming with people, and arrows and spears were constantly being fired back. A couple of ballisti were even firing, repelling several small boats that attempted to board. But facing an attack from four ships, defeat was only a matter of time.

It's the White Bird. Shi and Duo Duo had somehow climbed up to the bow of the ship, holding up another pair of binoculars. His expression changed. Captain Lao buys an honest man. He mainly runs short hall trade between SH 738 and 739.

He's done business with us a few times and has a very good reputation. Those bastards from the wings of freedom. Lynmo's eyes were icy cold. Caesar had just suffered a great loss at his hands. And now he was plundering neutral merchant ships to make up for his losses.

His methods as despicable as ever. Master, shall we fight? Shirha asked in a deep voice, his hand already gripping the helm. On the deck, A Wu Xiao Tai and the others also gripped their weapons tightly, their eyes burning with determination. On their first test to the new ship, they yearned for a real victory to prove themselves. Lynmo didn't answer immediately.

He was calculating. The enemy had four ships. Two were similar warships to those he had seen before, and two were converted speedboats. Beside only had one new ship with fewer than 20 sailors. Although the ship was strong and the cannons powerful, relatively speaking, they were at a disadvantage in terms of numbers and experience.

Charging indirectly for a head-on battle would be unwise. His gaze swept across the battlefield, then looked at the quiet yet dangerous black sailboat beneath his feet, and a thought flashed through his mind. No boarding action. Lynn Emmo quickly ordered. Sure.

Howal, seize the windward position and maintain distance. Ballist, aim at those two speedboats. Prioritize damaging their engines and sails. Archers, use free fire to disrupt the enemy ship's decks. Chi and Dodu, use flag signals and megaphones to call out White Bird, telling them to move closer to us.

We'll cover their retreat. The order was clearly given. Shirhow immediately took the helm and the sailboat taking advantage of the wind drew a swift arc seizing the upwind position on the battlefield while maintaining a distance of about 150 m from the freedom wings ships just within the effective range of the heavy ballisti and beyond the threat range of most of the enemy's arrows pavilion is here wings of freedom cease your attack immediately or you will be considered to have declared war on us and do picked up a tin megaphone and ruled with all his might while simultaneously having a sailor who knew Semaphore send out a simple signal. The sudden appearance of the massive black sailed warship and its shouts brought the battlefield to a standstill. The wings of freedom clearly recognized this newly renowned vessel, their offensive noticeably slowing.

The four ships began to adjust their formation, wearily facing the direction of the Inc. Abyss Pavilion. Meanwhile, the heavily damaged White Bird, as if grasping at a straw, desperately steered towards Linn Mos direction. It's the Moyuan Pavilion, the Storm King's ship, came a joyful shout from the White Bird. Who cares about any king? There's only one ship.

What's there to be afraid of? Let's rob them all. On one of the wings of Freedom's warships, a leader-like man grinned and ordered, "Send one warship and one speedboat to block that merchant ship. The other two follow me and take down this charlatan. Two ships, a warship and a speedboat, broke away from the encirclement and approached the black sailing ship. The other two ships intensified their attack on the white bird.

Greed nose. Then Emmo sneered. Crossbows, aim at that speedboat, fire. The two heavy ballisti, already calibrated, roared with a deep resonant sound. The armthick musketss tore through the air with a piercing shriek, hurtling straight at the fast enemy ship that was attempting to outflank them.

The wings of Liberty's fast boat had a relatively thin hull designed for speed. One crossbow bolt grazed the hull, kicking up a cloud of wood chips. The other, however, struck squarely in the mid stern of the hull. Could boom. Wood chips flew everywhere.

A large hole was torn in the hull of the speedboat. Seaater rushed in. The speed dropped sharply. The hull began to tilt and chaos ensued on board. With just one salvo, they destroyed one of the enemy's mobile forces.

The leader of the wings of freedom on the charging warship gasped in shock. He hadn't expected the enemy's ballisti to be so powerful and accurate, but he was already prepared, so he had no choice but to bite the bullet and order his archers to fire while simultaneously trying to get closer to the ship side. However, the black sailing ship, which had the upwind position, was faster and more agile. Sure, how steered steadily, maintaining a perfect distance from the enemy ship at all times. The archers on deck under the cover of shields continuously hurled arrows at the enemy ship.

Although their accuracy was mediocre due to the distance and the wind and waves, they effectively disrupted the enemy's deck crew. Lyno did not use Ballisti to attack the warship, but instead ordered, "Aim at the other warship, besieging the White Bird and break its mast." The Ballistic crew quickly adjusted their angle. At that moment, the White Bird was desperately trying to break free from the entanglement and was quite close to the warship at a tricky angle. Put another precise volley. One crossbow bolt missed its target, but the other, as if guided by its own eyes, slammed into the lower part of the warship's main mast.

could boom. The heavy hardwood mast groaned under the strain and snapped in two, crashing down on the deck along with the sail ropes. The warship instantly lost its main power and spun sideways on a sea, unable not only to continue pursuing the white bird, but also blocking its companions attack route. In the blink of an eye, of the four ships of Wings of Freedom, one was severely damaged, one was paralyzed, and only two remained intact, one of which was temporarily held up by the White Bird. The battlefield situation reversed in an instant.

The captain of the warship that had originally charged toward the black sailing ship was terrified when he saw that his side had lost more than half of its fighting force in an instant, while the strange black sailing ship was unharmed and still moving nimly. Retreat. Retreat now. He roared horarssely, no longer caring about saving face, and turned the boat around to run away. Try to run.

Lyn Mos eyes turned cold. Chase after them. Keep your distance and send them off with arrows and crossbows. Sure, how don't let them get away easily. The black sailing ship, like a persistent leech, used its speed advantage to linger at a distance behind the fleeing warship.

Its ballisty occasionally booming and its arrows constantly harassing it. Although it failed to sink the warship, it had left it in a sorry state with men constantly falling into the water from arrow wounds, its sails pierced in several places, and its speed gradually decreasing. Finally, after leaving behind more than a dozen corpses and a ship full of wounds, the warship barely managed to shake off its pursuers and rendevu with another equally battered warship that had also managed to escape the clutches of a white bird before fleeing in a panic to the southeast. The crippled warship and the heavily damaged fast ship were mercilessly abandoned on the sea. Their crews jumping overboard and desperately swimming away.

Linmo did not order a complete annihilation. One should not pursue a desperate enemy. The situation at sea is complex and he needed to preserve his strength and also leave behind some propaganda materials. The battle ended and the sea returned to calm, leaving only burning wreckage, floating debris, and the wailing of those who had fallen into the water. The white bird slowly approached, and Captain Lao by a middle-aged man with a weathered face and injured arm, stood at the damaged bow and bowed deeply to the black sailboat.

"Thank you so much, Pavilion Master Lynn, for saving my life. I will never forget it, Captain B. There's no need for such formalities." Lynn Emmo stood at the ship's railing. With the wings of freedom rampaging, it's our duty to stand guard and help each other. How is your ship damaged? Are there any casualties? Seven brothers died and more than a dozen were injured.

The ship can still move with difficulty, but it needs major repairs. Bi's voice was filled with grief and relief. If it weren't for Pavilion Master Lynn's timely arrival, my entire crew would probably have perished here today. Come back to Muan Pavilion with me to rest first. Lynn and Mo invited.

Also, Captain B, may I speak with you in private? I want to talk to you and all my friends who are still struggling to survive about what happened today and the rules of this sea area from now on. Old B was taken aback, then seemed to understand something and nodded solemnly. I dare not disobey. The black sailboat led the battered white bird back towards Moyuan Island. News of this battle spread faster than the wind throughout SH 739 and the surrounding area.

Linmo, the king of storms, piloted the newly launched black sailed giant ship on his first voyage, single-handedly defeating the four ship raiding squadron of Wings of Freedom and rescuing the White Bird with almost no damage to himself. Wings of Liberty suffered another crushing defeat. Their ferocity thwarted. What people care about even more is what Lyno said to Captain B at the end about the rules of the sea area. All the forces, teams, and lone wolves who heard the news understood that this sea, which was originally dominated by chaos and power, was about to welcome a new ruler who was trying to establish order.

Although he only had one ship and his territory was just an island, but the power, skill, and unwavering yet undeniable presence he displayed have prompted many to begin to seriously consider. Will they continue to struggle in the fear and chaos of the wings of liberty? Or will they turn to the perhaps more orderly future envisioned by the newly crowned King of the Storm? On the sea, black sails flutter, cutting through the waves, resolutely heading towards home. What it carries is not just a ship full of people and victory, but also the prototype of a new era and a set of new maritime regulations that will soon be forcibly implemented. Chapter 35. New rules establish authority.

Order takes shape. When a white bird followed the giant black sailed ship into the makeshift dock on Muan Pavilion Island, Captain Lao by and his still shaken crew were stunned by the site before them. They had expected to see a dilapidated, barely surviving post-war camp, but instead they were greeted by a wellorganized, heavily fortified sea fortress. Tall, thick breast works snaked along the island. Flags flew brightly at top wooden and stone watchtowers.

Craftsmen were repairing fortifications. Soldiers were patrolling and training. And in the distance, in a newly built dock, the skeletons of several smaller vessels were even being erected. The entire island exuded an air of efficiency and vitality. A stark contrast to the chaos and despair circulated outside.

"This is the Mo Yuan pavilion." A young sailor behind Lao by murmured, his eyes filled with disbelief. "Captain by please." Linmo had already disembarked and was waiting at the dock. He had changed out of his battle attire and was now wearing a simple dark cloth robe. His expression was calm without the arrogance of someone who had just fought a great battle. Instead, he appeared even more composed.

Old by hurly led his men off the ship and bowed respectfully once again, "Sect Master Lynn. We are sorry to have bothered you. Your place has truly broadened my horizons. It's just a struggle for survival." Lin Mo led them to a relatively intact shack area. Your crew could be temporarily housed here.

Such Chanchi and our doctor will bring people over to treat the wounded. Food and water will be delivered soon, so please rest first. The thoughtful arrangements move the crew of the white bird to tears of gratitude. Soon, steaming hot fish soup and baked flatbread were brought over and sued Shian, although she herself had not fully recovered. Also came with Lewincentio and several people who knew a little about herbal medicine to clean and bandage the wounded.

All of this made these people who had just experienced a life or death ordeal feel a longlost sense of security and warmth. After settling in briefly, Lynn and Mo met with Lao by privately in the central meeting hall. She and Duo Duo and Sherhow were also present. The shed was simply furnished with only a rough wooden table and a few stools. Linmo poured Lao by a cup of hot water and got straight to the point.

Captain Bai, I save you out of sense of duty, so don't worry about it. I invited you here today to talk about business at sea. Old by held the warm water cup in both hands and said with a rice smile, "Sect leader Lynn, in this world, what legitimate business is there anymore? It's nothing more than risking your life to rumage through various survivor outposts for supplies to earn a living. And you have to be constantly on guard against hungry wolves like the wings of freedom, just like today. What if I told you that this situation could be changed? Lyn Mo looked into his eyes.

Ola was taken aback. Change? How can be changed? Unless someone can suppress the wings of freedom and make this sea behave properly. After he finished speaking, he himself felt that it was unlikely. The wings of freedom were powerful and Caesar was even more notorious. Rules are made by people.

Lynmo's tone was calm yet carried an undeniable power. The rules of wings of freedom are the law of the jungle where the strong prey on the weak and plunder for survival. My rules are fair trade and win-win order. He gestured to Chandu Duo. Chandu Duo immediately took out a simple clause written on a waterproof animal hide and pushed it in front of Loi.

The temporary general rules for the Mo Yuan C draft. Olai read the title aloud, his heart inexplicably beating a little faster. The provisions are very simple with only a few core points. I within the sphere of influence of the Mayuan pavilion tenatively SH 739 and some surrounding waters. The safety of navigation and transactions of all vessels that abide by the rules will be guaranteed.

Two unprovoked attacks and plundering of other ships are prohibited except for legitimate self-defense and hostile forces as announced. Third, Muan Pavilion establishes an arbitration office to accept and mediate maritime disputes subject to the voluntary participation of both parties. Four, Muan Pavilion provides paid escort, birth maintenance, and basic material supply services. Five, all shelter vessels are obligated to share non-core information on sea conditions, weather, and danger zones. At the end of the article, there is a line of small print.

During the trial period, Muan Pavilion reserves the right of final interpretation and the right to use force to uphold the rules. Old by read it over and over again, his breathing growing heavier. These few points, seemingly simple, directly addressed the biggest pain point for these small and medium-sized merchant ships and team safety. If it could be truly realized, even partially, it would mean they wouldn't have to live in constant fear and could focus more on trade and production. Smaster Lynn, is this is this really possible? Old Bay's voice trembled.

The wings of freedom will not stand idly by and there are other large and small plundering groups as well. Therefore, this requires the joint efforts of everyone who does not want to be plundered. Linmo said Mo Yuan Pavilion will be the framework of this umbrella, but it needs more ships like the White Bird to support this sky together. We do not ask you to pay tribute, nor do we force you to join. We only ask that while enjoying the protection, you abide by the rules and within your capabilities, share resources and help each other.

This is an open strategy. They're trading security and order for people's hearts, intelligence, and potential business networks. By remained silent for a long time, he had been naive at sea for many years. Lynmo's ambitions were vast, and the risks were immense. But the reality was that without the Mo Yuan pavilion, his white bird would have sunk today and his men would be dead.

Following the bandit logic of wings of freedom would ultimately lead to either being swallowed up or destroyed. The path Linmo offered at least seemed to offer hope. I need time to consider this and I also need to discuss it with the brothers on board. Old finally said, his tone much more reassuring. But in any case, I by and everyone on the White Bird will forever remember the lifesaving grace of Pavilion Master Lynn today.

If there is any need for us as long as it doesn't go against our conscience, we will certainly not refuse. That's enough. Then Montac nuted. You guys stay here to repair the ship and recover from your injuries. Think it over carefully.

Chin Duo Duo will be in charge of coordinating supplies and repairs with you. After seeing off the emotionally turbulent Lao by Shin Duo Duo immediately stepped forward, his small eyes shining. SE leader brilliant. This general rule is tantamount to recruiting all small and medium-siz forces. As long as we demonstrate the strength to stop the wings of freedom.

We won't have to worry about people coming to join us. At that time, information, resources, and manpower will all converge on us. The premise is that we can hold them off. sure how said in a deep voice, pouring cold water on the situation. Caesar has suffered such a huge loss, he won't let it go easily.

Next time, there will probably be more than just a few raiding ships. Although our ship is powerful, we only have one, and we have few people. We are more than enough for defense, but far from enough to launch an offensive and control a large area of the sea. I know that Lynamo walked to the edge of the shed, looking at the bustling island outside. So we need allies and we need time.

Shien do Yuri in charge of releasing the contents of today battle and the general rules in an appropriate way. Emphasize our victory over the wings of freedom and our protection of merchant ships for those wavering oppressed small groups. You can secretly contact them and offer them some appropriate assistance. Understood. Public opinion warfare is also part of business warfare.

Shen Duo Duo accepted the order. Sure. How Linamo turned to him while strengthening the defenses. Select a second batch of sailors from the reserves and craftsmen to begin shipboard training. Also investigate whether we can use existing materials and captured freedom wing ships to quickly convert several fast sentry ships or auxiliary warships into vessels that can cooperate with the main warships.

They don't need to be very powerful, just capable of reconnaissance, harassment, and transportation. Converting captured ships will take time, but it's highly feasible. I'll get on it immediately. Sure, how agreed. Also, Lynn Mo concluded, "Contact Dragon Soul Steel Gun.

Send them a copy of our established general rules, stating our position and intentions and seeking their opinions and possible cooperation. At the same time, inquire about the latest gathering movements of the Wings of Liberty and whether there is any new information regarding the Stonemason Brotherhood." The three men each accepted their orders and departed. Lynn Mo remained alone in the council chamber, his fingers unconsciously tapping on the table. Implementing new regulations and consolidating resources were on the agenda sooner than he had anticipated. But the opportunity was fleeting, and with the prestige of defeating the wings of freedom and rescuing the white bird at its peak, he had to raise the banner as soon as possible.

Caesar's revenge is a sword hanging over our heads. We must we have a net strong enough before he swings it down again. But deeper still, the long-standing mysteries and threats, the call of the restless sea, the secret of the sleeping forest, the silence of the Stonemason Brotherhood, and the deep sea tremors that Sue Chanchian sense cannot be ignored. He stepped out of the shed, the setting sun painting the sea a golden red hue. Beside the dock, the massive blacksailed warship lay silently anchored like a lurking beast.

Further away, the crew of the White Bird, with the help of members of the Ink Abyss Pavilion, were moving materials and repairing the hall. Faintly, he could hear conversations and occasional laughter. The relief of surviving a catastrophe, and perhaps a glimmer of hope for the future. The seeds of order have been sewn. Whether it can spread like wildfire depends on what happens next.

Whether the storm of the wings of freedom arrives first, or whether Linn Mo's rules take root in this cruel sea first. He turned and walked toward the shipyard. There, under Shure House's direction, the craftsmen were busily dismantling and modifying the captured wings of freedom ships. Time waits for no one. He had to play each card in his hand in the most appropriate position as quickly as possible.

Chapter 36, general rules take effect. Clashes in the underground market. The temporary general rules for the MOUNC area has generated a far greater response in SH739 and the surrounding waters than expected. Much like a drop of boiling oil being thrown into water, Chindwood was public opinion offensive was remarkably effective. He not only disseminated the full text of the general rules through several semi-public intelligence channels, but also carefully leaked the detailed account of the black sailboat of the Moyuan Pavilion's first victory and the rescue of the White Bird with appropriate artistic embellishment along with real life images of the White Bird's crew receiving treatment on the island and the ship being repaired.

Synthesized using simple sketches and fragments of crystal photo recording stones in no time. Topics such as storm king Lynn Mo wants to establish new rules at sea. Wings of freedom raiding team suffers thunderous blow and moan pavilion provides safe trading zone spread wildly in the regional channels and private exchanges of various small gathering places. The reactions varied. Some small groups and lone merchant ships who had long been oppressed by the wings of freedom or other plundering gangs sought a ray of light in the long night.

Although they dared not openly express their support, in private, some ships began to carefully bypass the traditional dangerous routes and attempt to conduct probing activities within the claimed range of 30 nautical miles around Muan Pavilion Island. Other medium-sized groups, though slightly stronger, but also struggling with chaos, adopted a cautious wait andsee attitude. They admired the strength and sense of order that Lin Mo had demonstrated, but also worried whether this was the prelude to the rise of another wings of freedom, or whether the Mo Yuon pavilion was capable of withstanding Caesar's inevitable and furious counterattack. More often, however, are those who lurk in the shadows, spying and scheming. The remnants of the Wings of Liberty, raiding groups from other regions, and even some independent strong men with complex backgrounds are all watching coldly, assessing the true worth of this newly crowned king of storms and calculating the possibility of profiting from him.

Lyno was fully aware of this. He didn't expect a single set of rules to make everyone bowed down in submission. This was merely a signal, a filter to initially separate those forces that yearned for order and were willing to cooperate from the quagmire of chaos. A few days later, the first batch of visitors came to the door on their own initiative. It wasn't a fleet of ships, but three unassuming small fishing rafts carrying seven or eight thin salow-faced men and women with shrewd eyes.

They claimed to be from a small mutual aid group called the Scavengers Union, which made a living by collecting remnants and supplies from abandoned islands and shallow sea ruins, and was frequently driven away and exploited by various forces. "Master Lynn," said an elderly woman with gray hair and large knuckles, who introduced herself as Grandma Luo, "We have heard of your general rules. We dare not ask for protection, but only for a relatively safe place on the edge of the sea area. You have designated to organize our harvest, repair our tools, and occasionally exchange the scraps we find for some decent food and medicine. We are willing to hand over a portion of our earnings as birthing fees as per the rules.

And we are also willing to share some of the less valuable bits of information we know. Dot. He was very pragmatic and humble. This perfectly suited Lynn Mo's current needs. He needed fresh input, information, and proof that his rules could indeed bring tangible benefits.

All right, Lynn Mo personally received them. Three nautical miles east of Mo Yuan Pavilion. There's a group of reefs that protrude from the water. You can temporarily stop there. For transactions, you can contact Steward Shien Duo Duo.

Remember, follow the rules and don't cause trouble. This is your safe haven. Grandma Luo thanked them profusely and left with her people. Soon, wisps of smoke rose from the rocky area, jokingly called scavengers corner, adding a touch of life. Chando Duo also sifted through their scattered bits of information and gleaned a few useful details.

For example, there was a large piece of metal resembling a shipwreck under a reef in the southeast. Strangely shaped, large, unfamiliar ships have been frequently appearing in the vicinity of the restless sea, and the wings of freedom seemed to be secretly acquiring large quantities of sulfur and some kind of heatresistant clay. Almost simultaneously, Dragon's soul steel guns reply arrived. The reply was lengthy, cautious, yet proactive. Dragon Soul acknowledges Lin Mo's efforts to establish order, considering it a necessary attempt to counter the chaotic laws of wings of freedom.

They are willing to cooperate on intelligence sharing and limited resource exchange, especially food and medicine, and promise to provide a certain degree of strategic deterrence when necessary and feasible. However, they explicitly state that they will not directly intervene in the armed conflict between Moan Pavilion and Wings of Freedom unless the situation escalates to the point of threatening the survival of all Dragon Kingdom survivors in the region. Dragon Soul doesn't have much information about the Stonemason Brotherhood, only that their recent activities have become more secretive, seemingly focusing their efforts on exploring a specific deep sea steel forest ruin, possibly related to deciphering some ancient script or technology. Regarding the Wings of Freedom, Dragon Souls intelligence confirmed part of Lu Po's report. After returning to his lair, Caesar was both frantically punishing his underlings for poor performance and nearly emptying his coffers, using multiple agents to ruthlessly acquire sulfur, salt peter, oil, and large quantities of timber for arow shafts and ship planks throughout the region.

He seemed to be preparing some kind of large-scale highintensity attack with the target most likely being the Moan Pavilion. Sulfur, salt, peter, kerosene. He's planning a fire attack. sure how frowned as he looked at the intelligence report. Or maybe he's making explosives.

Our ships and fortifications are mostly made of wood, which is extremely vulnerable to fire. Caesar learned his lesson last time and knows he wanted to gain anything from a direct confrontation. So he as looking for other methods that Len Mo pondered is acquiring timber intended to replenish the losses from the warships. Or is there another motive? Suchan who had been listening quietly suddenly spoke up. Her voice was still weak, but her thoughts were clear.

Heart of the ocean is very sensitive to large-scale energy accumulation. If Caesar wants to use a large amount of explosives or inciniary agents, the preparation process cannot completely conceal the energy fluctuations. I could try to concentrate my mind and use directional sensing in the direction of the wings of Freedom's layer, which may provide an early warning. That's too risky. Leeway immediately objected.

You haven't recovered yet, and your directional sensing will consume even more energy. Plus, it'll easily attract the attention of any potential sensory beings in the enemy camp. It is worth a try, Sue Chenhan insisted. It has better to be proactive in issuing warnings than to be passively attacked. I only need to know if there's a large-scale accumulation of dangerous energy.

I Dante needs specific details. Looking at Sue Shian's pale face and determined eyes, Lynn Emmo finally nodded. We can try, but we must control the time and intensity. Stop immediately if you feel unwell. Leeway, you cooperate with her and prepare some calming and energy boosting medicine.

Unerstood lelia allesi. Just as everyone was discussing countermeasures, she duo duo hurdly walked in, his face bearing a strange expression that was a mixture of excitement and seriousness. Master, there is a a big deal, but it has a bit of a hot potato. Do he lowered his voice and middleman has connected us with a mysterious seller who has a shipment he wants to sell. The quantity is large, including at least 500 caddies of refined sulfur, 200 caddies of purified salt peter, 30 barrels of high purity kerosene, and 50 pieces of treated hemlock wood, which is the best material for masts.

Everyone felt a chill run down their spines. Sulfur, salt, peter, kerosene, and top quality timber. Wasn't this exactly what Caesar was frantically buying up? Who is the seller? What do you want to exchange? Lenmo asked. The seller is extremely mysterious, communicating only through encrypted messages, and their identity is unknown. They're asking for a high price, not ordinary supplies, and specifically request three things in exchange.

First, the complete version of the bronze fence craftsmanship that we auctioned before. Second, a detailed report on the distribution of energy nodes inside Sleeping Forest Abyss, even if it's just speculation. Third, she and Duodu paused a one-year safe passage guarantee personally signed by Storm King. Lyn and Mo covering the SH 700 to750 area. What huge appetite? Not only do they want the technology and key intelligence, but they also want Lin Mo's reputation as a guarantee.

Is this extortion or a test? Sure, how sneered. Perhaps both. Lynn Emmo tapped his fingers lightly on the table. The only reason someone can produce so many of Caesar s most urgently needed supplies at once is either because of a powerful and wellestablished force or because there are problems within the wings of freedom and someone wants to use us to trip up Caesar while also reaping benefits. Should we accept it or not? Shin Duo asked.

Accepting it might get us involved in an unknown conspiracy and there's also the risk of technology leaks. He glanced at Lynn Emmo. The bronze armor plate technology wasn't core, but it was still an important asset except that Lynmo said almost without hesitation, but the conditions need to be changed. The bronze process can be simplified, removing the core alloy ratios and quenching steps. The report on sleeping linuan can provide a fuzzy analysis of the outer energy field, but no information about the core area.

As for the guarantee of safe passage, a cold glint flashed in his eyes, it only guarantees the safety of the sea areas directly controlled by the Mo Yuan pavilion and the three designated public shipping routes with the additional clause. If the guarantee party actively attacks the Mo Yuan pavilion or its allies, the guarantee will be immediately voided and the party will be considered hostile. In addition, Lynn Mo added, "We will decide the transaction location. The sooner the better. Tell the middleman that we also need to inspect the goods.

Also try to investigate the middlemanes background and the possible origin of these goods. This is a dance on a knife's edge using noncore technology and vague intelligence to acquire strategic resources that could severely damage Caesar while simultaneously testing the waters of hidden adversaries or allies. Risk and opportunity coexist. Chi and Duo Duo accepted the order and quickly went to carry it out. Over the next two days, beneath the surface of calm, turbulent undercurrents surged on Mayuen Pavilion Island.

Several similar small groups gradually arrived at the scavenging corner and the rocky area had essentially formed a miniature neutral market protected by the rules of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. Although the transaction volume was not large, information began to converge. Under careful conditioning, Su Chian conducted two short-term directional sensing tests. The feedback was vague but alarming. In the direction of the wings of Freedom's layer, multiple unstable and malicious energy aggregation points were indeed detected.

Although the intensities varied, they were widely distributed and did not appear to be naturally formed. Lewi's led craftsmen and some sailors working day and night and successfully converted two light sentry boats using captured ships and existing materials. The boats were long and narrow, equipped with small sails and spare ores, and were quite fast. Although they had little offensive capability, they were sufficient for reconnaissance, communication, and harassing small enemy ships. Meanwhile, Chi and Duo Duo, after some tense remote bargaining, and covert investigation, finally reached a preliminary agreement with the mysterious seller.

The transaction location was set near a notorious abandoned island situated between the territories of Mayuin Pavilion in the Wings of Freedom. The time was midnight tomorrow night. As night fell, Lyno stood on the bow of the black sailboat, gazing at the dark sea in the distance. Tomorrow night's trading may be a trap, or it may be a turning point. The energy gathering that Sue Chanchian sensed, Caesar's frantic purchasing, and the sudden appearance of the mysterious seller, these clues, like scattered puzzle pieces, seemed to point to a storm.

And can his ship, his rules, his naent order, stand firm in the coming storm, or even rise with the wind? He gripped the gunnel tightly. The icy touch made his mind exceptionally clear. Whatever comes his way, he has to accept it. From a moment he decided to stand up and try to establish new rules for this sea of blood and fire. There was no turning back.

Only by moving forward and crushing all obstacles can we pave a path for those who come after us. Chapter 37. The mystery of the night flight. The mentor appears. At midnight.

The sea was pitch black with only a few faint starlight piercing through the low-hanging clouds. The black sailed warship Emoi Yuan moved like a silent ghost, turning off all its lights. Relying solely on Sue Chanchian's heart of the ocean for a keen sense of the ocean currents and sure how skillful steering, it glided under the cover of darkness toward the agreed upon no man's land abandoned island. The atmosphere was extremely tense. Apart from the necessary sailors and Lin Mo and Shure How by the helm, only a Woo, Shiao Chan, and five other elite warriors remained on deck, all clad in dark armor, their weapons within easy reach.

Su Xian stayed in the cabin, her face still pale, but she insisted on going along, her senses were the only reliable eyes in this environment. Weary still three nautical miles from the target island. Dot sure how s voice was low almost a whisper there s no energy reaction from large ships around but there s something underwater very faint like it s lurking suchan closed her eyes and concentrated for a moment then nodded gently it's not a large sea beast it looks like a man-made sensor or a small diving device characteristics are unfamiliar Lynmo's eyes narrowed slightly other side had indeed prepared a backup plan the outline sign of the abandoned island gradually emerged from the darkness like the remains of a colossal beast lying prone on the sea. The agreed upon meeting place was a sheltered shallow bay on the north side of the island. From afar, the bay was quiet with only the monotonous sound of waves gently lapping against the rocks.

"Slow down, maintain distance, and send out scout boats to scout ahead," Lin Mo ordered. A light patrol boat was lowered and led by Shiao Shun and two experienced sailors. It glided silently into the shallow bay like a water strider. Moments later, rhythmic faint bird calls echoed in the darkness safety signal. The black sailed ship then slowly approached the edge of a shallow bay and anchored about 100 meters from shore.

At this distance, the ballisti could cover most of the bay entrance and retreat would be relatively easy. almost simultaneously with the anchor being lowered, a lone lantern covered by a thick cloth lit up in the shadow of a reef on the inner side of the bay. Its dim yellowish light illuminated only a few meters around. Beneath the lantern, three figures draped in gray cloaks stood indistinctly, their forms obscured by the large fabric. Beside them lay several square objects covered with oil cloth, presumably the goods for the trade.

The other party was indeed punctual and there weren't many people there. Chin duo duo take some in to inspect the goods. Sure, how keep watch around. A woo, take two men and come down with me. Lynn Emmo quickly gave the orders.

He put on light leather armor, slung the modified crossbow over his back, and hung a short knife at his waist. He was the first to descend a rope net to a small boat. Chin Duo Duo followed closely behind with two knowledgeable craftsmen. The small boat cut through the calm water, heading towards the lone light. As they drew closer, Linmo could see the three greyrobeed figures.

They all wore masks that covered half of their faces, revealing only their emotionless eyes. The one in the middle was of medium build, his hands tucked into his sleeves, his demeanor as calm as a stone. Pavilion Master Lynn, it's a pleasure to meet you. The man in the middle spoke, his voice deliberately processed, carrying a metallic quality indistinguishable from a males or females. The goods are here.

What are our terms? Lynn Emmo stepped onto the damp rocks, his gaze sweeping over the oil cloth packages. Once the goods have been inspected, the payment will be made. He gestured to Chandu Duo. Chiand Doduo and the craftsman stepped forward and carefully lifted part of the oil cloth to check the color of the sulfur, the purity of the salt peter, and the viscosity of the kerosene. They also tapped the wood to test its hardness and grain.

After a moment, Chin Duodo gave Linmo a barely perceptible nod. The goods were genuine, of excellent quality, and the quantity was basically correct. The technical data and intelligence reports are here. Linmo took out two sealed bamboo tubes from his pocket and placed them on a flat rock. A simplified version of the bronze armor process, removing the three core steps, but the basic framework and principles are complete.

Records and preliminary inferences about the energy field fluctuations around Sleeping Forest Abyss. The core area is not involved. The greyroged leader glanced at the bamboo tube, but didn't immediately take it. Instead, he slowly said, "Then what about the guarantee?" Lynn Mo took out the third item, a speciallymade token made of a thin metal sheet etched with the characters Mo Yuan and simple wave patterns. On the back was Lin Mo's personal mark, which was difficult to imitate, left with a special engraving knife and a line of small characters.

The holder of this token shall enjoy temporary safe passage within the three shipping routes under the jurisdiction of MOU on attached and the controlled area for a period of one year. Note if the holder attacks me or my alliance, this token shall be invalidated and the holder shall be regarded as an enemy. You place the token on the rock as well. The token is here and the additional terms are written. Now it's your turn.

The gray-roed leader remained silent for a few seconds, seemingly assessing the situation. Finally, he slightly raised his hand, signaling his companions to push the goods towards Linmo. At the same time, he stepped forward and reached for the three items. The deal appears to be nearing completion. Just as the gray robe leader's finger was about to touch the bamboo tube, a sudden change occurred.

Whoosh! Boom! A burning rocket shot out from nowhere, streaking across the dark night sky and striking precisely a pile of abandoned ship planks not far to the side of the group. Flames instantly rose up, illuminating half of the shallow bay. Almost simultaneously, several splashes of water erupted from beneath the surface at the entrance to the shallow bay. Four small shuttle-shaped and entirely black submarines, each operated by single pilot, broke through the water. Their bows gleamed with a cold light.

There were specially designed rams and underwater crossbow firing ports. Further away, in the shadows high on the abandoned island, several points of fire flashed, and the sound of bow strings vibrating and short spears piercing the air tore through the silence of a night. An ambush and not just on one side. Enemy attack. Protect the pavilion.

Master Sherhow's furious roar came from the black sail ship. The ballisti on the Mo Yuan roared, firing at the several black submarines that had suddenly appeared and the fires high above on the shallow bay reef. Lin Mo reacted extremely quickly, crouching low the moment the rocket exploded and shouted sharply, "Retreat back to the ship." Chi and Duo Duo and the craftsmen scrambled to push the heavy packages. A Woo and two warriors quickly raised their shields, standing in front of Linmo and deflecting several arrows that flew through the air. The three gray robe men seemed takenback, but they didn't panic.

The leader quickly grabbed the bamboo tube and token left by Linmo and put them in his pocket, while the other two swiftly dragged two rectangular metal boxes from beside the pile of goods and open them with lightning speed. Inside were two exquisitly crafted folding crossbows that gleamed with a ghostly blue light. "They're not ours," the gray robroed leader growled at Linmo, his voice no longer feigned, but a slightly horse male voice. Its water ghost and night owl from the wings of freedom. Caesar's assassination squad.

As he spoke, he raised his crossbow and fired a barrage of shots at the nearest black submarine charging towards them. The submarine's speed was momentarily halted, and it began to leak water. Wings of Liberty, how did Caesar know about this deal? And why did he send an elite assassination squad? Lynamo had no time to think. While using his modified crossbow to retaliate against the short spears thrown from above, he directed everyone to retreat to the small boat.

The enemy's attack was highly targeted. With a muffled thud, a black submarine crashed into the small boat Lin Mo and his group were traveling in, instantly shattering it. Everyone fell into the water. The seawater was icy cold.

Lynn Emmo struggled to the surface, shaking the water off his face and saw a Woo locked in combat with a water ghost completely encased in a black rubber suit who had emerged from the submarine. This way, the gray robe leader suddenly shouted to Lynn Mo, pointing to a darker pile of rocks deep within the abandoned island.

There's cover there. Let's retreat there first. Lynn Emmo glanced at the direction of the black sailboats where fierce fighting was taking place. Go. Lynn and Mo made a decisive order to a Woo and the others while swimming vigorously toward the pile of rocks pointed out by the greyroged man. Now he should be called the scarf-faced man ripped off his tattered cloak, revealing a similarly gray but strangely textured form-fitting suit that seemed to absorb light to some extent. The mentor of the Stonemason's Brotherhood.

The scarred man and his companion showed no intention of boarding the ship.

Limo boarded the sentry ship and looked back, seeing only scattered fire light and the gradually subsiding sounds of battle on the abandoned island. The wings of Freedom's assassination squad seemed to have received the retreat signal and was quickly disengaging.

A meticulously planned deal and ambush ended in a three-way battle with each party eventually disengaging. The Mo Yuan ship picked up everyone and began its return journey. Inside the cabin, Lynn Mo changed out of his soaked clothes, looked at the sulfur oil piled in the corner, and touched the small roll of encrypted paper that the scarred man had given him as an extra gift. The parchment contained only one line of text and one illustration. To learn about the cube, meet at the lonely tower in three days at coordinates xx y menter.

The mentor of the stonemason's brotherhood has finally shown himself. Meanwhile, Caesar's assassination squad also revealed their fangs. This sea is indeed never at peace. Chapter 38. The secret meeting in the lonely tower.

The scale of truth. 3 days passed. Intense preparation. The aftershocks of a raid on the abandoned island had not yet subsided. The appearance of the wings of freedom assassination squad and the invitation from the stonemasons brotherhood's mentor were like two pebbles thrown into a deep pool creating ripples within the mo yuan pavilion.

The seas sulfur salt peter kerosene and hemlock would secretly stored in a reinforced underground warehouse guarded by trusted confidants personally assigned by Sherhow. These supplies were both powerful tools against Caesar and potential sources of further envy and trouble. Lynn Mo did not reveal the details of the mentor invitation to most people, only informing the core members that there would be a crucial contact with a mysterious force. He entrusted the island's defense and internal affairs entirely to Shureh How, while instructing Shin Duo Duo to strengthen internal and external information monitoring, especially to pay attention to whether the Wings of Freedom would make any new moves due to the assassination team's failure. Such Chian's physical health had improved considerably under careful recuperation, but she remained mentally exhausted.

Upon learning that Linmo was going to keep his appointment with his mentor, she remained silent for a long time before finally saying, "Take this with you." She handed Lynn Mo a small amulet made from a mixture of special seaweed and the residue of that golden liquid, emitting a faint, calming, and refreshing aura. Perhaps it can help you stay clearheaded and resist some mental interference. Her heart of the ocean was acutely sensitive to energy and she vaguely sensed that this mentor was definitely not simple. Leewi eyes buried himself in the mountain of documents and the piece of ke trying to decipher more clues about the cube and the so-called ancient civilization from the storm sailboat blueprints and the scattered data brought back by sleeping forest abyss hoping to provide some reference for the meeting with Lin Mo. On the third day at dusk, Lynn Mo piloted a light and fast modified sentry boat alone, quietly leaving Muan Pavilion Island.

He didn't take anyone with him as his mentor had explicitly requested in the secret letter. The sails were raised and the boat headed towards the coordinates marked in the letter Lonely Tower located on the northwestern edge of the SH 739 area near the border with other areas. The coordinates are located on a tiny, almost entirely steep isolated island. In the center of the island, as expected, stands a dilapidated stone tower constructed of some unknown grayish white stone. The tower's surface is covered with modeled erosion marks and tenaciously clinging dark vines, a testament to the ravages of time and sea erosion.

The spire has collapsed. The tower stands approximately 20 m tall, appearing strikingly out of place and mysterious on the desolate island. Without a dock, Linmo tied his patrol boat to a protruding reef and climbed the slippery rock face to reach the small island. The sea breeze here became howling and fierce, whipping fine salt grains against his face. He gripped the short knife at his waist, cautiously surveyed his surroundings, and then walked towards the only entrance at the base of the stone tower a low deep archway.

Inside the archway, it was pitch black with only a few dim rays of light filtering through the broken tower top and cracks and walls. The air was cold and damp, carrying a heavy smell of mildew and the sea. The stone steps spiraled upwards, covered with moss and gravel. Lyno didn't hesitate and stepped inside. His footsteps echoed far and wide within the empty tower.

He slowly ascended the stone steps, his mind highly focused, his senses amplified to the extreme. The talisman Sue Chian had given him was pressed against his chest, radiating a steady coolness. The tower seemed empty with only the marks of time. It wasn't until he reached the third floor, the best preserved floor in the tower, that he saw a figure. There were no windows on this floor, but in the center stood a simple stone table and two stone stools.

On the stone table sat an old-fashioned copper oil lamp, its small flame burning steadily, illuminating a figure sitting at the table. The man was also wearing a gray inconspicuous cloak, but the hood wasn't fully pulled up, revealing most of his face. It was the scarred man with whom he had briefly cooperated on the abandoned island. He sat there quietly, his hands folded on the stone table, calmly watching Lynn Emmo, walk up the last step. Master Lynn, please have a seat.

The scarred man, or rather, Mter said in a calm voice with a peculiar magnetic quality that could involuntarily quiet people down. He gestured to the stone bench opposite him. Linmo didn't sit down immediately, his gaze sweeping over every corner of the floor. The space wasn't large, and everything was laid out before him. Apart from the stone table, stone benches, and the oil lamp, there was nothing else.

He also couldn't sense anyone else's presence. Don't worry, it's just you and me. The mentor seemed to see through his thoughts. There are too many people on the abandoned island, and some things are inconvenient to say. It's quiet and safe here.

At least it's safe for now. Lyn Mo then walked to the stone bench and sat down, facing his mentor across the table. The light from the oil lamp danced on their faces, casting flickering shadows. How should I address you? Mentor or something else? Lyn Mo asked. The name doesn't matter.

It's just a code name. You can call me Mentor or Greystone. The mentor's tone remained calm. I invited you here today for two reasons. First, to apologize for the abandoned island incident.

Using your deal as bait was indeed illconsidered. Second, there are some things that it's time for you to know. About that cube, about sleeping forest abyss, or about this world? Lynn Emmo cut straight to the point. A hint of appreciation flashed in the mentor's eyes. You're very perceptive.

Indeed, it's all related to these things. He sat up slightly. First, to answer your first question, that gray white cube embedded in the ancient wood, we call it a civilization node or the observer's eye. The observer's eye. Then, Montac found it.

This world is not naturally formed, nor is it a playground for gods and demons, the mentor said slowly, each word carrying immense weight. This is a testing ground for a civilization selection project. The human civilization of the old earth was on the verge of collapse due to its own various problems. One or more higher beings that we cannot understand. Perhaps even more advanced civilizations or perhaps managers of some kind of cosmic law initiated this selection.

Billions of human consciousnesses were projected into this simulated ocean world given different initial conditions and talents to observe how we survive, develop, compete, and cooperate in extreme environments and whether we can ultimately evolve a new order and new characteristics sufficient to continue the flame of civilization. Even though Linmo was mentally prepared, he was still shocked when he heard these words: civilization selection, higher beings, testing ground. All of this sounded so incredible yet vaguely matched the various irrationalities of this world. Where's the evidence? Lynn Mo forced himself to calm down. The evidence lies within the observer Zup discovered deep within the sleeping abyss at the core of the restless sea and among all the marked ruins.

The mentor pointed upwards as if to the endless void beyond the tower. These nodes are part of the system that maintains the operation of this world and also probes for recording and observation. They collect data from specific areas, monitor energy flow, and even under certain conditions, fine-tune the experimental process. Fining like a marine mammal tide, a weather disaster, Lynn Mo immediately made the connection. Partly yes, but more often it asks about potential macro level impacts.

For example, the distribution of resources in certain areas, the unlocking threshold of a certain technology, or even the luck of individual samples, the menter tone carried a hint of barely perceptible sarcasm. Of course, the system has its rules and limitations which cannot be arbitrarily eliminated or excessively interfered with, otherwise the experiment would lose its meaning. It s more like a complex ecological simulator with many variables and triggering conditions added. As Lynn Mo processed this information, many questions in his mind began to unravel and connect. Why were there sign-in system, talents, and various illogical supply boxes and blueprints? Why were there patterns in the sea monster invasions and natural disasters? Why were there clearly unnatural landmarks like the eye of the storm and the path of eternal frost? The stonemason's brotherhood.

Do you know all this? What is your goal? Then mont. We are a group of people who glimpsed the truth earlier or rather who were unwilling to be merely observed samples the mentors eyes deepened. Our goal is not to resist that seems meaningless at the moment. Our goal is to understand to utilize and to win over understand the rules and vulnerabilities of this system. Utilize the knowledge and technology left in the relics and nodes to accelerate our own development.

strive to obtain a higher evaluation at the end of the final selection to win the qualification to go to the new world or to obtain administrator privileges to stay in this testing ground. Administrator privileges. Lynmo recalled the title he received when his island was upgraded and a vague feeling he had. You approached me for the purpose of cooperation. Lynmo looked directly into his mentor's eyes.

You have potential, Linmo, the mentor frankly admitted. Double SSS level talents and 100fold amplification system are an extremely rare combination of advantages in the early stages of this testing ground. You are cautious, strategic, and know how to hide and develop. What's even more remarkable is that you have begun to try to establish order, which in the eyes of advanced observers may be more valuable than mere military conquest. Moreover, you have come into contact with and influenced the observer's eye, which in itself means that you have entered some kind of watch list of the system.

By cooperating, we can share intelligence about the system and the ruins, support each other when exploring dangerous areas, and exchange the technologies and resources we need. We don't need to merge. We can remain independent, but we must coordinate on key objectives, the mentor stated. For example, exploring the eye of a storm in the turbulent sea where there may be more advanced nodes or databases or dealing with Caesar and the other sample forces that may exist behind him. Is there something else behind Caesar? Lynn Emmo caught the key information.

The rise of Wings of Freedom has been too fast and too smooth. Caesar's S-rank talent, Wrath of Thunder, is certainly powerful, but that alone is not enough for him to integrate so many resources and manpower in such a short time, or even build a decent fleet, the mentor said in a deep voice. We suspect that he may have also come into contact with some ruins or nodes, gained some kind of support, or made contact with a force that has also glimpsed part of the truth, but has chosen a different path. His frantic purchasing and preparations are not just aimed at you. Lynn Mo remained silent.

The amount of information was overwhelming. He needed time to process it. Cooperating with the Stonemason's brotherhood carried both benefits and risks. They clearly knew more, but were also more mysterious and harder to control. I need time to think about it.

Limo finally said, "Of course that the mentor wasn't he surprised. Cooperation is based on voluntariness and trust. You can think about it slowly. As a token of sincerity and compensation for the abandoned island, he took out a thin gray booklet that was neither paper nor leather from his pocket and pushed it in front of Linmo. This is an introductory manual on basic identification and application of primary energy ruins as well as a map marking the locations of three relatively safe secondary ruins in SH 739 and the adjacent area which may contain clues to star steel substitute minerals or deep sea ironwood.

You can verify its authenticity. Lynn Mo looked at the booklet in a neatly folded map but didn't immediately reach for it. What's the price? There has no extra cost. Consider it an investment. The mentor stood up, the oil lamp casting a long shadow on the model tower wall.

A storm is coming. Lyno Caesar s revenge is just a prelude. The real test may come from the depths of the ocean or it may come from the system itself. Whether you become a struggling pawn on the chessboard or try to understand the game and even influence the rules, the choice is yours. Do he walked toward the broken staircase leading to the top of the tower, his voice disappearing into the darkness with his figure.

The meeting of the lonely tower ends here. If you've thought it through, you can contact me through the old method. Take care, Storm King. The footsteps faded into the distance and eventually disappeared. Silence returned to the tower with only the flickering flame of the oil lamp burning quietly, and Lin Mo's own clearly audible heartbeat remaining.

He sat for a long time before slowly picking up the gray booklet and map. The booklet was cold to the touch, and the text and illustrations on it were ancient and strange. The map clearly marked three coordinates far from the main shipping lanes with brief explanations and risk warnings next to them. The tip of the iceberg of the truth has finally been revealed. It is cruel and grand, yet it also brings an unprecedented sense of clarity.

He packed his things, blew out the oil lamp, got up, and walked into the darkness, descending the stone tower along the way he had come. Outside the tower, night had fallen, and the sea wind howled. The distant sea was pitch black, as if concealing endless secrets and dangers. But Lynn Mos heart was brighter than when he arrived. Knowing the rules of the game, even just a part of them, is always better than groping blindly in the dark.

He leaped onto the sentry boat and untied the mooring ropes. The sails rose, the bow cleaved through the waves, and the boat resolutely sailed toward the direction of Mayuan Pavilion and toward that increasingly clear course of destiny. The road ahead may be more difficult, but the direction is already different. Chapter 39, the traces of Star Steel. The early days of the Alliance.

Upon returning from the isolated tower, Linmo did not immediately reveal the shocking truth of the civilization selection project. The information at that level was too impactful and prematurely disclosing it would only cause unnecessary panic and chaos. He only briefly mentioned to the core members his contact with a mentor, confirming that the Stonemason's Brotherhood was currently in a cooperative rather than hostile relationship and produced the rune manual in the ruins map. Leewi practically pounced on the grave booklet, his eyes wide behind his glasses, his fingers trembling as he traced the strange yet regular lines and symbols. This isn't just decoration.

These structures contain incredibly precise logic for guiding and converting energy. Although it's only the most basic of the basics, the principles are universal. If you can understand and apply it, even the simplest sturdiness, corrosion resistance, and energy slowing runes will have a qualitative impact on the construction and defense of the storm ship. Such Chian also leaned closer to sense it carefully, her brows furrowing slightly. The energy fluctuations of these runes are very peculiar, unlike the electromagnetic or chemical reactions commonly seen in our world.

They're closer to the underlying power of the cube in the sleeping forest abyss. They are very stable but also very cold. Can I learn it? Can I use it? Sure. How was more concerned about practical applications? We need time to study it. And even more so, we need practical materials to inscribe and test it that Leeway forced himself to calm down.

The booklet mentions that inscribing runes requires special energy conducting media such as certain high purity mineral powders, specific biological bone powders, or fragments of energy crystals. The little bit of energy storage crystal micro we have might come in handy, but it is far from enough. Dot. There are three locations on the ruins map. One of which is marked may contain star steel associated ore or or similar high conductivity minerals.

Lynn Mo pointed to a coordinate on the map located on the edge of the SH738 area, a complex body of water known as Echo Canyon. This is what we urgently need right now. With enough energy conducting materials, not only can Rune research advance, but it may also have a miraculous effect on strengthening the refined iron that replaces star steel. I know Echo Canyon Chin Duo interjected. He had been gathering intelligence lately.

It has said that the underwater terrain is extremely complex with strong currents and strange noises, hence the name. Several expeditions went in before and never came out again. Rumor has it that there are highly aggressive bioluminescent jellyfish swarms and some kind of strange fish that can mimic sounds to lure prey. It has quite risky to we have to go no matter the risks that Lynn Mo made up his mind. The construction of a storm ship cannot stop.

We need more advanced materials to meet the challenges of Caesar and the future. Sure, how you are in charge of selecting a capable expedition team. The personnel must be excellent and the equipment must be sufficient. Leeway, you will accompany the team and be responsible for mineral identification and collection. Such an he looked at the girl whose complexion was still not good.

You stay on the island to continue to recuperate and at the same time try to study the basic parts of the rune book about early warning and protection to see if they can be applied to the island's defense. No, I'm going to sue Chan shook her head. Her tone firm. The heart of the ocean is most sensitive to underwater environments and energy anomalies and can give early warnings of undercurrents and dangerous creatures. In a place like Echo Canyon, eyes and ears alone are not enough.

My body is fine. At least I can identify danger to Lin and Mo looked at her stubborn eyes and knew he couldn't persuade her. Su Chanjian was gentle on the outside but strong on the inside. Once she made up her mind, it was hard to change it. Okay, but you must stay in the middle of the team, mainly responsible for sensing and not participate in combat unless necessary.

Sure, how arrange for someone to protect her. Understood. Sure, how nodded. Chin duo duo Lin Mo continued Yuri in charge of two things.
