That's a brilliant move. Dragon Soul is powerful and upright. If we can reach an agreement on fighting against wings of freedom, the pressure on us will be much less. Even if we can't openly join forces, some covert cooperation is still good. I'll go prepare the proposal now.

After the meeting ended, everyone immediately went their separate ways. Sherhow carefully selected 15 people from among the combat personnel and peripheral members with exploration experience. Together with himself, Lin Mo, Leewi, Su Chian, and Xiao Tai and Lu Fong who had become increasingly calm and reliable after recovering from their injuries. They formed a 20 person expedition team. In terms of equipment, in addition to conventional weapons, they also brought improved underwater breathing tubes made from hollow plant stems and waterproof membranes.

Speciallymade stabroof gel suits woven from a mixture of treated sea animal skin and vine fibers, high-intensity crystal amps activated by energy storing crystal fragments, a large number of ropes and grappling hooks, and several simple mineral resonators that Leeway had hastily made overnight small devices that could produce a weak reaction to specific highc conductivity minerals based on a principle mentioned in the rune manual. Two sentry boats, which had undergone preliminary modifications and were equipped with small sails and extra or positions, carried the expedition team and quietly left the island the following morning, heading northwest towards Echo Canyon. After sailing for most of the day, the seascape ahead began to change. The once open waters were now dotted with numerous reefs and small islands, and the seaater had deepened in color, turning a dark green. A faint, salty, and subtly sulfurous dampness filled the air.

Most peculiarly, as we ventured deeper, various faint sounds began to echo in our ears. Sometimes like the distant sound of a conch shell horn, sometimes like the deep song of whales, and sometimes like a sharp metallic grating noise. These sounds mingled together coming from all directions making it difficult to pinpoint their source and unsettling the mind. This is at the outer edge of Echo Canyon Da sure how check the map and sea conditions then order the boats to slow down. Everyone be on high alert.

The sound can interfere with judgment. Watch out for underwater currents and reefs. Su Chian sat in the center of one of the boats, eyes closed and focused. Her heart of the ocean was fully deployed, acting like an invisible sonar scanning the surrounding seawater. The underwater terrain is indeed complex with many canyons and fissures, and the currents are unpredictable.

There are many signs of life, mostly small fish and crustaceans, but some individuals with stronger energy responses are swimming in the depths, their forms unclear. Also, she suddenly opened her eyes, pointing to a seemingly calm, dark area of water to her left. They the underwater rock walls emit strong intermittent energy radiation matching the characteristics of the inert energy conducting vein described in the manual. It might be the associated mineral we're looking for. Leeway immediately picked up the resonator and aimed it in that direction.

Sure enough, the crystal pointer on the instrument began to vibrate slightly, emitting an almost inaudible buzzing sound. "Go take a look. Be careful," Lin Mo ordered. The boat approached cautiously. It was a steep underwater cliff, dark in color, covered with a thick layer of dark green seaweed and barnacles.

Near the surface, tiny shimmering dark blue crystallin substances could be vaguely seen embedded in the rock face. It's blue veneer crystal, a good primary energy conducting medium. Leat, the purity looks good. And where blue veneer crystal appears, it's very likely that magnetite or cobaltite is also present, which are important additives to replace star pattern steel. However, just as they were about to lower the ropes and tools to begin collecting, Su Chanchians expression changed.

Watch out, something is coming up from the deep valley. It's moving very fast. The energy reaction is very strong. There's more than one. As soon as the words were spoken, the dark waters suddenly churned.

Several tentacle-like creatures as thick as an arm, translucent and shimmering with an eerie phosphoresence, burst out of the water and swirled toward the nearest boat. Their heads were hidden at the base of their tentacles, obscuring their full appearance. But their open suckers were filled with fine, gleaming bone spurs. It's a phosphorescent ghost beard. It's very aggressive and its tentacles have paralyzing toxins.

Sukianken exclams. Sure house shouted sharply. The soldiers on the ship immediately raised their shields and weapons. Ziaoai, quick as lightning, cleaved a tentacle that was coiled towards the ship's side with a single stroke. Fluorescent slime spurted from the severed end, emitting a sweet fishy odor.

Lu Fong and the others also used their spears and machetes to defend themselves. Lynn Mo raised his modified crossbow and aimed at the underwater shadows from which the tentacles emerged. He didn't fire immediately but waited. His keen senses honed by his rudimentary archery skills allowed him to perceive that while the tentacles moved swiftly, they seemed somewhat uncoordinated as if interfered with by some unseen force. Is it an echo? Or he suddenly remembered that the rune manual mentioned that certain basic rune combinations could interfere with creatures that rely on specific frequencies to perceive or act.

Liebe, is there any simple rune about sound or a frequency interference in the manual? Linmo shouted. Lie Jang was nervously dodging an attack from a tentacle when he heard this. He was stunned for a moment, then quickly searched his mind. Yes, there is a very simple basic configuration of silent ripple which can theoretically emit a fixed low frequency fluctuation that makes most organisms feel uncomfortable but requires an energy conducting medium to activate and the range is very small. Use blue crystal.

Try it now. Lenmo shouted as he used a crossbow bolt to force back a tentacle. Leewei frantically pulled a small sample of blue veined crystal he had collected earlier from another transaction from his bag and then took out a speciallymade engraving knife, the tip of which was mixed with a trace amount of energy conducting metal. He forced himself to calm down, recalled the patterns in the booklet, and with trembling hands quickly engraved an extremely simple rune consisting of three arcs and two dots on the surface of the blue vein crystal. When the last stroke was completed, Leeway, following the instructions in the manual, concentrated his meager mental energy, or rather attention into it, buzz.

The dark blue glow on the surface of the blue variegated crystal suddenly brightened slightly, and an almost invisible ripple of distorted air spread rapidly from its center. The effects are immediate. The frenzied phosphorescent tentacles that have been attacking so aggressively suddenly froze as if struck by an invisible whip, convulsing violently and quickly retreating underwater. Even the annoying jumbled echoes around them seemed to diminish for a moment. It worked.

Everyone was both surprised and delighted. Now's the time. Quickly gather the resources, then leave this area immediately. Lynn and Mo made a decisive decision. The duration of the rune effect was unknown.

There was no time to waste. Under Sher How's command, several agile team members wearing stabroof rubber suits quickly slid down the ropes and use special tools to chisel at the rock face, rapidly collecting the shimmering blue crystals and some dark metallic looking ores from the vicinity and stuffing them into waterproof bags. The whole process was tense but orderly and in less than 10 minutes, several large bags were filled. withdraw. Knowing when to stop, Lin Mo immediately gave the order.

The two boats quickly turned around, rowing and sailing, speeding back the way they had come. Only after leaving the Echo Canyon did the annoying noise and potential dangers gradually fade away. The hall yielded over 20 kg of blue veneer crystal and several kg of ore suspected to be magnetite and cobaltite. More importantly, it verified the practicality of rune knowledge. On the return journey, Sue Chanchian sensed the ores and whispered to Lanimo, "These ores do indeed contain metallic components similar to the description of star pattern steel, although very weak.

But after refining and rune enhancement, they might actually meet the requirements for substitution. That mentor didn't lie to us." Lynn Emmo nodded and looked in the direction of the Ink Abyss Pavilion. This expedition was very fruitful. Not only did they obtain muchneeded materials, but they also made preliminary verification of the power of runes. More importantly, the team's coordination and adaptability in actual combat were honed.

When they returned to the island, Chin Duo Duo also brought good news. Dragon Soul has agreed in principle to establish a limited strategic cooperative relationship. Chin Woodway Sace was filled with barely suppressed smuggness. They acknowledge our stance against the wings of freedom, are willing to share intelligence deeply regarding Caesar-es movements and suspected supporters, and have promised to conduct diversionary operations on the flanks or logistical lines of the wings of freedom when they launch a large-scale attack against the Mo Yuan pavilion. In exchange, we need to regularly provide non-core intelligence on sea beast tides, abnormal celestial phenomena, and the ancient ruins that we have obtained.

In addition, they are very interested in the basic rune technology that we may have mastered and hope to conduct academic exchanges in the future. also inform everyone that starting tomorrow we should concentrate our efforts and use the newly acquired ores and rune knowledge to accelerate the final construction and enhancement of the stormship. Although their techniques were clumsy and the failure rate was high as the shimmering runes gradually took shape on the keel ribs and hull.

Everyone could sense that the ship was undergoing some indescribable fundamental transformation. Linmo stood on a nearly completed ship's deck, stroking a piece of newly refined metal ingot with dark blue speckles in his hand. This was a star- patterned steel substitute alloy, initially refined from cobaltite and magnetite. With materials in hand, a direction was found. With runes in hand, a beginning was set.

And with allies in hand, a prototype was formed. Next, it's a matter of waiting for Caesar to make his move or taking the initiative to confront the eye of the storm in the turbulent sea. King of Storms. Leewi's eyes were bloodshot, but his gaze was frighteningly bright. After nearly 2 months of preparation, trading, exploration, research, and roundthe-clock construction, the ship carrying the future hopes of the Mo Yuan pavilion was finally completed. It is 35 m long with a towering main mast.

Its streamlined hull is primarily constructed of hemlock wood with key areas inlaid with alloy plates dotted with dark blue starlight. Under certain lighting, the fine runes engraved on the hull using blue crystal powder shimmer with a faint, almost imperceptible halo. Line stepped forward and reached out to touch the cool solid hole. The surface felt heavy, carrying the unique scent of wood and metal along with a faint tingling sensation from lingering runic energy. This was no ordinary ship.

It was the culmination of all the technology, resources, and wisdom currently available to the Mo Yuan Pavilion and a crucial asset for him to face future challenges and uncover the truth of the world. Amid the construction boom, Linmo did not relax his surveillance of the outside world.

He authorized Shien Duo Duo in his capacity as the business manager under the king of storms to release three concise announcements on regional and national channels. I moan pavilion is willing to engage in fair trade with all survivors who uphold goodwill and abide by basic rules and a supply of various materials especially food building materials and basic tools is stable. Second, Mo Yuan Pavilion possesses a certain level of armed force which aims to protect itself and safeguard the safety of its allies. It has no intention of provoking disputes, but will retaliate swiftly against any unwarranted infringement. Third, we thank the Dragon Soul organization for their congratulations.

Mo Yuan Pavilion cherishes its friendly relationship with all those who uphold order. The announcement was worded neither serville nor overbearing, demonstrating both strength and an open attitude, while clearly defining red lines and emphasizing the friendly relationship with Dragon Soul, implicitly conveying a deterrent. Immediately, the sentiment within the channel shifted again with many smaller factions and lone powerhouses beginning to express goodwill while the provocative remarks of wings of freedom were significantly suppressed. But the undercurrents will clearly not stop because of this. For hours later, the team responsible for monitoring and deciphering communications brought an urgent message.

We have intercepted a suspected encrypted communication segment between senior members of Freedom Wings. The decryption is incomplete, but the keywords include goods received, testing ground, area 3, and before the tide. The member's expression was grave. Area three, according to the nautical charts we know, likely refers to a broken reef area between us and the turbulent sea, where the terrain is complex and there are often unusual eddies. Before the tide, Such Chanhan looked at the sky outside the window.

There'll be a big tide tomorrow evening. They may have received some kind of goods in that area and plan to conduct a test in area 3 before tomorrow's high tide. Sure, how analyzed. What kind of test? a new type of weapon or something aimed at us or at the restless sea. Lin Mo walked to the newly posted more detailed nautical chart, his gaze falling on the broken reef area, area three and the edge of the restless sea behind it, marked in dark red and constantly flashing with tiny lightning symbols.

Our expedition was originally planned to proceed to the edge of the turbulent sea for reconnaissance in 3 days, he mused. But what if Caesar s men are already operating in the island and reef area ahead tomorrow carrying unidentified goods? We can't he let them cause trouble right under our noses especially on the only route to the turbulent sea. Su Shian added that would put us in a very passive position. Dot. Moreover, this could be an opportunity.

Do lewi pushed up his glasses. A glint of light flashing behind the lenses. If what they're testing is related to runes, energy, or that unknown civilization, we might be able to observe it up close or even intercept samples. Lynn Emmo turn around, his gaze sweeping over everyone. Plan changed.

Rune Tower construction will proceed as scheduled. Sure. How? Immediately select the most elite combat personnel to replenish the Mo Yuon supplies and weapons, especially underwater combat equipment and protection. Leeway, take all your detection equipment and rune resonators. Shendo Duo, stay on the island.

Coordinate the defense and maintain uninterrupted communication with the dragon soul. If the situation changes, execute the third contingency plan. And me? Suchin asked, you will depart with the Mo on. Your heart of the ocean is irreplaceable in terms of underwater environment and energy perception. Lyno looked at her.

But remember, your primary task is perception and early warning, not combat. If the situation gets out of control, the Moan will evacuate immediately. Understood. When will the operation take place? Sure, how asked. Tonight at midnight under the cover of darkness, the Mo Yuan will set sail ahead of schedule.

Target: Secretly approach the broken reef area, area 3, and conduct covert observation. If any Freedom Wings vessels or suspicious activity are detected, Lyn Mo's eyes turn slightly cold. Decide whether to monitor, interfere, or seize the area depending on the situation. The priority is to understand the enemy's intentions and obtain intelligence, avoiding large-scale direct conflict as much as possible. But if conflict is unavoidable, he paused, then said with unwavering resolve, then let's make sure we win.

Let Caesar know that the area around the Storm King's territory is not his testing ground. Yes. With the order given, the entire Mo Yuan Pavilion spraying in action once more. As night deepened, the Rune Tower in the center of the island, illuminated by torches and crystal lamps, began to take shape with faint energy flows swirling around its tip. Meanwhile, in the eastern dock, the Mo Yuon, like a behemoth in the night, was silently completing its final preparations for departure.

Its dark hull almost blended into the darkness with only the fine runes on its surface, occasionally flashing with a barely perceptible blue light. Lyn Mo stood on the deck and did a final check on his equipment. He had a modified crossbow, an alloy dagger, close-fitting armor, and a small leather pouch at his waist containing several blue patterned crystal chips engraved with different simple runes. These were experimental pieces that Leewi had rushed to make. Their effectiveness was unknown, but they might come in handy.

On the lower deck, the elite team members silently and swiftly took their positions. Sherhow was giving a final tactical briefing in a low voice. Su Chian stood near the bow with her eyes closed, her long hair blowing in the sea breeze, her senses spreading out like mercury. Midnight is approaching. Lynn Emmo gazed at the dark sea horizon, which led to the unknown reef area and the turbulent sea that made all sailors tremble with fear.

"Caesar, what are you trying to test and what have you obtained?" He gripped the coal gunnel tightly. "You'll find out soon." "Weigh anchor," he ordered in a low voice. raised the sails and set sail. Like an arrow released from a bow, the Mo Yuan cut through the calm night and headed towards the turbulent dark sea. The real storm perhaps had already quietly begun before it even reached the restless sea.

Chapter 42, Shadows of the Reef area. The Mo Yuan was like a pitch black knife, silently slicing through the thick darkness of the night to conceal their presence. The main sail was raised only onethird of its height, relying primarily on the well-trained sailors for power. Using long ores, the newly engraved sturdy runes on the hull lay dormant in the darkness. Their faint energy field only detectable upon close inspection like the breath of a sleeping behemoth.

Such Chan stood at the observation post on the left bow, her eyes slightly closed, her hands lightly touching the gunnel, her senses extended along the hull into the sea. Like countless invisible tentacles, scanning the changing hydraology and signs of life below. The water is getting shallower and a lot of jagged rocks are starting to appear on the seabed, she reported softly, her voice transmitted to the bridge through a makeshift megaphone. The currents are very turbulent. At least four different undercurrens are converging below.

There are very few small fish, but some crustations with neutral energy responses are attached to the rocks. About 800 m to the right, there is a large coral reef with a faint reflection on the surface above it, possibly a foamy area under the moonlight. Shh consulted the nautical chart and whispered, "We've entered the outer perimeter of the broken reef area. Everyone remain silent and keep lights out. Lookouts use luminous lenses and watch for any unusual activity on the water and in the sky.

Lynn Emmo stood in the shadows of the bridge, his sharp gaze sweeping across the dark reefs ahead, which resembled a crouching behemoth. The sea breeze carried a salty fishy smell mixed with a faint, sweet fishy odor unlike that of ordinary seaweed. Leewi squatted beside him, holding a modified mineral resonator in his hands. But at this moment, the instrument's pointer was only trembling slightly, its direction unclear. The energy background is very complex, Leeway whispered.

The reef itself, certain special minerals, and even some deep sea plants could cause interference. But if wings of freedom is really testing some high energy items here, it should be able to tell if they get close. Dot. Time slipped away slowly in the oppressive silence. Yuan like a ghost cautiously navigated the labyrinth of reefs.

avoiding one hidden reef after another that lurked like monsters in the night. Occasionally, a roosting seabird would be startled, emitting a piercing cry that sent a shiver of tension through the crew. Around 3:00 a.m., Such Chanchan suddenly opened her eyes, her voice tense. Port side, 11:00 direction, about 1.5 km away. There are large metal objects underwater.

They are ships, more than one. They are mored, but the holes are emitting regular energy pulses, very weak, as if they are maintaining some kind of low power operation. It's here. Everyone's spirits lifted. Sure, how immediately signaled the helmsmen to adjust the course, and using the shadow of a huge reef, they slowly and stealthily moved towards the port side.

At the same time, the lookout raised a moninocular telescope with a dark filter and carefully observed in the direction Sue Chansion indicated. At least two medium-sized sailing ships have been spotted, their masts visible. The design resembles the Predator class modified vessels commonly used by Freedom Wings. There are no obvious lights, but there's a faint reflection from the holes suggesting possible human activity, the lookout reported, barely suppressing his excitement. Can you see what they're doing? Lyn Mo asked.

It was too far away and too dark to see clearly, but one of the boats seemed to have a crane or similar device extending out of the water, which looked more like it was launching or retrieving something and fishing. Lynn Mo pondered for a moment, then ordered, "Continue to approach, maintaining cover from the reefs. Reduce the boat speed to the slowest possible." Suchan focus on sensing the area below that body of water, especially the direction the crane is pointing. like a black panther gliding close to the ground. The Mo Yuan slowly approached using the complex terrain of the reefs.

When the distance was less than a kilometer, even without binoculars, the dark outlines of the two ships could be vaguely seen. Like two larger reefs embedded in the inky sea. Sure enough, on the side of one of the ships, a thick crane-like shadow stretched towards the sea, its end disappearing into the water. Suchians brows furrowed deeper. her face appearing somewhat pale in the hazy moonlight.

There's something underwater. It's suspended or anchored to the seabed. The energy reaction is strange. It doesn't seem to be purely mechanical or mineral. It's more like a living thing, but the energy structure is very rigid with a strong sense of weaving like an aggregate forcibly combined from a large number of tiny life forms driven and bound by external energy.

Living organism aggregate driven by external energy. Linmo and Leewi exchanged a glance, both seeing the seriousness in each other's eyes. This didn't sound like an ordinary weapons test. Can you determine the size and shape of that thing? Then Montacet Such Chian strained to concentrate. Beads of sweat forming on her forehead.

It's very long, possibly exceeding 10 m with an irregular shape like a giant tangled vine or tentacles. The energy pulse is emanating from within it, synchronized with a device on the ship. Wait, something's changing. The ship's energy output is increasing. The underwater aggregate is starting to activate.

The energy reaction is escalating. Almost at the same time, Sue Chian finished speaking. Several powerful spotlights strictly shielded and shining only downwards, suddenly lit up on the wings of freedom ship in the distance. The beams of light pierced the darkness of the sea, focusing on the waters below the crane arm. By the brief glimpse of the light, the lookout and a few people on the bridge finally caught a glimpse of the terrifying underwater scene.

It was indeed an enormous, irregularly shaped dark brown to almost black mass, its surface covered in slime, reflecting a nauseating dim light. Under the bright light, it could be seen that it was composed of countless tentacle-like objects of varying thicknesses, resembling both plant and animal, twisted and intertwined, some with suckers or sharpbone spurs at their ends. At this moment, this mass was slowly writhing and expanding under the beam of light like a nightmare forcibly awakened from its slumber. What the hell is that? A young sailor couldn't help but exclaim, his voice trembling. I danty know but it is definitely not a product of natural evolution.

The leeway s voice also became dry. The energy readings are soaring. Its internal structure is extremely unstable as if it s being forcibly catalyzed and controlled. Just then something seemed to happen on the wings of Liberty ship. A dull loud crash like metal breaking or something collapsing rang out exceptionally clear in the silent seen night despite its distance.

Immediately afterward, the powerful spotlights began to shake violently and faint gasps and commotion came from a ship. It's out of control. Su Chanchian gripped the gunnel tightly, her fingertips turning white. The energy binding of that underwater aggregate is rapidly weakening. Its activity is surging.

It's becoming incredibly aggressive. As if to prove her words, the sea surface, shrouded in lights, suddenly exploded. A terrifying tentacle as thick as a bucket and covered with barbs and suckers burst out of the water and lashed the hull of the wings of Freedom ship next to it with a shrill sound. Crack. The sound of the wooden hull breaking could be faintly heard even from this distance.

The ship rocked violently and chaos erupted on board with shouts running and a clanging of metal all mixed together. Another ship attempted to attack the tentacles with ballisti, but even more tentacles swarmed out from underwater, frantically lashing and entangled the two vessels. One of the tentacles even coiled around a massive crane arm, bending it with a sickening metallic twisting sound. The experiment went out of control and backfired. Sure, how gasped.

What kind of monster did they create? Limo stared intently at the chaotic and terrifying waters, his mind racing. The wings of freedom were clearly testing a weapon combining biological and mechanical or energy technology, but they had failed. This thing was now indiscriminate in its attacks, friend or foe, and extremely aggressive. Boss, what do we do? Should we retreat in the chaos? Risks and opportunities coexist.

Sure, how Linmo's voice was calm and even prepare for battle. Mo you on circle around to the upwind side of that area of water and maintain a safe distance. Dot. As for that monster, if Wings of Liberty can't handle it, we'll help it get completely dealt with. Meanwhile, in the darkness, a new hunter had already silently taken its place. Chapter 43. Seizing the core. The sea surface in a reef area has become a living hell. The outofc control tentacle monsters displayed astonishing destructive power.

The first freedom wing medium-sized sailing ship attacked had a huge gash torn in its side. The air was thick with the smells of the sea, burnt seafood, and a faint stench of blood.

Such Chians face pald further, and fine beads of sweat kept seeping from her forehead. The core of that thing is in the middle cabin of the first tilted ship. The energy fluctuations are the strongest, but extremely unstable, like a fireball that could explode at any moment. Some of the activity of the surrounding tentacles is powered by that core, but it's mostly driven by the instinctive frenzy of its own biological tissues. She took a few quick breaths.

Its perception is strange. It mainly relies on energy disturbances and physical vibrations. Our ship has a runic energy field, although weak, but it's from a different source. It doesn't seem to have noticed us, or rather, it prioritizes attacking targets with more obvious energy disturbances and greater physical threats. A deformed product of biological and energy fusion.

Leeway stared intently at the resonator in his hand, its pointer swinging wildly, recording chaotic data. The core should be a device that forcibly drives and restrains it. Now, the restrain has failed and the biological instincts are backfiring, but the core is still providing energy, so it's more violent than a pure biological entity. What madman came up with this? Lyn Mo's gaze remained fixed on the battlefield. The listing ship was sinking faster, its stern already submerged.

Most of the survivors had transferred to small boats and were desperately paddling towards another ship. A disgusting mixture of blood and slime exploded in the moonlight. The monster emitted a high-pitched inhuman screech. Its tentacles struck by heavy arrows convulsed violently, snapped or detached.

One arrow even pierced deep into the edge of the main tumor, causing it to writhe wildly. "Now get in the water." Lin Mo waved his hand and jumped into the shuttle-shaped boat first. Su Chanhan stood at the bow of the Mo Yuan ship, gripping the railing tightly with both hands.

Roger that. Keep monitoring on. Lynn Emmo lowered his body as the small boat sped through the crests and troughs of the waves.

The icy sea water constantly splashing against his face. The short distance of two or 300 m seemed incredibly long at this moment. Linmo was the last to enter, and he secured the boat's mooring rope as well. The cabin was a mess, filled with a heavy stench of blood, burnt flesh, and an indescribable sweet rotten smell. The seawater had reached knee deep, and floating on it were broken planks, debris, and several mangled corpses. An emergency oil lamp still hung on the slanted bulkhead, casting a flickering, uneasy light. Turn right ahead, down to the next staircase.

The core energy source is on the next floor slightly to the right. Su Chians voice guided through the comp shell. Go. Linmo shorts sword in hand took the lead. Ziao Tai and Lu Phone guarded him on the left and right respectively while the other four team members kept watch on the rear.

The lower compartment was flooded almost waist deep. It appeared to be a laboratory or modification workshop scattered with bizarrely shaped glassware, metal supports, and biological tissue samples submerged in an unknown liquid. A nauseating sight. In the center of the compartment, a metal cabinet roughly the size of a wardrobe connected by thick cables appearing to be a mixture of some kind of highly conductive biological tendons and metal wires was half submerged. Several crystals emitting an unstable dark red glow were embedded in the cabinet surface, the source of the energy fluctuations.

Many pipes connected to the side of the cabinet, several of which were broken, gushing out a viscous, faintly glowing green liquid. That's it. Leeway's voice came from the comp shell, filled with excitement and tension. The dark red crystal is the energy source and control interface. The green liquid might be a bioactive maintainer.

First, disconnect the main energy connection. Be careful. There might be residual bioelectric shock or corrosiveness. Thai luo, guard the entrance. You two come with me.

Lynn Mo waited forward, avoiding the flowing green liquid and carefully examined the structure of the metal cabinet. Soon, he found several main cable connection points as well as an energy valve that appeared to be manually shut off. "Such Chian, what's the situation outside?" he asked while preparing his tools. The monster's main body has been temporarily forced back by sure burning arrows, but more tentacles are retracting, possibly indicating an anomaly in its core energy. You must hurry.

1 minute at most. 1 minute. Without hesitation, Linmo used speciallymade insulated pliers to quickly and precisely cut the three thickest main cables. Sparks crackled and a burnt smell rose. Then he found a manual valve and turned it to the closed position with all his might.

The dark red crystallin light on the metal cabinet surface quickly dimmed, leaving only a faint afterglow. Energy source cut off. Prepare to disassemble the core crystal and main control board. Lynn Mo ordered. Two team members immediately stepped forward and carefully pried open the protective panel of the metal cabinet with tools, revealing a more intricate internal structure.

One of them quickly collected a sample of the flowing green liquid using a speciallymade corrosion resistant container. The other communicated remotely with Leewi and under Leewi's guidance carefully removed the three most important dark red crystals in a metal plate covered with fine textures, placing them into a speciallymade leadlined waterproof seal box. The whole process took no more than 40 seconds. Got it. Let's go.

Lynamo picked up the seal box and ran back the way he came. Just then, the entire shipwreck shuddered violently, accompanied by a chilling, scraping, and tearing sound that was almost within reach. A tentacle with sharp bone spikes at the end forcefully pierced through the bulkhead, diagonally above their heads. Muddy sea water carrying fragments of wood poured down. "It spotted us." "Run!" Su Chanchians exclamation rang out from inside the conch shell.

"Run!" Lynn and Mo roared, carrying a box in one hand and wielding a knife to cut through the debris blocking their path. The group struggled with all their might, tumbling and crawling through the violently shaking, flooded cabin towards the breached exit. Behind them, more tentacles were frantically dismantling the ship's cabins with terrifying hissing and collapsing sounds following closely behind. A race against time. It all comes down to those final 10 m.

Chapter 44. fire and rebirth. Bone spiky tentacles grazed Lin Moe's back. The fishy stench they stirred, making his hair stand on end. Splinters of wood and murky seaater pelted down on him.

Exit. Jump. Lynn and Mo roared. Not even having time to turn around. Using the momentum of the tilting of the cabin, he and his box rushed towards the opening in front of him that led in a faint moonlight and water light.

The group plunged into the icy sea like dumplings being dropped into a pot. Linmo held his breath the moment he entered the water, gripping the sealed box tightly with one hand and kicking his legs hard, trying to float towards the direction of the small boat, he remembered.

He could hear the dull thuds of the underwater collapse and the immense suction from the tentacles churning the water. Left front, the small boat is over there. The heavy arrow transformed into a black line, not shooting towards the tentacles, but precisely piercing deep into the open, relatively fragile sucker-like mouth. The slime, mixed with unidentified tissue fragments, exploded.

The tentacle let out an extremely sharp screech, then suddenly convulsed and contracted, its movements instantly freezing. It's that moment of stillness. Two small boats narrowly made their way to the side of the Mo Yuan ship. Countless arms reached down and pulling and tugging quickly dragged the exhausted and pale-faced Linmo and the others onto the deck. The two small boats were then swiftly secured with ropes.

Set sail full speed. Get out of this area. Lynn Mo had barely stood up on the deck and hadn't even had time to catch his breath before he gave the order. With all its main sails raised and ores swung in unison, the ship shuttered slightly and began to accelerate, heading towards the reef Maze it had come from. Behind it, the tentacle monster, having lost its core energy support and suffered successive injuries, seemed to be at its last gasp.

Although it was still angrily waving its remaining tentacles, its pursuit speed had clearly slowed down. In the end, it could only let out a low, gradually weakening whale in the direction the Mo Yuan had gone before slowly sinking into the sea, polluted by blood and wreckage. On the deck, still reeling from the shock, Lynn Mo leaned against the ship's railing, breathing heavily. Cold sea water dripped down his latex suit. Such an ran over, her face even paler than his, her eyes red- rimmed.

She wanted to say something but could only grip his wet arm tightly, her fingers trembling slightly. Well done, Chanchian. Lynn Mos voice was horsearo as he gave her a tired but sincere smile. Without you, we wouldn't have been able to come back. Su Chanchian shook her head, tears finally falling, which she quickly wiped away.

Sherhal walked over and patted Linn Mos shoulder hard. He didn't say anything, but the fear and relief in his eyes were clearly visible. Leewi eyes hopped over like a monkey, his eyes fixed on the sealed box at Linmo's feet. Want to touch it, but not daring to. Core? How's the core? Is it sealed properly? What about those green liquid samples? Quick, let me see them.

I need to analyze them immediately. What are those lunatics at Wings of Freedom doing? Lynn Mo kicked the box and said to Lee way, "When we get back to the island, you'll have your chance to see this. Now have someone check the wounded, take stock of the losses and strengthen security. One of the wings of Freedom's ships escaped. It's damaged, but there might still be survivors.

Also, although that monster seems to be finished, it's not completely dead yet. This area of the sea is temporarily designated as a restricted zone. He walked to the top of the ship's deck and looked back at the battlefield that was gradually being swallowed by darkness and the shadows of the reefs. The moonlight was cold and the sea seemed to have returned to calm with only some floating debris and oil slicks as evidence of the fierce battle that had just taken place. This time he won.

He obtained a crucial item, severely damaged the enemy's secret weapon, and while his side was alarmed, they were not in serious danger. But Caesar's madness and ruthlessness exceeded his expectations. That monster combining biological and energy resources was clearly not something that could be created in a short time. Behind the wings of Liberty, there was probably more to it than just plunder. He touched the conch shell at his waist and Shinwood's anxious inquiry came through it.

Boss, how are things over there? There were some scattered messages on the regional channel just now saying that there was a huge explosion and commotion in the southeast reef area. Was that you guys? Do you need any support? Lineo calmed his breathing and replied, "It was us. We encountered the wings of freedom testing ground and a conflict occurred. The situation has been resolved and we are returning. The core objective has been achieved.

Notify the island to increase vigilance, especially at sea. We will be back soon." He put down the conch shell, feeling the steady progress of the Mo Yuan ship as it cut through the waves. He looked at his companions on the deck who were tired but had determined eyes and then at the warship beneath his feet, a vessel that embodied everyone's hard work and had performed well in its first combat mission. The title of King of Storms signifies not only glory but also the courage to confront the most turbulent undercurrents and fight the most ferocious beasts. And this is a path he is destined to walk with these people all the way.

Speed up and return. He gave the orders softly, his gaze fixed on the direction of Mauuan Pavilion Island. Back home, the rune tower should be almost finished. New challenges and opportunities await there. Chapter 45 tower.

The deepest darkness before dawn was cleaved open by the bow of the Mo Yuan ship. The island's outline gradually became clear in the faint morning light, and the lights on the watchtowers resembled guiding stars on the way home. After a night of life or death struggle, the exhausted people finally relaxed a little when they saw their home. As soon as the boat docked, Chi and Duod Duo and his men came to greet them. Seeing that everyone was soaking wet, injured, and exhausted, but with bright eyes, he swallowed back the question he was about to ask and just patted Linmo's arm hard.

It's good that you're back. The tower that engineer Lee kept talking about is finished. It was just completed an hour ago. Line looked up. In the newly built inner fortress area at the center of the island, a tower about five stories high with a stone in which structure in an ancient yet strangely rhythmic design stood quietly.

The surface of the tower was faintly visible with fine patterns outlined by blue variegated crystal powder, emitting a very faint soft blue white glow in the darkness before dawn. Completely different from the lights in other parts of the island, carrying a calm and mysterious atmosphere. Arrange for the wounded to go to the medical station first and have the others rest in shifts. We can't let our guard down. Sure, how you take charge.

Lyn Mo quickly gave the orders, then picked up the seal box and said to Leewi, who was waiting anxiously, and Sue Chanchian, who was barely holding on, "Let's go and take a look at our tower." Although Su Chanchians face was still pale, her eyes regained their clarity, and she silently followed. The interior of the primary rune tower appears more spacious than the exterior. The first floor is a vast hall with a complex circular array of runes about 3 m in diameter engraved in the center of the floor. It is currently emitting a faint glow as the energy of the tower flows. There is a peculiar sense of cleanliness in the air as if dust and odors have been filtered out, leaving only a faint scent similar to the mixture of minerals and pine wood after rain.

Upon entering, Leewayi took a deep wrapped breath, then rushed to the central array and pulled out various rudimentary instruments to begin testing. Stable, extremely stable. The free energy in the environment. He insisted on using this term rather than magical elements is naturally absorbed, purified, and then slowly released by the runes on the tower's base, forming a very gentle and orderly energy field. Performing rune inscription and energy material processing here will increase the success rate by at least 20%.

No, 30%. He gestured excitedly, then pointed to several recesses and platforms surrounding the hall walls. Look there. According to the blueprints, those are the interfaces for the detection bases and interference nodes. Although we don't have the corresponding auxiliary component blueprints yet, the basic functions should already be activated.

Give a try. Lynn Mo walked to a recessed area with fine energy conducting patterns connecting it to the central array along its edge. After a moment's thought, he placed a dark red crystal fragment, which had lost its activity and been removed from the core of the sunken ship into the recess. As soon as the fragment was placed, the circular array of runes in the center of the ground glowed slightly. Then a faint light screen appeared out of thin air above the slot where the fragment had been placed.

Twisted intermittent lines and dots of light flickered on the screen like a faulty touchcreen. Is this an analysis of the residual energy structure? Lewi leaned closer, pushed up his glasses, and tried to make out the details. Although it's incomplete, you can see that the energy channels inside this crystal are constructed in a very crude way, full of forced embedding and overriding traces. This is definitely not a product of natural formation or fine design. It's more like using powerful external energy to forcibly burn the energy affinity properties of some biological tissue into the mineral matrix.

Barbaric, inefficient, but it can indeed create a powerful energy source in the short term. Can we reverse engineer their technical approach or find their weaknesses? Linmo asked. I can feel that within a radius of about 200 m centered on the tower, the energy flow has become much clearer and more orderly. Initiate basic scanning.

Leeway took a deep breath and activated the analysis platform. The light screen in front reappeared, this time much more stable and clear than when using the fragments, and began to slowly outline the complex three-dimensional structure inside the crystal. Look here. Leeway pointed to a twisted main channel and countless branching veins on the light screen, an energy channel network.

The construction method is extremely crude, full of traces of violent drilling and subsequent repairs. The main channel forcibly penetrates the original stable structure of the crystal. And these branching veins are like some kind of energy sensitive biological nerve core that has been branded into it with high temperature and high energy. This will lead to a fragile crystal structure, low energy transmission efficiency, and extreme instability. He switched between several scanning modes and different colored areas appeared on screen.

The red areas are the inert energy matrix of the crystal itself. The dark blue is the embedded biological network residue and these bright green spots are the catalytic energy residue forcibly injected to activate and drive the network. This energy leeway magnify the image. His expression growing increasingly grave has strong induced mutation and force proliferation characteristics. It highly matches the energy signature of those green liquids.

He suddenly looked at the can of green liquid. Then at Lynn Mo, I understand the operating principle of this system is probably using this special crystal as an energy source and control core, forcibly driving and binding one or more special marine biological tissues with high activity and strong mutation capabilities. That green liquid is the culture medium and controller that maintains and stimulates the activity of the biological tissues. The crystal issues commands catalyzing the transmission of energy through the biological network, stimulating the biological tissues to grow rapidly, mutate, and attack according to a preset form such as tentacles. However, due to the dual brutality of the technology and materials, the instincts of the biological tissues are extremely prone to backlash.

And once the control cracks or the energy supply is overloaded, it will turn into the kind of outofcrol monster we saw last night. Lynn Emmo interjected his eyes. I see. As for the duration, the active ingredients in a liquid will naturally degrade, but the crystal can continuously emit enhanced signals, which I estimate can last for several hours to a whole day. Dot leeway pushed up his glasses. Caesar's revenge began in this unexpected and more insidious way. A man-made tide of sea monsters was brewing in the distant northeastern seas. He didn't know if he could make it in time, stop it, or even protect himself and Sue Chian's island from the raging beast tide. But there are some things that even knowing the danger must be done. How could the king of storms sit idly by while storms ravaged the seas he cares about? He took a deep breath, turned around, and walked firmly toward the dock. The Mo Yuan is about to set sail once more, heading into the unknown, raging seas. This time, however, they may face thousands upon thousands of ocean eyes stained crimson with madness. Chapter 48. Rushing across the raging sea.

Like a heavy arrow released from a bow. The MO Yuan crashed through the rising waves and sped off at full speed toward the northeast. The main sail, billowing in the wind like the chest of a monstrous beast, was fully engaged. The extended orars on both sides were in use, and the strongest sailors chosen for their skillful maneuvering roared low calls as they rode with all their might. The seawater cleaved at the bow turned into white foam, turnurning to both sides and leaving a long churning contrail at the stern.

The sky was overcast, letting clouds hung low, and the air was thick with a salty dampness and a faint, unsettling fishy odor. Standing at top the ship's upper deck, Lin Mo held a moninocular telescope, his gaze sweeping across the sea and horizon. Aside from the increasingly turbulent waves and a few seabirds flying low, nothing seemed to miss, but the heavy premonition in his heart. Along with the occasional brief reports from Leeway transmitted from the rune tower via the conchk shell at his waist, the energy field of the tower base is stable. No large-scale abnormal energy has been detected approaching the island, and the environmental free energy reading in the northeast direction continues to rise slowly, consistent with the precursor to a large-scale life form gathering, made him dare not relax for a moment.

Su Chian, wrapped in a thick waterproof cloak, leaned against the base of the main mast. Her face was still pale, but her eyes were focused. Her hands were clased together in front of her, her knuckles slightly white from the force. Her senses, like the most sophisticated sonar, continuously spread forward and into the deep sea. There are more and more life signs, she suddenly spoke, her voice not loud, but clearly reaching Lynn Mos ears amidst the wind, waves, and tides.

They re not on our route, but in a vast sea further east and north. Like countless restless points of light, originally scattered against the dark background, they're now being attracted and awakened by some invisible force slowly moving in roughly the same direction. I can feel that chaotic anger and hunger deepening. D. Can you identify the main species and their approximate speed of movement? Lyno asked, putting down his binoculars.

Such Chian closed her eyes and concentrated for a moment. The species are very diverse. The large ones have energy outlines similar to hammerhead sharks and tiger sharks, but are more chaotic. They're more medium-sized ones like schools of barracudas, large barracudas, and some kind of armored fastoving arthropods. Their overall speed is not fast, as if they are gathering and brewing.

But once they explode, the impact speed will be terrifying. The most troublesome thing is that there are some big guys in the deep water that are rising to the surface. Their energy reaction is very strong and their forms are hard to predict. Sharks, large predatory fish, crustaceans, and even possibly deep sea monsters lured ashore mos brow furrowed even more. If this was truly a man-made beast tide, its destructive power would be unimaginable.

ordinary wooden sailboats and even moderately fortified islands would be utterly vulnerable to such an impact. How far are we from there? And how far are we from Shallow Island? At our current speed and direction, it will probably take another 7 or 8 hours of sailing to reach the edge of that turbulent sea area. My island is further in. Sue Changians voice trembled slightly. I hope they are prepared.

Lyn Mo walked over and gently pressed her slightly trembling shoulder. We'll catch up. Your islanders aren't unprepared either. Besides, Caesar couldn't have made such a big commotion just to attack an island. His real goal might be testing, eliminating competitors in that area.

Or perhaps there's something he needs there. We still have time to deal with it. Such Chian felt the warmth and strength coming from her shoulder, took a deep breath, and nodded. Sherhow walked up from the lower deck. His face wet from the sea breeze and splashing water.

The ship is in good condition and the rowers are rotating smoothly. Weapons have been checked. All ballisty are loaded half heavy arrows and half incendiary arrows. Following the ideas Lee gave us before he left, we rush to make a batch of sound blasting tubes which are made by stuffing gunpowder and scrap iron into sealed bamboo tubes, lighting the fuse, and throwing them out. They can cause a loud bang and shrapnel damage at close range, which might be useful against dense schools of fish.

We've also added an extra layer to the underwater protective net, but whether it can withstand the impact of large sea monsters is hard to say. Do your best, Lin Mo said in a deep voice. Notify everyone to take the time to rest and eat. The real battle may begin around nightfall. The order was given, and the atmosphere on the ship grew even more tense, but no one panicked.

Those who could board the Mo on to participate in this expedition were all elites who had experienced many battles and trials. They silently checked their weapons, organized their equipment, chewed on their hard rations, and dried meat, occasionally exchanging a few words and low voices, their eyes filled with wolf-like vigilance and ferocity. Time passed amidst the waves and the sound of the wind. The sky grew increasingly gloomy, and a few cold raindrops began to fall. Visibility on the sea was decreasing.

An EMO Yuan seemed to be sailing through the mouth of a gray behemoth. Around 300 p.m., Sue Chansen, who had been sensing with her eyes closed, suddenly opened them and said urgently about 15 nautical miles ahead to the left, "There's a strong energy conflict. It's not a natural beast tide. It's a battle. There are ships, more than one.

They're fighting sea beasts." Lynn and Mo and Shirhow immediately rushed to the port side and raised their binoculars. Through the rain and lowhanging clouds, they could vaguely see scattered flashes of fire where the sea met the sky in the distance, as well as almost inaudible explosions torn apart by the wind. "Can you identify which faction it belongs to?" Linmo asked. Su Chian tried hard to discern. The energy in the battle zone is too chaotic.

But one energy fluctuation carries a very positive and orderly feeling. Somewhat like a dragon soul. Dragon soul. They're in the sea area too and are fighting with sea monsters. Slow down.

Move towards the combat zone. Stay concealed and maintain a safe distance for observation. Linmo ordered. If it were the dragon soul, perhaps they could obtain more intelligence and maybe even join forces. The Mo Yuan slowed down and taking advantage of the increasingly heavy rain and the thin fog at sea, carefully headed towards the direction of the flickering fire.

As the distance closed, the scene through the telescope gradually became clearer. Three medium-sized sailing ships arranged in a triangular formation were engaged in fierce combat with a horde of sea monsters several times their size. The ships were sturdy, their tactics wellcoordinated, and although the flags fluttering on their mass were wet with rain, the iconic dragon emblem of Dragon Soul was still clearly visible. The seab beasts attacking them were a diverse array. Hammerhead sharks over 5 m long, frantically ramming the hall.

schools of seawolf fish leaping out of the water trying to jump onto the deck and several giant sea scorpion-like creatures with shiny black shells wielding huge pincers constantly trying to climb the ship side. The Dragon Soul ships fought back tenaciously with crossbows, incendiary arrows and oil tanks mounted on the ship side. Many sea beast corpses and remains floated on the sea, but the horde seemed endless with each wave of attacks higher than the last. They're surrounded. The beast horde is organized, taking turns attacking to wear down their defenses.

Sure, how with his extensive experience, immediately saw the key point. Look there. Such an suddenly pointed to a relatively calm sea surface behind the horde of beasts. There's something underwater. The energy reaction is very concentrated, very deliberate.

It feels a lot like the residue of the green liquid, but it's more concealed, like it's issuing continuous commands. Lynn Mo looked in the direction she pointed, and the seawater, there seemed to be a darker color with a faint, unnatural dark green fluoresence flowing underwater. It's a beacon or a control node. Then Mo understood instantly. The wings of freedom hadn't revealed themselves directly, but instead deployed a control node here to guide the horde to attack the dragon soul ship that happened to be operating in this area.

This served two purposes. Testing weapon effectiveness and striking at their competitors. Boss, what do we do? Should we help or not? Sure. How asked helping Mint directly confronting this strange controlled beast tide, exposing themselves, which was extremely risky. Not helping meant that Dragon Souls three ships were likely to be completely wiped out.

Lynn Emmo hesitated for only a moment. The Dragon Soul is a potential ally and a representative of Order. To stand by and watch them perish would be morally reprehensible and detrimental to long-term strategy. More importantly, if they don't probe the strengths and weaknesses of this controlled beast tide here, they will only be more passive when the tide attacks sue Chian's island or themselves. Help, Lynmo said decisively, but not by charging straight in.

Sure, how command the Mo Yuan to circle around to the flank and rear of the beast horde. Aim at the underwater control node area that Chansion pointed out and use all the crossbows to concentrate firepower and give it a good beating. Use armor-piercing heavy arrows and explosive arrows. Blow it down. Understood.

A fierce glint flashed in Shows eyes, and he immediately rushed to the command post. Chan, focus all your attention on sensing the energy changes and the beast hordes reactions around the node. Xiaoai Lu Foam, take a team and get ready. If the beast horde goes out of control and scatters after the node is destroyed, some might escape and attack us. You're responsible for clearing out any sea beasts that get close.

The order was relayed swiftly. Like an assassin in the shadows, the Mo Yuan began to silently trace a wide ark, bypassing the fierce main battle and stealthily heading towards the eerily fluorescent sea area behind the beast horde. Everyone's heart was in their throat. Whether this can break the deadlock depends on this one strike. Chapter 49.

Breaking the impass. Gathering dragon souls. The Mo Yuan was like a poison dagger, silently cutting into the pulse behind the surging beast tide. The rain and sea fog provided excellent cover. The ship's lights had long been extinguished with only the occasional faint glow of runes emanating from the hull, strictly controlled to a minimum.

Everyone held their breath. The only sounds were the rhythmic slicing of ores cutting through the water and a mournful whistling of the sea breeze against the sails. Suchan gripped the damp, cold gunnel tightly. All her senses focused on the water that glowed with an eerie dark green light. Below the energy pulsed rhythmically and coldly, a stark contrast to the violent chaotic life fluctuations of the surrounding sea beasts like a stubborn discordant metronome in a chaotic symphony.

Right below about 15 m deep, the energy core is stable. But is there a protective bofield around it? No. But it's a large number of small energy organisms gathered and enveloping it like a living armor. Sue Changen's voice was extremely low reaching Linmo and sure how s ears through the comp shell. The interference is huge.

My senses can't penetrate it and I can t see the specific shape but the characteristics of the energy signal are highly homologous to those green liquids. And the source of the control signal s dispersion is right here. Position locked. Sure. House's eyes flashed and he growled into the loudspeakers of the crossbow positions below.

Crossbows 1 through 4, all equipped with Lee's speciallymade armor-piercing explosive arrows. Target 300 m directly in front, 15 m below the water surface. Concentrated area coverage. On my command, Yuan slowly adjusted its angle and a four heavy ballisti on its sides silently rose in the darkness for calibration. The gunners placed arrows with oversized gunpowder canisters attached to their sterns and specially hardened arrow heads into the slides, their fingers gripping the triggers.

Now, Sherhow suddenly waved his hand. Release. Boom. Boom. Boom.

Boom. from muffled thuds. Almost in unison, the crossbow strings vibrated violently and four speciallymade heavy arrows tore through the rain, tracing almost straight paths through the air before plunging into the dark green water. It entered the water without making a sound. Time seemed to freeze for a second.

Immediately, boom, boom, boom, boom. A muffled, massive explosion came from underwater, and the sea surface suddenly bulged upwards, transforming into four enormous splashes of water mixed with fire, slime, and shattered tissue. The powerful shock wave caused the Mo Yuan ship 300 m away to shake violently, and the people on the deck were thrown about. The dark green fluoresence of that body of water instantly became chaotic and flickering before rapidly fading away. it.

The energy core fluctuations are rapidly decreasing. Control signal interrupted. Suchan shouted immediately, her voice filled with surprise and exhaustion. Almost simultaneously, the swarm of sea monsters that were frantically besieging the dragon soul fleet ahead broke into obvious disarray. The predators who had been advancing and retreating in an orderly fashion suddenly halted their movements.

Their rhythm of attack disrupted. The hammerhead sharks stopped their relentless ramming of the ship and began to wander aimlessly. The school of sea wolves lost their unified target for leaping, and some even began to bite each other. The giant sea scorpions also stopped climbing, waving their pincers, seemingly somewhat bewildered. The node has been destroyed.

The horde has lost its unified command. Sherhow clenched his fist excitedly. "Don't be too happy yet," Lin Emo stared intently ahead. The command was interrupted, but their bestial instincts remain. Moreover, they have been provoked and are within reach.

Beware of counterattacks and chaotic clashes. All personnel prepared to engage the enemy. Sure enough, after a brief period of chaos, the sea beasts, having lost their unified objective, turned their anger and primal hunting instincts toward the nearest targets, including the Moan, which had just caused such a huge commotion. Some of the sea beasts turned around and charged toward the MOU on. Although their formation was scattered, their numbers were still considerable.

Fire freely. Prioritize taking out medium-sized targets there close by. Conserve heavy arrows. Shh commanded loudly, remaining calm under pressure. The warriors on the Mo Yuan immediately sprang into action.

The ballisti were replaced with ordinary heavy arrows, and they fired short bursts at the charging swarm of sea bream and scattered hammerhead sharks. Archers and spearmen on the ship's sides also took their positions, using arrows and harpoons to repel any small sea creatures attempting to approach. Ziaoai and Lu Foong, leading a team of skilled melee fighters, armed with long-handled sickles and machetes, guarded key positions on the ship sides, ready to deal with any stragglers that jumped aboard. The battle instantly intensified. Despite its superior equipment, the Mo Yuan was under immense pressure from the onslaught of numerous frenzied sea monsters attacking from multiple directions.

A hammerhead shark slammed into the underwater port side with a dull thud, causing the ship to tilt noticeably. Several seawolf fish seize the opportunity to leap, their sharp teeth biting into the hole plating, only to be pierced through by the warriors guarding the area with their spears. on the right. Those two giant scorpions are coming. The lookout screamed.

Two giant dark-shelled sea scorpions abandoned the dragon soul ship, slithering along with their segmented limbs and astonishing speed towards the right side of the MOU on their massive pincers raised high, gleaming coldly. Starboard ballista, aim at the joint. Fire. Sure. How roared.

The two crossbows on the right hastily aimed and fired. One arrow missed, ricocheting off the sea scorpion's thick carropase. The other, however, luckily struck the weak joint where one of the sea scorpion's pincers connected to its body. The arrow head embedding itself deeply. This the injured sea scorpion let out a sharp hiss and its movements became frantic.

The other intact sea scorpion rushed over and its pincers clamped down hard on the ship's side. Just at this critical moment, a sharp whooshing sound suddenly came from the side and behind. Several heavy crossbow bolts burning with intense flames shot towards the dragon's soul fleet. They struck precisely at the junction of the charging sea scorpion's head and breastplate. With several loud bangs, the flames and impact instantly charred and shattered the sea scorpion's head and breastplate, abruptly halting it charge as it crashed into the sea.

Its dragon soul support. Ziaoai exclaimed in surprise. The three Dragon Soul ships quickly regained their footing after the beast horde fell into chaos, and one of them decisively spun off to support the MON. The warriors on board coordinated perfectly, firing crossbows and arrows in unison to help relieve the pressure on the MON. With the addition of fresh troops, the pressure on the MON was greatly reduced.

The two ships fought side by side, providing cover for each other and repelling and dispersing the scattered hordes of beasts that charged forward. Lacking unified command and attack from both sides, these lured sea beasts finally began to retreat, some diving into the deep sea and others scattering away from the ships. About half an hour later, the sea finally returned to relative calm, leaving only floating corpses, wreckage, and lingering smoke and the smell of blood. The medium-sized sailboat that Dragon Soul had sent as support slowly approached. Standing at the bow was a tall, middle-aged man wearing simple leather armor, but with a tough and capable demeanor was Xiao Ji Gang.

Lord Lyno, I've long admired your name, King of Storms. You truly live up to your reputation. Xiao Ji Gangs booming voice echoed from a distance. Thank you for your assistance. If it weren't for your precise strike on that strange control node, our three ships would probably be doomed here today.

Lynmo walked to the ship side and cuped his hands in response. Captain Xiao, you're too kind. The dragon soul is maintaining order in the sea, and we just happen to be there, so naturally, we couldn't sit idly by. Besides, this controlled beast tide threatens everyone. The two ships drew closer and lower their gang planks.

Xiao Gi Gang accompanied by two deputies boarded the MOU on the two sides briefly exchanged information. One of our reconnaissance teams was tracking a faint energy anomaly we had previously detected in this area when we inadvertently fell into an ambush and were surrounded by this strange beast tide. We suspect it s the work of the wings of freedom, but weary struggling to find evidence and a way to break the spell. Dhiao Gi Gang said gravely, UV found a key as soon as you arrived. I admire your insight and decisiveness.

Our instruments have limited precision, but they are generally pointing in the same direction deeper into the northeast. We suspect that the wings of freedom may have discovered something there or using some kind of natural energy field there to amplify and spread their control signals.

This beast hide is very likely just a stress test. Linmo and Su Chanchian exchange a glance, both seeing the worry in each other's eyes. If Caesar had truly found a natural signal amplifier, the scale and range of the beast tides he could create would far exceed imagination. Captain Xiao, what your plans next, Linmo asked. We must report the situation and findings here as soon as possible.

At the same time, continue to monitor the energy anomalies in the Northeast. The threat from the wings of freedom has escalated to a new level and we must unite more forces to deal with it. Ziao Ji Gang looked at Linmo, his tone sincere. Lord Linmo, we are aware of the strength and stance of the Mo Yuan pavilion. Would you be willing to establish a closer cooperative relationship with the dragon soul? At least in this sea area, we need to fight side by side in dealing with the wings of freedom and this strange beast tide.

Lyno pondered for a moment. Deep cooperation with Dragon Soul had both advantages and disadvantages. The advantage was gaining official intelligence and support and sharing the burden. The disadvantage was the potential to be drawn into larger conflicts and actions would be somewhat restricted. However, the threat from wings of freedom was imminent, so cooperation would be mutually beneficial.

Yes. Linmo extended his hand. We can cooperate closely on intelligence sharing, joint defense and containment of freedom wings and its dangerous technologies. We can discuss the specific details with our subordinates later. Dot.

Xiao Ji Gang gripped Lin Mo's hand tightly. Good. That's great. After exchanging some more details and agreeing to keep communication open, Xiao Ji Gang led his men back to his ship, preparing to leave the dangerous waters and return to base to report. On board the Mo Yuan, the crew began cleaning the deck, treating the lightly wounded, and inspecting the damage to the hull.

Linmo looked northeast where Sue Chanchan's home was located, and also in the direction of the unknown energy anomaly and the possible signal amplifier. "Rest for an hour, replenish supplies, and then continue on your way," he ordered. "Our destination remains the same, but this time we must be more careful." Caesar's shadow looms wider and more menacing than imagined, and the road ahead remains shrouded in mist. Chapter 50. Lonely Island Fire.

After separating from the dragon soul fleet, the Mo Yuan continued sailing northeast. Night had fallen. The rain had stopped, but the dark clouds lingered, completely obscuring the moonlight. The sea was pitch black, with only the spray from the waves breaking at the bow, gleaming faintly. Most of the crew took the opportunity to rest while only the lookout and the sailors on watch remained at their posts, vigilantly observing the near absolute darkness around them.

Lyn Mo, wide awake, sat in the ship's deck, repeatedly examining the nautical chart by the dim light of a lantern powered by fragments of energy storing crystals. The coordinates of Su Chian's island were clearly marked on it. It would take approximately four more hours to reach them at full speed from their current location. More than 3 hours have passed since we encountered the dragon soul and destroyed the control node. Sure house said in a low voice as he walked over.

If Caesar had other arrangements or backup plans in that sea area, they should have been activated by now. Miss Sue Island is probably under pressure to Lynn. Emmon nodded, his fingers tapping unconsciously on the table. This was exactly what he was worried about. Caesar couldn't have made such a big fuss just to trap a few Dragon Soul ships.

Testing weapons, striking potential adversaries, or even concealing his true purpose exploring or utilizing the energy anomaly in the northeast were all possibilities. And Such Chanchan's Island, located relatively far forward and closely connected to the Mo Yuan Pavilion, was undoubtedly an ideal target for attack or testing. Speed up. Tell the rowers to hang in there a little longer and then everyone will take turns resting once we reach our destination. Lin Mo said in a deep voice.

Understood. Sure how turned to relay the order. Lin Emo stepped outside the cabin. The cold night wind invigorating him. He approached the bow of the ship where Su Chian still stood wrapped in a cloak like a silent statue facing northeast.

Chian, take a rest. Your senses are exhausted. Linmo draped a dry, thick blanket over her shoulders. Su Chanchian shook her head gently, her voice somewhat unsteady. I'm fine.

I'm listening to the sounds carried by the wind, the messages coming from the sea. My island is still here. I can feel that familiar faint call, the life imprint left by the island's inhabitants over a long period of time, but it's very anxious, very tense, like a string stretched to its limit. She turned to look at Lin Mo, her eyes shining brightly in the darkness. Linmo, will we make it? We definitely will.

Dot. Lin Mo grasped her cold hand. Besides, weary not unprepared. Your islanders have defenses. And Weevi brought the mo you on.

Dot. Su Chian felt the firm strength emanating from his hand, and the anxiety in her heart subsided slightly. She turned her attention back to the distance, trying her best to capture every subtle fluctuation. Time passed slowly and oppressively. Around 3:00 a.m., the Mo Yuan entered a sea area completely different from before.

The seaater was colder, the currents were turbulent, and the unsettling fishy smell in the air reappeared, even stronger than before. Scattered dead fish belly up and some broken unidentifiable fragments of biological tissue began to appear on the surface. We entered the edge of the affected area. Sue Chantians voice tightened. The marine life around us that showed signs of life has either fled or become unusually agitated.

Be careful underwater. As if to confirm her words, a muffled thud came from the bottom of the ship as if something had crashed into it. Immediately afterward, not far ahead on the port side, the sea suddenly exploded and a strange fish over 4 m long with a mouth full of fangs leaped out of the water, writhing wildly before crashing back down. It's a mad shark. They usually only live in the deep sea, an old sailor exclaimed.

They've been attracted here, too. Slow down. Be careful to avoid obstacles. All personnel, prepare for battle. Sure house roar rang out on the deck.

VMO Yuan slowed down, cautiously navigating the sea, fraught with unknown dangers. Occasionally, enraged or lost sea monsters would emerge from the darkness to launch attacks.
