Understood. He immediately ordered several crew members to quickly carry out several long tarpollen covered object from the lower deck and secure them to specific supports on both sides of the ship's hull. Uncovering the tarpollen revealed several thick modified copper pipes with simple energy conducting patterns engraved inside connected to a box at the stern containing an energy storage crystal and a simple rune array. This is an experimental product created by Lee Wayi based on the principles of the silent ripple rune amplified and oriented a directional sonic wave disperser. Theoretically, it can emit powerful sound waves of a specific frequency to drive away small to medium-sized marine life within a certain range.

However, it is extremely unstable, consumes a huge amount of energy, and the sound waves may also attract the attention of larger predators, making it one of his trunk cards that he will only use as a last resort. Activate target the fan-shaped area directly ahead. Sure. How ordered. The crew member in charge of operation activated the device and the light from the energy storage crystal dimmed momentarily while the rune array humped.

Several copper pipes began to emit a low, increasingly loud hum. The frequency changing rapidly until it finally became a sharp highfrequency noise that was almost inaudible to the human ear, yet caused the seawater to vibrate violently and made everyone on board feel suffocated and irritable. Buzz. The sea ahead began to tremble violently as if it were boiling. The mad sharks and other small and medium-sized frenzied sea creatures that tried to approach seemed to be whipped hard by an invisible whip, rolling and struggling in pain before turning around and fleeing in panic, quickly clearing a relatively clean area of water ahead.

It works, but it will only last a few minutes. Full speed ahead. Sure, how roared. The main sail of the Mo Yuan was raised to full height again, and the long oars were rode with all their might. Like a giant beast breaking free of its shackles.

It charged out along the cleared path. The speed suddenly increased. In Sue Chanchan's perception, the call of her home became clearer and clearer, but the anxiety and tension also became stronger, even mixed with a trace of despair. Her heart clenched suddenly about half an hour later, just as the directional sonic deflector stopped working due to energy depletion and the surrounding sea creatures showed signs of gathering again. A flickering light suddenly appeared in the darkness ahead.

It wasn't starlight, wasn't phosphoresence, it was real orange, red flame light, and not just in one place. Then more flashes of fire appeared, vaguely outlining the shape of an island. On the island's beach and near the shore, figures moved about and shouts of battle, the clanging of metal, the vibration of bow strings and the roars of sea monsters mingled and drifted on the wind. "It's my island. They're under attack!" Su Chanchian cried out, her body trembling with excitement and fear.

Lin Mo raised his binoculars on the edge of the medium-sized island. Makeshift wooden fences and obstacles were broken and burning in several places. Dozens of islanders were using the remaining fortifications, employing spears, harpoons, bows, and arrows, and rudimentary catapults to fight a bloody battle against numerous sea monsters attempting to storm the beach. On the sea, the wreckage of several small damaged boats could be seen burning and sinking. The attacking sea monsters were of mixed species and although their numbers were not as large as those that had besieged the dragon soul fleet for an island with limited defenses it was already a catastrophic disaster.

It s a scattered beast tide led by the wings of freedom. They rew wearing down the island as defenses sure how deduced emo you on full speed ahead allisti aim at the densest part of the beast horde crashing onto the beach and fire hard. Use incendiary arrows. Linmo's eyes flashed with cold light, his voice as icy as ice. Xiaoai Lu Fong, take two teams and get ready.

Once we suppress the beast horde, immediately board small boats to land and provide support. Remember, we are just a passing unsuspecting merchant caravan. I am Mr. J. Understand? Understood? Everyone responded in unison without slowing down in the slightest.

The Mo Yuan, like a black vengeful messenger, charged straight toward the island's fiery coastline. The soldiers on board quickly took their positions. The ballisti were adjusted and the arrows were knocked. As the distance rapidly closed, the people fighting on the island also spotted the suddenly appearing, menacing ship and cried out in surprise and uncertainty. Lin Mo stood at the very front of the ship's deck, raised his hand, and looked at the tiny figures fighting bloody battles against the sea beasts in the fire light, and at the isolated island that was teetering on the brink of collapse under the onslaught of the beast tide.

His fingers suddenly swung down. Fire. The next moment, the side of the Mo Yuon erupted in furious flames and howls. Burning arrows like a rain of meteors tore through the darkness and slammed into the densest herd of beasts on the beach. The rescue operation began and the anonymous identity of Mr.

J would once again become a mysterious and powerful cloak in Linmo's hands. Standing behind him, Su Chanchian looked at the familiar island and the blood soaked homeland, then at Lin Mo's unwavering back, her eyes instantly welling with tears. He came. He really came. Chapter 51.

Strangers offering aid. The burning heavy arrows like a rain of divine punishment slammed into the densest herd of beasts on the beach. The explosive flames instantly engulfed several of the leading crazy sharks while the rolling flames and scattering shrapnel tore apart and ignited the surrounding small and medium-sized sea beasts. The sudden and terrifying attack momentarily halted the frenzied horde, and many sea beasts instinctively retreated, creating an opening in their attack. Is that ship helping us? Reinforcements.

Reinforcements have arrived. Don't stand there now. Plug the gap. Spearman advance. On the beach, the exhausted and blood soaked islanders were initially stunned, then erupted in shouts of triumph.

A robust middle-aged man who appeared to be their leader brandished a Nick machete and gave orders with a horse voice. The survivors mustered their last courage and used spears, harpoons, and burning bundles of grass to drive back the sea monsters that had been frightened away by the explosion and were still lingering. Instead of docking directly, the Mo Yuan skillfully traversed a semiircle on the sea about a 100 meters from a beach, continuously suppressing the densest area of the beast herd with its broadside. The roar of the crossbows and the exploding of the incendiary arrows became the most reassuring symphony at that moment. Small boats prepare, landing team go, sure how commanded from the deck.

Two slightly larger landing craft, each capable of holding more than 10 people, were lowered. Xiao Tai and Lu Fong leading 20 fully armed elites from the Mayuan Pavilion, most of whose faces were covered by makeshift masks or camouflage paint, quickly boarded the craft and rode vigorously toward the gap in the beach that had just been cleared by crossbows. Lynn Mo remained standing in the shadows of the ship's deck, observing the landing through binoculars. His attire was different from usual. He wore an inconspicuous dark waterproof cloak over his face and a cloth covering half his mouth and nose, revealing only his calm eyes.

Suchen, however, was forced to remain in her cabin to rest while simultaneously avoiding being seen by any islanders who might recognize her. The landing craft surged onto the beach, and Ziao Tai and his men, like tigers unleashed, immediately joined the battle. Their equipment was clearly far superior, their training exceptional, and their teamwork impeccable. They quickly stabilized and widened the gap, dividing, driving away, and killing the remaining sea monsters. The ballisti on the Moan also ceized fire in time to avoid friendly fire.

With the addition of this fresh force, the balance of the battle quickly shifted. About 15 minutes later, the last wave of dozens of sea monsters that had stormed the beach were completely defeated, and the survivors fled back into the sea, leaving behind a mess of corpses and burning remains on the beach. The crisis was temporarily averted. On the beach, the islanders who had survived the ordeal sat or lay down, panting heavily. Many of them gazed at the silent and imposing black ship anchored near the shore and at the mysterious, powerful reinforcements that had suddenly appeared.

their eyes filled with gratitude, awe, and doubt. The middle-aged leader, panting heavily, approached Xiao Tai, who had just stepped onto the beach, supported by several young men. Xiao Tai, also figning nonulence, deliberately lowered his voice. It's all right. We're a passing caravan.

We saw them in trouble and just want to lend a hand. How many casualties do you have? Thank you so much, all you righteous heroes, for your help. The middle-aged leader named Chinhai was one of the temporary administrators elected after Su Chancham left. He clased his hands in gratitude. The casualties were considerable.

More than a dozen brothers died, and many more were wounded. But if you hadn't arrived in time, our island would probably be gone. Please, our benefactors, come aboard and rest. Let's do our part as hosts. Ziaoai waved his hand.

No need. We have sufficient supplies, so we'll rest on the ship. You all hurry up and treat the wounded, extinguish the remaining fires, clean up the battlefield, and be wary of the seam monsters returning. Also, he paused and asked as Linimo had instructed beforehand, "Were the sea monsters that attacked you more ferocious than usual, and did they seem to be launching an organized attack?" Chunhai's expression changed, and he nodded emphatically. "My benefactor is wise." Is indeed so.

Although these beasts are usually fierce, they would not recklessly attack our defensive weaknesses wave after wave. Moreover, about half a day before the attack began, we noticed that the fish in the nearby sea were darting around like madmen, and the seaater also had a strange smell. We suspected that someone was behind this. "Are there any suspects?" Xiaoai asked. Chanhai hesitated for a moment, then lowered his voice.

Before our island lord, Miss Su Chanchian, left, she reminded us to be careful of wings of freedom. During the battle just now, I thought I saw a ship shadow flash by on the distant sea, but it was too dark to see clearly. Or maybe I was just seeing things. Ziaoai understood, but remained outwardly calm. Understood.

We will stay in this area for a while to clear out any remaining threats. You guys hurry up and recover. If there are any further developments, you can use a fire signal for help. Thank you so much, my benefactor. Chunhai bowed deeply once again.

Ziaoai said no more, leaving behind some medicine and supplies under the guise of surplus supplies from the caravan and then led his team back to the small boat and sailed back to the Moan. Back on the ship, Ziao Tai gave Lin Mo a detailed report of the situation. Shinhai is reliable. He used to be a leader of the fisherman and has a lot of authority. Such Chanchian said after coming out of the cabin and hearing the report, the island s defenses were also planned with him before I left.

This time the losses are considerable that her voice was somewhat low. Yui, you done a great job. It has not easy to hold out until we arrive in the face of such an organized beast tide. Lynn Emmo comforted him, then turned to shau. The Mo Yuan will patrol and keep watch in the nearby waters, paying particular attention to any suspicious vessels spying on us.

Also, send a few small boats equipped with a makeshift energy resonators that Leewi rushed to build to probe the waters around the island and see if there are any remaining control nodes or traces of pherommonsta. Clear. Furthermore, Lyno looked at Sue Chanchian. Find a way to send Chan Hai some more specific warnings and defense advice without revealing our true identities. Use the same secret code you agreed on with him during your previous anonymous transaction and smuggle the information through the medicine package left on the island.

Remind him to strengthen nighttime vigilance. Stockpile more oil and long range weapons. Pay attention to water and food safety and minimize going to sea in the near future. also hint to him that if he encounters an insurmountable danger, he can evacuate to the southeast. Su Chians eyes lit up slightly.

I understand. I'll go write it right away. Lynn Mos arrangements were swiftly implemented. The Mo Yuan, like a loyal guardian, slowly patrolled the outer perimeter of the island. Several small proboats, like worker ants, carefully searched the nearby waters.

2 hours later, a small probo brought back the news. We found this in a crevice in an underwater reef about two nautical miles northeast of the island. A team member presented an object wrapped in a waterproof cloth that emitted a faint fishy smell. Upon opening the package, inside was a damaged fist-sized metal can. The surface of the can had rough scratches, and inside were traces of a viscous dark green liquid, very pheromone.

There really are still some release points left, Leeway exclaimed, both excited and furious through remote analysis via the comp shell. This canister has a timed or controlled rupture device, which should be used to continuously release pherommones to maintain attraction and stimulation for the marine life in this area. The main control node we destroyed was probably responsible for large scale and powerful commands, while these small canisters are maintaining local hotspots. Can we find any clues about who put there? Lynn Emmo asked. The team member shook his head.

The jar is very ordinary. It looks like it was crudely made by hand and there are no markings. We didn't find any other traces in the surrounding water either. Caesar is very careful. Sure house sneered.

He uses cheap little jars sets up remotely or in advance. So even if he has discovered, he can't he be traced back to him. Dot. Lynn Mo stared coldly at the rough metal can. This insidious yet effective method of harassment and weakening was indeed reminiscent of Caesar style.

This time it was a pheromone can. What about next time? Clean up all the jars we find. Expand the search area. Lynn Emmo ordered. Also notify Chunghai and tell them not to eat any fish caught in the nearby waters recently, just in case.

He walked to the ship's railing, gazing at the island as it gradually regained its lights and began to heal its wounds. This time they had caught up. But what about next time? Caesar's shadow was everywhere. And this asymmetrical attritional attack was impossible to defend against. He must speed things up.

He needs to consolidate his forces, acquire more resources, find Caesar's weaknesses, and even launch a preemptive strike. Chian. He turned to Sue Chanchan who had just returned after delivering the message and said, "Once it s light and we confirmed it s here for now, we ll head back immediately. There's still many things waiting for us at home. As for Caesar, we need to settle this score with him properly." Dot.

Looking at the cold determination in his eyes, Su Chian knew that Linmo, who had been quietly developing and hiding his strength, was gradually revealing the true sharpness of the king of storms because of the repeated force defenses and rescues. Beneath the surface, the undercurrents never cease. And above the water, new storms are quietly brewing. Chapter 52. Counterattack.

As dawn broke over the sea, the Mo Yuan was already far from Sue Chanchchan's island, sailing on its return journey. The ship bore several fresh wounds, and the deck still carried a faint, lingering smell of blood, but the atmosphere on board was completely different from when it set sail. Exhaustion was still etched on everyone's faces, but their eyes held a heavier weight. the anger of witnessing the devastation of their allies homeland, the confidence gained from long range support and precise breakthroughs, and a profound weariness of the wings of freedom's ruthless tactics. Linmo barely slept.

He stood in the ship's deck, a nautical chart, intermittent analysis summaries transmitted by Leeway via encrypted communication, and a recent intelligence report on the trade zone compiled by Chandu Duo spread out before him. Such Chanchian leaned back in a chair nearby, taking a nap, her brows furrowing slightly even in her sleep. The method Caesar used this time were lowcost, spread quickly, and were impossible to defend against that Lin Mos finger traced on the sea chart from the location where they encountered the dragon soul to sue Chaness Island and then pointed to the area marked with abnormal energy further northeast. A single control node coupled with multiple pheromone release points can create a regional continuous beast tide harassment. This time it was Chians Island.

Next time it could be other outposts of the dragon soul or any small or medium-sized settlement that is on friendly terms with us. He has testing the waters and he has also wearing us down. Sure how said in a low voice. He has testing the actual effectiveness of this weapon and the reactions from all sides while depleting the resources and morale of potential adversaries. Moreover, I suspect he is using this harassment to cover up his real operations in the northeast.

Linimo nodded. Caesar must also know about the energy anomaly that dragon soul discovered and he might even know more. Guiding the beast tide to attack Chanchian Island can both strike at us and draw the attention of all parties, including Dragon Soul, to this victim zone, providing cover for him to explore the anomaly area in depth. It's killing multiple birds with one stone. Then we sure looked at Linmo.

Hurry up and get home. Lynmo's gaze was sharp. We need to integrate all the information we've gathered this time. the weaknesses of the controlled beast tide, the possible intelligence about the abnormal energy in the northeast, and the dragon souls intention for closer cooperation. Then we'll formulate our response.

He looked at the intelligence summary sent by Chien Duo Duo, which mentioned that several major trading points in the Freedom Wings controlled area had recently seen unusual purchases of defensive and counterattack materials such as high tenacity ropes, waterproof fire oil, and large crossbow parts, and that these purchases were being made without regard cost. At the same time, several middlemen who had secret dealings with Freedom Wings had boasted at the dinner table that a big deal is coming soon, and we're going to pull off a deal that will shut everyone up. Caesar was stockpiling supplies, preparing for a major operation. Combined with the unusual energy activity to the northeast, his target was almost obvious. Furthermore, Lyno added, "After we return, have wei prioritized two tasks.

First, based on the analysis of pherommones and core crystals, quickly develop even the most rudimentary broadspectctrum dispersant or signal jammer prototype. Complete decryption isn't necessary. Simply reducing the guiding efficiency of the beast tide is sufficient. Second, using the rune tower, attempt limited purification or reprogramming research on the captured core crystals. Even if it only disables one of them or causes it to emit a chaotic signal in reverse, it will be a significant breakthrough.

Clear. The voyage was spent in intense review and planning. When the familiar outline of Mayuin Pavilion Island and the striking faint light of the rune tower in the center of the island came into view again, it was already dusk of the second day. The dock was a hive of activity. Chin Duo Duo, who had received advanced notice, had already organized a team to welcome the ship while also maintaining perimeter security.

The Mo Yuan slowly docked and its gangway was lowered. Linmo was the first to disembark, his feet landing firmly on solid ground once more. Although he had only been away for a few days, it felt like he had gone through a long battle. Everything on the island was in perfect order. The fortifications have been clearly reinforced.

There were many figures on the watchtowers, and the air was filled with a tense atmosphere of impending action, but also with a reassuring sense of stability. Welcome home, boss. Chi and Duo Duo greeted him, his chubby face beaming with genuine joy. But there was also a hint of seriousness in his eyes. While Urani's past few days, nothing went wrong at home.

But things outside have gotten even more tense. Let's go inside and talk. Lynn Emmo patted his shoulder. The group quickly arrived at the core council chamber of the inner fortress. The soft glow of the rune tower shone through the windows, making the room exceptionally tranquil.

A subtle contrast to the barely perceptible tension outside. Leeway practically burst in carrying a pile of new scrap paper and several mineral samples shimmering with different faint lights. Boss, a breakthrough. I found three potentially effective frequency bands for pheromone interference. Although the tower's computing power, he insisted on using that term, is limited and the derivation results have significant errors, it's worth a try.

Also, we've made progress on the energization treatment of the core crystal. Using a specific frequency of energy impact combined with low temperature can accelerate the necrosis of its internal biological networks. Although it can't be reversed, it can completely turn it into a useless rock. And he spoke rapidly and fluently. Lynn Mo listened patiently and affirmed his work.

Very good. Immediately begin preparing for the physical testing of the jamming device and the safety verification of the inertia process. Just let Duo Duo know what resources you need. Leeway excitedly agreed and ran off in a flurry. Next, Chi and Duodo gave a detailed report on the island's internal affairs and external intelligence, focusing on the wings of Freedom's resource mobilization and the movements of several suspicious ships.

Shirhow then reported on the island's defense reinforcement and the emergency repair arrangements for the MOUN. Such Chian listened quietly, occasionally adding her observations about the types and behavioral details of the beast tide creatures. Her emotions had calmed down considerably, but deep in her eyes, the scars of her homeland being attacked were still clearly visible. Finally, Lynn Emmo integrated all the information and made a series of plans. One, the island is placed on level two alert, second only to direct attack.

Patrol levels are increased and the outer reconnaissance network is encrypted, paying particular attention to movements from the northeast and the wings of freedom. Second, accelerate the research on anti-beast tide technology led by Lee Wei and try to produce simple equipment that has been proven effective in small batches such as improved silent room pieces, blasting tubes, etc. Third, led by Chiandu Duo, the Mo Yuan Pavilion secretly spread the word through reliable channels that the Mo Yuan Pavilion has mastered some methods to combat the controlled beast tide, and is willing to provide limited technical advice and material support to friendly forces in order to attract allies, disrupt Caesar's deployment, and enhance their own reputation. Fourth, in a formal reply to Dragon Soul, it agreed to establish a strategic cooperation framework that includes real-time intelligence sharing, joint crisis response, and limited technology exchange and proposed to hold a highle meeting as soon as possible to discuss joint action plans targeting the Northeast Energy Anomaly Area and Wings of Freedom. V internally expedite the formulation of follow-up reinforcement plan for the storm sailboat emo yuan and initiate early material reserves and design planning for a second warship of the same class.

Caesar wants to use underhanded tactics to wear us down and disrupt the situation, making it easier for him to fish in troubled waters. Lynamo concluded, his voice clear and powerful in the quiet council hall. Then we'll do the opposite. We'll solidify our position, unite with our friends, bear our fangs, and expose what he most wants to hide to everyone. If he wants to grow his power secretly, we'll make sure everyone is watching that area, leaving him no opportunity to strike.

If he wants war, we'll fight him. But the battlefield and the timing can't be decided by him alone. Everyone solemnly accepted the order and left to carry it out. Only Linmo and Su Chanchian remained in the council hall. The afterlow of the setting sun shone through the window lattice, casting a warm hue over the rune tower's glow.

"Thank you, Lyn Mo," Su Changian said softly. "For my island, and for everyone who was forced into this. It is not just for you." Do Lin Emo shook his head, looking at the lights gradually coming on outside the window. A man like Caesar only cares about conquest and plunder. Today he might attack your island to test weapons.

And tomorrow he might destroy anyone else home for resources. Fighting him is not just about revenge or self-preservation, but about ensuring that this sea area can still have a place where people can reason, have principles, and live in pea. He turned to look at Sue Chian. Besides, we now have the ability to do some things. The title of King of Storms isn't given lightly.

Looking at his resolute profile outlined by the setting sun, Su Chanchian felt the bewilderment and gloom in her heart caused by the attack on their homeland gradually dissipate in the calm and powerful aura emanating from him. She walked to his side and together they gazed out the window at the territory that was being shrouded in twilight, yet teeming with life thanks to the countless lights and rune tower glow. M. She responded softly, her voice low, but carrying the same firmness. The returning ships have entered port, but a new journey has already begun.

The hidden blades have been revealed, while the storm in the open is slowly taking shape. Chapter 53. The Omen from the heart of the tower. 7 days after the rune tower was completed, Leeway finally dragged himself out of the top floor research room, which was filled with strange energy and the smell of straw paper. His steps were unsteady and he had heavy bags under his eyes, but he was tightly clutching a thick roll of blueprints tied with fishkin rope in his hand.

His face had a strange expression that mixed with great fatigue and excitement as he headed straight for the inner fortress workshop area where Lin Mo was. Lynn and Mo and sure how were inspecting a new batch of trial produced sound blasting tubes. These improved bamboo tubes had thin iron plates lining their inner walls were filled with more evenly distributed gunpowder and sharp fragments of pottery. And the fuses were waterproofed, making them significantly more powerful than the previous homemade versions. Boss, major discovery.

It's not a jammer nor an inertization process. Leewi's voice was extremely penetrating, drawing the attention of the surrounding craftsman. It's a rune tower. I've created a predictive model by combining the tower's own detection array with the ocean energy fluctuation data provided by Miss Sue as well as some environmental energy characteristics that I deduced from those pherommones. Lynn Mo way for the craftsman to continue then ledly way to a relatively quiet area where materials were stored.

What predictive model? The weather or rather a large-scale periodic disturbance of environmental energy. Leeway eagerly unfolded the drawings which were filled with complex curves, waveforms, and dense annotations. Look here. This is the free energy reading curve of the environment around the island recorded by the rune tower over the past 30 days. And look at these mark points.

These are the several obvious weather changes we experienced the first storm, the subsequent continuous sunny days, the brief period of muggy weather, and the unusually cold and foggy sea fog we encountered a few days ago on our return voyage. Dot. He traced the curve with his finger. Did you notice the pattern? About 36 to 48 hours before each drastic weather change, the activity and chaos indicators of environmental free energy show a gradual increase followed by a rapid rise reaching their peak simultaneously with a weather change and then quickly declining. And for different weather types, the slope of the rising curve and the energy color, this is how the towers detection array distinguishes different energy characteristics, which I'll call it for now, show subtle but identifiable differences.

Linmo carefully examined the curves. Although he couldn't understand the specific parameters, the correlation between the key turning points marked by Leewi and the timing of weather events was indeed clear. You mean the rune tower can provide early weather warnings by monitoring changes in environmental energy? It has more than just an early warning. Leeway excitedly pointed to another set of comparison images. This is data on subtle changes in water energy recorded by Miss Sue.

Since by the heart of the ocean before large-scale anomalies in marine life after overlaying and analyzing it with atmospheric energy changes recorded by the tower, I found that they are linked. Moreover, atmospheric energy changes came first. In other words, it is very likely that some kind of periodic energy disturbance in the atmosphere first affected the energy field of the large-scale marine environment, thereby inducing abnormal behavior in marine life. The pherommones used by Caesar were likely just a targeted and malicious amplification and guidance based on this natural background disturbance. This deduction made Lin Mo and sure how beside him both tents.

If this were true, then the so-called controlled beast tide was not merely a technological weapon of the wings of freedom, but a malicious exploitation of some natural law. This explained why the beast tide could affect such a wide area and also meant that this threat might be periodic. Can you predict the next large-scale background disturbance? What is the specific time and what are the possible types of impacts? Lynn Emmo immediately grasped the key question. That's the significance of the model. Leeway pulled out a newly drawn chart showing an upward sloping curve extrapolated from existing data.

According to the model's calculations, the next large-scale environmental energy disturbance is likely to occur in 15 to 20 days. Based on the shape of the rising curve and preliminary energy color characteristics, this disturbance leans towards low temperature and stagnation attributes. Combining this with basic climate knowledge is highly likely to be a large-scale cold wave accompanied by strong winds and widespread temperature drops. A cold wave, sure, how gasped. If a large-scale cold wave really comes at this time of year, the seam may freeze over, making it difficult for ships to move.

Heating and food preservation will become major problems. Many small and medium-sized islands simply cannot withstand it. Leeway nodded emphatically. Moreover, if Caesar had a similar predictive method, he might have detected it even earlier than us. He could have used pherommones to drive away or gather certain coldresistant sea creatures before the cold wave arrived and then launched a targeted attack when the cold wave was at its most intense and everyone was preoccupied with their own survival.

Or he could have simply used the cold wave itself as a weapon to strike those unprepared forces. Lynn Emo silently tapped the wood beside him with his fingers. A chill seemed to creep up his spine before he knew it. He hadn't been unaware of the threat of extreme weather, but he had always considered it an unpredictable natural risk. If he could foresee it 10 or 20 days in advance, the significance would be entirely different.

This is no longer a simple survival challenge, but a bargaining chip in a strategic game. What is the accuracy of this prediction? What conditions are needed for the model to be continuously improved and validated? Lyn Mo asked quickly. Currently, the data sample is too small, and I estimate the accuracy to be at most 60%. But as long as we can continuously record future weather changes and energy data, the model will self-correct and the accuracy will improve rapidly, Leeway replied. The rune tower s detection array is key.

It provides energy readings that are more precise and stable than any of our previous instruments. Miss Sue heart of the ocean sensing data is an important auxiliary verification. In addition, if we can deploy some simple energy reading collection points in a wider sea area, even if it s just sending people to measure them periodically, it can greatly expand the model s data sources and prediction range. Dot. Lenmo pondered gathering point.

This requires reliable manpower and a safe flight path which the current coverage area of the Moanon Pavilion cannot yet provide. But Dragon Soul might be a viable option. Leeway immediately compile a detailed report including the model's principles, prediction basis, possible errors, and improvement needs. Raise the encryption level to the highest level. Lynn Mo ordered.

Sure, how notify Chin Duo Duo and Chian to come over. We have new strategic issues to discuss. Half an hour later, the core members gathered again in the council chamber. Lynn Emmo succinctly conveyed Lee Wei's findings and predictions. Upon hearing this, Chindwood was small eyes immediately narrowed into slits.

Knowing about the cold wave in advance, good heavens, that's a huge business opportunity, a huge strategic advantage if we stockpile warm clothing, fuel, and durable food in advance. It's not just about hoarding, Su Changian said softly, carefully examining the energy curve drawn by Leewi, lost in thought. If the cold wave is as predicted, many fish from tempered areas will migrate to warmer waters or enter deeper waters to hibernate. Coastal catches will plummet. Some temperature sensitive seaweed and shellfish may die off in large numbers.

This will trigger a chain reaction. For Caesar, this is both an opportunity and a risk. Sure, how analyzed. He may use the cold wave to strike his opponents, but the cold wave will also affect his ship maneuvers and supply lines. If he is indeed planning a major operation in the region of abnormal energy in the northeast, the cold wave may disrupt his schedule or force him to take risks ahead of schedule.

Da. Therefore, our strategy needs to be implemented in several steps. Lynn Emo summarized his gaze sweeping over everyone. First leeway, your team must do everything in its power to ensure the continuous and stable operation of the rune tower detection array and constantly improve the prediction model. At the same time, based on the prediction of low temperature stagnation, immediately begin to study targeted protection or mitigation measures such as how to keep important facilities running during cold waves, how to prevent water pipes from freezing and bursting, and how to ensure the production of green houses if any.

Second, Chindo Duo. Utilize all our commercial channels and inventory to secretly, discreetly, and in batches acquire and stockpile the following materials. All types of fur, down, and thick fabrics: charcoal, fuel oil, and any fuel that can burn stably, high calorie, long-lasting grains, and dried meat, and herb for treating frostbite and colds. Be careful with your methods to avoid causing significant market fluctuations or suspicion. At the same time, we can appropriately increase the production of our existing thermal products such as the warmstone imitations we sold during the previous extreme cold weather, but temporarily keep them in stock.

Third, sure how, immediately add an extreme cold wave response module to the island defense plan. Check the windproof and heat insulation performance of all buildings and ensure that watchtowwers and important outposts have heating points. Develop antifreeze protection and emergency deployment plans for ships such as the yuon in low temperature environments. Strengthen the fire prevention and anti- theft anti-robery levels of fuel and grain warehouses. Fourth, Linmo looked at Sue Chanchan.

Chian, I need you to cooperate with Leeway and use your abilities to continuously monitor subtle changes in the marine environment and cross validate them with the data from the tower. At the same time, think about which marine biological resources might be relatively stable or usable if your island were to face such a cold wave. We need to prepare some survival advice for a wider range of allies. Fifth, and most importantly, Lynn Mo's tone turns somber. The strategic cooperation with Dragon Soul needs to be accelerated.

This cold wave forecast can serve as an important bargaining chip for us to demonstrate our sincerity and value. We need to share some forecast information. Not all of it, of course, in exchange for their cooperation in deploying energy monitoring points in a wider sea area and to reach a deeper agreement on military cooperation in the event of a potential crisis created by Caesar using the cold wave. He stood up, walked to the window, and gazed at the rune tower that quietly emitted a faint glow in the night. This time, we must weave a protective net and prepare an icebreaking ax before the storm truly arrives.

Caesar wants to use the opportune moment to harm us. So, we must turn this opportune moment into our advantageous location and harmonious relationships. A cold wave is coming. He turned around, his eyes sharp as knives in the lamplight, and we must be the first to put on our winter clothes and be ready to face the wind and snow. Dot.

Chapter 54. Alliance and cold edge. On the morning of the third day, as agreed, the Dragon Souls envoy appeared precisely on the horizon southeast of Mayu Pavilion Island. It was a well-maintained, medium-sized warship with strong lines. Its dragon pattern flag fluttering in the seab breeze.

It didn't approach rashly, but instead stopped outside the warning line, raising signal flags to identify itself and its purpose. Cautious and courteous, standing on a watchtower of the main island, Linmo looked at the ship and said to sure how beside him, send a speedboat to guide it directly to port number two. Have Chin Duo Duo receive it there. according to the previously agreed second level ally etiquette. Understood.

Sure, how nodded. Then asked, "Boss, are you really planning to share part of the cold wave forecast information? Isn't that too risky? Share a part in exchange for more." Lin MOS gaze was calm. Relying solely on our own monitoring points, the range and accuracy of our predictions are limited. Dragon Soul has a wider sphere of influence and manpower. We need their data to improve our model so that we can more accurately judge Caesar as possible movements.

Moreover, by throwing out this bait, we can also show them our value and sincerity, paving the way for deeper cooperation. What about Caesar's side? Caesar one TB idle at Lynn Mo turned to the north of the island in the direction of the wings of freedom mass controlled area. He has also preparing. We predicted the cold wave, but he might have detected it through other means. This cold wave is a test and an opportunity for everyone.

It all depends on who is better prepared and who acts more decisively. Dot. The speedboat led the Dragon Souls envoy ships slowly into port number two, which was surrounded by reefs and newly built watchtowers. The dock area had been cleared out and she and Duod Duo accompanied by several neatly dressed compared to the others on the island assistants with professional smiles on their faces went to greet them. Allighting from the Dragon Soul ship were Xiao Ji Gang and two other men who appeared to be an agitant and a civilian employee.

After a brief exchange of pleasantries at the dock, they headed towards the council hall in the inner fortress district led by Chiandu Duo. Along the way, Xiao Ji Gangs sharp gaze swept over the island's well-organized fortifications, the busy but not panicked residents, and a rune tower in the distance that was clearly different from ordinary buildings, his eyes occasionally flashing with amazement. Inside the council chamber, Lyno was already waiting. He had changed into a clean, dark-colored cloth robe without much adorement, but his demeanor was composed. Su Chanchian and Leewi were also present.

Captain Xiao, welcome. Lin Emo stood up to greet him. Lord Lin Mo, I apologize for disturbing you. Xiao Ji Gang cupped his hands, his posture neither humble nor arrogant. I haven't had a chance to formally thank you for our battle last time.

I've been ordered to come here to discuss cooperation matters. After both sides took their seats without much formality, they quickly got down to business. Xiao Ji Gang representing the senior management of Dragon Soul first formally expressed the desire to establish a comprehensive strategic cooperative relationship with Mo Yuan Pavilion and proposed a preliminary draft cooperation framework covering multiple aspects such as intelligence sharing military coordination nondirect command technical exchange to a limited extent and joint crisis response. Lynn Mo listened carefully but did not immediately respond to the content of the draft. Instead, he gestured to Leewi.

Leewi Ching cleared his throat, stood up, and showed Xiao Ji Gang and the others several pre-prepared simplified charts. The core algorithm and specific data of the rune tower were hidden. He tried to explain the potential correlation between periodic disturbances in environmental energy and large-scale weather changes in plain language and based on existing models pointed out the high probability of a major weather anomaly with biased low temperature stagnation attributes occurring in the next 15 to 20 days. This means that a potentially regional and significant cold wave is brewing. Leewi concluded his voice slightly with tension.

If not handled properly, it will cause serious losses and if it is exploited by malicious individuals, the consequences will be unimaginable. Xiao Ji Gang and his agitants listened, their faces turning grave. Their civilian staff quickly took notes. As a large organization that had struggled in the survival world for so long, they were all too aware of the destructive power of extreme weather. Lord Lan Mo, this intelligence is extremely important.

Xiao Ji Gang said in a deep voice, "I wonder what your side thinks of it." Weve made some progress through special observation methods and data analysis, Linmo said casually, but our monitoring range is limited and our prediction accuracy needs to be improved. This is one of the reasons why we hope to cooperate more deeply with you. Dragon Soul has a wider reach. And if we can share some basic environmental observation data for specific sea areas, such as regular changes in water temperature, air pressure, and ocean currents, perhaps we can work together to make early warnings earlier and more accurate. Xiao Ji Gang exchanged glances with his two agitants.

One of whom, a man who appeared to be in a clerical position, spoke quickly and in a low voice. Xiao Ji Gang nodded and turned to Lin Mo. Since you were so frank, we will be frank with you as well. Dragon Soul does indeed have meteorological and ocean current observation points in several key sea areas and the data can be shared. Moreover, we can coordinate more manpower to strengthen the monitoring of the energy anomaly area in the northeast.

In exchange, we hope that you can provide similar meteorological early warning analysis regularly and also exchange information on cold wave response technology to a certain extent. Sure. Lynn Mo readily agreed. We can share early warning analyses regularly. In terms of technical exchanges, we can provide some basic cold wave protection plans and material reserve suggestions.

In addition, regarding concerns that the Wings of Freedom might use such natural disasters to launch attacks, I suggest that we establish a direct communication and rapid response channel in case of emergency. Dot. That's exactly what I was thinking. Xiao Ji Gang's spirits lifted. The specific details can be discussed and finalized by our subordinates.

In addition, we have recently received some scattered but alarming intelligence regarding Wings of Freedom. He gestured for his agitant to report. The agitant produced a briefing. According to our intelligence personnel and external intelligence, the Wings of Freedom have been frequently mobilizing their elite ships over the past week, converging on a forward base code named iceclaw on the northeastern edge of their controlled area. Simultaneously, they have been acquiring large quantities of antifreeze, lubricating grease, high-grade antifreeze used in certain precision machinery, low temperature explosives, and closed body diving suit blueprints or finished products through the black market in several underground channels.

The scale of their acquisitions far exceeds what is normally required for cold weather preparedness. Lynn Mo lightly tapped his fingers on the table, focusing on antifreeze, diving, and demolition. These supplies were highly targeted and combined with the energy anomaly in the northeast and the potential cold wave. Caesar's intentions were almost obvious he planned to conduct underwater or sub ice exploration/ operations in that anomalous area during or around the time of the cold wave. It seems Caesar has also set his sights on that area and is wellprepared even taking advantage of the cold wave.

Lynamo said slowly. Captain Xiao, how much do you know about that area with the abnormal energy? Xiao Ji Gang pondered for a moment. Our intelligence is incomplete. We only know that the underwater topography in that area is extremely complex with suspected large seabed structures and the energy readings fluctuate, occasionally interfering with ship compasses and communications. We sent a small submarine, a modified pressure vessel, to try to get closer for reconnaissance, but it was driven back by strong turbulence and unusually active deep sea creatures on the periphery.

It's very dangerous there. If Caesar really dares to force his way in during the cold wave, he's either crazy or he has some trump card that we don't know about. Lyn Mo thought of the unknown trump card. The monstrous technology that combined biological and energy elements, the mysterious mentor and the Stonemason's brotherhood. Behind Caesar, the waters run deep.

No matter what, we can't let him succeed so easily. Lin Mo's tone turned cold. If there's really something in that area, it would be a disaster for everyone if it fell into the hands of someone like Caesar. Captain Xiao, we might be able to draft a preliminary coordination plan for jointly containing wings of Freedom's operation. In the following period, the two sides held in-depth consultations on matters such as real-time intelligence sharing, deterrent patrols around the crutch base, and the establishment of joint observation posts near abnormal areas, and finalized the general principles and communication mechanisms.

The talks concluded in the afternoon. The two sides reached a deeper and more substantial cooperation agreement than expected. Xiao Ji Gang was clearly very satisfied with the outcome of the talks. Before leaving, he shook Lin Mos hand and solemnly said, "Lord Lin Mo, Dragon Soul has shown great sincerity in this cooperation. We hope that we can join hands to establish proper order in this sea area and curb their insane ambitions.

This is also what Emo Yuan Pavilion wishes for," Lin Mo replied. After seeing off the Dragon Soul Envoy ship, Lin Emo immediately summoned the core members. "The alliance has been established, but the real test has only just begun." Lyn Mos gaze swept over everyone. Caesar is gathering at Iceclaw, targeting the anomalous region in the northeast. A cold wave is approaching, and he must have something to rely on by choosing this time.

Su Chian frowned slightly, looked towards the northeast, and whispered.

When Captain Xiao and the others mentioned ice claws and the anomalous area just now, my heart suddenly skipped a beat. It felt like something cold in the deeper sea had been disturbed. It was a very uncomfortable feeling. Lynn Mo's heart tightened. Suchanians premonition was never unfounded.

He looked out the window. The sky seemed even darker than before. The sea breeze brought a more pronounced chill. The ink of the Covenant was barely dry when the cold front silently approached. And deep beneath the sea, the secrets coveted by ambition seemed to begin to stir restlessly.

The Storm King's gaze once again fell upon the unknown icy sea. This time he would not merely be on the defensive. Chapter 55. Building a city to keep out the cold. The Dragon Souls envoy took away the Covenant, leaving behind a heavy responsibility and an increasingly urgent timetable.

The island of Moyuan did not relax after the conclusion of important diplomatic activities. On the contrary, like a tightly wound precision machine, it operated with even greater efficiency under the leadership of its respective officials. However, unlike the tension when dealing with an imminent attack, this busyiness carried a sense of certainty and preparedness. Lynn Mo spent an entire day accompanied by Sherh How and several workshop leaders meticulously inspecting the adjustments made to defenses and production throughout the island. They first went to the cliff area facing the sea to the east.

Here a semi-encclosed wind fortress was being built on the site of an existing watchtower. The structure was mainly made of stone and wood utilizing a natural cliff face and newly built walls to block the fierce northeast winds. The interior was designed with spaces for fireplaces for heating and observation holes to ensure that the centuries could still perform their duties without suffering from hypothermia in extremely cold and windy weather. The craftsmen chanting in unison used pulley systems to lift heavy stone blocks and carefully laid them together. The clanging and hammering sounds carried far on the sea breeze.

According to engineer Le's worst case scenario calculation, the wind force on the sea surface may reach level eight or above during the cold wave accompanied by freezing rain or ice pellets. These wind forts must be able to withstand that environment and ensure that the people inside can survive. Dashure how pointed to a roof structure that was being reinforced. We used double- layered wooden boards with dried seaweed and clay sandwiched in between which provides insulation and wind protection. The windows are small and are double-sealed with thick oil paper and movable wooden boards.

Lenmo reached out and touched the thickness of the wall. Then looked at the sturdy base connecting to the cliff and nodded. What about fuel reserves? Each point needs to guarantee at least 7 days of uninterrupted heating. Charcoal and durable compressed Pete cakes are already being transported to the various outposts. In addition, manager Chien has obtained a batch of whale blubber, which can be used to make long-lasting oil lamps.

The light is weak, but the heat is longlasting for emergency use. The logistics foreman quickly replied. Leaving the cliff, they turned towards the inland supply depot area. It was busier than ever with several newly constructed semi underground warehouses taking shape. People were carrying bundles of furs, sacks of grain, jars of cured meat and dried fish, and medicines tightly wrapped in oil cloth, continuously transporting them in.

Chin duo duo spun around between the warehouses like a top, holding a list and occasionally giving loud instructions or quietly checking documents. Boss. Upon seeing Lynn and Mo, Chindu Duo wiped his sweat and ran over. The fur purchase went more smoothly than expected. Several small hunting camps in the north had a lot of stockpiled fur which we traded for with iron wear, salt, and some grain at a fair price.

Grain is a bit of a problem. Most of the coarse grains circulating in a market were bought up by us and a few other vendors. And the price of fine grains has increased by 30%. So I haven't followed suit yet. As for fuel, we've stockpiled a lot of charcoal, but we still don't have enough of Pete and whale oil, which burn longer.

I've already sent people to scout out the black swamp further away. They say there are good pete layers there. We don't need to force the supply of refined grains. Just make sure there's enough coarse grains and durable potatoes and dried meat. Prioritize fuel supplies for outposts, workshops, medical points, and core residential areas.

Lenmo looked at the bustling crowd. Check the warehouses for moisture and fire prevention. Again, if there's a large temperature difference between indoors and outdoors during a cold wave, condensation will also be a problem. Understood? Lime has been added to each warehouse to absorb moisture, and the ventilation openings have been designed to prevent rain and snow from flowing back in. Chindo Duo assured him, patting his chest.

The final stop on the inspection tour was the workshops and rune tower in the core area. Inside the workshops, furnaces roared and the sounds of hammering filled the air. Under Leewayi's guidance, craftsmen were undertaking final anti-reeze modifications to the MOU on applying special antifreeze grease to key mechanical components, filling any shrinkage gaps in the whole planks with a mixture of hair and adhesive, and creating antireeze covers for weapons such as crossbows. Another group was mass-producing Leeway's simple heater, essentially a modified brazier with added flu and radiators. the rudimentary.

It improved thermal efficiency and safety. Inside the rune tower, the atmosphere was quiet and focused. Su Chanchian sat on a cushion beside the central array, her eyes closed in concentration. She wasn't using combat perception, but rather a gentler, more continuous listening, sensing the slow, steady changes in the ocean's energy background and corroborating them with the detailed data streams recorded on the tower. Leeway along with his two most astute apprentices stood around several newly installed stone slabs engraved with intricate patterns.

Several secondary energy storage crystals were embedded in the slabs, their light flickering slowly according to a certain pattern, projecting simplified energy readings into the air. The tower's harmonic analysis function is even more powerful than I thought. Seeing Lynn Mo enter, Leeway excitedly lowered his voice. It can not only record the quantity and activity of environmental energy but also analyze its frequency composition. Look, the specific low frequency band representing the low temperature stagnation characteristic has increased in intensity by 15% in the past 48 hours and the rise curve is getting steeper and steeper.

The first batch of peripheral data shared by Dragon Soul also shows that the surface temperature of a sea has dropped by nearly 2Â° at several observation points about 500 nautical miles to the northeast. The cold wave may arrive a little faster than we initially predicted and its intensity may also be greater. Linmo walked to the stone slab looking at the abstract yet clearly defined ripples. Can be accurate to the day? Leeway leaned closer and pointed to a slowly rising curve. Based on this acceleration, I estimate that a large-scale cooling and strong wind will likely begin in 12 to 14 days.

But the vanguard such as sudden strong winds and sporadic freezing rain may affect our outer sea areas in 7 or 8 days. Lynn Emmo silently calculated in his mind that it would take 12 to 14 days. Time was tighter than he had hoped. Is the data integration with Dragon Soul going smoothly? he asked. Successfully.

They're using a similar bassband communication crystal as us, although the encoding method is different, but the tower can decode it. Emerging from the rune tower. Dusk was approaching. The sea breeze carried a noticeable chill stinging his face. Lynmo didn't return to the council hall, but strolled to a relatively flat beach on the southern side of the island. Far from the main fortifications and docks, it was quieter.

The first flame that refused to be extinguished in the shadows of the icy sea. Chapter 57. A conspiracy in the cold night. As the night deepened, the faint light of the rune tower became the most conspicuous lighthouse on the island. Look here, he said, pointing with his bone pin to the area of sea to the northeast that was highlighted. And according to our revised model, a large scale and drastic cooling and strong winds will fully erupt within 3 to 5 days after that dot. This means that if Caesar really wants to take action there, his best window of opportunity is likely during the period when the energy front passes, but before the full-blown cold wave arrives. Sea conditions will begin to deteriorate, but not to the point of being completely unnavigable. But beneath the tower that emitted a faint glow amidst the patrolling fire light, and in the hearts of everyone silently preparing for the approaching storm, something more resilient than the chill was quietly growing and coalescing. That was determination and also unwavering support. When the shadow of the ICC loomed, they became each other's most reliable bullwork and beacon of light. Chapter 58. analysis of ice traces.

The trace metal residue collected by the Dragon Soul Outpost team was carefully sealed in a small bone box lined with lead foil and sent to Leeway along with a parchment scroll filled with instructions. For the next two days, Leeway practically locked himself in a specially cleaned and reinforced isolation analysis room at the bottom of the rune tower. This place, originally intended for the safe handling of dangerous energy materials, had now become a temporary microscopic analysis field. Dressed in multiple layers of protective gear and wearing goggles made from polished crystal plates and leather, he used the stable energy flow guided from the rune tower to power several intricate yet crude tools. A etched needle polish from the hard to see monster teeth.

An observation mirror that could magnify 30 times with lenses made of stacked crystals of different purities and a simple elemental tendency test panel that used temperature differences and energy conducting powder for development. The process was tedious and slow, requiring immense patience and absolute composure. The two apprentices could only stay in the outer room, responsible for recording and passing items, barely daring to breathe. On the morning of the third day, Lee Wai dragged his exhausted but excited body out of the isolation room, holding several pieces of fishkin paper covered with symbols and hastily drawn conclusions. It's not any conventional alloy we know of.

His first words to Linmo were resounding. The structure of the residue is extremely unique. It wasn't forged or cast. Rather, it seems to be a composite structure formed by the spontaneous arrangement and combination of several base metals under a specific energy environment through some kind of growth or deposition process. Lynn Emo took the fishkin paper.

Besides the text, it also contains sketches of strange yet regular microscopic structures observed under microscope. Can you figure out its purpose? Or is it related to those oddly patterned metal tubes of the Krampens? There a strong correlation. Leeway affirmed. Although the residue is too small to fully reproduce the macroscopic form, its crystal arrangement is similar to the control network of the bioengy hybrid crystal I analyzed before. In terms of energy guidance, both emphasize forced guidance and resonance under unnatural conditions.

I speculate that these metallic residues are likely peeled off from the surface of some larger device or component used to operate stably and transmit specific energy signals in extreme environments such as deep sea high pressure and low temperature. Those strange patterns may not be decorations, but rather some kind of energy circuit or resonance pattern. He took a breath and pointed to the complex formulas on another sheet of paper. More importantly, I detected an extremely faint but very stable trace of an energy inert coating in the residue. This coating can effectively resist metal embritment and energy dissipation under low temperature conditions.

This is not a technology we can easily develop at this stage of survival. There must be a force with more advanced materials science knowledge supporting Caesar. Then Montac frowned deeply. Technological gap. This was the most troublesome problem.

You could compensate for a numerical disadvantage with courage and wisdom, but lagging behind in basic materials and energy applications often meant absolute passivity on the battlefield. Can you deduce the composition or preparation principle of this coding? Even just a clue, Lynn Mo asked. Leeway smiled Riley and shook his head. It's too difficult. The residual amount is too small, and the accuracy of the tower's energy analysis is also limited.

I can only confirm that it contains a few rare mineral elements, but I have no clue about the specific proportions and synthesis process. It's like seeing a piece of refined steel and knowing that it is 100 times stronger than pig iron, but not knowing how to build a blast furnace or how to control the temperature. Although he had expected it, Lynmo's heart still sank slightly. However, he quickly composed himself. At least now they had a clearer understanding of the gap between them and one of Caesar's strengths.

Thank you for your hard work, Leeway. Compile these analysis results into a report and raise the encryption level to the highest level. Also, try to design a simple device that can interfere with or pollute the resonant pattern of this metal based on its energy conduction properties. It doesn't need to be completely destroyed. Even just causing a brief signal disturbance would be helpful.

I'll give a try. Leeway's eyes rekindled with fighting spirit. As long as the principle is similar, there's a possibility of interference. I need more data on that bio energy hybrid crystal. Go find Chan.

She has more detailed perception records. Leeway left in a hurry. Linmo carrying the report went to Chandwood's place where she was rechecking the list of supplies. Chandu Duo had just finished a transaction with another group of fur merchants and was calculating the types and quantities of furs to be put into storage. Upon seeing Lynn Mo, he immediately put down what he was doing.

Boss, is there any news about Engineerly? Lynn Emmo handed him the report and briefly explained the situation. Chindwood was chubby face also turned serious. There's definitely something fishy going on. I don't know much about the technical aspects, but if that's the case, the tools Caesar prepared this time are probably more professional and dangerous than we thought. Conventional sabotage methods may have limited effectiveness.

That s right lin mo n n n n n n n n n n n n n n n n n n n nodded. Therefore, our previous strategy needs to be slightly adjusted. Dot Chi and Woodw's eyes lit up. Understood. Mix the truth with the lies. Make him suspicious and distracted. I'll get right on it.

Leaving the warehouse area, Linmo found Sue Chian and Sherhow on the beach who were instructing the special operations reserve team on ice water acclimatization training. The training ground was created by artificially splashing water and freezing it in a sheltered shallow bay. The temperature was extremely low and the team members wearing speciallymade thick rubber suits were practicing walking on the ice, icebreaking diving and the use of weapons in low temperature environments. Upon seeing Lin Mo, Sue Chian walked over. Her cheeks were slightly red from the cold wind, but she looked to be in good spirits.

Sue Chanchian closed her eyes, stood still for a moment, and carefully sensed it. The restlessness is continuing to increase, and the area is also expanding.

Many fish that originally lived in warmer waters are migrating to deeper or more southerntherly directions and the gaps they leave behind are being filled by some coldresistant and more aggressive species. In addition, I can feel that the pressure in the deep water layer to the northeast is changing with a feeling of being slowly emptied and filled, which is very subtle but not normal. Emptying and then filling. Then Mo pondered, "It's like some kind of large-scale periodic energy exchange or material cycle. It has somewhat similar but more deliberate." Sue Chanchian search for the right words.

A cold wind swept across the training field, carrying ice shards that stung people's faces. The cry of the IC. On the evening of the third day, after Leeway locked himself in the rune tower, the door to the isolation analysis room finally opened again. He emerged looking even more disheveled than before. His hair a tangled mess, his eyes sunken, and his lips chapped from dehydration. Yet behind his thick crystal lenses, his eyes burned with an almost obsessive excitement.

In his hand, instead of fish paper, he held a palm-sized dark gray metal disc covered with fine engravings. Linmo was discussing the final stage of the special operations reserve team's training plan with Sher How and Su Chanchian when they saw Leewi's appearance and stopped talking. Leewi, you su Chian looked at him with some concern. I'm fine, just a little sleep-deprived. Leewi's voice was horsearo, but it was filled with barely suppressed excitement.

Boss, look at this. He carefully placed a metal disc on the table. The disc looks unremarkable, as if it were roughly cast and polished from some kind of alloy. The engravings on its surface vary in depth and seem to be arranged randomly. However, upon closer inspection, one can see that the bottom of the engravings is filled with extremely fine, slightly darker color material.

This is Lynn Mo and Mo examined it carefully based on the energy guiding characteristics of that metal residue. I designed a prototype of a resonance contaminant. Leeway almost danced with excitement. The principle is very simple. It does not emit strong signals itself.

But when it detects a highintensity resonant wave in a specific frequency band that is of the same origin as the energy characteristics of that metal, it automatically excites several preset chaotic resonant modules inside, releasing a very short but highly disordered interference ripple into the surrounding space. He pointed to several inconspicuous small indentations in the center of the disc. These are filled with a response medium that I'm modulated using blue veneer powder and several energy conducting minerals. Once the target resonance is sensed, it will be activated. The surrounding grooves are energy conducting circuits.

Although rough, they are enough to diffuse the chaotic fluctuations. I estimate the effective range to be at most 10 to 15 m in radius. And the duration may only be two or three seconds, but as long as we can seize the critical moment, it can disrupt the normal operation of the Caesar equipment, even if only for a brief moment. Lynn Mo continued, a glint of light in his eyes. Even if it is just causing a critical command transmission to fail or causing a precision device to malfunction briefly, it could create an opportunity.

Dot. Yes, that's exactly what I mean. libei. Moreover, this thing has extremely low energy consumption. It can maintain standby by relying on the meager environmental energy it stores.

It only consumes energy from the response medium when it is triggered. After being triggered, it needs to be recharged and the medium replaced before it can be used again. It is a disposable item, but the production cost is not high. Sherhow picked up the disc, weigh it in his hand, and examined the engravings closely. How do you use this? You can't exactly swim to the bottom of the other ship and stick it on, can you? There are two uses that Leeway had clearly already considered it.

One is delivery. We'll l make a waterproof shell and find a way to throw or place it near the target. For example, by firing it with a crossbow or having it carried and placed by a diver. The sailors had to take turns using speciallymade wooden mallets and scrapers to promptly clear the ice from the hole.
