their light rams slamming into the sides of two other enemy ships that were trying to turn or escape. Although they did not cause serious damage, they successfully delayed their movements. Bart sure how gave the order and several grappling hooks and gang planks were lowered from the side of the Mo Yuon ship. The special forces members and elite sailors who were already prepared swept across the cold sea like tigers descending a mountain and pounced on the two heavily damaged enemy ships. Ziao Tai and Lu Fong each led a team, and their movements were swift and decisive.

The battle erupted suddenly and fiercely, but ended just as quickly. The wings of Freedom's patrol fleet clearly hadn't anticipated encountering an enemy of such size and strength, much less the decisiveness and ruthlessness of their attack. The two crippled ships were quickly brought under control, and the sailors resisting on deck were either subdued or forced into the sea. The other two ships, though attempting to fight back and escape, were also quickly boarded under the sustained threat of the Inc. Abyss's Ballisty and the close quarters combat of the Flying Fish and Wavebreaker.

In less than half an hour, all four enemy ships sank. The Mo Yuan Pavilion side suffered only a few minor injuries. Some debris and corpses floated on the sea, quickly covered by ice flows and snowflakes. Sherhow personally interrogated several of the captured leaders. Their testimonies confirmed his earlier suspicions.

They were indeed an outer patrol sent by Caesar tasked with blocking the waterway and intercepting any ships attempting to approach the northeast, especially Dragon Souls reconnaissance forces. They belonged to the second echelon's rear guard and knew very little about the first echelon's specific mission and location, only that the adults had taken the divine artifact deeper into the water to open the great gate. Lyn Mo pondered the word door, his ominous premonition growing stronger. They also mentioned that in the past 2 days, the sea creatures in this area have suddenly become more aggressive and they have already lost several small boats. Sherhow added, "This should be the result of the combined effects of residual pherommones and energy disturbances.

Deal with the prisoners, collect useful supplies, tow the ship behind the iceberg, and hide it. Prepare for it to sink," Lin and Mo ordered. "We can't carry any burdens, nor can we leave any obvious traces." After clearing the battlefield, the fleet set sail again. Although the encounter went smoothly, it served as a wake-up call for everyone. Caesar's blockade was more stringent than anticipated, and the closer they got to his core area, the greater the resistance they would encounter.

The wind and snow continued, and visibility showed no improvement. The Mo Yuan continued its journey northeastward along a relatively safe gap marked on the newly captured nautical chart. Suchians senses remained highly alert. She had to be wary of potential sea monsters and enemy ships while also trying to penetrate the chaotic energy field to search for the ancient fluctuations and the trail of Caesar's main force. Lynn and Mo stood before the observation window, gazing at the vast, white, and perilous world outside.

The first battle was a victory, but it was merely a trivial opening act in this icy struggle. The real challenge lies beneath the surface of the deep sea, shrouded in blizzards and unknown energies. He must lead his ship and crew through it all to find that crucial point. A point that might determine the fate of countless people. Chapter 62.

The shadow of deep dive. After clearing away the remnants of a skirmish, the Mo Yuan fleet continued its journey northeastward into the sea shrouded in energy and mystery amidst the increasingly violent blizzard. The speed of the voyage had to be reduced again. The ice flows on the sea were no longer scattered fragments, but large jagged ice flows, some even comparable to small reefs. The seawater had become viscous and murky, its color and ominous dark gray green with a layer of fine ice crystals floating on the surface.

The sky seemed to be perpetually covered by thick, letting gray clouds, the sunlight dim, making it impossible to distinguish between day and dusk. Only the gale, whipping up snow and ice shards, howled endlessly, lashing the hall and emitting a shrill cry like the whales of a vengeful ghost. The temperature inside the bridge had dropped to a level that required wearing all thick clothing to endure, even with the heating pipes. A thick layer of frost had formed on the observation windows, requiring constant scraping with a special scraper to clear away small patches of ice. Linmo, Sue Chian, and Shurehow took turns guarding the windows, struggling to navigate the icy maze with only their naked eyes and the limited field of vision of their telescopes.

Such Chanchian bore the heaviest burden, she maintained a near constant state of heightened awareness, like a faint lantern flickering in a blizzard, striving to penetrate both physical and energetic barriers to provide early warnings for the fleet. Her complexion worsened, shadows deepened under her eyes, and she would occasionally tremble slightly uncontrollably, a sign of excessive mental strain. Lyn Mo urged her to rest several times. But she simply shook her head, drank some heated sugar salt water, and closed her eyes again. Straight ahead, 15Â° to the right, about 500 meters away, there's a large group of reefs underwater, extending over a wide area.

We must detour that her voice was tired and horsearo. The detour route to the left is relatively clean, but I feel there is something beneath that area of water. It has not a reef. It has a living thing. It has very large.

Its energy response is very low. It is almost blending into the environment and it s moving slowly. Dot a sea monster sure how immediately became alert. Unlike the common types, the energy characteristics are ancient and dull, as if it has been dormant for many years and has just been disturbed by something. Sue Chanchian described her feeling.

It did not show any aggression, more like sleepwalking or rather being unconsciously drawn by some deeper calling. Dot. Lynn Mo noted the location and ordered the helmsmen to adjust the course, moving as far away from the suspicious waters as possible. He also instructed Shure how to notify the entire ship to maintain the highest level of silence and vigilance when passing through the area. The fleet carefully navigated around the reefs and the waters where the unknown behemoth slumbered.

As the massive hull of the Mo Yuan glided past an iceberg resembling the fangs of a giant beast, Linmo through the newly cleared observation window seemed to glimpse an enormous indistinct shadow slowly sinking into the deeper darkness of a deep green sea below. There were no large waves, only a string of huge, slowly rising bubbles that condensed into tiny ice beads the instant they touched the cold surface. Everyone breathed a sigh of relief, but the gloom in their hearts grew even heavier. This area concealed more and more strange things than they had imagined. After sailing for another 2 hours, Su Chian suddenly shuddered, opened her eyes abruptly, and her face drained of color.

Then, Montac, her voice trembled slightly with urgency. That ancient and heavy fluctuation has changed. It's accelerating and I sensed a large amount of dense metallic energy reaction right to our northeast about 30 to 40 nautical miles away. It's Caesar's main fleet. They've stopped.

No, not stopped. They're operating. Those metallic reactions are making a deep connection with some point on the seabed. They were finally getting close. Lin Mo's spirits lifted, but then Su Chanchian's next words tighten his heart.

And that feeling of being guided is even stronger now. Not only the giant creature we just bypassed, but also many other deep sea creatures of varying sizes are gathering towards that core point. It has not a frenzied attack, but more like being attracted summoned to go somewhere. Sue Chanchian pressed her forehead, seemingly enduring some discomfort. What Caesar wants to open that door may not just be some kind of device he has trying to communicate or awaken something deeper something closely connected to the ancient history of this ocean awaken him sure how's face was ashen has he gone mad in a place like this at this time for him this might be the perfect opportunity Lynn Emmo calmly analyzed the intense energy disturbances are masking the anomalies the impending cold wave is hindering intervention from other forces and he happens to possess the key and technology he obtained from somewhere.

He looked at Sue Chanchian. Can you roughly assess the depth of their operation and how long it might take? Sue Chian tried to concentrate and after a moment shook her head. It's too far away. The interference is too strong. I can only feel the connection deepening and the energy exchange intensifying.

The acceleration of that ancient fluctuation is very obvious. Like a rusty giant will being forcibly pushed faster and faster. I don't know what it will be like when it's fully spinning. They had to get close as quickly as possible. They had to interfere with or even stop them.

Lynn Mo knew that time was flying by. Full speed ahead. Follow the safe path you've sensed and approach the target area as quickly as possible. Lynn Mo ordered, "Notify flying fish and wave breaker to maintain their alert formation and focus on preventing any unusual underwater creatures." The order was given, and the Mo Yuan's propellers began to paddle with all their might. Again, the main sail adjusted to the optimal angle, carving a path through the wind, snow, and ice flows.

The increased speed brought greater turbulence and risk. The hull occasionally collided with smaller ice flows, producing dull thuds, but there was no time to worry about that now. After sailing for about an hour, the snowstorm ahead seemed to have thinned slightly and visibility improved to about 200 m. It was at this moment that Sue Chansen, who had been on high alert, suddenly pointed to the left front. There, something is rising from underwater.

It's moving very fast. The energy reaction is Caesars's. It feels like a mixture of metallic and bio energy, but more concentrated, more like a finished product. Everyone immediately looked over. About a 100 meters away.

The sea surface suddenly arched upwards, and a dark streamlined spindle-shaped object over 10 m long broke through the icy water, leaping several meters above the surface. Its entire body was covered in a dark, neither gold nor wood material with regularly distributed dark red light bands on its surface. Its head was cone-shaped, and its tail had a complex fin-like structure and a propeller. It hovered briefly in the air, seemingly scanning or locating its position. The dark red light bands flashed rapidly a few times before plunging back into the sea, barely splashing any water, leaving only a rapidly spreading ripple and a few wisps of lingering white steam.

It's a submersible, some kind of underwater vehicle. Sure, how gasped. Caesar even has this kind of thing. There's more than one. Su Chanchian exclaimed urgently.

There are others nearby. They're patrolling. The perimeter is very large. We've been discovered. Almost as soon as she finished speaking, another identical black submersible silently emerged from the shadow of an iceberg not far away on the starboard side of the a device on its head turning and pointing towards the.

Although there was no attack, the feeling of being locked on and chilling instantly spread throughout the entire ship. Lynmo's eyes were sharp as knives. It seemed that Caesar's door had not been fully opened yet, but the hounds guarding the gate had already bared their fangs. Don't fire. Maintain course, but slow down.

Adopt a defensive but not offensive posture. Lynn Mo quickly ordered, "Sure, how? Prepare for negotiation. signal the general distress call and the Mo Yuan pavilion's identification flags. See if the master behind these hounds will show up. He wanted to take a gamble.

He was betting that Caesar wouldn't want any unforeseen complications before achieving his ultimate goal, especially not a full-scale war prematurely with a storm king whose strength was unclear and who had just breached his outer defenses. The gamble was dangerous, but they needed time. They needed to get closer to the core and they needed to figure out the true nature of these hounds. The Mo Yuan moved slowly forward, especially made flags, representing negotiation, and Mo Yuan pavilion, rising on the main mast and fluttering violently in the gale. The two black submersibles followed like ghosts, neither too close nor too far, their dark red light bands shining steadily, maintaining a silent deterrent.

Above the icy sea, amidst the wind and snow, a suffocating silence of confrontation pervaded the air, and in the deeper depths of the sea, the accelerating rotation of the ancient waves seemed to be faintly audible. Chapter 63. Standoff at the icy sea. Like a lost whale stumbling into a giant's lair, the Mo Yuan slowly sailed under the cold gaze of the black submersible. The wind and snow seemed to have wisely subsided a bit, and visibility remained at around 200 m, enough to make people see the two streamlined dark red cold glowing creations like a malignant tumor attached to the left and right flanks of the fleet.

They didn't launch an attack, nor did they make any further deterrent moves. They simply maintained a fixed distance and orientation, their dark red light bands pulsating steadily, conveying a silent warning and surveillance. This silent oppressive feeling was more chilling than direct artillery fire. Inside the bridge, the air seemed to freeze. Linmo stood before the observation window, his gaze calmly sweeping over the two submersibles before turning to the snow-covered sea in the distance.

Such Chian leaned back, closing her eyes and trying to calm her overexerted mind, but her body still trembled slightly involuntarily. Shouse stood beside the communicator, his fingers unconsciously tapping on the cold metal casing, awaiting a response, or perhaps the next twist of fate. Time ticked by, each second feeling as if stretched out by the cold wind. The soldiers and sailors on deck gripped their weapons and ropes tightly, watching the sea and the shadows beneath with vigilance, their breath condensing into white mist in the frigid air. After this suffocating silence lasted for about 15 minutes, the dark red light band on the bow of one of the submersibles suddenly changed its flashing frequency, emitting a regular coded pulse.

Simultaneously, the modified bassband communication crystal on the MOU on used to communicate with the Dragon Soul suddenly lit up faintly, emitting a crackling electrical noise. Then, a severely distorted voice, yet still discernable as arrogant and cold, forcefully cut in, unfamiliar ship, state your identity and a reason for your intrusion. The sound came directly from inside the bridge, indicating that the other side possessed some kind of powerful signal suppression and directional transmission technology. Lynmo and Sure How exchanged a glance. Sherhow stepped forward, adjusted the feedback channel on the communication crystal and replied in a deep voice, "This is the storm sailboat Moan belonging to the Mo Yuan pavilion.

We are currently on a maritime patrol mission and have deviated from our course due to severe weather. What faction are you? Why are you intercepting us here? A brief silence followed, broken only by the crackling of electricity. Then the distorted voice rang out again, tinged with a barely perceptible mockery. Emo Yuan Pavilion. I've heard of Linmo, the Storm King, deviating from a course.

This frozen hell doesn't seem like an ordinary cruising area. The other party clearly knew their identities and saw through their excuse immediately. Lyn Mo stopped beating around the bush and spoke directly to the communication crystal. Caesar, since you know it's us, why hide? Have your little toy step aside and perhaps we can talk. A low chuckle came from the other end of the communication.

The distortion unable to conceal its arrogance. Limo, you are more daring and more foolish than I imagined. This is my hunting ground, and what is taking place is the sacred work before the great descent. I give you two choices. Turn around immediately and leave the sea area and I may pretend I didn't see it or stay and become part of this great sacrifice.

Sacrifice? Lyn Mos eyes narrowed. This word brought his ominous premonition to its peak. Caesar, how much do you know about what lies beneath the sea? And what do you intend to do with it? Then Monta Pulbbit, the so-called great descent is probably not a domain for a plunderer like you plunderers. Uh-huh. Caesar's laughter, amplified by the distortion, sounded particularly jarring.

The moral shackles of the old world are worthless here. Power is the only truth. What lies beneath the sea is the key to new power. It will grant me the authority to rule this sea and indeed the entire new world. As for you ants clinging to the past, either submit or perish.

Before the words were even finished, the communication was abruptly cut off. At the same time, the two submersibles that have been monitoring the situation suddenly increased the frequency of their flashing dark red lights. They began to accelerate, no longer maintaining distance, but like two venomous snakes lurking in weight, rapidly weaving and darting towards the bow and stern of the Moan. He's about to make his move. Sure, how shouted.

All personnel, prepare for battle in the ballisti, watch the underwater. No, wait. Lynn and Mo raised his hand to stop Sher How from immediately ordering an attack. His gaze fixed on the movements of the two submersibles. He's probing and he's also driving us away.

Judging from their course, he's trying to force us to change course or retreat rather than attacking directly. As expected, although the two submersibles were aggressive, they always maintained a safe distance from the MON. Their movements were more like drawing an invisible boundary, forcing the Mo Yuan to leave its current course and drift southwest. Suian struggled to her feet, pressing her fingers to her temples, enduring the discomfort as she extended her senses once more. He's right.

The thing beneath the sea is accelerating its awakening. The energy flow is accelerating, and the core of that ancient fluctuation is becoming increasingly clear and aggressive. Caesar's fleet has deployed a circular formation around the core area and those large metal devices are firing powerful energy beams into the seabed as if heating or stimulating a certain point. The deep sea creatures that have been attracted are gathering towards that point. But as soon as they get close to the energy beams, they disappear as if melted or absorbed.

Her description made the temperature on the bridge seemed to drop several degrees. Absorbing life energy, activating ancient beings. What terrifying ritual was Caesar performing? We cannot retreat. Lynn Mo's voice was resolute, breaking the oppressive silence. The more he tries to drive us away, the more it shows he's afraid of being disturbed, and that his sacred operation has reached a critical and vulnerable stage.

Sure, how order flying fish and wave breaker to spread out to the flanks, attract the submersible attention, and harass them, but don't engage in a direct confrontation. Mo you on. Adjust your course and force your way through the gap in the Caesar fleet circular formation. Speed isn't important, but stability is crucial. Adopt the posture of getting as close to the core as possible, no matter the cost.

Yes. A fierce glint flashed in Show's eyes as he immediately relayed the order. The massive Mo Yuan emitted a deep rumble, its bough slightly adjusted, ignoring the two submersibles that were trying to force it to turn. Instead, it slowly but firmly pressed forward towards the gap they had deliberately left, leading to the core area. At the same time, the flying fish and the wave breaker, like two agile hunting dogs, suddenly accelerated from the flanks, maneuvering behind the two submersibles.

The ship's light crossbows began to aim and fire. Although the accuracy was poor in the wind and waves, they successfully attracted the other side's attention. This unexpectedly forceful action clearly startled the people operating the submersibles. The two submersibles paused briefly, seemingly communicating internally or requesting instructions. Then they abandoned their attempt to drive them away.

The dark red light suddenly became blinding and a baffle below the bow slid open, revealing a large, dark, gaping launch tube. They're going to attack, the lookout screamed. Allisti, aim at the submersible launch tubes and power units. Intercept fire. Shh roared.

However, the anticipated torpedoes or energy beams did not fire. The submersible launch tubes merely flashed briefly before shutting down. They seemed to have received new orders, ceasing their attempt to directly intercept the MON and instead accelerating their retreat to create distance while maintaining surveillance. They withdrew. A first maid asked somewhat incredulous.

It s not a retreat. It s a change of strategy. Linmo mo stared at the two black shadows that quickly blended into the snowy background. Caesar doesn't he want to start a full-scale war with us at this time and waste his strength. He has chosen a more prudent approach monitoring delaying letting us back down on our own or dealing with us at his leisure after he has finished his task.

He turned around and looked at Sue Chanchan. Can you sense the energy changes in the core area after a breakthrough? Such Chian focused her senses and after a moment a complex expression appeared on her face. The acceleration of that ancient fluctuation seems to have slowed down a little, very weak, but definitely there. Caesar's energy beam emission also seems to have shown a slight unstable fluctuation. Our approach has indeed interfered with him.

Although it's small, it's effective. Even the slightest disturbance is a glimmer of hope. Lenimo nodded. Keep moving forward. Stay vigilant.

Send our current location and encounters to the dragon soul, requesting them to exert pressure in this direction. We need to be like a thorn in Caesar's throat, making every sacrifice he swallows painful. The mo yuan continued to break through the icy sea, resolutely heading towards the core area where energy surged and danger alert. The wind and snow intensified again and visibility decreased once more. But escorted by the two ghostly submersibles that followed them at a distance.

They knew they were approaching the final stage of this icy sea battle. In the deeper ocean, the ancient beings that were forcibly heated and stimulated seemed to have experienced a subtle deviation in their awakening process due to the unexpected intrusion of dust. Chapter 64. Ice crack. Under the watchful eye of the black submersible that seemed to accompany it like a ghost, the Mo Yuan continued its arduous advance towards the energy turbulent core area.

The wind and snow regained control, reducing visibility to less than 100 m. The sounds of the ship colliding with the ice flows grew more frequent and muffled. Each impact causing the ship to tremble slightly and ice shards to scatter like broken jade. The sailors took turns working more frequently. Their actions of clearing the ice almost mechanical, their eyebrows and eyelashes covered in frost, their breath quickly dissipating into the frigid air.

The atmosphere on the bridge was oppressive and focused. Lyn Moe's gaze was mostly fixed on the two faint dark red shadows outside the observation window. Like leeches, they maintained a fixed distance and position, neither moving away nor getting closer, silently asserting their presence and surveillance. This feeling of being watched by venomous snakes was more mentally taxing than an open confrontation. Wrapped in a thick blanket, Su Chian sat in a corner near the heating ducks, forcing herself to engage in intermittent deep sensory perception.

She dared not exert her mental energy for extended periods with such intensity as before that would be tantamount to suicide. Instead, she would concentrate fully on listening for a few minutes every half hour or so, then immediately rest and recover. Even so, after each session of perception, the weariness on her pale face deepened. The energy beam is still being emitted, but the rhythm seems to be slightly disrupted. After another brief perception session, Su Chanchian closed her eyes, her voice so soft it was almost drowned out by the wind.

The acceleration of that ancient fluctuation has indeed been slowed down very subtly like a heavy flywheel about to spin being gently tapped. Although it's still spinning, it's not as smooth anymore. Caesar seems a bit impatient. I sense some unusual fluctuations in the metallic energy reactions in several places. Impatientness is a good thing, Sher House said after returning from checking the antifreeze measures in the lower cabins.

It means our presence is indeed bothering him. The more anxious he is, the more likely he is to make a mistake. Lynamo nodded and asked, "What about those deep sea creatures that were attracted there? How are they doing?" Suchan frowned even more deeply. They're still gathering, and I feel their state is changing. At first, it was passive attraction, like sleepwalking.

But now, creatures that get close to the energy beam seem to go through a very brief, painful struggle phase before being absorbed. Although it disappears quickly, the sudden sharp dissipation of life energy is very clear. She couldn't help but shiver, unsure whether it was from the cold or something else. Sacrifice. Lynamo repeated the word Caesar had used in a low voice, his eyes icy.

To use life energy to heat or activate an ancient being. This method had already exceeded the scope of ordinary ambition, exuding a nauseating and sinister aura. as Dragon Soul replied. He looked at the team member in charge of communications. The team member shook his head.

The wind, snow, and energy interference are too strong, and the bassband communication is intermittent. The last complete message we received was 4 hours ago. Captain Xiao confirmed that their fast reaction fleet had established a forward position about 60 nautical miles to our southwest. But due to the obstruction of floating ice and the bad sea conditions, large-scale advancement is difficult. They're trying to send small high-speed ships and reconnaissance units to approach us, which is expected to take some time.

A distant source of water cannot quench an immediate thirst. Lynn and Mo knew that at least for the crucial period ahead, they would largely have to rely on themselves. How about Leeway? Any new discoveries at the Rune Tower? The communications team member nodded. Engineer Lee just sent a very brief encrypted message saying that the tower's deep scanning array has captured the interior of that ancient fluctuation which appears to contain multiple resonant cavity structures with energy circulating and reinforcing within them. He believes that if the stability of one or more of these resonant cavities could be disrupted or even destroyed, it could cause much greater obstacles to the entire activation process than is now.

However, he also emphasized that this is only a speculation based on the energy model without an actual structural diagram. The specific location and shape of the resonant cavities cannot be determined. Lynn Emmo noted down this keyword. It might be the key to their next move. Boss sure how walked to the nautical chart pointing to their current location and the estimated core area.

At our current speed and direction, we should be able to reach the edge of Caesar s fleet s circular formation in about 3 to 4 hours. At that point, it probably one TB as simple as just these two little toys monitoring us. His main warships and those large equipment one T let us get close to it. I know that Lin Mos gaze moved across the nautical chart, so we can't TB stupid and just crash into it. We're a flying fish and wavebreaker now.

As per your orders, they maneuvered on both sides of the perimeter, maintaining a distance that was neither too close nor too far. The two submersibles were mainly focused on us and their response to their harassment was not very proactive. Sherhow replied, "Let them continue to patrol the perimeter, maintaining their presence." But Dante, let them easily enter the firing range of the enemy s circular formation. We need them as eyes and potential surprise weapons. Lynn Mo pondered.

As for the MOU on, we need to change our approach. Caesar s circular formation is to protect and maintain energy output to the seabed. So the defense inside the formation, especially the area directly below where the energy beam is focused, may actually be weakened to avoid affecting operations or rather his attention will be more focused on external threats. Sure, how's eyes lit up. You want to come from underwater? It asked just one direction, Linmo said, not giving a definitive answer.

But the prerequisite is that we must first break through to a sufficiently close distance and find an opportunity. The underwater equipment and jammers of the special operations reserve team are prepared for this possibility. But now he glanced at the two stubborn shadows outside the window. We need to get rid of or lure away these two tagalongs at least to create a brief window of opportunity. How to draw them away? A direct attack won't work.

It might play right into Caesar's hands and trigger a full-scale conflict. Showing weakness and retreating, that's even less likely. Suchanian suddenly spoke softly. They seem to be waiting for some command or perhaps waiting for some opportunity. I can sense that their energy response is very stable, almost blending into the chaotic background of the sea area with only slight fluctuations when they occasionally adjust their position.

They don't seem to have any intention to attack autonomously, waiting for the right moment. Linmo pondered the phrase, his gaze fixed on the snow-covered northeast. That was the source of the energy fluctuations and the core of Caesar's operation. Could it be that Caesar's entire plan, including the peripheral interception and surveillance, was proceeding according to a precise timetable? Was he waiting for a specific energy peak or a certain phase of a cold wave? Just then, the ship shuddered violently, more violently than any of the previous impacts. At the same time, a teeth grinding, creaking sound came from the wood, twisting and squeezing.

We've hit a large ice flow on the starboard side. There's a leak report. came the anxious shout from the lower deck over the radio. Damage control team, proceed immediately. Assess the damage.

Sherhow responded immediately. Lynn Emmo strode to the right observation window. There a jagged grayish white iceberg roughly the size of a small house was slowly separating from the starboard stern of the MOU on where the ship's hull had rubbed against the iceberg with chips and ice fragments were mixed together. Although the ship had been reinforced, the impact was clearly severe. Misfortune never comes singly.

Almost simultaneously with the impact, a submersible that had been steadily monitoring the flank suddenly flashed its dark red light a few times and then without warning began to turn, not toward the but accelerating toward the snowstorm on the other side and quickly disappeared from sight. Is there only one left? Everyone on the bridge was taken back. Was it because the Mo Yuan had been suddenly damaged, reducing their assessment of the threat, or had something more serious happen over there? Suchian forced herself to focus and turned her senses back to the direction where the submersible had disappeared. After a moment, a look of confusion appeared on her face. A very small but sharp hole suddenly appeared in the energy background over there, as if something had briefly absorbed the surrounding free energy.

It was very abrupt and didn't seem like a natural phenomenon. The other submersible went in that direction. A hollow space attracting a submersible. Lin Mo's mind raced. Had Dragon Souls reconnaissance units successfully infiltrated? Or beneath this icy sea besides Caesar's target was something else that had also been alerted.

Whatever it may be, this sudden turn of events seems to have torn a tiny crack in the tight surveillance network between them and Caesar. The opportunity has arrived. A cold glint flashed in Linmo's eyes. Sure. How? Order the Emo Yuan to maneuver behind the largest iceberg to the left front, using the terrain to temporarily obscure the remaining submersible view.

Flying fish and wave breaker conduct probing reconnaissance towards that cavity, but don't go too deep. Focus on confirming the situation. What about the extent of the damage? Sure, how asked. As long as it doesn't sink, keep going, Lyno said decisively. Tell the damage control team that I'm giving them half an hour to bring the leak under control.

We need speed now and we also need a bit of luck. The MO you on dragging its damaged starboard side struggled but determinately adjusted its course through the wind, snow, and floating ice heading toward the shadow of the iceberg that resembled a silent behemoth in the distance. The remaining submersible seemed to hesitate for a moment, its dark red light flickering erratically. Ultimately, it did not immediately follow, but remained in place, as if observing or waiting for new instructions. A crevice had appeared, though small, a keen enough hunter would spot a glimmer of light within.

Every step from here on would be more dangerous and more crucial. Chapter 65, Whispers of the Cold Abyss. The Mo Yuon, dragging its damaged starboard side, glided slowly into the leeward side of the massive iceberg like a wounded whale. Instantly, the raging blizzard and surging waves from the northeast were mostly blocked by the huge ice, and the pressure on the ship was suddenly relieved, leaving only the muffled howling of the wind from the other side of the iceberg like the breathing of a giant beast. A temporary respit.

Inside the bridge, everyone remained on edge. Sherhow had personally let a team down to assess the damage. His brief instructions and reports constantly coming through the walkie-talkie. Three ribs are cracked and there's a hole in the outer hole. Sea water is seeping in at a moderate rate.

The leak sealing team is using quick setting gel and pressure fill planks. The backup pumps have been started and should be able to control the situation within half an hour. Lynn and Mo stood in front of the relatively calm port observation window. His gaze fixed on the faint dark red glow of the only remaining submersible visible on the other side of the iceberg. It remained stationary about 400 meters away on the sea surface, neither approaching nor leaving like a leopard patiently waiting for its prey to reappear.

It is still waiting, Su Chanchian said softly. She was wrapped in a blanket, her face still pale, but her eyes had regained a little clarity. The void has disappeared. The other submersible didn't te return. I can t sense what happened over there at all.

It asks like I'm being shielded by something. D shielding. Then mo pondered. Was it dragon souls jamming equipment? Or was there truly something beneath that icy sea that could silently swallow even Caesar's submersible? Any news about flying fish and breaking waves? He asked the communications team member. Just received a brief light signal from flying fish.

Arrived in the general area of the hollow. No obvious anomalies found, but seawater temperature and energy readings are extremely unstable. Advised not to venture further. They are conducting a perimeter reconnaissance. It wasn't surprising that Lynn Mo wasn't found.

It would have been strange if he had been found so easily. What concerned him more was the instability of the seawater temperature and energy. This sea area was like a pressure cooker about to boil over. Its surface appeared covered in ice and snow, but its interior was filled with violent and chaotic power. Order them to maintain their distance and continue monitoring that area, focusing on whether any new voids appear or anything else that doesn't belong to Caesar's fleet is active, Lin Mo instructed.

Then he turned to Sue Chanchan. Chansen, while things are relatively calm now, carefully sense the core area and that ancient fluctuation again and see if there are any new changes after we broke through the surveillance and approached. Note that if you feel any discomfort, stop immediately. Such Chan nodded, took a few deep breaths of the cold air, and closed her eyes again. This time, she deliberately slowed down, letting her senses flow like a gentle stream rather than the raging waves before, carefully bypassing the chaotic surface energy of the sea area, and probing towards the heavy and magnificent pulse in the depths.

Time ticked by. Only the faint hum of the ventilation ducts and the distant, indistinct sounds of leak ceiling operations remained on the bridge. Lyn Mo waited quietly, his gaze occasionally sweeping across the silent iceberg outside the observation window and the snow-covered sea further away. The iceberg's surface was not smooth, but covered with grooves and holes carved by millions of years of wind and frost, resembling a gigantic, indifferent face in the dim light. About 10 minutes later, Su Chian's eyelashes fluttered a few times, and she slowly opened her eyes.

Her expression was somewhat strange, a mixture of confusion, a hint of fear, and some indescribable understanding. "That ancient fluctuation," she said softly, as if afraid of disturbing something. Its acceleration has indeed been slowed down, but it seems to be differentiating inside. The differentiation then monts like a chaotic hole that s starting to produce different sounds. Sue Chian struggled to find the right words.

Before it felt like a heavy single pulse dot, but now I can vaguely discern at least two or three different rhythms or intentions intertwined within it. One is still heavy and slow, carrying endless weariness, as if it wants to continue sleeping. Another has become somewhat eager, even greedy, actively absorbing and responding to what the Caesar energy beam is transmitting. And there is a a third one that s very faint almost imperceptible but it feels very cold and very alienating to me like an observer or like it s calculating something dot three different intentions. Lynn Mohart trembled violently.

Could it be that the ancient being beneath the sea was not a unified consciousness or device but some kind of composite entity? Or did Caesar's activation process inadvertently trigger some previously dormant different parts within it? Does Caesar know about this? Sure, how having finished treating the damage, returned to the bridge covered in cold air and water stains just in time to hear Su Chanchians words. It's hard to say, Lynn Mo shook his head. If he knows, it might be exactly what he wants to awaken the greedy part within him and use it for his own purposes. If he doesn't know, then he might be opening a Pandora's box that even he can't control. In either case, it means the situation is sliding into an even more unpredictable abyss.

What can we do? Su Chian looked at Linmo, her eyes filled with worry. That greedy part seems to be absorbing life energy even faster. Those deep sea creatures that have been attracted there. The resonant cavity that Lee Wayne mentioned, Lynmo's thoughts became clearer. If the ancient wave really begins to differentiate and different rhythms appear, then the corresponding resonant cavity structures may also be different and they may even interfere with or compete with each other.

If we can find and interfere with a resonant cavity that represents the intention of greed, we may be able to exacerbate its internal instability or even trigger internal strife, disrupting Caesar's plans. The principle is simple, but putting it into practice is incredibly difficult. They don't even know the specific shape and location of the resonant cavity, let alone distinguish which corresponds to which intention. We need to get closer. We need a clearer perception.

Lynn Mo and Mo looked at Sue Chanchian, then at the iceberg outside the window. We need to continue getting closer to the core and we need to find a relatively safe location where we can listen clearly. This iceberg is only a temporary refuge, not a long-term solution. Shirhow walked to the nautical chart and pointed to the area between the icebergs and the core region. This area has dense floating ice and scattered icebergs, resulting in extremely poor visibility, but it also facilitates concealment and maneuverability.

Caesar's main circular formation should be about 10 to 15 nautical miles ahead. If we can use the cover provided by these iceberg formations to get closer and then what? rely on this behemoth, the Mo Yuan, to navigate through the ice flows? A first mate asked skeptically. That collision just now was bad enough. No, the Mo Yuan will remain here as a diversionary force and a last stitch backup. That Linmo made the decision.

Sure, how you select the most elite special forces members carrying underwater equipment, jammers, and other necessary tools. They will travel in the flying fish and wave breaker using the agility of small boats to infiltrate through the iceberg crevices and get as close to the core area as possible. Your mission is not a frontal attack but reconnaissance and location. If possible, find the energy characteristics of the resonant cavity that Leeway mentioned and attempt to use the jammers for probing sabotage. He paused, then looked at Sue Chian.

Chansen, you need to go with them. Only your senses can distinguish those different intentions and their possible corresponding energy nodes. I know it's dangerous, but I go do Sue. Changian nodded without hesitation, her eyes firm. Remote sensing from here is still a barrier.

Only by getting closer can we see more clearly and hear more accurately. Dot. I will protect Miss Sue. Sure house said solemnly. The operation must be swift and covert.

If discovered or if Caesar's operation encounters a major setback, retreat immediately without hesitation. Lynn Mo instructed the MOU on will create some disturbance here to attract the attention of the remaining submersible and any other possible surveillance forces. We will maintain communication silence and only receive your emergency signals. The plan was quickly finalized. Sherhow immediately went to select team members and prepare equipment.

Such Chian also took the time to rest, preparing for the upcoming high-intensity sensory training. Lynn Emmo walked alone to the edge of the bridge, gazing out the window at the seemingly ancient iceberg. Beneath the icy abyss, whispers began to rise and divisions began to emerge. A storm stirred up by ambitious individuals was drawing everyone into its grip. The small team he dispatched would be like a slender yet sharp probe, piercing the vortex at the heart of the storm, listening to the dangerous whispers from the deep sea and trying to find a glimmer of hope before destruction strikes.

A glimmer of light will ignite between the ice crevices. Chapter 66. Glimmer of light in the ice crevice. Like two thin black blades, the flying fish and breaking waves silently slid out of the huge shadow cast by the Mo Yuon and disappeared into the even deeper darkness and snowstorm behind the iceberg. Sherhow personally commanded from the flying fish, which also carried Su Chanchian and four of the most elite special forces members.

The other five members, led by Vice Captain Lou Fong, were aboard the Wave Breaker, responsible for flank cover and rear guard action. Both ships underwent additional camouflage. The dark sails were furled, replaced with lower auxiliary sails and longer orars, and key parts of holes were bound with gray white burlap and broken ice, blending them as seamlessly as possible into their surroundings. The moment we left the leeward side of the iceberg, a raging blizzard and biting cold enveloped us once more. The temperature was even lower than before.

The snowflakes were no longer soft down, but fine, hard- eyes crystals that stung our faces. The seawater had become unusually viscous, taking on an opaque, dark gray hue with a thin, semi-olid, oily substance floating on its surface, creating significant resistance as the oars paddled through it. Su Xian was wrapped in her thickest fur clothing with a waterproof rubber cloak over it, but the chill still seeped in everywhere. She forced herself to ignore the discomfort in her body and focused all her attention on her senses. This time she no longer pursued range or intensity, but instead condensed her senses into an extremely thin line like a deep sea fishing probe, carefully avoiding the chaotic energy turbulence on the surface, extending towards the heavy and complex pulse source in the northeast direction.

Straight ahead at 1:00, about 2 nautical miles away, there are large amount of metal fragments and biological remains deposited underwater. The energy residue is very chaotic. It may be the sight of a previous battle or accident. We suggest you detour." Her voice was transmitted to Shhau's ears through a speciallymade resonant bone piece close to the corner of his mouth. The volume was just loud enough to be heard, but wouldn't carry too far.

Sherhow nodded and gestured to the helmsmen and the breaking waves. The two small boats, like ghosts, skillfully navigated through the increasingly dense ice flows, avoiding the danger zones indicated by Su Chanchian. Navigation became exceptionally difficult. Visibility was almost zero, relying entirely on Su Chanchian senses and the helmsman season experience. The ice flows were of all shapes and sizes.

Some had sharp knifelike edges while others were hidden underwater only revealing inconspicuous corners. The hull occasionally scraped against the ice flows producing a teeth grinding creek. Everyone held their breath even deliberately softening their rowing movements. The sound of the oars cutting into the water completely masked by the howling wind and snow. On the left at the 9:00 position about 800 meters away, there are signs of life sea creatures quite numerous gathered under a large ice flow.

Their energy state is very volatile, but they show no signs of moving as if they are waiting for something. Suchan warned again. Shirhow immediately signaled the ship to veer to the right and create some distance. Through the swirling ice crystals, one could vaguely see the bottom of the small mountain-like ice flow to the left, where countless dark shadows were writhing, and occasionally a pale bony spike or scale would flash by. Those were predators attracted or driven there temporarily lying dormant for some reason.

"Keep moving forward. Keep your distance," Shha whispered. Their target wasn't these sea monsters. After sailing for another half hour, Su Chian's breathing suddenly became more rapid. We've entered an energy depression.

The concentration of free energy around us is very low, as if it has been drained by something. It's very quiet here. Even the sound of wind and snow seems quieter. Sure, how cautiously looked around. Indeed, there seemed to be fewer ice flows here.

The sea was relatively calm, and the wind and snow were no longer so fierce. But this unusual calm made him uneasy. "Look underwater," a sharp-eyed special forces soldier, said in a low voice. Looking down, everyone saw faint, almost imperceptible dark green halos in the deep gray seawater, flickering slowly like breathing. "These halos were not chaotic, but rather vaguely formed winding paths leading northeast.

Is it because the pheromone residue was solidified by the low temperature, so became visible?" Such Chanchian said uncertainly. The energy characteristics are very similar to those used by Caesar before, but they are more old, as if they were left behind a long time ago. Had Caesar been here before, or did these traces belong to earlier explorers? Sure, how wondered, but the low-lying area beneath his feet seemed safe for the time being. He gestured for the ship to continue along a faintly glowing crevice, slowing it down to its lowest speed. Such Chians perception continued to extend forward.

As she drew closer, the different voices within that ancient fluctuation became increasingly clear. The one with a greedy and active intention to absorb was the most obvious, like a thirsty abyss, constantly devouring the nutrients supplied from above, Caesar's energy beam, and around the attracted creatures. The heavy and weary voice, on the other hand, was like background noise. Although it still existed, it seemed to be suppressed by the former's activity. What concerned her most was the third one, that faint, cold, and alienated sense of calculation.

It seemed to exist deeper within the entire fluctuation structure, not participating in absorption, but simply quietly observing and recording all the flow and changes of energy. Brother, sure how Sue Chian suddenly said softly, her voice trembling slightly. I think I can sense the approximate locations of those resonant cavities that not their specific shapes, but the nodes where energy converges and transforms. The node corresponding to the greedy intention is in the upper middle layer of the wave structure near the energy input where is the most active and also the most unstable. The node corresponding to the calculation intention is very deep where the energy flow is extremely complex and precise like a central hub dot.

Can you pinpoint the location? Even just the general direction. Sure, how asked immediately. Such an closed her eyes trying to match the vague sense of space with her current direction. Greed node is northeast of our current location about two to 300 meters below the sea surface. calculation node is in a similar direction but deeper possibly more than 500 m or even deeper and she paused there seems to be a very special energy barrier around that calculation node my senses have a hard time penetrating it feels very hard and very exclusive between 200 and 300 m and above 500 m sure how's heart sank with their current rudimentary underwater equipment reaching such depths was virtually impossible leeways jammer was designed to operate at a depth of only about 100 m.

Is it possible to indirectly affect that greedy node by interfering with the energy input from the outside? Sherhow proposed another idea. It has possible. Suchan pondered. Caesar s energy beam was launched from a ship on the sea surface. If we can interfere with it before it reached the seabed or destroy the source of the beam.

Before she could finish speaking, the breaking wave ship, which have been silent all along, suddenly emitted a series of rapid light signals indicating that an anomaly has been detected. Sure, how Sue Chanchian immediately looked towards the left rear towards the breaking waves. In the swirling snow, the outline of the breaking waves seemed somewhat blurred and about a 100 meters to its side. A nearly perfect circular area about 20 m in diameter abruptly appeared on the sea surface. The water in that area was noticeably darker, almost inky black and completely still, creating an eerie contrast with the surrounding undulating sea.

Even more unsettling was that the water at the edge of the circular area was slowly but visibly denting towards the center as if an invisible funnel was sucking water in from below. It's a void. It looks just like the one that lured the submersible away before. Sukianken exclamed, "It's moving, heading towards Caesar's core formation." Almost as soon as she finished speaking, without warning, a thick, dark brown pillar, its surface covered with irregular nodules and deep grooves, slowly rose from the center of the inky black circular hole. The top of the pillar disappeared into the wind and snow, obscuring its entirety, but the part that was visible above the sea was nearly 10 m high and over 3 m in diameter.

It stood there silently, exuding an indescribable ancient aura mixed with decay and silence. It was not a submersible, not a ship, and not any known sea creature. What is that? Everyone on the two small boats felt their hair stand on end instantly, and even their breathing stopped. The moment Sue Chian's senses touched that pillar, it was as if she had crashed into a cold, hard wall formed by endless years and death, and was violently bounced back. She groaned.

Her face turned ashen. Her body swayed and she almost fell over, but Shh next caught her. Chan. Shir House said urgently. No, it's nothing.

Such Chian gritted her teeth and stood firm, but her eyes were filled with horror. That thing is alive, but it's not a living being. Its energy is very similar to the deepest, most weary part of that ancient fluctuation. Is it a part separated from an ancient being on the seabed? Or is it a limb that was attracted up? As sure how gazed at the eerie silent pillar and then at the faint glow of the Caesar fleet in the distance amidst the wind and snow, a terrifying conjecture took shape in his mind. Could it be that what Caesar is trying to activate is not some underwater device at all, but some indescribable enormous being sleeping beneath the icy abyss? And are these suddenly appearing cavities and pillars the tentacles or symbols unconsciously emitted by this being during the forced awakening process? If that's the case, they will no longer be facing Caesar's fleet and technology, but some unimaginable, indescribable terror belonging to the ancient history of this world.

Retreat. Shhal made a decisive decision, signaling the breaking waves to retreat at full speed. retreat to the ink abyss immediately. Quickly, without hesitation, the two small boats turned around, their oars pounding wildly as they sped off in the direction they had come from. Behind them, the massive dark brown pillar still stood silently in the center of the shrinking cavity, like an indifferent ancient deity statue from the deep sea, quietly watching the escape of these tiny intruders.

Between the eyes creasses, what they glimpsed was not a glimmer of hope, but a desparing shadow cast by the abyss. Chapter 60. Seven. Returning shadow scheme. Like startled swordfish, the flying fish and wave breaker darted desperately through the gaps in the ice flows, leaving the wind, snow, and the sea with its eerie giant pillars far behind.

Only when the familiar mountainlike black silhouette of the Mo Yuon appeared ahead through the swirling snow did the tents nerves relax slightly. Sure, how half carrying and half supporting the pale-faced and nearly exhausted Sue Chanchian climbed the rope ladder onto the deck of the Linmo, who was already waiting at the side, immediately stepped forward to help her into the bridge lounge, which had been prepared and was heated by a stove.

Luong also quickly boarded the ship with the crew of the breaking waves, each of them still showing signs of shock. What's the situation? The bridge was deafly silent, say for the occasional hissing sound from the heating pipes.

Even the bravest warrior felt a chill run down his spine upon hearing such a bizarre description that defied comprehension and seemed to touch the very depths of the world. Su Chian held the warm ceramic cup in both hands, absorbing its negligible warmth. After Shshirehau finished speaking, she added in a horse voice, "The feeling the thing gave me was almost identical to the most weary and heavy part of that ancient wave at the bottom of the sea. Caesar's forced feeding of that greedy part with energy beams and life energy may have caused instability in the entire existence, and these pillars are an outward manifestation of this instability.

She paused, a hint of lingering fear flashing in her eyes. Moreover, when my senses touched it, what I felt wasn't malice or even consciousness, but a pure cold presence and the discomfort of being forcibly disturbed. It's like being pricricked by a needle in deep sleep. Your body will instinctively twitch regardless of willpower. Lynn Mo listened in silence, his fingers unconsciously tapping the table covered with nautical charts.

The situation was worse and more complicated than he had anticipated. Caesar's target was clearly not some ancient weapon or treasure, but a colossal, incomprehensible being slumbering beneath the abyss. His attempt to crudely feed and control a part of it might be triggering an unpredictable awakening reaction from the entire being. "Those pillars were proof of that." "What about that computation node? Any new discoveries?" Lin Mo asked. Su Chanhan shook her head.

"The distance is too far. The interference is too strong." And after being hit by that pillar later, my perception was completely messed up. Yes. Engineer Lee sent over the latest analysis and combined with the proximity sensing data we provided earlier. He revised the model. The greedy node is located in the shallower active layer that frequently exchanges energy with the outside world.

Lynn Mo said cautiously. We Danty know what the correction mechanism of that core control zone is, how strong it is, or whether it will cause a more terrible chain reaction. Sure, how you take flying fish and wavebreaker and set off again. Ultimate destruction was the last resort, meaning abandoning the unknown knowledge and power it might contain, and also implying enormous, unpredictable ecological risks. Suchan also forced herself to stand up. Lynn Emma nodded, his gaze once again turning to the snow-covered north outside the window. The plan was made. The next step was action. Chapter 68. The icicles appear. Sure.

How leading the newly repaired flying fish and wave breaker once again glided out of the protection of the Mo Yuan like a ghost, disappearing into the chaotic snowstorm surrounding the iceberg. The ship navigated through an increasingly treacherous labyrinth of floating ice. The wind and snow seemed endless, and visibility remained extremely poor, but Sherhow noticed that the temperature in the surrounding sea seemed to be rising very slowly. Although it was still bitterly cold, the semi-olid oily substance on the surface of the sea had thinned slightly. This was not a good sign. It might indicate that energy activity from the seabed was intensifying, affecting the local water temperature.

Following the coordinates provided by Su Chian, they carefully bypassed the central area where the pillar appeared, stopping about a nautical mile to the side behind a natural barrier formed by several medium-sized icebergs. They then lowered a speciallymade ice anchor to secure the vessel. This location was relatively concealed, yet they could observe the activity in the target sea area through gaps in the icebergs. Sherhow raised the moninocular telescope wrapped in animal hide, adjusted the focus, and peered through the wind, snow, and ice crevices. The sea appeared normal at the moment with only churning gray water and scattered ice flows.

But upon closer inspection, one could see that the water seemed darker than the surrounding area and the surface had an unnatural slightly inward swirling motion as if a slow whirlpool lay beneath. The energy reading is abnormal. The background free energy concentration is continuously increasing and the fluctuation frequency is accelerating. One of Lee Ways apprentices stared at the simple instrument in his hand, the pointer trembling rhythmically. It matches the characteristics of stress disorder described by sister Chanchandot.

Sure, how nodded, signaling his team to remain silent and observe. Time passed slowly, and apart from the sounds of wind, snow, and waves, the sea was deathly still. Just as Shirhow began to doubt his judgment. A sudden change occurred. First, a dense cluster of enormous bubbles rose without warning from the center of that dark water, bursting with dull thuds.

Then the sea surface began to noticeably sink, forming a slightly smaller, about 15 meter diameter inky black cavity than the one witnessed last time. Unlike before, this cavity was not stationary, but moved at a slow but steady pace towards the northeast, the core area of Caesar's fleet circular formation. "It's moving. It's heading towards Caesar," the lookout exclaimed at a low voice. Even more chilling is that as the cavity moves, the seawater at its edge seems to be pulled and lifted by an invisible force, gradually condensing and shaping into a dark brown pillar similar to the one seen last time, but slightly thinner and with more dense knots on its surface.

Like a strange giant tree growing from the deep sea, accompanied by tooth grinding, subtle sound like rocks rubbing together, it slowly rises from the center of the cavity. This time, due to the closer distance and better viewing angle, Sure. How could see it more clearly. The surface of the pillar wasn't completely smooth. Within those deep grooves, a faint dark blue light flowed, like solidified blood vessels or remnants of some kind of energy circuit.

The pillar still exuded a sense of decay and silence, but it seemed to have gained an inexplicable directionality. It wasn't standing randomly. Its slight tilt clearly pointed towards the direction of Caesar's fleet. Record, all data, shape, speed of movement, energy changes. Sure, how ordered urgently, the two apprentices frantically but attentively operated the instrument.

Looking in the direction Lu Fong had indicated. Further away, about two or three nautical miles on the snow-covered sea, two similar, slightly smaller, inky black holes appeared. They were also moving slowly, their direction also pointing towards Caesar's fleet. A short dark brown tip had already emerged from the center of one of the smaller holes. This is not an isolated case.

These strange pillars are appearing in multiple locations and seem to be drawn together by some unified force or attraction converging with a clear objective towards Caesar's work area. Are they responding to Caesar's energy beam or are they being attracted by the greedy nodes? Sure, how's mind raced? Such Chian had said that the pillars were related to the fatigue base and the greedy nodes were being forcibly fed by Caesar. Sure how forced himself to calm down. This was invaluable intelligence. At the same time, he didn't forget the limited harassment mission Lin Mo had assigned him.

He signaled to a special forces member on the flying fish to adjust the angle of a light crossbow and load it with a bolt specially made by Leewi with the arrow head replaced by small jammer. A short slow burning time delay fuse was also attached to the tail of the bolt to ensure that the jammer would be triggered near the predetermined depth. The target was not the pillar or the void, but rather a small area of sea about 100 m away to the side of the movement path of the two voids. It was close to the area where the Caesar energy beam might pass through based on Sue Chian's previous perception of energy flow trends. put.

Boom. Boom. Two crossbow bolts leaving barely perceptible trails disappeared into the wind, snow, and waves. Whether they would hit their intended range, whether they would trigger at the correct depth, and what the disruptive effect would be remained unknown. This was more like a trial balloon, a test of the stability of Caesar's operating environment.

After firing the crossbow bolt, Sherhow didn't hesitate. Retreat. Return to the Mouon via the second route. Their reconnaissance mission has been exceeded confirming the multiple locations and directional movement of the pillar. Harassment operations have also been carried out.

Staying any longer is too risky. Intelligence must be sent back immediately. The two small boats start again, speeding towards the Moan along a planned, more ciruitous and concealed route. Behind them, in the wind and snow, several silent giant pillars were slowly moving like indifferent judges from the deep sea, casting ever approaching enormous shadows upon the torch, ignited by human ambition and ignorance. Inside the bridge of the Mo Yuan Linmo had just received the emergency simulation results from Leeway relayed through the rune tower based on Suchians new data.

The simulation showed that if the stress manifestation of the baseline continued to intensify and interacted deeply with Caesar's active layer stimulation, there was a 47% probability that it would trigger a deeper chain reaction imbalance in the entire ancient existence system, potentially leading to unpredictable consequences, including but not limited to larger scale physical structure manifestation, energy rampage, or even triggering some kind of cleanup protocol of that computation. note. Lynn Mo frowned as he looked at the term cleanup protocol. He hoped it was just a term from Leeway's worst case scenario model. He looked out the window, waiting for Sherhow's return and also for the next move in this perilous situation at the ICC.

Chapter 69 news from the ice abyss. When Sherhow returned to the Moon with flying fish and wave breaker, Linmo was already waiting in a small cabin in the inner fortress which served as a temporary combat analysis room. The charcoal stove was burning brightly, dispelling most of the chill that had crept in through the cracks in the door, but the air was still filled with the mixed smell of frozen oil, damp wood, and tense sweat. The situation is worse than expected, but also clearer to Sherhow took off his heavy coat, which was covered in ice crystals, took a large gulp of the hot soup Lynn Emo handed him, and began his report. His breath steaming in the air, he spoke quickly but clearly, explaining in detail the observations of multiple holes and pillars, their directional movement towards Caesar s fleet, and the attempted firing of jamming crossbow bolts.

The two accompanying apprentices immediately presented him with a waterproof board for recording data and leeways instruments. As Lynn Mo listened, he quickly skimmed through the hastily written but crucial notes. When he heard that the pillar had a dark blue glow on its surface and that its movement was directional, his brows furrowed deeply. Linmo put down the recording tablet and looked at Sure. "The distance is too far, and the wind and snow are too strong, so we can't see clearly." But before we withdrew, we could vaguely see the outer perimeter of Caesar's fleet circular formation with our binoculars. There seemed to be signs of ship movement and the light signals were quite frequent, but we can't be sure if it was related to our harassment.

At this moment, Su Chian, supported by Leewi, also entered the cabin. Her complexion was better than before, but the fatigue from over sensory perception still lingered in her eyes. The data brother how brought back matches my previous feelings. Her voice was somewhat weak, but she was very certain. Those pillars were indeed attracted by the abnormal activity of the greed node.

I can feel that in that ancient fluctuation on the seabed, the dissatisfaction or disturbance of the weariness base is intensifying. It's like a sleeping person whose body is repeatedly pricricked by needles. Although they haven't woken up yet, their entire body has begun to unconsciously tense up and resist. Leeway, what new progress has your model simulation made? Linmo turned to the technical director whose hair was disheveled and whose eyes were sunken. Leeway immediately perked up.

He walked to a small blackboard made of charred wood temporarily erected in the center of the cabin covered with complex symbols, formulas, and structural sketches. Combining the latest sensory data from Chian and the observations brought back by the stone team, the model has been corrected. He picked up a small piece of charcoal. We are now 80% certain that the ancient being is a highly complex layered energy matter composite system. The greedy node is located in the shallow active zone.

Highly interactive with the outside world and highly malleable but also the most unstable. The fatigue base constitutes over 90% of the systems mass and basic energy reserves. It is highly inert and slow to respond. But once triggered by a sufficiently strong anomalous stimulus, its mass will produce an overwhelming reaction. In the computation node, he paused, then emphasized the central circle of the sketch with his charcoal pencil.

It's likely not a traditional control center, but more like a balancer or stabilization protocol execution unit. Its function is to monitor the state of the entire system. And when a serious imbalance occurs internally that could lead to system collapse, activate a preset correction or reset procedure. Clearance protocol. Linmo recalled the term from Leeway's previous deduction report.

Yes, it has something like that. Leeway said excitedly. Of course, this is just an analogy. We Dantine know the specific form of the protocol of this ancient system. It could be a force suppression at the energy level, a reorganization of the material structure, or even the release of some kind of pheromone or field that we cannot understand to eliminate abnormal stimuli.

Linmo sure how and Sue Chanchian exchange a glance, all seeing the chill in each other's eyes. If this purge protocol were triggered, and the biggest abnormal stimulus at present was Caesar's fleet and energy beams, then Caesar would likely be the first to be affected. Is it possible? Shouse said in a deep voice that Caesar also knew about this risk if he dared to play with fire like this. Was he confident that he could control the greedy node before the protocol was triggered thereby influencing or even overriding the balancer? Possibly D. Leeway pushed up his glasses which had slipped down to the tip of his nose.

If he obtains sufficiently in-depth operational instructions or backdoor access to this system from his mentor or some other channel, theoretically he could indeed attempt to seize control. Dot. But this is extremely dangerous like welding next to a powder keg about to explode. The success rate is extremely low. And if he fails, that would detonate the powder keg prematurely.

Lynn Mo continued, his tone icy. And we are right next to that keg now. A brief silence fell over the cabin, broken only by the occasional crackling of the charcoal fire. Won't the jamming arrows we launched? Such Chanchian asked with some concern. Probably not.

Leeway shook his head. Our interference is very weak and the target is directly impacting the system nodes. It is just disrupting the energy transmission environment. Compared to Caesar s energy beam, this interference is like throwing a pebble into a river. It might cause a few ripples, but it has far from enough to trigger the balancer's judgment.

However, if Caesar s operation makes even the slightest mistake, causing the stimulation of the greedy nodes to get out of control. He didn't finish his sentence, but his meaning was clear. The limited harassment by the Mo Yuan Pavilion might indirectly increase the risks of Caesar's operations, thus accelerating the arrival of unpredictable consequences. Just then, the communications team member rushed in, knocking on the door and holding a new coded message. Boss, urgent message from Captain Xiao of Dragon Soul.

It came through the backup shortwave channel. The signal is weak, but the content has been deciphered. Lin Mo took the thin piece of animal skin paper soaked in a special solution. It bore Xiao Gi Gangs familiar handwriting, but the writing was more hasty and hurried than before. Lord Lyno, our high alitude reconnaissance balloons, luckily not frozen, have transmitted blurry images.

A large-scale whirlpool and unidentified luminous phenomena have appeared on the sea surface at the center of the Caesar ring formation with energy readings rising sharply. Their fleet has begun to retreat towards the outer perimeter of the formation, seemingly entering the final stage or encountering an accident. Our three rapid response fleets have broken through the outer ice barrier and are approaching your position at full speed. Expected to rendevu with your forces in 6 to 8 hours. In addition, our underwater listening array has detected a continuously increasing abnormal low-frequency soundwave originating from an unimaginable depth with characteristics inconsistent with any known sea creatures or custal activity.

Please be extremely vigilant. The situation may change. Please make a decision as soon as possible. Xiao Gang. Final stage.

An accident. Unidentified low-frequency soundwaves. Lynn Mo briefly explained the contents of the secret letter to everyone. Everyone's hearts sank. Caesar's actions were faster than expected or the situation was spiraling out of control.

And could the extremely deep-seated, abnormal, low-frequency sound waves detected by the dragon soul be the sign that the balancer Leewi had speculated was beginning to activate or respond? "We don't have much time left." Lyn Mo's voice was exceptionally clear in the quiet cabin. "Sure, how? Order the MOU on to prepare for departure, but keep it stationary and concealed for now. Flying fish and wave breaker will take turns resting and stand by at any time." Leeway, immediately maintain top priority contact with the rune tower. I need you to utilize all computing power and combining all available data. Deduce as much as possible.
