Lewi took a deep breath and nodded emphatically. I'll do my best, Chian. Lynamo said, looking at Sue Chian one last time, his tone slow but firm. You need to rest, but you also need to be prepared. From now on, your senses may be the only basis for us to determine whether and when the balancer is activated.

Once you sense a qualitative change in the energy pattern of that computing node on the seabed or that low-frequency sound wave reaches a certain critical point, notify me immediately. Dotto lenmo walked to the port hole of the small cabin and looked out at the endless wind and snow. The huge shadow of the iceberg was cast on the moan like the haze of fate. Caesar is accelerating his madness. The ancient beings of the deep sea are brewing an unknown counterattack.

The dragon souls reinforcements are on their way and they stand on the edge of the eye of the storm, trying to grasp at that sliver of life that may not even exist in the vortex of destruction. The message travels through the icy abyss. The impending change is imminent. Every step from here on will be a gamble of life and death. Chapter 70.

Abyss resonance. yuan. Like a colossal beast lurking in the shadow of an iceberg, waited silently. Time on the bridge seemed frozen in the extreme cold. Each second stretched long and viscous.

The charcoal stove struggled to radiate heat, but could not dispel the heavy pressure permeating the air. Suian, wrapped in a thick blanket, curled up in a chair near the radiator. She wasn't asleep, nor could she truly rest. Her eyes were closed, but all her attention was focused on her ears, not with her ears, but with her innate, keen perception of the ocean's pulse. Leewayi's improved portable resonator rested on her lap, emitting a very faint, rhythmic hum to help her stabilize and focus that mysterious sensation.

Lyn Mo stood before the observation window, his gaze piercing through the frost that constantly condensed and was wiped away from the glass. Looking northeast, there lay the eye of the storm, the altar of Caesar's ambition and the source of the ancient restless will of the deep sea. The wind and snow continued to rage, but whether it was his imagination or not, the howling wind seemed to carry a new, extremely low, almost indistinct yet unsettling hum. Shhow inspected the lower deck, ensuring that every damaged area was properly reinforced. Every weapon was ready to fire and every team member was bundled up in warm clothing, remaining vigilant at their posts.

The brief rest could not eliminate the fatigue from the continuous tension, but discipline and determination sustained them. About 2 hours have passed. Suddenly, the resonator on Sue Chanchians lap emitted a short, high-pitched shriek, followed by the pointer swinging wildly from side to side. She abruptly opened her eyes, her face instantly turning as white as paper, her fingers gripping the armrests of a chair tightly, her knuckles turning blue. It as here, her voice trembled uncontrollably, not from fear, but from a sense of insignificance and awe in the face of overwhelming power.

That computing node, the balancer, its energy mode has changed. It has moved from monitoring to preparing for activation. Lynamo was suddenly turned around and stroed up to her. What exactly does it feel like? Can you determine what's being activated? Such Chian breathed rapidly, struggling to organize her thoughts. It's like an enormous, incredibly precise instrument where all the gears and levers inside are silently aligning and meshing, preparing for final operation.

The energy is no longer just flowing calmly, but is beginning to converge and compress towards a certain focus. That feeling of coldness, alienation, and calculation hasn't changed, but it's become sharper and more purposeful. And that low frequency soundwave, which the dragon soul reported before, I can now vaguely hear too, not a sound, but a pressure pulse that directly affects my senses. Almost as soon as she finished speaking, several crystal chandeliers fixed to the cabin walls suddenly went out for a moment without warning, flickering violently a few times before returning to normal. At the same time, everyone felt an extremely slight but real tremor beneath their feet.

It wasn't the ship hitting an ice flow, but rather a dull, deep tremor emanating from the entire seabed, or rather the entire sea area itself. Everyone on board, stay calm. Check all systems. Shh's voice came through the walkie-talkie, steady and powerful. Lynmo pressed down on Su Chanchian shoulders, feeling her slender body trembling slightly.

Can you determine its prepared target? Is it Caesar or all anomalous energy sources? Suian closed her eyes, cold sweat beating on her forehead, straining to decipher the inhuman logic flowing within that vast consciousness. The target is a group of abnormal stimulus sources prioritized based on the intensity of energy interference and the degree of disruption to system stability. She said haltingly. Caesar's energy beam is the strongest and most persistent directly connected to the greed node and has the greatest destructive power and highest priority. But our interference arrows and other scattered energy disturbances in this E area have also been marked only with much lower priority, like incidental items on a cleanup list.

Just then, Leeway burst through the hatch, his hair standing on end, clutching a roll of thermal blueprints just transmitted from the rune tower. The blueprints displayed wildly fluctuating curves. Boss, the tower's deep scanning array has captured crucial evidence. Look at this waveform. He spread the blueprints on the table.

This is the real-time curve of the computation nodes energy convergence. This is the intensity feedback of the Caesar energy beam. And this is the comprehensive index of environmental anomalies. These three curves showed a strong correlation 10 minutes ago. The slope of the computation nodes convergence curve has increased sharply almost synchronously with the intensity curve of the Caesar energy beam and the slight fluctuations in the environmental disturbance index which likely include our interference have been incorporated into the computation nodes algorithm with an extremely low waiting coefficient.

It's building a target model. The cleansing protocol initiation process has begun. His voice was from excitement and lack of sleep, but every word struck everyone's hearts like an icicle. How long will the process take to start? What might be the cleaning method? Lyn Mo forced himself to remain absolutely calm. It as impossible to make a precise judgment.

Leeway quickly flipped through the blueprints. Judging from the speed of energy convergence and mode switching, the system s own reaction is not fast like a rusty giant ship starting up. But once the preparation is complete, the execution of cleanup could be very rapid. The method model deduction gives several probabilistic predictions. The most likely is that it releases a super strong directional energy pulse directly burning or overloading the energy structure of the target node.

The second is that it triggers a drastic change in the local space environment such as an instantaneous extreme low temperature, high pressure or strong current physically destroying the target. and there is a small probability that it releases some kind of information command that we cannot interpret directly causing the internal collapse of the target system. Either way, it would be a catastrophic disaster for the Caesar fleet caught in the crossfire. And for the Mo Yuan Pavilion, also marked as a low priority incidental entry and the potentially approaching Dragon Soul fleet, it would mean enormous and unpredictable risks. Is there any way to influence its target locking to make our priority lower or Caesar's priority higher? Lyno asked the most crucial question.

Leewi and Su Chian exchange a glance. Leeway pushed up his glasses and spoke rapidly. Theoretically, yes. If we can simulate a stronger, more abnormal energy characteristic that is more destructive to the system stability and make the balancer think that this characteristic is highly correlated with or even homologous to Caesar's energy source. We might be able to deceive the algorithm and direct the main elimination firepower more concentrated towards Caesar, but this requires extremely precise energy simulation and timing of deployment.

And the risk is extremely high. If the simulation fails or is detected, we might immediately become the highest priority target. Chan, can your senses distinguish the specific energy characteristic identification code of the target locked by the balancer? Even just a part of it? Linmo looked at Su Chanchchan. Such Chian bit her lower lip, closed her eyes again, and directed her perception into the cold, vast, and warming up depths of that will. This time, she no longer tried to understand the whole, but rather, like the most sensitive probe, tried to capture the subtle, distinctive differences in the energy flows that were heading toward different priority goals.

This was an extremely demanding and meticulous operation. Time ticked by. Her face grew paler and paler, and her body trembled more and more violently. Just as Lin Mo was about to tell her to give up, she suddenly opened her eyes, a glimmer of light flashing within them. There is a slight difference in the information flow heading towards Caesar.

Besides the high-intensity energy markers, there a very faint but extremely stubborn forced link characteristic like it was forcibly welded on incompatible with the system's own energy full of violence and incoordination. The information flowing towards other lower priority targets however only shows simple abnormal energy disturbance markers that she gasped. That forced link characteristic feels very similar to Caesar s strangely patterned metal cylinders and the bioeny veins forcibly embedded in his pherommones before it has a fingerprint left by his technology. The fingerprint of Kaiser technology a sharp glint flashed in Lynmo's eyes. This was a key that could be exploited.

Liebe, can we use our jammers or the energy of a rune tower to simulate this forced link characteristic? Even if it's just for a moment to attach it to Caesar's energy beam signal. Leewe quickly calculated in his mind veins throbbing on his forehead. We can try. The core principle of a jammer is resonant interference by adjusting the response medium and rune circuit. It is hoped that a similar characteristic waveform can be simulated briefly.

However, it requires real-time frequency data of the Caesar energy beam as a reference and the deployment must be extremely precise. The characteristic addition must be completed at the very moment before the balancer finally locks onto the target and initiates cleaning. Too early and it will be filtered out by the systems adaptive filtering. Too late and it will be too late. Real-time frequency data is shallow.

I can try to continuously sense the fluctuations of the Caesar energy beam, but the balancer is initiating the final moment of cleansing death. Ill make the judgment. Uh, Lynn Emmo interrupted her, his voice firm and decisive. Leeway, you immediately go and prepare to adjust the jammer and make a modified version that can simulate the characteristics of forced link in the shortest possible time. Shan Shian, concentrate and lock onto the fluctuations of the Caesar energy beam.

Once you sense that the energy convergence of the balancer has reached its peak and is about to explode, tell me immediately. He looked to sure how. Notify the entire ship to prepare for impact. Once they received my order, they must project the jammers at all costs. Orders were quickly relayed and the MO Yuan Pavilion War Machine began operating at high speed again under the shadow of the iceberg. However, this time their goal was not to defeat the enemy, but to gently adjust the direction of death's finger amidst the devastating abyssal resonance. Chapter 71.

Critical instructions. Leeway locked himself in a temporarily emptied storage room on the lower deck of the Moyu On, which became his workshop for urgently modifying the jammer. Several emergency lights powered by energy storage crystals provided a pale but stable light source, illuminating the tools, materials, and a dozen or so dark gray metal discs scattered on the workbench. The air was filled with metal shavings, dissolved glue, and a faint pungent ozone-like odor emitted by the energy conducting materials during high-intensity energy adjustments. He sent his two apprentices to guard the door, leaving only the most clever one inside to assist, passing tools and recording data.

Leewi's eyes were bloodshot, but his gaze was frighteningly bright, as if burning with some kind of desperate flame. In one hand, he held the waveform diagram of the Caesar energy beams forced link characteristics, which Sue Chanchan had just dictated and which his apprentice had sketched. In the other hand, he used an extremely fine carving knife to finally adjust the rune circuits on a disassembled jammer core the response medium block filled with blue vein crystal powder and energy conducting minerals. The arc angle here should be off by 0.5Â°. That's it.

The texture connecting the third energy conducting node needs to be deepened, but it absolutely mustn't touch the adjacent isolation layer, he muttered to himself as he operated, his forehead covered in sweat, which he didn't bother to wipe away. The medium ratio needs to be increased by 3% obsidian powder to enhance its aggressiveness and inongruity in its energy characteristics, simulating the violent embedding effect of Caesar. The simple testing instrument on the workbench emitted a soft hum and flashes, displaying the response of the adjusted medium to the simulated waveform. Each failed attempt meant discarding a precious piece of response medium in a significant amount of time. But we hands were steady.

Failure did not discourage him, but instead brought him closer to the unsettling waveform characteristics that needed to be simulated. Meanwhile, in the relatively quiet bridge lounge, Su Chanchian sat cross-legged on the floor, a thick layer of fur beneath her. She no longer closed her eyes, but opened them wide, her pupils seemingly unfocused, her gaze piercing through the bulkhead and fixed on the distant and dangerous northeast. Her hands rested gently on the resonator Lee Wei had left behind on her knees. The devices hum gradually synchronizing with her own breathing.

She was tracking, locking onto, memorizing. Caesar's relentless energy beams like a brutal scorching whip repeatedly lashed at the greedy nodes on the seabed, leaving clear whip marks on the surrounding environment, a unique, violently grafted frequency of fluctuation. Su Chanchian carefully used her senses to touch these whip marks, not resisting, but simply observing, memorizing, and familiarizing herself with each rise and fall, deeply imprinting them into her consciousness. At the same time, she also had to spare some attention to vigilantly monitor the movements of the deeper balancer. That cold vast will the focus of its energy convergence was becoming increasingly scorching and clear like a volcano about to erupt exuding a suffocating sense of oppression.

What she was looking for was the final most intense energy contraction and silence critical point before the volcano erupted. On deck and in the lower cabins, a different kind of orderly tension prevailed. Sherhow relocated the last group of non-combat personnel, mainly Lee Wei's other apprentices, some clerical staff, and the wounded to the specially reinforced core compartment of midshipips. Time slipped away silently in the waiting and preparation. Every minute, every second seemed to be stretched out by the extreme cold and compressed by invisible pressure. He held a dark gray disc in his hands that looked no different from the other jammers, but his eyes held an almost exhausting excitement. The judgment of the icy sea is about to unleash its first bolt of lightning. Chapter 72. The judgment of the ice sea. The flying fish and breaking waves. were like two shadows clinging to the sea.

Struggling to navigate through the increasingly menacing ice flows and turbulent energy currents. The snowstorm seemed to be intensified by the boiling energy field to the northeast. The ice crystals no longer fell vertically, but were pulled apart by an invisible force, tracing eerie spiral paths through the air. The seawater took on a sickly deep blue purple hue with tiny bubbles constantly bursting on the surface, emitting a faint, pungent odor of sulfur and ozone. Sherhow crouched at the bow of the flying fish, squinting as he stared intently ahead through the observation lenses, which were constantly covered in frost and quickly wiped away.

His heartbeat was steady and strong, but his palms, gripping the short telescope, were slightly sweaty as far as the eye could see. Beneath the dark red and eerie blue sky on the horizon, the outline of Caesar's fleets circular formation flickered in and out of view amidst the energy glow and snowstorm. Like Willow the wisps encircling the entrance to hell. Even more chilling was the enormous vortex at the center of the formation, which had now expanded to a size large enough to engulf several large ships. The waves surging from the vortex's edges reached heights of tens of meters, and a roar could be faintly heard even here.

We're about 1.5 nautical miles from our destination. The old sailor at the helm reported horsely. He had to fight against the increasingly turbulent currents and the suction from the whirlpool. The current has changed direction and is pulling us that way. Also, there's a lot of something underwater swimming very fast towards the whirlpool.

Even without him saying it, sure how could see it. From time to time, huge dorsal fins or twisted tentacles flashed across the sea surface. These were deep sea creatures driven by their final energy feast or their instinct for fear, frantically surging towards that whirlpool of death. Maintain course, full power, avoid large creatures. Sure, how roared.

The propellers of the two small boats paddled wildly, and the engines, small propellers powered by energy storage crystals and runes, which had been simply modified by Leewi, hummed under the strain, struggling against the increasingly strong environmental resistance. Such Chanchchan's voice came through the small bone resonators worn in everyone's ears, clearer than the sound of wind and snow, yet carrying a sense of exhaustion and tension. Balancer energy focus compression is about to saturate. The Caesar energy beam intensity has reached its peak and is still climbing. The critical point is very close.

You must hurry. Every word she spoke was like a drum beat striking the hearts of Sher How and every team member. Faster, faster, hard to port. Avoid that swarm of glowing jellyfish ahead. Luong urgently warned aboard the breaking waves.

To their left, a large group of giant jellyfish, over half a meter in diameter and emitting a ghastly white fluoresence, were drifting with the current. Their tentacles, several meters long, crackled with electricity as they moved. These were mutants spawned or attracted by abnormal energy. Encountering them would be a major problem. The two ships narrowly missed the edge of the jellyfish swarm.

One of the crew members on the flying fish was a little slow and his arm was brushed by a drifting tentacle. His thick waterproof suit was instantly pierced with a small hole and his skin felt a burning pain. He groaned and gritted his teeth to cut off the tentacle with his dagger. His teammates quickly applied the emergency neutralizing ointment that Lee Wayi had prepared him. Danger lurked everywhere, but the target was right ahead.

They could clearly see several astonishingly thick beams of energy interwoven with dark gold and blood red emanating from several special ships in a circular formation of Caesar's fleet. Like colossal pillars supporting the heavens and earth, these beams continuously pounded into the center of the vortex, sinking into the unfathomable abyss. That was Caesar's energy beams violently feeding the tentacles of the seabed. That's it. Shurhow pointed to a relatively calm area about 800 meters ahead where the seawater was unusually deep in color.

That was the edge of the energy beam transmission path calculated based on Sue Chian's previous perception and leeway's model. Inside the bridge of the Moon, Sue Chanchians body jolted violently. She had maintained a near split state of perception, simultaneously locking onto the raging Caesar energy beam and monitoring the energy focus of the balancer as it approached its peak. At this moment, she clearly saw that the focus, like the core of a supernova before its explosion, had reached its limits in both brightness and pressure, and its internal structure was undergoing a final decisive reorganization and locking. and Caesar's energy beam, like the final fuel, was frantically being injected into it.

The tipping point is in the next second or the second after that. Without the slightest hesitation, she immediately channeled the simple resonance key that Lewi had told her a weak mental guide that mimicked the current main frequency fluctuation of a Caesar energy beam, but was supplemented with specific forced link harmonics through the bone resonator into the jammer in Shure House's hand. Now Sherhow had no time to think it through, relying entirely on his instincts hone through countless life and death battles and Su Chanchians silent urging filled with fear. He suddenly pulled the trigger of the crossbow. Boom! With a muffled thud, the crossbow string vibrated. The jammer carrying the hopes and calculations of everyone in the Mo Yuan pavilion trailed an almost invisible contrail as it traversed 800 m of space filled with turbulent energy and blizzards heading towards the designated dark waters. The jammer was silent when submerged in water. Tom seemed to freeze at that moment.

Sure, how Lu Fong, all the special forces members, and even Linmo and Leewi on the distant Mo Yuan ship held their breath, widened their eyes, and stared intently at the direction where the jammer landed, at the boiling energy field in the northeast, and at the huge vortex that seemed to have frozen for a moment. 1 second, 2 seconds. The anticipated flashes of light or sounds that might occur after the jammer was triggered did not appear. The waters remained deep with only the waves churning. Deep in the ocean, the balancer had just locked onto the destructive energy that was about to erupt, targeting the abnormal stimulus source group. The logic or algorithm flowing inside seemed to stutter very slightly. like a finely tuned instrument before outputting its final command. It receives two nearly overlapping target signals with slightly different feature weights. One signal, Caesar's energy beam, is extremely strong and distinctive, bearing a strong forced link violent mark.

The other, a weak signal that has just been connected, a feature simulated by the jammer, has negligible strength, but its forced link violent mark is highly homologous to the main target signal and even appears more glaring and inongruous in certain details due to the deliberate simulation. for the balancer that executes the cleanup protocol to eliminate the greatest threat to system stability. Should these two highly correlated anomalous signals undergo correlation enhancement processing to ensure the thoroughess of the cleanup? This process of pause and reassessment may have taken only a fraction of a second in a non-human balancer consciousness. But it was this fraction of a second of hesitation and enhanced linkage that caused the already compressed and destructive energy about to crash into the source of the Caesar energy beam to have its focus resolution and tracking priority invisibly raised and sharpened again. It was like a shotgun originally aimed at the torso, but just before firing, the crosshair was slightly raised by an invisible hand, aiming more precisely at the head.

The next moment, there was no deafening explosion, no dazzling burst of light. The boiling dark red and eerie blue light in the northeastern sky and sea suddenly contracted and collapsed for a moment, as if the entire space had been sucked away. Immediately afterwards, a humming vibration indescribable in sound and seemingly acting directly on the soul and the material world suddenly spread out from the huge vortex at the center of the Caesar fleet circular formation. Instead of creating giant waves, the seawater was struck as if by an invisible hammer, instantly caved in, forming a terrifying funnel-shaped crater far larger than before. All the sea beasts, ice flows, and even the few Caesar special ships at the innermost edge of the formation, which were exerting their full energy output rushed towards the whirlpool.

Under this irresistible judgment from the deep sea, they didn't even have time to struggle before being silently erased and dragged into the suddenly appearing bottomless dark abyss. Those thick dark gold and blood red energy beams that connected heaven and earth suddenly extinguished and disintegrated from the middle like blood vessels severed by a sharp blade. The blinding flashes and violent shock waves generated by the energy backlash instantly swept around the outer perimeter of Caesar's fleet circular formation. The world lost its color and the icy sea trembled. The judgment has arrived in a way that far exceeded anyone's expectations.

Chapter 73. Aftermath of the judgment. The judgment. Power from the depths of the sea did not continue to erupt. Like a precise and deadly heartbeat.

After a moment of violent contraction and release, it quickly returned to a deeper and more unsettling silence. The eerie glow of crimson and dark blue mingle with the sky, replaced by thick, letting gray to black clouds that seem to absorb all light. Pressing low over the turbulent sea. In the center of the ocean, the terrifying funnel-shaped crater nearly a kilometer in diameter and the one that had swallowed the core of Caesar's fleet was being filled inwards by a tidal wave of seawater, producing a continuous, deafening roar like a stampede of horses or the groaning of the earth. The massive amounts of seaater crashing and compressing created hundreds of meters high, murky white walls of water that spread wildly in all directions.

The shock wave arrived faster than sound. Even the flying fish and wave breaker nearly two nautical miles away were violently lifted and tossed about like leaves in a storm. Sure how gripped the ships railing tightly. Feeling as if his internal organs had shifted, his ears ringing, unable to hear anything but the destructive roar between the sea and sky, he saw the wave breaker violently rocking on the adjacent wave crest, nearly capsizing, its crew tumbling in a heap, only kept from being thrown out by ropes and safety harnesses. Hold on.

Hold on tight. Shh roared with all his might. But even he couldn't hear his own voice. A turbid, massive wave carrying fragments of ice, twisted metal, and indistinguishable charred organic debris, rolled in like a tsunami. Two small boats struggled desperately in the turbulent waters, tossed to the crest of a wave, then plunging into its trough, each second in danger of being completely swallowed or smashed to pieces.

Driven by their survival instincts and rigorous training, the sailors steered their oars and makeshift rudders with all their might, trying to steer the boats towards the direction of the waves and reduce the stress on their sides. The physical aftershocks of this deep sea judgment lasted for nearly 10 minutes before gradually weakening into merely an exceptionally violent surge. When the flying fish and breaking waves finally managed to stabilize themselves on the churning sea, everyone was soaked to the bone, pale-faced, and many were injured, vomiting or gasping violently by the ship's side. Sherhow wiped the cold sea water and blood foam from his eyes. He didn't know where he had cut himself and hurriedly looked around.

Both ships were still there, although the holes were damaged in many places and the mass were bent. The core structure didn't seem to have collapsed. He quickly counted the crew and his heart sank. Two people were missing from the flying fish, thrown out by the first giant wave and were nowhere to be seen. Three people were also seriously injured on the wave breaker, but they were all on board.

Before he could grieve, Sha forced himself to turn his gaze toward the direction of Caesar's fleet. The sight before him made even this seasoned and tough man gasp in shock. The sea looked as if it had just witnessed a natural disaster. The massive whirlpool had vanished, leaving the surface churned and ravaged, littered with countless pieces of broken planks, canvas, twisted metal components, and all sorts of bizarre char debris. Several relatively intact Caesar warships farther from the explosion's epicenter were now spinning like drunkards, their sails torn, mass snapped, and flames erupting from multiple hatches, clearly out of power and control.

Further away, some ships that had miraculously escaped the epicenter were frantically adjusting their course, attempting to escape this death trap. Their formation completely broken. As for the special ships that were originally at the core of the circular formation and responsible for energy output, as well as most of the bloodshar class main force, they have completely disappeared along with the seawater and icebergs in that area, leaving only a terrifying bottomless void that is being rapidly filled by turbid seawater and foam mixed with oil and unknown substances churning on the surface of a sea. They succeeded. They really succeeded.

That tiny disruptor, like a grain of sand precisely inserted into the gears, induced the balancer's judgment to fall on Caesar's own head with far greater intensity and precision than expected. But at this moment, sure how felt little joy, only the lingering fear of surviving a disaster, and a deep awe in the face of nature's, or rather in human powers, raging fury. They had utilized this power, but had almost been buried along with its aftershocks. Team leader Shure, shall we continue the mission? A special forces soldier with abrasions on his face asked weekly. Sherhow shook his head, grabbed the soaked bone resonator, and tried to contact the Moan.

The signal was weak and filled with static, but it was still barely usable. Moan, this is flying fish. Judgment in effect. Caesar core destroyed. Fleet scattered.

We have lost two men and our ship is damaged. Requesting evacuation orders. A moment later, Lyn Mo's voice came through intermittently, equally tense and suppressed. Received. Evacuate immediately according to the third contingency plan.

Pay attention to sea conditions and the MOU on will provide support. Understood. Sure. How cut off the communication and immediately order the two ships. Abandon all unnecessary equipment.

Travel light. Retreat at full speed. Follow the third contingency plan. route back to the Moon. The ship started again, dragging its battered body and headed towards the rendevous point agreed upon with the MON.

Looking back at the sea that looked like it had been trampled by a giant, the flames, thick smoke, floating wreckage, and a panicked shadows of surviving ships against the backdrop of the leaden sky and surging waves created an apocalyptic scene. The atmosphere was equally somber inside the bridge of the Moan. Lyn Mo stood before the observation window, slowly lowering the binoculars in his hand. Despite the greater distance, the terrifying vision of the judgment and the annihilation of Caesar's fleet was still faintly visible through the wind, snow, and waves. Had it succeeded from a strategic perspective, yes.

Caesar's long planned, dangerous operation against the ancient underwater entity had been completely thwarted. Its core forces and fleet had suffered severe damage and were unlikely to pose a significant threat in the short term. But what was the price? The two team members who were forever left in the ICC. Such Chanhian had completely collapsed from exhaustion after sending out the resonance key and was currently being urgently cared for by Lee Wayi and the ship's doctor. Her face was deathly pale and her breathing was weak.

This experience was like stealing a jewel from the mouth of a sleeping dragon. A lucky success, but the aftershocks of the dragon's unintentional sway of its tail nearly cost them their lives.

Boss Leewi, after settling Such Chanin, walked over to Lynmo. His face was also grim, showing both exhaustion from overexertion and fear of the unknown power. The rune tower s remote monitoring shows that after activating judgment, the balancer experienced a sharp drop in energy levels, re-entering a deep silence or cooling off state. The activity of the greed node has also decreased significantly. The overall ancient fluctuations on the seabed have become more subdued and stable than before, almost like satisfaction.

Or is it just weakness after excessive consumption? What about those pillars on the seabed? Lynmo asked. It is slowly sinking and dissipating. But the traces of forced linking may still be there and the system estate itself has changed. Balance was restored but a scar remained along with a vast disturbed unknown. Lynn Mo remained silent. At that moment the communicator rang again reporting that Sherow's team had safely arrived at the rendevous point and was returning. Linmo turned around and looked at the other members on the bridge who were equally exhausted but whose eyes were filled with complex emotions.

The joy of victory, the sorrow of losing comrades, the fear of unknown forces, and the bewilderment of surviving a disaster. Notify everyone. Lynmo's voice wasn't loud, but it carried clearly across the bridge. We're returning to port, but this isn't the end. The Storm King sword, wielded for the first time in such an indirect and perilous manner, fell a powerful foe. But the shadows beneath the icy sea did not dissipate. Looking back from the ashes. The Emo Yuan dragging its damaged hull embarked on its return journey amidst the gradually calming yet still turbulent waves and the incessant snowstorm. The fruits of victory were stained with the blood of the fallen and also with a deep awe of that uncontrollable power. Su Chian didn't wake up until the morning of the second day after returning to port.

She found herself lying on a soft bed in the bridge lounge covered with thick fur. She tried to move her fingers and a strong feeling of weakness and a throbbing pain deep in her mind made her take a deep breath. Memories flooded back like a tide.

The frigid cold of the icy sea, the raging energy beams, the cold and vast will of the balancer, and finally the allout guidance of the resonance key, followed by boundless darkness. The cabin door was gently pushed open, and Lyno walked in carrying a bowl of hot porridge. Seeing that her eyes were open, he paused for a moment, then quickened his pace to the bedside. "How are you feeling?" He put the porridge aside, reached out, and touched her forehead. The temperature was normal, but it was ice cold to the touch.

It feels like I've been hollowed out. Su Chanchian's voice was as she forced a smile. It also feels like I've had a very long and exhausting dream. Do we succeed? It's a success. Lynn Emma nodded, handed her the bowl of porridge and watched her swallow it in small sips.

Over the next few days, Moyuang Island was immersed in a busy yet orderly process of recovery and reflection. A week later, Su Chanchian had basically recovered and the main repairs of the Mo Yuan were mostly completed. Linmo finally opened Xiao Ji Gangs secret letter. The letter outlined the core contents of the draft agreement, an intelligence sharing mechanism, principles of military cooperation, including mutual support and joint operations, the scope of technical exchanges limited to non-core areas, and a joint plan to eliminate the remaining forces of the Wings of Freedom. Signs of intense fighting were present, but no body of Caesar himself or definitive evidence of escape was found. Dragon Soul is willing to join hands with Mo Yuan Pavilion to maintain the peace of this seer.

The letter's contents were as expected. Dragon Soul demonstrated sufficient sincerity and a pragmatic attitude, but also clearly defined its dominant position and the boundaries of interests in the cooperation. Caesar's fate remained uncertain. The Stonemason's Brotherhood was stirring. The secrets of the deep sea remained unresolved and the external environment remained complex.

Su Chian and Leewi would remain on the island to handle internal affairs and continue their research. On the eve of his departure, Lynn Emmo arrived alone at the top of the rune tower. I know that Lyno put his arm around her shoulder. This trip is both for cooperation and to get a feel for things. We need to develop and that requires dealing with the outside world. But we must firmly hold our bottom line and fundamental principles in our own hands. thought.

The two silently gazed at the night view of their homeland. After the battle in the ICC, the Mo Yuan Pavilion officially joined the ranks of the top powers in the sea. Now, upon their return, a new chapter is slowly unfolding beneath their feet.
