Chapter 76. The Covenant of Rock. The voyage to Rock Island was completely different from the previous lifethreatening journey deep into the icy sea. The Moan had undergone emergency reinforcement. Although some deep structural damage would require extensive repairs upon returning to the island, it was no longer a major obstacle for short voyages.

On the main mast, the flags representing the king of storms and the Mo Yuan pavilion fluttered in the early summer sea breeze. The hull, cleaned and simply repaired, had washed away most of the traces of battle, revealing a sturdy and imposing black texture. A relatively stable ocean energy map transmitted remotely from the rune tower provided guidance for navigation, helping them avoid several turbulent areas that might have been affected by the ICC events. Lynn Emmo stood on the deck, gazing at the azure sea and the scattered islands in the distance. The sunlight warmed him, bringing a long lost comfort, a stark contrast to the recent extreme cold.

But his gaze remained sharp and calm, unwavering. Sherhow, standing nearby, inspected several pieces of equipment on board, presented as samples and a display of sincerity, including a simplified version of Leewi's improved silent ripple generator and several specially treated metal plates salvaged from Caesar's wreckage. Chanduo, meanwhile, was huddled in the cabin, finalizing the draft terms of the negotiations with Dragon Soul and a list of possible supplies for exchange. His chubby face alternated between excitement and furrowed brows as he muttered to himself. "Have you heard of Dragon Soulless Rock Island before?" Sh house said as he walked to Lynn and Westside.

It has one of the earliest and largest comprehensive forward bases they established in the southeast Sea. It has said to have a permanent population of over 5,000 and a complete defense system, shipyards, workshops, and trading markets. It has one of the key hubs of order in this sea area. Choosing a location for the talks is both a demonstration of strength and a sign of acceptance. Lynn Emmo nodded slightly.

We need the information channels and a certain level of security that such a hub provides. But we cannot be completely bound by its rules. This time we need to not only obtain the benefits of cooperation but also see clearly how Dragon Souls rules actually operate and where the bottom line is. That Xiao Gi gang seems like a pragmatic person. Sherhow commented, "Pragmatic, but it also represents the will of Dragon Soul as a whole." Lyn Mo's gaze was far-reaching.

Personal likes and dislikes have limited weight in the face of organizational interests. What we need to cooperate with is the entity Dragon Soul, not just Xiao Ji Gang as an individual. After sailing for two days and one night, on the morning of the third day, the outline of Panser Island appeared on the horizon. It was an island far larger than the main island of Mo Yuan Pavilion, towering high in the center with densely packed buildings and dock facilities along its shore. Most striking with a continuous stone defensive walls and watchtowers built along the mountain side.

Their thick walls gleaming with a luster of metal reinforcement. The docks were bustling with activity, mass like a forest, and ships of all sizes moving in and out in an orderly fashion. A huge flag embroidered with a golden dragon fluttered above the fortress at top the island's highest point. Several nautical miles from the island, a medium-sized patrol sailboat flying the dragon soul flag approached, signaling its identity with light signals before leading the way. The waterway was clearly well cleared and maintained with sufficient depth and clear buoy indications.

The Mo Yuan followed the guide ship, slowly entering a specially reserved birth in the main dock area. On the dock, a squad of spirited dragon soul soldiers in uniform leather armor were already lined up, accompanied by several people who appeared to be civilian officials. Lynn Emmo straightened his clothes, a solidly made simple dark-colored outfit covered with a dark patterned cloak symbolizing his status and was the first to descend the gang way. Sherhow and Shin Duo Duo followed closely behind. Eight carefully selected, equally neatly dressed guards, holding unloaded crossbows, stood solemnly at the side of the ship, not disembarking, serving both as a ceremonial guard in a display of self-restraint.

Welcome to Rock Island. Lord Linmo and his entourage. A refined looking man around 40 years old stepped forward, cupped his hands, and smiled. My name is Zhao Wuan, the agiton of Captain Xiaoi Gang. I am here to await your arrival on the captain's orders.

Lieutenant Zhao, you're too kind. Thank you for waiting so long. Lynn Mo returned the greeting with a cupped hand, neither humble nor arrogant. Captain Xiao is currently handling some urgent military affairs at the command post, and we'll meet with you shortly. Before that, let me arrange for you all to rest and give you a brief introduction to the base.

What do you think? Zhao Yuan's attitude was warm and considerate. When in Rome, do as the host does. Thank you for your help, Lieutenant Zhao. Led by Zhao Wy Yuan Linmo and his companions boarded a covered wagon with a simple carriage pulled by two strong pack animals and headed towards the island along a smooth stone road. What they saw along the way made even Lin Mo and the others who were mentally prepared secretly marvel at the dragon souls organizational capabilities and resources.

Along both sides of the road, buildings of various functions stood side by side. Neat barracks, steaming workshops, medical clinics filled with the aroma of herbs, schools where the sound of students reading aloud could be heard, teaching basic literacy, arithmetic, and survival skills, and bustling trading markets. Although there were many pedestrians, they moved quickly, each doing their own thing with few idlers. The streets were clean, the drainage ditches were well-maintained, and one could even see people specifically responsible for cleaning them. Soldiers patrolled in orderly steps, their eyes alert.

Pansure Island currently has about 5,300 permanent residents, including 2,000 combat and support personnel, 800 artisans of various kinds, and the rest are family members and people engaged in logistics, trade, education, etc. Zhao Yuan introduced with great familiarity. We have established a preliminary contribution point system. Residents can earn contribution points by working, fighting or providing technology or resources and then exchange these points for food, clothing, shelter and various services. The more you work, the more you earn, which helps maintain basic order and productivity.

A contribution point system. Lin Moe's heart stirred. This coincided with some vague ideas in his mind, but Dragon Soul had obviously systematized and implemented it. That's our main shipyard and workshop area. Zhao Yuan pointed to an area enclosed by high walls, from which came the sounds of heavy hammering and steam hissing.

It can maintain and build multiple medium-sized warships simultaneously, and also produce most standard weapons and tools. Oh, and over there is the planting and livestock area. Utilizing some improved technologies and limited green houses, it can barely supply some fresh vegetables, meat, and eggs. Most of our grain still needs to be purchased or traded. The caravan eventually stopped in front of a three-story building constructed of massive stones located halfway up the mountain.

The building was rugged and sturdy and soldiers guarded the entrance. This is the reception hall for honored guests. The conditions are simple. Please forgive us. Za Yuan led the group inside.

The interior was spacious and although the furniture was simple, it was sturdy and durable. The walls were covered with nautical charts and maps of regional power distribution, and the floor was covered with thick felt, dispelling the chill of the stone house. Each room was equipped with a separate fireplace and ventilation vent. Please take a short rest. Your toiletries and meals will be delivered shortly.

Captain Xiao will come to visit me personally after he finishes his business. After arranging everything, Zhao Yuan politely took his leave. After closing the door, Chandu Duo immediately went to the window and carefully observed the layout and patrol routes outside. He whispered, "This place is heavily guarded and well planned. It is indeed the old layer that Dragon Soul has been operating for a long time.

Just by looking at this setup, it is not something that ordinary forces can compare to." Sherhow checked the room inside and out, confirming there were no obvious surveillance devices which would be difficult to achieve with current technology and said in a deep voice, "They're flexing their muscles, but they are also demonstrating order. It is cooperation, but it is also deterrence." Lin Emo walked to the nautical chart on the wall, his gaze sweeping over the marked dragon soul controlled areas, known territories, dangerous sea areas, and several locations marked with special symbols that appeared to be ancient ruins. One of them near the northeast I see was marked with a red question mark. Since we're here, let's make the best of it. Lenmo turned to his two companions.

Take a break and recharge. The real negotiations will begin soon. Remember our goals. Equal cooperation, clear boundaries, and tangible benefits. Talk less, observe more, and listen more.

In the afternoon, shortly after a simple lunch, footsteps and a guard's announcement came from outside the door. Captain Xiao Ji Gang has arrived. The door opened and Xiao Ji Gang dressed in military uniform, travel worn but still in high spirits stroed in with a hearty smile. Lord Lin Mo, brother Sherhao, Manager Chen, you must be tired from your journey. Base affairs have been busy, so I couldn't greet you from afar.

Please forgive me. Captain Xiao is very busy with military affairs, so it is an honor for him to personally receive us. Lynn Mo stood up to greet him. After exchanging pleasantries and taking their seats, Xiao Ji Gang cut to the chase without further formalities. Regarding the IC incident, it was thanks to the strong support of the Mo Yuan Pavilion that we were able to thwart Caesar's conspiracy in avert catastrophe.

The entire dragon soul will remember this. As for the cooperation framework mentioned in your previous letter, what are your thoughts, Lord Lynn Mo? Lynmo already prepared slowly began to speak. The Dragon Souls maintenance of order in the seas is a collective effort. The Mo Yuan Pavilion is willing to contribute. The draft framework is feasible in principle, but the details which are crucial to the foundation of long-term cooperation between the two sides still require careful consideration.

For example, the scope and timeliness of intelligence sharing, the definition of command authority for joint operations, the specific content and limitations of technical exchanges and post-war interests, especially the division of resources and sea areas left behind by the wings of freedom, all require clear regulations. His words were clear and calm. Yet, every sentence hit the nail on the head, expressing both a willingness to cooperate and an undisguised concern for his own interests. A hint of appreciation flashed in Xiao Ji Gangs eyes. He liked this straightforward negotiation style.

Lord Lyn Mo is a man of few words. In that case, let's discuss this in detail. My dragon soul is sincere, but we must also be responsible for the thousands of compatriots under our command. I hope you understand. In the ensuing hours, within this simple stone chamber, negotiations that would profoundly impact the future landscape of this sea area officially commenced.

Sunlight streamed through the high windows, casting shadows on the rough stone floor. Witnessing the first cautious and pragmatic clash between emerging powers and those upholding order. Meanwhile, inside the rune tower on the island of Moyu, Leewi was deep in thought, staring a newly discovered metal fragment engraved with strange symbols. Such Chian, while organizing her perception records, suddenly noticed that among the previously dormant deep sea fluctuation data concerning the ancient existence on the seabed, there was a set of extremely weak energy decay curves that seem to exhibit a certain regularity of periodicity. Before the dust has settled over the ICC, new mysteries and undercurrents have quietly emerged.

Chapter 77. Agreement details. The negotiations inside the stone chamber lasted from the afternoon until evening. The embers in the fireplace were reit twice, and the hot tea brought by the servants was changed several times. The sunlight slowly shifted from one side of the high window to the other, eventually leaving only a dim yellowish afterglow.

The air was filled with a faint smell of tobacco. Xiao Ji Gang occasionally smoked a homemade pungent tobacco. the musty scent of parchment and an invisible tense sense of conflicting wills. The conversation between Lin Mo and Xiao Ji Gang gradually moved from the macrolevel principles and framework to specific detail clauses. Both men demonstrated exceptional patience and attention to detail.

Regarding intelligence sharing, Xiao Ji Gang pointed to the unfolded draft with a charcoal pencil. Our side proposes establishing a three- tiered intelligence system. The first tier is the strategic level involving major threats that could trigger regional instabilities such as Caesar's actions targeting dangerous underwater locations, large-scale natural disaster warnings, or unusual movements by other large hostile forces which must be shared unconditionally within 12 hours of confirmation. The second tier is the tactical level involving specific military operations, resource point competition, and the movements of important figures which must be shared within 24 hours before the operation or after discovery. The third tier is the routine level, including marine weather, ocean currents, common marine mammal activity, and general power frictions, which will be summarized and exchanged periodically.

Lenmo pondered for a moment. The classification is reasonable. However, the premise of unconditional sharing of level one intelligence is that both sides must reach a consensus in advance on the assessment criteria for the authenticity and threat level of the intelligence so as to avoid misjudgment or deliberate exaggeration that could cause unnecessary tension. I suggest establishing a permanent liaison group composed of senior personnel from both sides to be responsible for the initial assessment and transmission of level one intelligence. Xiao Jigi Gang thought for a moment and nodded.

Okay. The liaison group's location can be rotated between Pansure Island and your island every quarter. Personnel must undergo strict vetting. Agreed. Linmo continued regarding the joint operation command.

The draft mentions the Supreme Commander will be decided through consultation as needed which is too vague. I propose that the party initiating the operation be the primary commander with the other party providing troops and resources to support it and assigning a deputy commander to participate in decision-making. If the operation s objectives involve the core interests of both parties, a joint command will be established with commanders rotating among themselves. But major decisions require the unanimous agreement of both commanders. This is to ensure the independence and voice of the Mo Yuan pavilion in the joint operation and to prevent it from being completely controlled by the dragon soul.

Xiao Ji Gang gave Lin Mo a deep look and slowly said, "Lord Lyno, your considerations are thorough. It is feasible in principle, but detailed rules need to be added. The main commanding party must submit a detailed action plan and risk assessment in advance. And the cooperating party has the right to raise objections and negotiate modifications within a certain scope. If the joint forces suffer serious losses that could have been avoided due to a major error by the commanding party, the other party has the right to terminate cooperation and reserve the right to pursue accountability.

That makes sense. Lynn Mo agreed. This is also a system of checks and balances. Regarding technical exchanges, Chindu interjected at the opportune moment, a shrewd businessman smile plastered on his face. We understand Dragon Souls concerns.

Core technologies do indeed need protection. The draft's definition of non-core areas is too broad. I suggest we each first compile a list of technologies were willing to exchange and a list of needs and then conduct an initial match. For example, we are very interested in Dragon Soul's expertise in reinforcing large building structures, improving basic smelting processes, and the detailed operation of the contribution point system. In return, Dragon Soul might have some insights we could exchange regarding the protection of small equipment in harsh environments, basic detection of energy anomalies, and the processing of some sea monster materials.

His words were perfectly watertight, indicating that his side had leverage in the exchange. Small equipment protection and energy detection were Leewi's specialties and have been verified by the IC and also specifically asking for Dragon Souls infrastructure management and basic industrial technology all of which were urgently needed for the rapid development of Moan Pavilion. Xiao Ji Gang glanced at a civilian official beside him who was taking notes. The official nodded slightly indicating that he had noted the key points. Manager Chiians suggestion is excellent.

This matter can be handled by the specific technical personnel below who will draft the exchange projects and methods and then submit them to you and me for approval. However, it must be made clear that all exchange technologies must not be disseminated to any third party without permission. Of course, Chin Duo Duo replied with a smile. The most challenging issue is the distribution of postwar gains, especially the division of control over resource points and sea areas left behind after the collapse of the wings of freedom. Xiao Ji Gangs attitude was clear and firm.

Although Caesar was defeated, his controlled area is vast with numerous resource points and his remaining forces still exist. As a main force maintaining order in the region, Dragon Soul has the responsibility and ability to take over most of the area, wipe out the remaining enemies, restore order, and protect the innocent survivors. Of course, Emo Yuan Pavilion made great contributions in this battle and should receive appropriate compensation. He pushed forward a marked nautical chart. With the original iceclaw base as the boundary, the frigid waters to the east and north, extending to the broken ice zone are characterized by harsh environments, unknown risks, and considerable distance from your islands.

Dragon Soul is willing to take over and assume defense of these areas. As for the areas to the west and south, including some medium-sized resource islands formerly controlled by Wings of Freedom, two discovered small iron or veins and the patrol rights to the relatively safe shipping lanes leading to the northeast. Dragon Soul is willing to jointly manage these with Mo Yuan Pavilion or have your side take the lead with Dragon Soul providing necessary support. Specific management methods and profit sharing can be discussed further. Lyno looked at the C chart.

Xiao Ji Gangs division seemed generous, allocating the most dangerous and potentially dangerous northeastern ICC region to Dragon Soul while leaving the relatively safer and more resourcerich western and southern regions to Mo Yuan Pavilion. However, upon closer examination, while the northeastern region was dangerous, it was also most likely to hide clues related to the secrets of the deep sea. Dragon Souls takeover meant that the future exploration rights and information control of that sea area would primarily fall into their hands. The western and southern regions given to Mo Yuan Pavilion directly bordered their existing controlled areas, facilitating resource absorption and acquisition. However, this also meant that Mo Yuan Pavilion would directly face the most likely direction of a counterattack from the remnants of the Wings of Freedom, becoming Dragon Souls first line of defense against retaliation.

This was a brilliant move. It provided tangible benefits, shifted some of the risk, and ensured Dragon Souls control over the most critical unknown area. Lynn Emmo tapped his fingers lightly on the table, not immediately expressing his opinion. He needed to weigh the options. A direct refusal might affect the cooperative atmosphere while accepting everything might put him in a passive position in the future.

"Captain Xiao's division of responsibilities is thorough," Lynn Emo said slowly. "The situation in the Northeast Sea is complex, and it is indeed appropriate for Dragon Soul to take charge of the overall situation. In the West and South regions, Emo Yuan Pavilion can be responsible for the main defense and development. However, regarding the specific regulations for the joint management of the area, and if any special relics or information related to this incident are discovered in the Northeast Sea in the future, we hope to retain a certain right to know and a limited right to participate. After all, we have paid a price for this and also possess some unique information.

He emphasized unique information, implying that the Mo Yuan Pavilion was not entirely ignorant of the secrets of the seabed, nor had it completely abandoned its concern for that region. Xiao Ji Gangs gaze sharpened slightly. After a moment of eye contact with Linmo, he suddenly smiled and said, "Lord Lyn Mo is indeed farsighted. Very well. The details of the joint management charter will be drafted by our subordinates.

As for the special discovery in the Northeast Sea, if it is indeed directly related to this incident and involves significant safety, Dragon Soul promises to promptly inform your side and where possible, invite your experts to participate in the assessment. However, the leading role and final decision-making authority must belong to Dragon Soul. This is necessary to maintain overall order, and we hope for your understanding. Understand? Then Montac nodded. Gaining the right to know and limited participation was the best outcome they could achieve at this stage.

They wouldn't relinquish control and Dragon Souls bottom line was clear. The framework of the main terms was thus finalized with both sides making concessions while safeguarding their core interests. The following discussion covered some details such as communication frequencies, coded signals, joint exercise arrangements, and a preliminary plan to eliminate the remnants of the wings of freedom. It was decided that both sides intelligence networks would first locate the main gathering points of the remnants before discussing specific actions. By the time the final clause was verbally agreed upon, the sky outside was filled with stars.

More oil lamps were lit inside the stone room, their flickering flames illuminating the weary yet relaxed faces of the group. Xiao Jiang let out a long sigh and rubbed his temples. Lord Linimo, negotiating with you requires the utmost care. However, the result is satisfactory. I will have someone prepare the formal agreement overnight and please review it tomorrow.

If you have no objections, you can sign it. Thank you for your help, Captain Xiao. Lyn Mo also felt a wave of mental exhaustion, but the results of this intense battle were fulfilling. It has getting late and IV had a simple banquet prepared. It s not a gourmet meal, but it s all locally produced at the base.

It as just a small token of my appreciation and I hope ull do me the honor of attending that Xiao Gang stood up and invited him. Linmo did not refuse. A formal banquet was both a matter of etiquette and an opportunity to further observe and solidify the relationship. The banquet was held in a slightly larger hall of the guest house. The dishes were not lavish, but the portions were generous.

There was grilled fish, stewed meat, vegetable soup, and a kind of coarse bread baked with grains from the island. The wine was also homemade fruit wine with a low alcohol content. In addition to Xiao Ji Gang and Zhao Wuan, several important managers of Dragon Soul on Panter Island were also present. The atmosphere at the meeting was much more relaxed than during the negotiations, and the conversation mainly revolved around interesting anecdotes from the sea and the exchange of survival experiences. Lynmo didn't talk much, but every time he spoke, he hit the nail on the head, demonstrating his considerable knowledge.

Sherhow chatted happily with several military officers from Dragon Soul, exchanging tips on dealing with different sea monsters. She duodo was in her element, quickly becoming familiar with the managers in charge of logistics and trade and whispering about the market prices of certain in- demand commodities. Midway through the banquet, Xiao Ji Gang suddenly put down his wine glass and said to Lynn Emmo seemingly casually, "Oh, right. There's something I almost forgot to tell you." While clearing the edge of the broken ice zone, we discovered the wreckage of the escape ship that may have carried Caesar. It was empty, but there were signs of a fierce struggle and a small amount of blood.

We traced the nearby tracks, pointing to a deeper part of the broken eye zone, but the environment there is extreme, and our reconnaissance team cannot go any further. He paused, lowering his voice. Furthermore, our outer monitoring points have discovered that members of the Stonemason Brotherhood have been frequently appearing near several known ancient ruins recently, seemingly searching for something. The location of one of these ruins is related to the direction in which Caesar's escape trail disappeared. Linmo felt a chill run down his spine.

Caesar's fate remained a mystery, and the movements of the mysterious Stonemason's brotherhood became increasingly enigmatic. Were they searching for Caesar or were they eager to find another key after Caesar's failed mission? Thank you for informing me, Captain Xiao. Lynn and Mo raised his glass in a gesture of respect. It seems that although the sea is temporarily at peace, the undercurrents are still strong. We need to work together more closely.

Exactly. Xiao Ji Gang raises glass in a toast for order and for survival. The glass is clinkedked lightly, producing a crisp sound. The details of the agreement have been finalized at the negotiating table, but the real test perhaps was only just beginning to surface amidst these new undercurrents. In the darkness of night, the island of Pansure is brightly lit like a lighthouse of order standing tall in a chaotic sea.

But beyond the lighouses glow in the deep darkness, unknown shadows still linger and lurk. Chapter 78. New affairs upon returning to the island. Yuan was returning from Pansure Island with a smooth journey. The sea shimmerred and the warm early summer sun dispelled the biting chill brought by the icy sea of the past few days.

The ship still bore obvious signs of battle damage, but it sailed smoothly. The route guided by the rune towers avoided all known turbulent areas, making the return journey exceptionally smooth. Lyno stood at top the ship's deck, gazing back at the gradually shrinking outline of Rock Island. The negotiations had been remarkably successful. A relatively equal and clearly defined strategic cooperation agreement was about to be signed, officially granting Mo Yuan Pavilion the recognition and endorsement of Dragon Soul and defining its own sphere of influence and interests.

More importantly, through contact with Xiao Ji Gang and other members of Dragon Soul, he had gained a preliminary understanding of this behemoth style and bottomline pragmatic, orderly, and rule- abiding, but also absolutely committed to maintaining its dominant position. This laid the foundation for long-term interaction in the future. But the information Xiao Ji Gang revealed at the end left Lin Emo uneasy. Caesar might not be dead and his movements might have intersected with those of the mysterious Stonemason's brotherhood. The secrets of the deep sea were far from being revealed and new undercurrents were already stirring.

Boss, look at this. Shhal walked over, holding several newly compiled lists. This is Fatty Chin's estimate of the manpower and resources needed to take over the resource islands and mines in the west and south regions in the initial stage, as well as the preliminary development plan. He suggested that we first transfer a group of experienced and combat capable veterans from the islands to establish outposts while recruiting some reliable newcomers to fill the gaps using experienced personnel to mentor new ones. In terms of defense, we need to deploy at least two modified sentry ships and a small squad of standing troops.

Lenmo took the list and glanced at it. Chinwood's plan was very detailed, taking into account personnel rotation, material supply, construction of defensive fortifications, and initial development priorities, prioritizing iron or mining, followed by agricultural pilot projects on Arabal Islands. The investment was considerable, but the returns were substantial. Those resources would greatly alleviate the resource pressure brought about by the rapid development of Mo Yuan Pavilion, especially the stable supply of iron. Okay, when you get back, you and Shin Duo Duo will finalize the personnel selection and resource allocation.

The outpost personnel should be highly skilled with excellent compensation and clearly defined responsibilities. It has better to have stronger defensive forces. The remnants of the wings of Freedom 1T be content and may launch a counterattack, Lin Mo instructed. In addition, the boundary demarcation and communication mechanism for the shared management area with Dragon Soul should be finalized as soon as possible to avoid future friction. Understood.

Sherhow nodded in agreement. A few days later, the Mo Yuan slowly sailed into its own harbor. Although the scene of welcoming them at the dock was not as grand as when they returned last time, it was still very enthusiastic. The island had clearly changed again. In the outer defensive walls seem to have been raised and reinforced, and several new watchtowers have been built.

Near the inner fortress area, a larger stone and which structure with obvious workshop features had been topped out. In the distance, the cultivated fields were even greener than when they left. Su Chanchian and Leewi waited at the dock with a group of people. Su Chanchian looked much better while Lewi had dark circles under his eyes, but he was in high spirits. Welcome home.

Su Chian stepped forward and looked Lin Mo over carefully as if trying to make sure he was all right. Thank you for your hard work at home. Lynn Emo nodded to her, then looked at Leewi. Judging from your expression, you've made another discovery. Yes, a major discovery.

Leewi couldn't wait and almost blurted it out on the dock. But Su Chanchian gently tugged at his sleeve, making him realize the inappropriate occasion. He lowered his voice and said, "Let's talk about it when we get back." The group returned to the inner fortress council hall. She and Duo Duo had already instructed people to prepare a simple welcome banquet, but everyone was clearly more concerned with business. After a quick meal, they gathered in the council hall.

Leeway immediately launched into a long explanation. Boss, the Caesar remains you brought back along with the pheromone samples and forced lane characteristic data combined with the deep scan record from the rune tower. I've done cross analysis and reverse engineering. He spread out several diagrams filled with complex symbols and connecting lines. It can be confirmed that at least part of the technological system Caesar possessed is highly similar to the ancient runic knowledge held by the stonemason brotherhood in terms of underlying energy guidance logic.

You could even say that Caesar's technology is a simplified degraded version of that ancient knowledge but with a greater emphasis on immediate combat power and control and application branch. He pointed to a comparison diagram. Look here. This is a basic energy stability structure recorded in the Stonemason Brotherhood rune manual. This is an energy circuit analyzed from Caesar's remains.

Although it is crude and rudimentary, the arrangement of the core nodes and the direction of energy flow are clearly some kind of variant of the former. And here the bioeny veins that are forcibly embedded in the pherommones. Their grafting method is similar to the forbidden technique of foreign object energy conduction recorded in ancient runes, but it is even more ruthless and reckless. Lynn Mo carefully examined the comparison diagrams. Although he couldn't understand the specific technical details, Leeway's conclusion was clear.

Behind Caesar, there was likely the Stonemason's brotherhood, or at least he had obtained key technical knowledge from the Stonemason's brotherhood and modified and applied it in his own way. Can you determine the specific relationship between Caesar and the Stonemaster's Brotherhood? Is it cooperation, employment, or betrayal? Lynn Mo asked. Leeway shook his head. Tracing the origins of technology is possible, but judging interpersonal relationships is not. However, judging from Caesar's final risk to activate the underwater existence and the Stonemason Brotherhood's eagerness to act after his failure, their cooperation was probably not pleasant, where they each had their own ulterior motives.

Caesar may have wanted to use ancient knowledge to achieve his personal ambitions. While the Stonemason Brotherhood seemed more obsessed with knowledge and relics themselves, Xiao Ji Gang mentioned that members of the Stonemason's Brotherhood were active in ruins near the direction Caesar escaped. Lynn Mo pondered. Are they looking for Caesar or for something Caesar might have taken or left behind? Or is the ruins themselves their target? Su Chian spoke up at this moment, her voice gentle but clear. I have also made some discoveries.

During the time you were away, while I was organizing the sensory data from the IC trip, I discovered that the deep energy fluctuations of that ancient being on the seabed, although they generally subsided after the judgment seemed to exhibit an extremely weak but regular periodic fluctuation in energy decay. She walked to a small black boar that had been prepared and drew a slowly descending curve with charcoal. as she marks several almost imperceptible roughly equally spaced tiny bumps on the curve. It s like the tides or breathing very slow with a cycle of about 15 to 20 days. This breathing fluctuation was not present in the data before the judgment or was masked by more intense fluctuations dot periodic fluctuations.

Lynmo's heart skipped a beat. What did this mean? Did that ancient being after being stimulated and consumed enter a new state of recovery or adjustment? Or was it part of its own operating mechanism previously undetected due to deep slumber or forced energy interference by Caesar? Does this fluctuation have any special significance? Has the nature of the energy changed? Then Montress Suchian shook her head. The nature of the energy has not changed significantly. It still has that heavy ancient and inert feeling. The fluctuation is very small.

If you don't deliberately look for patterns, you can almost ignore it as background noise. The meaning is still unclear. But I think this may mean that the existence is not completely dead. It may have an extremely slow life rhythm or energy cycle that we cannot understand. Leewi's eyes lit up and he leaned closer to the blackboard.

Periodicity. If we can confirm the period and phase, we might be able to predict its next relatively active or sensitive time window. This is crucial for any future operations we undertake near that sea area. Predicting the active period of ancient beings. This idea is both terrifying and holds immense strategic value.

Linmo also relayed Xiao Ji Gangs information about Caesar's escape route and the Stonemason's Brotherhood's movements to everyone. A brief moment of contemplation fell over the room. More and more fragments of information were emerging. Ancient knowledge, misuse of technology, underwater secrets, mysterious organizations, periodic fluctuations, and a missing powerful enemy. Right now, there are a few things that need to be addressed immediately.

Lin Mo organized his thoughts and began. First, Leewi and Sue Chian continue research. Leeway focus on analyzing the technological homology. Try to find more connections between Caesar's technology and the knowledge of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, especially any potential backdoors or loopholes. Shansen.

Continue monitoring and verifying that periodic fluctuation. If possible, try to build a preliminary predictive model, but be extremely careful and absolutely do not actively stimulate or attempt to delve deeper into its perception. Second, sure how and Chiendu Duo go all out to take over and develop the western and southern resource zones. This is the most tangible benefit at hand, and we must transform it into our strength as soon as possible. At the same time, coordinate with Dragon Soul on the details of joint management of the area and establish a stable communication and patrol mechanism as soon as possible.

Third, the intelligence network needs to be strengthened. Chandu Duo use all channels to focus on collecting information in two areas. First, the exact movements and possible gathering places of the remnants of the wings of freedom. Second, any clues about the appearance, transactions or exploration activities of members of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, especially those related to ancient ruins. Dragon Soul will also share some intelligence, and we need to establish our own verification and supplementary channels.

Fourth, Lynn Mo's gaze swept over everyone. The Mo Yuan needs to be thoroughly repaired and upgraded as soon as possible. Using the materials from the captured Caesar wreckage and new technologies, heavily way guide the workshop to strengthen the Mo Yuan's defenses, propulsion, and especially its resistance to abnormal energy environments. At the same time, begin preparing the design and material reserves for the construction of a second main warship. Our naval power must keep pace with our status and the challenges we face.

The task was clear and specific, and everyone readily accepted the order. After the meeting, Lynn Emmo walked alone to the terrace of the inner fortress. The setting sun bathed the island in gold. Boats came and went at the dock. The workshops jingled, figures worked in the fields, and in the distance, the training ground echoed with synchronized slogans.

A scene brimming with life. The agreement with the Dragon Soul brought a relatively stable external environment and room for development. But the shadow of Caesar, the secrets of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, and the mysteries of the seabed are like hidden reefs beneath the surface, lurking not far away. Upon returning to the island, the primary task is to digest the spoils of war, consolidate the foundation, and enhance strength while keeping a close eye on the waves that may emerge from the deep sea or strike again. A new phase begins with the first step and the storm king's fleet after rest and reinforcement will sail towards a wider sea.

A sea where opportunities and risks coexist. Chapter 79. Pioneering the dawn. Shh trudged through the due dampened grass. Surveying the resource point that had just been taken over by the mo yuan pavilion.

The island was small, long, and narrow with undulating terrain, but its northern mountains contained a small but highquality hematite vein. a priority development target on Shindwood's list. The island's original small mining camp belonging to the Wings of Freedom had long been abandoned during the defeat, leaving only a few crooked wooden huts and scattered mining tools. The advanced team sent by Mo Yuan Pavilion consisted of 30 people, 10 of whom were combat personnel led by an experienced veteran responsible for guard duty and the construction of defensive fortifications. The other 20 were carefully selected by sure how five craftsmen skilled in basic exploration and mining.

Five artisans proficient in construction and carpentry. Five diligent workers responsible for logistics and miscellaneous tasks. And five ordinary islanders who volunteered to earn contribution points in the new territory. Over the next few days, the camp was beginning to take shape. Abandoned wooden huts were reinforced and cleared, serving as temporary shelters and storage.

The base of the watchtower had been compacted and the superructure was being built. A simple path leading from the camp to the northern mining site had been cleared with several basic sentry posts set up along the way. For defense utilizing the terrain, a simple low wall was built around the camp using sharpened wooden stakes and stones with trip wires and bells placed at key locations. Team leader sure good morning veteran Wong Kuay who was in charge of the team joged over. He was nearly 40 years old with a scar on his face.

He was an early member of the Mo Yuan Pavilion, known for his bravery in battle and his calm demeanor. Everything was normal last night. The patrol team didn't find anything unusual. It's just that the bird song in the woods was a bit strange in the latter half of the night, so I had an extra shift of centuries added. Sure, how nodded.

Better safe than sorry. How's the exploration at the mining site going? Old Shun the craftsman has taken his men to inspect it. Wong Kuay pointed to the north. The outcrop of the or vein is clearly visible. About two people high and a dozen steps wide sloping down into the mountain.

The ore has moderate hardness and a good iron content. The only problem is that we danty have enough mining tools. The few pickaxes and hammers left by Wings of Liberty R&T enough. So, we need to send another badge from the island. Also, Old Shan said it would be best to get some gunpowder because in some places the rock is too hard and using manpower to break it down is too inefficient.

Meanwhile, on the vast main island of Mayuan Pavilion and the rocky island of Dragon Soul, similar expansion and development are quietly taking place on different levels and in different ways. Hemlock mine news. The mornings on Heimmllock Island are awakened by the crisp chirping of birds and the tinkling of bells. At the mine site, the newly arrived makeshift crusher was already in place, and two strong miners were taking turns cranking the heavy wooden handle. The gears meshed with a creaking sound, and the belt drove the heavy breaker hammer, striking the hematite, or that had been loosened beforehand with a crowbar. Crush stones flew everywhere and quickly piled up below.

Old Shun wearing a homemade dust mask made of rot tan and thick cloth squatted nearby roughly separating the crushed or by size using a special sie. Effortless. It really saves effort. A minor panting and sweating profusely after finishing a round of cranking. Laughed before.

Smashing a piece like this would make my arms ache for ages. Now cranking this handle, although tiring, is much easier. Master Jeang, hands behind his back, squinted as he observed the Crusher's operation, occasionally pointing out which gear needed lubrication with animal grease and which belt needed adjustment. He had previously managed small mines and was familiar with these rudimentary methods. This is just the first step.

Once production increases, we'll have to find ways to improve it. If only we could utilize water flow or wind power. On this side of the camp, the watchtowwer had already been built to a height of two people with a sturdy frame. Wanka was leading several combat team members, applying a mud mixture of clay and straw to the tower to increase its windproof and heat insulating properties. Space had been reserved at the top for a crystal lamp and an alarm bell.

The low walls surrounding the camp had been raised another foot, and at several key corners, Shivot Freeze made of sharpened wooden stakes had been installed that could be quickly lowered. Everything was progressing smoothly. But Shirhow knew that beneath the surface of calm, hidden dangers still existed. The remnants of the wings of Liberty, like a wounded wolf pack, would never willingly give up this rich mine. Although Dragon Soul bore the brunt of the cleanup, it was hard to guarantee that no stragglers wouldn't set their sights on this place.

Moreover, the island was densely forested besides the known paths. Who knew what else might be hidden here? Although the unusual bird calls Wong Kuay mentioned last night hadn't reappeared, Sherhow still ordered an increase in the density of nighttime patrols in a number of centuries. That afternoon, Sherhow was inspecting a small, newly cultivated vegetable patch. Team leader, Shure, we've dug up something strange at the mining site.

sure how immediately put down the wooden stick in his hand. What is this? Is there something wrong with the ore? Bones and metal fragments. Sherhow frowned and immediately followed his team to the mining site. The bone fragments were thick and irregularly shaped. A little deeper nearby, a thin metal plate about the size of a palm, almost completely covered with reddish brown rust, was obliquely embedded in the rock, with a corroded texture faintly visible on its edges.

Old Chun and Master Jeang were squatting nearby, carefully cleaning the surrounding gravel with fine brushes and wooden sticks. Team leader, sure, look at this bone. Old Shun pointed to a larger fragment. The thickness and density, Dante, resembled those of a typical sea beast or an animal that might be found on the island. It looks more like the leg bone of a large land animal, but the shape I sent quite right.

Dot Sherhow took the bone fragment. It felt heavy in his hand, and the cross-section was rough, unlike any marine creature skeleton he had ever seen. This guest silenced them all for a moment. The world's landscape was already bizarre, dotted with isolated islands, and the sea level seemed to have undergone tremendous changes. A few days later, when the flying fish came again to deliver supplies and or Sherhow carefully packed this batch of non-or items and handed them along with his detailed discovery record to the person in charge on the ship, instructing him to personally deliver them to Lynn, Mo, and Leeway. The camp's facilities also became more and more complete, and they even built a small bath house using surplus timber utilizing mountain spring water and sun-heed stones. However, on what seemed like an ordinary evening, an accident occurred. At that time, Sher was on the newly built watchtowwer, observing the sunset over the sea and the movements of the surrounding jungle.

Suddenly, a large flock of dark birds took flight in the sky above a dense forest about half a mile northwest of the mining site. They lingered for a long time, accompanied by several short, sharp cries that did not belong to any known bird species. Almost simultaneously, a hidden tripwire bell set up on the path leading from a mine to the dense forest rang urgently. "Enemy attack, Wong Ka, who was under the tower, sprang up instantly and grabbed the spear leaning against the wall." "It's not human," Sure House said in a deep voice. He raised his binoculars and looked into the dense forest.

The branches and leaves swayed, but he couldn't he see any obvious human figures. It has something else. Everyone, retreat to camp and close the gates. Archers, move to the towers. Miners, stop work immediately.

Take your tools and retreat quickly. The order was swiftly relayed. The artisans and miners working at the mine, though bewildered, were immediately disciplined enough to drop their work, grab their pickaxes or hammers, and retreat rapidly along the cleared paths towards the camp. The combatants quickly took their positions. Archers climbing the watchtowers and firing platforms behind the low walls, intently aiming towards the dense forest.

Just as the last minor rushed into the camp, and the gate was quickly slammed shut, the trees at the edge of the dense forest began to shake violently. Immediately afterwards, three ferocious creatures, each the size of a calf, leaped out. They had rough, dark green skins, similar to lizards, but their heads were flatter, their mouths were filled with fine, interlocking teeth, their limbs were short, thick, and powerful, and their claws gleamed coldly. Most peculiar were the rows of jagged bone spur-like protrusions growing on their backs, the tips of which faintly glowed with a dark red light. It's a spiky ridge lizard.

They usually only live in deeper forests or swamps, are very aggressive, have thick skin, and spines on their backs are poisonous. Wong Kuay recognized the creature. His expression grave. How they get here, and why are they appearing in groups? The three-headed spiny lizards stopped at the edge of the forest, their flatheads turning, their cold vertical pupils scanning the camp not far away. They seemed somewhat wary of the humans on the fence and watchtowwer and did not immediately rush over, but they did not leave either, instead anxiously pawing at the ground and emitting low, threatening roars.

Bows and arrows, aim for the eyes and soft areas of the abdomen. fire freely, sure how ordered. With a few swift whooshing sounds, several arrows shot towards the lizard beasts. But these creatures reacted extremely quickly, jerking their heads or turning their body sharply. Most of the arrows clattered off their thick skin or dorsal spikes, leaving only shallow white marks.

Only one arrow managed to strike the forl joint of a lizard beast, causing it to roar in pain and slow its movement slightly. Its physical defenses are incredibly strong. Sure. How's heart sink? The weapons in the camp were mainly prepared to defend against human attacks. They were far less effective against such a tough-kinned beast.

Use fire. They're afraid of fire. Quick, gather the torches together. Several team members quickly move the torches and oil canisters from the camp behind the low wall. However, before they could prepare, the three-headed lizard seemed enraged by the arrows, or perhaps sensing the human's weakness.

It no longer hesitated, letting out a sharp screech, and charged towards the camp with all its might. It was incredibly fast. "Fire! Stop them!" Sure how roared, grabbing a heavy crossbow and aiming at the head of the leading lizard beast before pulling the trigger. The crossbow bolt pierced the air and struck the lizard beast squarely in the forehead, but the arrow head only penetrated halfway before being jammed by the hard skull. The lizard beast thrashed its head wildly in pain, but its speed only slowed for a moment before it continued charging.

The other two lizard beasts followed closely behind, less than 30 m from the fence. Inside the camp, everyone gripped their weapons tightly, their faces pale. The ferocity of these monsters had exceeded their expectations. Just at this critical moment, a muffled rumble like rocks rolling down suddenly came from the direction of the mining site. Immediately afterward, there was a loud crash as something heavy fell to the ground, followed by an extremely shrill scream from a lizard beast.

The three-headed lizard, which was about to charge, suddenly stopped and looked back at the mining site with surprise and uncertainty. Shh also looked over in astonishment. Dust billowed up at the mining site as if something had collapsed. And could that scream from earlier have been? Before they could figure it out, a series of even heavier and more unsettling footsteps came from the dense forest in the direction of the mine. It was as if some enormous creature was moving slowly, each step causing the ground to tremble slightly.

The three-headed spiny lizard seemed to have heard some extremely terrifying sound. It no longer cared about the camp in front of it, let out a terrified howl, turned around, and fled back into the depths of the dense forest it had come from without looking back. It tumbled and crawled away and disappeared in the blink of an eye. The crisis mysteriously disappeared. The camp was deathly silent, say for the heavy breathing of the group, the gradually settling dust from the distant mining site, and the lingering echoes of their heavy footsteps.

Sherhow and Wong Kuay exchanged a glance, both seeing the surprise and lingering fear in each other's eyes. What exactly was unearthed beneath the mine, and what did it cause to cause a stir? The development of Hemlock Islands seemed to involve far more than just iron or mining. Night deepened, enveloping the camp and the suddenly mysterious and dangerous forest deep within the island. A new challenge in an unexpected way quietly arrived. Chapter 81.

Mysteries of the ancient mind. The dust kicked up by the fleeing thorny lizards had not yet completely settled, and the Hemlock Island camp remained deathly silent. Everyone gripped their weapons tightly, staring in shock toward the mining site where the dust was gradually clearing, leaving only a jumble of collapsed rocks and a bottomless, dark gap. The chilling, heavy footsteps had long since faded into the dense forest deep within the island. Sherhow was the first to react, he suppressed his shock and ordered sharply, "Wong, take your men and strengthen the camp security.

However, the situation at the mine was unclear. There appeared to have been rockfalls and landslides during the final evacuation. At noon the following day, the main island of Mauuan Pavilion, the inner fortress research lab. Leeway was scratching his head, staring at a pile of ancient artifact fragments sent back from Hemlock Island. He cleaned, measured, and compared the peculiar bone fragments with various solutions and atlases, initially determining that they did not belong to any known large marine or terrestrial mammals. Their skeletal structure seemed closer to some long extinct enormous reptile, but there were subtle differences. As for the rusted metal plate, after careful rust removal using vinegar and a fine brush, the surface patterns gradually became clear and extremely intricate interlocking geometric pattern with what appeared to have been inlaid in the center, leaving a regular circular groove.

the craftsmanship and precision. Leeway carefully examined the cutting marks on the edges of the patterns with a magnifying glass. It doesn't look like it was handmered, more like mold casting or even more precise machining. And the alloy composition, it can maintain its basic shape even after rusting like this. It's very tough.

He was engrossed at his work when Lynmo walked in with an urgent report from Hemlock Island. Something's happened on Hemlock Island, Lyno said succinctly, handing him Shure House's report. He pointed to the bone fragments and metal plates on the table. What team stone and the others dug out might just be the tip of the iceberg. Leeway immediately began packing his treasure chest. Upon learning of the situation, Sue Chanchian did not hesitate and indicated that she was no longer seriously ill and could accompany them. She also developed a strong interest in the artifacts unearthed on Hemlock Island, especially the aura that terrified the spiny lizard beasts, which might be similar to some residual energy she had sensed before. 2 days later, Lynn Mo Leewi and Su Chanchian along with a 10person elite guard team arrived at Ironwood Island aboard the Mo Yuan, which had undergone emergency repairs and was in top condition. The atmosphere at the camp remained tense.

Sher How welcomed the group into the command cabin, gave them a detailed account of what had happened, and led them to observe the mine's collapse from a distance. It was an irregular black hole about 5 m in diameter with jagged edges. Looking down, it seemed bottomless, and a cool breeze blew up from the darkness, carrying a smell of earth and stone and a faint, indescribable, stale odor. We didn't te dare get close after the incident. We just observed from a distance.

Sh house said the collapse didn't te continue to widen and there were no more sounds coming from inside. The surrounding woods seemed to have fewer birds and animals. It was very quiet. Duck Such Chian stood at a safe distance, closing her eyes and concentrating instead of extending her senses to their fullest extent as she had in the icy sea. She gently enveloped that area with her consciousness like a thin veil.

A moment later she opened her eyes, her brows slightly furrowed. It has both empty and full down there that she described the contradictory feeling. Empty means there is no life force fluctuation, at least not within my perception range. Full means there a very strong sense of sedimentation down there like dust and rocks accumulated over countless years and a kind of cold rigid presence. It s not life but more like a massive object.

It doesn't t have the active energy of the icy sea, but it has a weight. The weight of history no living creatures. What about the footsteps? Could it be some kind of mechanical movement, or did that massive object shift during the collapse? Suchian wasn't sure. My perception isn't that clear about pure material stacks and static objects, but I'm certain there aren't any creatures with strong life energy like the spiny ridge lizard below. This conclusion brought a slight sense of relief to everyone, but the mystery remained unsolved.

We have to go down and take a look. Leeway looked at the black hole, his eyes gleaming with the determination of a technician and a hint of adventurous excitement. Then mo pondered. The risks were unknown, but leaving it unattended would pose a greater threat. Hemlock Island was an important resource point and could not be easily abandoned. We can explore, but we must be fully prepared. Do Linmo finally decided how? Dot. Preparations took most of the day. A sturdy wooden tripod was firmly secured to the edge of the collapse and thick cables threaded through pulleys. Leeway modified several search lights, enhancing them with energy storing crystals and focusing runes, allowing the light to shine farther and brighter. He also brought along sonic detectors and improved small energy resonators.

The personnel descending were all dressed in thick leather armor and carried weapons and signal flares. As the sun set, everything was ready. Linmo Leeway Sherh How and two of the bravest and most meticulous guards stood in the gondola. The people above began to slowly release the ropes, and the gondola sank inch by inch into the dark abyss. The beam of the search light pierced the darkness, illuminating the uneven rock face.

The collapsed passage wasn't vertical, but sloping downwards, surrounded by scattered rocks of varying sizes and hematite, a common mineral in veins. After descending about 20 m, the sloping passage seemed to end, revealing a relatively open space below. The basket gently touched the bottom. Five people stepped out of the gondola and onto the loose, grally ground. A search light swept across the area, revealing a vast ancient underground cavern over 10 m high.

Its walls marked with signs of human excavation. Its style rugged and ancient, a stark contrast to modern mining techniques. In the center of the cavern lay a massive, even larger pile of grayish white fossilized bones, strangely shaped and of the same origin as the fragments they had previously unearthed. Beside the bones lay scattered rusted metal fragments and even the outlines of intricately structured metal components half- buried underground or faintly discernable gears connecting rods and some kind of frame. This isn't a mine.

Leeway's voice was filled with shock and excitement. This is an ancient sight, or rather an ancient workplace or a tomb. His light lingered on a relatively intact rock wall at the far end of the cave. There, the outline of a doorway, clearly carved out of the earth, was about 3 meters high and 2 meters wide, but its interior was completely sealed off by collapsed boulders. Above the doorway, on the rock wall surface, a faded but still recognizable mural was outlined using some kind of corrosion resistant pigment or metal inlay.

In a mural, some blurry, seemingly heavily armored humanoid beings are operating enormous, strangely structured machines. One end of the machines is connected to the outline of a terrifying creature with massive bones and spikes crawling on the ground. The background of the painting features towering waves and capsized ships. Lynmo's gaze was fixed on the mural. Did ancient humans or humanoid beings use machines to subdue or exploit those terrify creatures? And is the backdrop a maritime catastrophe? What exactly happened on Hemlock Island in ancient times? What lies buried here is likely far more than just an iron or vein.

Beneath the ancient mine lies a mysterious and potentially mind-blowing history. This history seems to have intricate connections to the world's oceans, creatures, and even some lost technologies. Chapter 82, The Key to the Ancient Remains. The beam of the search light was fixed on the complete skeleton, and for a moment, only the suppressed breathing of a few people and the faint sound of water dripping on rocks in the distance could be heard in the underground cave. The skeleton lay silently among the rubble and rusted metal.

Even though it was mostly petrified, one could still sense its immense size and ferocity in life. The row of jagged bone spurs on its spine perfectly matched the outline of the subdued creature in the mural. But what was most striking was undoubtedly the dark metal device deeply embedded in the bone crease at the junction of its cervical vertebrae and the first vertebrae with only part of its complex interface visible. My god. Leewi's voice trembled whether from excitement or fear and he subconsciously took a step forward only to be pulled back by Sherhow beside him.

Don't be impulsive. Sherhow hissed his eyes scanning the surroundings wearily, especially the skeleton and the sealed stone door. Who knows if this thing has any other strange features? Lynmo gestured for everyone to keep their distance as he carefully examined the metal device. The exposed portion was covered with intricate patterns and grooves consistent with the style of a metal plate they had previously discovered, but clearly more refined. There were signs of breakage at the interface, as if it had been connected to something, but that connection was now gone.

Leeway, what can you see? Linmo asked. Leewi raised the energy resonator in his hand, adjusting the frequency and carefully pointing it towards the bones and the device. The resonator emitted a slight buzzing sound, and the pointer trembled slightly, but the amplitude was very small. There is no active energy reaction, very weak, almost negligible inert energy residue similar to the feeling of these metal fragments. The device itself seems to be completely dead.

But the way it fits into the bones, he squinted, trying to make out in the dim light. It doesn't seem like it was put on later, but rather like it was forcibly implanted or connected to it from some angle while it was still alive. Implanted while the creature is alive to control it. The scene on the mural flashed through Lin Mo's mind. Those blurry human figures operating machinery connected to this creature.

Such Chian's voice came through the small bone communicator they carried, connected to the ground, tinged with tension. The weight and sedimentation below are still very strong with no new life or energy fluctuations. But near that skeleton, there's a very faint residual pain and binding sensation in the air. So faint it's almost an illusion. The lingering pain and constraints further confirmed Leeway suspicions.

Can you figure out exactly what this device is used for? Then press it. If it really is a control device, its technical principles may contain immense value, but also unknown risks. Leewi shook his head. Looking at the outside isn't enough. We need to get closer to inspect it, and we might even need to dismantle part of it.

But that's too dangerous. We don't know its structural stability, nor do we know if there are any residual defense mechanisms. Then Emmo pondered, "In this environment, risking everything to dismantle an unknown ancient device was tanamount to gambling, but leaving it unattended meant the mystery would remain a persistent worry, and the mining plans for Hemlock Island would be indefinitely postponed." "Let's start with the most basic recording and external mapping," Linmo decided. Leeway: Use your tools to record as many details, textures, and dimensions as possible of the exposed parts of the device without touching them. Sure.

How? Take some people to measure the size of this cave and record all visible artificial traces and the distribution of bones and metal debris. Watch your step and don't touch any unidentified objects. He turned to the communicator. Chansen, what's the situation up there? Everything is normal. There are no abnormalities.

Sue Chanchan replied, "Do you need me to come down and help? My senses might be able to discern more subtle structural differences inside the device." Dot. Not for now. Let's stay in touch. Lynn Emmo refused. The situation below was still unclear, and Such Chan had just recovered.

He couldn't let her take any risks. The group split up. Leeway, like a cautious cat, circled a relatively safe open area, carefully tracing the exposed patterns of the device from a distance using a special charcoal pencil and tracing paper. Simultaneously, he used an extended probe with a reflector to observe the devices interfaces and fit from different angles. Sure.

How along with two team members began pacing the cave area using ropes and simple measuring tools, marking the locations of larger bones and metal fragments on the ground with lime powder. Lynn and Mo himself held a flashlight, carefully studying the mural. As the light moved, more details emerged. The blurry human figures seemed to wear clothing with pipes and heavy padding, and their heads had round transparent masks. The machines they operated had complex linkages and gear structures.

Some pipes connected to the ground while others extended towards the subdued creatures. In the background of the marine disaster, besides giant waves and ships, there seemed to be some more twisted, indescribable, enormous shadows hidden in the depths of the waves. Is this depicting a war, an experiment, or a desperate struggle under some kind of disaster? Lynn Mo Leewii's voice interrupted his thoughts filled with suppressed excitement. We've made a discovery. Look at this.

Lyn Mo and sure how gathered around. Leewi pointed to the center of a complex pattern on the rubbing paper here. This circular groove is almost exactly the same size and shape as the groove in the center of the metal plate I brought down from above. And these surrounding auxiliary patterns are also highly similar. He took out the rust removed metal plate and compared it under the spotlight.

Sure enough, although the patterns on the murals and installations were more three-dimensional and complex, the core circular groove and the surrounding geometric patterns were exactly the same. Could that metal plate be the key to this control device or a component of a larger system? Lease pakula. The people in the mural seemed to be holding something similar. Lenmo took the metal plate. It's cold, heavy touch sending shivers down his spine.

If this truly was a key, how should it be used? Inserted into that groove, what would be the consequences? Would it activate the long dead control system or trigger something else entirely? Furthermore, Leeway pointed to the broken part of the device interface. Look at this break. It is very new, very new relative to all this dust. It doesn't te look like a natural corrosion brake, but rather like it was torn off by some external force. And near the break, there are fine scratch marks that are different from the surrounding rusta.

Tore apart by external force. Lynn Emmo immediately recalled the chillingly heavy footsteps and the collapse earlier. Could something else have happened down there besides the sounds they heard? Had something broken free? This thought seemed to chill the air in the cave even further. "Have you finished recording?" Linmo asked. IV recorded almost everything that can be recorded externally.

Leeway nodded. The measurements are almost complete. The cave is roughly an irregular oval shape, about 40 m at its longest and 20 m at its widest. Apart from the collapsed entrance we came in through and the sealed stone door, we haven't found any other obvious exits. The bones and large metal fragments are mainly concentrated in the center and near the stone door.

Sure. How reported. Okay. Do Linn Mo decisively ordered collect all the rubbings and measurements and take the metal plate. Weary leaving.

Remember, Dante, touch anything, especially the skeleton and the device dot. The group slowly retreated back to the gondola, checking once again to ensure no items were left behind or anything unusual. The ropes slowly rose, carrying them away from this underground space filled with ancient mysteries. Back on the ground, the afterglow of the setting sun made them feel a little dazed. Suchian came forward and looked at everyone with concern.

The situation is more complicated than we anticipated. Lynn Emmo briefly explained his findings. That metal plate might be the key. Leeway, when we get back, you and Shian should work together to study the plate and the rubbings and see if we can decipher its purpose and the information it might contain. Sure, how the mine is temporarily sealed off completely with double security measures in place.

No one is allowed to approach the collapse site without my order. The camp's defenses cannot be relaxed. He looked at the dark hole and then at the heavy metal plate in his hand. While the iron ore on Hemlock Island is undoubtedly important, the unexpected discovery of ancient ruins and potential control technologies may be far more valuable than a mere vein. Behind this discovery lies a connection to the world's lost history.

The knowledge sought by the Stonemason's Brotherhood and perhaps even the origins of an ancient being deep beneath the sea. An ancient key was unearthed by chance. Will opening it unleash opportunity or disaster? No one knows, but once the exploration begins, it's hard to stop. Nightfalls, enveloping Hemlock Island and the ancient mystery that has only just begun to unfold. While consolidating its existing foundation, the gaze of Muan Pavilion is involuntarily drawn into the deeper mists of history.

Chapter 83. Cipher on the stone tablet. The Emo Yuan, carrying the secrets brought back from the depths of Hemlock Island, quietly returned to port. The setting sun dyed the sea a molten gold, and the stern left a long, fragmented trail of light. The usual clamor on the deck was gone.

A heavy silence, a mixture of discovery and bewilderment enveloped everyone. Lyn Mo stood on the bridge, his gaze fixed on the location of Hemlock Island on the nautical chart. But his thoughts drifted to the dark metal plate lying quietly in the internal compartments isolation box and a dazzlingly intricate ancient patterns that Lee Wei had copied. Mining on Hemlock Island had been forced to a halt, but the value of this unexpected discovery might far exceed that of the hematite. Suian leaned against the port hole, closing her eyes to rest.

While her senses were beneath Hemlock Island, she hadn't encountered any danger, but she had clearly captured a kind of ancient, forcibly restrained pain and heavy sedimentation. This feeling was completely different from the ancient existence beneath the icy sea. It lacked that vast vitality and power, more like a tragedy and struggle buried and solidified by time. She vaguely felt that there might be some inexplicable connection between the two, like different fragments of the same enormous jigsaw puzzle. Leewi eyes locked himself in a makeshift workshop filled with instruments and drafts, studying the rubbings with near obsessive concentration under the soft glow of a crystal lamp.

He examined every turn of the patterns inch by inch with a magnifying glass. Measured the depth and angle of the grooves with a self-made ruler and sketched, calculated, and built possible models on scrap paper with a charcoal pencil. His apprentice was responsible for recording and passing on the data, barely daring to breathe. Look at these auxiliary patterns here. They read not just decorations.

They form a multi-layered nested energy guiding circuit. And this groove with its spiral pattern on the inner wall seems to be designed for some specific insertion and rotation action. Leewi muttered to himself, his eyes bloodshot yet unusually bright. The person operating the machinery in that mural is holding something similar. Inserting, rotating, starting or controlling it.

But where the energy source where the control signal? This board itself has no energy source. He tried to use the knowledge he had learned from the rune tower to analyze the patterns and found that some of the structural principles were the same. But the way they were expressed was more ancient, simpler, and even more efficient and essential. It was like seeing the earliest form of a complex mathematical formula. Rudimentary yet hitting the core.

It was late at night when they returned to the main island of Muan Pavilion. The island was brightly lit and well defended, but Linmo had no time to rest. He immediately summoned the core members for a brief briefing, emphasizing the sensitivity of the discovery underground on Hemlock Island and issuing strict confidentiality orders. Starting the next day, Leewi and Sue Chanchian moved into a newly opened, more secure ancient artifact analysis room on the bottom floor of the rune tower. This room was far from the core energy flow of the tower, avoiding mutual interference and facilitating the isolation of possible accidents.

The metal plate was carefully placed on a stone platform engraved with basic stabilizing runes. Leeway did not rashly attempt to activate it, but continued to test it using various non-cont methods, energy resonance scanning, microructure observation, material composition analysis using rudimentary methods such as acid etching and colorimemetry and repeatedly compared it with the rubbings of neural patterns and device patterns. Such Chanchian was responsible for the exploration at the perception level. She adjusted her mental energy to an extremely relaxed and peaceful state. Like the gentlest breeze slowly brushing across the surface of the metal plate, feeling the information carried by the material itself, the flames and pressure during casting, the contact with rocks, water vapor, and minerals over the long years, and the faint almost dissipated energy imprint that once flowed through its internal circuits.

Time slipped away quietly amidst focused research. 3 days later, one afternoon, when Leeway gently applied a speciallymade fine cotton thread soaked in different developing solutions to a specific location on the rubbing pattern, following a supposedly predicted energy flow path. An unexpected change occurred. The cotton threads soaked in the medicine produced extremely subtle but visible color changes when they came into contact with certain intersections of specific patterns. They changed from grayish white to light blue, dark red, or light gold.

Moreover, these color changes were not random, but rather followed the patterns, presenting a regular ripple-like gradient. Energy path imaging. It really works. Leeway's hands were trembling with excitement. I just randomly came up with this potion formula based on the reaction characteristics of several energy conducting minerals in a rune tower to specific energies, and I never expected it to actually work.

Look, these colors represent different energy attributes or intensity changes. Blue might be stable basic energy. Red is a control or activation signal, and gold might be a higher level command or certification. He quickly recorded the path and intersection of each color change. Su Chanchian immediately focused her perception on those color change nodes as well.

This time, what she sensed was no longer a vague mark, but some more specific and structured residual information, like listening to an extremely distant, severely distorted ancient ballad that still retained a specific rhythm and tone. At the intersection of these golden nodes, "Sue Chansen said with her eyes closed, her finger lightly pointing to several spots on rubbing paper. There are very very faint remnants of intention that they read not words more like fragments of preset functional instructions that one of them feels like connect/lock another like energy reading/verification and the most vague one seems to be mode switching or status query function commands leeways eyes lit up even more this confirms my conjecture this board is just a key it might be a portable control terminal with authentication and basic command functions Only after inserting it into that device slot and completing connection/locking and energy reading/verification can it issue subsequent mode switching commands to operate that ancient machine and control that giant beast. This deduction sent the hearts of everyone involved in the research racing. If true, then possessing this lab meant they might be able to decipher a lost ancient technological system capable of controlling powerful beings or similar entities.

Its value was immeasurable. But what kind of energy does energy reading/verification require? Linmo who had been listening quietly raised the crucial question. We don't know what password it needs to verify and where is the energy source that powers it. The machines in the murals seem to have external energy pipes. Leeway's excited expression subsided slightly.

This is indeed a difficult problem. The verification code may be hidden deeper in the patterns or it may require a specific energy key. As for the machinery on the energy mural, it may have a large external power supply device, but this portable terminal is likely designed to obtain its starting energy from the inserted device itself. or the terminal may have some kind of long-lasting micro energy that we cannot detect and that has been depleted. He pointed to the circular groove in the center of the stone slab.

I suspect that something was originally embedded here, whether it was decoration or the terminals battery or identity core, but it's lost now.
