She and Duo Duo accepted the order. After the meeting, Lin Mo went alone to the high point of the dock. In the distance, the sea and sky stretched endlessly. While nearby, ships came and went, and the sounds of craftsmen hammering never ceased. Moan pavilion was steadily growing stronger, but the disturbances and threats from the outside world, like the tides, rose one after another, and were becoming increasingly complex.

The Wings of Liberty are clearly enemies, but they are shrouded in secrecy, making them easy to defend and difficult to attack. The relationship with Dragon Soul is one of both cooperation and competition, with each side testing the waters and their bottom lines remaining unclear. The Stonemason's Brotherhood is a completely unknown third party with vastly different objectives, making them difficult to fathom. His information network had begun to pick up some faint signals. His spies in the southwest were also sending back valuable intelligence.

But this was only the beginning. The real confrontation often lay not in a clash of swords, but in these silent battles for information, resource competition, and strategic foresight. He needs more patience and sharper insight. Moan Pavilion is like a warship being equipped with more sophisticated observation and aiming equipment and a more powerful propulsion system. Before it truly enters the storm zone, it needs to continuously improve itself and see every detail of the storm as clearly as possible.

A cool sea breeze blew. Lin Moe's gaze swept across the bustling dock, taking in the warehouse area, training grounds, and research workshops. Everything here was his foundation for facing future changes. and every ripple in the outside world. Every piece of the puzzle helped him to more clearly outline the contours of that unknown sea.

The silent battle has begun. He and his Muan pavilion must proceed cautiously, navigating this complex game to secure the most advantageous position for themselves. Time remains one of his most important allies. Chapter 91. Unexpected visitor.

In the late autumn of Mayuan Pavilion, the sea breeze blows stronger day by day, adding a richer blend of busyiness and tranquility. Leeway's research has finally achieved a breakthrough, albeit a small one. While continuously comparing the common grammatical points of different symbol systems, he combined his previous repeated study of the energy path of the Hemlock Island slab with the fragments of information he recently received from Shand Duo Duo about the Stonemason's Brotherhood exchanging black slabs and suddenly had a new conjecture about a group of previously difficult to classify composite symbols in a certain edge area of the slab. We previously thought this set of symbols might represent a secondary energy circuit or an auxiliary function interface, Leewwayi said, pointing to the redrawn analytical diagram with shining eyes. But after repeatedly comparing it with the commonalities of the status indicators we summarized, as well as the indirect expressions in the Dragon Soul symbols that seem to represent external devices or expansion modules, we discovered that its core might not be interface, but rather verification association.

He pointed to several key turning points and connections on the drawing. Look here. The way the brush strokes here are very similar to the symbols we've already deciphered that represent permission, but more complex. It doesn't point to the master verification at the core of the slate, but rather to one or more specific auxiliary units or supporting devices outside the slate itself. It's more like an identification code or pairing identifier used to confirm whether an external device is authorized to connect and exchange data with the slate system.

Suchian leaned closer to examine it closely, trying to sense it and slowly nodded, "I do have that feeling. This item is exclusive. Please do not contact without permission." Has an extra layer of exclusivity and specificity compared to a simple interface description. Lyn Mo looked at the blueprints thoughtfully. You mean the Hemlock Island slabs aren't isolated? They might have accompanying auxiliary devices that require a specific identification code to activate or use.

And these devices might be the key components for completing the verification license or connecting to the energy source. Very likely, Leeway said excitedly. This explains many contradictions. Why does the stone slab itself seem incomplete? Why is the verification permission so abstract and difficult to understand? Because it may just be a control console or identity authentication center. The real operating authority or power pathways are in the hands of those scatter terminals that require specific keys.

The identification codes represented by these symbols to access. The stonemason brothers collection of stone slabs or metal plates with symbols may be in search of these scattered terminals or a list containing the identification codes. If this inference holds true, it is of great significance. It not only explains part of the mystery surrounding the Hemlock Island slate, but also subtly outlines a possible decentralized ancient system architecture. It also indirectly confirms that the Stonemason's Brotherhood's goals may have been extremely systematic and long-term they were attempting to piece together the entirety of this system.

This discovery is very important. Continue to explore this direction and try to deduce more possible identification code structures or features. Lynn Emmo affirmed. In addition, try to integrate this idea into your academic exchange proposal without revealing the actual stone slab and specific symbols as a tople exploratory topic to see if we can get any confirmation or rebuttal from the outside. Understood.

Leeway threw himself into the new simulation work with great enthusiasm. Meanwhile, Sue Chanchian's comprehensive plantation plan entered the implementation phase. The core area was selected on a sunny, gentle slope on the southeast side of the main island. After leveling and preliminary soil improvement, functional zones were divided. The first batch of coldresistant tuber crops and improved fast growing vegetable seeds had been sewn.

These were fuzzy locations based on Leewi speculation about the distribution of energy in ancient symbols purely experimental. Such Chanchian recorded data and observed changes every day. Sure, how focused the training on handling emergencies and rapid response. Regarding the ice flow area, after the initial flurry of vague information, market discussion has subsided, but genuine observers don't seem to have left. In the southwestern Misty Bay direction, the frequency of messages relayed by informants decreased as the remnants of the Wings of Liberty appeared to have completed their initial assembly and infrastructure construction and the screening of outsiders became exceptionally strict. Their fortress was beginning to take shape with heavily fortified outer walls. Amidst this seemingly calm yet turbulent atmosphere, an unexpected visitor quietly approached the outer sea area of Mayuan Pavilion. The visitor was a medium-sized three-masted sailing ship, plain in style, but well-maintained, flying a plain flag without any insignia of power.

It did not attempt to enter the core shipping lanes of the Moan Pavilion or approach the main island, but instead anchored near a public supply point on the outskirts established by the Moan Pavilion for safe trade with scattered caravans or lone travelers. dispatching a small boat carrying three people, waving a friendly signal flag, requesting informal and friendly dialogue with the leaders of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. The patrol boat on duty quickly reported the situation. Linmo was checking the latest warehouse inventory when he received the report. Have you ascertained their purpose and identity? Lynmo asked the guard captain who came to report.

They only said they represented a group of friends who are interested in ancient knowledge and have no intention of being enemies with any power and wanted to exchange ideas on common areas of interest. The leader was a woman who called herself Vera and she was wellmannered. The other two seemed to be attendants or guards. The ship was inspected. It was not obviously armed and there weren't many people on board, the captain of the guard replied.

They seemed very disciplined and did not show any aggression or probing intent. ancient knowledge. Lynn Mo's heart skipped a beat. Had the Stonemason's Brotherhood found a new way to contact them or was it another similar force? Notify Shir how to strengthen covert surveillance around that supply point. Such Chian Leewi and I will listen from behind the scenes. Lynn, Emo quickly made the arrangements. Remember, be polite, but keep your distance. Find out who they are and what they want. Yes.

An hour later, under a makeshift semi-open seaside pavilion set up at the supply point, Chi and Dodu met the visitor who called herself Vera. Linmo, Su Chanchian, and Leewi, on the other hand, were observing the meeting from a nearby disguised observation house using hidden gaps and a simple sound transmission device using hollow bamboo tubes and thin membranes. Vera was a woman in her early 30s dressed in a practical dark blue travel outfit. Her long brown hair was neatly tied back. Her appearance wasn't particularly striking, but her eyes were clear and focused, exuding a scholarly calmness.

She introduced herself as an independent archaeologist, part of a small group of like-minded friends who focused on collecting and studying artifacts and information from ancient civilizations around the world. We heard of the Muan Pavilion, especially some of their transactions during the time of Mr. Jay and weary very interested in certain special items that your side may have come in contact with. Vera said calmly and a moderate pace. We have no ill intentions, nor do we belong to any known major power.

We believe that the value of knowledge lies in sharing and deciphering, not in hoarding or using it for force. Our visit is to establish a possible channel for information exchange based on equal exchange. We also have some rubbings of symbols and records of artifact characteristics collected from various ruins which may corroborate your existing discoveries. She duo duo smiled broadly and chuckled. Oh dear Miss Vera, you flatter me too much.

Our Mayu pavilion is just a place where we do small business and try to live a peaceful life. Those ancient relics and symbols you mentioned are too profound. We may occasionally come across some strange and unusual things, but we only sell them as handiccrafts or materials. We don't know anything about researching them. Vera smiled slightly, undeterred, and took out several carefully protected rubbings from her leather pouch, placing them on the table.

Manager Chien, there is no need for an immediate reply. These are rubbings of symbols we recently discovered at a shallow relic site on the Eastern Sleeping Ridge with a rather unique style. Perhaps your researchers would be interested in taking a look. Regardless of whether there is any intention to cooperate, these copies of the rubbings can serve as a token of our goodwill. Looking inside the room, Leewi's breath hitched slightly when he saw the patterns on the rubbings.

Suchan also let out a soft lin sharpened. Those symbols were different from those provided by the hemlock island slabs and the dragon soul. They represented a third independent style. But Leewi immediately and keenly caught a familiar shadow of a common grammatical point in the winding stroke say state fine-tuning technique. Chin duo duo naturally noticed the interest signal wei had sent through a hidden hand gesture.

His smile remained unchanged as he took the rubbing, examined it carefully, pretending to be trying hard to decipher it, and then laughed. Oh dear, this drawing is quite abstract. Since Miss Vera is so kind, we'll accept this gift without hesitation. We'll let you know as soon as we have any news." Vera nodded gracefully.

"That's only right. We'll be waiting on the ship, looking forward to your good news." The first encounter ended in a polite and cautious atmosphere. Chapter 92. Rubbing Identification. Vera's appearance was like a pebble thrown into a pond, creating ripples on the calm surface of Mo Yuan Pavilion. Linmo's orders were swiftly executed. Leewi and Sue Chanchian immediately immersed themselves in the newly imprinted symbols, while Chin Duo Duo used multiple intelligence networks to try to sketch out the vague outline of Vera and the independent researchers group behind her.

The rubbings from the sleeping ridge were carefully laid out on the long table in Leeway's workspace. The lighting was adjusted to the most suitable angle and Leeway even took out a simple magnifying glass set and tracing tools that he had received from signing it earlier. Such an on the other hand prepared a new notebook ready to perceive and describe it from her perspective of rhythm. The rubbing appears to be on some kind of fine sandstone slab. The symbols are deeply engraved and the edges are slightly blurred due to erosion over time, but the overall condition is much better than the stone slab on Hemlock Island, which have been subjected to the pressure of mineral veins.

The style of the symbols is indeed quite different from any I've seen before. They are more fluid, lacking the cold geometric feel of the Hemlock Island symbols, and without the ruggedness and abruptness of those symbols provided by the dragon soul. Instead, they have a continuous rhythm similar to scroll work or waves, but the transitions still reveal a clear regularity and intention. It has a truly unique style that Leeway muttered to himself as he carefully examined the direction and depth of the engravings with a magnifying glass. The carving tools were probably more refined or the stone was softer.

Look at the end of this curve. It is very smooth and natural. It doesn't tea look like it was chiseled, but rather like it was grinded with some kind of high-speed rotating hard tool dot. Su Chian closed her eyes and concentrated, her fingers hovering above the rubbings, slowly moving them to try and capture that rhythm. After a long while, she opened her eyes, a hint of confusion and surprise in them.

It feels very different. The Hemlock Island symbols feel like calm instructions and frameworks to me, while the Dragon Soul symbols feel like straightforward marks and warnings. These are more like a description or record, even carrying a touch of lyricism, describing a certain state, recording a certain process, but at the core, that unnatural, meticulously designed sense of order still exists. It's definitely not a natural pattern, description, or record. Leeway pondered.

If we combine this with our previous conjectures about identification codes and distributed terminals, could it be part of some kind of operation log or device status record? Look at this combination of consecutive symbols. It seems to express a dynamic process. Initiation, stable, C intervention, application of energy or action, C change, parameter adjustment, C stability, new state achieved. The symbolic expression of this change stage in its core style is highly similar to the common grammatical point I summarize for representing state fine-tuning. It asks just that here it s embedded in a more complex and narrative string of symbols.

This discovery greatly encouraged the two men. If these new symbols were indeed some kind of log or record, then the information they contained about how ancient systems operated might be more valuable than mere control commands. it could reveal the process, not just the result. For the next two days, Leewi and Sue Chanchian devoted themselves almost tirelessly to the analysis. They tried to use known common grammatical points as anchors to decipher the possible structures in the new symbol strings.

Progress was slow, but not without results. They initially identified several recurring symbol fragments that appear to represent time units, energy level scales, and operator identifiers. Possibly. More importantly, at the end of a relatively complete symbol sequence, they discovered an independent symbol that had a subtle connection to the transitional habits of the Hemlock Island Slate identification code symbols. It was like a signature or confirmation mark engraved alone at the end.

This is very likely the identification code of the terminal device corresponding to this record or at least some kind of identifier related to it. Leeway excitedly pointed to the symbol. Although we can't decipher what it specifically refers to, its existence itself confirms the existence of distributed terminals and identification systems. The ruins that Vera and the others discovered may be the remains of a terminal or a place where records were stored. Meanwhile, Shin Dudwa's investigation also yielded initial results.

through several clandestine channels specializing in selling intelligence and background information. And by expending considerable resources, he finally pieced together some fragments of information about Vera and her group. Vera seems to have a reputation in several high-end small academic exchange circles and the black market for rare ancient books and materials. Chi and Dodu reported to Lyno, "Her reputation is quite polarized. Some people think she's a pure scholar, knowledgeable, fair in her dealings, only interested in solving ancient mysteries, and never involved in power struggles.

Others think she and the group behind her are too mysterious, highly capable, and always able to find some obscure but important clues to relics. They believe there must be some unknown support behind her, and she may not really be as independent as she seems. There are many different opinions about the group behind her. Some say it is a secret society composed of several like-minded scholars. Some say it is a research team funded by the descendants of a fallen noble family.

And there are even outrageous rumors that they have ties to the Stonem's Brotherhood, but parted ways due to ideological differences. The only generally accepted fact is that they're probably not many in number. But the core members seem to be top experts in various professional fields, archaeology, semiodics, geology, ancient engineering, and they seem to have mastered some unique techniques for detecting and interpreting relics. Chanduo paused, then added, "Furthermore, there are unconfirmed reports that they recently had some unpleasant contact with the Stonem's Brotherhood, seemingly over priority access to explore a newly discovered site. They apparently reached a compromise, but the relationship seemed strained.

This might explain why they approached us. See, perhaps they're looking for a new powerful partner or source of information to counterbalance or bypass the Stonem's Brotherhood. LenMo tapped his fingers lightly on the table. Vera's team's background was more complex than he had anticipated. They weren't the Stonemason's Brotherhood, but they were equally deeply involved in the field of ancient ruins and possessed considerable strength and technology.

Their potential competition with the Stonemason's Brotherhood aligned with their claim of independence and increased the credibility of their contact with the Ink Abyss Pavilion. The enemy of my enemy could at least be a temporary friend or a useful source of information. Havly Wei and the others come to any conclusions in their analysis. Lynn Mo asked just as I was about to report. Engineer Lee and Miss Sue made an important discovery.

Those new rubbings are likely a kind of operation log and contain symbols that appear to be terminal identification codes confirming the hypothesis of distributed terminals. A glint of light flashed in Linmo's eyes. The stepping stone Vera brought was indeed invaluable. It wasn't just a new set of symbol samples. It was a crucial clue that could verify and advance their own research.

It seems that Miss Vera has shown more sincerity than we expected, Linmo pondered. But we still need to clarify her true intentions. Is she simply looking to exchange information? Or does she want to draw us into their competition with the Stonemason's Brotherhood? Or perhaps she has a deeper scheme? He pondered for a moment and made a decision. She and Duo Duo, in your name, invite Miss Vera to a second meeting at the supply depot tomorrow morning. This time, Leewi and I will happen to be present.

Note that Leeway and I are the island lord with a slight interest in ancient symbols and a craftsman responsible for material appraisal and incidentally studying miscellaneous subjects. The conversation will revolve around the rubbings she provided. Listen to her insights on these symbols and also appropriately reveal some of our vague impressions about the common ground of the symbols that we accidentally discovered and see her reaction. Understood, boss. I'll arrange it right away.

Chin duo duo understood immediately. The next morning, the seaside pavilion was once again set up as a meeting place. This time, Linmo and Leewi sat inside beforehand with tea and some dried fruit, a local specialty of the island on the table, chatting casually. Chin Duo Duo stood to the side, waiting. Vera arrived on time in a small boat, still accompanied by only two attendants.

She didn't seem surprised to see two more people in the pavilion as if she had expected it. Manager Chien, I apologize for bothering you again. Vera smiled and nodded, then turned her gaze to Lin Mo and Leewi. And who are these two? Oh, let me introduce you. Chin Duo Duo said with a warm smile, "This is Lin Mo, the leader of our Muan Pavilion, and this is Leewi, the manager of our workshop.

The leader happened to be inspecting this area today and heard that Miss Vera brought some interesting rubbings of ancient artifacts. He was also very interested, so he came over to take a look. Manager Lee usually likes to tinker with some strange and unusual things and has some knowledge of engravings and symbols. So, it's Chief Lynn and Steuart Lee. Nice to meet you.

Vera bowed to the two men with composure. Her gaze lingered on Lin Mo's face for a moment, calm and unwavering before turning to Leeway. Seeing the magnifying glass and tracing paper beside him, a knowing smile flashed in her eyes. After a brief exchange of pleasantries, the conversation naturally turned to the rubbings. Vera spoke first, her tone calm and professional.

After reviewing the rubbings we left for you last time, I wonder if your researchers have made any interesting discoveries or have any thoughts. Our team's preliminary judgment is that this may be an inscription about the maintenance or status record of some kind of ancient equipment. Unfortunately, we have only just begun to decipher its symbol system. Leeway glanced at Linmo and after receiving tacid approval continued. Ms.

Vera, you're too kind. We're just looking around. The style of these symbols is indeed unique, quite different from the few we've seen by chance before. But coincidentally, when I compared them, I felt that the habits of the strokes when these symbols express certain processes of change seem to have a slight inexplicable similarity to some other ancient engravings we've seen. It's the kind of technique used to handle transitions of states.

He didn't mention any specific symbols or locations, but rather offered a very vague observation about common ground. Vera's eyes lit up slightly upon hearing this, and she leaned forward slightly. Oh, manager Lee also has this feeling. To be honest, our team also vaguely noticed a similar phenomenon when comparing the symbols of different ruins. It seems that there are some more fundamental rules of expression or technical language logic that transcend a single symbol system.

The fact that your side can notice this shows that you also have considerable accumulation in semiotics. She paused, seemingly considering her words before continuing. We believe that these common points across the ruins may be the key to unlocking the entire technological system of ancient civilizations. I wonder if your side would be willing on the basis of mutual trust to engage in a deeper exchange regarding the discovery and speculation of these common points. We can provide more simple samples and analytical notes from different ruins in exchange.

The conversation began to touch on the core issues. Lenimo picked up his teacup, gently blew on it, and didn't answer immediately. He was observing Vera, observing her expression, her eyes, and her choice of words. It seemed that she indeed attached great importance to the research direction of common ground, and was willing to pay a substantial price for it. Academic exchange is naturally a good thing.

Do Len Mo put down his teacup and spoke slowly, his tone calm, but with a hint of detachment. However, Emo Yuan Pavilion is still in its early stages, and its primary concern is survival and development. Our interest in these ancient relics is limited to satisfying some curiosity and seeing if we can find some inspiration that is useful for the present. Inepth and targeted exchanges and cooperation involve many considerations. We have received Ms.

Vera's proposal, but we need time to discuss it internally. Dot. He neither refused nor agreed, giving a response very much in line with the identity of a cautious island owner. Vera seemed unsurprised and nodded understandingly. Chief Lynn's caution is entirely understandable.

Exploring ancient secrets is certainly attractive, but focusing on the present is fundamental. We will not force anything. This visit is mainly to express goodwill and establish initial contact. These rubbings and some related basic analysis notes are left with you as a small gift. Regardless of whether there is an opportunity to cooperate in the future, we hope that these materials will be of some help to you.

She once again demonstrated her sincerity by proactively providing more information. The meeting ended in a polite but reserved atmosphere. Vera made no further demands, politely took her leave, boarded her ship, and indicated that they would stay in the outer waters for a few days to await the final reply from the Mo Yuan pavilion, but would not cause any disturbance. Watching the sailboat disappear into the distance. Lynn Emo whispered to Chi and Duo.

They are very patient and strategic. What they gave us was substantial. Continue investigating, especially the specific details of their conflict with the Stonemasons Brotherhood. Leeway, you two hurry up and digest the new notes she gave us. We need to determine whether the limited and highly controlled exchange of information with them is more beneficial or harmful.

A new choice lay before him. Would this suddenly appearing group of scholars be an aid in unraveling the mystery or a trigger for even greater trouble? Lynn Mo needed to weigh the options, deciding how to proceed while ensuring the safety and development of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. Chapter 93. Prudent cooperation. The arrival and departure of Vera's team did not cause much of a stir within the Mo Yuan Pavilion.

Most members were unaware that such a fleet had ever visited the outer regions. However, within the core circle, discussions on how to respond to this proposed academic exchange took place meticulously and cautiously. That same evening after their second meeting, Lynn, Emo summons Shureh how she duo duo such and leeway back to the meeting room. The rubbing copy left by Vera in a neatly bound, meticulously handwritten analytical notebook were on the table. The notebook was detailed and logically clear, containing not only their initial interpretation of the sleeping ridge rubbings, but also appendices of simple comparisons and characteristic summaries of several other known symbolic styles.

It even cautiously raised several open-ended questions about cross-system commonalities, demonstrating a candid and academic approach. IV reviewed their work. It s very solid and of a very high standard. Leewi said first, his tone carrying an expression of approval for his colleagues. Their perspective on symbols is similar to ours, but their methodology is more systematic.

Several conjectures mentioned in their notes regarding energy flow representation and operational hierarchy identification have been very enlightening for me. The data samples they have may be even richer than we imagined. Such an nodded in agreement. The notes mention a method to help determine the age and function of relics based on the residual trace elements in the environment and the degree of weathering of rock straighta. Although it is only briefly described, the idea is very novel and it is also of reference value for my planning of plantation site selection and assessment of the long-term impact of environmental stabilizers.

Chin duo duo stroked his chin. From an intelligence perspective, the sincerity they've shown is indeed substantial. Moreover, the new information I've received basically confirms the claim that they are in competition with the Stonemason's Brotherhood. About a month ago, in the Echo Islands to the southeast, the two sides almost clashed over a small ruin that had just emerged from the seabed. Later, through some unknown negotiation, the Stonemason's Brotherhood gained access to the ruin, but Vera's team obtained complete surface mapping data and the right to sample the surrounding artifacts.

It sounds like a compromise between technical experts. Each getting what they wanted, but a grudge has been formed. Sure, how remained cautious. Technology is one thing, but people's hearts are another. They approached us proactively, demonstrating their strength and expressing goodwill, so their demands must be substantial.

We can certainly gain some knowledge by cooperating with them, but could we be drawn into their conflict with the Stonemason's Brotherhood? Or perhaps they want to use us to test or restrain the Stonemason's Brotherhood. Our current strength is already enough to deal with the remnants of the Wings of Liberty. And with the addition of the mysterious Stonemason's Brotherhood and this scholarly group with unclear backgrounds, the situation is far too complicated. Lynamo listened quietly to everyone's opinions, his fingers unconsciously tracing the cover of Vera's notebook. The notebook was made of paper of uniform texture, a rarity in this era, and the binding thread was some kind of synthetic fiber, revealing its exquisite details.

Leewi Sue Chian. If we only engage in very limited purely academic information exchange, for example, focusing only on the research direction of common grammatical points and offer some peripheral observations that do not involve specific archaeological sites or core symbols in exchange for similar observations of other symbol systems in their possession. Would that be of great help to your research? Are the risks manageable? Lynn Emmo asked. Leewi and Sue Chian exchange a glance. After careful consideration, Leewi replied, "It will definitely help.

It can broaden our horizons, verify our ideas. It may even help us discover angles we've overlooked if we strictly limit the content of our exchange. Only discussing abstract methods and feature induction without involving any specific details that might expose the hemlock island slab or the dragon soul symbol. The risks should be manageable. It's like two mathematicians discussing problem-solving strategies without revealing the original problem data they have.

Suchin added, "Furthermore, we can require all communications to be conducted in encrypted one-time written form to avoid direct meetings and reduce the risk of being tracked or infiltrated. We can even designate a completely neutral third party location such as a recognized secure trading island for data delivery and reception." Chandwood was eyes lit up. This is a great idea. It maintains contact, obtains information, and minimizes the risk of contact. We could try one or two of these blind exchanges first to see their reactions and the quality of the information they provide before deciding whether to go deeper.

Sure, how thought for a moment and nodded. If it's just written isolated communication without involving personnel exchanges or specific action coordination, I can accept it. But we must carefully review the exchange materials to ensure there are no hidden agendas or secret codes. The opinions of the group gradually converged. A trial, highly controlled, low-risk information exchange could be conducted to further assess Vera's team's true intentions and potential value.

Lynn Mo finally made the decision. All right, let's go with this approach. Chi and Duo Duo, you will send an encrypted message to various ship through a secure communication channel. The message is as follows. The Mo Yuan Pavilion is also interested in the study of the common points of ancient symbols and is willing to conduct preliminary non-directional academic discussions.

We propose that the first exchange of information be conducted in writing at the neutral exchange on Conchk Island, a covert intelligence hub controlled by Chen Duo Duo. The exchange topic is limited to the abstract stylistic features representing state transitions and energy levels in different symbol systems. Each party should provide no more than three pages of overview text and corresponding unattributed symbol examples, ensuring that the examples cannot be traced back to specific relics. We will send an anonymous messenger to complete the handover. If agreed, it will take place in 3 days.

He paused then emphasized the message implied that this was our only mode of cooperation and there was no guarantee that there would be any follow-up. If they accepted it meant they valued academic exchange more than anything else or they had enough patience. If they refused or made other demands then there was no need to continue. Understood? I'll get on it right away. Chin Duo Duo immediately began preparations.

The encrypted message was sent out that evening via a clandestine carrier pigeon lake. Conchk Island was a small intelligence relay station established by Chandu Duo in his early days. It was located in a secluded place and used as a cover to run a general store. The shopkeeper was an old sea merchant whom Chiendu Duo had helped in his early years. He was loyal and reliable.

After the message was sent, there was only waiting. For the next 3 days, everything at Moanon Pavilion continued as usual. Training, production, research, and trade proceeded at a steady pace. However, the core members all paid closer attention, awaiting the other party's response. During this time, Leewi and Su Chian meticulously prepared an overview for the exchange.

They extracted several of the most representative yet least easily traceable calligraphic features of state fine-tuning and hierarchical identification from the hemlock island slabs and dragon soul symbols. These features coupled with simplified illustrative symbols after some distortion were written in the most objective and descriptive language possible resulting in a 2 and 1/2page summary. This summary might be invaluable to true experts, but to layman it would be like a foreign language, and there was absolutely no possibility of it revealing any course secrets. On the morning of the third day, news came back from Conch Island. The exchange was complete.

As agreed, the other party provided three pages of handwritten materials and several corresponding simple example diagrams. The messenger described that the other party was a silent middle-aged scholar who, apart from confirming identity and exchanging items, did not utter a single word and quickly left after the handover. The information was brought back immediately and delivered to Leewi. He and Su Chian immediately began to study it. The level is very high.

Leewi couldn't help but exclaim in a low voice after watching for only a short while. The seven variations of the energy level decay representation. they summarized are more systematic than I thought. In this they noticed the different symbol systems graphical distinction between birectional flow and unidirectional conduction and guess that this might be related to the design concept of the devices input and output ports. We haven't thought about this angle in depth yet.

Such an also engrossed in watching the examples of symbols they provided although they were processed show that they come from at least four different styles of relics. One of them has a very unique rhythm, almost like a visual expression of music or sound waves. If that's the case, then ancient civilizations may have mastered the technology of using specific frequencies for control or transmission. The insights gained from the new materials are enormous, even somewhat revolutionary. Vera's team's depth and breadth of expertise in semiotics clearly surpasses that of a Moyua.

In this exchange, Mo Yunga traded some peripheral but crucial feature inductions for a more systematic and perspective richch methodological framework and typological samples, which from a purely knowledge exchange perspective was undoubtedly a gain. More importantly, the other party kept their promise, provided highquality materials, and did not attempt to include any suspicious information or make any additional requests. This increased their credibility to some extent. It seems they are serious scholars. At least they performed impeccably during this exchange.

After listening to Leewi and Sue Shian's report, Lynn Emmo summarized, "We can continue this low-risk written communication, not too frequently, and the topics can gradually become more in-depth, but the bottom line remains the same. Do not reveal specific information about the relics and do not involve any intentions for action. At the same time, Chin Duo Duo continued to investigate their background, especially the composition of their core members and the source of their funding. Understood, Chin Duo Duo replied. Also, there's new information from the north and west.

Oh, the Dragon Souls research vessel went to the ice shatter zone again, this time staying for a slightly longer period. It seems they installed some kind of long-term monitoring device at the edge of the fissure. Our informants didn't dare get too close, but they saw them lowering equipment down in a basket. The Stonemason's Brotherhood showed no signs of approaching, but they're increasing their purchases of anti-jamming communication components and deep water pressure resistant hall materials at several key trading points, possibly preparing as well. In the southwestern Misty Bay, the main structure of the wings of Liberty's fortress appears to be complete, and more obstacles and early warning systems have recently been deployed around it.

There are indications that they may be testing that big guy inside as a continuous low humming sound has been heard for nearly an hour before stopping. All parties are taking action. Whether it's probing, lying in weight, or developing their capabilities. The Mo Yuan Pavilion is no exception. This cautious collaboration with Vera's team has opened a small door, adding a new potential channel for future intelligence networks and knowledge reserves.

Lyn and Mo walked to the window and looked out at the Azure Sea. The door to cooperation had opened a crack, letting in a few rays of new light, but the world outside remained full of unknowns and risks. He needed to strike a balance, neither letting this crack prematurely expose his weaknesses, nor failing to fully utilize it to observe and extract necessary information. Steady development, prudent cooperation, and a wait andsee approach remain the most suitable course for Muan Pavilion at this stage. However, the nautical charts and telescopes in their hands seem to have become slightly clearer and sharper.

This small improvement may be a necessary accumulation for dealing with even greater storms in the future. Chapter 94 frequent strange events. The first written exchange with Vera's team was successfully completed, opening a window for Moyuan Pavilion to understand a broader world of ancient symbols, but it did not immediately change the main theme of the island's operation. Days continued to roll forward amidst a mix of busyiness and tranquility. Only a subtle tension seemed to have been added to the air from all directions.

Such Chian's integrated plantation ushered in the first round of crop germination. Under the influence of the carefully arranged environmental stabilizers, the tender green seedlings broke through the soil, their uniformity and robustness significantly better than the control area. This amazed the elderly farmers responsible for the actual cultivation and they looked at Sue Chanchian with more trust. Sue Chanchian's daily data notebook grew thicker and thicker. She began to try to perform correlation analysis between the growth parameters of different crops and environmental indicators, temperature, humidity, light, changes in soil trace elements, attempting to find quantitative evidence of the stabilizer's effectiveness.

This work was tedious and meticulous, requiring great patience, but she enjoyed it immensely. Lie eyes was immersed in the new ideas brought about by the materials provided by Vera's team. Their systematic methodology and broader sample database greatly expanded his research horizons. He began to re-examine all the known symbols on the Hemlock Island slate, attempting to understand them using a new classification framework and set about designing a more rigorous common grammar point verification process. He realized that some of his previous conjectures might have relied too much on single samples and needed more cross validation to be confirmed.

Communication channels with Vera's team remained silent. Both sides seem to tacitly need time to digest the results of their first exchange. Shh's cold weather reserve team concluded another round of intensive training and conducted a 3-day comprehensive exercise. The simulated objective was to establish a temporary forward base and complete the transfer and guarding of specific supplies in complex environments characterized by severe cold, dense fog, and ice flows. The exercise exposed several problems such as the fragility of tools in low temperatures, insufficient communication reliability in fog, and a lack of efficient and safe equipment for landing in ice flow areas.

Sherhow noted these issues down and immediately organized improvements upon his return, contacting Shian Duodo to procure specific models of alloy tools with better toughness, asking Leeway to help design and improve the existing flag signaling and whistle communication rules and urging the ship rights to expedite the reinforcement of the anti-colision measures and the modification of the anti-skid decks on several spare speedboats. Just as Mo Yuan Pavilion was strengthening itself step by step, the intelligence network under Chiandua's command like keen tentacles continued to capture every unusual movement in the outside world. First, regarding the ice rifts, Dragon Soul seems determined, having not only installed long-term monitoring equipment, but also recently deployed a significantly larger and more professional research fleet to the perimeter, attempting to deploy deep sea submersibles equipped with lighting and cameras into the rifts. This move is clearly no longer just observation, but carries explicit exploratory intent. However, the operation appears to be unsuccessful.

Merchant ships passing through nearby waters claimed to have seen Dragon Souls fleet briefly retreat with some broken equipment debris floating on the surface, suggesting a possible malfunction or accident involving the submersibles. Dragon Soul subsequently strengthened security in the area, prohibiting other vessels from approaching, but exploration activities have not ceased, only become more cautious. Dragon Soul is determined to find out what's down there. Chindidu coming to Leno. They've even used a deep sea submersible.

The investment is considerable. It seems that what's in that rift is more attractive or more unsettling to Dragon Soul than we imagined, and we must find out as soon as possible. Secondly, there's the Stonemason's Brotherhood. Their acquisition of anti-inference communication components and deep water pressurees shell materials continues unabated. Furthermore, Chindwood was informants have noticed that their agents at several key trading points have recently begun inquiring about highfrequency acoustic wave generators and specific frequency resonant crystals offering high prices but with extremely demanding requirements.

They looking for increasingly obscure and specific things. Chin Duo frowned. It seems they also preparing to explore some extreme environment and their technological approach might be different from Dragon Soul S. Is it more inclined towards acoustics or vibration technology? Could it be that something beneath the ice shards needs special sound waves to detect or activate the most eye-catching remnants of the wings of Liberty in a misty bay of the southwest? The low humming sound previously heard during tests of the big guy inside the fortress was not an isolated incident. According to reports from centuries stationed in the nearby waters to monitor the situation, this humming sound reappeared two or three more times in the following days, each lasting for varying durations, from a dozen minutes to nearly an hour.

The sound seemed to emanate from the core of the fortress deep in the bay. Even through the thick fog and waves, a faint, unsettling, and rhythmic vibration could still be faintly felt. What's even more unsettling is that during the most recent instance of the buzzing sound, a reconnaissance speedboat from the pavilion patrolling the perimeter, maintaining a safe distance, observed unnatural disturbances in the cloud formations above Misty Bay. Faint but unusual arc-shaped flashes of light flickered deep within the clouds, accompanying the rhythmic buzzing. This phenomenon lasted for less than a minute, disappearing as the buzzing ceased.

electromagnetic phenomenon or some other energy leak. This was Leewi's first thought upon hearing the description. If it were just mechanical operation, it's unlikely to cause visible changes in the high altitude clouds. That big guy is probably more than just a large weapon or engineering machine. What kind of blueprints did the Stonemason brothers provide them with? Sure.

How's expression was grim? Whatever it is, the longer the remnants of the wings of freedom control it, the greater the threat it poses to us and the surrounding areas. The competition in exploring the shattered ice zone was escalating with technological means beginning to intervene. The Stonemason's Brotherhood's technological reserves and objectives were becoming increasingly clear.

Meanwhile, the remnants of the Wings of Freedom, the enemy they thought was hiding away to lick their wounds, seemed to have, with the aid of mysterious technology, cobbled together some kind of device with unknown energy characteristics. These unusual movements, viewed individually, might simply be the result of various forces acting according to their own logic. But taken together, they suddly paint a picture of an impending storm. The secrets of ancient ruins, lost technologies, and the ambitions and fears of various forces are intertwining and colliding in this sea. The ship Mayuan Pavilion began to subtly adjust its sails and ballast stones based on the wind signals coming from all directions, preparing to meet the potentially more complex and unpredictable sea conditions. As night fell, Lynmo climbed the watchtowwer once more. The northern sky was deep and clear, while the southwest was shrouded in its usual mist.

On the sea, the lights of Mo Yuan Pavilion mingled with the starlight, appearing peaceful and steadfast. But Lynn Mo and Mo knew that beneath this tranquility, the undercurrents were growing increasingly turbulent. Frequent unusual movements could be a crisis, but they could also be an opportunity. The key was whether he could see the direction of the tide before the storm truly hit and position his ship in the most advantageous position. He needed more information, more accurate judgment, and a faster pace of growth.

Time seemed to be more pressing than ever before. Chapter 95 Echoes from Afar. The fog over the broken ice zone, the humming from the depths of the bay, and the looming claws of various forces like thunderclouds gathering on the distant horizon did not directly envelop the mo yuan pavilion. But the muffled thunder and the occasional flashes of lightning were enough to make the lookouts tense. Preparations within the mo yuan pavilion were accelerating.

Yet outwardly an orderly facade remained maintained. Seedlings in the plantation thrived under the stabilizers. The cold weather reserve team began joint drills at night and in severe weather conditions, and the warehouses supplies were breaking records daily. However, an invisible pressure had quietly seeped into every discussion and decision-making process within the core circle. The second written exchange with Vera's team was completed again via the channel on Conch Island after the agreed interval.

This time the Mayuan Pavilion team added a little more depth to the previous exchange, providing a summary of observations on the graphical tendencies of representing the concepts of cycle or periodicity in different symbol systems and attaching several highly abstracted example symbols. Vera's team's feedback once again demonstrated their profound knowledge. They not only responded to the discussion about cycles, but also provided a brief overview of common energy buffering or isolation structures in ancient ruins, mentioning several recurring symbol combinations in different ruins suspected of being used for damped oscillations or filtering specific frequency energy. This material happens to have a subtle connection to the energy disturbances that Leewi and Shure how have recently been focusing on the potential energy disturbances caused by the big guy wings of liberty energy buffering isolation and filtering of specific frequencies. Leewi studied the new data repeatedly, his eyes shining.

Vera and the others may also be paying attention to similar phenomena. If the combinations of symbols they provided really have practical functions as speculated, it may mean that ancient civilizations have long master methods to deal with specific energy fluctuations and may even have designed them into certain devices or building structures. Such an considered it from another angle. If the things inside the wings of Liberty Fortress are indeed releasing some kind of regular, possibly energy containing fluctuation, then according to this document, the ancients might have used structures represented by these symbols to buffer or isolate to prevent damage to the surrounding environment or the equipment itself. But the Wings of Liberty obviously didn't, or perhaps they didn't care.

It is also possible that the technical blueprints they received were incomplete or that the stonemasons brotherhood provided a flawed version that didn't t take stability into account. She and Duodo guessed after all those greyroed men dant looked like philanthropists who would care about the life or death of the users. Then Emmo pondered Vera's team had once again provided highly targeted and insightful information as if he could anticipate their focus. Was this a keen academic resonance or some kind of deliberate guidance? He couldn't determine for the time being, but the value of the information was undeniable. Combine these symbolic features related to energy buffering and isolation with the common grammar points that Leewi summarized earlier and try to deduce whether we can design a simple device model that can theoretically detect or weaken energy fluctuations at specific frequencies, even if it's just on paper.

Lynn mo instructedly weigh require it to be built immediately but we need to figure out the principles and the materials that might be needed at the same time anonymously leak the part of this new data about frequency filtering to our technical intelligence dealers at several key trading points and see if there is similar demand or technology emerging in the market especially through channels related to the stonemasons brotherhood. He wanted to verify whether these academic conjectures provided by Vera's team actually corresponded to the technical materials that the Stonemason's brotherhood was collecting in reality. A few days later, the surveillance of the misty bay of wings of freedom finally yielded a more concrete breakthrough. A seasoned fisherman who had been sponsored by Chanduo for a long time and used fishing for precious silver threadfin bream as a cover ventured close to a secluded headland on the outskirts of the bay on a rare clear day. With the help of a high-powered telescope, he could see part of the fortress's outline in the distance.

It wasn't a castle or fortress in the traditional sense, but rather a low-lying massive industrial complex covered in metal and stone. Most striking was its central section, where a strangely shaped cylindrical structure composed of multiple layers of metal rings and thick pipes stood, estimated to be over 30 m high and about 10 m in diameter. The outer walls of the cylindrical structure were covered with intricate welding marks and additional supports, suggesting it had been hastily assembled. At the time, the structure wasn't operational. It stood silently, but numerous figures were busily working around it, seemingly inspecting or adjusting it.

That big cylinder is definitely the thing that makes the buzzing sound. Sure house said with certainty after seeing the sketch drawn based on the fisherman's description. With such a complex structure and such a large volume, the energy it consumes must be astonishing. No wonder they hid in Misty Bay. Once this thing is activated, it will be a giant signal lighthouse.

The fisherman also said that he saw some people dressed differently from the tattered clothes of the wings of freedom, loitering around the cylindrical base, pointing and whispering, and he suspected they were members of the stonemason's brotherhood, Shien Duodo added. But they didn't te stay long and quickly left in one of those special speedboats. Around the same time, new and unexpected news also came from the northern icebreaking zone. Dragon Souls deep sea exploration appears to have made some progress. They haven't made any public discoveries, but the perimeter security has been significantly tightened, and they've even begun to drive away certain ships that get too close and whose backgrounds are unclear, suspected to be reconnaissance vessel from the Stonemason's Brotherhood or other forces.

However, even under this tight blockade, a rumor of dubious veracity has begun to circulate in some highly secretive intelligence circles. Reports indicate that Dragon Souls deep sea submersible instead of discovering the imagined ancient architecture or treasure deep within the rift detected an extremely weak but clearly regular acoustic signal. This signal was not naturally formed. Its encoding is extremely complex, seemingly containing a vast amount of information, yet no one could decipher it. Even more disturbingly, when the submersible attempted to record and approach the signal source, it encountered unexplained strong interference, causing some instruments to malfunction and forcing it to surface.

A Dragon Soul technician involved in the operation privately revealed that the interference did not resemble a mechanical malfunction or natural phenomenon, but rather seemed like some kind of proactive defense mechanism. Acoustic signals, active defense. Leeway almost jumped up when he heard the news. This matches our previous speculation that the Stonemason's Brotherhood might be looking for sound wave related technologies and a frequency filtering mentioned in Vera's data. There might be an ancient system that is still partially operational beneath the shattered eye zone using sound waves for communication or control.

The dragon soul has touched its outer defenses. Such an also shocked. If that's true, then it's not just a static relic. It might still be alive with at least some of its functions still running automatically. This news carries immense weight.

If true, it means that what lies beneath the cracks in the ice flows is far more valuable and dangerous than even the most radical estimates. The technology and potential consequences of a still functioning ancient system are immeasurable. Limo's expression was grave. The complexity and danger of the situation, the living ruins in the north, the energy behemoth in the southwest and the stonemason's brotherhood and the complex Veritim roaming between them, eyeing ancient technology were escalating exponentially. Can the source of this information be confirmed? He asked Chien Duo Duo.

I can't confirm it completely, but the source of the information is an old informant IV cultivated for many years and who is highly reliable. He swore that he heard it from a Dragon Soul peripheral logistics staff member who had spoken out of turn while drunk and that person was transferred from his post the next day. Dot Lynn Emmo walked to the sea chart, his gaze shifting back and forth between the Shattered Ice Zone and the Misty Bay. These two places, one in the north and one in the southwest, were far apart.

Yet, they seemed to be subtly connected by an invisible thread composed of ancient technology and energy anomalies. An MON pavilion was located at a node within the radiation range of this hidden thread. Suspend all further communication with Vera's team. Lynn Mo suddenly made the decision. inform them that Mo Yuan Pavilion is temporarily suspending all external academic exchange activities indefinitely due to internal matters.

We express our gratitude for the previous exchange of materials. Everyone was taken aback. Shen Duo asked, "Boss, do you suspect them?" It asked not that we suspect they necessarily have a problem, but with the situation unclear and risks escalating, any additional uncontrolled contact could become a variable. Lynn Emmo explained we need time to digest the existing information and more importantly we need to focus on dealing with the imminent threat once the wings of freedom s cylinder is fully operational it is likely to make a big move the secrets of the shattered ice zone will dragon soul and the stonemason brothers let this go ensure that we are not dragged into any party s scheme or used as a panda he paused then said firmly from now on mo yuan pavilion will be on full alert. All non-essential external communications will be reduced to a minimum.

Sure, how the guard team will be on level two alert, strengthening the defense and patrols of all key locations. Chi and Duo Duo, the intelligence network will be scaled back, prioritizing the security and monitoring of our own sphere of influence. External information will be collected primarily and all proactive infiltration or guidance activities will be suspended. Leewi Suchian, your research will shift to internal application, focusing on utilizing existing knowledge to enhance our defense, production, and survivability. Yes.

The crowd solemnly accepted the order. The distant echoes were already clearly audible. A storm was brewing, and the ship of Emo Yuan Pavilion had to furl its unnecessary sails, inspect every plank, and prepare ballast stones to meet the real challenge. Lynn Mo's gaze swept over every resolute face in the council chamber. After so much quiet development and accumulation, it was time to see if Mo Yuan Pavilion could stand firm like a reef when the storm truly arrived or even find a way to move forward amidst the waves.

The undercurrents on the nautical chart will eventually surface, and they must be fully prepared. Chapter 96, The Silent String. Lynn Mo's order to be on full alert and retreat for self-preservation was like a pebble thrown into a calm lake within the Mo Yuan Pavilion. It didn't create ripples, but rather a rapid, orderly, and silent chain reaction. This island, this ship named Mo Yuan Pavilion, began to tighten its muscles and tense its nerves in a visible yet silent way.

The most noticeable changes came from the defense front. Sher House suspended almost all non-essential island construction and production tasks, focusing his main efforts on strengthening and testing the defense system. Stricter warning zones were established around the main island and several key subsidiary islands with the addition of numerous concealed lookout points and hidden stakeouts. All ships entering and leaving the shipping lanes, whether owned by the Mo Yuan Pavilion or from foreign trade, the latter having been significantly reduced, were subject to more thorough inspection and guidance, and their routes were redesigned, moving them away from the core area. The storm ships and several main warships completed their final comprehensive overhaul and resupply and are ready to be deployed at any time.

The cold weather reserve has been split up with some elites added to the standing escort and others forming a rapid reaction force equipped with the best gear stationed at several strategic points to ensure they can be deployed from different directions to fight or provide support in the shortest possible time after receiving an alert. Inside the island, the number of guards at key facilities such as warehouses, workshops, command posts, and research workshops, leeway and suanch's work areas, has doubled, and a double post system and a regular patrols have been implemented. Sherhow even organized a small-cale exercise simulating enemy infiltration and sabotage to test the guard's reaction and the effectiveness of the emergency plan. Although some minor problems were exposed, he was somewhat satisfied with the overall vigilance and response speed. Chindwood's intelligence network swiftly shifted from actively gathering intelligence and guiding public opinion to passively receiving information and rigorously filtering it.

All dispatched informants received clear instructions, cease all proactive contact and reconnaissance activities that could arouse suspicion, and switch to silent observation. The focus was on monitoring key target areas. The periphery of the icebreaker zone, the exit of Misty Bay, and major trade route nodes, recording any anomalies, but without intervention. Communication channels with Vera's team were unilaterally silenced, and the conchk island transit station entered a receiving not transmitting state. In terms of market transactions, Mo Yuan Pavilion significantly reduced the amount of high-v value or sensitive materials sold to the outside world while quietly increasing its reserve purchases of basic survival supplies, especially storeable food, clean water, medicine, and basic building materials.

Its actions were dispersed and discreet, avoiding price fluctuations or excessive external attention. Chin Duo Duo, like an experienced spider, retracted most of its web, leaving only the most essential strands, quietly sensing every trimmer in its web. Leewi and Sue Chian's research direction was also pragmatically adjusted according to Linmo's request. Leeway temporarily set aside the profound deduction of the common grammar of the ancient symbolic system and instead focused on two things. First, in collaboration with SHOW, they attempted to design several simple prototype alarm devices for detecting abnormal energy fluctuations or sound waves of specific frequencies using existing semiodic conjectures about energy fluctuations and buffer isolation.

Although limited by materials and processes, the effective detection range and accuracy of these prototype devices were very limited, but they at least provided a theoretical possibility of early warning. Second, they systematically organized all the technical drawings and templates obtained from previous check-ins, transactions, and research on relics, assessed their direct application value in defense, production, and survival, and compiled a list of key materials needed for improvement or mass production. Such Chanchian then conducted a phase summary of the long-term observation data of the environmental stabilizer, confirming its stable positive effects on crop yield increase and local environmental optimization. She began to compile a concise guideline for the construction and management of high efficiency planning areas, systematizing experiences in site selection, layout, stabilizer use, and crop rotation for future use in expanding production or guiding allies. At the same time, she also assisted Leeway in analyzing the potential impacts of abnormal energy fluctuations on ecology and human health from biological and environmental perspectives.

Although empirical data was lacking, at least some theoretical early warning indicators were established. The entire Moan Pavilion seemed to have transformed from adventurous ship sailing the waves into a fortified sea fortress, now on high alert and impregnable. The daily hustle and bustle was replaced by more disciplined busyiness, and a calm and focused atmosphere permeated the air. Everyone knew something big might be about to happen. But long-term training and Lin Mo's consistent composure prevented this tension from turning into panic, instead transforming it into more cautious action and closer cooperation.

Lynn Mo himself was like a reclusive chess player, spending most of his time in the reinforced main building's command room. The situation map hanging on the wall was updated daily and he carefully analyzed and considered all the external intelligence gathered by Chandu Duo, the defense status reported by Sherhao and the research progress of Leewi and Such Chian. External intelligence continued to arrive intermittently like distant rumbles of thunder in the direction of the shattered ice zone. The Dragon Souls blockade remained tight. Exploration activities seemed to have entered a more covert and technical phase with no more large-scale fleet operations, but the oppressive feeling of an impending storm was growing stronger.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood's procurement list had added items such as high precision inertial navigation units and geomagnetic field anomaly recorders, indicating that their goals were becoming increasingly clear and their technical preparations increasingly professional. In the misty bay of the southwest, the wings of Liberty's fortress remained shrouded in thick fog. But the frequency of the low humming sound seemed to be slowly increasing and its duration was trending towards longer. Reconnaissance speedboats on the perimeter reported that during the recent episodes of the hum, fish in the nearby waters exhibited brief unnatural gatherings or scattering and some sensitive navigation compasses showed slight brief fluctuations in their needles. These signs all indicated that the influence of the cylinder device was gradually spilling over.

What concerned Linmo most was a seemingly unrelated message from the eastern seas. A fleet that regularly hunted large sea monsters on the edge of the Cape of Storms reported several extremely unusual incidents of collective sea monster agitation. Recently, several large sea monsters with different habits, and even natural enemies would suddenly gather in specific areas, behave wildly, attack each other, and even actively ram ships before inexplicably dispersing within a short period, leaving behind large areas of bloodstained seawater and wreckage. This phenomenon was extremely rare in the past, but it had occurred three times in the past month. It's like it's been subjected to some kind of strong but unconventional stimulus or drive.

Sue Chanchian analyzed after hearing the news. It could be underwater geological activity or it could be some kind of energy field or pheromone interference that we don't yet understand if it's related to the wings of freedom device or something beneath the ice flows. She didn't continue but her anxiety was palpable. The world was becoming increasingly uneasy, and the source of this unease seemed to be pointing to the ancient relics that were gradually surfacing. Time passed in silent vigilance.

Mo Yuan Pavilion was like a fully drawn bow, the string taught, the arrow poised, but not yet released. Lyn Mo waited, waiting for a clearer signal, waiting for a gap in the situation to appear, or waiting for the inevitable collision to finally arrive. He stood by the command room window, gazing at the well-trained guards and an orderly island outside. The power that had been painstakingly accumulated had now transformed into tangible barriers and sharp blades. But the impending storm might far surpass anything seen before.

How much tension could this silent string withstand? And when would it unleash that decisive hum? As dusk settles where the sea meets the sky, the lights of Man Pavilion gradually illuminate the scene. Standing like a silent yet resolute island in this increasingly uneasy world. The strings are taught, awaiting the wind. Chapter 97. The strings strikes and the wind rises.

The silent vigilance of Mayu pavilion was like a deep sea current, seemingly calm on the surface, yet surging with immense energy and focus within. More than 10 days passed in this highly tense yet unusually orderly state. News from the outside world like filtered sea breezes seeped into this silent fortress, carrying with it the distant scent of gunpowder and the coldness of metal. The rumbling thunder from the direction of the ice shards finally echoed more clearly. Chien Duo Duo obtained a fragmented but incredibly informative intelligence summary through an extremely secretive and costly channel.

This summary appeared to originate from a technician who had participated in the early exploration program of Dragon Soul, but left due to ideological differences or conflicts of interest. The summary revealed that Dragon Souls Deep Sea Submersible not only detected regular acoustic signals, but also discovered and successfully retrieved a sample of a non-naturally formed composite structure from the ice rock mixture on the sidewall of a fissure. The sample description is vague, but it mentions that its material is not any known metal or rock and it possesses excellent energy conductivity and memory properties. It can slowly recover its original shape after being deformed under pressure. More importantly, the sample surface is etched with resonance patterns that partially match the frequencies of acoustic signals received deep within the fissures.

Dragon Souls preliminary analysis suggests that this sample is likely a fragment or node of a larger structure and its patterns could be either antennas receiving specific commands or anchor points maintaining the stability of the local energy field. They really did dig something out from below. Leeway's breathing quickened as he looked at the summary translated and compiled by Chien Duo Duo. The resonant pattern energy anchor points are very likely of the same origin as the symbols on our stone slab. Beneath the ice shards, there's probably a large scale ancient complex, some of which are still operational.

The intelligence summary also mentioned that after obtaining the samples, the acoustic signals deep within the fiser experienced a brief but violent disturbance accompanied by a smallcale non-earquake induced cavity collapse sound within the ice layer. Dragon Souls monitoring equipment recorded the instantaneous ultra- low frequency pulses causing damage to some precision instruments. Subsequently, the acoustic signals became weak and unstable, forcing the exploration operation to transition to a more cautious long-term monitoring and sample analysis phase. The active defense mechanism has been triggered. Lynn Mo concluded the dragon soul got the key, but it also alerted the watchdog.

The thing below reacted very quickly. Almost simultaneously, the buzzing behemoth in the southwestern misty bay seemed to have completed a phase of adjustment and began to reveal its fangs more clearly. The previous low intermittent hum gradually evolved into a more penetrating rhythmic pulsating roar. Every 6 to 8 hours, the roar would occur precisely, lasting for about 15 minutes like the slow beating of a giant heart. When the roar occurred, not only did the cloud disturbances and faint flashes of lightning over the bay become more frequent and clear, but even dozens of nautical miles away, the distinct rhythmic vibrations could be detected with simple hydrophones.

Even more disturbingly, during the two most recent pulse booms, monitoring points set up at a greater distance by Moyuan Pavilion to listen to ambient background noise recorded an extremely weak modulation signal that seemed to be synchronized with the boom pulses. This signal was mixed in with a complex ocean background noise and was difficult to analyze. But Leeway initially judged that it was likely a carrier signal. That is the boom might not just be a simple sound wave or energy release but was also actively sending out some kind of modulated signal carrying information. Is it speaking or summoning something? Felt sure how's concerns were more direct.

Regardless of what it's sending, this regular signal with its distinct energy characteristics is like a torch in the dark. The remnants of the wings of freedom are probably hiding in Misty Bay, not just to conceal themselves, but also to use the complex environment there is covered to conduct this kind of signal broadcasting. Their goal is definitely not limited to holding out in one place. Just as the key in the north and the broadcast in the southwest were gripping everyone's attention, new activity emerged from the temporarily silent scholar channel. Vera's team ship hadn't left, remaining unusually quiet in the public anchorage outside the Mo Yuan Pavilion.

However, the transit station on Conch Island received an insigned tightly sealed letter addressed to the person in charge of Mo Yuan Pavilion. The letter wasn't sent through the usual exchange channels, but was delivered directly by a stranger who called himself a wandering messenger who dropped it off and left. The letter was very short, consisting of only two sentences written in an elegant variant of archaic script. The sound of ice breaking has already begun, and the sea of fog is about to boil. Knowledge knows no bounds, but storms have eyes.

Those who observe quietly may see the opportunity for dragons and snakes to rise from the land. If there is any glimmer of light to be found at midnight, 3 days from now at the old place, let the starlight be the signal. The document wasn't signed, but the wording and implications clearly indicated it came from Ver's team. They were not only aware of the unusual activity in the icebreaker zone in Misty Bay, but also seemed to foresee even greater chaos, dragon and snake rising from the land. They extended an olive branch of cooperation once again, but this time it hinted at a more proactive stance of observation or even intervention and proposed a specific time and place.

The old place likely refers to Conk Island in a mysterious method of communication, a spark as a signal. They really have been watching us do frowned. They even knew when we were silent and they used a more covert way to send a message directly. Spark as signal sounds like some kind of optical signal. What are they trying to do? Are they trying to get us to join them in the chaos and get a share of the spoils? Or do they have some crucial information and want to team up with us? Sure, how asked cautiously.

Showing ourselves at this time is too risky. Leewi eyes was moved by the line. Knowledge knows no bounds, but storms have eyes in the letter. They may believe that this storm caused by ancient relics is a key window to gain deeper knowledge, but they also acknowledge that the risks are huge. So they want to find reliable allies to share the glimmer of light.

Such Chian said softly. They mentioned those who observe silently may witness the opportunity for dragons and snakes to rise from the land. Is this implying that if we just passively wait, we might miss important turning points or be swallowed up by a sudden giant wave? Perhaps proactive, limited observation and preparation are the way to deal with the storm. All eyes were fixed on Lyno. The exploration in the north had achieved a breakthrough, but triggered a counterattack.

The device in the southwest began broadcasting regularly, and a mysterious group of scholars extended an invitation tinged with adventure. The silent strings had been plucked by forces from different directions, emitting a low, clear vado. The wind had begun to blow. Lynn Emo silently stared at the brief letter, then glanced at the constantly updated situation map on the wall. Mo Yuan Pavilion was like a temporarily calm spot in the eye of a storm, but the surrounding vortex was rapidly closing in.

Continuing to remain completely silent and protect themselves might avoid the initial impact. But it could also mean missing the opportunity to learn the truth, acquire key resources, or even influence the course of the situation. Completely heeding Vera's suggestion and recklessly intervening would undoubtedly plunge themselves into an unknown vortex. He needs a middle way. A way that allows him to acquire information and exert influence while minimizing risk.

No direct meeting. Lynn, Emo finally spoke, his voice steady and firm. She and Duo Duo prepare an encrypted reply. The content is as follows. The sparks are visible, but boats cannot reach it.

A mirror can be set up at the old place to observe the stars from one direction only. If the stars are willing, they can reflect a cloud map or two. The time limit remains unchanged. He looked at the slightly confused group and explained, "We on one t send anyone." We ll set up a hidden observation point on Conch Island that can only receive specific light signals. Spark if Vera and the others appear as scheduled and send out their signals.

We ll observe their action from a distance to see what they want to do and who they want to contact. At the same time, we ll hint to them that if they re willing to share key information about the current situation, cloud atlas, we can consider establishing a one-way controllable information reception channel, mirror stargazing. This is an extreme form of caution and probing. It involves remaining unseen, making no promises, observing without revealing anything, and using a vague exchange condition to entice the other party to first disclose some valuable intelligence. What if they agree and actually provide valuable information? Chen Duo Duo asked, "That proves they're indeed sincere in their willingness to cooperate and that we have the intelligence we need.

We can decide whether to conduct further extremely limited and absolutely secure written exchanges based on the value of the information, but it will absolutely not involve any joint operations."
