Lynmo said, "If they disagree or if the so-called spark is just bait, then we will remain silent and strengthen our defenses." With the plan finalized, everyone immediately split up to prepare. Chandu Duo was responsible for encrypted replies and arranging the receiving point on Conch Island. Shirha was responsible for selecting the most elite reconnaissance personnel to secretly go to the nearby waters to provide support and leeway and Sue Chian assisted in designing the optical observation and signal identification schemes required for mirror stargazing. The strings of Mo Yuan Pavilion remain taut, but fingertips have already lightly touched them, ready to pluck their own calm and astute notes amidst the rustling winds and howling winds. The strings pluck, the wind rises, and the true test seems to be quietly approaching between the midnight starlight and the silent mirror.

Chapter 98. Peeping at the stars at midnight. The agreed upon 3-day deadline arrived quietly beneath the surface of a high level of vigilance, yet an unusually calm atmosphere both inside and outside the Mo Yuan Pavilion. The daytime hustle and bustle faded away, and night, as dark as ink, spread across the sea and sky. The stars were sparse, and the crescent moon was hidden behind thin clouds, making it the perfect time to carry out clandestine activities.

Conchk Island. This unassuming little island appears even more tranquil under the cover of night. Beneath a steep cliff on the island's north side, eroded by the sea, lies a hidden recess. Its entrance narrow, yet revealing a hidden world within. Originally an emergency hiding place set up by Chen Duodu years ago, it has now been temporarily converted into a one-way observation station.

The interior of the recess had been simply cleaned and an inconspicuous viewing hole was carved into the open sea. Its inner wall lined with lightabsorbing black velvet. Behind the viewing hole mounted a long telescope hastily modified by Leeway. This telescope centered on a highquality crystal lens obtained through a signin event incorporated several sets of precise gears and rails allowing for fine-tuning of the observation angle without moving the telescope itself and possessed some night vision enhancement capabilities utilizing a photosensitive coating sensitive to faint starlight. The eyepiece of the telescope was connected to a complex light blocking tube ensuring that not a single ray of light leaked out.

The observation mission was led by two elite guards personally selected by Sherh How, cenamed Night Owl and Raven. Both were experienced reconnaissance specialists, skilled in infiltration and observation and utterly loyal to the Mo Yuan pavilion. 6 hours in advance, they secretly infiltrated the cave, carrying sufficient water and rations, as well as a simple signal transmission device connecting to a speedboat several miles away. hidden in a reef area via a highly concealed waterproof signal line buried in a rock crevice on the speedboat. A dedicated person was responsible for translating the received signals in real time and transmitting them back to the main island.

Linmo Sherha Chandu Duo Leewi and Su Chian gathered in the main island's command room awaiting news. On the walls of the command room, a detailed nautical chart of the area surrounding Conch Island was enlarged and hung, marking known reefs, ocean currents, and possible observation points. A copy of Vera's letter and a draft of her encrypted reply lay open on the table. The atmosphere was solemn and heavy. Time ticked by, and midnight was fast approaching.

The only sounds in the command room were a scratching of charcoal pencils across paper and the occasional hush conversations. Such Chian gently stroked the sea shell bracelet on her wrist while Leeway repeatedly examined several drafts on the table concerning possible forms of optical signal encoding. Lynn Immo sat upright in the main seat. His gaze calmly fixed on the small representing Conchk Island on the nautical chart, his fingers unconsciously tapping a rhythmic beat on the back of his chair. "It's exactly midnight." Sherhow looked at the water clock and announced the time in a low voice.

Almost as soon as he finished speaking, the signal receiver connected to the speedboat made a slight click and then the green light indicating signal access lit up. The guard in charge of communications quickly handed the headset to Lynn Mo. A slight static noise came through the headphones, followed by Night Owl's extremely low but exceptionally clear voice coming through the signal cable. Main island. This is Night Owl.

Midnight. No abnormalities on the sea. Observation scope in place. Clear view. No light source detected.

Continued to observe, Lynn Mo replied briefly. About 15 minutes passed. Just when everyone thought Vera's team might not appear or that spark as a signal had another meaning, Night Owl's voice rang out again with a hint of tension that was barely perceptible. Main island attention. At the 11:00 position, about three nautical miles away, there's a faint flash on the sea.

The flashes are irregularly spaced, but there seems to be a repeating pattern being recorded. Everyone in the command room perked up. Leeway immediately went to the table, picked up paper and pen, and prepared to record the signal pattern. Chin Duo Duo quickly marked a point at the 11:00 position on the nautical chart. The flashing pattern is initially identified.

Short, short, long, short, long, long. Repeating once every 3 seconds and then pausing. Bial's voice calmly reported the observation results. Leewi quickly jotted down on the paper a fragment representing RU in Morse code, but not entirely standard. He whispered, "It doesn't seem like a standard communication code.

It might be a custom identification signal." Night Owl continued reporting. The flashes have stopped. A ship has appeared on the sea. Its outline is Vera's threemasted sailing ship slowly moving towards the designated reef area southeast of Conch Island. There are no lights on the ship, only faintly visible by starlight and the reflection of the sea is moving very slowly.

Are there any other signs of activity on the ship? Lyn Mo asked. Nothing yet. The sailboat has anchored outside the reef area. A small boat with about three people has been launched and is paddling towards the beach on the southeast side of the island. The small boat has no lights on.

Continue to monitor the movement of the small boats and pay attention to any abnormalities on the sailboats and other sea areas, Lin Mo instructed. Clear. The next half hour was a long wait and meticulous observation. After the three people on the small boat landed, they seem to be busy with something on the beach, but due to the angle and the darkness, the observation mirror in the recess could not see the details clearly. Night Owl and Raven could only judge their presence by the occasional blurry figures and extremely faint sounds of tools.

What are they setting up? Could it be that the so-called spark isn't launched from the ship, but from the island? Chen Duo Duo guessed. Lee Wei eyes focused on the signal pattern. Although the flashing signals they emitted were not standard, it was clearly a conscious act of communication. Who were they trying to contact besides us? Could it be anyone else? Just then, Night Owl's voice rang out again, tinged with obvious surprise. Main island, attention.

A light is rising from the direction of the beach. It's not an open flame, but a cold light. The color is bluish white. The brightness is stable, and it's slowly rising like some kind of signal lantern. It's about 3 m high.

The light is flashing in a specific rhythm. The rhythm is long, short, short, long, short. Unlike the previous flashing pattern on the sea, new light signal, Vera's team did indeed establish a signal point on the island. Who are they sending signals to? In the air or in other directions at sea? Sukiangyang Wandiff. Raven reporting.

Another slightly deeper voice cut in on the communication. Raven was using another telescope to observe the sea in other directions. Watch the two:00 position about five nautical miles away. There is a faint reflective object moving on the sea. It is moving very fast.

It is approaching. The outline is of a small speedboat and the style is very similar to the stonemason's brotherhood s speciallymade speedboat mentioned in the previous intelligence. The stonemason's brotherhood. They come after all. The atmosphere in the command room instantly tensed.

Vera's team sent a signal attracting the stonemason's brotherhood ship. Was this a trap or a secret contact that all three parties were aware of? Night Owl, Raven, maintain absolute silence. Observe only and record all details that Lynn and Mo voice remain calm. Pay attention to the Stonemason's Brotherhood speedboat movements and their methods of contact with Ver team. Dot.

Clear. What followed completely exceeded Emo Yuinga's expectations. The Stonemason's Brotherhood speedboat did not approach Conch Island directly, but slowed down about a nautical mile away and began to slowly circle around a fixed point. At the same time, a highly concentrated dark red thin beam of light shone from the bow of the speedboat like a blood red line shooting straight towards the approximate direction of the bluish white signal lantern on the island's beach. A laser or was some kind of highly directional signal light? Leeway exclaimed in a low voice.

They're using this method for directional communication. The red and blue lights did not intersect in the night sky, but they clearly constituted a kind of dialogue that could take place without close proximity. The entire process lasted less than 5 minutes. The red light went out first, and the Stonemason's Brotherhood speedboat immediately changed direction and sped away at an even higher speed, quickly disappearing into the night shrouded sea. Moments later, the bluish white lanterns on the beach also went out.

Vera's team's small boat quickly reappeared and rode back to their sailboat. The sailboat weighed anchor and also silently sailed away in a different direction from the Stonemason's Brotherhood speedboat. Conchk Island returned to its deathly silence as if everything that had just happened was merely an illusion. Night Owl Raven, after confirming the target has completely left, proceed with caution. Be sure to clean up any traces, Lynn.

Mo ordered. Yes. Communications were temporarily cut off. Silence filled the command room, broken only by the slightly heavy breathing of the crew. Vera and the others actually contacted the Stonemason's Brotherhood directly in this way.

Chin Duo duo exclaimed incredulously. Didn't they say they had competition and conflicts with the Stonemason's Brotherhood? This looks more like a secret rendevu. Perhaps the conflict is real, but in some situations, cooperation is also necessary," Linimo said slowly. "They used the mirror we provided to let us see firsthand their contact with the Stonemason's Brotherhood. Was this a demonstration or a sign of honesty? Or are they trying to send us some kind of message that they have the ability to speak directly with that mysterious organization?" The two signals they rescending along with the red light from the stonemason's brotherhood are definitely exchanging information that Leeway frowned.

But what is it? Is it about the shattered eyeone or the misty bay or some other ruins we dy know about? Suchian said worriedly. Does the fact that they showed us these things mean that what's going to happen next might affect us? Are they giving us a heads up or trying to drag us into this? Sure. How clenched his fist? Regardless of their purpose, the Stonemason's Brotherhood is entangled with the remnants of the Wings of Liberty. And now Vera's team is also secretly contacting the Stonemason's Brotherhood. This is a very murky situation.

We must be even more careful. Lynamo stood up and walked to the nautical chart, his gaze deep. Peering at the stars at midnight didn't yield clear answers, but rather a more elusive star map and interwoven shadows. Vera's team had demonstrated their channels and capabilities, while the Stonemason's Brotherhood had revealed their more clearly defined technological fangs. The Mo Yuan Pavilion as a silent observer was safe, but might also be thus isolated from the true flow of information and the decision-making circle.

Record everything observed tonight in detail and archive it. Linmo turnaround is tone firm. At the same time, activate the second contingency plan. She and Duo Duo sent a new encrypted message to Ver ship through the backup secure channel. The message should contain only two words.

Observe no comments, no demands. Doc, he paused, his gaze sweeping over the crowd. They told us to look, so we looked. Next, we need to see what they do and also see which way the wind will blow in the icebreaker zone and the Misty Bay. Continue to strengthen our vigilance.

Meanwhile, Lewi, Su Chian, concentrate on trying to decipher the possible meaning of the signal patterns we saw tonight from all the information we have. Even if it's just a guess, we need more pieces of the puzzle to understand this game. The midnight sparks and mirrors have faded, but the reflections and preparations they evoked have only just begun. Mo Yuan Pavilion remains on the edge of the storm, but its observing eyes have become even sharper before the true waves crash against the shore. Every ripple of information deserves careful capture and weighing.

Chapter 99. Cipher letters. The words observed vanished silently from the other end of the encrypted channel like a pebble thrown into a deep pool. Mo Yuan Pavilion received no reply from Vera's team and a threemasted sailing ship completely disappeared from the surrounding waters after the midnight meeting as if it had never existed. However, the starlight and red glow outside Conch Island that night were etched into the minds of Mo Yuan Pavilion's core members like a brand, bringing more doubts than answers.

In the days that followed, Mo Yuan Pavilion maintained a state of full alert that was outwardly relaxed but inwardly tense. But the focus of its internal work quietly shifted towards information deciphering and situation analysis. Leewi and Su Chian devoted almost all their energy to analyzing the signal patterns they observed that night. They split up. Leewi was responsible for deciphering the information encoding that the light signals might carry while Such Chian using her sense of rhythm tried to understand the possible emotional or intentional connections between different signal patterns.

Leeway encountered enormous difficulties in his work. Whether it was the irregular flashes of light initially emitted by Vera's team on the sea, the different flickering rhythm of the lanterns on the island, or the modulation information possibly implied by the dark redirectional beam of light from the Stonemason's Brotherhood speedboat. None of these had a known code book or matching system. He tried various classic encoding methods such as simplified Morse code, binary positional encoding, and even some variations of ancient military codes for matching, but all he got were a jumbled mess of meaningless combinations of letters or numbers. They might be using a completely custom-designed or even one-time use cryptographic system, Leewei reported to Lynn Mo, rubbing his throbbing temples.

or those light signals themselves dant t directly correspond to text information but are simplified symbols for identity recognition status confirmation or action instructions that like pyro flag signals or military hand signals but more complex such progress was equally slow and subjective the flashes on the sea gave me a feeling of probing and uncertainty with a hint of urgency the lanterns on the island were more stable and expectant as if waiting for a response The red light from the Stonemason's Brotherhood was very cold and hard and direct with almost no emotional fluctuations. It was purely information transmission or conditional confirmation. She described her perception. But this feeling was too vague to deduce any specific content. Although their direct decryption failed, their work wasn't entirely fruitless.

Through repeated comparisons and modeling, Leewayi deduced that Vera's team might possess a fairly sophisticated technical solution for short-range optical cover communication, far exceeding the current capabilities of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. Such an perception at least confirmed that the collaboration between Vera's team and the Stonemason's Brotherhood was not seamless, but rather a highly guarded temporary communication based on certain preconditions. Just when a signal research was at a standstill, Chindwood was intelligence network sent more specific information from another unexpected direction which might be related to the meeting that night. An informant who had been lurking in the eastern reef black market, a large floating market located in the buffer zone between several major powers known for trading gray goods and information, managed to extract some fragmented information from a drunken down on his luck captain who claimed to have once provided transportation services for the outer perimeter of the Stonemason's Brotherhood by paying a high price. According to the captain's boast, about 10 days earlier, he had been ordered to pilot a disguised cargo ship, transporting a batch of tightly sealed wooden crates to a desolate area in the northwest.

The recipient was a speedboat that was unmarked, but looked very powerful. Its characteristics resembled those of the Stonemason's Brotherhood. During the handover, he overheard the people on the speedboat in a greyroed, a distinctive stonemason's brotherhood attire, escorting a ship whispering about things like the echoes and the ice flow are getting clearer. The resonance test of the and the delivery of the backup resonator must be done discreetly and on time. After the handover, the grey rogue man gave the people on the speedboat a small metal tube, saying it contains some kind of frequency correction parameters and contingency plan for contact in the fog sea.

The informant repeated the drunken captain's words. The captain said that the grey rogue man instructed that the items must be delivered to friends on the other side of the fog sea before the next title window and also said that the structure on the other side has unstable resonance and needs external calibration. The echoes and keys of the ice crushed area. The structures and resonant instability of the fog shrouded sea. And what about frequency correction and contact contingency plans? These fragmented words like a flash of lightning instantly connected many scattered points.

Leeway suddenly stood up and said excitedly, "I understand. The acoustic signal emitted by the ancient facility below the ice shards is an echo. The sample that Dragon Soul found might be the key or node that can resonate with it. The Stonemason's Brotherhood has been collecting related technologies and they may have known this for a long time or even have other keys or resonators." Such Chian also realized in the Misty Bay that large cylinder belonging to the remnants of the Wings of Liberty is the construct they built. The pulsed roar it emits is probably some kind of resonance.

But this resonance is unstable. So the Brotherhood of Stonemasons needs to provide frequency correction parameters for calibration. Vera's team at the meeting on Conch Island that night might have been the middleman, a witness, or even one of the technology providers. They were assisting the brotherhood of stonemasons in some kind of technical handover or coordination with the remnants of the wings of liberty. Shindu Duo continued his analysis before the next title window.

The tides affect ocean currents and seawater pressure which may also affect the propagation of sound waves in the water or the operational status of certain facilities. This may be a time point they have set for action. The Stonemason's Brotherhood will send the calibration parameters to the wings of freedom to ensure that their construct can operate stably at a specific time or achieve a certain effect. Lynn Emo listened to everyone's analysis, his gaze sharp. The outline gradually became clear.

The ancient acoustic system of the shattered eye zone, the exploration of the dragon soul, the Stonemason's Brotherhood's pursuit of technology, the energy device of the remnants of the wings of freedom, and Vera's team's mysterious bridge. All of this seemed to revolve around the keywords sound, frequency, resonance, and control. The Stonemason's Brotherhood attempted to utilize ancient technology, perhaps to control or activate something. The remnants of the Wings of Liberty may have been their chosen testing ground or tool. Vera's team is well-versed in this and may have had contact with both sides, their motives unclear.

Dragon Soul was an unexpected intruder, but they also obtained the crucial key. So, what did the Stonemasons Brotherhood ultimately intend to do with that construct? Was the calibrated resonance aimed at the icebreaking zone or was it for some other purpose? Does that drunk captain remember the approximate tide window time? Lynn Emmo asked Chi Duo Duo. Chandu Duo shook his head. He was vague. I only remember that it was about 10 days later, but the calculation of the title cycle at C requires a specific location.

We don't know the specific location and reference point they agreed on, so we can't make an accurate calculation. 10 days is not a long time. Continue to dig up all information about title windows, frequency correction, and constructs at all costs, Linmo ordered. At the same time, closely monitor any unusual movement to the exit of Misty Bay and the remnants of the Wings of Freedom, especially the intensity and duration of the next pulse roar, and whether there are any other accompanying phenomena. Leeway Su Chanchian based on this new approach re-examine all the data we have on energy fluctuations acoustic signals and ancient symbols focusing on finding parts that may be related to resonance calibration and control.

He paused then looked at everyone. If our predictions are correct then something big is likely to happen in Misty Bay and the icebreaker zone soon. We may not be able to stop it but we must see it clearly and be prepared. Although the letter wasn't delivered directly, the coded message had already subtly emerged through fragmented information. A vast net woven from sound waves, energy, ancient technology, and the ambitions of various factions was quietly unfolding in this sea.

Mo Yuan Pavilion was situated on the edge of this net, needing not only to avoid being drawn in, but also to try to discern its intricacies and even find a thread that could be used. A storm is approaching, and this storm may not originate from nature, but rather from the echoes of the deep sea and a resonance of human activity. Chapter 100. The window will open. From the red glow of stars glimpsed at midnight on Conk Island to the fragmented drunken tales circulated through the East Reef black market, the scattered information pieced together and deduced repeatedly by Lee Wayi, Sue Chanchian, and Shi and Dodu Oo, gradually sketched out an unsettling picture, an unknown plan with tidal windows as its time limit, connecting the ancient echoes of the icebreaker zone, the artificial resonance of the wings of freedom, and the technical calibration of the Stonemason's Brotherhood was like the shadow of a deep sea monster slowly approaching beneath the calm surface of the sea.

The response from Mo Yuan Pavilion has thus entered a new phase. Simply remaining silent and on guard is no longer sufficient. More targeted preparations must be made within the limited time available. Linmo first adjusted the allocation of internal resources. He approved Leewi's request to use a batch of reserved rare metals and precision machining tools to urgently manufacture several improved prototypes of the wideband acoustic wave detector and recorder.

These prototypes were designed based on Leeway's conjecture about ancient energy symbols and the energy buffer provided by Vera's team. Although they could not actively emit or resolve complex signals, they could passively receive and record anomalous sound waves and vibrations in the environment with higher sensitivity and a wider frequency range, especially those signals that might have regularity or modulation characteristics. Such an assisted in optimizing the detector's anti-inference structure and environmental adaptability to ensure they could operate stably under different sea conditions. Our goal is to have sharper ears, not louder voices. Lynn Emmo emphasized the leeway.

Understanding what those resonances and echoes are actually saying or at least recording their patterns of change is crucial for us to assess the situation. Dot. Sure. How adjusted is training focus accordingly. The cold weather reserve team was reorganized and incorporated adaptive training to cope with strong sound waves or vibration interference.

Team members were required to complete communication, coordination, and basic operational tasks in simulated high-intensity noise and vibration environments created by simple equipment, honing their responsiveness and teamwork when their senses were severely disrupted. Simultaneously, Sherhow began developing multiple emergency evacuation and shelter plans for sudden crises from different directions, north, southwest, and even potentially other directions at sea, and organized several small-cale drills. Chindwood's intelligence network was like a newlywoven net with a more focused approach. Surveillance of Misty Bay was elevated to the highest priority. In addition to existing remote observation points, Chin Duo Duo spared no expense in bribing the captain of small supply ship that regularly entered and exited the bay to deliver fresh fruits and vegetables to the fortress's lower ranking personnel.

This captain, timid but greedy, promised to record as much as possible any unusual sounds from within the fortress, the atmosphere surrounding personnel movements, and subtle changes in the appearance of a large cylinder during each trip, transmitting this information through a pre-planned covert method. Direct reconnaissance of the eyeshard area was impossible due to Dragon Souls tight blockade and the Stonemason's Brotherhood's high level of expertise. Chiandu Duo instead intensified his monitoring of the flow of technical personnel and a market for rare resources. He needed to know besides those already known which other individuals or forces were secretly collecting technologies and resources related to acoustic detection, frequency control, and deep sea engineering. This might reveal how many other players were lurking behind the scenes.

Time slipped away amidst the intensive preparations. Every day, subtle changes were taking place in the voices coming from the southwest and the north. As predicted, the pulsating roar of the misty bay began to show signs of calibration. According to a newly developed report from the inside captain, the roar had briefly ceased for most of the day about 5 days ago. And when it resumed, its tone seemed to have become pure and stable with a previously faint teeth grinding metallic highfrequency noise almost completely gone.

The intervals of the roar remained regular, but the duration of each roar began to show regular slight adjustments based on the tidal cycle. The roar would last slightly longer by a few minutes before and after high tide, and its intensity also seemed to increase imperceptibly. The weak carrier signal accompanying the roar recorded by peripheral monitoring points also showed more complex and regular modulation characteristics. They retuning it like tuning a musical instrument. at leeway analyzed the latest recorded data.

The frequency correction parameters provided by the Stonemason's Brotherhood should have been used by now. The target frequency of that thing is likely related to some natural change caused by tidal forces such as seawater pressure or specific ocean currents. The area around the shattered ice was relatively quiet. Dragon Souls exploration activities seemed to have entered a deeper period of silence. The outer perimeter remains sealed off, but no new noteworthy actions were reported.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood's procurement list had added items such as highdensity energy batteries and multisspectral signal shielding materials, seemingly indicating preparations for some kind of infiltration or protection. Just 3 days before the expected date of the title window, an unexpected incident occurred. The bribe supply ship captain upon his most recent entry into a misty bay brought out a flat palmsized metal sheet wrapped in tarpollen. The sheet had irregular edges as if cut or broken off from a larger component, and its surface was covered with burn marks and twisting. However, on its relatively flat side, several extremely faint yet unusually neat engravings were faintly visible.

The captain claimed that he had stumbled upon a metal sheet in a pile of scrap awaiting disposal on the edge of the fortress and thought the pattern was a bit strange, so he secretly hid it. He dared not linger and, as agreed, sent the item out along with routine intelligence. The metal sheet was immediately delivered to Leeway. After careful cleaning, the engravings were revealed two nested extremely smooth arc patterns with several tiny dot-like depressions adorning the inner side of the patterns. This is a style known to Wings of Liberty or the Stonemason's Brotherhood, Lewi said confidently after examining it carefully.

The smoothness and precision of the texture even surpasses the sleeping ridge rubbing style provided by Various team. It has closer to the cold geometric feel of our hemlock island slate, but with an added strange flowing charm. He tried to observe the cross-section of the engraving with a high-powered magnifying glass. The processing technique is also extremely advanced. It doesn't te seem like it was handcarved, but more like it was formed in one piece.

After sensing it, Sue Chan frowns slightly. It feels very empty. Unlike our stone slab, which has a clear sense of instruction or framework, it doesn't have the meaning of description or record like other symbols. It's more like a marker or a purely abstract representation of an interface. Those two arcs give me the feeling of loop and inclusiveness, but they are very restrained.

This unexpectedly acquired metal fragment, like a signature from an unknown third party, suddenly appeared in the rubble of the Liberty Wings fortress. Where did it come from? Was it an original component of the great cylindrical structure? Or an antique mixed in with the technical materials provided by the Stonemason's Brotherhood? Or perhaps some other force had already established a connection with the remnants of Liberty Wings through unknown means. On top of the mystery, another mystery arises. Lynn Mo listened carefully to the report about the metal sheet, remaining silent for a long time. The complexity of the situation had once again exceeded his expectations, but he did not panic.

Instead, he became even calmer. Trace the patterns on the metal sheet and compare them with the symbol library, but don't delve into it for now. Linmo instructed. The primary task at present remains dealing with the title window. All prototype detectors must complete their final debugging before sunset tomorrow.

Shh will arrange the most reliable teams to secretly take the equipment to the designated observation points. Two points in the north to focus on monitoring any abnormal sound waves that may come from the direction of the ice flow area. Three points in the southwest forming an arc around the exit of the Misty Bay to record the detailed parameter changes of the pulse roar. All monitoring equipment on the main island and the affiliated islands will be activated and put into continuous recording mode. He looked at everyone, his tone calm, yet carrying an undeniable authority.

The window is about to open. We cannot predict what will rush out, but we must see its outline and hear its sound. Pass down the order. All members of the Mayuen Pavilion, enter level one silence and standby status. Do not emit any signals or lights that may attract attention unless absolutely necessary.

We must stand there silently like a reef, observing, recording, and waiting. Yes. The order was swiftly relayed. The entire island of Mauuan Pavilion fell into a final pre- battle silence. Lights were controlled, noise was prohibited, and even training exercises were switched to completely silent indoor sessions.

Everyone could feel the unusual tense atmosphere, a sense of impending doom. Leewi and Sue Chian were conducting final checks in the laboratory. Shir how was checking the equipment and routes of each observation team and Sh and Duo Duo was guarding his communications room to ensure that all intelligence lines were unobstructed. Lynn and Mo climbed alone to the top of the reinforced command platform and gazed into the distance. Dusk was falling and the sea and sky stretched into a vast expanse of gray.

The northern sky seemed even darker than usual while the southwest remained shrouded in its usual mist. The wind seemed to have stopped and the sea surface had an unusual smoothness. Was this the calm before the storm or the suffocating stillness before a towering wave? The window is about to open. Mo Yuan Pavilion has opened every ear it can and tightened every nerve it can mobilize. They do not seek to actively intervene in this movement jointly played by ancient echoes and human ambition.

But they must become the most clear-headed listeners, recording the rise and fall and changes of every note. This silent listening is itself a power and also a choice. When the force of the tides reaches its peak, when man-made resonance attempts to converse with the ancient echoes, the fate of this sea area may begin from this moment, sliding in a direction no one can predict. Mo Yuan Pavilion must ensure that it can still see the way forward and hold the rudder firmly in the midst of the turbulent current. Chapter 101 echo resonance.

The scheduled tidal window quietly arrived on the eve of a windless and oppressive dawn. All of Mo Yuan Pavilion's monitoring equipment was already operating at full power. The detection teams scattered across the designated observation points in the north and southwest were like silent sentinels hidden in well- camouflaged crevices of reefs or leeward spots on small islands. They breathed very softly, afraid of disturbing the sophisticated instruments ability to capture every sound wave and vibration in their surroundings. Inside the command center on the main island, the atmosphere was as still as iron.

Lynmo, Sherhow, Chanduo, Leewi, and Su Chanchian sat around a large table on which lay the latest nautical charts and various record forms. In the center was an audio signal receiver connected to the main channels of various observation points, heavily filtered and amplified on several devices nearby. Indicator lights of different colors flickered slightly with the fluctuations of background noise and chaotic lines danced on the waveform displays. Time ticked by and the calculated peak time of the window drew ever closer. Everyone stared intently at their assigned equipment or chart area, occasionally exchanging a few brief words in hushed whispers.

At 0.1 in the north zone, the background noise is stable and no abnormal sound source has been detected. Dot. At 3 in the southwest, the pulse roar interval in the target area is normal and the intensity reading remains at the baseline level. main island array. Everything is normal, calm, and almost deathly calm.

But this calm was more unsettling than any commotion. Just before the predicted peak point was about to be reached, unusual activity was first detected from the southwest. Southwest.1 reporting, a suppressed urgent voice came through the communicator. The target's pulse roar intensity has begun to rise abnormally. The rate of increase is very fast.

It has exceeded the calibration baseline by 50% to 80%. And it's still rising. Almost simultaneously, similar reports came from several other southwestern observation points. On the waveform display, several curves representing the direction of Misty Bay suddenly rose like a giant beast awakening and emitting a low roar. What about the frequency? Has the modulation signal changed? Leeway immediately asked.

The frequency appears to be drifting slightly upwards. The modulation depth of the modulation signal is increasing and the pattern is becoming more complex. Recording inside the command center, everyone's hearts were in their throats. As expected, the wings of Liberty's construct was propelled to an even higher power level when the tidal forces reached their peak. However, this is just the beginning.

Just as the intensity of the pulsating roar from the southwest climbed to an unsettling peak and began to oscillate at high levels, reports from the northern observation points began to arrive. North zone 2 reporting continuous low frequency sound waves detected originating from the icebreaking area. Intensity slowly increasing. frequency is very low approaching the infrasound range accompanied by intermittent highfrequency harmonic pulses. The echo in the shattered eye zone has also been triggered.

Waveform characteristics. Are they consistent with what Dragon Soul detected before? Leeway's voice trembled slightly, whether from nervousness or excitement, it was hard to tell. The core frequency characteristics are highly similar. However, the overall intensity and complexity far exceed previous records. The highfrequency harmonic pulse is newly added.

The two places, north and south, are far apart. Yet, they seem to have begun their performance simultaneously under the invisible batten of tidal forces. The southwest is a resonance that has been artificially amplified and carefully calibrated, while the north is an ancient and profound echo stimulated by external forces. Record all data. Listen carefully for any modulation signals hidden in the sound waves.

Lynn Mo ordered in a deep voice, his eyes fixed on the two constantly rising and oscillating curves on the waveform display. The next half hour was an acoustic storm. The pulsating roar from the southwest and the low frequency echoes from the north like two clumsy giants attempted a somewhat awkward yet powerful dialogue within the vast resonating cavity of the ocean. Their frequencies were not entirely synchronized, sometimes briefly overlapping, sometimes diverging, generating complex interference patterns. The broadband detectors deployed at Muan Pavilion captured a multitude of previously unseen acoustic phenomena, standing waves, beat frequencies, and harmonic resonances.

Suchian closed her eyes, trying hard to perceive the processed mixed sound waves coming from the receiver. Her face was slightly pale, chaotic, yet with a kind of tyrannical order. The sound from the southwest is like a person shouting at the top of their lungs, while the sound from the north is like a mountain slowly awakening, emitting a low sigh. There is no real understanding between them, more like a collision and probing of energy. Lee eyes focused on the data.

The energy level is too high. Especially the echoes from the ice flow area. The low frequency part of which has extremely strong energy penetration may have already affected the deep sea straighta structure over a large area. The resonance in the southwest is trying to catch up the frequency but it's always a little short, unstable, etc. He suddenly widened his eyes and pointed to one of the screens displaying the energy distribution of a specific frequency band.

Look here. About 3 minutes ago, an unusual energy peak appeared near 7.83 hertz. This frequency is one of the fundamental frequencies of the Earth's Schuman resonance. How could it appear here? And its intensity is slowly increasing. Schuman resonance.

That's an extremely low frequency electromagnetic resonance phenomenon that exists between the Earth's ionosphere and the Earth's surface, usually associated with global lightning activity. How could it be excited or coupled by man-made sound waves? Although infrasound, before they could figure out, even more drastic changes occurred. The simple magnetometers and atmospheric electric field meters set up on the main island and at all observation points issued alarms almost simultaneously. Magnetic field disturbance, rapidly changing intensity, anomalous atmospheric electric field, accelerated charge accumulation. The nautical charts show that the anomaly is rapidly spreading outward from the misty bay and the ice flow area.

In the sky, the previously sparse clouds are visibly gathering and thickening, turning a somber iron gay color. On the sea, waves have risen even without wind. The waves are not high, but their directions are chaotic, as if the sea itself has become restless. Marine life. Observe the marine life.

Such Chian suddenly remembered something and heardly shouted. Soon, team members near the observation point reported that a large school of fish was fleeing in panic from beneath the surface and some deep sea fish were even surfacing belly up. Seabirds cried out in alarm and flew in flocks away from the center of the anomaly. the effects of infrasound and anomalous electromagnetic fields on organisms. Sue Chanchian said her voice tightening especially the frequency that is close to the Schuman resonance which may seriously interfere with the biological nervous system and migration instinct.

Just then an extremely sharp earpiercing highfrequency noise seemingly capable of tearing eardrums came from the main channel receiver connecting to the direction of the ice crushing area. It lasted for about 2 seconds. Then a low-frequency echo from the north abruptly weakened as if forcibly suppressed or interrupted by something. Almost simultaneously, the pulse boom from the southwest also experienced violent unstable fluctuations. Its intensity plummeted and the modulation signal became chaotic.

A few seconds later, it too abruptly stopped. After reaching a chaotic climax, the voices from both the north and the south fell silent almost simultaneously. Only the increasingly thick dark clouds in the sky, the chaotic aftershocks on the sea, and the still residual abnormal magnetic and electric field readings on the instruments proved that the brief but intense resonance just now was not an illusion. Is it over or has it been interrupted? Shin Duo Duo murmured. It has more like it got out of control due to instability, triggering some kind of protection mechanism or exceeding a certain critical point that leeway analyzed the rapidly changing waveform records.

The last highfrequency noise in the icebreaking area is very suspicious. It may be an overload reaction of its internal defense system. The structure in the southwest obviously failed to stabilize the resonance and went out of control. Shh looked at Linmo. Chief, what's next? Lynn Mo slowly exhaled, his gaze sweeping over the environmental parameter readings on the screen, which were still slowly recovering.

All observation points maintain the highest level of silence and record all subsequent changes. Main island lift level one silence and move to level two alert. Shendo Duo, use all channels to collect reports of anomalies in other areas during the window period, especially the dragon soul controlled area. the possible activity areas of the Stonemason's Brotherhood and major trade routes. Leewi Sue Chian analyze all the data just recorded, especially the abnormal 7.83 herz energy peak, the final highfrequency noise and the detailed parameters before and after the soundwave interruption.

He paused, his tone grave. We witnessed, or rather heard the beginning of a process and perhaps a failed attempt, but the forces and intentions that triggered it remain. The first thunder of the storm has passed, but the clouds have not dispersed. We must figure out what that echo resonance just now meant, and what profound changes it will bring to this sea area. Dot.

The echoes had resounded. The resonance had ceased, but the aftershocks lingered. After a brief moment of shock, the observers of Muan Pavilion immediately plunged into the more complex work of data analysis and intelligence gathering. They knew that the real contest had perhaps only just begun. And what kind of door that key composed of sound and energy would open remained hidden deep within the solid ice of the North Sea and the dense fog of the Southwest.

Chapter 10 O2 analysis of the aftermath. The abrupt end of the echo resonance did not immediately bring about the anticipated violent conflict or earthshattering changes. On the contrary, for the next few days, an eerie post- disaster-like stagnation permeated the sea and sky. Reports from the external observation points of the Mo Yuan Pavilion continued to arrive in a southwest Misty Bay direction. The regular pulse booming had ceased after it stopped, and a thick fog covering the bay seemed even thicker and more solid than before, with even the usual ship traffic almost completely absent.

In a northern Icebreaker area, the Dragon Souls blockade remained in place, but the activity frequency of the research fleets on the periphery had significantly decreased, exhibiting more of a vigilant and wait and see attitude. An unusual calm often signifies a new phase in the underlying power struggle or the brewing of an even greater storm. Inside the Mo Yuan Pavilion, a period of highintensity, highdensity information processing and analysis has begun. Leewei and Sue Chanchian practically lived in the analysis room. The massive amount of data recorded by the broadband detector was like a huge chaotic treasure trove of acoustics and energy waiting to be sorted and interpreted.

They divided the data stream of the entire window event into dozens of time segments and frequency bands and performed spectral analysis, energy integration, and correlation comparison on each one. The most crucial discovery points to that brief unusual 7.83 herz energy peak. The appearance of this frequency is by no means accidental that Leewi's eyes were bloodshot but his spirits were high. It coincides with the fundamental frequency of the earth schuman resonance. Our data shows that during the period when this energy peak appeared and intensified, the efficiency of the conversion of infrasound and low-frequency sound waves emitted by the two sound sources in the north and south into electromagnetic waves was abnormally improved, especially the part coupled with the atmospheric ionosphere.

This may mean that the structure of the wings of freedom and the ancient system of the ice flow zone under certain conditions could have their soundwave energy resonate or modulate with the global extremely low frequency electromagnetic field in a way that we do not yet understand. Suchanian added, biological observation records also support this. During the few minutes when that frequency energy peak was strongest, not only in the nearby sea area, but also at observation points further away, there were reports of intensified abnormal behavior in fish and birds. The Schuman resonance frequency is believed to be related to biological rhythms and nervous system activity, and the consequences of such imposed external interference are unpredictable. Would the stonemason brothers know about this? Chin duo duo frowned.

Could it be that the frequency correction parameters they gave to the Wings of Freedom were a deliberate attempt to lure it into touching this dangerous resonance point? Possibly, Leeway nodded. But judging from the final result, the resonance was clearly out of control. The final highfrequency noise counterattack of the icebreaking zone system may not just be a defense, but also a forced reset, interrupting the dangerous coupling process. The wings of freedom structure is estimated to have suffered considerable damage. Another important analytical conclusion concerns the patterns on the mysterious metal fragment.

Leeway attempted to digitize it and perform pattern matching with all the complex modulation signals recorded during the window event. Although no direct coded correspondence was found, after comparing the waveforms of certain high-frequency harmonic components in the last few seconds before the north and south sound sources ceased, he discovered a striking similarity. The mathematical abstract model of the double circular arc pattern on the metal fragment had a highly similar topological structure to the envelope shape of a transient component in that highfrequency harmonic. This likely means that the interface or marking represented by these patterns is related to handling specific types of highfrequency transient energy fluctuations. Leeway said excitedly, "It may come from a more advanced control unit or safety valve that can stably handle this kind of dangerous resonance.

The discovery of its fragments on the wings of freedom structure either indicates that their technological origins contain such advanced components but failed to replicate or utilize them successfully or that a similar safety unit was destroyed in a previous test or accident. This deduction cast a deeper shadow over everyone's hearts. The technology possessed by the Wings of Liberty might be more dangerous and incomplete than what they saw. And who was this force capable of creating such advanced security units? Just as the internal analysis was in full swing, Chindwood's intelligence network finally managed to salvage some valuable fragments from the unusual aftershocks of the outside world. First, regarding Dragon Soul, multiple indirect sources confirm that following the window incident, Dragon Souls top leadership apparently held an emergency meeting.

Subsequently, its alert level around the shattered eye zone was raised to an unprecedented level, and several elite rapid reaction fleets were secretly deployed to the northwest to standby. Rumors suggest a serious internal division within Dragon Soul regarding whether to continue exploring the rift further. One faction advocates taking action as soon as possible during the relatively stable period after the ancient systems reset to obtain core samples or data. The other warns of excessive risk, arguing that unknown defense mechanisms have been triggered, and a shift to long-term monitoring and research is necessary to avoid further provocation. Secondly, there was the Stonemason's Brotherhood.

This organization seemed to vanish after the incident. Their speciallydesed speedboats never appeared at any known surveillance points, and even their usual procurement of technical materials was temporarily suspended. However, a high-ranking informant planted by Chandu Duo in the East Reef black market reported that three days after the incident, several elusive and distinctive individuals appeared deep within the black market, offering high price rewards through intermediaries for intelligence or physical samples related to highfrequency energy pulse physical protection technology and rapid stabilization methods for geomagnetic anomalies. The requirements were extremely specialized and payment was to be made in anonymous rare metal ingots. The informant suspected these individuals were connected to the Stonemason's Brotherhood and might also be assessing the losses and urgently seeking countermeasures.

The most unexpected intelligence was related to Vera's team. A friendly caravan operating near the eastern sleeping ridge on its return voyage unexpectedly discovered Vera's threemasted sailing ship in a remote atal lagoon. The ship appeared to have undergone emergency repairs with fresh signs of patching on the hull and it lay there quietly with no one visible on board. The caravan dared not approach hastily leaving before relaying the news back. They've got to hiding too or maybe they're fixing something.

So during that meeting they might not have been just bystanders or messengers. Lynmo, having synthesized all the analysis reports and intelligence fragments, stood before the constantly updated situation map and fell into deep thought. The window incident was like a dangerous experiment, verifying some terrifying conjectures and exposing the bottom lines and dilemmas of all parties. The ancient system possessed powerful defense and reset capabilities. The Wings of Liberty's adventure ended in failure and potential heavy losses.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood's technology had risks and limitations. Strategic disagreements arose within Dragon Soul, and Vera's team's whereabouts became even more mysterious. For Mo Yuon Pavilion, this incident did not pose a direct threat. Instead, it provided an extremely valuable opportunity to observe the highle game up close, gaining a wealth of firsthand data. However, this also meant that they had glimpsed deeper secrets and inadvertently formed a closer connection with them.

Our strategy needs a slight adjustment. Lynn Mo finally spoke, his voice calm, but decisive. Continue to maintain level two alert, but shift our focus from comprehensive monitoring to targeted tracking of external intelligence. Pay close attention to two points. First, the outcome of the internal debate within Dragon Soul and its subsequent course of action.

Second, the initial movements of the stonemason's brotherhood after they resumed their activities, especially the evolution of their technological needs. He turned to Leewi and Sue Shian. Your research direction also needs to be adjusted. Suspend the exploration of the general common grammar and focus on two things. First, based on the correlation between the texture of metal sheets and highfrequency harmonics, try to reverse engineer the schematic diagram of a simple device that can theoretically buffer or cancel similar dangerous energy transients, even if it has just the conceptual design.

Second, conduct in-depth research on the generation conditions and potential impact of the 7.83 herz anomalous energy peak and assess whether it can be more safely induced or shielded. We need to try to transform from observers to understanders and limited defenders. Dot. He then looked at Sureh How and Chin Duo in internal defense plan. Add items to deal with abnormal electromagnetic field interference and infrasound pollution.

Supplies inventory list. Add possible protective materials against the above threats. for external transactions. Continue to keep them low frequency and discreet, but we can appropriately release some of our observations on the impact of environmental anomalies on organisms by blurring them out to test the market reaction and see if we can attract potential communicators with relevant protective technologies or knowledge. The aftershocks haven't subsided and the analysis continues.

Mo Yuan survived this unexpected resonance and managed to seize valuable data fragments. Next, they will use these fragments to piece together a more complete picture of the world and forge a unique shield of knowledge to offer some protection against future storms. Danger still lurks, but through meticulous analysis, the direction forward seems to be becoming clearer. Chapter 103 tests and choices. The aftermath of the window incident transformed within Mayuan Pavilion into more refined knowledge accumulation and strategic adjustments.

While the deep waters outside after a brief period of silence began to ripple in new directions, Leewi and Sue Chanchian's research has entered a critical stage. The difficulty of reverse engineering the principle of the energy transient buffer device far exceeded expectations. Although the patterns on the metal fragments have a topological correlation with dangerous highfrequency harmonics, their specific working principle, material properties, and energy conversion paths are almost entirely enigmatic. They tried various known physical models for simulation, but the results were unsatisfactory. The biggest bottleneck lies in their lack of the most crucial element.

What exactly is the medium for the interface represented by those patterns? Is it some kind of electromagnetic wave in a specific frequency band? Is it a more peculiar particle flow? Or is it some kind of direct conversion of soundwave energy forms? Without this premise, all designs are like castles in the air. We might need a sample even if it s damaged as long as we can analyze its internal structure and material composition. Leewi reported to Lin Mo rubbing his temples wearily. Or we need more fundamental textbook style information on the energy theories of ancient civilizations rather than scattered application symbols. Such Chian's research has made relatively more progress, but it is also full of uncertainties.

She has been continuously tracking the subsequent effects of the 7.8 83 hertz anomalous energy peak. By analyzing the biological behavior data transmitted back from various observation points after the window event, although the sample size was limited and indirect, she found that this anomalous energy interference seemed to leave some kind of hysteresus effect. In the days following the event, the phototactic/photophobic behavior of fish and the opening and closing rhythms of shallow sea mollis in the affected area showed persistent disturbances, although the degree was slight and they slowly recovered over time. This indicates that the interference of the imposed external resonance on the biological physiological rhythms did not subside immediately. It acts like a giant bell being struck hard.

Even though the sound stops, the bell is still vibrating slightly. Sue Chian explained, "If this striking is more frequent or more intense, it could cause irreversible disruption of the biological clock and even affect the reproduction of the population. The long-term effects are incalculable." These research advances have on the one hand deepened Moan G's understanding of potential threats and on the other hand made them more clearly aware of the limitations of their own technology and a lack of knowledge. Just as the internal research was making difficult progress, Chandwa's intelligence network captured a clearer analysis of the Dragon Souls movements, several Dragon Soul rapid reaction fleets deployed to the northwest did not withdraw. Instead, they established temporary forward bases at several strategic locations.

Simultaneously, several large shipyards and precision instrument workshops under Dragon Souls control received urgent orders to begin mass production of specially designed small to medium-sized deep sea submersible platforms and ruggedized sample storage tanks suitable for the complex environment of the ice zone. These signs strongly suggest that the radical exploration faction within Dragon Soul appears to have gained the upper hand, and they're making substantial material preparations for a potentially larger and more thoroughly prepared deep sea operation into the ice crack zone. However, in subtle contrast to this tough stance, Dragon Soul has released some ambiguous signals seeking cooperation on diplomatic and intelligence levels. Xiao Ji Gang sent Lin Mo another, more direct letter through a backup encrypted channel neither party had used before. The letter cut to the chase, directly mentioning the abnormal energy coupling phenomenon observed during the window and the resulting regional environmental disturbances, frankly stating that Dragon Souls research department was highly concerned and deeply worried about it.

The letter pointed out that neither party's existing knowledge and technology could fully understand or address the complex risks originating from ancient systems. Therefore, based on shared survival and security considerations, Dragon Soul hoped to engage in a non-public high level and pragmatic technical dialogue with Mo Yuinga, which possessed a certain level of technical insight and operational stability on the topic of the principles and security boundary assessment of ancient energy systems. Dragon Soul was willing to provide some non-core taxonomic data on specific ancient energy patterns as a basis for the dialogue. This letter was more frank and targeted than ever before. It acknowledged the risks, highlighted the value of the Mo Yuon Pavilion, technical insight, operational stability, and offered a seemingly sincere advanced payment ancient energy pattern classification data.

Clearly, Dragon Soul not only noticed the Mo Yuan Pavilion silent observation during the window incident, or rather guessed that the Mo Yuan Pavilion had the ability to observe, but also likely learned through some channels that the Mo Yuan Pavilion was conducting related research internally. They feel they can't crack that tough nut on their own. So, they want to get us involved to find a solution or at least share the risks and ideas. Shin duo duo analyzed the taxonomic data they provide might just fill in the basic theory puzzle that engineer Lee is most missing. Sure how remain vigilant.

They might also want to find out how far our research has progressed or even try to exploit our research ideas. They are in a hurry to act now and they will be interested in anything that might accelerate their understanding process. Such Xian said worriedly. Won't having such high level technical dialogues with them expose too much of our research direction and progress. Moreover, once such deep technical ties are established, it will be difficult to completely severize later.

Leeway was torn. The taxonomic data promised by Dragon Soul held a fatal attraction for him. It might be the key to deciphering the Hemlock Island slab, understanding the patterns of the metal fragments, and even designing protective devices. But he also knew that it was likely a tempting lure. All eyes were once again focused on Lin Mo engaging in deeper technical exchanges with Dragon Soul amplified both the risks and opportunities like never before.

Lynmo didn't make a decision immediately. He carefully studied Xiao Gangs letter, scrutinizing every word. Behind dragon souls urgency and frankness lay immense pressure from the rifts in the shattered ice zone and a deep apprehension about the unknown risks hidden behind them. They didn't need allies or at least a think tank that could offer different perspectives. In response to Xiao Ji Gang Linimo said slowly after a long period of thought.

Emoy Yuan Pavilion is also concerned about the potential risks of the ancient energy system and is willing to conduct limited technical exchanges on the security boundary assessment. We agree to accept the taxonomic data they provide as the basis for dialogue in a demonstration of our sincerity. However, the method of communication must be clearly defined. It must be in writing only through a designated encrypted channel. The topic must be strictly limited to the functional classification of specific energy patterns and their corresponding potential risks and must not involve any specific relic coordinates, physical sample information, or specific technical implementation paths for either party.

We reserve complete autonomy over whether and how to respond to the content of the exchange. If you agree, we may send some sample data in advance as a sign of our sincerity. This is an extremely cautious response, retaining ample initiative and a backup plan. We accept the materials and open a highly restricted area for written discussion, but we do not commit to any substantive cooperation or reciprocal exchange of information. We'll see how the goods Dragon Soul offers are before deciding whether and how to continue.

Furthermore, Linmo added Chindu Duo used the highest level resources to investigate the details of recent decisions within Dragon Soul regarding the Shattered Eye Zone project, especially after the Radical Faction took the lead. Whether there has been any leak of their specific action plans and timelines, we need to determine whether their pursuit of dialogue is a genuine search for solutions or merely an additional theoretical insurance for their risky actions. The letter was sent like yet another tenative move. Meanwhile, the Stonemason's Brotherhood seemed to have truly fallen into complete silence, utterly still, and the misty bay of the Southwest remained shrouded in a thick, ominous fog, utterly desolate. Vera's team sailboat remained anchored in that remote at all lagoon.

Showing no signs of leaving or sending any new information. Like a group of patient anglers or perhaps wounded beasts, they quietly licked their wounds in the shadows, observing the changing tides. Mo Yuan Pavilion continues to seek a balance between accumulating strength and cautious exploration. While awaiting the Dragon Soul data, Leewi and Sue Chian continued to dig out potentially overlooked details from the existing data. Sher House guard team conducted an extreme pressure exercise based on the scenario of complete communication outage and command node failure.

honing their grassroots autonomous combat and survival capabilities under worst case conditions. Lynn Mo knew that this tentative contact with the dragon's soul might open a new door, or it might introduce new risks beneath the fog of the southwest and the solid ice of the north. The real undercurrents might never have stopped, but we're just waiting for the next perhaps more decisive window. The choice has been made and the test has begun. The Mo Yuan Pavilion, like a ship sailing through increasingly complex and treacherous seas, must simultaneously steer its external communications and maintain its internal defenses, cautiously navigating the fog towards its chosen direction.

Chapter 104. Data and the fog. Chapter 104. Dragon Souls reply came faster than expected. Less than two days after Lin Mo sent that strictly encrypted letter, a speciallymade metal cylinder sealed with multiple layers of anti-tampering measures was delivered to a hidden receiving point on the outskirts of Mo Yuon Pavilion through an absolutely secure one-way transmission channel.

The sender's identity was unknown. The handover was clean and efficient, and no trace was left behind. The metal cylinder was immediately delivered to the reinforcement analysis room where Leewi and Su Chanchian were located. The two of them personally operated the opening process while Sher How and his men guarded the perimeter to ensure everything went smoothly. Inside the cylinder, there were no letters, only a stack of white paper of a special texture, thin yet tough, with a complex array of symbols drawn clearly and neatly in ink accompanied by concise text annotations.

As Xiao Ji Gang promised, this is a taxonomic document on ancient energy patterns. The document systematically categorizes hundreds of different symbolic patterns into 12 major categories and dozens of subcategories based on their geometric characteristics, the flow of their strokes and their location and context in known archaeological sites. Each category includes a brief name and hypothetical function such as energy conducting type suspected of guiding and constraining energy flow commonly found at channel or pipeline interfaces. Converging type, possibly used for energy gathering and amplification, often seen on the periphery of suspected energy core areas, and buffer/dissipative type, speculated to be used to smooth energy fluctuations or safely release excess energy, often appearing at structural weak points or on the inner walls of enclosed spaces, etc. Very professional and systematic, Leeway quickly flipped through the document, his eyes shining.

Although it's just classification and speculation without specific energy parameters and implementation principles, this systematic approach to induction is of great reference value for understanding the possible positioning of different symbols within the entire technical system. Look, they've categorized those composite symbols in the third section of our hemlock island slab into the subclass control command type. Composite patterns possibly used to send or verify specific operation commands. complex structure often associated with suspected permission verification areas. This judgment is highly consistent with our previous conjecture.

Such an also examined it carefully. Their description of the characteristics of buffering/dissipation type texture overlaps with what we saw in Vera's data and the feeling that the texture on the metal sheet gives us. But the classification here is more detailed and it also mentions the suspected distinguishing features of highfrequency transient buffering and low-frequency steadystate dissipation. This may help us narrow down the scope of the inference of the function of the metal sheet texture. However, after the initial excitement, a closer examination brought doubts.

Chi and Duodu pointed to a detail. The texture of these papers and the ink stains don't resemble long preserved ancient books or archival copies. They seem more like recently meticulously copied texts. Moreover, although the classification is systematic, all the functional descriptions use words like suspected, possible, and speculated without any definitive conclusions. This can certainly be understood as academic rigor, but it could also be a tentative exploration with reservations.

Leeway calmed down and nodded. Indeed, the value of this data lies in providing a grand classification framework, but it lacks the most crucial specific energy parameters, activation conditions, and input output relationships corresponding to each type of pattern. It's like giving us a car parts catalog that describes in detail the shape and installation location of spark plugs, pistons, and gearboxes, but doesn't provide the fuel grade, ignition timing, or gear ratio. We still can't build a working car or even verify whether these parts descriptions are completely accurate, but this catalog itself is the most systematic information we have come across so far. Such Chian said, "At least it proves that Dragon Soul or the research forces behind them had a long history of accumulation and in-depth thinking in this field and their willingness to share this framework itself shows a certain sincerity or rather an urgent need." Lynn, Emo listened to the detailed report.

He instructed Leewi and Sue Chian to continue their in-depth analysis of the data, especially comparing its classification with the known patterns of the Hemlock Island stone slabs and metal fragments to see if they could discover any previously overlooked connections or contradictions. At the same time, he asked Chandu Duo to expedite the gathering of intelligence on Dragon Souls internal decision-making processes. Several days later, Chandua's investigation yielded clear results. Based on information from multiple indirect sources, the internal debate within Dragon Soul regarding the shattered eyes project had indeed ended with a limited radical exploration faction gaining the upper hand. The so-called limited meant that they rejected the risky plan of immediately carrying out large-scale armed excavation or force breakthrough, but approve an upgrade action plan.

The core of the plan is to manufacture and utilize a fleet of more robust intelligent submersibles equipped with a wider variety of detection devices to conduct a more comprehensive and targeted exploration of the ice crush fractures during the next relatively stable geoysical window. Dragon Soul seems to have its own calculation method estimating it to be in 2 months. The goal is to create a more detailed three-dimensional map of the fracture interior, locate possible core units or controlling regions, and attempt to obtain a wider variety of physical samples. The entire operation emphasizes non-cont non-invasive exploration. Sample collection will only be considered when safety is ensured and the objective is clearly defined.

They become more cautious. The unexpected countermeasures from the window incident have clearly left them shaken. Chi and Duo Duo analyzed. But they haven't t given up. Instead, they ve invested even more resources in more meticulous preparations.

They're seeking technical exchanges with us is likely an attempt to leverage external expertise to help them better understand the samples and probe data, assess the risks, and even find theoretically safe pathways for any eventual contact or interaction. Dot. Meanwhile, Leewi and Su Chanchian's data analysis also made crucial progress. They discovered that several subclass symbolic features in the classification system provided by Dragon Soul concerning highfrequency transient buffers and energy state markers exhibited a striking multi-layered agreement with the double circular arc patterns on the metal fragments and certain mathematical characteristics of the abnormal highfrequency harmonics that appeared in the final stage of the window event. This agreement was not merely a simple shape similarity, but involved deeper geometric attributes such as the curvature variation of the patterns and the distribution of symmetry defects.

This almost certainly confirms that the patterns on the metal sheet belong to a special safety interface or control node used by ancient civilizations to handle or identify certain highfrequency transient and dangerous energy fluctuations. leak axadi. The classification data from dragon soul provides a crucial circumstantial evidence framework for confirming this. Moreover, the data mentions that such patterns are often found alongside isolation valves or pressure relief devices suspected to be main energy pathways in some relics. Suchanian then made another discovery.

I also noticed that the description of a special subclass of energy conducting patterns resonant focusing in the data mentions that under certain conditions this type of pattern may guide energy to form a standing wave interference field thereby selectively amplifying or attenuating external energy at a specific frequency. Could this be used to explain why the ancient system in the ice shard zone produced such a strong echo response to the calibrated pulse roar emitted by the wings of freedom construct? Because the frequency of a construct happens to fall on the sensitive band of a certain resonant focusing channel. These discoveries further connect fragmented information. Although the Dragon Soul data does not provide ready-made answers, its systematic classification framework is like a map with many blank spaces but clear coordinates, allowing the Mo Yuan Pavilion to place the existing scattered landmarks more accurately, thereby inferring more terrain outlines. We will compile our findings, especially the correlation between highfrequency transient buffer patterns and metal sheets, dangerous harmonics, and our conjectures about resonant focusing and echo phenomena into a highly summarized technical speculation brief.

Stripped of all specific source attributions, Lynn Mo decided as a preliminary response to the classification data provided by Dragon Soul. The brief can raise two open questions for discussion. First, what risks might the failure or absence of such safety interface patterns pose to the associated systems? Second, how should the safety boundaries be defined when external artificial resonance couples with the inherent focusing channels of the ancient system? He paused for a moment. This is the bait we've thrown out. We'll see if Dragon Soul just wants to get our ideas or if they're really willing to have a substantial exchange on the core issue of safety boundaries.

At the same time, we'll continue to delve deeper into our own research, especially based on a new framework and try to design a conceptual model of that buffer device, even if it's just on paper. The data, like a key, unlocked a window into the internal structure of ancient technological systems. Yet, the fog still shrouded the southwestern bay, the eastern atal, and the ice covered fissures of the north. With cautious exploration, the Mo Yuan Pavilion quietly took a small step forward. They began using borrowed maps, comparing them with the scattered landmarks they had discovered, attempting to sketch a more realistic outline of that unknown continent.

The road ahead remained fraught with uncertainty, but the light in their hands seemed slightly brighter than before. Chapter 105 response and bargaining chips. The carefully worded technical speculation briefing from Myuan Pavilion, which removed all specific references, was like another stone thrown into a deep pool, creating ripples on the other end of the encrypted channel that were both expected and somewhat unexpected. Dragon Souls reply was swift as ever. And this time, Xiao Ji Gangs letter contained less official politeness and more direct technical discussion.

He first expressed high appreciation for Mo Yuinga's keen insight and constructive speculation, believing that the two open-ended questions raised in the briefing hit the core dilemma currently facing research. Regarding the first question about the risk of safety interface failure, Longhun's response did not provide a definitive answer, but instead offered a new appendix, a statistical summary on the correlation between stress distribution and energy overload in ancient composite structures. The summary shows that in over 70% of the known cases of relic sites showing signs of structural damage or energy runaway, severe wear, fracture or functional loss of highfrequency transient buffer patterns was found near the damaged area or related control nodes. The summary cautiously points out that this correlation strongly suggests rather than proves that such patterns play a crucial role in maintaining the local stability of the system and a failure could be a trigger or accelerator of energy runaway. They're using statistical data to support our hypothesis, Leeway exclaimed excitedly after reading the appendix.

Although it is still just a hint, it is a step further than simple taxonomy. They must have more data on damaged sites. This summary is just the tip of the iceberg. Regarding the second question about the safety boundary of resonant coupling, Longhun's response was more cautious, even somewhat vague. The letter acknowledged that currently very little is known about the frequency response characteristics, sensitivity thresholds, and interaction mechanisms with non-native resonances of the resonant focusing channels within ancient systems and that reliable experimental verification methods are lacking.

However, Longhun proposed that based on existing data and observational data of window events, they have preliminarily established a framework for a multiparameter risk assessment model to simulate the system response spectrum that may be triggered by external resonant inputs of different frequencies, intensities, and durations. They are willing under the premise of strict data anonymization and model simplification to share the model's basic architecture and input output logic with Moyuan hoping to jointly improve it.
