They want to get us involved in perfecting this model. Sue Chanchian pointed out astutely this means they admit they can't handle it themselves and need external expertise. Moreover, this model is likely to be crucial to their upcoming probe operation.

And they need the model to assess whether the probe operation itself will inadvertently trigger a system countermeasure. Chando Duo stroked his chin. First it was the classification framework. Now it's the risk assessment model framework. They're gradually adding more trying to use this half-finish knowledge to lure out more ideas and verifications from us.

However, this model framework itself is also very valuable for us to assess the risk of that structure in the southwest going crazy again. Linmo carefully read the letter and the new appendix. Dragon Souls response strategy was becoming increasingly clear. They possessed a wealth of fundamental data and research frameworks, but had encountered bottlenecks in the most crucial areas of theoretical breakthroughs and practical application verification, urgently needing new ideas and cross validation. The insight previously demonstrated by Mo Yuan Pavilion had shown them its value.

We can agree, Lynn Mo concluded. We will accept their model framework sharing. Leeway, you will lead a team to study and understand this framework and try to incorporate our existing data, window event records, metal plate texture analysis, and even related conjectures for Vera's data to see what inferences we can draw or what contradictions we can find. Remember, we are studying the framework and logic, not any specific detection data or rea parameters of the dragon soul dot. He paused, then added, "In return, we can share our preliminary observations, also desensitized, regarding the potential delayed interference of the 7.83 herz anomalous energy peak on biological rhythms with them as a supplementary environmental risk assessment reference.

This would not only demonstrate our value, but also align with their concern about systemic risks. This is a deeper technical exchange, but remains at the level of framework to framework and conjecture to conjecture. Without touching on either party's core data or specific action plans, Mo Yuan uses its unique perspective and analytical capabilities to exchange for Dragon Souls systematic research tools and a broader data background. A new round of written communication ensued. Leeway's team quickly immersed themselves in analyzing the risk assessment model framework provided by Longhun.

This framework was rigorously structured with numerous parameters considering various variables such as energy frequency, intensity, waveform, duration of action, environmental medium, and even local geomagnetic and gravitational gradients. Its complexity far exceeded any existing analytical tool in Muan Pavilion. Although it was merely an empty shell without any actual data, its design concept itself was highly inspiring. They considered everything very comprehensively, especially by including environmental factors as important variables, which is consistent with our observation that window events are affected by tidal forces. Leeway praised them, but also felt the pressure.

To actually run this model, a massive amount of basic parameters and calibration data are needed, which are probably only available to Dragon Soul itself. Such Chian was responsible for compiling Mo Yuinga's observations on biological interference into a rigorous report. She specifically emphasized the limitations of the data and the preliminary nature of the inferences, but used clear logic to point out the possibility of a potential coupling between abnormal energy frequencies and biological rhythms and its farreaching impact. Although the report was brief, it touched upon a soft risk dimension concerning the entire ecosystem that might have been overlooked by the Dragon Soul technical faction. As the technological exchanges between the two sides deepened, the fog surrounding the outside world was also quietly changing.

The deathly silence of the southwestern foggy bay was finally broken. According to reports from the outer surveillance points, the fog concentration in the bay had fluctuated irregularly over the past few days, sometimes briefly thinning to reveal the outline of the massive silent fortress behind it. No ships were seen entering or leaving, nor were any more pulses heard, but that unsettling silence seemed to be replaced by a new, indescribable presence. The captain of the bribe supply ship sent back his last message, after which contact was lost, saying that during his last entry, the atmosphere inside the fortress felt very oppressive. The guards were tighter.

Ordinary personnel were forbidden from approaching the central area, and there seemed to be a faint ozone-like metallic smell in the air. Meanwhile, in the east, the sailboat belonging to Vera's team, which had been anchored in the Atal Lagoon, was discovered one morning to have vanished without a trace, leaving no clues or information. They had disappeared as silently as they had arrived. Even more noteworthy is the resurgence of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, an organization that had been dormant for a long time. While they ceased large-scale procurement of technical materials, Chindwood's informants discovered in the most hidden corners of the East Reef black market that someone was beginning to acquire intelligence on high efficiency tidal energy conversion technology and precise mapping data of deep sea geothermal anomalies at exorbitant prices, demanding near obsessive accuracy and timeliness.

Simultaneously, several smaller factions that had previously engaged in clandestine transactions with the remnants of the Wings of Freedom received warnings from unknown sources, instructing them to handle all transactions in the Southwest with caution in the near future to avoid getting involved in uncontrollable energy pollution. Is the Stonemason's Brotherhood clearing out the perimeter also preparing for some kind of operation that requires the support of tidal energy and geothermal energy? Shin Duo Duo analyzed. They seem to have abandoned the route of directly stimulating the ice flows or being deeply tied to the wings of liberty and turned to a more covert and perhaps more basic technological direction. Lynmo, considering the progress of technological exchanges and the changing external landscape, gradually pieced together a more complete yet increasingly complex picture. The Dragon Soul was gathering strength, preparing for a more precise probe.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood adjusted its strategy. Their target remained unclear. The remnants of the wings of freedom seemed to be licking their wounds, but had not lost their threat. Vera's team once again vanished into the shadows. While Mo Yuanu has not yet obtained any direct treasure during this in-depth technical dialogue with Dragon Soul, they have quietly extended their knowledge tentacles into a higher level, more systematic research field and begun to learn how to use more advanced analytical tools.

They used their unique observations as bargaining chips to gain the right to listen in and began to try to understand the deeper rules of this grand game. This is perhaps more important than directly acquiring one or two ancient artifacts. In an era where knowledge and information are the core power, understanding the framework itself is a form of power accumulation. Lyn Mo knew that how long and how deep this framework level cooperation with Dragon Soul could last depended on whether Moan Pavilion could continue to provide the unique perspectives and verification value that the other party needed. He had to ensure that Leewi and Sue Chanchian's research could not only draw nourishment from Dragon Souls framework, but also maintain an independent direction of thinking and even see further and more meticulously than Dragon Soul in some aspects.

The response has been given and the chips have been laid out on the table. The ensuing game will test wisdom and composure even more. The ship of my pavilion using borrowed nautical charts is learning to draw its own more precise course. But beneath the distant fog and ice, the true undercurrents never cease, waiting only for the next opportune moment to surge forth once more. Chapter 106.

Frequent ominous signs. The exchange of technical frameworks with Dragon Soul was like injecting high octane fuel into the research engine of Mo Yuan Pavilion. Wally's team was limited by a lack of actual data and unable to conduct a true simulation when analyzing the complex risk assessment model framework. The framework's rigorous logical structure and multivariable coupling analytical approach greatly expanded their thinking. They began to try to use the language of this framework to re-examine and articulate Moyuan Pavilion's existing findings, especially the causal chain regarding the uncontrolled energy coupling in the window event.

If we consider the ancient system of the ice shatter zone as a black box with multiple resonant focusing channels and safety buffer nodes, Leeway drew a simplified diagram on the whiteboard explaining his new understanding to Lynn Mo, Su Chanchian, and Shien Duo Duo. The pulse roar of the wings of freedom construct is equivalent to inputting a high intensity but technically crude resonant signal into one of the focusing channels at a specific frequency. This signal not only excites the systems echo response but may also due to its impure waveform or improper modulation accidentally stimulate multiple adjacent channels with different functions simultaneously including those safety nodes responsible for energy transient buffering dot. He pointed to several connected nodes in a diagram based on the energy overload transfer algorithm of the dragon soul framework. When a safe node becomes functionally weakened or fails due to overload, its burden will be transferred to adjacent nodes forming a chain reaction.

This may explain why such dangerous highfrequency harmonics and global energy runaway eventually occur. the safety network is partially breached leading to a temporary instability of the system until a higher level forced reset mechanism is triggered. Such Chanchin added, "This also aligns with the high correlation between damage to the security patterns and system malfunction mentioned in the Dragon Soul data. The Wings of Freedom's construct is like a rough iron rod that has been forcefully inserted into the gear train of a precision clock. This interpretation based on a new framework makes the entire window event process clearer and more cautionary.

It shows that attempting any form of interaction with these ancient systems is like dancing on the edge of a minefield. The slightest misstep could trigger not only a counterattack from the target system, but also a chain reaction of collapses in its internal security mechanisms with unpredictable consequences. What does this mean for Dragon Souls probe plan? Lynmo asked. This means they have to be extremely cautious. Leewi said definitively.

Their detection signals must be infinitely more precise than the iron rod of the wings of freedom and they must avoid known vulnerable areas of safe nodes as much as possible. Even so, risk still exists because we know nothing about the distribution and vulnerability thresholds of those nodes that no matter how good their model framework is, without this crucial data, it has just empty talk. Dot. Just as internal research was deepening with the help of new tools, external ominous signs began to appear in a more frequent and unsettling way. First, there was the misty bay of the southwest.

After a brief period of fog fluctuations, that sea area seemed to fall into a deeper, more deathly silence. Even the usual seabirds avoided that airspace. But Chiendwood's advanced reconnaissance points deployed further away and equipped with long range infrared and lowlight observation devices transmitted puzzling images. On a moonless deep night through highly sensitive equipment, the outline of the massive fortress deep in the bay was observed to have briefly shimmerred with an extremely faint dark red inner halo several times. The brightness and dimness of the halo seemed to have an extremely slow breathing rhythm, each lasting for a few minutes before disappearing.

There was no accompanying sound or energy fluctuation, at least not detected by the Mo Yuan Pavilion's equipment. It looks like something is running at low power or slowly charging. Sure, how frowned as he looked at the blurry video recording. The remnants of Wings of Liberty are still tinkering with that thing, and they've become even more secretive about it. Meanwhile, some unsettling strange occurrences began to appear sporadically in the eastern and southern waters.

Several caravans and fishing vessels traveling along different routes reported encounters with mad sea monsters. These monsters did not actively attack the ships, but rather exhibited extreme frenzy and chaos, rampaging and tearing at each other on the surface near the convoys. Some even recklessly crashing into reefs until they were exhausted or died. The types of frenzied sea monsters varied, ranging from common sharks and large schools of fish to some normally docil deep sea species. Even stranger, the locations of these events seemed random, and the timing showed no obvious pattern.

Yet, subsequent tests of the water quality and background noise in the affected areas revealed no toxic substances or abnormal sound sources. Such Chanchian attached great importance to these reports, linking them to her previous speculation that the 7.83 83 hertz anomalous energy peak might cause lag interference with biological rhythms. If the effect of that interference is cumulative or if there's some kind of more insidious subsequent energy radiation that we haven't yet detected even though the window event has passed its residual poison may still be slowly spreading affecting the nervous systems of marine life over a wider area. She worried could these frenzied events be manifestations of this lag effect. This speculation is chilling.

If a localized failed resonance experiment can have such lasting and widespread ecological impacts, what kind of disaster would a larger scale more successful interaction bring? The Stonemason's Brotherhood's new moves are gradually coming to light. Their continued high-priced acquisitions of high efficiency tidal energy conversion technology and deep sea geothermal anomaly mapping data are becoming increasingly specific, indicating a clear application orientation. Based on fragmented information from various sources, she duodo believes the Stonemason's Brotherhood is secretly building a sizable energy harvesting and conversion base in a remote geologically active sea area far from mainstream shipping routes. Their purpose is unclear, but they clearly require a stable and powerful input of natural energy. What are they trying to do by abandoning direct stimulation of ancient systems and instead utilizing natural energy? Are they trying to power some kind of energyintensive equipment or are they conducting long-term research that requires a stable energy environment? Chian do guest.

In any case, it shows that they have changed their strategy from seizing to building dot. What concerned Lynn Mo most was an unverified rumor from a northern border trading post. The rumor claimed that explorers returning from the edge of the far northern perafrost wasteland reported a rare phenomenon of blue ice melting in certain areas where the wasteland met the icy sea. This wasn't ordinary ice melting, but rather the melting of ancient ice layers, some millions of years old, containing special air bubbles and minerals that gave them their deep blue color, with honeycomb like melting holes appearing from within, oozing a slightly salty fishy liquid of unknown composition. The explorers also claimed to have heard a dull rhythmic thumping sound seemingly coming from the Earth's core near those areas.

Is the ancient blue ice of the perafrost region melting abnormally? And what about the regular muffled sounds coming from underground? The rumor, though seemingly absurd, pierced Lin Moe's mind like a cold needle. He recalled the fissurers in the ice crushing region and the conjecture that ancient systems might be scattered across the globe beneath the ice of the perafrost wasteland. Did some ancient creation also slumber? was a resonance of that window event like a pebble thrown into a pond, creating ripples that somehow traveled to distant places, awakening or disturbing other slumbering beings. Strange omens appeared frequently from the southwest to the northeast, from the sea to the ice fields. The world seemed like a disturbed giant with various inexplicable neurotic twitches appearing in different parts of its body.

The atmosphere inside the Mo Yuan Pavilion Command Center was heavy. Intelligence reports and unusual findings from various parties were piled on the table, resembling a chaotic cloud map foreshadowing an impending storm. Strengthen monitoring in all directions, especially long-term tracking of abnormal marine biological behavior and environmental parameters. Lynn Mo instructed Leeway. Your group should try to use the dragon soul framework to build a simplified ecological disturbance risk assessment submodel focusing on assessing the potential chronic impacts of different energy frequencies and intensities on typical marine populations.

We need to quantify this threat. He looked at the remote sea area marked on the nautical chart as the suspected activity area of the stonemason's brotherhood. Chanduo find a way to infiltrate that area. You don't need to go deep. just confirm the approximate location, size, and possible purpose of their base.

Be careful not to alert them. Finally, his gaze fell on the blank space representing the perafrost of the north. As for the rumors about the north, put them on hold for now, but inform all our spies along the northern trade routes to be on the lookout for any new information about geology, ice, or unusual sounds. The unknown is spreading and threats are mutating. The Mo Yuan Pavilion cannot simply passively record these anomalies.

It must begin to try to understand the logic behind them and assess the systemic risks that their superp position and resonance might trigger. Steady development remains the constant. But this development must include the ability to cope with these increasingly bizarre and global challenges. The accumulation of knowledge and the construction of defenses have never been more urgent. An invisible hand is slowly lifting a corner of the world's veil, revealing not a beautiful scene, but a bottomless, writhing darkness.

Chapter 1 07. Echoes of the ice field. The bizarre rumors about the perafrost wasteland were like another pebble thrown into the deep waters of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. Although their veracity was questionable and their origins unclear, in this sensitive period of frequent anomalies, any extraordinary rumors deserve to be observed. Lynmo did not immediately invest resources in an in-depth investigation of that remote frigid land, but instead listed it as a high-risisk area for anomalies to be observed, incorporating it into the routine screening scope of the intelligence network.

His attention remained primarily focused on those more direct and urgent threats and changes. Leeway's team has made substantial progress in digesting and applying the risk assessment model framework of Dragon Soul. Unable to obtain core data to fill in the model, they creatively utilize the framework's logical structure to deduce several key missing data lists which are considered indispensable for assessing the risks of any interaction with the ancient system. The list includes but is not limited to specific energy conduction thresholds for different types of energy patterns, redundancy and failure transfer functions of safety buffer nodes and trigger conditions and cool down times for the systems global reset mechanism. Although we dy know the answer, we now have a clear understanding of what the problems are and how important they are.

Dot. When Leewi reported to Linmo, he had the clarity and excitement that researchers have when facing complex problems. We have compiled this list of key missing data and our rededuction of the window event chain based on the framework logic into a summary of technical inquiries and scenario deductions and sent it back as in-depth feedback on the dragon soul model framework dot. This feedback was no longer a simple exchange of observations but a question that touched upon the core dilemma of dragon soul research. It demonstrated the depth of Mo Yuinga's understanding of the framework and also subtly pointed out the potential blind spots in Dragon Souls existing research that may have accumulated a large number of phenomena and data, but they are also struggling to build a unified theory and extract key parameters.

Dragon Souls response slowed. Clearly, this crucial feedback required time to digest and internally discuss. A few days later, Xiao Ji Gang replied with a brief letter stating only that, "Your insights are profound and have been forwarded to the relevant research department for in-depth discussion without providing any new information or commitments." The technical dialogue seemed to have entered a brief plateau with both sides digesting the existing exchange and assessing the next steps. Meanwhile, Sue Chian's work on building the ecological disturbance risk assessment submodel encountered even greater difficulties. The lack of fundamental data on biological neurohysiological responses to specific energy frequencies made any quantitative assessment virtually impossible.

She then adopted a more roundabout approach, extensively collecting and organizing recent reports of abnormal marine biological events from various regions, attempting to conduct cluster analysis from multiple dimensions such as time, space, species type, and abnormal behavioral characteristics to find possible patterns. This work is tedious and complex, but preliminary analysis shows that these events are not entirely random. Although they are widely distributed spatially, there appears to be a slight trend in time starting from a window event and spreading outwards. More importantly, historical environmental monitoring data painstakingly collected by Moyuan from records of past caravans and data from scattered observation stations in the sea areas where the anomalous events occurred show that in the period leading up to the events. The background infrasound and extremely low frequency electromagnetic noise levels in these areas generally exhibited a slight increase beyond normal fluctuations.

This could be indirect evidence. Sue Chanchian pointed out at the analysis report meeting, indicating that the energy disturbances caused by the window event may have a much larger impact range than we directly observe and that they spread and accumulate in the marine environment in a very covert and slow manner. When they accumulate to a certain level or encounter specific environmental conditions or biological sensitive periods, they may trigger the sudden group behavior disorder that we see. This is a chronic systemic environmental stress. This conclusion elevates the phenomenon of marine life going berserk from an isolated tale to an early sign of a potential global ecological crisis.

The severity of which weighed heavily on the minds of all attendees. The outline of the Stonemason's Brotherhood's energy base in a remote sea area gradually became clear thanks to Chandwood's costly and secret reconnaissance. It wasn't the heavily guarded fortress he had imagined, but rather a large-scale, highly specialized, and almost fully automated research and energy harvesting complex. Using high-powered telescopes and long range photography equipment, reconnaissance personnel captured images from high altitude observation point dozens of nautical miles away using a specially designed tether balloon. The base was built on a mid ocean ridge with active geothermal activity and contained a dense array of oddly shaped tidal converters and pipelines extending deep into geothermal wells.

At the center of the base were several low streamlined silver gray buildings with few people visible, but small unmanned vehicles occasionally move between the facilities. They are quietly working on infrastructure construction and energy reserves and they're moving very quickly and with extremely high efficiency. Chin Duodo commented, "It seems that they will not take any external action in the short term, but once completed, the energy and technological resources they can mobilize will be considerable. Their goal is probably not simply self-sufficiency." The internal breathing aura phenomenon in the southwestern Misty Bay appeared twice more, still without any pattern, and each time it was weaker and shorter, as if the massive construct was entering a low power hibernation or deep selfch check state. Surveillance from the outside detected no personnel or supplies entering or leaving.

The sea area was eerily silent. Just as Mo Yuan Pavilion was busy sorting through this chaotic information and trying to piece together the overall picture, a new and more impactful piece of intelligence accompanied by a huge cost was delivered to Linmo. Chandwood's most capable and deeply hidden senior intelligence agent was exposed when he tried to get close to the outer supply chain of the Dragon Soul Project and paid the price with his life. However, in his last moment, he uses life to convey a fragmented but thrilling message. Information reveals that Dragon Souls probe project is far more extensive and sophisticated than previously imagined.

They not only constructed new deep sea submersibles, but also secretly modified three large icebreaker mother ships to serve as mobile forward bases and command centers. Most alarmingly, intelligence fragments suggest that Dragon Soul obtained a critical guiding object through an unorthodox channel. Specific details are unclear, but implied that this object can resonate stably with the depths of the ice flows and appears to have been pre-processed, making the resonance risk manageable. Dragon Soul plans to use this object during the next window of opportunity to attempt to establish a preliminary low power directional energy link with the goal of reading surface information flows and verifying the system state model. They found another key and it might be a safer and more effective key.

Leeway almost cried out after seeing the intelligence pre-processing. Could it be that a third party force has already mastered the technology to safely use this key and they've given it to Dragon Soul? Is it the Stonemason's Brotherhood or Vera's team? This intelligence struck them like a boulder thrown into a still lake. Far from being deterred by the window incident, Dragon Soul, having obtained the new key, prepared for a more ambitious and inevitably riskier proactive contact. If they succeeded, they might gain groundbreaking insights into the ancient system. But if they failed, the chain reaction could far exceed that of the last time.

The intelligence source paid with their life, and its accuracy requires crossverification with other information. Lynmo's voice remained calm, but his eyes flashed with a sharp light. Chandu Duo, use all backup and emergency channels at all costs to verify three things. First, the specific form and source of the Dragon Soul New. Second, the specific technical solutions and security measure for their planned establishment of an energy link.

Third, the precise timing of the next window of opportunity. These are our current top intelligence priorities. He turned to the others. Internal research will be temporarily redirected. Leewei Suchian, you two concentrate your efforts on simulating and deducing the system response spectrum that a low power directional energy link might trigger as well as various possible failure modes and consequences based on all existing knowledge about the icebreaking zone system, energy patterns, and safety buffers.

Sure. How check all our remote monitoring equipment to ensure that we can cover a wider frequency and energy range during the next window period, paying particular attention to monitoring any weak signals that might be characteristic of a directional link. Rumors about the perafrost wasteland have yet to be cleared up. The shadow of mutations in deep sea creatures continues to spread. The Stonemason's Brotherhood is silently gathering strength in the distance.

The behemoths of the southwest are temporarily lying dormant, and the dragon soul is about to drop a stone that could shake the entire world beneath the northernized plains. The world's echoes have not yet subsided, and a new proactive question is about to rise. The Mo Yuan Pavilion is caught in a complex force field created by multiple parties, unable to remain aloof or stop any one of them. All they can do is observe more intently, strive to understand more diligently, and grow faster. They pray that when the echoes from beneath the ice plains return, they will have sufficient knowledge and preparation to discern the meaning of those sounds and determine their own course.

The come at the eye of the storm may already be counting down. Chapter 108. Keys and choices. The fragmented information obtained at the cost of a senior intelligence officer's life burned like a red-hot iron into the hearts of everyone in the Mo Yuan pavilion. The dragon's soul not only did not back down, but was secretly planning an even more invasive exploration and might even have obtained a more secure key.

The authenticity and details of this information directly relate to the future course of the situation and even the safety of the entire sea area. Overwhelmed by grief and pressure, Chin Duo Duo activated several long, dormant, high-cost intelligence lines. The most crucial of these was a contact with an undercover agent code named Nighthawk. This individual held a key position in a secondary logistics hub within Dragon Soul. His identity concealed.

He was one of Chindwood's early one-way contact agents. Activating him meant this card would be completely exposed. But at this moment, there was no time to worry about anything else. The instructions were transmitted through a complex deadmail system and coded messages. At all costs, investigate the nature, origin, and security core of the new key scheme.

Priority: top secret. During the anxious days of waiting for the Nighthawks reply, the Muan Pavilion, based on the available information, launched intensive simulations and preparations. Leewi and Sue Chanhan temporarily set aside other research and devoted themselves to simulating the system response that low power directional energy link might trigger. Using the Dragon Souls risk assessment framework as the backbone, they filled in known characteristics of the shattered eye zone system, echo characteristics, inferences about the function of the safety texture, signs of the reset mechanism, as well as parameters from the failure of the wings of freedom case as references for the danger boundary, and constructed multiple simulation scenarios with different key characteristics, link, strength, and duration of action. The simulation results are worrying.

In all simulations, once the link is established, regardless of its power, it triggers a detectable response from the target system. The only difference lies in the strength and nature of the response. In the most optimistic scenario, assuming a perfect key match and an extremely restrained link, the system may only respond with an encrypted status code or authentication request. However, even slight mishaps such as a minor flaw in the key, the link power exceeding a critical threshold or an excessively long duration can trigger consequences ranging from error warning feedback to local security node overload. And ultimately, regional defense countermeasures or system denial of reset.

The key lies in the purity of that key and the precision with which the dragon soul controls the link process. Leeway pointed to the summary chart of simulation results. If their key is indeed pre-processed and the resonance risk is controllable as the intelligence says and their technology can achieve subsecond power fine-tuning and instantaneous interruption, then theoretically it is possible to obtain some information within the safety boundaries. However, any minor error in any link could lead to a repeat of the same mistake. And because this is a directional link, it could even trigger a more concentrated and stronger countermeasure.

Dot. Such Chanchian is more concerned about the potential environmental spillover effects. Even if the link itself is strictly controlled, the energy redistribution and response processes it triggers within the system may be like a pebble thrown into a deep pool, producing secondary fluctuations that our current models cannot fully simulate. These fluctuations propagating through geological structures or water bodies may disturb the energy balance of a wider area exacerbate existing ecological disturbances and may even awaken other dormant units. Sherhow's defensive preparations were more pragmatic.

He not only inspected all monitoring equipment, but also organized an emergency evacuation drill simulating a sudden highintensity energy pulse or infrasound impact. The drill required all non-critical personnel to enter designated specially reinforced underground shelters or ship cabins with a certain level of electromagnetic shielding as quickly as possible and critical personnel were required to master the skills to maintain basic operations and communications under strong interference. The drill revealed some bottlenecks in evacuation routes and deficiencies in some shielding facilities which were quickly recorded and rectified. Several more days passed in the intense preparation. Finally, the first encrypted report from Nighthawk was delivered to Chandu Duo through an unexpected channel of everyday items.

The report was still fragmented, but the information was extremely valuable. Regarding the new key, Dragon Soul did indeed acquire an item described as a dark blue spindle-shaped crystal, neither gold nor stone, about the length of a palm with a slowly flowing cloud-like halo inside. The origin of this item is extremely confidential. Even the Nighthawk level cannot access it. It was only learned from extremely rare fragments of highle conversations, seemingly related to an accidental discovery during an early exploration of ruins and subsequent long-term secret research and was only recently re-evaluated and activated.

The crystal is stored in a speciallymade container with multiple energy shields, and its transportation and activation are subject to extremely strict procedures. Regarding the link scheme, Project Dragon Soul utilizes a specialized device called a resonance probe capable of emitting highly pure composite acoustic beams with precisely tunable frequency and waveform. The core of the scheme involves first using a low power broadband scan to confirm the optimal resonant frequency between the key crystal and the target region and then establishing an extremely narrow band strictly programmed directional energy link at this frequency. The entire linking process is planned in multiple phases, each lasting only a very short time, milliseconds. Each phase is immediately interrupted for system feedback assessment, and the next phase only proceeds after safety is confirmed.

The scheme mentions several real-time monitoring indicators and preset interruption thresholds, which does appear to indicate that risk control has been considered. Regarding the next window of opportunity, nightshade provide a more precise time frame approximately 19 to 23 days later lasting about 36 hours. This largely matches Leewi's calculations based on astronomical and ocean title data. The key is a cloud-like halo inside the crystal. Leeway pondered.

This description is not exactly the same as any of the ancient artifacts we have obtained before, but spindle shape and internal halo are vaguely mentioned in some ancient legends and scattered records about the storage or conversion medium of top level energy dot. Their technical solution sounds very cautious, a typical step-by-step verification and rapid response approach. Sue Chenin commented, "But the problem is, are their evaluation criteria for system feedback accurate? Can those interruption thresholds really take effect before the systems countermeasures are formed? These are all unknowns. Lynn Mo carefully read through each report and every deduction result. The Dragon Souls actions were like a meticulously designed scientific experiment conducted on the edge of a cliff.

The experimenters believe they had mastered enough theory, tools, and safety ropes. But the subject of the experiment was an ancient being full of unknowns possibly possessing defense mechanisms far beyond comprehension. Cross compare all the technical details about the key and linkage scheme transmitted back by Nighthawk with the various risk scenarios we have deduced. Linmo instructed Leeway and Sue Shian identify any potential risks in their scheme that have not been adequately addressed or any assumptions that we believe are insufficiently supported by evidence. compiled them into a supplementary risk notice.

He looked at Shien Duo Duo notify Nighthawk that his mission is complete. He should immediately enter a silent stealthy state and not be contacted unless it is a matter of life and death. His safety is the top priority. Finally, Lynn Mo's gaze swept over the solemn faces of everyone in the command room. We will not intervene, nor will we stop, nor are we able to stop the dragon souls actions.

But we must be fully prepared to observe, record, and analyze the entire process of this operation. This may be an unprecedented opportunity for us to understand the operating logic of the ancient system and assess the limits of human intervention. He paused, his tone low and firm. Notify all units that during the Dragon Soul window period operation, the Mo Yuon Pavilion will enter the highest level of silent observation. All external activities are suspended and energy radiation is reduced to the minimum.

We must be like a real reef blending into the background, using all our eyes and ears to clearly see this dance on the edge of a cliff. The key is in hand. The choice has been made. The dragon soul is about to knock on that ancient door. Whether the response from behind the door is knowledge, warning, or a torrent of destruction, the Mo Yuan Pavilion must see every glimmer of light shining through the crack.

Hear every soft creek of the hinges turning. This observation itself is the most precious capital necessary for survival in this increasingly bizarre and dangerous world. The storm is coming, and this time they may be able to see its true shape. Chapter 1 09. Observing from the edge.

The precise time window of the dragon's soul probe operation like the sword of Damocles hovers over a specific mark on the calendar. Its invisible pressure meticulously adjusting the rhythm of every gear in the Mo Yuan pavilion. Only 7 days remain until the operation begins. Following Linmo's instructions, the entire Moan Pavilion has switched to the highest level of silent observation mode. All non-essential energy consuming facilities have been shut down or reduced to minimum maintenance levels.

Nighttime lighting control is strict to the point of being harsh and even everyday cooking smoke has undergone special treatment to reduce its heat signature. The island is like a colossal beast that has concealed all its presence and lurks in the shadows with only countless eyes and ears silently opening in the darkness aimed at the north and southwest. After integrating the details of the key crystal and resonance probe scheme transmitted back by Nighthawk, Leeway and Sue Chanchan simulation work entered the final calibration and risk point extraction stage. They discovered that the theoretical basis of several key safety thresholds and interruption conditions preset in the dragon soul scheme likely heavily relied on the assumptions of linear response and predictable delay of ancient systems. But based on our analysis of the window event, the chain reaction of the system as internal security network when stimulated by a specific stimulus may be highly nonlinear and instantaneous.

Leeway pointed to a peak graph in the simulation results. In other words, the system may not react linearly in order of detection processing response, but rather trigger a preset almost immediately effective defense protocol the instant the energy input reaches a certain critical point. The millisecond level interruption of the dragon soul project may still be too slow in the face of a real system response. Such an raised another concern from the perspective of energy conduction medium. Their solution mainly considers the propagation and attenuation of sound waves and seawater and ice layers, but ignores the fact that when energy links are established, they may directly couple to deeper geological structures or global energy networks through the crystal itself or internal system pathways.

Once such deep coupling is formed, it may not be able to be cut off by a simple interruption. It will be like a needle inserted into a blood vessel. Even if it is pulled out, the effect have already occurred. They compiled these two core risks along with several other minor but significant technical details into a rigorously worded and logically clear document titled potential nonlinearity questions and deep coupling risk warnings regarding directed energy links which they sent to Dragon Soul as a supplementary risk warning. This warning was no longer merely an observational conclusion, but a deep critique based on technical principles directly addressing the theoretical foundation of Dragon Souls action plan.

They knew this warning might go unanswered or spark heated debate within Dragon Soul. But it was a voice that Emo Yuan Pavilion as a technical observer had to raise driven by moral considerations and their own safety. Even after the Nighthawk fell silent, Chindwood's intelligence network did not slack in its external information gathering efforts. Instead, it became more passive and covert. He utilized several publicly available information collection channels disguised as natural phenomenon monitoring or commercial data statistics, cross- refferencing abnormal signals from the automatic identification system, AI is of ships in the northern seas, specific weather disturbance patterns on satellite cloud images, and even anomalous signal fragments accidentally overheard by amateur radio enthusiasts.

Piecing together indirect evidence of the Dragon Soul fleet movements. Based on information from various sources, Dragon Souls three modified Icebreaker mother ships and their escort fleet have quietly arrived at their designated positions outside the ice flow zone and begun final system integration and testing. Their operations are exceptionally discreet, maintaining strict radio silence and relying primarily on lasers and data links for internal communication. They have also deployed a considerable number of underwater sonar arrays and anti-detection buoys attempting to envelop the entire operational area in an information blackbox. They danti want anyone to know exactly what happened including potential allies or saboturs and duo duo judged.

This shows that they themselves are not entirely confident about the outcome of the operation and have prepared for the worst case scenario of secrecy. The southwestern misty bay remained deathly silent. The occasional dark red aura of light seemed to have vanished completely as if the massive structure had truly entered a deep hibernation. However, the monitoring equipment deployed at a greater distance by the Mo Yuon pavilion, targeting extremely lowfrequency magnetic fields and changes in gravitational gradients recorded a persistent extremely weak but stable background noise in the direction of the bay. Unlike any known natural geomagnetic disturbance or tidal effect, the source characteristics of this noise have not yet been analyzed, but is like a perpetually unhealing minute wound, continuously oozing anomalies from the skin of the environment.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood's remote energy base appears to be in its final construction phase. Recent footage taken remotely from a high altitude balloon shows the silver gray building complex at the base's center largely complete. With the surrounding tidal and geothermal energy harvesting arrays nearing completion, the foundations of what appear to be large energy storage units, possibly giant capacitor banks or flywheels, can even be seen being hoisted. The entire base remains sparssely populated and boasts an astonishingly high level of automation. After disappearing from the atal lagoon, Vera's team has not appeared at any known monitoring points, as if they have completely blended into the seam mist.

Time passed day by day in a stifling silence. With only 3 days remaining until the start of Operation Dragon Soul, a final islandwide redundancy test of the communication and command systems was conducted within Mo Yuan Pavilion. This ensured that in the event of a primary communication network outage due to unknown energy interference or physical damage, backup and emergency communication methods, including buried wired signal lines, fixpoint laser communication, and even trained carrier pigeons, could maintain basic command links and critical data transmission. Simultaneously, all personnel in key positions were clearly defined regarding autonomous action guidelines and final rendevous points in the event of a loss of contact. Sherhow personally inspected the concealment and survival supplies of each observation point.

These observation points were mostly located on remote islands and reefs, hidden caves, or even camouflaged floating platforms. Personnel would need to remain there for days on end, enduring loneliness and harsh environments just to capture signals that might be fleeting. They were the nerve endings of the Mo Yuan Pavilion reaching into the distance, fragile yet crucial. On the eve of the operation, Lin Mo convened a final meeting with core members to discuss the situation. We cannot predict what will happen starting tomorrow at Lin MOS gaze swept over everyone.

Dragon Solless operation may succeed. It may fail or may trigger a chain reaction that we cannot foresee at all. Our mission is not to intervene, but to observe, record, and understand as much as possible. He pulled up the latest comprehensive situation map. Leewi Sue Chian, you lead the analysis team to guard the underground command center on the main island, responsible for processing all data transmitted from the observation points in real time, conducting preliminary analysis and risk warnings.

Sure. How you're in charge of the ground defense command post to ensure the safety of the island itself and also serve as the emergency support hub for all observation points. Chen Duo Duo you are responsible for summarizing screening and conducting preliminary analysis of all intelligence information to ensure the smooth and accurate flow of information at all observation points. Once the operation begins the sole task will be recording an encrypted data transmission. Any active detection or signal transmission is strictly prohibited.

If any exposure risk is detected or an insurmountable danger is encountered. Evacuation must be carried out immediately according to the pre-arranged plan with the safety of personnel as the top priority. He paused, his tone grave. This observation may reveal a deeper truth about this world or it may confront unimaginable dangers, but only by seeing clearly can we know which path to take in the future. Everyone take your positions.

The meeting ended, and everyone left silently to their respective posts. Under the cover of night, Mayuin Pavilion resembled a ghost island on high alert, yet devoid of any fire, with only the faint sound of the sea breeze rustling through the rocks and buildings. Lynn Emmo climbed alone to the top of the reinforced observation tower, which had undergone special electromagnetic shielding. Here, the view was expansive, the instruments were complete, and it had a separate hardwired connection to the underground command center. here along with the entire Mo Yuan pavilion.

He would witness and record this knocking on the door experiment taking place beneath the distant ice plains, an experiment that could potentially determine the future. In the northern night sky, the stars were dim as if obscured by the omen of the impending energy disturbance. To the southwest, thick fog persisted, and the silence was like a graveyard. To the east and south, vast seas stretched into the night, seemingly calm, yet concealing the continued disruption of biological rhythms and unknown environmental pressures caused by the aftershocks of the window. Mo Yuan Pavilion is like a calm observer standing on the edge of abyss, having adjusted all its telescopes and recording equipment, holding its breath and waiting for the being beneath the abyss to respond to the impending cautious questioning.

The time has finally come to a critical point. Observation is about to begin. Chapter 1 10 echoes beneath the ice. Time flowed exceptionally slowly in the absolute silence and focused waiting. The timers at all the observation points of Moon Pavilion were synchronously counting down to the millisecond with the estimated start time of the window period provided by the Dragon Soul as the origin.

Northern region outside the icebreak zone. Dragon Souls three modified icebreaker mother ships, like three steel icebergs, were anchored in a triangular formation in the sparsely populated sea. All unnecessary lights on the holes were turned off, leaving only the eerie blue glow of the instrument panel in the command bridge, and a few faint signals outside the holes to prevent collisions. The massive holes remained motionless in the polar winds, exuding a solemn, poised readiness. Underwater, a complex sonar array and a network of monitoring buoys had already been deployed like an invisible net covering the bottomless dark chasm ahead.

The personnel from Miuan Pavilion, stationed at two concealed observation points in the north, huddled in specially designed insulated shelters dressed in white camouflage suits that blended seamlessly into the icy environment. on the screens in front of them. Data streams from passive receiver arrays pulseed background noise spectrum, hydrophone vibration waveforms, magnetic field strength variation curves. Everything appeared calm, but everyone held their breath, their fingertips hovering over the emergency recording and alarm buttons. In the underground command center, Leewi, Sue Chian, and several core analysts stared intently at the main screen.

The screen was divided into dozens of sections displaying real-time data from different frequency bands and monitoring methods, as well as simulation curves of several response models preset based on the Dragon Souls possible action patterns. The air seemed to freeze with only the extremely low hum of the equipment's cooling fans. 10 minutes until the estimated start time, an analyst whispered. Lynn Mo's voice calmly transmitted to every key position via internal hardwire communication. All units, finalize equipment status.

Maintain absolute silence. Time was ticking away. 9 minutes 5 minutes 2 minutes. About 30 seconds before the countdown reached zero. On the main screen of the northern number one observation point, a very subtle ripple appeared on the waveform representing the passive sonar array.

This ripple was completely different from any natural background fluctuation. A group of composite soundwave pulses with highly pure frequency and precisely controlled intensity and extremely low level like a cautious tentacle probed into the deep sea where the rift was located from the direction of the dragon soul fleet. The probe beam has been launched. Leeway lowered his voice, a sharp glint in his eyes. They have begun the first phase, a broadband scan to confirm the resonant frequency on the waveform.

The spectral characteristics of that group of sound pulses changed rapidly, clearly indicating a rapid frequency scan. After about 15 seconds, the scan stopped and all the energy quickly converged and concentrated into an extremely narrow frequency band. The frequency value of that point was automatically captured and highlighted by the device, a complex and non- integer frequency value. yet carrying an eerie sense of harmony. Resonant frequency locked.

Now Leeway clenched his fist. Almost instantly after the frequency was locked, the monitoring data changed dramatically. The magnetic field reading in the direction of the ice flow showed its first clear and regular fluctuation, perfectly synchronized with the intensity change of the directional sound beam. The underwater audio device also detected an echo from deep within a crevice with the same frequency as the external sound beam but seemingly modulated in some complex way. This echo was not a simple reflection.

Its waveform contains subtle difficult to decipher structures superimposed on it. Link established. Energy coupling confirmed. Such an stared at the rapidly refreshing energy flow analysis data on another screen. The coupling efficiency is astonishingly high.

That crystal key is working. The atmosphere in the underground command center instantly became extremely tense. Dragon Soul had indeed successfully established a low power directional link. Now, the key question was how long this link could be maintained and how the system would respond. The link lasted for about 5 seconds.

Then, the intensity of the external sound beam abruptly dropped to Zero Dragon's soul. as planned, executed its first millisecond level interruption. Almost simultaneously, the magnetic field disturbance and echo signal in the direction of the rift also disappeared as if everything that had just happened was merely an illusion. Phase 1 security disruption, the analyst reported the target system response matches the initial characteristics of authentication request simulation scenario A3. No signs of overload or countermeasures were detected.

A suppressed sigh of relief filled the command center. The first step seemed to have been successful. After a brief pause, the Dragon Soul began its second phase. This time, the power of the directional sound beam was slightly increased, but still strictly controlled below the theoretical safety threshold, and the duration was extended to approximately 0.3 seconds. The link was reestablished and the waveform structure of the system echo became more complex as if transmitting a longer information packet.

However, less than a second after the connection was interrupted, an anomaly occurred in the direction of the ice shard area, the passive monitoring array captured an extremely brief but far stronger broadband pulse burst than any of the previous echoes. This pulse burst did not originate from the depths of the fissure, but rather seemed to be excited simultaneously from certain specific locations on the sidewall of the fissure. The pulse lasted for less than 100th of a second before disappearing into the background noise, but its instantaneous energy peak caused the alarm lights on the monitoring equipment to flash wildly for half a second. What is that? Sukianken exclamed. It's not a proactive response from the system.

It's more like a state refresh or selfch checkck pulse from a security node because the energy input from the link triggered some internal threshold. Leeway's face turned pale as he quickly retrieved the spectral details of the pulse burst. The frequency components are complex containing multiple characteristic frequency points that may be related to the highfrequency transient buffer pattern. Damn it. This is very likely the nonlinear response we warned about before.

Although the link was interrupted, the systems internal security network was alarmed, triggering a chain of instantaneous selfch checks. Almost simultaneously, instruments set up further away by Moon Pavilion to monitor micro vibrations in the Earth's crust recorded an extremely slight but clearly identifiable tremor deep beneath the cracks in the icebreaking zone with a tremor pattern unlike any known tectonic earthquake or ice collapse. Dragon Souls operation seemed to have encountered an unexpected setback. The command center's communication channels were silent. Everyone awaited Dragon Souls next move.

The Dragon Soul fleet remained silent for a full 5 minutes, much longer than the scheduled interval. Clearly, they had also detected the unusual pulse burst and ground tremors and were conducting an emergency assessment. 5 minutes later, the third phase of the connection attempt began. This time the power of the external sound beam was adjusted to an even lower level than in the first phase and the duration was shortened to the limit seemingly becoming unusually cautious. The link was established and the echo reappeared but this time the waveform of the echo showed obvious distortion and delay as if the internal response path of the system had been interfered with or blocked.

The link was interrupted in a very short time. At the very moment of interruption, a sudden change occurred. The broadband pulse burst that had subsided suddenly reappeared. This time with even greater intensity and longer duration than the first one. Even more frighteningly, the source of the pulse burst no longer seemed to be confined to the sidewalls of the fracture, but began to rapidly propagate along some invisible path into the deeper parts of the fracture and into the lateral ice and rock straighta.

A chain reaction of network overload. Leeway suddenly stood up. They're trying to soothe the system with lower power, but that might have triggered a deeper fault diagnosis protocol. The system thinks it's under continuous lowintensity penetration attack and is initiating a wider range of internal selfch checks and isolation procedures. The monitoring data began to trigger a full-scale alarm.

The magnetic field disturbances became violent and chaotic. The water temperature gradient along the cracks fluctuated abnormally, and even tiny bubbles began to seep out from the ice cracks. Further away, the equipment set up by Mayuan Pavilion to monitor ultra- low frequency environmental noise captured a deep suppressed humming sound seemingly originating from the depths of the earth, which was slowly increasing in intensity. The energy link must be permanently terminated. Immediately, Su Chian shouted into the communicator.

Even though she knew the dragon soul couldn't hear her, as of hearing her thoughts, the dragon soul fleet ceased, emitting any more directional sound beams. They clearly realized the situation was spiraling out of control and decisively stopped all active probing. However, the system, which had been awakened, did not seem to calm down immediately. The abnormal pulse bursts, ground tremors, and low-frequency humming continued, although their intensity was slowly decreasing, but at a much slower rate than expected. The entire ice fragmentation zone seemed to have transformed from sleeping giant into a restless patient, tossing and turning, uttering painful ramblings.

The observation points at Mouan Pavilion faithfully recorded all of this. The data stream like a burst dam surged towards the underground command center. New fine signs of stress crack propagation were recorded inside the ice layer. Water chemical composition monitoring shows that the concentrations of iron silicon and various rare metal ions are abnormally elevated at the Fiser outlet. The ambient infrasound background noise level increased by 15 dibels and a stable low frequency modulation was observed.

Dragon Souls knocking on the door experiment seems to have ended prematurely in a way that was both successful and disastrous. They may have obtained some valuable initial handshake data, but they undoubtedly seriously disturbed the target and triggered a series of unknown and potentially lasting stress responses within the system. Lynn and Mo stood on the top floor of the observation tower, looking up at the gloomy northern sky through the special glass. Although he couldn't see anything with a naked eye, he could sense that beneath that frozen sea, some ancient and enormous being had partially awakened and was examining this world that had dared to disturb it in its own way. The echo beneath the ice has already resounded.

What this echo will bring, no one knows. The observation records of Mo Yuan Pavilion now hold the only and most crucial key to understanding this unexpected dialogue and its consequences. The wind seems to have grown colder. Chapter 111. The aftermath.

The dragon souls knocking on the door experiment came to an abrupt end after triggering a series of unsettling stress responses from the ancient systems in the shattered ice zone. Like a boulder thrown into a deep pool, the ripples did not immediately subside as the stone sank. Instead, they began to spread in all directions in a more complex and subtle way. Even after the operation concluded, Mo Yuan Pavilion maintained a 3-day period of maximum level silent observation. Data transmitted from various observation points in the north clearly showed that the anomalies in the direction of the icebreak zone had not subsided rapidly.

Although the broadband pulses triggered by the internal security network chain reaction no longer erupted, the environmental magnetic field and water disturbances remained in a state of continuous fluctuation above baseline levels. The concentration of special ions seeping from the fissures remained high, and the stress cracks inside the ice layer after their initial rapid expansion seemed to have entered a slow but continuous creep phase. Most unsettlingly, the low-pitched humming sound originating from the ground, although its intensity had greatly decreased, persisted stubbornly like background noise, sometimes strong and sometimes weak, like a disturbed giant unconsciously grinding its teeth in its sleep. The system has not been completely reset. That leeway stared at the compiled 72-hour data trenchart, his voice horse.

Or rather, its reset process is much longer than we imagined, and it may have left some after effects. Those persistent anomalies may be the self-regulation process after the internal energy balance was disrupted, or it may be that some kind of low-level alert state has been activated. Such Chanchchan added, "Biom monitoring data also shows that the activity rhythms of plankton and deep sea fish in a large area around the ice flow have become significantly disrupted and their migration paths have become chaotic. This is similar to the biological anomaly pattern after the window event, but the scope and duration of the impact seemed to be even greater. That key crystal and directional link may have left a more profound imprint.

After confirming that there were no immediate external threats targeting the Mo Yuan Pavilion, Lynn Mo ordered the lifting of the highest level of silence and the restoration of level two alert, but all observation points continued to maintain 24/7 monitoring. A massive stream of data began to be analyzed more deeply and systematically in the underground command center. At the same time, Chindwood's intelligence network also began to make every effort to capture the aftershocks caused by this incident. Dragon Souls reaction was the most direct. After the operation was halted, their fleet did not immediately withdraw.

Instead, they further strengthened the blockade around the ice shards and began deploying a large number of new monitoring buoys with complex antenna rays, seemingly eager to comprehensively monitor the situation and collect after effect data. Unconfirmed reports suggest that this half success half out of control operation sparked heated debate within Dragon Soul with a conflict between radical and cautious factions becoming public. However, Dragon Soul officially remained absolutely silent, issuing no statements as if everything that happened in the ice shards those days was merely an illusion. However, this silence itself was a strong signal. All the major powers, those with even a modicum of intelligence, noticed the unusual energy disturbances in the northern seas and the dragon souls unusually large-scale mobilization and blockade.

Rumors began to breed and spread at an alarming rate. The ancient beings of the perpetually frozen wasteland have been awakened by the dragon soul and are gathering their power in preparation for revenge. The dragon's soul stole forbidden knowledge from the ruins, but in doing so, it also incurred the guardian's curse. Beneath the shattered ice zone isn't a ruin at all, but a door to an unknown dimension that the dragon's soul almost opened. Various bizarre and exaggerated versions circulated among lower level survivors and smaller factions, causing a degree of panic and speculation.

Although the top factions might not believe these rumors, they undoubtedly exacerbated the already tense and suspicious atmosphere. The Stonemason's Brotherhood was one of the first external forces to react substantially. The day after Mo Yuan Pavilion observed the anomaly spreading in the ice crushing zone, Chindwood's informants discovered that the construction of the Stonemason's Brotherhood's remote energy base had suddenly slowed with the installation of some peripheral tidal energy harvesting arrays even halted. Simultaneously, they were urgently acquiring high precision environmental radiation monitoring instruments and long-term geomagnetic anomaly recording and analysis services through various clandestine channels at inflated prices, clearly strengthening their ability to monitor changes in the overall energy environment. They were also frightened.

Chin Duo Duo analyzed the outcome of Dragon's Soulless actions exceeded their expectations. What they're most concerned about now is probably not their own energy project, but what kind of global environmental chain reaction will be brought about by the disturbance of the ancient system and whether it will affect their own long-term plans. The southwestern Misty Bay remains shrouded in deathly silence. But the remote magnetic field and gravity gradient monitoring equipment deployed by Mo Yuan Pavilion detected an extremely faint new change amidst the persistent background noise. The rhythm of the noise seemed to be beginning to resonate or follow in some indescribable nonlinear way with the faint low humming coming from the direction of the distant ice flows.

Although so faint as to be almost submerged in a margin of error, this discovery sent a chill down the spines of everyone in the know. Is that construct still passively receiving something? Or is its dormant state itself reacting to this global change in energy background? Vera's team remains silent as if they have completely vanished into thin air. After combining the results of internal data analysis with external intelligence feedback, Lynn Mo convened a core meeting. The situation is clear now. Lin Mo's tone was calm, yet carried a cold clarity that saw through the complexities of the situation.

The Dragon Souls adventure has disrupted a fragile balance. The ancient system is not an inanimate object. It possesses complex self-maintenance and defense mechanisms and its influence may extend far beyond a single relic. Now a part of it has been activated existing in an unstable sub-healthy state. This state itself and the environmental chain reaction it may trigger will become a new variable that all forces must face in the near future.

He pointed to the chart. Dragon Soul has swallowed the bitter fruit of its own adventure, and in the short term, it is probably neither able nor willing to conduct large-scale exploration again. Instead, it will focus on monitoring and assessing the damage. The Stonemason's Brotherhood has been forced to adjust its pace and strengthen environmental monitoring, which may delay or change its strategic intentions. The situation of the wings of Liberty remnants is unclear, but the potential connection between its construct and the global energy background makes it an unpredictable risk point for us.

Lin MOS gaze swept over everyone. This means that our previously relatively clear role as observers needs to be adjusted. We are no longer just observing the actions of a certain site or a certain force, but we need to start observing and responding to a changing global energy environment system and the chain reactions it triggers. Leeway Sue Chanchian, your research direction needs to be upgraded again. The focus should shift from understanding specific relics to modeling global energy environment disturbances and their ecological and geological impacts.

Using all the data we have accumulated this time and before try to build a simplified multi-node coupled environmental change early warning model precise prediction is not required but it should be able to identify anomalous patterns and the increasing trend of correlation styo the focus of intelligence gathering also needs to shift reduce the priority of tracking the specific details of the actions of a single force and instead vigorously collect a wide range of reports on abnormal environment enironmental events, changes in geological activity, and abnormalities in biological population behavior around the world, no matter how small or bizarre they may seem. We need to piece together a map of the spread of energy disturbances from these fragments. Sure, how add contingency plans to the defense strategy to deal with gradual environmental degradation, such as the impact of long-term infrasound or abnormal magnetic field exposure on personnel and equipment, as well as possible new types of environmental disasters. He concluded, "The Aftershocks are spreading and the old rules of the game may be being rewritten. A cautious resource inensive approach is still effective, but its meaning must be expanded.

We need to not only stockpile resources, train personnel, and crack technologies, but also learn to understand and adapt to this increasingly unpredictable world that is coming alive. This may be the real key to our long-term survival in this island survival game. The aftershocks continue to spread. Having clearly discerned the shape of the first truly significant storm, the Mo Yuan Pavilion ship began adjusting its ballast and rigging, preparing to continue its voyage in even more turbulent and unpredictable sea conditions. Observation and understanding would become its new and most important sales.

Chapter 112. Environmental Network. Lynn Mo's decision to shift the focus to observing the global energy environment system is like adjusting the lookout towers and sonar arrays of the MMO Yuon pavilion ship. The target has a shifted from specific points, relics, forces to abstract yet ubiquitous surfaces, environment, energy fields, ecological disturbances. This requires a higher level of integration capabilities and a broader monitoring perspective.

The internal research began the painful transition. Leewi and Sue Chian temporarily set aside their in-depth investigation of the specific relics such as the Hemlock Island stone slabs and metal fragments and devoted all their energy to building this simplified global environmental disturbance early warning model. This work was more difficult than they had imagined. What they have were fragments of data recorded by the limited observation points of the Muan Pavilion itself before and after several past events. the window event, the dragon soul knocking on the door, plus scattered, vague, and difficult to verify reports of abnormal events from all over the world that she and Duodo could collect.

It's like trying to piece together a mirror that reflects the entire ocean from a few broken pieces of glass. Leeway said to Lyn, Mo with a rice smile. He and Sue Chian first tried to standardize and parameterize the existing data defining dozens of key environmental indicator variables such as infrasound intensity index in a specific frequency band, regional magnetic field disturbance variance, composite index of abnormal ion concentration in water and biological behavior deviation score. Then using some of the logic from the risk assessment model framework they learned from long hun they attempted to establish a correlation network and influence transmission weights among these variables. The initial model was extremely rudimentary with many functional relationships between variables being purely speculative and the input data was sparse and incomplete.

However, even so, when they used data from window events and knocking events as test cases, the model still captured some meaningful patterns. For example, the peak of energy disturbance often occurred slightly later than a main anthropogenic or natural triggering events and its spatial decay was not a simple concentric circle diffusion but rather showed a trend of directional propagation along certain implicit energy conduction paths which may be related to seafloor geological structures major ocean currents or even atmospheric circulation. Furthermore, the occurrence and degree of abnormal biological behavior seem to have some statistical correlation with the product of the variables infrasound intensity in a specific frequency band and variance of magnetic field disturbance. The model is far from predictive, but it is starting to describe and correlate, Sue Chian said, showing the preliminary analysis charts. For example, based on existing data, the energy disturbances of the window event decayed much slower in the southwest than in the east, and more subsequent biological anomalies were detected along the direction of the extended tributaries of the Kroio current.

This may suggest that ocean currents not only carry heat and nutrients, but may also act as a medium for conducting some kind of energy disturbances. Although these preliminary findings are only a rudimentary summary of patterns, they provide a completely new perspective for understanding the propagation of environmental disturbances. Based on this, Leeway proposed that the layout of the existing observation network at Moyuan should be optimized and monitoring points should be added or strengthened at key nodes of the potential energy transfer paths predicted by the models to form a more targeted environmental monitoring network. Lynn Emmo approved the suggestion. Sherhow began organizing a team to secretly deploy simple automated monitoring stations on several selected remote islands or open waters far from the main island but along the model's predicted path using existing speedboats and camouflage buoy equipment.

These stations consumed very little power, relying primarily on solar and wave energy and periodically transmitted data via encrypted low-frequency satellite data links modified using rare communication templates obtained through signin. They were like silent sensory cells scattered across the open ocean by the mo yuan pavilion. While the Mayuin Pavilion was busy weaving this invisible environmental perception network, the aftershocks from the outside world evolved into new and more concrete forms. According to the intelligence compiled by Chien Duo Duo after its initial blockade and silence, Dragon Soul seems to have begun to adopt a strategy of limited transparency. They haven't released any details of the knocking on the door experiment, but through several semiofficial scientific research exchange channels, they have successfively released academic briefings on the correlation between recent geomagnetic activity anomalies in the Arctic Circle and climate change, as well as preliminary reports on observations of biological adaptation in extreme deep sea environments.

These reports are rigorous in content and solid in data, but cleverly avoid any trace of human intervention. attributing all observed anomalies to fluctuations in natural cycles and complex geoysical processes that require further research. They're trying to guide public opinion and provide a scientific and dethreatening explanatory framework for the observed phenomena. Chen Duo analyzed on the one hand they are appeasing internal and external doubts and on the other hand they're laying the groundwork for when they may have to disclose more information later. At the same time, the publicly released data itself has become a relatively reliable external data source that our model can site dot.

The stonemason's brotherhood's response was more pragmatic and efficient. While construction of their remote energy base load, it didn't stop. Instead, they adjusted the functions of some facilities, transforming several large energy storage units into the basic structure of environmental buffer and isolation chambers. Simultaneously, they procured a large quantity of a special composite material with excellent electromagnetic absorption and mechanical damping properties through black market channels. Seemingly eager to enhance the base's ability to withstand fluctuations in the external energy environment.

They're fortifying their nest, Chin Duo Duo judged. This shows that they believe the environmental disturbances will not subside in the near future and may even intensify. They have chosen the safest course of action to ensure the absolute security of their core strongholds. First, the most noteworthy changes came from some previously overlooked small and medium-sized factions and scattered survivor groups. As rumors about anomalies, freakish sea monsters, and unpredictable weather intensified, coupled with confirmation from the Dragon Souls semiofficial report, a pervasive anxiety and desire for change began to spread.

Some small settlements near areas with frequent anomaly reports began spontaneously trying various primitive protective measures such as surrounding islands with metal mesh, attempting to shield against abnormal electromagnetic fields, digging deep trenches around their dwellings and filling them with charcoal, attempting to absorb harmful earth energy, and even holding superstitious sacrificial rituals. More settlements located in relatively calm areas began consciously stockpiling more disaster relief supplies and strengthening information sharing among themselves, forming several small regional mutual aid intelligence networks. Panic and spontaneous responses are spreading at the grassroots level. Such Chian looked at the reports on the grassroots trends collected by Chen Duo Duo and felt complicated. Although it is chaotic and inefficient, it shows that ordinary survivors have a direct perception of changes in the environment.
