Their survival instincts drive them to take action even if the methods are wrong. Amidst this global undercurrent, an unexpected event brought Mo Yuan G's environmental network plan to the forefront. A small caravan with stable but discreet trade relations with the Mo Yuan Pavilion encountered an extremely violent and unpredictable mad dog wave and intense electromagnetic interference while returning to the main route from the Emerald atal in the southeast. The caravan lost one ship and several people were injured. The survivors still shaken sought help at the nearest Mo Yuan Pavilion Trading Post.

According to the captain, the weather was fine and the sea was calm when suddenly waves rose from three different directions without wind, converging into a devastating giant wave. At the same time, all electronic compasses and simple radios malfunctioned instantly, and the ship's metal components crackled and flashed with tiny electrical sparks. Chandu Duo personally handled the rescue and resettlement of the caravan and recorded the details of the incident and its location coordinates. He input the coordinates into the environmental model that was being built and leeway and suanchen immediately retrieved the models calculations of recent environmental indicators for the area based on limited data as well as the records of the most recent observation point at Mayuan Pavilion. The model shows that over the past 7 days the magnetic field disturbance variance and infrasound intensity in a specific frequency band indices in this area have been slowly rising.

Although the absolute values are not high, the trend is clear. Leewwayi pointed to the chart and our newly deployed no three buoy monitoring station which is closest to the incident site recorded a brief but significant peak in abnormal ion concentration in the water and a chaotic micropressure wave disturbance about 2 hours before the incident. These signs are logically related to the multidirectional converging waves and electromagnetic interference characteristics described by the caravan in terms of time sequence and phenomenon type. Did the model alarm? Linmo asked, "According to our initial threshold, there are no issues because none of the individual indicators exceeded the limits." Such Chanchian replied. However, the model cannot currently effectively identify the coordinated anomalies of multiple indicators within a short period of time and a small space.

This event resembles a miniature locally uncontrolled release of environmental energy that did not reach the main transmission path dot. This unexpected incident acted as a catalyst. It proved that the environmental monitoring network being built by Moyuan and the analytical model behind it though rudimentary are on the right track and have already been able to capture subtle signs of real threats. It also highlighted the shortcomings of the current model its weak ability to provide early warnings of multi-indicator anomalies and localized emergencies. Adjust the priority of the model algorithm.

Lynn Mo ordered add identification and weighted alarm logic for multi-indicator spatial co-occurrence and sudden changes in short-term indicators. At the same time, taking this incident as a case, densely deploy monitoring points around the area where the caravan was in distress to form a high sensitivity monitoring network to continuously observe the recovery status and new changes in the area. He looked at everyone. Our net has caught its first fish. Although it's small, it has shown us the loopholes in the net.

We must continue to weave the net and continue to repair it. The world is becoming more sensitive and volatile, and we must become faster than it. This environmental awareness net will become one of our most important survival tools besides resources and military force. The environmental network serves two purposes. To discern the direction of the tides and to hear the faintest ominous hum from the deep sea before the waves truly shatter the deck.

The survival strategies of Mayuan Pavilion are quietly evolving through repeated observation, learning, and adjustments. Chapter 1, 13 footprints on the ice. The unexpected events at Emerald Atal provided the first practical test and valuable data calibration points for the environmental sensing network that Mayuan Pavilion is currently building. The spatiotemporal coupling between the mad dog waves and electromagnetic interference described by the caravan and the weak anomalies in several indicators previously captured by the environmental model. Although not providing an early warning pointed to a clear direction for optimizing the model algorithm, Leewi and Sue Chanchen's research team embarked on a new round of intensive research.

Focusing on the emerald atal incident, they made sweeping improvements to the model's multi-indicator collaborative analysis logic. The new algorithm added modules for regional anomaly energy density gradient calculation and cross medium water earth disturbance propagation delay correlation analysis and significantly lowered the alarm threshold for short-term multi-indicator co-occurrence anomalies. Although this inevitably leads to an increase in the false alarm rate, it is a necessary sacrifice under the current principle of better to report a false alarm than to miss one. Meanwhile, the engineering team under Shure House command accelerated the deployment of a high sensitivity monitoring network in the waters surrounding Emerald atal. In addition to the existing ion concentration, acoustic wave and magnetic field monitoring, highresolution surface wave radar and atmospheric electric field meters were added.

These new devices like more sophisticated tentacles are attempting to capture the precursor signals of the next possible similar local energy runaway. While Moyuang was busy perfecting its own monitoring system, the outside world's perception and response to environmental changes became more diverse and specific. Dragon Souls academic guidance strategy continues. They have released a theoretical model paper on the possible modulation effect of global ocean circulation on the propagation of low-frequency energy disturbances as well as data on experimental observations of the abnormal responses of specific marine microbial populations to heavy metal ion concentrations. These achievements are of a high standard, but they still cleverly avoid any connection to human events, placing everything within the framework of natural science research.

However, careful observers will notice that the spatiotemporal distribution of the observational data cited in the papers highly overlaps with the abnormal reporting areas following the window and knocking events. This is a clever form of information disclosure intended only for insiders. The Stonemason's Brotherhood's fortification project is nearing completion. Chandwood was informants report that the core complex of that remote energy base is now covered with a distinct layer of dark composite material exhibiting a low reflectivity characteristic that can trash sharply with its surroundings in remote sensing images. The tidal and geothermal energy harvesting arrays around the base are also complete and quietly put into trial operation, but the vast amount of energy generated doesn't seem to be being exported on a large scale.

Instead, it primarily supplies the base's interior where several large unidentified enclosed factory structures have been added with no external markings or signs of activity. They are using stable natural energy sources to carry out some kind of internal project that requires high energy consumption and a highly isolated environment. Shin Duo Duo judged. Combined with their previous obsession with tidal energy in geothermal energy and their current eagerness to strengthen their defenses, this project is likely directly related to their pursuit of ancient knowledge or technology reproduction, and they are extremely wary of environmental disturbance and will spare no effort to ensure that is not disturbed. Panic and self-help behaviors at the grassroots level are polarized.

In some isolated islands where information is scarce and superstition prevails, absurd protective rituals are escalating, even leading to small-scale conflicts over so-called talismans for warding off evil. Meanwhile, in other areas with relatively convenient transportation and greater information exchange, disaster prevention guidelines based on simple practical experience are emerging. These include wrapping important electronic devices with multiple layers of tarp pollen and metal foil to protect against sudden electromagnetic pulses and adding layers of lime and charcoal to building foundations to prevent potential dampness and trace amounts of harmful gases. These rudimentary methods reflect the tenacious survival wisdom of ordinary people facing unknown threats. Amidst this chaotic and ongoing evolution, an unexpected yet perfectly logical letter was once again delivered to Lynn Mo through the secret channels of Conch Island.

The letter came from Vera's team, which had been missing for a long time. The letter cut straight to the point without any pleasantries. Vera first briefly mentioned that after the window incident, her team had ventured deep into the Arctic Circle and some high latitude perafrost regions to conduct a series of investigations into the correlation between ancient ice cores and recent environmental disturbances. They drilled ice core samples to depths of over 100 meters in several remote ancient blue ice layers and conducted highresolution physicochemical analyses. We have found imprints in ice layers from several different locations and at different ages, the letter states that are highly similar to the energy signatures of the currently spreading environmental disturbances.

These imprints are manifested in the form of specific isotopic abundance anomalies, disordered sedimentary sequences of trace metal elements, and directional distortions in ice crystal structures. Preliminary judgments suggest that similar environmental disturbance events with specific energy signatures have not occurred for the first time in the long geological history and their cycles are difficult to estimate. But each one has left an indelible mark on the memory of the earth's environment. Ice layers, sedimentary rocks. Vera points out that the current disturbances exhibit significant similarities in their energy signatures to certain ancient imprints recorded in ice cores, especially in the coupling patterns between highfrequency transient components and a low frequency background.

This strongly suggests that the source triggering the current disturbances may share a common or similar physical mechanism with those entities or events that left their mark in ancient times. At the end of the letter, Vera proposed a new collaboration. She was willing to share some anonymized ice core analysis data and energy characteristic comparison maps with Mo Yuan Go. The condition in exchange was that Mo Yuan Go could provide high temporal resolution sequences of multiparameter environmental monitoring data within a specific latitude and longitude grid in recent times especially before and after the Dragon operation to verify their ice core dating model and improve the construction of the current perturbation spatial propagation and attenuation model. We believe that combining historical imprints with present observations is the only way to understand this silent global transformation.

Vera wrote in the letter, knowledge should have no barriers, especially when it comes to the very foundations of survival. The value of this letter is immeasurable. For the first time, it provides precedent evidence for the current environmental disturbance on a macroscopic scale of geological history, elevating it from an isolated event to the level of a possible periodic natural/ unnatural phenomenon. The depth of research and global perspective demonstrated by Vera's team once again made Mo Yuan Goof feel its own limitations and insignificance. No wonder they disappeared for so long in the Arctic Circle, Sue Chanchan exclaimed.

Icecore records are indeed the golden key to revealing long-term environmental changes. If their data is reliable, it means that what we are facing may not be a malfunctioning ancient machine, but a natural or unnatural law of periodic activity. Leeway focused more on the technical details. It's reasonable for them to want our high temporal resolution data. Although our monitoring network has a smaller coverage than their historical samples, it may have an advantage over their drilling at fixed points in the polar regions in terms of temporal continuity and parameter diversity.

It's a perfect compliment. Lynn Mo Ponder for a long time. Vera's proposal was frank and constructive, hitting the core of the problem. Exchanging data would benefit both sides and greatly advance their respective research. However, risks remained.

Providing detailed environmental monitoring data might expose some layout and capability details of the Moyuan Pavilion's monitoring network. We can exchange them, Linmo finally decided, but the data needs to be processed a second time. We need to provide daily or semi-aily average sequences of three specific highly generalized environmental indicators such as regional energy disturbance comprehensive index, biological activity deviation, and geomagnetic stability score within a radius of 1,000 km centered on the ice shard area before and after operation Dragon Soul. We will not provide specific sensor locations, raw waveforms, or any details that could lead to the inference of our monitoring network density. At the same time, we require VAS team to provide corresponding rigorously dated ice core energy characteristic sequence samples as well as their quantitative analysis report on the similarity of the characteristics.

This was a carefully weighed exchange. Mo yuan goo provided macro trend data to meet Vera's verification needs while protecting the core secrets of its own network. In return, obtaining the historical imprint data from the ice core played an irreplaceable role in refining its environmental model and understanding the nature of the disturbance. The letter was replied to according to this principle. Meanwhile, Lynn MMO instructed Shin Duo Duo to use all possible means to investigate more details of various teams activities in the Arctic Circle, especially the specific locations where they drilled ice cores and whether they had contact with other forces such as Dragon Souls Arctic Expedition Team.

He needed a more comprehensive assessment of the true intentions and potential risks of this mysterious scholar partner. Ancient imprints on the ice and a real-time monitoring network at sea are about to be connected via encrypted data streams. Moan pavilion has opened another new window on its path to understanding the world. The scenery outside is even grander and even more profound and unfathomable. And a map in their hands is gradually filling in the interwoven lines of history and the present, transforming it from a foggy blank.

Chapter 114. The data abyss. The data exchange between Muan Pavilion and Vera's team was completed under high encryption and mutual vigilance. Both sides got what they wanted, but also harbored greater doubts about each other's true intentions. Leewi and Sue Chanchen's research team encountered a data explosion.

The eyes core analysis data provided by Vera's team was like a time tunnel connecting current environmental disturbances with similar events in the distant past. Those intricate isotope ratio curves, trace element peaks and valleys, and ice crystal structure parameters after complex mathematical transformations revealed a chilling regularity. Look here. Leeway pointed to two overlapping curves on the screen. One for the energy disturbance index of current monitoring data and the other from an icecore sample from about 8,000 years ago.

Although the time scales are vastly different, the order of the peaks and troughs, the relative intensity ratios, and even some subtle oscillation patterns are more than 70% similar. This can't possibly be a coincidence. Such an however focuses more on comparing data related to ecological impacts. The changes in biogenic silica deposition flux, an indicator of phytolankton productivity and the abundance of certain specific spores and pollen recorded in ice cores show a timephase lag correlation with the marine biological behavior disturbances and primary productivity fluctuations we currently observe. About 1 to 3 months after a disturbance, biogenic silica deposition flux first experiences a brief peak followed by a period of stagnation lasting several years.

This likely means that each such energy disturbance has a profound and lasting impact on global marine ecology and may even alter the climate. These findings elevate the severity of environmental disturbance to a new level. It is not merely a physical problem that could trigger geological disasters or equipment malfunctions, but a long-term threat that could reshape the entire planet's ecology and climate. Just as Mayuan Pavilion was struggling to digest this historical data, their real-time monitoring network detected a new anomaly. Initially, a node in a high sensitivity monitoring network set up around Emerald atal recorded a sound signal lasting about 10 minutes with an extremely low frequency but a highly complex modulation.

This signal sounded like a dreaming almost indistinguishable amidst the background noise of the ocean. However, after being filtered and enhanced by a specific algorithm designed by Leeway, its internal structure revealed a disturbing grammatical sense. It didn't resemble a natural phenomenon, but rather a conscious broadcast. In the following days, multiple monitoring points scattered across different sea areas and along different energy conduction paths successively captured signal fragments with similar characteristics. These signals varied in their occurrence time, duration, and specific frequency, but their core modulation grammar was highly consistent.

Even more disturbingly, the locations of these signals appeared to be moving slowly but clearly from the deep sea towards the shallower continental shelf along the main geological structural zones on the seabed. It asks like something or a group of things is speaking along the trench and mid ocean ridge and is approaching the land. that Sue Chanchian tried to perceive these signals with her sense of rhythm, but only felt a series of cold, chaotic, inorganic noises as if listening to the sleep talk of a huge malfunctioning machine. Chandwa's intelligence network also reported related signs. Several coastal and island settlements reported that in recent nights, strange muffled sounds like many people underwater striking metal could be heard from the sea, sometimes accompanied by a faint glow in the seaater.

Some fishermen claimed that while trwers in deep water, they had pulled up strange shaped objects that looked like machine parts or bones. But these objects were quickly bought up by unidentified people at high prices. The Stonemason's Brotherhood suddenly resumed its activities. No longer confined to fortifying their base, they dispatched several small fast reconnaissance fleets to the waters where unusual signals were frequently reported, seemingly searching urgently for something. Simultaneously, their demand for deep sea salvage technology and high compression resistant materials on the black market increased dramatically.

Dragon Soul also seems to have taken note of these new developments. They have strengthened their monitoring of the country's coastline and important shipping lanes and unusually issued a safety warning to all maritime operators, reminding them to be aware of unidentified underwater sounds and luminous phenomena and advising them to avoid operating in deep sea areas at night without providing further explanation. Inside the command center of Mayuan Pavilion, all the clues and intelligence converged, pointing to a disturbing possibility. Something deep beneath the sea is being awakened or attracted by continuous environmental disturbances and is beginning to approach areas of human activity. We need to know what that is.

Linmo made the decision. Leeway concentrate all computing resources and try to crack the modulation patterns of those signals to see if we can extract any meaningful information. Such Chian compared the ice core data provided by Vera to see if there are any records or indirect evidence of deep sea anomalies in similar periods of disturbance in history. He looked at sure how and Chien Duo Duo strengthen the defense of all our coastal facilities and shipping routes, especially the underwater sections. Send a crack reconnaissance team aboard the Storm Shadow, a specially modified speedboat with excellent stealth and quietness capabilities to the nearest point of anomalous signal outbreak for on-site reconnaissance.

Remember, observe only, do not make contact, and do not expose yourselves. Clear. A new crisis, like an iceberg emerging from the abyss of data, is revealing its menacing corner. The Moan Pavilion is on high alert once more. This time, the threat is no longer confined to distant icy plains or mysterious ruins, but is slowly approaching their homeland from beneath the deep sea.

And their understanding of this threat is virtually zero. The shadow of the storm silently sets sail under the cover of night, heading towards the seas where ominous whispers had recently begun to echo. The ship was equipped with state-of-the-art passive sonar and optical observation equipment, as well as a seasoned reconnaissance squad. They would become the first eyes of the ink abyss pavilion reaching into the dark abyss. Meanwhile, Leewi and Su Chian continued searching through mountains of data for any clues that might reveal the truth.

They both knew that time was running out. Chapter 115. A glimpse into the abyss. Like a true deep sea phantom, the shadow of the storm glides silently across the rippling surface of the moonless night. Its hull is treated with a special coating that absorbs most radar waves and visible light.

And its propeller has been modified for quieter operation, minimizing noise in all electric propulsion mode. Inside the four reconnaissance team members, Captain Shan Hai, Deputy sonar operator Xiao Foam, observer Wuru, and technician Sun Lee each performed their duties with focus concentration. Their target was a recent anomalous signal outburst located approximately 120 nautical miles southeast of the main island in a deep sea basin near the edge of the continental shelf. According to monitoring network data, the distinctive modulation murmur had been detected there three times in the past 48 hours with a signal strength showing an increasing trend. Five nautical miles from the target area, Chunghai whispered into the internal communication channel.

He was an experienced veteran with dark skin and sharp eagle-like eyes. Everyone check your equipment and enter level one silence. Do not speak unless absolutely necessary. Communicate with hand gestures. The last faint indicator lights inside the submarine went out, leaving only the heavily filtered dim green light from the screens in front of each person.

The waveforms on the sonar screens jumped around, displaying the complex terrain and biological echoes below. Xiao Fong, wearing headphones, was completely focused on distinguishing every subtle sound. The shadow of the storm slowly approached the designated coordinates. The sea was unusually calm with only the slightest ripples left by a gentle breeze, but this calm only made the atmosphere inside the vessel more tense. Approach the edge of the target and stop the ship.

Deploy the toad array sonar. Chunghai ordered. A long cableconnected sonar array was slowly lowered into the water, providing more sensitive and longer range passive listening capabilities than shipboard sonar. Time passed in silence. 10 minutes, 20 minutes.

The sonar screen showed nothing but the normal background ocean noise and the occasional school of fish. Could the signal source have moved or is it just intermittent? Suddenly wondered in a low voice. She was responsible for monitoring the environmental sensor data. Sh. Xiao Fong suddenly raised his hand, making a shushing gesture.

He closed his eyes, his brows furrowed as if listening to a very distant sound. In the headphones, besides the rustling of the flowing seawater, there seemed to be another extremely faint rhythmic tapping sound with long intervals, but each tap had a dull texture. Suspected target signal detected. Xiao Fong opened his eyes, speaking rapidly but clearly, bearing 275, distance approximately three nautical miles, depth very deep, over 800 m. Signal characteristics match the monitoring network records with 85% accuracy.

Everyone's spirits lifted. Chennhai immediately ordered, "Maintain absolute silence and record all data. Woo Rua. Activate the low light night vision periscope and observe the sea surface for any accompanying anomalies. Storm shadow floated silently like a real reef.

The toad sonar array continuously received the dull regular tapping from the deep sea. As time passed, the frequency of the tapping seemed to increase extremely slowly, and more complex, brief echoes began to appear, as if there was more than one object being tapped, or that the tapping had triggered some kind of structural resonance. Suddenly, Wua lowered his voice with a slight, almost imperceptible tremor. Captain, at 2:00 in the sea, about 500 meters above sea level, there's a faint light, not phosphoresence, but a cold bluish green light rising up in patches from underwater. Chennhai immediately moved closer to the periscope.

He saw that the sea was boiling. From the unfathomable darkness, clusters of blue, green, fist-sized halos of light were constantly rising. The halos weren't intense, flickering faintly, illuminating a small patch of water around them. At the center of each halo, something small and irregular could be vaguely seen. The halos rose to about 10 meters above the surface and then stopped, no longer rising, simply hovering there, slowly drifting with the current.

Record the images, analyze the spectrum, Chanhai shouted in a low voice. Suddenly operated the equipment rapidly. Spectroscopic analysis reveals non-bioluminescent characteristics. Wavelengths are concentrated in the 480 to 520 nanometer range. Energy source unknown.

Non-thermal radiation. Preliminary morphological identification of the central material suggests irregular metal or mineral fragments. Wake. The surface of these fragments seems to have extremely fine scratches. Just then, Xiao Fangg's voice rang out again, this time with even greater seriousness.

Sonar signal change. The knocking has stopped. A new sound has appeared like friction. A large number of fine friction sounds are coming from the same area and are rising. On the sonar screen, the echoes representing that deep sea area suddenly became dense and chaotic as if something was emerging from the loose sediment on the seabed, stirring up large amounts of mud and debris.

Prepare to evacuate. Chennhai ordered decisively slowly retract the toad array. Prepare power. Head 180. Maintain minimum speed and do not create a noticeable wake.

The shadow of the storm began to slowly move backward as if fading into the shadows. Everyone's hearts were in their throats, their eyes fixed on the sonar screen and the periscope image. The blue green halos began to move, no longer drifting aimlessly, but as if drawn by some force, slowly but surely converging towards the direction where the shadow of the storm had just lingered. At the same time, the fine friction sounds beneath the sea grew louder, accompanied by more churned sediment echoes. Are they tracking where we were just now.

Wurui's voice was dry. Ignore them. Keep evacuating. Be mindful of the depth. They might only be active at certain depths.

Chennhai remained calm. The shadow of the storm gradually moved away from the strange and active sea area. It wasn't until it had receded more than a nautical mile that the abnormal echoes on the sonar, gradually weakened and dissipated. The blue green halos also stopped converging and returned to a state of aimless floating, eventually fading and sinking into the deep sea. After confirming safety, storm shadow slightly increased its speed and quietly returned towards the direction of Mo Yuan Pavilion.

Inside the vessel, no one spoke. Only the soft hum of the equipment and the heavy breathing of everyone present filled the air. What they had just witnessed exceeded all their previous knowledge and imagination. Hours later, the shadow of storms returned safely, bringing back valuable recorded data and highdefinition images. The atmosphere in the underground command center of Myuan Pavilion was even more tense than before.

The images and data brought back by the reconnaissance team were repeatedly played and analyzed. Leewi spoke first, pointing to the enhanced image on the screen of the fragments of the center of the halo. Look at these engravings. Although extremely small and incomplete, their straight lines and specific corner patterns are similar to any ancient symbolic system we know, but not exactly the same. It's more like a mark left by an older, more basic, or perhaps industrialized mass production.

Such an however focused on the blue green cold light. Energy characteristic analysis shows that this light emmitting method is extremely inefficient and is accompanied by trace amounts of specific radioactive isotope decay characteristics. This doesn't seem to be designed for lighting or communication. Rather, it seems to be a byproduct of some kind of energy conversion or matter decay process. Sure, how analyzed from a military perspective.

These things, whatever they are, have shown a certain degree of reactivity. They respond to soundwave stimulation, knocking sounds, and may also be aware of hydrodnamic disturbances. They converge after we move. Moreover, they seem to mainly operate in the deep sea and mid ocean waters. And so far, there has been no indication that they intend to rise to shallow waters or attack ships.

But this does not mean that there is no threat. Chin Duo Duo summarized the latest news from the intelligence network. Similar phenomena have been sporadically reported in the past 24 hours in two other deep sea areas on the edge of the continental shelf to the east and south. The scale is smaller than the one we encountered, but the characteristics are similar. The Stonemason's Brotherhood's reconnaissance ships have also appeared near those areas.

Dragon Soul has not yet made a public response, but we have detected that several of their research ships are undergoing emergency modifications with large-scale deep sea fishing and isolation equipment installed. Lenimo listened silently to all the reports, his gaze shifting between the eerie halo, the strange markings, and the constantly updating intelligence summaries on the screen. Beneath the deep sea, something has indeed been awakened. These things appear to be related to ancient civilizations, marks, accompanied by unusual energy phenomena, cold light, and respond to sound waves of specific frequencies. They are slowly moving and spreading from the deep sea towards the edge of the continental shelf.

This is no longer a mystery of remote ice fields, nor a potential threat to the southwest bay. This is an ongoing, spreading, and unexplained deep sea anomaly. Compare these new findings. is the scratch features the cold light energy spectrum and their acoustic response characteristics with the ice core data provided by Vera Lin Mo instructed leeway and such focus on finding any indirect records of deep sea bioluminescence metal debris deposition or abnormal biological activity during similar periods of disturbance in history. We need to know whether these things have appeared in the past and what impact they had at the time.

Dot. He turned to Sure. How in Shin Duo Duo, we must fully upgrade our maritime early warning system. All vessels, especially those operating in the deep sea or navigating the edge of the continental shelf, must be equipped with improved passive sonar and optical anomaly detection equipment. We must develop emergency avoidance and response procedures for encountering similar phenomena.

At the same time, we must anonymously share the basic characteristics, excluding specific locations and scratch details of these deep sea anomalies that we observe with several reputable regional survivor mutual aid networks through covert channels which will serve as an early warning dot. In addition, Lynn Moaused all non-essential deep sea activities will be suspended. Our environmental awareness network will focus on increasing the monitoring density of water composition, background noise, and biological aggregation behavior in the continental shelf margin area. The abyss has been glimpsed, revealing a cold, eerie, and unknown corner. The Mo Yuan Pavilion must adjust its strategy, shifting from simple land island defense to confronting entirely new challenges that may arise from the deep sea beneath its feet.

This world is becoming increasingly unfamiliar and dangerous at a speed beyond everyone's comprehension. And the test of survival has entered a new and deeper dimension. Chapter 1, 16 fragments of Revelation. The deep sea images and data brought back by shadow of a storm are like another boulder thrown into the pool of knowledge at Mayuan Pavilion. The strangely marked metal fragments, the eerie cold light, and the unknown entities that exhibit reactivity to sound waves and disturbances have completely changed everyone's imagination of the threat of environmental disturbances.

The threat is no longer limited to invisible energy fields and macroscopic climate change. It has taken on a concrete, observable, and possibly even active form. Leeway and Sue Chanchian's workload suddenly increased dramatically. They not only had to continue refining the overall environmental model, but now they also had to focus all their efforts on analyzing these newly emerging deep sea anomalies. The ice core data provided by Vera's team became a crucial control system.

The two led their team day and night in data mining and comparison. We've made a discovery. 3 days later, Leeway is eyes bloodshot reported to Lin Mo, his voice with excitement. We compared records of trace metal element depositional anomalies and specific isotope abundance peaks from over 40 ice core samples from different eras and locations. We found that although the occurrence cycles of these anomalies are long and irregular, their spatial distribution shows a striking statistical correlation with the trends of major seafloor spreading zones, subduction zones, and large seamount chains worldwide.

He pulled up a transparent layer covering a global nautical chart on which known major seafloor geological structures were marked with red lines and the approximate corresponding sea areas of anomalous events in the ice core records were marked with blue dots inferred from isotope atmospheric transport models. The red lines and the groups of blue dots showed a high degree of overlap. This means leeway pointed to the nautical chart that the source events that have caused global environmental disturbances in history are likely to have occurred in these areas of intense seabed geological activity or conversely the geological structure of these areas may be more likely to record or amplify a certain type of energy disturbance. Such an added key finding more notably in those sedimentary anomalous layers. We re-examined the microscopic images of ice core samples attached to the veridata using a high-powered electron microscope and discovered extremely tiny geometric structures with morphologies highly similar to the debris grooves captured by shadow of the storm.

Although blurred due to ice crystal encapsulation and age, the basic characteristics are consistent. This indicates that similar debris or rather material with this specific groove also appeared on a large scale during historical periods of disturbance and was captured by the ice layer with upwelling or atmospheric deposition. This discovery directly links deep sea anomalies to historical global disturbances. The debris is not an isolated newly emerging anomaly, but rather likely a byproduct or leakage accompanying each major disturbance. What are they? Linmo asked the core question.

Leewi took a deep breath. Based on the existing information, we propose a preliminary highly speculative hypothesis. These fragments may not be natural minerals, nor are they complete ancient artifacts. They are more like metabolic waste or structural fragments produced during the operation, maintenance, or disintegration of some large complex system. Those markings may be a kind of product batch identification, functional code, or discard mark.

and the faint cold light and radioactivity they carry may be a manifestation of the slow decay of some unstable energy structure inside them. As for their reactivity, Sue Shian continued, "It may stem from the extremely weak energy field or information structure remaining within them, which can resonate or trigger extremely inefficiently with external sound waves or energy disturbances of a specific frequency. Just like a piece of iron filings with weak magnetism will be attracted when it gets close to a magnet. They gather at the location where the shadow of the storm has been. Possibly not because they're tracking us, but because they are attracted by the extremely weak noise or disturbances of specific frequency leaked from a hole or sonar array during operation.

If this hypothesis holds true, it means that beneath the deep sea, there may be one or more unimaginably large ancient industrial systems or energy processing systems. They're still partially operational or periodically activated. These debris fragments are simply debris inadvertently discharged or shed from the system. The current environmental disturbances are as if this system has once again entered a period of activity or a period of failure, causing more debris and energy byproducts to be released. The impact of this hypothesis is far greater and more unsettling than any previous speculation about a single ancient site.

It points not to a few scattered ancient ruins, but to an unimaginable network of ancient infrastructure spanning the global seabed, deeply intertwined with Earth's geological activity. Just as internal research was making groundbreaking progress, the external situation was also escalating. The Stonemason's Brotherhood reacted most swiftly and aggressively to the deep sea anomalies. Their reconnaissance fleet began frequently patrolling the major mid ocean ridges and trenches of the oceans, employing large deep sea trolls and robotic arms in an attempt to salvage the luminous debris and potentially larger wreckage. Intelligence indicated they had successfully captured some samples and urgently transported them back to their fortified energy base.

Simultaneously, their demand for high-grade radiation shielding materials and unknown substance analysis technology skyrocketed on the black market with prices reaching astonishing levels. Dragon Soul, on the other hand, appeared more cautious and systematic. After completing the refit of their research fleet, they did not engage in large-scale salvage operations like the Stonemason's Brotherhood. Instead, they began deploying a long-term multi-node seabed observation network in several selected continental shelf edges. This network integrates various sensors, including acoustic, optical, chemical, and geomagnetic sensors, seemingly aiming to monitor the long-term occurrence patterns, migration paths, and correlations with changes in environmental parameters of these deep sea anomalies.

Simultaneously, Dragon Soul released a scientific explanation regarding the recent observations of spontaneous luminescence and enhanced underwater geological activity in some sea areas through official channels. Again, attributing the phenomenon to complex seabed physicochemical processes and urging all parties to conduct research with a scientific attitude and avoid panic and irrational behavior. The panic at the grassroots level, fueled by both the scientific guidance from the dragon soul and an increasing number of eyewitness reports presents a contradictory mix. On the one hand, official explanations offer some reassurance. On the other hand, those who personally experience the events or listen to detailed eyewitness accounts feel a deeper unease.

In some islands and coastal settlements near the areas reporting deep sea anomalies, spontaneously organized nighttime patrols and the erection of makeshift underwater obstacles have become commonplace. Vera's team fell silent again after the data exchange. However, she and Duo Duo, utilizing top level infiltration resources, finally uncovered a clue. Core members of Vera's team, it seemed, had secretly visited Dragon Souls Advanced Research Facility in Northern Port after the shadow of a storm reconnaissance incident. Their stay was brief and the meeting was highly classified.

Subsequently, Dragon Souls Deep Sea Observation Network deployment plan accelerated significantly and some technical details appear to incorporate designs unconventional for Dragon Souls traditional style. They're sharing technology or at least coordinating at the high level. Chien du duo judged. They share the same goal to figure out what s really down there in the deep sea. Just as all eyes were on the deep sea, the Muan Pavilion's monitoring network detected a subtle but important change.

The persistent weak and stable background noise in the southwest Misty Bay direction experienced three brief but significant attenuations in the past 48 hours, each lasting about half an hour before returning to normal. Simultaneously, sensors deployed further away, targeting macroscopic disturbances in the energy field recorded three extremely weak energy release pulses originating from the southwest direction corresponding to the same time frames. That construct seems to be performing a very long cycle, very low power pulse type selfch check or energy discharge. Leeway analyzed the data each time it discharges its own stable field background noise will temporarily weaken. Could this be a way for it to maintain a low power sleep state? Or is it trying to achieve some kind of very low-level synchronization or tuning with the changing energy background of the outside world? This discovery suggests that the creatures in the southwestern bay, though seemingly dormant, are not dead and are still interacting with this changing world in an extremely slow manner in ways imperceptible to humans.

All the clues historical imprints and ice cores, active debris in the deep sea, faint pulsations in the bay, and intensified investigations from all sides point to the same profound and dark truth. Beneath the waters of this world lie ancient relics far beyond human imagination which are being disturbed by continuous environmental disturbances and are gradually emerging from their millions of years of slumber revealing their vague and eerie outlines. Mo Yuan Pavilion was like an observer standing on the edge of a dark forest having just shown a flashlight on the first strange glowing leaf while the entire forest remained hidden in boundless darkness and mist. Linimo knew they had to be even more cautious, but they also had to continue deeper because this forest might very well be the very land beneath their feet upon which they depended for survival. Ignorance of it was the greatest danger.

The revelation brought by the fragments had only lifted a tiny corner of the veil of truth. Chapter 117, the data chain. Leewi and Sue Chanchian's bold conjecture that deep sea debris is a metabolic product of ancient systems was like a depth charge dropped into the cognitive landscape of Mo Yuan Go. This conjecture connected scattered clues environmental disturbances, ice core imprints, active debris, and even the faint pulsations in the southwest B to a faintly discernable logical chain. Although many links in this chain remain weak and full of assumptions, it provides an unprecedented holistic framework for thinking, the focus of the work naturally shifted to verifying and enriching this framework.

Leeway divided the research team into two directions. One group continued to delve deeper into the ice core data provided by Vera, attempting to reverse engineer more quantitative information about the composition, release amount, and release cycle of metabolic products in relation to geological activities from those ancient environmental imprints. The other group focused on tackling the debris sample data, mainly highresolution images and spectral analysis brought back by storm shadow, trying to decipher the possible information encoding rules from those strange markings. The analysis of the scuts has been exceptionally difficult. The scuts are extremely small and most have been blurred and incomplete due to seawater erosion and the passage of time.

Leeway tried all known methods of symbol comparison and even applied some of the geometric grammar summarized from his research on hemlock island slabs but still could not form a meaningful interpretation. The combination of the scuts seems random yet it subtly reveals a cold sense of order. Maybe weary going in the wrong direction. dot. Sue Chian, who had been staying up all night, rubbed her temples and suggested a new idea.

These marks might not be words or symbols, not used to express abstract concepts. Could they be a kind of physical identifier like the assembly line number, material code, or tolerance mark on modern industrial parts? Their significance lies not in being read, but in being identified by specific inspection equipment or processing systems through touch, magnetic field, or some kind of energy resonance. This idea suddenly dawned on leeway. That's right. If these fragments are indeed discarded parts or processing waste from some large system, then the markings on them are more likely machine readable codes used for sorting, recycling, or quality traceability.

We're trying to understand them like we're interpreting text just like trying to see a barcode with our eyes, we can only see a bunch of black and white stripes. Only by using a laser scanner to read it can we get the numerical information underneath. This shift in understanding is crucial. It means that to truly understand these fragments moan may need a completely different reading technology perhaps involving specific energy frequencies, scanning angles or field effects precisely what they currently lack. But this at least explains why the Stonemason brothers were so eager to salvage these fragments.

Chin Duodo pointed out at the analysis meeting they may have possessed or thought they possessed some of the reading technology. They wanted to deduce from these discarded parts the technical standards, material formulas, and even the operating logic of that ancient production line. This seems to be less risky than exploring a complete, possibly self-defensible relic, but the potential gains are equally enormous. Just as the research at Mayuan Pavilion was fluctuating between confusion and breakthroughs, the flow of information about deep sea anomalies in the outside world began to show more obvious stratification and competition. Preliminary data from Dragon Souls deep sea observation network appears to be selectively leaking to certain friendly research institutions and large survivor alliances.

This data has been carefully cleaned, removing all sensitive information that might point to humaninduced or non-natural intelligence and primarily presents highly specialized marine geological and physicochemical reports such as enhanced submarine turbidity current activity, abnormal composition of local hydrothermal vent materials, and statistical analysis of the optical properties of deep sea suspended particulate matter. Dragon Soul is attempting to consolidate its dominant discourse on environmental anomalies through this limited sharing of authoritative scientific data, guiding all parties along the path of natural scientific research, it has set. However, the Stonemason's Brotherhood's actions were constantly tearing away this scientific veil. They weren't just salvaging debris. According to the latest intelligence, one of their elite deep sea operations teams had apparently successfully captured an irregularly shaped metal plate roughly the size of a tabletop on a seammount slope.

When the debris was brought to the surface, an eyewitness, a hired oceangoing cargo ship captain who happened to see it from a great distance through binoculars, described it as flashing with unstable dark blue arcs of electricity, the surrounding seawater boiling violently and emitting a strong ozone odor. The debris was quickly transferred into a speciallyesed, sealed container filled with pipes and cooling devices and transported away at high speed by the Stonemason's Brotherhood's speciallymade speedboat. Although the news did not spread widely, it caused a stir within the small circles of top powers. A piece of wreckage capable of spontaneously releasing energy and of considerable size is far more valuable than tiny fragments. It may contain a more complete structure, clearer markings, and may even retain some internal components or energy circuits.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood has really caught a big fish this time. Chien Duod Duo said solemnly, "This remnant may give them a temporary lead in the race to decipher ancient technology, but fortune and misfortune are intertwined, and possessing a treasure can be a crime. Other forces will not sit idly by, especially dragon soul." Sure enough, less than 48 hours after the wreckage was salvaged, a rapid reaction fleet deployed by Dragon Soul in the relevant sea area began a high-profile combat readiness patrol exercise. The exercise area intentionally or unintentionally covered several routes that the Stonemason's Brotherhood might take from the salvage point to their base. This was an undisguised show of force and pressure.

The information ecosystem at the grassroots level is even more chaotic. In addition to the increasing number of eyewitness reports and panic responses, some scattered folk experience summaries about interpreting deep sea lights or using unusual signs to predict the weather have begun to emerge. These summaries vary in quality. Some are based on superficial observations and coincidences while others are clearly mixed with superstition and conjecture. However, they reflect the tenacious efforts of ordinary survivors who unable to access highle information and technology are trying to understand and adapt to change in their own way.

Just as information from various sources was intertwined and undercurrents were intensifying, the internal network of Mayuan Pavilion detected an extremely faint but seemingly clearly directional abnormal signal. The signal did not originate from the deep sea, nor from environmental disturbance data, but rather from a low-frequency backup communication channel that they had previously used during data exchanges with Vera's team and which had since been abandoned. The signal was extremely brief, a complexely encrypted digital pulse train, but using the same encryption method as the one previously used by Vera's team. The pulse train was automatically captured and tagged by Mo Yuan G's communication monitoring system. Is it Vera's team? Why are they using an abandoned channel? And the signal is so weak.

It's like they're unsure if we're still listening or the transmission conditions are extremely poor. Chi and Duo Duo reported to Lynn Mo immediately. Can it be cracked? Lynn Mo asked. I'm familiar with the encryption method and I'm trying out. It will take time.

The signal content should be very short. Chin Duo Duo replied. Hours later, the initial deciphering results came back. The message was still only one sentence with obvious garbled text due to data loss. Wreckage critical interface fragment reading requires resonance.

Be wary of actively searching for coordinates. Data loss. The information was fragmented yet its meaning was astonishing. Vera's team clearly knew about the Stonemason's Brotherhood salvage of the large piece of wreckage, the key to the wreckage. Referring to it as the interface fragment and noting that reading it requires resonance.

This confirmed Leewayi and Sue Chian's conjecture that the engraving required a specific method to read it. More importantly, they issued a warning to be wary of active searching. What does this active searching refer to? Is it the Stonemason's Brotherhood's actions or something else? And where does the last lost coordinate point? They re-risking their lives to send us a message. Sue Chanchian analyzed using abandoned channels and brief vague information suggests that their situation might be unsafe or that their communications are being monitored. Could vigilant and proactive search mean that their attempt to read that piece of debris might like the dragon soles knocking on the door experiment accidentally trigger something or attract some kind of searcher? This speculation is chilling.

If reading an unclaimed interface fragment can be risky, then what kind of entity is the complete system hidden beneath the deep sea that can produce these fragments? Vera's shattered warning, like another fine thread, was woven into the web of knowledge about this world that Mo Yuan Pavilion was striving to build. This web was still full of loopholes and shrouded in mist. But with each new clue added, the vast and ancient outline hidden beneath the surface became more real and more onspiring. The chain of data is gradually linking the past and present. The deep sea and the icy plains, the power struggles between various factions and the shattered warnings of the enigmatic scholar.

Mo Yuan Pavilion knows they stand at the starting point of an increasingly clear yet increasingly dangerous path of cognition. Whether what lies ahead is deeper darkness or the glimmer of dawn, no one knows. All they can do is firmly grasp these fragile chains of data and conjecture and continue cautiously peering into that unknown abyss. Chapter 118. The danger of resonance.

The broken warning from Vera's team via the abandoned channel was like several sharp icicles stuck in the minds of the Mo Yuan Pavilion's decision makers. Interface fragments. Reading requires resonance. Beware of active searching. Each word carried a weight and chill far beyond its literal meaning.

This warning came abruptly and secretly, indicating that Vera's team was either in danger or had foreseen some imminent peril, and that this danger might be directly related to the large wreckage that the Stonemason's Brotherhood had just acquired. Lynmo did not immediately take radical action. He ordered Chien Duo Duo to use all backup and unconventional monitoring methods to closely monitor all electromagnetic and acoustic signals around the Stonemason's Brotherhood's energy base, especially any possible abnormal energy fluctuations. At the same time, he instructed Leewi and Sue Chanchian's research team to simulate and deduce with the highest priority the various physical reactions and energy coupling scenarios that might be triggered by resonant reading of a large metal remnant carrying an unknown energy structure. The key is resonance.

Leeway spread out his draft at the emergency meeting. Vera specifically emphasized this word. This means that reading is not a simple physical scan or chemical analysis, but rather stimulating some kind of inherent frequency or energy structure that may remain inside the debris, making it respond, thereby exposing its internal information or structural features. This is essentially the same kind of technology as Dragon Soul, using the key crystal to establish a low power link with the ice shard system. only the object has changed from a huge potentially defensive complete system to a relatively static seemingly harmless fragment.

Suchian frowned, but Vera warned of being wary of active searching. If it's just reading a fragment, why would there be such a warning? Unless this resonance reading is not just asking about the fragment itself, its energy signal might be heard by some unknown entity that is either of the same origin as or hostile to the fragment or worse. Although the fragment itself is incomplete, there may still be an extremely unstable critical self-destruction or calling mechanism inside and the external resonance attempt might become the trigger to detonate or activate it. This conjecture seemed to lower the temperature in the conference room by several degrees. Sure, how said in a deep voice.

In other words, what the Stonemason's Brotherhood is holding in their hands may not be a gold brick, but a bomb whose fuse is unknown. Their attempt to read it is like defusing a bomb and doing so with almost no understanding of its structure. We must assume the worst case scenario. Lynmo finally set the tone. Leeway, your simulation should focus on three risk scenarios.

The overflow of resonance energy, the triggering of unstable structures within the fragments, and the activation of possible signal broadcasts, and estimate their impact range. Chen Duo Duo Focus Intelligence monitoring on whether there are any abnormal personnel evacuations, energy fluctuations or signs of a surge in encrypted communications at the Stonemason's Brotherhood base. Sure. How have all our peripheral monitoring points, especially those facing the Stonemason's Brotherhood base? Put them on high alert, ready to record any possible spillover energy or signal characteristics stuck. For the next 2 days, Emo Yuan Pavilion maintained a high level of alert, outwardly relaxed, but inwardly tense.

On the surface, the island operated as usual with training, production, and research continuing. But within the core circle, everyone was on edge. The area surrounding the Stonemason's Brotherhood's energy base remained eerily calm. However, analysis of thermal and lowlight images transmitted from high altitude reconnaissance balloons revealed a significant increase in heat activity in several large enclosed buildings within the base in recent days, exhibiting irregular pulse characteristics clearly inconsistent with the base's stable tidal and geothermal energy input rhythm. Simultaneously, Chindwa's wideband antenna deployed at a considerable distance detected extremely weak but persistent electromagnetic background noise emanating from the base's direction with subtly fluctuating frequencies.

This strongly resembled leakage from a large number of sophisticated electronic devices operating at full capacity during complex frequency adjustments that were difficult to completely shield. They have definitely started trying to read it, Chin Duo asserted. And they're progressing quickly with the power and complexity of the equipment continuously increasing. Just as my UN pavilion was closely monitoring the movements of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, their global environmental monitoring network detected new and more widespread abnormal disturbances. This is not a violent eruption at a single point, but rather a slow but widespread background uplift.

Much like the eb and flow of tides, multiple monitoring points scattered across different oceans and depths have recorded a synchronous gradual increase in abnormal ion concentration indices and infrasound intensity at specific frequencies over the past 48 hours. The increase is not significant, but the trend is clear and the coverage has begun to spread from the edges of active geological zones to a wider basin area. It's like a large net being gently rippled and the ripples are spreading throughout the entire system. Such Chanchan looked at the monitoring data summary chart with deep concern. This global gradual synchronous rise is more unsettling than the previous localized violent outbreaks.

It indicates that the impact of the disturbance source is deepening or in other words the sensitivity or responsiveness of the entire marine environmental system to such disturbances is generally increasing. Leeway attempted to compare this new phenomenon with long cycle records in the Vera icecore data. Some very old ice records show that during the incubation period before major disturbance events, there are sometimes similar baseline drifts of environmental parameters that last for tens to hundreds of years. This may be a warm-up sign before the entire system, whether natural or unnatural, enters an active long cycle. This discovery places the current series of events from the window to the knocking on the door and then to the emergence of deep sea debris and the spread of environmental disturbances within a larger and more pressing time scale.

They may not be dealing with just a few isolated incidents, but rather standing at the starting point of a long active cycle. Against this backdrop of global undercurrents, the storm in the direction of the Stonemason's Brotherhood base finally saw its first flash of lightning. Laid on the third night, a secret acoustic monitoring buoy set up by Moyuan Pavilion in the southwest direction about 200 nautical miles from the Stonemason's Brotherhood base captured an extremely brief but extremely strong broadband energy pulse. The pulse lasted for less than 100th of a second, but its instantaneous energy peak exceeded the maximum value ever recorded by the buoy, directly triggering the equipment's overload protection. Almost simultaneously, several magnetic field and atmospheric electric field monitoring points facing that direction also recorded corresponding strong instantaneous disturbances.

Further away, the main island monitoring array of Mayuan Pavilion even captured an extremely weak echo from the deep sea, but with frequency characteristics highly correlated with that pulse, as if part of the pulse's energy had penetrated the seawater and straighta and been reflected back by something hidden somewhere deep inside. Something's happened. She duo duo rushed into the command center, his face pale. The source of the pulse has been pinpointed to the core area of the stonemason's brotherhood base. The energy signature contains a large number of frequency components related to highfrequency transient buffers, but it's completely out of control, releasing explosively.

Leeway quickly retrieved the detailed spectrum of the pulse for analysis, his fingers trembling slightly. This this is very similar to the scenario in our simulations where resonance energy generates positive feedback with the unstable structure inside the fragment leading to a local energy avalanche release. They may have triggered the fragments self-destruction or overload protection mechanism. Moreover, the pulse contains strong unm modulated carrier signals, which is like some kind of raw data or status code stored inside the fragment being violently erupted. Almost exactly a few minutes after Emmo Yuinga detected the pulse, several encrypted communication signals requesting emergency assistance and reporting distress broke through the silence at extremely high power, shooting in several different directions from the direction of the Stonemason's Brotherhood base.

The content of the signals was chaotic, but the core message was clear. A serious experimental accident had occurred inside the base, causing energy runaway and structural damage. requesting emergency technical support and medical assistance. Vera's warning proved prophetic. The active search brought disaster.

Monitor all spilled energy and signals. Record every detail. Lynmo's voice was calm, but his eyes were sharp as knives. Activate level one silence. Suspend all external communications.

Sure. How? Strengthen the island's defenses, especially against potential energy shock waves or electromagnetic pulses. She and Duo Duo closely monitor the responses of all parties to the Stonemason's Brotherhood's distress signal, especially Dragon Soul. The Stonemason's Brotherhood's resonance experiment ended in a violent and potentially costly accident. What unpredictable changes will this accident and the runaway energy and potential data fragments it broadcast to the world bring to an already turbulent situation? The Mo Yuan Pavilion is like a ship standing before a tsunami just beginning.

The first wave's roar has already reached them. While an even larger wall of water is slowly rising in the distant darkness, the danger of resonance is already evident. The real storm may have only just begun to brew. Chapter 119, Aftermath Assessment. The brief but intense energy pulse that erupted from the Stonemason's Brotherhood base was like a blinding flash of lightning in the night.

Though fleeting, it instantly illuminated many things hidden in the shadows and cast a long shadow in everyone's hearts. Following the incident, Mayuin Pavilion maintained a 12-hour state of maximum silence and alert. All observation equipment operated at full power, recording the recovery process of various environmental parameters such as energy, magnetic field, and acoustics after the pulse, as well as whether there would be any subsequent secondary outbreaks or abnormal spread. The direct physical impact of the pulse itself did not cause significant damage to the main island of Mayuan Pavilion, which is more than 200 nautical miles away. It only caused brief fluctuations in the readings of some sensitive electronic devices.

However, the complex energy characteristics contained in the pulse and the unknown information fragments that may be erupted with it are what truly require vigilance. Leewi and Sue Chanchians team worked through the night to analyze the captured pulse data. Spectral analysis confirmed Leewayi's initial assessment. The pulse energy was concentrated in several narrow frequency bands related to the highfrequency transient buffer function, but exhibited complete chaos and overload characteristics, indicating that its source likely the interphase fragment had experienced a catastrophic collapse of some stable structure under the stimulation of resonance. More noteworthy was that in the tail of the pulse, they indeed separated several extremely weak but structurally seemingly regular data stream segments that appeared to have undergone high-intensity compression.

These data stream fragments are severely damaged and cannot be directly interpreted. But their encoding structure is different from any communication protocol or storage format we know and has obvious discontinuous characteristics that leeway pointed to the distorted waveform on the screen. It asks like a book that has been blown to pieces and the few pieces we picked up only have a few missing strokes on the radicals. To understand them, we may need to know what writing or even language this book uses. Dot.

Such an focused on assessing the impact of the pulse on the environment. The instantaneous electromagnetic disturbance and infrasound impact caused by the pulse resulted in brief but significant water disturbances and biological stress responses in the surrounding waters. Our monitoring network shows that after the pulse within a 50 nautical mile radius of the incident site, the biological activity deviation index at multiple monitoring points showed brief spikes. Some deep sea fish rose to the surface and large schools of small fish in shallow waters fled in panic. However, these effects are rapidly subsiding and no signs of long-term ecological damage have been observed so far.

Meanwhile, Chanduwa's intelligence network, like a spiderweb shaken by the events, was capturing the ripples of reactions from all sides to the incident. Dragon Souls response was the fastest and most official. Less than 2 hours after the Stonemason's Brotherhood sent out their distress signal, a humanitarian relief and accident investigation flotillaa composed of a hospital ship, engineering rescue vessels, and escort ships departed port in a high-profile manner heading directly towards the Stonemason's Brotherhood's energy base. Dragon Souls official statement was carefully worded, emphasizing a responsible attitude based on jointly addressing natural disasters and technological risks and international obligations to maintain maritime security and stability and stated that it would conduct necessary personnel rescue, technical assessment, and environmental monitoring in the accident area. It sounds grand, but they acted swiftly.

They not only wanted to be at the scene of the accident as soon as possible to assess the damage and obtain firsthand data, but also wanted to take this opportunity to observe closely and even enter the core base of the Stonemason's Brotherhood. Chin duo duo analyzed. The Stonemason's Brotherhood is currently suffering in silence. With their base damaged and personnel injured, it would be unreasonable for them to refuse Dragon Souls rescue. So, they have no choice but to open a gate.

This may be the opportunity that Dragon Soul has been waiting for. The reactions of other major powers were more nuanced. Several organizations that had potential rivals to the Stonemason's Brotherhood or had long coveted their technology began to gather their ships and reconnaissance forces around the accident area, but remained on the edge of international waters, observing without daring to approach Rashley. Clearly, they all wanted a share of the spoils, but were wary of the dragon soul's powerful intervention and the potential dangers lingering from the accident itself. Rumors about a massive energy explosion in the Devil's Sea and the triggering of an ancient curse have resurfaced among the survivors, triggering a new wave of panic buying of supplies and flight path avoidance.

Some trade routes that were originally closed to the Stonemason's Brotherhood base have been temporarily disrupted. After issuing that warning of the breakage, Vera's team disappeared completely again. It was as if their only mission was to issue an alert and then they vanished back into the mist. After combining internal data analysis and external intelligence, Lynn Mo convened a core meeting. The Stonemason's Brotherhood's adventure ended in a disastrous failure.

Lynn Mo concluded, "This proves that Vera's warning was accurate. Active search and resonance reading contain enormous risks that we do not yet fully understand. That interface fragment may be more complex and dangerous than we imagined. It is not a simple information storage disc, but maybe an organ fragment that still has a weak connection with a vast system and possesses some kind of activity or defense mechanism. He paused, then looked at Leeway and Sue Chian.

Your research direction needs further adjustment. Temporarily put aside attempts to decipher the information content of the fragments themselves that may exceed our current capabilities and security boundaries. Shift your focus to the following. First, how to identify and provide early warning of similar ancient artifacts that may have active or unstable structures. Second, assess models of the environmental and ecological chain reactions that such artifact out of control events may trigger, especially long-term chronic effects.

Third, based on this pulse data, try to reverse engineer its possible resonance triggering mechanism, not to imitate it, but to understand its dangerous principles and establish a more comprehensive threat signature database. Understood. Leeway and Sue Chanchia nodded solemnly. This incident made them realize that ignorance and recklessness are equally deadly when facing these ancient creations. Chando Duo Lin Mo turned to the intelligence chief.

Strengthen intelligence gathering on the details of the Dragon Soul Rescue Teams activities at the accident site, especially their interactions with the Stonemason's Brotherhood and any information that may be obtained regarding debris or the cause of the accident. At the same time, closely monitor the subsequent movements of other observing forces and assess whether a new alliance or confrontation pattern has formed as a result. Sure. How? Lyno finally turned to the defense chief. Based on the parameters of this energy pulse event, update our defense plan.

The focus should be on strengthening our protection against highintensity short duration electromagnetic pulses and infrasound shocks, especially the protection of critical electronic equipment and underground bunkers. At the same time, organize an emergency drill based on the scenario of encountering a sudden unknown energy disaster. After the meeting, everyone went their separate ways. The Mo Yuan Pavilion, this sea fortress, did not panic after experiencing a distant shock. Instead, like an experienced chess player, having clearly seen the consequences of an opponent's risky move, it calmly began to adjust its own strategy, fortify its position, and consider its next move.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood's resonance danger is a reality, and its aftershocks are spreading across political, technological, and psychological levels. This event undoubtedly serves as a wake-up call to all forces harboring ambitions for ancient relics. However, it may also give rise to new changes. Dragon Soul might use this opportunity to infiltrate the Stonemason's Brotherhood and acquire its technological accumulation. Other forces might accelerate their own research and development of alternative technologies.

And will those beings hidden deep beneath the sea react further to this seemingly imminent explosion? The aftershocks have yet to subside, and new variables have already been injected into this increasingly complex game. Moan Pavilion needs greater patience and keener insight to capture every subtle signal that could potentially determine the future course of events amidst the turmoil. The game of survival is entering a new phase that places greater emphasis on risk identification, long-term assessment, and strategic resolve. They must ensure that when the next resonance occurs, regardless of its origin, Emo Yuan Pavilion has sufficient buffer and room to maneuver. Chapter 1 20 dark room agreement.

The lingering smoke and energy disturbances above the Stonemason's Brotherhood's energy base had not yet completely dissipated when Dragon Souls humanitarian relief and accident investigation team had already like a precise scalpel cut into this area that had just suffered trauma. Three white ships painted with the dragon soul insignia and a prominent medical cross were mored at the less damaged dock on the outskirts of the base. Personnel in uniform and with efficient manners quickly disembarked carrying a large amount of medical equipment, engineering assessment instruments, and sophisticated scanning devices disguised as environmental monitoring equipment. Moan pavilion continuously observed the rescue operation using highaltitude balloons and long range passive listening devices. The footage showed that the dragon soul personnel demonstrated a high degree of professionalism and discipline.

The medical team guided or rather monitored by members of the Stonemason's Brotherhood entered the clearly damaged central area building to treat the wounded and assess the damage. The engineering team began safety checks on the damaged energy harvesting arrays and building structures outside the base and the sizable and best equipped technical assessment and environmental monitoring team politely but firmly requested access to the core enclosed factory area where the accident occurred. The Stonemason's Brotherhood was clearly hesitant, but they eventually gave in doshian Doduo looked at the blurry images transmitted back. There were severe burn and distortion marks at the factory entrance. The Dragon Soul members wore the highest level of protective clothing and breathing equipment before entering.

The situation inside is probably not optimistic, though. Over the next 2 days, Dragon Souls rescue team worked with an efficiency bordering on ruthlessness. The wounded were transferred to the medical ship in batches and equipment fragments suspected of containing radiation or energy contamination were carefully sealed, labeled, and transported away. Environmental monitoring data was collected and analyzed in real time. Closed door meetings between the Dragon Soul and the Stonemason's Brotherhood leadership were frequently held in the only relatively intact command building within the base.

Each meeting was conducted with doors and windows tightly closed and communication jamming measures strictly enforced. Although the intelligence network of Mayuan Pavilion could not penetrate these secret talks, it captured some key information from other sources. First, there was the flow of supplies. Dragon Soul supply ships delivered far more special supplies to the base than were needed for medical and engineering repairs. large quantities of rare metals and semiconductor materials for repairing precision electronic components.

Several mobile laboratory modules that were clearly for highle biochemical isolation and hazardous substance analysis and even several core components of tightly wrapped oddly shaped devices that appeared to be large energy stabilization or confinement devices. They re helping the stonemason's brotherhood repair its core facilities and the most technically demanding part at that she duo duo analyzed this is definitely not just simple humanitarian aid it has deep technological involvement what s the cost secondly there's the issue of personnel movement several core technical staff members of the stonemasons brotherhood who survived the accident but were reportedly seriously injured did not return or transfer to public medical facilities after initial treatment. unlike other injured personnel after being taken away by the Dragon Soul medical ship. Instead, they simply disappeared. Meanwhile, within Dragon Souls technical assessment team, several members possessed a distinctly different demeanor from engineers or scientists.

They acted discreetly but with sharp eyes, frequently engaging in formal contact with the Stonemason's Brotherhood's middle-level management, intelligence exchange, or even subversion and recruitment. Sure. How judge from a military perspective, Dragon Soul is using this opportunity not only to acquire technology, but also to dig out the other side as talent and internal information. Dot. Just as the outside world was closely watching the rescue show between Dragon Soul and the Stonemason Brotherhood, the internal research of Mo Yuan Pavilion made an unexpected but important discovery after adjusting its direction.

While reviewing all reports of abnormal marine life and corresponding environmental monitoring data since the window incident, Sue Chanchian discovered a previously overlooked detail in the areas where marine frenzy event occurred several hours to a day before the outbreak.
