The concentration of a specific rare earth element ion in the water showed a brief but clear peak. This rare earth element is not a common pollutant. It is sparssely distributed in nature and its abnormal enrichment is usually related to specific geological activities or industrial emissions. We examined all possible natural sources of disturbance such as nearby hydrothermal vents, river input, and even atmospheric deposition, but none of them could explain this short-term localized spike, Sue Chian said, pointing to the data charts until Leewi suggested, could it be related to those debris? They immediately retrieved the spectral data of the debris brought back by Shadow of the Storm and the residue analysis of the Stonemason's Brotherhood accident pulse.

Indirectly extracted from fragments of the publicly available environmental monitoring report from Dragon Soul. The comparison revealed that both the tiny debris and the large piece of wreckage contained this specific rare earth element in their material composition and in an abnormal proportion. This element may be a crucial component of some key energy conversion or structural material in those ancient creations libe dusa when they are active damaged or collapse as in the stonemason's brotherhood experiment. Trace amounts of this element are released into the surrounding environment and it may have an extremely strong yet still unknown effect on the nervous system or circadian rhythms of certain marine organisms. This discovery directly links deep sea anomalies with biological frenzy, providing a crucial intermediate variable for understanding the ecological impacts of environmental disturbances.

It means that monitoring changes in the concentration of this specific rare earth element could become a new indicator for early warning of the activity level or accident risk of deep sea anomalies. Just as Mo Yuan Pavilion was thrilled by this discovery and began to incorporate it into the environmental early warning model, Chin Duodo delivered some major intelligence about the results of the secret talks between Dragon Soul and the Stonemason Brotherhood. The intelligence didn't come from direct wiretapping, but rather from a seasoned informant embedded in a logistic supply system within Dragon Soul. This information was pieced together from fragmented conversations among lowranking members outside the Stonemason's Brotherhood's base gathered over drinks. While the details were vague, the core information was shocking.

Dragon Soul and the Stonemason's Brotherhood reached several secret agreements. In exchange for Dragon Soul providing comprehensive rescue, technical repair support, and security guarantees, the Stonemason's Brotherhood agreed to first grant Dragon Soul access to some of its non-core research archives regarding ancient energy pattern classification and basic theory of resonance reading technology. Second, allow Dragon Soul experts to participate to a limited extent in the follow-up analysis of the accident debris, including the large fragment that caused the accident, and share some safe and controllable analysis data. Third, in the near future, its maritime activities, especially those involving the exploration of ancient remains, will be informed to Dragon Soul in advance and subject to safety advice, which is essentially equivalent to accepting a certain kind of technical supervision and action reporting from Dragon Soul. Fourth, tacitly allow Dragon Soul to recruit some core technical personnel who were injured in the accident or who felt confused about the future of the organization.

Dragon Soul promised to help the Stonemason's Brotherhood repair its core facilities, provide a certain level of resources and technical support to maintain its operation, and within reasonable limits, provide protection for its base from other opportunistic forces, a treaty of surrender. After listening to the report, Linmo said slowly, "In order to survive and preserve their last bit of research capital, the Stonemason's Brotherhood was forced to open its doors to Dragon Soul and relinquish some of its autonomy. Dragon Soul in turn achieved deep penetration and technological harvesting of its long-term competitor without bloodshed, acting as a rescuer, and also incorporated a potential source of technological risk into its regulatory system. A win-win situation, but Dragon Soul wins more. Chin Duo commented, "The Stonemason's Brotherhood will probably find it difficult to act independently as before.

They may become Dragon Souls peripheral laboratory or risk probe in the field of ancient technology research." "What does this mean for us?" Such Chanchin asked. "This signifies a major shift in the world of ancient technological exploration." Leewi pondered. The independent and mysterious Stonemason's Brotherhood has been weakened and absorbed, greatly strengthening Dragon Souls orthodox research capabilities, resulting in a higher concentration of resources and technology. Any other forces attempting to enter this field will face a more powerful, organized, and dangerous opponent. Simultaneously, by controlling the Stonemason's Brotherhood, Dragon Soul may also have gained more firstirhand information about deep sea anomalies, interface fragments, and related risks.

Lynn Mo walked to the nautical chart, his gaze sweeping over the markers representing Dragon Soul, the Stonemason's Brotherhood, and the Misty Bay of the Southwest. The dark chamber agreement has been reached, and a new balance is forming. Dragon Souls strength and influence are growing and their desire for control over the overall situation will also increase. We need to reassess our strategy for technical exchanges with Dragon Soul. We must not interrupt this valuable information channel, but we must also be wary of being drawn into an overly tight cooperation framework and losing our autonomy.

He paused, then continued. At the same time, the upheaval in the Stonemason's Brotherhood may spur other factions, especially those who also have ambitions for ancient technology, but lack the connections to take more aggressive or covert actions. The remnants of the Wings of Liberty in the southwest, Varys team in the east, and even shadowy forces we haven't yet detected may all adjust their strategies. As a result, the situation may enter a new normal that appears calm on the surface, but is actually more turbulent underneath. In the shadows, the agreement was signed.

The line between light and shadow seemed to blur. Rescue and annexation, cooperation and control, lay separated by a mere inch. As both an observer and participant in this grand game, Mo Yuan Pavilion had to more clearly discern the true intentions and leverage of each player, navigating the increasingly intricate network of interests to find a narrow path that would both acquire knowledge and preserve itself. The storm may have temporarily subsided, but beneath the surface, new undercurrents were quietly forming, even before the ink on the agreement was dry. Chapter 1, 21.

Deep Sea Glimmer. The secret agreement between Dragon Soul and the Stonemason's Brotherhood acted as a powerful catalyst, rapidly altering the technological exploration landscape of the surrounding waters. The once independent and mysterious Stonemason's Brotherhood, now under Dragon Souls assistance and supervision, had its activities become relatively predictable, yet also exhibited a more unsettling degree of coordination. The Mo Yuan Pavilion's monitoring network detected a significant change in the energy output pattern of the Stonemason's Brotherhood's energy base. After initial repairs, the previously relatively stable and self-sufficient tidal and geothermal energy harvesting arrays are now intermittently transmitting highdensity energy packets to a northern research hub controlled by Dragon Soul.

This transmission is not continuous, but occurs every few days, lasting several hours each time, during which the electromagnetic shielding around the base is noticeably enhanced. Are they transmitting processed energy or are they smuggling data through the energy flow? Chin Duo Duo analyzed the monitoring data. Dragon Soul may have set up a blackbox facility there to process and analyze the technical data and samples obtained from the Stonemason's Brotherhood. This regular energy transmission can both maintain the operation of the facility and may also be a highly encrypted method of data transmission. Meanwhile, Dragon Souls own deep sea exploration operations after integrating some of the Stonemason's Brotherhood's technology became more systematic and daring.

Several mixed research teams led by Dragon Soul and accompanied by Stonemason's Brotherhood technical advisers began conducting detailed grid-like surveys of several previously marked areas with frequent deep sea anomaly activity. They use a new type of composite sonar array with precisely adjustable power and frequency, emitting more complex sound signals than before, seemingly containing multiple preset interrogation modes. They're trying to have a more complex and secure dialogue with those debris. Leeway analyzed the characteristics of the intercepted sonar signals. Based on the lessons learned from the Stonemason's Brotherhood incident, their current signal design has clearly incorporated more security, redundancy, and interruption mechanisms.

This is not a crude resonance excitation, but more like a cautious attempt at multiband authentication. These exploration efforts have yielded some initial results. According to remote monitoring by the Mo Yuan Pavilion and scientific research findings intentionally leaked by some dragon souls, new patterns have begun to emerge in the aggregation behavior of deep sea luminescent debris in the key exploration areas. They are no longer simply drifting randomly or responding to a single stimulus, but rather under the stimulation of specific frequency soundwave sequences. They briefly form simple repetitive geometric patterns such as rings, spirals, and even rudimentary fractal structures.

These patterns last for an extremely short time, typically only a few seconds to a dozen seconds before dissipating and the debris returns to its disordered state. These patterns, Dante, seem to have formed naturally. Sue Chanchian looked at the blurry images captured by the highsensitivity deep sea camera. Although simple, their symmetry and repetition strongly suggest the existence of some kind of program or rule behind them. These debris, even if they're just metabolic waste or structural fragments, may have a more complex information structure than we imagined and may be able to exhibit low-level self-organizing behavior under specific external stimuli.

Dot. More notably, whenever this brief pattern forms, the concentration of specific rare earth element ions in that area, as recorded by the Moyuang monitoring network, exhibits a synchronous subtle peak. This further confirms the close connection between these rare earth elements and ancient creation activities. They're like a kind of tracer Leeway summarized and also a byproduct of some kind of energy metabolism. Monitoring their concentration changes and spatial distribution may help us infer those deeper system activities that we cannot see.

Dot inside the Mo Yuan pavilion. Based on these new discoveries, the environmental early warning model is undergoing another significant upgrade. The newly added modules, self-organizing behavior recognition of deep sea anomalies and spatial concentration gradient analysis of specific rare earth elements, have begun multi-dimensional correlation analysis with existing indicators such as energy disturbances and biological anomalies. The model's complexity is increasing exponentially and the demand for computing resources is also growing. Leeway has had to request more higherformance computing core units obtained through daily login rewards to support the model's operation.

Just as Moyuan was focused on technical observation and model building, an old friend in the southwest once again attracted attention in an unexpected way. After a long period of stillness and occasional faint pulsations, a dramatic change occurred in the direction of Misty Bay on a windless dawn. The first to detect the anomaly was a high altitude monitoring balloon deployed by Moyuan Pavilion 150 nautical miles from a bay. Its highresolution optical sensor captured the thick cotton-like fog that had shrouded the bay for months, beginning to churn and thin at a visible rate. As if an invisible hand was stirring it, a hole began to appear in the fog from its center and rapidly expanded outwards.

As the thick fog dissipated, the outline of the massive silent fortress deep in the bay was revealed more clearly than ever before in the morning light. It was a complex complex of buildings made of metal, rock, and unknown composite materials filled with sharp geometric lines and huge pipes. The towering cylindrical structure at the center still stood, but its surface seemed to have many new ancillary structures and external supports, making it look more intricate than when shadow of the storm scouted it. However, this clear view lasted for less than an hour. Just as all the monitoring points of myuan pavilion were recording with all their might, a point of intense white light suddenly appeared on the top of the cylindrical structure in the center of the fortress without any warning.

The white light was not continuous, but flashed three times an extremely high frequency. Each flash accompanied by an energy pulse of low intensity, but with extremely unique frequency characteristics. After the pulse, the already spread fog seemed to be rewound and began to gather and thicken again at a faster speed. In just over 10 minutes, it tightly enveloped the entire bay again, restoring its former impenetrability. The whole process was brief and eerie, as if the sleeping behemoth had only briefly opened its eyes, scanned the world around it, and then closed the curtain again.

What did those three flashes and pulses mean? Sure, how stared at the pulse waveform recorded by the sensor. It doesn't look like an attack, nor like the weak pulses that maintained dormcancy before. It's more like a signal flare or a state change notification. Chin Duo Duo quickly mobilized the intelligence network. Several small merchant fleets and fishing boats in the surrounding waters witnessed the dissipation of a dense fog and the flashes of light causing a small-cale commotion and speculation.

Dragon Soul has not made any public comment, but we have detected that one of their rapid response fleets adjusted its patrol route to the southwest after the incident, but did not approach the bay. Leewi and Sue Chian carefully analyzed the energy characteristics of the three pulses. The frequency components are very concentrated mainly falling within the characteristic frequency bands we previously identified that are related to energy buffer and safety node. But the modulation method is very special like a kind of counting or state coding. Such Chian tried to perceive the rhythmic residue left by the pulses.

It feels very mechanical and certain without emotional fluctuations just like a machine announcing self- test complete status code triple X. The remnants of the wings of Liberty after undergoing unknown internal changes suddenly sent out a clear but ambiguous signal. What does this signify? Is internal debugging complete? Is a new operation imminent? Or is it some kind of reaction to a series of external changes such as the agreement between Dragon Soul and the Stonemason's Brotherhood and the upgrade of Deep Sea Exploration? Lynn Mo synthesized all the information and paced around the command room. The faint glowing patterns of the deep sea, the brief opening of the bay's eyes, the accelerated integration of the dragon's soul and its technological probing this world was becoming increasingly active. Various hidden systems seem to be responding in different ways to the continuous environmental disturbances and humanity's increasingly in-depth exploration.

Maintain the highest level of observation, but do not take any action that could be interpreted as a response. Lynn Mo finally ordered. Whether it's the deep sea glow or the Gulf signal, silence is the best shield until we truly understand its meaning and intention. Continue to improve our early warning model. Meanwhile, Chi and Duo Duo, I need to know the true reaction and assessment of Dragon Souls top management regarding this Gulf incident at any cost.

He gazed southwestward at the sea, now shrouded in thick fog once more, his eyes deep and unfathomable. What was brewing beneath that mist? And what ancient secrets did those shimmering fragments in the deep sea whisper? Mo Yuan Pavilion stood like an observer before countless slowly opening doors. each door emitting different sounds and revealing different glimmers of light. He had to maintain absolute calm and patience, discerning which were the sounds of the wind, footsteps, and the very breath of the abyss itself. A glimmer of light in the deep sea, a fleeting glimpse through the mist.

These are but the tip of the iceberg quietly revealing the awakening world. And beneath that iceberg lies hope or a greater calamity. The answer may lie hidden in each subsequent careful observation and common analysis. Never before has the survival strategy of AMO Yuan Pavilion relied so heavily on a keen ear to the silence and a profound understanding of even the faintest glimmers of light. Chapter 1 22 New Guests arrive.

The name coral society was like a pebble thrown into a deep pool creating considerable ripples within the intelligence assessment system of the Mo Yuan pavilion. Shen Duo Duo mobilized all available resources attempting to sketch out the outline of this suddenly emerging organization in a short period of time. However, the feedback was surprisingly scarce. This organization appears to be extremely lowprofile, or rather, its core area of activity and membership exceeds the coverage of the Mo Yuan Pavilion's existing intelligence network. The few vague clues available suggest they may have originated in the more remote southeastern region, a complex sea area known as the labyrinth of Thousand Islands, a place dotted with islands and treacherous waterways.

Historically, a preferred hiding place for various small factions and hermits. The Coral Society rarely participates in mainstream trade or power struggles, but occasionally their agents can be seen at highly exclusive secret auctions and academic exchanges involving ancient documents or rare materials, acquiring specific items with astonishing financial resources and expert insight, only to disappear swiftly after the transaction. They re like a group of ghost fish in the deep sea, only occasionally catching a glimpse of us when they surface to breathe. She and Duo Duo reported to Len Mo, her tone tinged with helplessness. They have no fixed stronghold markers, no publicly available member list, and their style of operation is even more secretive than the Stonemason's Brotherhood.

They came to us on their own initiative and with a gift that we couldn't te refuse, so their intentions must be quite significant. Then Mo pondered at this sensitive moment when the Dragon Soul and the Stonemason's Brotherhood had reached a new balance. When an unknown signal was emanating from a southwest bay, and when the faint light in the deep sea concealed hidden secrets, the sudden visit of such a mysterious organization could not be a coincidence. The intact artifact components and ancient energy harmonic stabilization technology in their possession, whether genuine or not, directly address the core bottleneck of the Mo Yuan pavilion's current research. Arrange a meeting.

Linmo finally decided the location will be our outermost seven trade outpost where the terrain is complex making it easy to monitor and evacuate. The other side can only send one ship with no more than five people. Chin duo duo you will personally receive them while Show will lead a team to provide support from the outside to ensure safety. Leeway sue Chian and I will observe from the rear. Understood.

Chin Duo Duo and Shirha replied simultaneously. The seven trading outpost is located in a secluded fjord about 80 nautical miles southwest of the main island. The surrounding area is riddled with reefs and only one manmarked secret waterway is accessible. Several simple but sturdy wooden peers and houses have been built in the fjord which are usually used for trading with small caravans with clean backgrounds and also serve as an intelligence relay station. The meeting was scheduled for noon 2 days later.

The weather was fine that day with excellent visibility. The Coral Society's vessel arrived as promised. It was a medium-sized two-masted sailing ship, long and sleek, meticulously maintained, painted an inconspicuous gray blue without any flags or markings. It glided silently into the fjord along the marked waterway like a ghost, and mured steadily beside the outermost pier. for people disembarked from the ship.

The leader was a man who appeared to be in his 40s with a refined and calm demeanor. He wore a set of dark gray cotton linen clothes suitable for movement and a pair of glasses with crystal lenses. He introduced himself as Mu, the external liaison director of the Coral Society. Behind him were three men. One was burly and had a steady gaze, seemingly a bodyguard.

The other two carried two boxes of different sizes covered in special leather and appear to be technicians. Chandu Duo was already waiting under the awning by the pier and greeted him with the usual warm smile of a businessman. After exchanging a few pleasantries, the atmosphere seemed harmonious, but both sides were on high alert. Manager Chin, it's a pleasure to meet you. I've long admired the achievements of Mayu Pavilion in environmental monitoring and the analysis of ancient symbols.

I've taken the liberty of visiting you today in the hope of establishing an exchange relationship based on shared interests and pragmatic considerations. Mus voice was calm and his pace was unhurried. Director Zhao, you're too kind. Our Moyuan Pavilion is just a small, humble establishment doing business to make a living and occasionally showing an interest in old objects. We've long admired your esteemed association.

Chin Duo Duo chuckled, her words perfectly tactful. Mu smiled slightly, seemingly unconcerned by Chiandu's platitudes and cut straight to the point. To show our sincerity, we have brought a small gift with us, which may be of some help to your current research. He gestured for the technician behind him carrying a smaller box to come forward and carefully open the box on the wooden table in the pavilion. The box was lined with black velvet, and in the center lay an object.

It was an irregularly shaped dark silver metal component, roughly the size of two fists. Its surface covered with intricate grooves and protrusions as well as numerous tiny holes arranged in a complex array. On several cross-sections of the component, one could see layers of thin sheet-like structures as thin as cicada wings and connecting lines as fine as hair. Most strikingly, at the center of the component was a deep blue crystal the size of a fingernail with a polyhedral structure. Inside the crystal, a faint nebula-like mist seemed to be slowly rotating.

This is a surviving core unit of an ancient resonator array, Mu explained. Although it is only a small part of the complete array, and its energy is nearly depleted, its internal structure is basically intact, especially the tuning crystal and the surrounding waveguide patterns, which are quite well preserved. We believe it will be very helpful for your understanding of the generation and control principles of ancient energy harmonics. Leewi, who had been observing from behind using hidden cameras and audio equipment, almost stopped breathing the moment he saw the component. The characteristics of the crystal, the style of the waveguide pattern and the hemlock island slabs, metal scraps, and even the dragon soul key crystal were all intricately connected yet far more refined and complete.

This was a genuine ancient artifact component that transcended the category of waste. Such Chian also stared intently at the screen, trying to sense it, but only felt an extremely restrained, almost dormant sense of order, like a sophisticated musical instrument that was only temporarily silent. Chandu Duo showed a suitable expression of surprise and interest. Oh my, this is truly a rare item. Director Zhao's gift is far too generous.

Zhao Mu waved his hand. The gift is just a stepping stone. What we really hope to cooperate on is something else. He asked another technician to open the larger box. Inside were no physical items, only a thick bound file and several special chips for storing data.

This is part of the basic theoretical and algorithmic framework of our environmental energy harmonic dynamic stability model that we have summarized after years of long-term observation of multiple deep sea energy anomaly areas that mu tone became serious. We have noticed that your side seems to be building a similar early warning model. Our model may complement yours in some aspects. For example, how to identify and filter out interference signals caused by passive scattering of inactive debris. how to more accurately track the active transport path of specific rare earth elements and how to preliminarily determine whether the core of a deep sea energy anomaly area is a dormant ruin or a low power operating facility.

These words directly hit the weakest and most pressing areas of Moan G's current model. The other party clearly has a deep understanding of Mo Yuan G's research direction and progress. Chindwood's smile faded slightly and she became cautious. Director Zhao seems to know a lot about our work. It's just some reasonable speculation based on publicly available information and our attention to similar researchers.

Zhao Mu frankly stated, "The association's mission is to seek lost order in the glimmer of the deep sea. We believe that facing this ancient world that is awakening, any solo effort is dangerous. Knowledge needs to be shared and risks need to be shared. We provide technology and samples in exchange for your high temporal resolution data on the correlation between environmental energy fields and biological behavior obtained from long-term monitoring in specific areas such as the area around the Misty Bay in southwest China. The combination of our data may allow us to make earlier and more accurate predictions about the state changes of certain sensitive nodes.

He proposed clear terms for the exchange. In exchange for core ancient components and advanced environmental analysis models, he would acquire Muan Pavilion's exclusive monitoring data in the southwest bay area. Linmo listened quietly from the command vehicle in the back. The other side's objective was clear, the offer tempting, and it pointed directly to the most critical and ambiguous area of the current situation, the Southwest Bay. This coral society had an extraordinary interest in what was happening in the bay.

This matter is of great importance and cannot be decided by me alone. Chin Duo Duo responded according to the pre-arranged plan. We will study and evaluate director Zhao's proposal and gift in detail. Please rest on the ship for a while. We need some time to discuss this internally.

Dot. That's only right that Zhao nodded politely, then returned to the sailboat with his entourage and waited patiently. Inside the pavilion, Chi and Duadu carefully closed the two boxes and quickly took them back to the rear. Leewi and Sue Chanchian immediately conducted a preliminary but detailed examination of the components and documents. The component is real.

The ingenuity of its internal structure far surpasses any sample weave obtained before. Although the crystal has weak energy, its physical structure and possible optical properties are revolutionary for our understanding of the key and resonance. The model's data framework is very advanced. We've never thought of many of the algorithmic approaches, but they're logically consistent and some of the reference data matches what we have. Such Chanchian quickly browsed through the documents.

If the framework they provided is genuine, our model's performance can be improved by at least an order of magnitude. The temptation is immense, but the risks are equally clear. Providing detailed monitoring data for the southwest bay could expose the capabilities and deployment preferences of the Mo Yuan go monitoring network and might even indirectly reveal their understanding of the structures within the bay. Moreover, what is the true purpose of this coral society? Is it merely for research or does it intend to use the Mo Yuan G's data to take some kind of action against the bay? Their target is likely something in the Gulf. Lynn Mo said in internal communications, "They're trading our muchneeded technology and samples for the intelligence key to the target area.

It's a deal, but behind it, they're flexing their muscles and testing our bottom line and needs." He quickly weighed the pros and cons. The value of the components and model framework was tangible and it could greatly accelerate the technological accumulation of Mayuan Pavilion. Although the data from the Southwest Bay was sensitive, it could be carefully processed to remove core secrets and provide a research data set that have been timeshifted and parameter blurred. Agree to their terms, Lynn, Emo decided, but the data exchange must be done in phases. We will first provide the first part of processed historical data on the correlation between macroscopic fluctuations in the energy field around the Gulf and regional biological migration patterns in exchange for detailed 3D scan data of the first half of their model framework and its components.

Subsequent exchanges will be discussed based on the results of the first phase of cooperation and the level of trust between the two parties. At the same time, all exchange data must be encrypted and completed through disposable media to cut off any possibility of backtracking. This is a cautious, gradual exploration of cooperation. It aims to acquire muchneeded resources while controlling risks and retaining the option to terminate the cooperation at any time. Chin Duodo met with Mu again with a revised cooperation plan.

Mu seemed unsurprised by the proposal for a phased exchange and readily agreed to the first phase. The two parties quickly signed a simplified agreement written in complex encrypted language and completed the first exchange of data and sample scan data. After completing the handover, the Coral Society sailboat did not linger and quickly sailed away from the fjord, disappearing into the distant sea. Mo Yuan Pavilion acquired valuable physical samples and a theoretical framework, but also welcomed a new, more mysterious and purposeful partner. Meanwhile, beneath the thick fog of the Southwest Bay, this distant data transaction seemed to have inadvertently attracted even more attention.

In a glimmer of the deep sea, a new player quietly made his move, and the old game was undergoing unpredictable changes. Chapter 1. 23 new interpretations of ancient artifacts. The dark silver metal component left behind by the coral society along with a thick stack of technical documents were like two pieces of high purity fuel thrown into the research furnace of the ink abyss pavilion quickly igniting fiery and brilliant sparks of thought. After strict security isolation and multiple tests, the component was carefully transferred to Leeway and Sue Chanchian's main laboratory.

The components were placed in a speciallyesed inert gas chamber equipped with various scanning and micromanipulation devices. Leeway almost pressed his face against the observation window, his eyes gleaming with fascination. Look at the direction of these wavegu patterns. They're not planer, they're three-dimensional. They intersect and couple between layers at different depths, forming a three-dimensional resonant cavity structure we've never imagined before.

In this tuning crystal, he pointed to the deep blue polyhedrin slowly rotating with nebulous light. Its facet angles and the rotation axis of its internal halo seem to have a strict geometric correspondence with specific nodes of the surrounding patterns. This is definitely not decoration. It's the core of energy focusing and frequency control for the entire resonant unit. Such an tried to approach the component with her unique sense of rhythm.

She closed her eyes, her fingers hovering over the control box, her brows slightly furrowed. It's very quiet, but not dead still. Like a deep well, the water is calm, but you can feel the slow, unreachable undercurrens deep below. The patterns don't feel like pipes to me, but more like strings or tuning forks waiting to be plucked by fingers at a specific frequency. And that crystal is the tuning hammer and also the resonator.

The two quickly divided the tasks. Leeway led the team utilizing all available non-destructive testing methods, high precision X-ray, computed tomography, micro area laser spectroscopy, and superconducting quantum interference magnetometers to collect comprehensive data on the component. The goal was to construct a complete three-dimensional digital model and analyze its material composition and possible residual energy field characteristics. Such Chian led another group to study the framework materials of the environmental energy harmonic dynamic stability model provided by the coral society. The Coral Society's model framework ingenious and advanced beyond Mo Yuan G's expectations did not attempt to explain all phenomena with a single theory.

Instead, it constructed a multi-layered scalable explanation prediction system. The foundational layer consists of a vast database of environmental parameters and feature extraction algorithms. The intermediate layer comprises multiple parallel computational models based on different physical assumptions such as geoysical resonance, biogeeochemical cycle coupling and unknown energy field interference. And the top layer is a complex model selection and weighted fusion mechanism that dynamically adjusts the confidence weights of different underlying models based on the characteristics of real-time input data providing a comprehensive risk assessment and trend prediction. The most impressive aspect of this framework lies in its learning and adapting capabilities.

Sue Chian reported at the analysis meeting, "It has a built-in feedback loop that can use the deviation between the predicted results and the actual observations to back optimize the feature extraction algorithm and model way allocation. Although we only have the framework and lack the core historical data they might use for training, its design philosophy itself is extremely inspiring. In particular, their proposed living transport path tracking algorithm and facility dormcancy assessment index provide us with a completely new tool and perspective for understanding deep sea rare earth element anomalies and judging the state of relics. Just as Leewi and Sue Chian were immersed in the excitement brought by the new technology, Shindwood's intelligence network continued to transmit back every little thing happening in the outside world. The cooperation between Dragon Soul and the Stonemason's Brotherhood seems to have entered a relatively stable honeymoon period.

The Stonemason's Brotherhood's energybased repair work is basically complete. And with Dragon Souls technical support, its energy output efficiency and stability have even improved compared to before the accident. In return, the Stonemason's Brotherhood has granted Dragon Soul access to some non-core research files and tacitly allowed Dragon Souls expert team advisers to be permanently stationed at the base participating in some peripheral data analysis projects. However, according to fragmented information from inside sources, the large interface fragment remnant that caused the accident, as well as the Stonemason's Brotherhood's most core resonance reading technologies, remain tightly guarded in a separate isolated area deep within the base, untouchable by Dragon Souls experts to this day. Dragon Soul is very patient.

They are waiting and slowly infiltrating, Chien Duo judged. The Stonemason's Brotherhood, on the other hand, is trying its best to maintain a technical firewall under the guise of cooperation. How long this delicate balance can last depends on Dragon's soleless appetite and how many Trump cards the Stonemason's Brotherhood still has died. After that brief signal, the Misty Bay in the southwest returned to absolute silence. The thick fog remained as still as a wall.

The monitoring points set up by my UN pavilion in the surrounding area, aside from continuously recording the faint but stable background noise and the occasional breathing pulsations synchronized with global energy background fluctuations made no further discoveries. However, a retrospective analysis of historical data based on the facility dormcancy index within the coral society's model framework showed that the dormcy of the structures within the bay had been slowly but steadily declining over the past few months, gradually sliding from initial deep dormcancy towards the edge of shallow standby. It hasn't he woke up, but it seems to be getting easier to wake up, Sue Chian said, pointing to the analysis charts with a worried tone. In a wider area of the ocean, the microluminescent patterns phenomenon, which are briefly formed by deep sea anomalies, has become increasingly frequent, and the patterns have become slightly more complex under the continuous inquiry of the Dragon Soul Hybrid scientific expedition team. Meanwhile, the Moy Yuan Pavilion's monitoring network confirmed that the abnormal concentration fluctuations of specific rare earth element ions are highly spatiotemporally correlated with the occurrence of these pattern events and that their concentration peaks and distribution ranges show a slow expanding trend.

All of this points to one conclusion. The system beneath the deep sea is becoming more active and its responses to external stimuli are becoming more rich. 7 days later, Leewayi's team completed a preliminary analysis report on the components of the Coral Society. The results were encouraging, but also brought more mysteries. The component is made of a highly composite crystal metal ceramic layered structure, and its manufacturing process is completely beyond the comprehension of modern metallurgy.

The three-dimensional model shows that its internal three-dimensional waveguide patterns form an extremely complex resonant network with fractal characteristics. Preliminary analysis suggests that the tuning crystal may be a synthetic mineral with special nonlinear optical properties and pisoelectric effects capable of efficiently converting mechanical vibrations sound waves of specific frequencies into electromagnetic waves of specific wavelengths and vice versa. This is a sophisticated soundlight electricity conversion and control hub. Leeway summarized. It is likely a single pixel or channel in a larger array.

Based on the inverse deduction of the texture structure and crystal parameters, its most sensitive input frequency has a disturbing overlap with several key dangerous frequencies that we previously recorded in the window event and a dragon soul knocking event. This means that the ancient resonator core unit provided by the coral society is likely designed to handle or generate dangerous frequencies that could trigger violent reactions in ancient systems. It is both a key to understanding ancient energy technology and a potentially dangerous instrument if improperly played. Do they give this to us because they thought we wouldn't understand it or because they believe we wouldn't do anything reckless? Such an asked a pointed question. Lynn Mo carefully reviewed all the analysis reports and intelligence summaries.

The Coral Society's gift was of immense value, but the information it contained was equally profound. They demonstrated unfathomable technological reserves and a precise grasp of the Mo Yuan Pavilion's needs. Their target was clearly the Southwest Bay, and the tools they provided could both help the Mo Yuan Pavilion better observe the world and potentially inadvertently open Pandora's box. continue to delve deeper into the components and model framework, but all experimental simulations involving dangerous frequencies must be conducted in a completely offline closed simulation environment. Any form of physical energy injection testing is strictly prohibited.

Lynn Mo issued strict instructions. At the same time, prepare for the second phase of data exchange with the coral society. This time we could provide a portion of the interim analysis report on the correlation between energy field disturbances in the periphery of the bay and fluctuations in the population size of specific marine species in the region as well as our preliminary assessment charts of the dormant trend of the bay structure based on their model framework. He paused for a moment, then added, "In the exchange data, we appropriately include some discoveries that we have preliminarily verified, but are not core findings, such as the sensitivity threshold of certain type of plankton to abnormal rare earth element concentrations. This demonstrates our value and also tests their reaction to this type of ecological association information.

Ancient artifacts, though old, hold new principles. models, though simple, convey profound meanings. While acquiring knowledge, the Mo Yuan Pavilion must proceed cautiously, carefully assessing the true value and potential risks of each exchange. This deal with the Coral Society is like exchanging fire with a stranger in a dark forest that could illuminate the path ahead or could set them ablaze. They must ensure that the torches they hold are used only to light the way ahead, not to ignite the entire forest.

Chapter 124. the foundation of sky. The ancient resonator core unit provided by the coral society is like a delicate key. Although it cannot directly open any specific door, it allows the researchers of Mayuan Pavilion to glimpse a corner of the intricate gears within the grand system behind the door. Leeway's team is working day and night to analyze the 3D scanning data and material testing reports, attempting to reverse engineer the design logic and possible application scenarios of this soundlight electricity conversion hub.

What is most puzzling is its energy efficiency, Leeway said, pointing to a set of simulation results with a furoughed brow. Based on the material properties and structural model, this component under ideal conditions has an absurdly high energy conversion efficiency for a specific frequency band almost reaching the theoretical limit. Moreover, the energy loss is mainly in the form of weak photon radiation of specific wavelengths and extremely regular thermal vibrations. This means that the system it belongs to controls energy with an almost artistic precision and is by no means the crude brute force we imagined. After a thorough study of the coral society's model framework, Sue Chanchian proposed a new integration approach.

If we consider this resonator unit as a basic note, then the coral society's model framework is like teaching us how to identify melody and harmony. The core of their framework regarding environmental harmonic stability is actually about identifying and utilizing the inherent relatively stable energy fluctuations in the environment background sounds to calibrate and amplify the abnormal signals we want to monitor. This is logically consistent with the resonator units ability to efficiently identify and convert specific frequency inputs. She proposed combining the coral society's algorithmic framework with the energy pattern function mapping already developed by the Mo Yuan Pavilion based on hemlock island slate symbols and dragon soul taxonomy data to create a brand new ancient energy device function and environmental interaction simulation platform. While this platform cannot manufacture any physical objects in a short term, it can simulate the possible behavior patterns of different ancient artifact components under specific environmental energy backgrounds in a virtual environment, thereby more safely assessing their potential functions and risks.

Lynn Mo approved this bold interdisciplinary research plan. It would require a large amount of computing resources and the integration of knowledge from different research groups. But if successful, Emoi Yuan G's understanding of ancient technology would move from blind men touching an elephant to a new stage of system modeling. While the internal research was progressing with difficulty, the second phase of data exchange with the Coral Society proceeded as scheduled. This time their requests were more specific.

They wanted complete time frequency analysis data on all low-frequency magnetic field directional pulsations events monitored by Moyuan Pavilion within a 50 nautical mile radius of the southwest Misty Bay over the past 6 months as well as detailed parameters and verification methods for Moyuan Pavilion's assessment model of the bay structure dormcy level. In exchange, the Coral Society provided the core algorithm module of their model framework for predicting the critical point of dormant activated state transition in large composite energy structures as well as historical data of environmental baseline energy spectrum supposedly reconstructed from the remains of a sunken ancient coastal observation station. The latter is of extremely high reference value for calibrating the monitoring equipment at Muan Pavilion and eliminating regional background interference. What they wanted was very specialized directly targeting the core of the vital signs monitoring of that thing in the Gulf. Chi and Duo Duo analyzed after the exchange.

Moreover, they seemed very interested in our assessment model itself and wanted to understand our diagnostic approach. This didn't t seem like a simple academic exchange. It was more like preparation for some kind of targeted intervention or contact. Lynn Mo agreed with this assessment. The Coral Society's focus on the Southwest Bay was unusually persistent and in-depth.

The data and models provided by Mo Yuan Pavilion would likely become key to their risk assessment and formulation of the next steps. This was a mutually beneficial transaction, but its ultimate outcome might point to an action that Moan Pavilion was currently unable to control or participate in. strengthen the security of our own monitoring network around the Gulf and upgrade the encryption level of all data transmission links, Lynn Mo instructed. At the same time, use the environmental baseline energy spectrum provided by the Coral Society to recalibrate all our monitoring equipment and improve the reliability and comparability of the data. We must ensure that the data we send out is valuable.

But we must also sharpen our own eyes even more. Beneath the seemingly calm surface, new variables are brewing in the external world regarding Dragon Soul. After initially digesting the technological insights gained from the Stonemason's Brotherhood, its official research institution released a significant report, the preliminary assessment white paper on the distribution and activity of potential ancient energy nodes on the global seafloor. This report for the first time systematically correlates geologically active areas such as mid ocean ridges, trenches, and submarine volcanic chains with historically and recently monitored environmental energy anomalies based on the energy characteristics, activity frequency, and contribution to environmental disturbances of these nodes. It classifies and assesses their risks.

The report identifies the area where the southwest misty bay is located as a level three activity node anomalous state. Suspected non-natural energy accumulation activity pattern inconsistent with known geological processes requires continued monitoring. Meanwhile, the ice flow fissures are designated as a level two activity. Node clear energy characteristics significant recent human disturbance potentially high risk. Through this approach, Dragon Soul demonstrates its powerful global monitoring and research capabilities while simultaneously laying the groundwork for future actions in terms of public opinion and technology.

Under the guidance of the Dragon Soul, the Stonemason's Brotherhood cautiously restarted small-cale deep sea sampling operations. However, their targets were no longer active anomalies or large debris, but rather relatively quiet deep sea sediments and specific rock straightus samples, seemingly conducting more fundamental research on ancient environmental context and geocchronology. This might be a force transformation, or it could be to accumulate new bargaining power with a dragon soul. In a wider ocean, the specific areas of anomalous rare earth element concentrations are still slowly expanding and are beginning to overlap with some newly discovered extremely slow deep sea circulation anomalies. The upgraded monitoring model from Moyuan suggests that these rare earth elements may be being carried and diffused by some large scale slow water movement and their sources appear to be multiple.

Just as many parties were focusing on the ocean and energy, Linmo made an important decision concerning the long-term development of Mo Yuan Pavilion to officially launch the preliminary research and resource preparation plan for the core template of Sky City. This epic sanctuary template obtained from the sign-in system requires an astronomical list of materials, including a large number of unheard of synthetic materials and special components. Previously, due to external pressure and insufficient technological reserves, it had been sheld. Now, with a deeper understanding of ancient energy technology and the advanced model framework obtained through a trade with the coral society, Lin Mo believes it's time to begin laying the foundation for the construction of this ultimate sanctuary. He separated the relatively conventional parts of a template such as the basic structure, energy core, and environmental maintenance system and handed them over to Leewei and Sue Chanchian's research group for technical feasibility assessment and alternative material research.

At the same time, he gave Chiand Do the long and staggering list of resources, instructing him to begin collecting information and access channels for relevant materials globally in a most discreet and decentralized manner without rushing for quick results, but to begin planning systematically. Sky City is not just a refuge, Linmo said to everyone at the core meeting. It should be the culmination of all our knowledge, our ultimate fortress against any storms to come. Its construction will be a long process, but every step must be solid. From now on, it will become a long-term core goal of our internal development.

The foundation of the sky begins at your feet. Amidst the turbulent depths of the ocean and the fierce competition among various forces, the Mo Yuan Pavilion has quietly turned its gaze to a higher dimension. They understand that relying solely on islands and observation stations at sea is insufficient to truly establish themselves in this increasingly unstable world. They need a mobile home that transcends the disturbances of the sea, possessing a high degree of autonomy and survivability. And the sky city is precisely the blueprint for this dream.

The deepening of research, the continuation of transactions, external undercurrents, and the launch of ambitious goals constitute the multifaceted rhythm of life at Mo Yuan Pavilion. They're like a group of sailors preparing for a storm, simultaneously reinforcing the ship's hull, learning navigation, and dreaming of building a colossal vessel, busy, fulfilled, and cautiously optimistic about the future. Ancient mysteries echo beneath the deep sea. While hopes for the future float above, Mo Yuan Pavilion's voyage amidst this constant exploration is heading towards a more unknown yet also more expansive tomorrow. Chapter 125 models and resources.

Deep beneath the Mo Yuan Pavilion's underground core laboratory, a tranquil atmosphere, a mixture of excitement and focus was enveloped. The massive main screen no longer displayed a simple data stream or waveform, but a complex, slowly rotating 3D model composed of countless translucent lines and points of light. At the model center was a high precision digital twin of the dark silver resonator core unit provided by the Coral Society. surrounding it. According to the Coral Society's algorithm framework, simulated and rendered environmental energy background fields of different colors and dynamics.

Blue representing relatively stable deep sea geothermal background harmonics. Green representing infrasound disturbances modulated by ocean currents and strands of constantly changing dark gold threads symbolizing those elusive abnormal energy flows related to ancient creation activities. Load historical data set number three. Time period 72 hours before to 24 hours after the window event. Spatial range 500 km around the ice break zone.

Leeway's voice trembled slightly as he gave the instructions to the operator. As commands were input, the model on the screen dynamically changed. The blue green area representing the environmental background field began to fluctuate regularly while the strands of dark gold abnormal flow resembled a group of awakened snakes converging and entwining from the edge of the model towards the core unit model at the center. Their intensity, frequency, and convergence path were highly consistent with the historical data actually monitored by Moyuan Pavilion. Look here, Such Chanchian pointed to several specific waveguide texture nodes around the core unit of the model.

These nodes were emitting a gradually increasing faint glow under the stimulation of the simulated abnormal energy flow. The model predicts that when the frequency components of the abnormal energy flow match the inherent resonant frequencies of these nodes by more than 67%. The unit will enter a preparatory conversion state and the rotation speed of the tuning crystal light missed inside will increase by about 15 times. And based on the residual trace analysis of our physical component scan, the vortex morphology of the light missed inside the crystal does indeed show micro stress characteristics left after long-term high-speed rotation. This is almost a virtual model that confirms that this ancient component was very likely passively or even designed to participate in that global energy disturbance during the historical window event.

It is like a sophisticated stethoscope passively recording certain characteristics of that heartbeat. If we can further refine its resonance parameters and deduce its most sensitive listening frequency in reverse, Lee Ways eyes gleamed, we might be able to filter out those more subtle ancient system whispers that we always wanted to capture but were drowned out by background noise. This is the groundbreaking perspective brought about by integrating the coral society's model framework with ancient material data. It is not just an analytical tool, but more like a powerful lens, allowing them to examine environmental data that has long been recorded, but has always been incomprehensible from a completely new angle. Meanwhile, Chandwa's task of laying the groundwork for the Sky City project was also proceeding intensively yet discreetly.

The epic list of materials was dismantled, reassembled, and mixed into a large number of unrelated ordinary trade orders. The names of the previously unheard of synthetic materials on the list were given disguised code names. Highdimensional phase stabilized alloy became special corrosion resistant marine steel plate. Experimental batch on the purchase order. Environmentally adaptive biop-olymer substrate became new waterproof canvas coating raw material.

through several unrelated trading agents and shell companies. Chin Duo Duo posted scattered and restrained purchase requests on major trading hubs and black markets under various pretexts such as researching new building materials, developing high performance codings, and even exploring new materials for artistic creation. The reaction is more complicated than expected. Chanduo reported to Lyn Mo, "There are several materials such as crystallized earth vein core fragments and directionally condensed stardust powder that have absolutely no market records, not even similar rumors. Either the names are too ancient or too obscure, or the actual items may be held by a very small number of more secretive forces or ruins that we have not yet come into contact with." In addition, he added, "When we tentatively sought to purchase the high purity resonant crystal blank, the basic energy lens rough on the list, we attracted several unusual inquiries.

Not only did traders with dragon soul backgrounds come to inquire about its use, but even an outside agent of the Stonemason's Brotherhood made roundabout inquiries. This thing seems to be a sensitive item, even in high-tech circles. This was expected. Some of the core materials needed for Sky City inevitably overlap with the ancient technologies currently sought by top powers. Any large-scale unusual procurement could expose their intentions and strength.

Lynn Mo instructed Shin Duo Duo to suspend the public purchase of those materials that were both elusive and overly sensitive and instead through intelligence networks secretly gather all historical records and legends about the possible origins, alternative names or substitutes of these materials. Resource accumulation is a long-term process and cannot be rushed. We should start with those marginal materials and basic raw materials that are traceable and can be used to confuse the public and establish a stable and inconspicuous supply. Chain.limo set the strategy. At the same time, we should use the communication channels with the coral society and dragon soul to subtly learn about the modern research progress and application fields of certain special minerals or energy materials without revealing our intentions.

Knowledge is sometimes more important than physical objects. In the outside world, the impact of Dragon Souls global undersea potential ancient energy note assessment white paper is unfolding. Although it doesn't name names, its description of the southwestern Misty Bay as abnormally in condition, suspected of containing unnatural energy aggregates has undoubtedly attracted more attention, both overt and covert, to that area. Several medium-sized survivor alliances that have intelligence ties with Mo Yuan Pavilion have strengthened their monitoring and intelligence sharing of the southwestern route, clearly taking precautions. The Stonemason's Brotherhood's shift towards basic geological research appears to have yielded some minor results.

through academic channels controlled by Dragon Soul. They published a paper on the correlation between anomalous heavy metal element cycles in late pleaene sediments of a certain sea basin and paleocclimate events. The paper was substantial but made no mention of ancient civilizations attributing all findings to complex paleoic chemical processes. This served as a low-key academic debut showcasing their value while avoiding provoking any undue influence. The southwestern bay itself remains shrouded in dense fog.

However, based on the state transition critical point prediction algorithm provided by the coral society and combined with the latest monitoring data, Emo Yuongo has reassessed the situation and made a more accurate judgment. The dormant state of the structures within the bay has declined to near the theoretical critical awakening threshold and their internal systems may be undergoing a slow but continuous warm-up or selfch check process. The time it takes for them to actively open their eyes or release signals to the outside world next may be significantly shorter than the last time. Just as everyone inside and outside Muan Pavilion was gathering strength for their long-term goals, the Coral Society sent its third contact through a pre-reserved encrypted channel. This time there were no new physical samples, only a very brief request for technical consultation.

They requested that Moyuan using its improved model and environmental monitoring data assess the potential disturbance prediction of the impact on node stability in the surrounding environment when applying a precisely designed low power multiband composite resonant field at specific geographical nodes. Several attitude and longitude coordinates are provided in the appendix, three of which are very close to the southwest Misty Bay. They emphasized that this was merely a theoretical deduction requirement to refine the active intervention simulation module of their model. This request instantly created a tense atmosphere within the core of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. The Coral Society finally stopped concealing their intentions.

They not only wanted to observe the southwest bay, but were also actively planning some form of active contact or technical intervention. And now they hope to use the Mo Yuan Pavilion's models and observation capabilities to assess the risks of such intervention. They read bolder than we imagined. Sure house said in a deep voice they just had the stonemason's brotherhood incident and they dare to plan resonance field intervention on something of unknown size in the bay. It has also possible that they have mastered key technologies or security measures that we donty know about.

Leeway analyzed from a technical perspective where they believe that the things in the Gulf have reached a level of dormcancy that makes it safe to try to wake them up or engage with them. Dot Lynn and Mo stared at the list of coordinates and the brief description of the resonant field parameters lost in thought for a long time. Providing such an assessment was tantamount to indirectly participating in the risky actions that the coral society might take. But refusing could sever this valuable channel of technical exchange and deprive him of a window into understanding the other party's true capabilities and intentions. An assessment can be conducted.

Lenmo finally decided, but the assessment report must be based on the most conservative risk assumptions highlighting all uncertainties and potential chain reactions. At the same time, a clear technical challenge section should be included in the report, pointing out that there are multiple potential overlaps between its resonant field parameter design and our known dangerous frequencies and citing the Stonemason's Brotherhood accident as a cautionary case. Finally, citing limitations of the theoretical model, the assessment results should be stated as being for reference only and not constituting any action recommendations. This is a response that fulfills the obligation of cooperation, clearly defines the boundaries of responsibility, and even carries a warning connotation. Mayuan Pavilion needs to continue walking this dangerous tight trope, acquiring knowledge while avoiding being dragged into an uncontrollable vortex.

The model is being refined, resources are being sought, and the external winds seem to be blowing increasingly fiercely from the southwest. Chapter 126. Warning assessment. The Coral Society's brief yet clearly stated technical consultation request was like a hot potato placed before Moingga. The question was how to assess the risks of an active resonant field intervention on the structure of the southwest misty bay and the examiner was likely to be the harsh reality.

Lynmo's instructions were clear and resolute. Do it carefully, estimate conservatively and issue explicit warnings. This was not only a response to the coral society, but also a serious test of Mo Yuan Pavilion's own technical judgment. In the underground command center, Leewi, Suian, and several core analysts were engaged in intensive simulation work on the upgraded ancient energy equipment function and environmental interaction simulation platform. The resonant field parameters provided by the Coral Society were carefully input.

It was a composite signal sequence containing seven different fundamental frequencies each with three different modulation waveforms with a power level marked as extremely low but the duration of action was planned to last 48 hours. They designed the signal very smartly. Leeway analyzed as he operated the system. Of the seven fundamental frequencies, three fall within our known safe channels that are strongly correlated with the environmental context. to maintain a safe distance from known biologically sensitive frequency bands and two very subtly brush against the edges of those ancient system characteristic frequencies that we have labeled as potentially dangerous or unknown in function.

This is not a brutal stimulus but more like a carefully designed probing knock using mostly safe frequencies as cover and carrier with a little bit of special greeting dot. Such Chian is responsible for monitoring the ecological impact prediction module integrated into the simulation platform. Duration is the biggest variable she points out. Even with extremely low power signals, the cumulative shaping or disruption effect on the local energy environment over 48 hours cannot be ignored. The model shows that around the 18th hour, identifiable distortions begin to appear in the diffusion patterns of specific rare earth elements in the waters surrounding the target area bay.

After the 36th hour, the simulated structure dormcy curve begins to show an accelerated downward trend exceeding the error range. They gradually increase the simulation parameters to test various unexpected scenarios, assuming the construct was far more sensitive to a certain edge frequency than expected. assuming unpredictable distortion or resonant amplification of the signal as it propagated through complex underwater topography and multi-layer media. Assuming a natural global energy background fluctuation occurred during the intervention, resulting in a superp position effect. The results of each stress test were unsettling.

Even in the most optimistic scenario of all parameters precise and no unexpected interference, the simulated construct eventually crossed the critical awakening threshold, entering a simulated lowactivity standby state. Its internal energy field fluctuated more intensely, releasing a series of ambiguous but clearly energy characteristic response pulses. In over 70% of the unexpected scenarios, the results pointed to varying degrees of loss of control. From violent internal energy releases caused by the construct safety mechanisms being mistakenly triggered, similar to but weaker than the Stonemason's Brotherhood incident to the release of response pulses triggering a chain reaction of activity in a wider range of deep sea anomalies. And finally to the worst case scenario, the simulation program crashed due to parameter overflow, indicating that the system response exceeded the model prediction boundary.

After 36 consecutive hours of tireless simulation and verification, a comprehensive risk assessment report over 50 pages long and containing numerous charts, data citations, and uncertainty statements entitled theoretical risk assessment report on applying composite resonant fields to specific geographic nodes was finally completed. The report's core conclusion highlighted in bold states, "Based on current understanding and technological models, the proposed intervention carries a high risk of triggering unpredictable changes in the target system state and potential regional chain reactions. The risks primarily stem from the target systems current nearcitritical dormcancy level, the potential coupling of specific frequency parameters with unknown dangerous frequency bands, and the cumulative effects of long-term intervention. Implementation in a real world environment is strongly discouraged. The final chapter of the report which Lynn Mo requested to include is titled technical questions and case warnings.

It details the similarities between the resonant field parameters and the dangerous frequencies observed in the window event, the knocking on the door event and the Stonemason's Brotherhood accident and includes an energy release spectrum from the Stonemason's Brotherhood accident for comparison. The warning message of which is self-evident. The report was sent to the Coral Society via an encrypted channel. Inside the Mo Yuan Pavilion, everyone awaited the other party's response. Their feelings a mix of emotions.

They hoped this serious warning would be heated. Yet, they also had a vague feeling that since the other party had made such a request, they probably wouldn't easily give up just because of a report. While waiting for response, work continued in other areas. Leeway's team made an unexpected but important side discovery in their research on ancient resonator units. After comparing the micro structure of the tuning crystal inside the unit with several environmental reference energy spectrum characteristics mentioned in the coral society model framework, they speculated that this crystal is likely a natural environmental harmonic recorder.

It adjusts its lattice structure extremely slowly over a long period of time to adapt to and memorize the dominant energy frequencies of its environment. This may explain why the component is so sensitive to certain frequencies because it inherently recognizes these frequencies. If this conjecture holds true, Leewayi said excitedly, then by analyzing more ancient crystal samples from different sources, we might be able to read the environmental energy climate of different periods and locations in ancient times, just like reading tree rings. This is more direct than ice core records. Su Chian then began to use the new model to re-examine the environmental data that Mo Yuinga had collected in the early days near the Hemlock Island mine, looking for whether any more subtle energy field fingerprints related to the stone slab had been overlooked.

Chandwa's resource network received an exciting yet troublesome piece of information. An independent prospector who had been operating in the waters near the edge of the lava islands in the south claimed to have discovered a black glassy substance in a cooled lava tube within a submarine volcanic fissure. This substance was described as shimmering with a strange internal luster incredibly hard and extremely sensitive to temperature changes. The description closely matched the properties of a mid-grade structural material code named earth vein tempered glass on the sky city materials list. However, the prospector lost contact after sending the message and his last reported location coordinates pointed to a dangerous area known for its active submarine volcanoes and fierce currents.

The source of information is of moderate reliability, but the target's characteristics match well and its geographical location is remote, making it unlikely to attract the attention of major powers. Chen Duo Duo assessed it's worth sending a capable team to verify it, but the risks are considerable. After careful consideration, Lynn Mo approved the reconnaissance operation, but stipulated that it must be carried out with the highest safety standards. The team's mission was limited to confirming the existence of the mineral vein and taking preliminary samples. They were strictly prohibited from engaging in prolonged combat or venturing into dangerous areas.

The operation was cenamed glass probe. Just as the glass probe team was secretly preparing to set off, a reply arrived from the Coral Society. The reply remained brief and calm. They expressed their gratitude and high respect for Moyuan's detailed and professional risk assessment and acknowledged that the risks identified in the report do exist and need to be taken seriously. However, the letter also subtly mentioned that their understanding of the target node and Moyuan's model based on existing data might have some cognitive differences based on different information sources.

They stated that they would carefully consider the report's recommendations and may further optimize and strengthen the intervention plan. At the end of the letter, they made a new seemingly unrelated request, asking if Muan Pavilion was interested in the spatial topology reconstruction of ancient large-scale energy transmission networks and implying that they possessed some fragments of historical distribution maps of the main channels for underwater energy transmission. The Haven T given up. Chi and Duo Duo put down the translated telegram. They just changed their wording.

Cognitive difference. They may have crucial information about the situation inside the Gulf that we donty know making them think the risks are manageable. Optimization plan. They will still try dot. The newly proposed energy network topology research is both a shift in topic and a demonstration of their deeper knowledge reserves.

Continuing to tempt us, Leeway added. Lynamo stared intently at the letter, his gaze deep. The Coral Society was like a seasoned deep sea angler, patiently casting bait and adjusting the line. They wanted to fish in the bay and the data and assessment capabilities of the Moanon Pavilion were a crucial part of their fishing gear. In response, we stated that we have academic interest in the study of energy network topology and can exchange views on the macrolevel issue of the historical evolution of the distribution of main channels and its correlation with geological activities.

However, we will not discuss specific coordinates or detailed maps at this time, Linmo replied. At the same time, we will internally upgrade the confidentiality level and analysis frequency of all monitoring data in the Southwest Bay. We must be prepared to know immediately whatever the Coral Society does next and assess the potential impact on us. The warning has been issued. The choice lies with the other side.

All Mo Yuan Pavilion can do is continue to fortify its observation posts, hone its analytical skills, and strive to discern the intentions of each opponent in this increasingly complex game. Resources await in a distance. Technology breaks through at the forefront and the dark clouds of the storm may be quietly gathering above the seemingly calm fog in the southwest. Their voyage is destined to oscillate between caution and ambition, searching for the most elusive safe passage. Chapter 1 27 glass and undercurrents.

Operation Glass Probe, a reconnaissance mission unfolded quietly under extreme secrecy and meticulous preparation. The team consisted of four experienced members. The captain was Chun Hai who had distinguished himself in the shadow of the storm mission. The team members included Lau, a technician skilled in geological and mineral identification, a Shouer, a helmsman adept at navigating dangerous waters, and Shia Mo, an electronics expert responsible for communications and equipment support. They boarded a specially modified unassuming but high-performance high-speed boat and quietly departed from the anchorage outside Mo Yuan Pavilion in the darkest hour before dawn heading south towards a notoriously turbulent lava islands waters.

According to intelligence, the target area is located on the eastern edge of the archipelago near an active submarine volcanic fisher zone known as black smokers. The seabed there is complex with hydrothermal vents constantly spewing high temperature, high pressure acidic water and toxic gases. While the surface is perpetually turbulent with dangerous and irregular eddies and upwellings due to the confluence of warm and cold water. The small boat must traverse this natural barrier discreetly to find the coordinates last reported by the missing explorer on the main island of Mayuan Pavilion. Linmo and the others had to temporarily shift their focus away from the glassy probe because the ripples from the Coral Society's subsequent actions after receiving the warning assessment report were beginning to emerge.

First, there's a technical briefing leaked through a semi-public academic exchange platform of the Coral Society attributed to an independent research team. The briefing is titled a new exploration of numerical simulation of the influence of specific low-frequency composite resonant fields on stable energy background environments. While the briefing's content is technically complex, its core argument subtly dialogues with a warning assessment report from Moyuan. The independent team claims that simulations using their improved multifysics coupling model have confirmed that under strict parameter control and multiple safety redundancy mechanisms, the influence of specific low-frequency resonant fields on quasi steadystate energy structures is highly directional and reversible and the probability of triggering a systematic chain reaction of runaway reactions is below the model error threshold. Although the briefing doesn't mention any specific locations or projects, it's clear to anyone with a discerning eye that this is providing theoretical support for the safety and feasibility of some kind of active intervention technology.

They are responding to our warnings through academic discussions and tried to establish a new technological discourse. Leeway analyzed the briefing. We didn't TC the details of their proposed improve model and safety redundancy mechanism, but if it as true, it means that their ability to control risks may be stronger than we thought. Chind Woodwa's intelligence network also detected related movements. Several vessels flying the flags of neutral research institutions, but with hull types and equipment configurations clearly exceeding the requirements of routine scientific research appeared on the high seas outside the southwestern Foggy Bay.

They did not approach the dense fog area of the bay, but instead remained anchored at several points about 100 nautical miles away, conducting continuous hydraological, meteorological, and deep sea acoustic monitoring. The resupply and personnel rotation of these vessels had indirect but traceable connections to several peripheral cover organizations known to the coral society. They are establishing forward observation posts and benchmark monitoring points. Chi and Duo Duo judged to collect real-time background data for possible interventions and to monitor any disturbances in the Gulf. This scale of preparation does not seem like a spur-ofthe- moment thing.

Meanwhile, Dragon Soul seemed to have noticed the unusual increase in attention in the southwest. One of their routine patrol fleets coincidentally adjusted its course, beginning to more frequently cross the edge of the waters where the Coral Society monitoring ship was located and incidentally conducted several public search and rescue and antipiriracy drills.
