Leeway immediately returned to his control panel and began to reassign monitoring tasks. Such Chanchan also stood up. I asked the biology team to pay attention to the activity of plankton in the water above the dome. If there's a large-scale energy transfer, even if it is very weak, it may cause abnormal biological behavior. Time passed second by second.

The countdown has entered its final 20 minutes. The atmosphere in the command center grew increasingly tense. Everyone returned to their posts, staring at their screens, waiting for that moment to arrive. Lyn and Mo finished the tea in his cup, which had already gone cold. He glanced at the time for 05 a.m.

There is still 17 minutes until the predicted pulse occurs. Another brief message came from Shien Duo Duo. Dragon Souls reconnaissance ship has entered the 50 nautical mile range, moving very slowly, as if it's testing something. In addition, another batch of high purity crystals has appeared on the black market. This time in larger quantities, and the price is 20% lower.

The seller seems to be in a bit of a hurry. In a hurry? Linmo caught the word. If the remnants of the Wings of Liberty truly control the fortress and can use its production lines to manufacture supplies, why would they be in such a hurry to ship them out? Unless they need to quickly acquire some external resource in return or perhaps they encountered some trouble. Keep an eye on it, Linmo replied. Pay special attention to whether anyone is buying large quantities of medical supplies, food, or radiation protection equipment.

Receive. The countdown has entered its final 10 minutes. Leeway began to verify the status of the entire system. All monitoring points report status. Submarine array normal.

Buoy network normal. Seismograph array normal. Drone relay normal. Biosampling team in position. Environmental sensors in place.

A series of confirmation sounds rang out in the command center. Each voice tense and strained. Lin Mo pulled up a comprehensive situation map of the area where the fortress was located. On the deep blue sea, two points of light representing the Dragon Soul Reconnaissance ship were slowly moving, approaching the 45 nautical mile mark. Further away, the red marker representing the fortress stood silently like a time bomb.

5 minutes left in the countdown. Such Chian suddenly whispered, "The creatures in the observation cage at 47 nautical miles are starting to show signs of agitation. Some crustaceans are randomly bumping around in the cage and the fish are gathering in the corners. These are early signs of stress. Can I sense it?" Sure, how asked.

Possibly, do Sue Chanchian stared at the monitoring screen. Sometimes living organisms are more sensitive to electromagnetic fields and radiation than instruments. In particular, species that have lived in areas with high radiation backgrounds for a long time may have evolved some kind of early warning mechanism. Dot. 3 minutes left in countdown.

Leeway began the final equipment calibration. All recording systems enter highest sampling frequency mode. Backup power switch to standby. Data buffer pool has been cleared. Ready to receive peak traffic.

2 minutes left in a countdown. Lynn and Mo noticed that the two reconnaissance ships of Dragon Soul stopped at a distance of 43 nautical miles and stopped moving forward. Did they receive a warning as well or did their equipment detect some early signs? One minute countdown. The entire command center was so quiet you could hear someone breathing. Everyone stared at their screens, fingers hovering over the control buttons, ready to respond to any unexpected situations.

Lynn Emmo watched as the countdown numbers decreased from 60 59 58 57. He suddenly remembered the words that she and Duo Duo had conveyed. Heartbeat is breathing and breathing requires energy. If this ancient fortress is indeed breathing, then each breath means that it is consuming energy and also acquiring energy. So what will this breath reveal? 30 seconds, 20 seconds, 10 seconds.

Leeway began counting down. 5 4 3 2 1. Time resets to zero. Everyone's eyes were fixed on the monitoring screen. 1 second.

2 seconds. 3 seconds. Nothing happened. The expected pulse signal did not appear. Inside the command center, only the hum of the equipment could be heard.

Leeway frowned and quickly checked all the monitoring channels. All sensor readings are normal. No abnormal signals were detected. No pulse occurred. Is it delayed? Such Chanchin asked.

Possibly dot Lee way stare at the time. The last time we observed a period of 6 hours and 14 minutes, but that was based on the average of three observations. The actual period may fluctuate by a few minutes. Dot. Wait five more minutes.

Lenmo said time passed in silence. Every second felt incredibly long. 4:27 a.m. 5 minutes have passed since the predicted time. There's still nothing there.

Dragon Souls reconnaissance ship remained at a distance of 43 nautical miles, neither advancing nor retreating. The creature in the cage showed some relief from its agitation, but was still not completely calm. "Something's not right," Leeway murmured. "Even with fluctuations, the deviation shouldn't exceed 5 minutes. Unless before he could finish speaking, the energy monitoring graph on the main screen suddenly jumped is not a pulse.

Instead, it's a continuously rising curve. The index representing the background radiation level is rising at a slow but steady pace. Starting from the baseline, 5% 10% 15%. This isn't pulse. Such an stared at the curve.

This is a slow release. Lin Mo immediately retrieved the data from the other sensors. Seawater temperature monitoring sea at a depth of 2 km directly below the fortress. The water temperature is rising at a rate of 0.1Â° per minute. The magnetic field strength fluctuated three times more than usual and the frequency was chaotic.

Seabed vibrations C seismographs recorded continuous low frequency tremors with a focal depth of about 3 km which corresponds exactly to the location of the dome structure. It's taking a breath. Lyn Mo suddenly said, "What?" Leewi didn't hear clearly. It asks not a short rapid heartbeat but slow continuous breathing. Lin Mo pointed to the synchronously changing curves.

Energy is being continuously released and absorbed. That dome is likely an energy source or a cooling system. He glanced at the time 4:31 a.m. This breathing process has lasted for 4 minutes and is still continuing. All monitoring devices adjust recording mode.

Lynn Mo instructed this is not a momentary event but a continuous state. What we need to record is the complete waveform of the entire process as well as the phase relationship between the various parameters. Understood. Leeway immediately began operating the system. Such an also realized biology group.

Please note that the pattern of ecological impact from this continuous release may be completely different from that of a pulse. Record the time series of all abnormal behaviors. The command center is busy again, but this busy period had a different rhythm. It's no longer about capturing a fleeting signal, but about recording a slow, potentially long breathing process. Lyn Mo sat back in his chair, watching the continuously rising curve on the screen.

He realized that their understanding of this ancient fortress might have been misguided from the very beginning. Is not a heart that beats once every 6 hours. Instead, it is a lung that is breathing slowly, and each breath may be far more complex than they imagine. A faint glimmer of dawn began to appear in the sky outside the window. A new day is about to begin, and that fortress sleeping in the deep sea is awakening in its own way.

Chapter 134, Continuous Breathing. 6:20 a.m. The screen in the command center showed that the energy release had been going on for nearly 2 hours. The red curve representing the background radiation level after climbing to 237% of its initial value finally began to show signs of leveling off. The rate of increase slowed significantly like a long-d distanceance runner's final struggle as they approached the finish line.

Leeway rubbed his sore eyes and projected the latest data onto the main screen. The release rate is starting to decline. Dot his voice was tired but also excited. It has dropped from 1.8% 8% per minute at its peak to 0.3%. Now, at this rate, it may plateau or start to decline in another 30 minutes to an hour.

Dot, what about the water temperature? Lynn Mo asked. Synchronized. Leeway pulled up another set of data. The seawater temperature 2,000 m directly below the fortress rose from an initial 3.2Â° C to a high of 5.7Â° C and is now stable at 5.6Â°. The heat source seems to be weakening.

Such Chian walked over from the biological monitoring area holding several printed charts in her hand. The ecological impact is obvious that she spread out the charts. In the observation cages we set up at 47 nautical miles, six out of the 20 experimental organisms have died in the past 2 hours. The deaths occur between the 90th and 110th minutes after the energy release began. She circled several time points with her pen.

Living individuals also exhibited severe stress responses metabolic rates generally decreased by more than 40%. And swimming activity was almost zero. Moreover, she paused then pointed to the last chart. Our plankton samplers deployed at four different distances collected large numbers of dead single-sellled algae. Even at the furthest point, 47 nautical miles away, the alba mortality rate was eight times higher than usual.

Is the scope of the impact still expanding? Sure, how asked. No, the impact is expanding, Sue Chenshin corrected. The range is still roughly within 50 nautical miles, but the degree of ecological damage within those 50 nautical miles is increasing exponentially as the release time lengthens. If this breathing state continues for more than 4 hours, I suspect that all multisellular organisms within those 50 nautical miles will die dot. There was a few seconds of silence in the command center.

All died. That means that the area will become a complete no-go zone for life. Where is Dragon Souls reconnaissance ship? Lyn Emmo turned to Chin Duo Duo. Chandwood's voice came through the communicator. They're still at 43 nautical miles.

According to the fragmented communications we intercepted, their shipboard sensors have also detected continuous energy release. Two hours ago, they tried to retreat 5 nautical miles, but it seems they've stopped again. They're probably waiting for orders from higher command. Any new developments? Yes, that s voice turns serious. 15 minutes ago, Dragon Soul dispatched two special engineering vessels from the rear.

Judging from their appearance, they should be models used for deep sea operations and sample collection. They may be planning to try to get close and collect water samples or something else after the energy release is overdot. What about the remnants of the wings of liberty? No movement. Chin duo duo said the area within 40 nautical miles of the fortress remains a black box. However, the price of that batch of crystals on the black market has dropped by another 15% in the past 2 hours.

It has now almost half the price of similar products on the market. The seller is very eager to get rid of it. Lynn and Mo leaned back his chair, his fingers tapping lightly on the armrest. Energy is continuously released. Ecosystems are dying out at an accelerated pace.

Wings of Liberty are in a hurry to sell their merchandise. Dragon Soul is preparing to collect samples. There should be a connecting line between these fragments. Leewei, he suddenly spoke. If a dormant ancient facility suddenly begins to release energy continuously for an extended period of time, what could be the reason? Leeway pondered for a few seconds.

Several possibilities. First, a system malfunction resulting in energy leakage. Second, the activation of a high energy consuming functional module such as weapon charging, shield generation, or large scale production. Third, he paused for a moment. It's going through a necessary maintenance cycle.

Just like a person turns over and adjusts their position when they sleep, a system that's been dormant for a long time may need to stretch its muscles periodically to prevent its components from aging and becoming stiff. Which one do you think it is? The third possibility is the most likely dotly way pulled up the spectrum analysis chart of the energy release. You see, although the spectrum of the release is complex, there are obvious periodic fluctuations. Every 17 to 18 minutes, there is a small fluctuation in intensity and the fluctuation pattern is almost exactly the same. This does not seem like a fault leak, but more like a regular cycle.

Dot. Sue Chanchian leaned closer to take a look. Doesn't it look like blood circulation? The heart pumps blood, the blood flows throughout the body, and then flows back. That is somewhat true. dot leeway nodded.

If that is the case, then this fortress might be undergoing a full system energy cycle. It s sending the stored energy to each subsystem, activating them, checking their status, and then recycling it. The whole process would take several hours. Then why was it a short pulse every 6 hours before, but now it's a continuous release? Sure. How asked it as possible that it was in a light sleep before and now it is in a deep sleep maintenance phase.

Leeway speculated or the remnants of Wings of Liberty triggered a higher level protocol causing the system to enter a different operating mode. Lenmo looked at the energy curve on the screen which was beginning to flatten out. The release has lasted for 2 hours and 17 minutes. According to Leewi's speculation, if this is a complete system cycle, it may be coming to an end soon. Notify all monitoring stations.

Lynn Mo said, "The energy release may be coming to an end. After it's over, be sure to record any unusual changes, sudden drops in temperature, magnetic field reversals, changes in seabed vibration patterns, don't miss anything." Clear? Furthermore, Lynn Mo added, "After the release is completely ceased, arrange for two groups of hardened underwater vehicles to attempt to enter the 45 nautical mile zone. Do not venture too deep. Collect data just at the edge. If Dragon Souls engineering vessels move, we must obtain firsthand information before they do, the risk is very high, Leewi warned.

Although the radiation level may decrease after the release, the interference field may not necessarily disappear. So, we'll use a ruggedized version and only up to 45 nautical miles. Lyno said, "If the sensors malfunction, we'll retreat immediately. We don't need to risk our lives. We just need to be one step ahead of Dragon Soul." After the order was issued, each department began preparations.

Such Chian returned to the biom monitoring area and began designing a post-release bio-reovery observation plant. She needed to know how long it would take for the ecosystem to begin self-repairing after such an intense energy shock, if it could even repair itself. Sherhow then began to reassess the evacuation time window. If the fortress's breathing pattern changed, then its behavioral logic and movement probability needed to be recalculated. He retrieved all known data and began modeling and simulation.

Chin Duo Duo continued to monitor the movements of all parties. Dragon Souls engineering vessel was already on standby 40 nautical miles away, waiting only for the energy release to finish. The Coral Society's research buoy array was also continuing to operate. They clearly hadn't given up. The Stonemason's Brotherhood, however, remains silent.

7:05 a.m. The energy release has entered its third hour. The curve has flattened out completely with the value remaining at about 98% of the peak level, and there are no longer any significant fluctuations. The water temperature also remains stable at 5.6Â° C. Seabed vibrations have weakened to the point of being almost undetectable.

It has almost over dot leeway stare to the data stream. All the indicators show that the system is wrapping up. Dot 7:23. The red curve on the main screen began to descend without warning. It was a slow descent, but an almost vertical drop.

Within just 3 minutes, radiation levels plummeted from 241% of their peak to 120% of their initial value and then continued to decline. The water temperature dropped simultaneously from 5.6Â° 6Â° to 3.5Â°. The magnetic field strength has returned to its normal fluctuation range. The seabed vibrations have completely stopped. Is it over? Suchinian asked.

Not yet. Leewi pointed to the screen. Look, it hasn't stabilized after dropping to the baseline. It's still declining. As expected, the curve did not stop after touching the initial value and continued to decline.

90% 80% 70% 7:31 a.m. The radiation level eventually stabilized at 62% of the initial value. It was nearly 40% lower than before breathing began. The energy is being recycled. Leeway suddenly realized it's not just releasing, it's also absorbing.

It releases for 2 hours, then reclaims the dissipated energy at an even faster rate. It's like taking a deep breath, inhaling more than you exhale. Where does the extra energy come from? Sure, how asked. All eyes were drawn to the enormous dome-shaped structure beneath the seabed. Lyn Mo pulled up the real-time monitoring footage of that area.

Because of the great depth, the image was blurry and all that could be seen was darkness. However, a seismograph installed on the nearby seabed recorded a faint but clear set of vibration signals originating from inside the dome and propagating upwards toward the fortress. It asked drawing energy from below. Linmo said that dome is its energy source. Each breath is an energy exchange and replenishment dot.

Then why did the radiation level decrease instead? Suchian asked puzzled. If energy was replenished, the background radiation should have increased. It's probably because it recovers not only the radiation it releases, but also the background radiation that already exists in the environment. Leeway speculated its energy system has a purification or conversion function, turning radiation pollution into usable clean energy. So after breathing it out, the surrounding environment is actually cleanered.

This speculation silenced the command center for a few seconds. An ancient war machine capable of purifying radiation pollution. This sounds so contradictory. Is the underwater vehicle ready? Lynn Mo broke the silence. Both teams are in position.

Leeway replied. They could depart at any time. Depart. Destination 45 nautical miles. Collect water and sediment samples and measure real-time radiation levels and magnetic field strength.

If any anomalies are detected, immediately retreat. Clear. Two sets of ruggedized underwater vehicles departed from the outer base of Mayuin Pavilion and headed southwest. They move slowly, remain hidden, and avoid attracting the attention of the dragon soul. The first group of underwater vehicles reached the 45 nautical mile boundary.

The transmitted data showed that radiation levels were indeed only about 65% of what was predicted. The magnetic field was stable and the water temperature was normal. Continue forward to 44 nautical miles, Linmo MO ordered. The submersible moved forward slowly. 8:19.

Entering the 44 nautical mile zone, the data began to fluctuate. Radiation levels have risen slightly to 71%. Regular minor disturbances have appeared in the magnetic field. Water temperature shows an extremely slight upward trend. Stop here, Lyno said.

collect samples, perform a full range scan, and then retreat to the 45 nautical mile line. Clear. The underwater vehicle began operation. A robotic arm extends to collect surface sediment. A water pump extracts seawater samples.

Various sensors operate at full power, recording every detail of this sea area that has just experienced breathing. Just then, Chindwood's voice came through the communicator, sounding urgent. Dragon Souls engineering ships have moved. Both are heading towards the fortress at a considerable speed. At this rate, they will approach from the northeast and are expected to be within 45 nautical miles of the fortress within an hour.

Let them go first, Lin Mo said calmly. Our underwater vehicle will withdraw after collecting the samples. Don't run into them. Understood. Also, Chin Duodo paused.

The Coral Society is also making moves. They deployed a small unmanned submarine approaching from the west. It s quite small probably trying to get the data before the dragon soul dive. It's a race among many parties. Sure house said.

Then let's see who gets more valuable data. Lynmo looked at the real-time footage transmitted back by the submarine on the screen. The seabed at 44 nautical miles is now quite different from what it was before. The seabed is covered with a layer of fine grayish white sediment resembling the remains of some kind of organism or mineral deposits. Deep sea coral reefs, once ubiquitous, are now almost nowhere to be seen.

Even the most common tube worms and sponges are pitifully scarce. This seabed looks like it has been carefully cleaned. It was so clean it was unsettling. The submersible robotic arm scooped up a handful of sediment and loaded it into the sample chamber. Just then, the sensor suddenly sounded an alarm.

The magnetic field strength increased by 300% within 5 seconds. The water temperature rose 2Â° instantly. Retreat. Lynn Mo immediately ordered full speed back to the 45 nautical mile line. The submarine's thrusters started at full power and it changed direction.

But it was too late. The image on the home screen began to shake violently, then turned into static. Data stream interrupted. The communication signal disappeared. Loss of contact.

Dotly ways voice tightened. The last data transmitted back showed they were still moving but all the sensors failed. The navigation system may also be can it be found if the autonomous driving program is still working. They will return along the preset route. Leeway stared at the control panel but without navigation relying solely on inertia.

He didn't finish speaking. In a command center, everyone stared at the blank screen, the 44 nautical mile line. There's something there still moving. It's not the fortress itself. It's something else.

8:47 a.m., 28 minutes after losing contact, one of the underwater vehicles reappeared shakily within 46 nautical miles of the monitoring area. It has obvious scratches on its outer shell, and one of the thrusters has stopped working, but it is still moving with difficulty. The other group never appeared again. Leeway immediately initiated the recovery process, dispatching a speedboat to tow the damaged submarine back. 9:20 a.m.

The underwater vehicle was transported back to base. The sample chamber was intact, but all of its electronic equipment, including the black box, was burned out, completely scrapped. Meanwhile, Dragon Souls engineering vessel had already reached the 45 nautical mile mark. Their adventure has only just begun. Chapter 135.

The secret in the sample sea. Inside the Moyuan biological laboratory, the lights were brightly lit. The ventilation system emitted a low hum and there was a faint smell of disinfectant in the air. Suchan dressed in a white lab coat, goggles, and gloves stood in front of the control panel. On the panel were two transparent sealed sample containers, both retrieved from the submarine that had miraculously returned.

One jar contained a seawater sample about 500 ml. The other jar contained sediment, a fine grayish white powder, and was about half full. Leeway stood to the side holding a tablet computer, ready to take notes. Lynn Emmo stood in front of the observation window, watching the operation inside through the glass. Measure the radiation level first, Such Chian said.

She took out a handheld radiation detector, calibrated it, and then held it close to the seawater sample container. The numbers on the instrument screen fluctuated a few times before stabilizing at 0.18 microcevers. About 65% of the normal background value. She recorded the data, which is consistent with the data last transmitted back by the submersible dot. Next, the sediment samples were examined.

As soon as the instrument approached, the numbers began to climb rapidly. 0.35 0.67 1.12 1.89 finally settling at 2.41 microceverts per hour. The radiation levels in the sediments are 13 times higher than in seawater. Sue Chanchan frowned. This is no ordinary silt.

She carefully opened the sediment sample container, took out a small amount of powder with a sampling spoon, placed it on a glass slide, and pushed it under the microscope. Adjust the focus. A patch of grayish white granular material appeared in my field of vision. The particles were uneven in size, irregular in shape, and had a somewhat rough surface. It s not a mineral crystal, Sue Chian said softly.

It s more like a fragment of a biological calcium skeleton, but the structure is very strange. Dot. She switched to a higher magnification objective lens. The field of vision is narrowed. The details of those grayish white particles are clearer.

The surface has a fine porous structure like the skeleton of a sponge or some kind of coral. But the arrangement of the pores is very regular presenting a spiral geometric pattern. This is not a naturally formed biological structure. Such Chanchian looked up. It s too regular.

The skeletons of organisms in nature also follow a pattern, but this precise spiral arrangement looks like it was designed. Leewi leaned closer to take a look. It looks like some kind of filtering structure or an energy conduction structure. Anything is possible. Such an took another sample and put it into another device.

I'll do an elemental analysis. The equipment started operating. The laser shown on the sample and the spectrometer captured the reflected signal. A few minutes later, the results came out. The main component is calcium carbonate accounting for 87%.

The rest are silicates, trace metal elements, and about 1.3% unknown substances, which have no matching entries in the spectral feature database. Such an stared at the screen. The molecular structure of the unknown substances is very complex like some kind of organic inorganic hybrid material. Organic inorganic hybridization, LinMo asked from behind the observation window. It has both the carbon chain structure of organic matter and the crystal framework of inorganic matter.

Sue Chansin explained such materials are rare in nature and are usually artificially synthesized for special purposes such as biompatible implant materials or highly efficient catalyst carriers. She paused for a moment. If this really broke off from the fortress, it's probably a fragment of its outer armor or internal structure. A kind of smart material that can self-rep or interact with its environment. self-repair.

Leewi's eyes lit up. It asked just a guess suit. Chian shook her head, but its structure does have that potential. The porest design can accommodate repair fluids or nano machines, and the organic parts can provide flexibility and adaptability. She continued analyzing the seawater samples.

The data for pH value, salinity, dissolved oxygen, and nutrient content are displayed one by one. The composition of the seawater has changed. Sue Chian pointed to the data. The pH value is 0.3 lower than normal seawater, making it more acidic. The dissolved oxygen content is abnormally low, only 40% of the normal value.

However, the concentrations of phosphate and nitrate are very high, 5 to 8 times the normal value. Dot. What does this mean? Lin Mo asked. This means that the aquatic environment of that sea area has been severely altered. Such Chian said, "Low oxygen, high nutrient salts, and acidity are typical characteristics of a dead zone.

When a large number of organisms die and decompose, they consume oxygen, release nutrients, and produce acidic substances at the same time." She pulled up previously recorded biological mortality data. It matches the ecological disasters we've observed. But strangely, if it were just biological decomposition, nutrient concentrations shouldn't be this high. Unless unless there is additional input, Leeway replied, the energy release process of the fortress may have simultaneously catalyzed certain chemical reactions, releasing a large amount of nutrients from the seabed sediments into the water. Or to put it more directly, it is itself releasing these substances.

Lynn Mo stared silently at the data. The grayish white sediment may be fragments of smart materials. The unusual hydrochemical environment suggests the input of some substance. This coupled with the energy system capable of purifying radiation further supports this. This fortress seems to be doing several contradictory things at the same time.

releasing energy pollution that kills organisms, but also recycling and purifying radiation, discharging substances that change water quality, but also possibly using advanced self-healing materials. Any news from the remnants of the wings of Liberty? He turned to the communicator. Chi Dudwa's voice came through. Same as always, no movement within 40 nautical miles. But the price of that batch of crystals on the black market has dropped again.

Now it's only a third of the market price. And a new buyer has appeared. What's your background? I don't know. The transaction used multiple layers of encryption and anonymous accounts, but the purchase volume was huge. They bought up all the remaining goods.

Payment was prompt. No haggling. Chen du duo paused. I checked the flow of funds and it eventually pointed to a few offshore accounts in the Caribbean region, but I couldn't te find anything further down the line. Dot.

Where are dragon souls engineering ships? They've already entered the 44 nautical mile zone, going one nautical mile deeper than our submersible. They're still moving forward, but very slowly, as if they're probing as they go. Chin Duo Duo said they're very cautious, releasing a sonar pulse every 5 minutes to scan the seabed topography. It seems they really want to get close to the fortress. Let them go, Lyno said.

We'll wait and see for now. Understood. Also, the Coral Society's unmanned submarine lost contact at 43 nautical miles. Just like our submarine, they tried to restart communication three times, all of which failed. As expected that Linmo looked at Su Chian, continue to analyze the samples and see what else we can find.

Sukiank, she divided the sediment sample into three parts. One part was kept for archiving, one part was used for further chemical analysis, and a third part was prepared for a riskier experiment. I want to test its biological response, she said. What do you mean? Leeway asked. Since it has a potentially biompatible material, I want to see how it reacts to living cells that Sue Chian took out a small transparent dish from the incubator.

Inside were some translucent gel-like substances with tiny clusters of cells scattered throughout the gel. These are stem cells extracted from the seaweed we cultivate, placed in a culture medium that simulates seawater, she explained. I take a little bit of sediment powder, sprinkle it on the edge of the culture medium, and observe the cell migration and differentiation response. Is there any risk? Yes, such said frankly, if this material is toxic or radioactive, all these cells will die, but I think it's worth a try. Leno thought for a few seconds and nodded.

take precautions and operate remotely. The experimental equipment was moved into the isolation control box. Using a robotic arm, Sue Chian carefully took out a small pinch of grayish white powder and sprinkled it on the edge of the culture dish about 5 mm away from the nearest cell cluster. Then she activated the time-lapse microscopic imaging system. The camera automatically takes a picture every 30 seconds to record the real-time changes in the cells.

For the first 10 minutes, nothing happened. The cell clusters remained still and showed no obvious movement. The culture medium was clear without discoloration or precipitation. 12th minute. The clump of cells closest to the powder began to show subtle changes at its edges.

Several cells detached from the main clump and slowly moved towards the powder. The movement was very slow, only a few micrometers per minute, but it was clearly visible under a microscope. They're approaching on their own. Such Chian stared at the screen. 18th minute.

As the cells moved near the powder, their morphology began to change. The originally round cells elongated, extending pseudapodia-ike protrusions to gently touch the powder particles. Upon contact, a faint fluoresence appears on the cell surface, a sign of a change in cell membrane potential, usually indicating an excitation or stress response. But the cells did not die. Instead, they began to adhere more tightly to the surface of the powder particles as if probing.

25th minute, even stranger things happened. The powder particles began to lighten in color at the sightes where they adhered to the cells. They gradually changed from grayish white to translucent and finally to almost completely transparent, leaving only a very faint outline. The cells attached to it increased in size by about 20% and their internal structures appear to be more active. It's being digested by the cells.

Leeway asked incredulously. It has not entirely digestion. Do Sue Chanchian zoomed in on the image. Look, the structure of the powder particles is breaking down, but the breakdown products seem to be absorbed by the cells. The cell's R&T showing any toxic reactions.

Instead, it as if they've gained extra nutrients or information. She quickly operated the instrument to monitor the cell's metabolism in real time. Data shows that the cells that came into contact with the powder experienced a 60% increase in metabolic rate and improved energy production efficiency. The activity of several key intracellular enzymes was also significantly enhanced. This material has a promoting effect on cells.

Suian summarized and it seems to be able to be recognized, contacted, and then broken down and utilized by cells. This is incredible. Dot. If it's fragments of the fortress's outer armor, what does that mean? Linmo asked. Leeway thought for a moment.

This means that the fortress may have biompatibility. Its materials can not only self-repair, but also be recognized and interacted with by living organisms. It is even possible that some of its functions are achieved through interaction with biological systems. For example, for example, energy exchange, information transmission, or symbiosis. Leeway said, "If its original design intention was truly preservation of civilization, then establishing some kind of symbiotic relationship with surviving organisms may be a way to achieve long-term protection." This hypothesis silenced the laboratory.

An ancient war fortress capable of interacting with living beings. It kills creatures within 50 nautical miles, yet uses materials that can be recognized and utilized by cells. It purifies radiation, yet it also releases substances that alter water quality. Conflicts are increasing. But perhaps behind these contradictions lies a unified logic.

They just haven't found it yet. 1:00 in the afternoon, the Dragon Souls engineering ship sent back the first message. They successfully reached the 43 nautical mile mark and collected water and seabed samples. However, while attempting to continue deeper, the ship's electronic systems began to experience intermittent malfunctions, forcing them to retreat. The samples they brought back are now being sent to the laboratory at the rear.

At the same time, the coral society sent a data sharing request to Mo Yuan Go through clandestine channels. They were willing to provide all previously monitored energy release data in exchange for Moong G's preliminary analysis results on sediment samples. They knew we got the samples. Chin Duo Duo said they must have heard about our underwater drones return from the black market. We can exchange Linmo decided but only provide basic data such as chemical composition and radiation levels.

The results of the cell experiments will remain confidential for now. Dot clear 2:00 in the afternoon. Suian completed the second round of experiments. She experimented with different types of cells interacting with the sediment powder fish cells, crustation cells, and even cultured mamalian cells. The results are similar, but not exactly the same.

Marine organisms cells respond more actively to powders, resulting in higher efficiency in their breakdown and absorption. Mamalian cells can also interact, but at a much slower pace, and the metabolic boost is smaller. This material seems to have a preference for marine life, Sue Chanchchan said. Or rather, it was originally designed for the marine environment. It makes perfect sense that the fortress sank to the bottom of the sea.

Leeway said, looking at the experimental data, Lynn Mo suddenly thought of a question. If the materials of this fortress can be used for biometric identification, what will happen to the organisms living around it that come into long-term contact with these material fragments? Such an was stunned. She slowly turned her head to look at the cells in the petri dish that had become active. They might evolve, she said softly, or be modified. Long-term exposure to this material could lead to adaptive changes in an organism s metabolism structure and even genetic information.

like those creatures in that sea area that can survive in a high radiation environment. Lynn Mo asked, "Not only that, does Such Chan expression turn serious? If the material can really exchange information with cells, then it may carry some kind of design blueprint. After a living organism comes into contact with it, it may change in the direction preset by the blueprint." She paused for a long time. That fortress may be more than just a fortress. It may also be a bio-engineering factory.

Chapter 136 blueprints and flesh and blood. At 11 p.m., the lights were still on in the Mouan Pavilion Command Center. Su Chian sat at the workbench in the biology lab, her eyes fixed on the microscope's eyepiece. She had been observing for 6 hours straight, only drinking half a cup of water and eating two compressed biscuits in between. The cells in the petri dish are changing at an accelerating rate.

The clump of algal stem cells that initially came into contact with the sediment powder has now almost completely broken down and absorbed those grayish white particles. The cells are three times larger than before. And their morphology has also undergone a fundamental change. No longer a standard sphere, but elongated into thin filaments intertwined and connected to each other, forming a complex network. Even more disturbing is the abnormal differentiation of the internal structure of these cells.

Some cells have a surge in the number of chloroplasts, turning them dark green. Some cells have abnormally developed mitochondria with metabolic activity eight times that of normal cells, and some cells have even begun to secrete a translucent mucus-like substance that slowly diffuses in a culture medium. They are differentiating. Sue Chian said into the communicator. Her voice a little dry, but the direction of differentiation is completely inconsistent with a normal developmental path of seaweed cells.

It asks more like they're transforming into different functional modules according to some preset program. What program? Lin Mo's voice came through the communicator. I don't know. Sue Chanchian adjusted her focus but looks very organized. Look, the cells that secrete mucus are concentrated at the edge of the network like they are building a barrier.

High metabolic cells are located at the network nodes like energy supply stations. Cells containing chloroplasts are evenly distributed probably responsible for light energy harvesting. It is almost like the prototype of a miniature ecosystem. Dot. She paused for a moment.

Give them more time and resources and I doubt they could actually develop into a complete self-sustaining microbial structure. There was a few seconds of silence on the other end of the communicator. Continue to observe, Linmo said. Record all the details of the changes. Also conduct a control experiment culturing the same cells using normal seawater samples to see if similar changes occur.

It s already being done. Sue Chian looked at another incubator next to her. The control group is doing normally. The cells are just dividing and proliferating normally without any abnormal differentiation dot. So the changes do indeed come from those sediment powders.

Yes, do that. Su Chanchian took a deep breath. And I think that is not all. The powder may carry some kind of instruction information that tells the cells what to become and what to do. It asks just that our current experimental conditions are too simple and the cells can only do this much dot.

What if a more complex organism came into contact with this material? Such an answer immediately. She thought of the dead creatures in that sea, the mutated species that could survive under high radiation, and the strange environmental changes within 50 nautical miles of the fortress. I don't know, she finally said, but I think Wedi better not let any living organism come into contact with this stuff for extended periods of time. At least until we figure out how it works. 1:00 in the morning, Chin Duo Duo sent some new information.

Dragon Souls lab has the results. His voice was exceptionally clear on the communication channel late at night. After they received the samples brought back by the engineering ship, they analyzed them overnight. Now, inside information is starting to circulate. Get to the point, Lynn and Mo said.

Okay, that Duo Duo organized his thoughts. First, they confirmed the radiation purification phenomenon. The radiation level in the waters 40 to 50 nautical miles around the fortress is indeed about 40% lower than normal. Moreover, this purification effect is slowly spreading outward expanding by about 0.5 nautical miles per day. Dot.

Secondly, they detected a high concentration of nanocale metal particles in the water sample. The main components are high melting point rare metals such as titanium, zirconium, and hapneium with particle sizes ranging from 10 to 100 nanmters and complex organic modification layers on the surface. nanometal particles. Lewi interjected. What's the concentration? Each liter of sea water contains approximately 3 to 5 million particles.

Chian duo said this concentration is thousands of times higher than that of normal deep sea water. Experts at Dragon Soul speculate that these particles may have detached from the surface of a fortress material or be byproducts of its energy cycle. And the third one Linmo asked. Thirdly, biological samples. Dachshind Wu's voice became serious.

In the plankton samples they collected at a distance of 43 nautical miles. They found a large number of abnormal cell structures. The chloroplast arrangement of algae was changed. The shell components of small crustations showed abnormal mineralization and even the gene expression profile of bacteria showed significant shifts. He paused for a moment.

Dragon Souls conclusion is that the fortress is continuously releasing some kind of bioactive factor which can alter the physiological structure and function of organisms that come into contact with it. Their biggest concern now is whether this effect will be passed up the food chain and eventually affect humans. The command center was quiet for a moment. What do they plan to do? Lin Mo asked. There is no clear action plan at the moment.

Chen Duo said there are internal disagreements. Some people advocate taking military action immediately to destroy or seal off the fortress before the impact expands. Others believe that we should continue to study it. After all, if we can master this technology, its value will be immeasurable. Dot.

What about the remnants of Wings of Liberty? Still no direct news. But a new batch of goods has appeared on the black market. Who bought it? Dot. Lyno pondered for a while. Keep an eye on it, he said. Also try to reach out to various team send a new message using their metaphorical format.

The blueprint is in, but where is the flesh and blood? Clear. After the communication ended, Lynmo walked to the observation window and looked at the dark sea outside. The lighthouse beams swept rhythmically across the sea in the distance, illuminating the rolling waves. Sparse stars shone in the night sky, but most were obscured by thin clouds. Shhal walked in from outside holding a document in his hand.

Close the file. But hopefully we won't need these. I hope so too, Sher House said. But it's always good to be well prepared. He paused for a moment, then continued.

Yes. After Sherhow left, Lynn Mo returned to the control panel. He pulled up all the data he had collected over the past week and began to reanalyze it. That fortress was likely more than just a war stronghold.

It is a complex multifunctional facility. It can fight, produce, purify the environment and even modify living organisms. Liebe Lin Mo connected the communication in the technical area. Yes, Leeway's voice sounded a little tired, but very clear. If we assume that the fortress was designed to rebuild civilization after a cataclysmic event, then what functional modules do you think it should include? Lewi thought for a while.

First, it must have a shelter function to protect survivors. Second, it must have a production function to provide survival resources. Third, it must have environmental restoration capabilities to restore damaged ecosystems. Fourth, it must have defensive capabilities to counter external threats. Fifth, he paused for a moment, then added, it may also need biological adaptation functions to help survivors adapt to the changed environment after the disaster.

Biological adaptation. Then Montac repeated, "Yes," Leewi continued, "If the post- disaster environment undergoes fundamental changes such as increased radiation levels, abnormal climate, or ecosystem collapse, then the human body may not be able to survive in the long term. In that case, some kind of adaptive modification will be needed to allow humans to survive in the new environment. So those bioactive factors might not be weapons, but rather tools for modification, possibly." Lewwayi said, "If the designer's original intention was to protect civilization, then helping survivors adapt to the environment is a reasonable consideration. This question hung in the air of the command center. 3:00 in the morning. Su Chanchian has made a new discovery. Lynmo, you'd better come and take a look. There was a suppressed shock in her voice.

Lynmo rushed to the biology lab immediately. Through the observation window, he saw Su Chian standing in front of the control panel. A microscope connected to a large screen. The screen displayed magnified images of cells. "What happened?" Lin Mo asked.

"Look here," Su Chian said, pointing to a corner of the screen. That was an area at the edge of the petri dish, furthest from where the powder was initially placed. It originally contained only ordinary undifferiated al stem cells. But now those cells have also changed. Although they did not come into direct contact with the powder, they began to move toward the direction of differentiating cell networks.

Their morphology gradually changed and their internal structure began to reorganize. This change is spreading. Sue Chanchian pulled up the time series images. Starting from the powder placement point, the area of influence is expanding outward at a rate of about 2 mm/ hour. It is not through material diffusion, but more like information transmission.

The differentiated cells seem to be sending some kind of signal to the surrounding cells telling them what to do. Dot. She zoomed in on an area. The images show that the two cells are connected to each other by elongated cytoplasmic protrusions with dense vesicle transport activity at the junction. They are exchanging substances and information.

Sue Chian said differentiated cells transfer some of their contents to undifferiated cells inducing them to also change. This process is highly directional and organized and is by no means random dot. Lenmo stared at the screen for a long time. What will happen if this process is not interrupted? All the cells in the entire petri dish will join that network. Sue Chian said, becoming a unified multifunctional biological structure.

It s like the prototype of a tissue or the beginning of a simple organ dot. Can you stop? IV tried it. Dr. Sue Chian pointed to several discarded culture dishes next to her. Removing the powder, changing the culture medium, and even using drugs to inhibit cell metabolism.

Didn't he work? Once it starts, the process can't te stopped. It s like the cells are programmed to complete the entire differentiation process, though. She turned off the screen, turned around, and her face was somewhat pale. Lyn Mo, this is terrifying. What if the active agents released by that fortress have the same effect in a natural environment? She didn't continue, but Lyn Mo understood what she meant.

If nanop particles in seawater, smart materials and sediments, or even mutated organisms themselves could transmit such modification commands, then the entire marine ecosystem could be reprogrammed. According to a blueprint set by some unknown designer, it was 4 in the morning and it was still dark. The core members of my pavilion gathered in the conference room, the atmosphere heavy. Su Chian presented all the experimental data. Lewi reported the technical analysis results.

Chin Duo Duo summarized the intelligence from all sides. Sherhow explained the defense preparations. After everyone had finished speaking, all eyes turned to Linmo. We face a choice, Lyn Mo said slowly. Continue to stand by and wait for the situation to develop or intervene proactively and try to influence or stop the process.

He paused for a moment. But whichever path we choose, we must understand that we are not facing a simple enemy nor an ordinary natural disaster. We are facing a system designed to reshape life. We don't know who designed it. We don't know what its ultimate goal is.

We don't know what it will do to the world. All we know is this. If we do nothing, the initiative for change will always be in the hands of others. The meeting room was silent. On a sea outside the window, the morning light began to gradually appear.

A new day is about to begin and this world is quietly changing. Chapter 137. Longwave echo. After the morning meeting, Lynn Emmo stayed alone in the conference room. The coffee on the table had gone cold and several extinguished cigarette but lay in the ashtray left by sure how would smoke one or two when under pressure.

Outside, the sky was fully bright and sunlight streamed through the bulletproof glass, cutting a bright patch of light across the floor. Lyn Mo didn't touch the thick analysis report. He just sat there looking at the large seam map on the wall. On the map, the location of Muan Pavilion is marked with a green triangle 120 nautical miles to the southwest. A red circle represents Awakening Fortress.

It was pushed into this position.

Lyn Mo understood this perfectly. If he had a choice, he would continue to develop quietly, accumulate resources, and expand his advantages until no one could challenge him. But this suddenly awakened ancient fortress disrupted everything. It was like a boulder crashing into calm water, the ripples causing all the boats to rock violently. There was a gentle knock on the door.

"Go in," Linmo said. Such Chanian pushed open the door and came in, carrying a fresh cup of hot tea. She took away the cold coffee cup, replaced it with a teacup, and then sat down opposite Lynn and Mo. Leewi is continuing to analyze various team information. She spoke first.

D Such Chanchian lowered her head and looked at her clasp hands. Cells develop resistance.

Even she paused. Even when I kill some of the differentiating cells with radiation, the surrounding cells will proliferate rapidly to fill the gaps and then continue the differentiation process. It's as if some kind of collective consciousness is maintaining this process so that even if the individuals are destroyed, the blueprint itself will not be destroyed. Lyno put down his teacup. You believe this was conscious? I don't know.

Sue Chian raised her head, a look of confusion in her eyes. From a biological point of view, this can be explained as a phenomenon of swarm intelligence like ant colonies or be colonies. This is not just a technical issue, it's a power issue. Who has the right to decide the fate of a sea area? Who has the power to divide the ocean into restricted zones? Dragon souls believe they exist because they represent order and collective interests. But Lynn Emmo doesn't like others making decisions for him. I've never liked it. At 100 p.m.

Leewei came to find Linmo with a decoded and complete information. The information was longer than expected and it took three pages to print. Metaphors within metaphors, but the basic meaning is understandable that Leeway handed the printed document to Lin Mo. The Veritine believed that the fortress is not a war machine or at least not entirely. It is a prototype of a civilization preservation facility designed to rapidly rebuild a habitable environment after a major catastrophe.

Lynn Emmo quickly skimmed through the text. According to Vera's team, this facility cenamed Ark is part of a great evacuation plan of a lost civilization. This civilization foresaw a catastrophic catastrophe on its home planet and thus built multiple such facilities distributed across various key ecological zones around the world. Each facility contains the civilization's technology database gene pool and environmental modification system. After a disaster, the facility automatically activates, beginning to repair the surrounding environment, modify local organisms, and rebuild a new habitable ecosystem for the survivors.

The transformation is not random but carried out according to a preset ecological template. Do leeway pointed to one section. These templates are based on the civilization s research on the ideal ecological environment and are said to integrate the advantages of multiple species aiming to create a more adaptable and stable ecosystem. So those active factors are executing a template program. Lynn Emmo asked.

Yes, but the problem is Leeway turned to the next page that according to the incomplete records obtained by Varess team, disagreements arose within the civilization during the later stages of the construction of these facilities. Some believe that the world should be completely reconstructed according to the template while others believe that more space should be reserved for natural evolution. The final design was a compromise which may have left many ambiguities. What's the meaning? This means that the core program of the facility may not be completely stable or there may be undiscovered vulnerabilities. Leewi said what's more troublesome is that the resonance activation method used by the remnants of Wings of Liberty is an irregular method pieced together by the Stonemason's Brotherhood from damaged records.

They may have only activated part of the function but damaged the integrity of the system. Lin Mo continued reading. In the final part of the message, Vera's team gave their assessment. The fortress is currently in a semi-autonomous state. Basic maintenance procedures are running, but the advanced decision-making module may be damaged or missing.

It is still performing environmental modification tasks, but may not be able to correctly determine the boundaries and priorities of the modifications. It's like a self-driving car. The navigation system is broken, but the accelerator and steering will still work. Leeway explained. It knows to move forward, but it doesn't know where to go or how to avoid obstacles.

Can the remnants of Wings of Liberty control it? It might be possible in the short term because they provide the initial instructions, but in the long term, Leeway shook his head. As the system as autonomy increases, control may shift. After all, by design, these facilities should ultimately be taken over by qualified administrators, not temporary activators. What qualifications are required for an administrator? The information didn't go into details, but it mentioned genetic authentication and knowledge inheritance. It's possible that only descendants of that civilization where those who have mastered specific technologies can fully take over.

Lyn Mo put down the printed document and walked to the window. Outside the window, the Muen Pavilion base was in operation. Ships were loading and unloading cargo at the dock. Workers were feeding animals in the aquaculture area, and patrol boats left white trails on the distant sea. Everything seemed orderly and stable.

But if the fortress in the southwest really gets out of control, if its area of modification continues to expand, and if Dragon Soul takes extreme blockade measures, all of this could be disrupted. Where is Vera's team now? Lyn Mo asked. The message didn't he say, but the longwave signal source was located in the southeast about 200 nautical miles away from us close to the deep sea trench area. Leewi said they may be hiding in some secret base. Can we get in touch? Can we speak directly? It's difficult.

They only use longwave broadcasting and don't accept point-to-point communication. It may be for security reasons or it may be due to equipment limitations. Then Montac nodded. He needed more information, but his access to it was limited. Vera's team possessed crucial knowledge, but were unwilling or unable to communicate directly.

Dragon Soul had the capability to act, but its thinking was too militaristic. The Coral Society was only concerned with research. The Stonemason's Brotherhood remained silent. Wings of Liberty were trapped in their fortress. Moan Pavilion is stuck in the middle.

At 3 p.m., Sherhow brought the patrol team's test report. The analysis results of the abnormal biological samples are in. He placed the report on the table. They're indeed physiological structural changes. Fish gills have developed additional filtration structures.

Crustaceians have abnormally hardened shell components and some plankton have even shown polyloy mutations. Are there any traces of active ingredients? Yes. Trace amounts of nanometal particles were detected in the tissue samples consistent with the composition reported by Dragon Soul, Sher House said. However, these organisms were captured 80 nautical miles away, far exceeding the current influence range of the fortress. This indicates that the active factors are either spreading faster than we thought, or there are other transmission routes.

For example, ocean currents, migratory organisms, and even atmospheric deposition. Shouse said, "If nano particles are small enough, they could be carried by the wind to very distant places." Dot. Lyno rubbed his temples. The situation is getting complicated at a pace he doesn't quite like. We will strengthen biological monitoring in our surrounding areas, he said.

We will pay special attention to aquaculture areas and fish farms. Any abnormalities will be reported immediately. Dot it already underway. Sure. How replied.

In addition, I suggest activating the level two emergency response plan. All ships entering and leaving the area should undergo additional disinfection procedures. Personnel must be thoroughly cleaned after contact with seawater and food and water sources should be tested more frequently. Dot. Agreed.

Go and make the arrangements. After sure how left, Lin Mo looked at the map again. He looked at the red area, at the various color markers around it, and at the spiderweb like lines connecting them. Then he picked up a pen and drew a circle around the location of Muan Pavilion on the map. It's not a defensive circle.

It's a circle of influence. If we can't te stop change, he muttered to himself. Then at least we should learn to control the direction of change. The sky outside the window is starting to darken again. Night is coming, but beneath the surface, change continues.

Chapter 1 138. Testing in the fog. The sea fog rolled in from the southwest at 4 in the morning. It wasn't naturally formed sea fog. Meteorological monitoring data showed that the water temperature, air temperature, and humidity in that area did not meet the conditions for fog formation.

But the fog still came, grayish white, clinging to the sea surface, spreading slowly and steadily. The Mo Yuan Pavilion's early warning radar was the first to detect the anomaly. The fog's boundaries were too neat, and its movement was unnaturally uniform, as if an invisible hand was pushing it. When Lin Mo was awakened by the duty officer, the leading edge of the fog, had already reached the 70 nautical mile mark. Monitoring footage showed that the grayish white fog, like a living thing, spread across the sea surface, swallowing everything in its path.

Visibility rapidly dropped to less than 50 m. "Radiation level?" Lin Mo asked as he put on his coat. Normal, no abnormal increase. Do we s voice came through the communicator, but other parameters have changed. The magnetic field fluctuation amplitude in the fog area has increased three-fold and the concentration of charged particles in the air has increased significantly.

Also, sonar detection shows a large number of virtual images at the edge of the fog area as if it has been interfered with by something dot. What about biological reactions? We are monitoring it. However, the fog is too thick and the optical equipment is basically ineffective. We are mainly relying on acoustic and infrared sensors. When Lynn and Mo enter the command center, a real-time situation map was already displayed on a large screen.

The gray shadows representing the fog area were slowly expanding on the map like a drop of ink spreading in water. Sure, how and Chandu Duo had already arrived. Su Chian rushed over from the biological monitoring area holding the data she had just printed. The chemical composition of the fog is in the analysis that she handed the report to Lynn Emmo. The water vapor content is normal, but it contains trace amounts of nanometal particles consistent with the components detected in the seawater around the fortress.

There are also several unknown organic molecules with very complex structures. There are no matching entries in the database. active factor. Linmo asked possibly, but we don't have live sample exposure tests, so we can't be sure. Such Chian said, "For safety reasons, I've ordered all ventilation systems to be shut down and internal circulation filtration to be activated.

I advise everyone to stay home for the time being, and those who must go out should wear protective equipment." Sure. How then reported, "The entire patrol team has been recalled. The number of personnel at the dock and outer outposts has been doubled and all have been issued gas masks and protective suits. Ships are temporarily suspended pending further instructions. Chi and Dwa's intelligence came a little later, but it was more comprehensive.

Dragon Soul has also detected the sea fog. Their fleet has retreated to the edge of the fog area and is deploying drones to attempt reconnaissance through the fog. Half of the Coral Society's buoy array is inside the fog area. Communication is currently normal, but there is a lot of noise in the transmitted data. The Stonemason's Brotherhood is still silent.

He paused. In addition, a new piece of intelligence has just appeared on the black market. Someone claims that before the fog formed, they saw a band of light rising from the sea in the direction of the fortress. And then the band of light dispersed and the fog came. The price is very high, but no one has confirmed it yet.

Lynn Mo stared at the gray area on the screen. light bands, folk nano particles. There should be a connection between these things. How fast is the fog moving? He asked. Currently, it is moving at an average speed of 3 nautical miles hour, but its direction has changed.

Do leeway pulled up the trajectory map. Initially, it was heading due east, but an hour ago, it started to veer north, and now it is moving roughly northeast. If it maintains this direction and speed, it is expected to reach the outer perimeter of our base in 8 hours. thought 8 hours. Time is not tight, but it's not ample either.

How thick is the fog? Lynn Emmo asked again. It has a vertical height of about 30 to 50 m, only close to the sea surface and does not extend upwards, but its horizontal range is very large, currently covering a circular area with a diameter of about 40 nautical miles, and it is still expanding. Is the fortress in the center of the fog? Yes, according to the last clear satellite image, the fog did indeed begin to spread from the fortress, but it is still unclear whether it was actively released by the fortress or influenced by some natural phenomenon. The command center fell silent. Everyone looked at Lynn Mo, awaiting his decision.

Lyn Mo walked to the control panel and brought up the base's defense deployment map. Green icons represented friendly units, red represented potential threats, and gray represented unknowns. Now, a huge gray mass is pressing in from the southwest. Activate level three alert. He finally spoke.

Suspend all non-essential activities. Production and aquaculture areas are ready to relocate at any time. Sure. How? Set up a second perimeter 5 nautical miles from a base. If anything unidentified approaches, issue a warning first, then take action.

Clear leeway. Mobilize all available monitoring equipment and establish an observation network at the edge of the fog zone. I need to know the real-time changes in the fog, its composition, and whether there is anything else inside. We already working on it, but our existing equipment has limited FOD penetrating capabilities. Then let us use the simplest method.

Linmo said, "Deploy buoys, set up a sensor array and use wire transmission. The longer the cable, the longer the monitoring will extend." The cost will be very high and we may not be able to recoup the cost of the equipment. Equipment can be rebuilt, but information cannot be discarded. Lynn Mo turned to Chanduo. Contact our insider at Dragon Soul and exchange intelligence.

We are willing to exchange any discoveries they make for real-time data from the edge of the fog zone, especially the results of drones penetrating the fog. Okay. What about the Coral Academy? Contact them as well. Tell them we can provide fog composition analysis data in exchange for their buoy array historical records. I need to know what happened in that area before the fog formed.

Orders were issued one after another and the command center became busy again. Suchen did not leave. She stood beside Lyno, watching the constantly changing gray area on the screen. What do you think this is? She asked softly. Test Lyno said her probe.

Dot. What are you testing? Testing the environment s reaction. Testing the organism's reaction. Testing our reaction. Lin Mo pointed to the fog diffusion trajectory.

You see it as not spreading aimlessly. The direction is adjusted and the speed is controlled. It asked more like conducting some kind of systematic scan using fog as a medium to collect information. What information are you collecting? Lynmo did not answer immediately. He recalled a line from Vera's team message.

The blueprint is not a picture but a memory. If that fortress is indeed rebuilding its environment based on some kind of old memory, then it first needs to know what the current environment looks like. It needs to know where the creatures are, where the resources are, and where the threats are. fog may be its eyes and ears. At 7:00 in the morning, it got light, but visibility in the foggy area did not improve.

Leeway's monitoring network transmitted back the first batch of data. The composition of the fog was changing the closer to the center, the higher the concentration of nano particles and the more types of unknown organic molecules. The intensity of magnetic field interference increased with depth. After entering the fog zone five nautical miles, wireless communication was essentially unusable. We deployed three buoys, but only the shallowest one is still transmitting signals.

Leeway reported the other two lost contact after going 8 nautical miles. The last data before they lost contact showed that the concentration of nano particles underwater was 10 times that of the surface die. What about living things? A large number of plankton died at the edge of the fog zone. Fish exhibited abnormal behavior. Some swam frantically while others remained completely still.

Even stranger, the traps we set three nautical miles away caught several species that should have been in the deep sea. They seem to have been driven up from the depths by something dot. Such an pulled up images of those deep sea species. Several hagfish, several giant isopods, and a rare deep sea dragon fish. These creatures usually live hundreds of meters below sea level, but now they were appearing in shallow water.

Were their physiological indicators? The stress response was extremely strong. The heart rate was two to three times the normal value and the concentration of stress hormones in the blood was extremely high, but strangely there was no obvious physical damage nor any indication of the invasion of active factors. It's like they were scared, Sher House said. or they were forced into it, Lyn Mo added. He looked towards the center of the fog.

There the ancient fortress lay silently on the seabed. The fog it released was altering the ecology of the entire sea area. At 9:00 in the morning, Chi and Duodo brought information about the exchange of dragon souls. Their drones failed to penetrate the fog. Chi and Duo Duo said all three medium-sized drones lost contact 10 nautical miles after entering the fog area.

Images transmitted before the loss of contact showed abnormal optical refraction phenomena inside the fog and the drone's own navigation systems experienced serious positioning errors. They think it's electronic interference. More than that, Dragon Souls technicians suspect that the nano particles in the fog may have formed some kind of distributed antenna array that can actively interfere with electromagnetic waves in specific frequency bands. Moreover, the interference mode is very intelligent and will dynamically adjust according to the signal characteristics of the target. Are our buoys still working? It's still there, but the transmission rate has dropped by 70%.

Leeway said it might be because we're using wire transmission and the signal modulation method is relatively old, no longer interfering with key frequency bands. Being old can sometimes be a disadvantage and sometimes it can be an advantage. What about the Coral Society? They were happy to exchange data. Chand Duo Duo pulled up a document. This is all the records of their buoy array in the 12 hours before the fog formed.

The data shows that in the 6 hours before the fog formed, the microbial community in the waters around the fortress underwent drastic changes. The number of a certain metal-loving bacteria increased by thousands of times in 4 hours and then suddenly all of them died. After the death, the concentration of nano particles in the water began to rise. Is the death of bacteria a cause or consequence? The Coral Society believes this is the cause? They speculate that the fortress activated some mechanism that induced bacteria to proliferate and accumulate metal elements, then killed the bacteria and extracted nanoparticle raw materials from them. These particles were then released into the atmosphere, forming fog.

Using bacteria as a production line and seawater as raw material, it produces what it needs. Very efficient. Lynn Emmo commented, "It is also terrifying." Such Chian said, "If it can manipulate microorganisms at will, then the entire ecological balance of the ocean is under its control. Today, it can create fog. Tomorrow, it can create toxic alba blooms or something even worse." At 11:00 a.m., the edge of the fog zone was still 40 nautical miles from the Mayuan Pavilion base.

But a new problem has arisen. The monitoring network detected unusual water movement on the northeastern edge of the fog covered area. A strong upwelling carrying large amounts of nutrients and cold seawater surged from a depth of 200 m. Upwelling itself is not uncommon, but its location and scale are rare. is right in front of the expanding fog area as if clearing the way for the fog to arrive.

Upwelling changes water temperature, salinity, and nutrient composition, Sue Chanchan said looking at the data. This disperses the existing planktonic community, creating space for new communities. If the nano particles and active factors brought by the fog require specific environmental conditions to function, then upwelling is preparing a petition dish. We are systematically transforming the environment, Leeway concluded. Moreover, the steps are very clear, Linmo said.

First, change the water chemistry, then release the modification factor, and finally use fog as a transmission medium and cover. Each step is interconnected. He walked up to the map and looked at the everexpanding gray area. He is now almost certain that this is neither a coincidence nor a system malfunction. This is a purposeful and systematic action.

That fortress is reshaping the sea area according to the blueprint it remembers. The question is where will it stop? At noon, Sher House sent back an emergency report from the outer perimeter cordon. Mr. Lynn, ships have appeared at the edge of the fog zone that his voice was somewhat tense. They are not from Dragon Soul, nor from any known force.

Three small speedboats emerging from the fog. No markings, no communication response, and they are heading northeast. Uh, intercept them. Linmo ordered immediately, but maintain distance and do not enter the fog zone. Understood.

Two patrol boats have been dispatched. Intercept them, and contact is expected in 15 minutes. The atmosphere in the command center suddenly became tense. A ship emerging from the fog. Who is it? A remnant of the Wings of Liberty or something else entirely? 15 minutes felt like an eternity.

Lynn and Mo stared at the clock, counting each second very clearly. At 12:08, Sherhow reported again, visually confirmed. There are three modified assault boats. Each boat carries three to four people, all wearing full protective suits and masks. The hulls show obvious signs of modification with additional antennas and equipment boxes installed.

Is there hostility? Not yet. They slowed down after spotting our patrol boat, but didn't turn. One of them raised a white flag. Raise a white flag. These days, the standard procedure for encounters at sea is to communicate first, then approach.

Raising a white flag directly is either an extreme sign of weakness or a trap. Maintain vigilance. Allow them to approach to a safe distance, but do not allow them to board the ship. Lyno said, "Have them send a representative over in a small boat. Only one person clear.

At 12:16, a small boat was lowered from the assault boat carrying one person and slowly sailed toward the patrol boat of Mayuan Pavilion. Through the remote monitoring footage, Lin Mo saw the person. Medium build, wearing a gray protective suit, the face mask obscuring the view. The movements were steady without any unnecessary actions. After the small boat pulled alongside the patrol boat, the man raised his hands to indicate that he was unarmed.

Sherhow's men quickly searched him and after confirming his safety, led him into the patrol boat's cabin. Sherhow's voice came through the communicator. The man has boarded the ship. He said he wants to see you, saying there's important intelligence to exchange. He won't reveal his identity, but he gave you this.

The scene shifts and Sherhow's hand appears in front of the camera holding a metal badge. The badge is circular with intricate etched patterns on its surface and at its center is a geometric design. Three intersecting rings each with fine engravings inside. Lin Mo didn't recognize the pattern, but Chin Duo Duo gasped in shock on the communication channel. That s an internal token of the Stonemason's Brotherhood, he said.

Only members of level three or higher have it. The details of the pattern represent the branch and level of authority. I've seen this pattern once before. It is the symbol of the deep divers group. They are an elite group within the brotherhood specifically responsible for exploring deep sea ruins.

The stonemason's brotherhood emerging from the fog. Haven't they fallen silent? Shouldn't they distance themselves from wings of freedom? Bring him over, Lyno said. Clear. Communication ended. Lyn and Mo looked at the close-up of the badge on the screen. Three intersecting rings. The deep diver group.

Things seemed to be taking an unexpected turn. The fog was still slowly advancing over the sea outside the window. Gray, silent, unfathomable. The person emerging from the fog brought new variables. Chapter 139.

Words of the deep ones. The isolation chamber located on the east side of the Muan Pavilion base is an independent prefabricated unit. It has an independent ventilation system with the air filtered through three stages. Behind the one-way observation window is the monitoring room where Lynn Mo, Sue Chanchian, and Leewi are currently standing.

The man who called himself the deep diver sat on a metal chair inside the isolation pod. He had removed his protective suit and put on a gray bodysuit. His mask was also gone, revealing a face that appeared to be around 40 years old. His cheeks were thin, his eyes were sunken, and he had stubble on his chin. Dot. He leaned forward resting his elbows on his knees. Report any unusual activity immediately. After the order was given, everyone began to take action. Lynn and Mo stayed in the monitoring room and observed chinnying for a while longer. This man possessed a contradictory quality, both weary and alert, both frank and reserved. He said a lot, but there was certainly much more he didn't say.
