The sky outside the window gradually darkened. The fog over the sea was still slowly but steadily advancing northeastward, gray, silent, unfathomable. Were the people brought in from the fog allies or the beginning of another trouble? Lynamote didn't know, but he knew one thing. The peaceful days in this sea were long gone. Chapter 140.

The messenger in the fog. At 5:00 in the morning, the fog stopped advancing. It didn't dissipate, but rather remain still like the tide after it has reached its highest point. Monitoring footage showed the grayish white fog wall hovering 35 nautical miles from the Mo Yuan Pavilion base. Its edges so neat they looked as if drawn with a ruler.

Within the fog zone, visibility remained zero. Outside the fog zone, the morning light began to illuminate the sea. Leeway stared at the data screen, his fingers rapidly tapping on the keyboard. He was verifying Chinnying's second prediction regarding the fog spread radius. According to the formula provided by Chennying combined with the intensity of the first wave of energy released by the fortress and local hydraological data, the maximum radius of influence of the fog was theoretically 52 nautical miles.

The actual measured value is now 51.5 nautical miles. The error is less than 1%. Either his formula is true or his team did extremely precise preliminary observations, Leeway told Lyno. But either way, it shows that they have more information than we thought. Dot.

Lynn Emmo stood in front of the observation window, watching the sky slowly brighten outside. Inside the isolation pod, Chi Ining was still asleep in a relaxed posture, seemingly completely unconcerned about his situation. Perhaps he was very confident. "What are the results of the whole inspection?" Linmo asked. Su Chian pushed open the door and came in holding the test report in her hand.

Her face showing a mixture of confusion and vigilance. It has very troublesome dot. She placed the report on the table. We scan the entire hull of those three assault boats. The surface is covered with a layer of nano particles with an average thickness of only a few micrometers, but the distribution is extremely uneven.

Dot. She pulled up the scanned image. The screen displayed a three-dimensional model of the hull with different colors representing different particle densities. It was clear that the particles formed several distinct clusters at the stern and on both sides of the hole with very regular shapes all elongated or net-like. What is even stranger is the structure that Sue Chian zoomed in on an area.

These particles aren't t randomly attached. They reconnected. Look here. The particles are arranged in chains and there are cross connections between the chains forming a kind of neural network like structure. Duh.

A neural network. Leeway leaned closer to look. You mean these particles are self-organizing? It looks like it. Sue Chanchian pointed to the details in the image. Moreover, the structural complexity varies in different clusters.

The stern is the most complex with three levels of branches. The hull is simpler with only the main trunk and onele branches. It looks like it s growing the growth requires energy. These particles may extract energy from ship hole materials or seawater. Such anchin said.

Our sampling analysis revealed a weak electrochemical gradient inside the particles. Although very weak, it does exist. Lenmo stared at the images. Grayish white nano particles adhered to the ship's hull in the sea fog, then began to self-organize, forming neurallike structures. "It sounded like science fiction, but the test report was right before his eyes." "What functions does it have?" he asked.

"It is not clear yet," Sue Chanchan said. "But Wee, he done a few experiments. We found that these structures are very sensitive to changes in electromagnetic fields. Chapter 141. Deep breathing. For hours before the deep breathing began, the monitoring network of Mayuan Pavilion detected the first sign. It was not an energy fluctuation, nor a change in magnetic field, but sound. The deep sea microphone array recorded a low-frequency sound wave around 10 hertz, lasting about 3 minutes.

The sound source was located in the massive dome structure directly beneath the fortress. The soundwave form was peculiar, rising slowly at its peak, remaining stable for a period, and then slowly declining like a long sigh. Leeway's expression was solemn when he projected the acoustic spectrum onto the main screen. This is mechanical vibration at least not the kind of mechanical vibration we usually see. He said the frequency is too stable and the waveform is too clean that it has more like a pressure regulation process in some kind of fluid system.

Dot. Is the dome adjusting its internal pressure? Lynn Mo asked very likely. Leeway pulled up the data from the last deep breath. Look, there was a similar sound, wave, signal 2 hours before the last breath. Only the frequency and duration were slightly different.

Su Chian realized in early Earth life was anorobic.

Chapter 142. When the fog disperses, the deep breathing lasted for 4 hours and 17 minutes. As the energy release curve began to plummet, Leeway stared intently at the screen, his fingers hovering over the keyboard. According to the information provided by Chinnying, the subsequent recovery phase would be more intense than the release with the system recovering the dissipated energy and matter with maximum efficiency. Sure enough, radiation levels plummeted below baseline within half an hour, becoming 50% lower than before the deep breathing began.

Seawater temperature dropped simultaneously. Warm currents vanished without a trace, and a thin film of ice, even formed on the surface, extremely unnatural in warm waters. The fog wall began to dissipate. It wasn't blown away by the wind, but rather as if drawn back by an invisible hand, rapidly contracting from the outside in. The grayish white mist flowed back along a certain regular path, converging towards the central area, eventually forming a huge funnel-shaped vortex on the sea surface before being sucked into the deep sea.

The whole process was clean and efficient, leaving no residue. The fog dissipated, but the remaining sea area was completely unrecognizable. Monitoring data is being transmitted back continuously. The marine ecosystem within 52 nautical miles has suffered a devastating blow. Plankton density has decreased by more than 99%.

Fish have almost disappeared and coral and sponge communities on the seabed have died on a large scale. The water is severely acidified with pH values generally below 7.0 reaching 6.5 in some areas. Dissolved oxygen concentrations are close to zero. This is a dead sea. How long will it take for the ecosystem to recover? Lynn Emmo asked.

Such an looked at the data model with a grim expression. Without external intervention, natural recovery could take decades. She said water acidification and hypoxia can persist for a long time, making it difficult for new organisms to survive in such an environment, even if they migrate in from the outside. What is more troubling is that we detected high concentrations of heavy metals and radioactive isotopes. These were released from seabed sediments and could have been present for centuries.

Do is this the kind of environment a fortress needs? It asks very likely Sue Chanchian pulled up a report. We found a large number of anorobic microbial spores in water samples we collected at a depth of 48 nautical miles. These spores were originally buried deep in the seabed sediment layer but have now been released into the water. Once conditions are right, they will germinate and reproduce. What are the conditions? Oxygen-free, acidic, and rich in specific minerals.

Souk Chian said that exactly the condition the sea area has right now. Dot. Then Mo understood the fortress wasn't being destroyed randomly. It was being precisely prepared as a culture medium. First clean the site, sterilize it, adjust the environmental parameters, and then sew the seeds.

What kind of ecosystem do those anorobic microorganisms form? I don't know. Sue Chanchchin shook her head. Modern oceans are almost entirely aerobic ecosystems and anorobic microorganisms only exist in small quantities in some extreme environments. There is no precedent for what would happen if they multiplied on a large scale. Dot.

The command center fell silent. Outside the window, the sea had returned to calm. Sunlight shone on the still scarred waters, making them shimmer and appear normal. But underwater, death was spreading. At 10:00 a.m., the lurking devices storage device was sent to the isolation analysis room.

It was a palmsized metal cube with no interfaces or markings on its surface. After examining it with a scanner, Leeway confirmed that it used a non-standard encrypted data storage technology, had a complex internal structure, and featured physical anti-tamper design. We need his biometrics and password. Leeway reported Linmo arrived at the isolation chamber. Shanning was already prepared.

He walked to the pass through window, placed his palm on the designated area, and whispered a 16-digit password. The metal cube glowed with a faint blue light for 3 seconds before going out. It s ready, the shadow said. It s now readable, but it can only connect to non-network devices. If a network connection is detected, it will automatically lock and erase the data.

Dot very cautious, Linimo said. We must be careful. Dot. Chianing returned to his chair. Some people are willing to risk their lives for the information in here.

Leewi connected the device to a completely isolated analysis terminal. There was no internet connection, no wireless module, and all unnecessary peripherals were disconnected. Data reading begins. The first batch of data declassified was the observation log of the Brotherhood of Stonemason's deep divers over the past 3 years. It included thousands of pages of written reports, tens of thousands of images, and massive amounts of sensor data.

The timeline spanned from the discovery of the fortress to its activation by the Wings of Liberty. Leeway quickly skimmed through the abstract. Their observations are far more detailed than ours. He said they recorded the fortresses energy fluctuation cycles, magnetic field change patterns, and even predicted that it would periodically self-maintain. Data shows that the fortress conducts a deep self check on average every 81 years.

The last one being 67 years ago. If it follows the normal cycle, it will remain dormant for at least another 14 years. The activation of Wings of Liberty accelerated this process. Not only was it brought forward, but it also disrupted its program. Leewi pulled up a technical analysis document.

According to the Deep Ones 1's research, the normal awakening of a fortress should be a gradual process requiring external administrator authentication and command input. But the resonance technology used by Wings of Liberty is essentially a brute force attack forcibly activating its basic system with a high energy pulse, skipping all security verification stuff. So, it's in safe mode now. It s worse than safe mode. Lewi said it asks like a computer being forced to boot up but the operating system is corrupted so it can only run some basic programs.

These programs run according to preset instructions but they have lost the control and regulation of higher level logic. Such Chanchian also joined the analysis. She focused on the biological impact. The data contains extensive research on bioactive factors. The deep sea divers collected hundreds of biological samples from the area surrounding the fortress, recording physiological changes under long-term exposure.

The results were alarming. Fish exhibited abnormal organ proliferation. Crustaceians showed altered shell structures and algae displayed disordered gene expression. They conducted human cell experiments. Sue Chantians voice trembled slightly.

They use volunteer cell culture dishes to contact the active factors. After 24 hours, the cells began to spontaneously reorganize, forming a structure similar to a neural network. After 48 hours, these structures began to release electrical signals as if they were communicating. And then what? The experiment was abruptly terminated and all samples were destroyed. Such Chanchian flipped through the records, but several deep ones who participated in the study reported that in the following weeks they experienced auditory hallucinations, visual hallucinations, and involuntary muscle twitches.

One of them even wrote down an undecipherable code in his sleep. Nerve infection. It's possible that the active factors affected the nervous system in some way. Such Chanchian said, "Based on the data, it is speculated that these factors can not only modify physiological structures, but also transmit information, even information at the level of consciousness." Lynn Mo looked at the shadowy figure inside the isolation chamber. Has this person been exposed to the active factor? Has he been affected? At 2 p.m., the data analysis moved into its core section, the administrator agreement.

This part of the content was clearly encrypted at a higher level and the decryption process took nearly an hour. What was ultimately revealed was a series of complex technical documents and design drawings. This is the structural diagram of the fortress. Leeway zoomed in on a three-dimensional cross-sectional view. The images show that the fortress is divided into seven layers.

The top layer contains the defense system and external interfaces. The middle three layers are production, storage, and energy zones. And the bottom three layers are the core control area and database. The entire structure resembles an inverted pyramid with most of its volume buried deep beneath the seabed. The administrator interface is here.

Leeway pointed to a location in the core area. You need to enter from the inside and there are multiple verifications. You can only gain access after passing physical access control, gene scanning, and knowledge tests. Is there an alternative entrance? Yes, but they read all at a deeper level requiring drilling through the seabed which is extremely risky. Leeway pulled up another map or you can enter from directly above the fortress.

There an emergency maintenance passage here which is normally closed but may be briefly opened during system selfch check. When is the next selfch check? Leway check the records based on its operating cycle. The next partial selfch check should be in 72 hours. It will last for about 15 minutes during which time the passage will open but only enough for one or two people to enter quickly and you must return within 15 minutes otherwise the passage will close and you'll have to take the internal route. 72 hours 3 days time is very tight.

What's the content of the knowledge test? Lynn Mo asked this part of the data is more fragmented. The deep diver team mainly collected the logical framework of the test and some sample questions. The test is divided into three parts. System principles, ecological ethics, and civilization survival. The system principles section examines the understanding of the fortress's design philosophy and operational mechanisms.

The ecological ethics section examines the manager's value judgments regarding environmental modification. The civilization survival section examines the decision-making ability under disaster scenarios. The questions are all open-ended with no standard answers, Leeway said. But the system will score based on the logical consistency of the answer, its value orientation, and the degree of adherence to preset principles. The passing score is 80%.

What if it doesn't pass? The document doesn't say, but it mentions that those who fail need to undergo re-education. There's no record of what the re-education specifically entails. It's very likely not a pleasant experience. At 4:00 in the afternoon, Chin Duodo brought the latest developments from all sides. Dragon Soulless fleet has begun its advance.

His voice carried an urgency. They reentered the 50 nautical mile zone and are deploying deep sea probes. Meanwhile, their high alitude reconnaissance aircraft have taken clear photographs of the fortresses surface showing clear structural changes. What changes? Some previously sealed hatches have opened, revealing the equipment inside. Judging from their shape, they could be weapon launch ports or exits from production units.

Shien duodo paused. In addition, according to information from within Dragon Soul, the nuclear weapons proposal has entered the formal discussion stage. They are assessing strike plans and potential environmental impacts. What about the Coral Society? They set up a temporary research station on the edge of the Dead Sea and began collecting water samples and biological remains. However, their focus does not seem to be on the ecological disaster, but rather on the newly emerging anorobic microorganisms.

One researcher publicly stated that this is an excellent opportunity to study early life on Earth. The Stonemason's Brotherhood, a complete shutdown, all external activities suspended. But our sources say there's a split within the Brotherhood with some younger members dissatisfied with the conservative attitude of the higher-ups and plotting independent action. Someone might try to make contact with the fortress. Lynn Emmo ended the communication.

He walked to the map and looked at the area of the sea that had just undergone a deep breath. It was calm now, as if nothing had happened, but the monitoring data told him that something new was brewing underwater. The spores of anorobic microorganisms are germinating. Heavy metals and radioactive materials are slowly settling. The aquatic environment is moving closer to a certain preset standard.

72 hours later, the fortress will open its self inspection channel. Compile the information into a briefing. Lynn Emmo said to Leewi, "We need to develop a complete plan. How to approach the fortress, how to enter the passage, how to pass the test, how to rescue people, and how to retreat the should we involve hidden shadow?" Yes. Lynn Mo nodded, but only in an isolated environment via video conference.

Tell him they need to know all the details. The exact location of the passage, the route after entering, the possible defense systems we might encounter and the location and distribution of the remnants of the wings of Liberty. What if he's lying? Then let us verify it. Lynamo said, "Use our own data to compare with his information. We need to clarify any contradictions." Dot.

At 6 p.m., Chinnang participated in the first planning meeting via encrypted video from inside the isolation pod. He seemed very cooperative, answering every question. He provided detailed parameters regarding the location of the passage, the entry angle, and the time window. He even drew a partial route map inside the fortress, marking the areas where the Wings of Liberty might operate. They remain concentrated on the top three floors right now, Chining said, pointing to the structural diagram near the production line because there are food synthesis equipment and medical facilities there.

They can't te get into the controlled area. The defense system onet allow it. Can you contact the people inside? It asked difficult. Dot. Chinn shook his head.

Communications inside the fortress are closely monitored, but I have a few agreed upon signaling methods such as leaving markers in specific areas. If they see them, they might respond a rescue priorities. The shadowy figure remains silent for a few seconds. Save those who can still remain conscious first, he concluded. Those who have already been assimilated may be beyond saving, but at least give them a choice.

The meeting lasted until 8:00 p.m. The preliminary plan is complete. 3 days later, utilizing the fortress's 15minute self inspection window, we will enter from directly above an especially designed deep sea submersible. The crew will be reduced to two people in MMO and chinning. The others will be responsible for perimeter support and evacuation.

The risk is extremely high, but this is currently the only opportunity. After the meeting, Lynn Mo remained alone in the command center. He looked at the 3D model of the fortress on the screen. The inverted pyramid structure casting a huge shadow on the seabed. 72 hours.

Many things can happen during this period. Dragon Soul may launch a nuclear missile. The Coral Society might cause some unexpected problems. The radical faction of the Stonemason's Brotherhood may take action. Underwater, anorobic microorganisms are multiplying.

Time is passing. Outside the window, the moon rose over the sea. Its cool light shining on the recently extinguished waters. Silence. But Lynn Emmo knew that this silence wouldn't last long.

New changes will come soon. Chapter 143. Preparation and variables. The day after the plan was finalized, the Mayuan Pavilion base entered a period of intense preparation. Leeway was in charge of modifying the deep sea submersible.

The small submersible, originally used for scientific research and observation, was towed into the dock and began a large-scale modification. An additional pressureresistant layer and an electromagnetic shielding layer were added to the outer shell. The propulsion system was upgraded to a silent model and all navigation equipment was replaced with an interference resistant mechanical inertial composite system. The most troublesome part was the interior space. The cabin, which originally accommodated three people, needed to be rearranged to make room for equipment while ensuring that two people could move freely inside.

Leeway and his technical team worked continuously for 18 hours, revising the blueprints seven times before finally finalizing the plan. Oxygen reserves are enough for 48 hours and food and water are enough for 72 hours. Leeway reported to Lynn Mo his eyes bloodshot. We have two communication systems. One is conventional sonar communication, but it may fail inside the fortress.

The other is an emergency underwater cable communication system, but requires laying spools and has limited range. What about defense? Only the most basic ones do pulled up the design drawings. two high voltage stun guns with a range of 5 meters. They can be used against humans, but their effectiveness against machines or mutated creatures is questionable. There are also four acoustic stun grenades which can create shock waves underwater, but the user will also be affected when using them.

Dot, that's enough, Linimo said. We're not going to fight a war. Such an studying samples of anorobic microorganisms in another laboratory. The spores in the water samples collected from the edge of the Dead Sea had already begun to germinate. Under the microscope, the grayish white hy grew slowly, intertwining and forming a thin membrane-like structure.

The growth rate is faster than expected that she recorded the data. For every degree the temperature rises, the division cycle shortens by 15%. At this rate, a visible bacterial film will appear on the surface of this sea area in 3 days. What the dangers? It is not clear yet. Such Chanchin said, "But the bacterial film may change the optical properties of a sea surface affecting the penetration of light.

The deeper impact is on the ecosystem if they proliferate on a large scale. They will consume organic matter in the water and release methane and hydrogen sulfide. The latter is toxic and deadly to most marine life." She paused for a moment. Moreover, the metabolic products of these microorganisms may enter the atmosphere. Hydrogen sulfide will be converted into sulfur dioxide in the upper atmosphere, further affecting the climate.

A local problem is evolving into a regional problem. Chindwood was intelligence network operates around the clock. More and more information is coming from Dragon Soul. The nuclear weapons proposal has moved from the discussion stage to the feasibility study stage. There are three specific plans.

First, to directly hit the fortress's surface structure and destroy it with a shock wave. Second, to strike the seabed supporting it, causing it to collapse and be buried. And third, to detonate it in nearby waters, triggering an underwater landslide that covers it. The third option has the most supporters. Chien Duo Duo said it has a relatively small impact on the environment and a high success rate.

Geological expert from Dragon Soul have completed simulations and believe that dropping three medium yield nuclear bombs at a specific location could trigger a large-scale sliding of seafloor sedimentary layers. What about time? Preparations can be completed in as little as 5 days. Dot Chian Duo Duo paused. But there are internal disagreements. Some people think we should wait and see what the fortress does next.

Others believe that the risk increases with each day of delay. The Coral Society acted even faster. They established three permanent research stations on the edge of the Dead Sea and began continuous 24-hour observations. The latest report shows that a biofilm of anorobic microorganisms has appeared in a localized area of about 2 km and is expanding at a rate of 30% per day. The academic community is very excited.

She and Duodo said several senior researchers even proposed to actively fertilize the microorganisms to accelerate their growth in order to study their complete life cycle. Although this proposal was rejected, it shows that their focus is not on ecological disasters at all. Dot. The Stonemasons Brotherhood remained silent, but she and Duodo noticed some unusual fund flows. Several accounts linked to the Brotherhood were making large-scale purchases of deep sea diving equipment and special materials with the suppliers being several long-established European military companies.

Someone is making preparations, but we Danty know who it is or what they re going to do. Chin Duodo concluded. The following afternoon, the Shadow completed a detailed map of the fortress's interior routes inside the isolation chamber. He used video conferencing to draw a 3D path diagram bit by bit on a shared screen. Starting from the entrance passage, it goes through a sloping maintenance pipe, enters the upper corridor, then goes down through the production area, and finally reaches the perimeter of the control area.

There's a fork in the road here. Chenning pointed to a location with the cursor. Left leads to the energy core. Right leads to the database. We need to go to the database first.

There's an interface there for conducting knowledge tests. What will we encounter on the road? Linmo asked. First, there is the automatic defense system. Shadow said the monitoring system inside the fortress should still be working, but based on the experience of the Wings of Liberty, the system usually one tack unless you enter a clearly prohibited area. The bigger threat is the people of the Wings of Liberty.

They could be anywhere. Dot. How many of them are there? The latest intelligence indicates that there are approximately 30 to 40 people, but they're scattered across various areas. Some may have already lost their mobility, while others may have become aggressive. Chining pulled up several blurry photos taken from early reconnaissance data.

The images showed several people in protective suits, but their postures were strange. Some are huddled in a corner, some were standing still, and some are talking to a wall. These are images from 2 weeks ago. Their condition may be worse now. How do we avoid them? Try to use the maintenance passages and pipe levels.

Chining said, "Those places are narrow and they rarely go there. But the downside is that the routes are complicated and it is easy to get lost. I will remember the main landmarks, but if I encounter a branch, I may need to make a judgment on the spot." The meeting lasted for over an hour. Chenning described the characteristics, potential risks, and coping strategies for each key point in as much detail as possible. Lynn and Mo took notes, intending to create a simple guide.

After the meeting, Leewi came to find Lin Mo holding a tablet in his hand. The deep sea submersible modifications can be completed tonight and testing can begin tomorrow, he said. But there's a problem. The power system, it needs to supply propulsion, life support, shielding, and equipment simultaneously. At full capacity, it can only sustain operation for 30 hours.

What if there's an unexpected delay? Streamline the equipment. Lynn Mo said except for life support and propulsion, everything else can be reduced as appropriate. The shielding layer can have its power reduced and the navigation equipment can be used intermittently. Extend the power reserve to 40 hours. This would increase the risk.

Entering the fortress itself carries risks. Lynn Mo said, "What we need to do is balance the risks, not eliminate them." Dot. Leeway nodded and went back to work. As evening fell, Sue Chanchand brought a new discovery. An abnormal growth pattern has emerged in the anorobic microbial bofilm.

Instead of expanding evenly, the bofilm has thickened significantly in certain areas, forming several radial ridges. These ridges extend outward from the center of the Dead Sea, pointing precisely towards several important surrounding marine ecosystems. It acts like establishing a connection channel that Sue Chanchian pointed to the satellite image. The mcelium is actively adjusting its growth direction extending towards areas richer in nutrients. Moreover, the mcelial density inside the ridges is particularly high which may indicate a stronger material transport capacity.

What you transmitting? It could be spores or it could be metabolic products. Such Chanchchan said, "What worries me more is that we detected trace amounts of active factors in the water samples at the end of the ridge line, the same components released by the fortress." Dot. Lynn Emmo stared at the grayish white lines on the image. They spread across the sea surface like blood vessels connecting the Dead Sea to the surrounding healthy waters. Is the fortress expanding its sphere of influence? Or it could be building some kind of infrastructure? Su Chanchian said, "If the bacterial film can stably transport matter and energy, then it can deliver active factors to more distant places without moving the fortress." This hypothesis reminded Lin Mo of the nanoparticle network in the fog.

Both are distributed structures and can transmit matter and information. The fortress's transformation strategy appears to be multi-layered. large-scale fog and deep breathing for environmental resetting. Fine nano networks for monitoring and microbial membrane networks for material transport. A complete system is taking shape.

At 8:00 p.m., Sherhow reported on the adjustments to the defense deployment. We have added three layers of monitoring network around the base, he said, showing the deployment map. The outermost layer is a sonar buoy array covering a radius of 20 nautical miles. The middle layer consists of patrol boats and drones responsible for mobile response. The innermost layer is shore-based defense facilities, including high-pressure water cannons and sonic generators.

What threat are you referring to? The main threat is biological. Sure house said if those mutated creatures or microbial membranes expand in our direction, we need to issue early warnings and intercept them. In addition, we also need to guard against infiltration by other forces. Dragon Soul, the Brotherhood, and even the Wings of Liberty may send people over. What about the evacuation plan? It has already been planned.

Sure, how pulled up another document. In extreme circumstances, all core personnel and critical supplies can be evacuated within 4 hours, but that would mean abandoning the base, which would result in significant losses. Doc, I hope we won't need it, Lin Mo said. Late at night, Lynn Mo arrived at the dock alone. The submersible undergoing modification sat in the dock, scaffolding erected on its hull where technicians were still busy at work.

The blue light of welding torches flashed in the night, and the rhythmic clanging of metal echoed. 3 days later, he will ride in this iron canister to dive more than 100 m into the seabed and enter an ancient facility full of unknowns. The risk is very high. it might not be able to come back. But he had no better choice.

Letting the fortress continue operating would eventually destroy this sea area and everything the mo yuan pavilion had built. Taking the initiative offered at least a sliver of hope. Then montak such voice came from behind her. She walked to his side and looked at the deep sea submersible in the dock. Are you worried? She asked.

I'm worried Linmo answered truthfully. But the things that need to be done still need to be done. I can come along. My knowledge of biology might be useful. Dot.

No. Linmo shook his head. The situation inside is too complicated. I need you to stay outside. If something goes wrong, at least someone will know what happened and someone can continue to work on solutions.

Dot. Suchan remained silent for a while. You must come back, she finally said. I'll try. The two stood side by side watching the bustling activity in the dock.

The night was deep and the sea breeze carried a salty damp scent. On the distant sea, moonlight shone on the Dead Sea region where everything was pitch black, devoid of any reflection. Microbial bofilms were growing. Nano particles were likely still suspended and the fortress lay silently awaiting its next self inspection on the seabed. There are still two days left.

Many things may happen and many things must be prepared for, but at least for this moment, there's still a brief moment of peace. Lynamo took a deep breath and turned to leave the dock. There's still a lot of work to do. There's no time to linger. Chapter 144, the eve of departure.

24 hours before departure. In the equipment room on the third basement floor of Mo Yuan Pavilion, Linmo and Shiening were conducting a final check. Two black waterproof backpacks were laid out on a long table, and every item inside was carefully evaluated, weighed, and secured. Two oxygen regeneration canisters, each with three replacement cartridges. 24 compressed rations, each only the size of a thumb, but providing 400 calories.

A first aid kit sealed in a waterproof bag containing not only standard medications, but also radiation antidote and nerve sedatives. Chining picked up a multi-tool knife, weighed it in her hand, and then put it back. "We on one te bring this," he said. "The internal structural materials of the fortress are very special. Ordinary knives can't te cut them and might even trigger the stress sensing system.

Then what should we use?" Lynn Mo asked. Chenning took out two short metal rods from his equipment about 20 cm long with fine patterns on their surface. He held one end and twisted it gently and the other end popped out a semi-transparent crystal blade gleaming with a faint blue light. Highfrequency oscillating blade. Chinnying explained the blade vibrates 40,000 times per second, capable of cutting through most materials and generates almost no heat, making it difficult for thermal detectors to detect.

Lyn Mo took one and tried it out. It felt very light and had good balance. Brotherhood technology an improved version dot chining didn't he say much sheathing the knife Ichi take one but hopefully we one teen need them dot the communication equipment was the most difficult decision to make the interference inside the fortress was too strong making conventional radio communication virtually useless team tried several solutions and finally selected an underwater communication system based on ultrasonic modulation its effective range was only 500 m, but its advantage lay in its strong anti-inference capabilities. WLL also bring these. Leeway took out two devices the size of matchboxes.

Short-range laser communicators. We can use these if we encounter obstacles that block the sound waves. But the line of sight between the two points needs to be clear and there can be no suspended particles interfering. Dot. What about the backup plan? There is no backup plan.

Lewi said frankly, "Even a lot of equipment could fail in that environment. You have to be prepared for a complete loss of contact." Then Montac nuted. He had considered this possibility long ago. The equipment inspection lasted 2 hours. The function, usage, and emergency alternatives of every item were repeatedly confirmed.

Shadow's understanding of the fortress played a crucial role. He knew what was useful and what was superfluous. Dante, bring any electronic timing devices? He cautioned, "The Fortress S energy field will interfere with the crystal oscillator, causing time to run fast or slow. Use this." He took out two oldfashioned mechanical watches with three hands on the dial and thick cases. When fully wound up, it can last for 40 hours with an error of no more than 10 seconds per day.

Inside, the sense of time can easily become confused, so a reliable reference is essential. Such Chian was conducting final biological tests in the adjacent laboratory. The bacterial film in the Dead Sea area was expanding at an accelerated rate, now covering more than 50 square kilm of the sea surface. Even more disturbing was the fact that the film was showing stratification. The surface layer was composed of ordinary grayish white hy while the underlying layer contained a dense dark red structure.

It s like it s differentiating that she told Lynmo who had come to check. The surface layer is responsible for photosynthesis or material exchange while the lower layer may be responsible for structural support or other functions. We took a sample and sliced it and found a microtubial system similar to blood vessels in a dark red layer dot. What you transmitting? I don't know, but there is liquid flowing in the micro tubes and the flow rate is very regular. Sue Chanchian brought up the microscopic image.

Moreover, these bacterial films are now starting to release a gas mainly composed of methane and hydrogen sulfide, but mixed with trace amounts of organic compounds which have a similar structure to the active factors released by the fortress. Is it spreading active ingredients? Possibly. Su Chanchient said the wind will carry the gas to farther places. Although the concentration is very low, the long-term effects of exposure are unpredictable. Lynn Mo and Mo watched the bacterial film image on the screen expand continuously.

Grayish white and dark red intertwined like a huge wound slowly growing on the sea surface. Once we enter the fortress, you continue monitoring, he told Su Chanchian. If there are any unusual changes, record them. If the situation gets out of control, evacuate according to the contingency plan. Dot.

Such Chian wanted to say something, but in the end, she just nodded. At 300 PM, Chi and Duo Duo brought a summary of the latest intelligence from all parties. Dragon Soul's nuclear strike plan has entered its final stage of evaluation. They have deployed a strategic nuclear submarine, which is currently on standby 100 nautical miles east of the Dead Sea. At the same time, three bombers carrying bunker buster warheads have been stationed at the forward base as a backup plan.

But they still hesitant, Chin Duo said. The latest reconnaissance photos show more openings on the Fortress S sur surface, some of which reveal moving mechanical structures. Dragon Solless technical advisers believe this may be part of some kind of defense upgrade and recommend taking action as soon as possible. What about the Coral Society? They are now divided into two factions. Do flipped through the report.

One faction advocates immediately collecting a large number of bacterial film samples and transporting them back to the main base for genetic modification research attempting to cultivate a controllable version. The other faction believes this is too dangerous and advocates establishing an isolation zone for observation first. Which faction has the upper hand? The radicals. The council has just approved an emergency grant to purchase large-scale culture equipment and biosafety facilities. It looks like they really intend to cultivate those microorganisms on a large scale.

A madman, Leewi said in a low voice. Will the Stonemason's brothers make any new moves? Shin Duo Duo paused. Yes, but it has strange, he said. We detected that security at several of the Brotherhood s outer outposts has suddenly been tightened with all personnel undergoing strict checks to enter and exit. At the same time, a batch of special supplies was secretly transported to the southeast, including high precision sonar arrays and deep sea drilling equipment.

What are they trying to do? I don't know, but it is definitely related to the fortress. Chandu duo said also the remnants of the wings of freedom have started selling their goods on the black market again, but this time it is not energy crystals, but some strange biological tissue samples. They res said to have been collected from inside the fortress and they were priced extremely high, but they were quickly bought by anonymous buyers. Lynmo recalled Chiening mentioning that the people inside the fortress might be experiencing physiological changes. Could those biological tissue samples be? He shook his head, suppressing the thought.

In the evening, the submersible completed its final underwater test. Leewei personally piloted the vehicle, diving to a depth of 100 meters in the waters surrounding the base to test all systems. Propulsion, steering, life support, communications, and shielding all met design specifications. There is only one problem, Leeway reported after coming ashore. In a simulated fortress energy field environment, the power consumption of a shielding layer is 30% higher than expected.

If there is strong interference, the power consumption will be even faster. Can it be optimized? It has too late. Leewi said we can only bring an extra set of spare batteries, but that will increase the weight and affect our maneuverability. After discussing it with Chennying, Lynn Emo decided not to bring a spare battery. The best way to conserve power is to get inside the fortress as quickly as possible.

Chining said once weary inside the maintenance corridor external interference will decrease. What we need is speed not endurance dot. It was late at night 8 hours before departure. All preparations are complete. The submersible is docked at pier 3 fully charged and has undergone inspection.

Equipment packs have been loaded and secured in their designated positions. Route maps and emergency plans have been printed out, laminated and distributed to each person. Linmo made final arrangements at the command center. While I'm away, the base will be jointly managed by Isu Chian and Sherhao. He told the core members, "Lewi will be in charge of technical support and Chin Duo will be in charge of intelligence monitoring.

If we do not return within 72 hours and there is no news, we will handle it as the worst case scenario." What's the worst case scenario? Sure, how asked. Dragon Soul launches a nuclear strike or other forces trigger catastrophic consequences. Linmo said, "At that time, you will need to decide whether to evacuate or take other actions. There are contingency plans, but you must be flexible and adaptable to the situation. The atmosphere in the room was heavy.

We will maintain communication monitoring." Leewi said, "Although the chances are slim, we will definitely receive any signals you send. Be prepared that we may not come back," Linimo said calmly. This is not pessimism, it's reality. After the meeting ended, the others left one after another. Lyno stood alone in front of the control panel, looking at the live video feed of the fortress on the large screen, was taken by a high altitude reconnaissance aircraft at dusk, and the metal structure lay quietly on the seabed, its surface occasionally flashing with blue light.

Shining was brought over from the quarantine area. He had already changed into a special diving suit with lightweight protective gear over it. His face was expressionless, but his eyes were very focused. Final route confirmation. Linmo brought up the 3D map.

The two spent half an hour going through every key point, every alternative plan, and every potential risk. Shinying had an excellent memory, and his description of the fortress's internal structure was detailed and accurate. He could even recall some of the markings on the corridor walls. Have you been inside? Lynamote suddenly asked. The shadowy figure remained silent for a few seconds.

No, he said, but my mentor went in while it was dormant. He made a lot of sketches and took many photos. He never came out. Dot. What happened? The system suddenly initiated a partial selfch check and he was trapped in the maintenance tunnel.

The shadow's voice was very soft. The last thing we heard from the communication was his breathing getting slower and slower and then it stopped. 3 months later, the fortress went back into deep hibernation. When we went to look for him, we only found a protective suit and some calcified tissue. Lyn mode did not speak, so I have to go in.

Dot. Chining raised his head, not for revenge, but to find out what it is and to prevent more people from becoming like that. It was 3:00 a.m. 2 hours before departure. The two arrived at the dock and made final preparations before boarding.

The submersible hatch was already open. The interior was cramped but logically laid out. Linmo sat in the pilot's seat and Channing sat in the passenger seat fastening their seat belts. Leewi was making a final check outside when he gave a thumbs up through the observation window. All systems are functioning normally.

Su Chanchian walked over and handed Lynn Mo a small sealed box. A live sample of the bacterial film. She said it might be useful if we encounter a biologically related system, but we must be very careful not to let the sample leak. Dot. Lynmo took the box and secured it to the storage compartment next to his seat.

We will be careful. Sher Howal led his patrol team to maintain vigilance on the perimeter. The sea was calm in the night with only slight ripples from a gentle breeze. The Dead Sea region in the distance was pitch black, as if even a moonlight had been absorbed. Chen Duo Duo sent the final intelligence update from the command center.

Dragon Souls nuclear submarines have begun moving to their designated positions. The Coral Society's transport fleet has just departed port, fully loaded with cultivation equipment. We've lost signals from two monitoring points at the Stonemason's Brotherhood for unknown reasons. Continue monitoring, Lynn Mo said. Stay vigilant.

Understood. Good luck to you. Communication ended. The shadowy figure adjusted its breathing mask and checked the oxygen flow. "Are you nervous?" he asked.

"A little," Lyno said honestly. "But we've done all the necessary preparations." "That's enough," Chining said. Inside, plans never keep up with changes. "The important thing is to stay calm and adapt to the situation." The hatch slowly closed, the ceiling latches clicking softly. The interior lights dimmed, leaving only the necessary instrument panel backlighting.

Leeway tapped the outer shell from the outside. Then his footsteps faded into the distance. The submersible detached from mounting frame and slowly sank into the water. Through the observation window, Lynn Emmo saw the lights on the dock gradually blur, eventually turning into shimmering spots of light on the water surface. As the descent began, the pressure gradually increased and a slight pressure was felt in his eardrums.

Depth gauge displays 10 m, 20 m, 50 m, 100 m. The submersible adjusted its attitude and turned southwest. The thrusters started, emitting a deep hum on the navigation screen. The preset route lit up in green, and the destination marker was 87 nautical miles away. We set off.

There is no turning back. Lynn Emmo glanced at chinning. The other person had their eyes closed as if resting or perhaps recalling something. Outside the window, the deep sea was pitch black with only the submersible lights illuminating the water a few meters ahead. Occasionally, bioluminescent creatures would swim by, leaving fleeting trails of light, 87 nautical miles, which would take 6 hours of the current speed.

Upon arrival, we arrived just in time for the fortress's self inspection window. Time is very tight, but this is just the beginning. Chapter 14587 nautical miles in the deep sea. The submersible moved steadily forward in the darkness. The depth gauge read 120 m, a depth where natural light had completely disappeared.

The beam of the submersible light cut through the seawater, illuminating a small area ahead. Occasionally, deep sea creatures startled by the light would quickly swim away, leaving blurry shadows at the edge of the field of vision. Lynn Emmo stared at the navigation screen. The green route stretched forward with the destination marked 87 nautical miles away. At the current speed of 14 knots, it would take another 6 hours and 11 minutes.

Just enough time. The dashboard displays all parameters as normal. Power consumption is 5% lower than expected, possibly due to lower water temperature and reduced heat dissipation pressure at night. The shielding layer is functioning stably and external interference levels remain within safe thresholds. He adjusted the seat to better fit his back.

The cockpit was cramped. Two adults would have almost no room to move around. The air circulation system emitted a low hum, filtering out carbon dioxide and replenishing oxygen. The humidity was well controlled. There was no noticeable stuffiness.

The shadowy figure opened its eyes, glanced at the depth gauge, and then closed them again. Take a nap, Linmo said. I'll wake you when we get there. I can't sleep. The shadowy voice came through the communicator, sounding somewhat distorted.

I can see those images as soon as I close my eyes. What image? Among the materials collected by the brotherhood, there are some things that shouldn't be seen. The shadow paused for a moment. Such as those creatures that have been completely transformed by active factors. It has not a simple mutation.

It has a reconstruction, skeletal rearrangement, organ proliferation or degeneration, nervous system reorganization. He opened his eyes and looked out the observation window at the pitch black deep sea. The most frightening thing is that some of the modifications seemed to be purposeful. For example, a deep sea eel originally had degenerated eyesight and relied on electro sensing to hunt. After coming into contact with active factors, it grew extra sensory organs on both sides of its head with a structure as complex as an artificially designed radar array.

Is the fortress testing biomodification programs or they recollecting data? Chinying said, "According to the design documents, this fortress should be equipped with a complete ecological database which stores tens of thousands of biological templates, but those templates are based on the environment of the designer as home planet and may not be suitable for Earth. So, it needs experimentation and parameter adjustments." Lynn Mo recalled the bacterial membranes growing on the edge of the Dead Sea. A grayish white surface, a dark red under layer, and a microvascular system for transporting substances. It looked like the prototype of some kind of basic ecological unit. What if it completes the test? Begin large-scale transformation, Chining said.

Following the blueprint, gradually transform this sea area and even a larger area into a pre-esigned standard ecosystem. That may be a world completely unfamiliar to us. The submersible continued its descent, reaching a depth of 150 m. The water temperature here was even lower, only 4Â° C. The pressure gauge readings increased steadily, and the outer shell emitted a slight creaking sound than normal deformation of metal under pressure.

The navigation system indicated that they had entered the outer area of the Dead Sea. Although still dozens of nautical miles from the center, the water quality had already begun to change. Looking out the observation window, the transparency of the seawater had noticeably decreased as if shrouded in a thin mist. The suspended particles have increased. Lyno looked at the sensor data, mainly biological debris and mineral particles.

The concentration of nano particles is also starting to rise. The power consumption of the shielding layer increased by 8%. The submarine sat up straight and brought up the view from its external camera under the illumination of its navigation lights. Countless tiny particles could be seen suspended in the seawater, drifting slowly like snowflakes. Some particles reflected a metallic sheen in the light.

The fortress s eyes. He said these nano particles form a distributed monitoring network. We entered their sensing range. Dot will be discovered. Not necessarily.

Dot. Chenning stared at the data. If the particle density is not high enough or we haven t triggered their recognition threshold, they may just be recorded as background noise. But the closer to the center, the greater the risk though. He operated the control panel, dimming the submarine lights and changing the angle of the beam.

Reduce active light emission and lower the sonar pulse frequency. We need to drift in like a falling leaf. The submersible switched to a semi-passive navigation mode. Propulsion power was reduced and course and depth were maintained primarily through adjustments to buoyancy and control surfaces. Speed decreased to 8 knots, but the submersible became quieter and more stealthy.

2 hours have passed. The depth was maintained at around 200 m, a depth that would avoid potential wind and waves on the sea surface without subjecting the vessel to excessive pressure. They had sailed approximately 28 nautical miles with 59 nautical miles remaining. Lynn Mo checked the life support system. Oxygen reserves were at 87% and power at 79%.

At this rate of consumption, it was enough to sustain them until they reached their target location and returned. Do you need something to eat? He asked Chinnying. Not for now, Chinnying said. It has best to be on an empty stomach before entering the fortress. In case of an emergency, having food in your stomach will increase the risk of vomiting.

Dot. That makes sense. Lynmo put away the compressed rations he was holding. The seawater outside the observation window is becoming increasingly turbid. Visibility has now dropped to less than 5 m and the beam of the underwater light is being absorbed by a sponge unable to shine very far.

The density of suspended particles has reached 20 times that of normal seawater. The sensors detected unusual water flow. It wasn't an ocean current, but rather a localized regular eddy and upwelling. The flow carried particles creating visible streaks. It's like breathing.

Linmo said it has breathing. Chin pointed to the water flow diagram. The fortress is conducting basic energy exchange. It inhales seawater rich in minerals and organic matter and expels metabolic waste and modified byproducts. This cycle never stops, but it is intensified during deep breathing.

Dot. He pulled up a diagram showing the path of the water flow marked in different colors. We are now moving along the edge of a suction stream. This stream comes from the southeast, passes through the center of the Dead Sea, and then sinks into the processing system at the bottom of the fortress. Theoretically, this is the most covert route because the system assumes that the stream contains raw materials and does not monitor it in any special way.

What about the risks? If it s identified as a non- raw material, it might be intercepted by the filtration system, Chinnying said, or it might be sent to the processing unit. That would be troublesome. Dot. The submersible carefully adjusted its position, staying close to the edge of the current. The current here is slower but more stable, conserving propulsion.

Another hour passed. 43 nautical miles from the target. 3 hours and 17 minutes have passed. A burst of static came through the communicator followed by Leewi's voice broken and intermittent. Lynmo, can you hear me? The situation has changed.

The signal was very poor with long gaps between each word. Linmo increased the receiving power. Leeway repeat. Has the situation changed? The soulsece ceiling submarine is moving closer and has learned to cause explosive growth of bacterial bofilm. Be careful.

The signal is completely interrupted. The lurking device quickly operated the console, attempting to reestablish the connection, but failed. External interference levels had spiked to dangerous levels, and the shielding layer's power consumption had reached 90% of its design limit. Weve entered a high interference zone, he said. From now on, we may not receive any outside messages.

D Linmo pulled up the last complete intelligence record he received. Although it was fragmented, the key information could still be pieced together. Dragon Souls nuclear submarine was approaching and the Coral Society's bacterial membrane was growing explosively. None of this is good news. The submersible continued its journey.

In the 4th hour, they encountered their first group of unusual creatures. At first, there were just a few bright spots on the sensor about 300 m apart and at similar depths. Lynmo thought they were just ordinary fish and didn't pay much attention, but the bright spots increased in number and eventually gathered into a large group numbering at least 100. The swarm retrieved sonar images. The images showed a group of medium-sized marine creatures 1 to 2 m in length swimming in a strange manner, not the smooth undulations of fish, but a stiff mechanical propulsion.

"Turn the lights down to the dimmest," Cheneying whispered. The navigation lights were almost completely off, leaving only the faint glow of the instrument panel. The submersible hovered in the water, maintaining its depth by fine-tuning buoyancy. The group of creatures swam slowly past on the left. At its closest, the distance was no more than 50 m.

Using the faint bioluminescence they emitted, Linmo was able to make out their appearance. It was a creature he had never seen before. Its body resembled an eel, but was covered by a chittinous exoskeleton that gleamed with a metallic sheen. Its head had no eyes, only a few recessed sensory openings. Neatly arranged fin-like structures lined both sides of its body, but those fins were not for swimming.

They looked more like antenna rays. The most bizarre thing is their swimming pattern. The entire group maintains a strict formation like train soldiers. The lead individual emits rhythmic flashes of light and the individuals behind it respond in turn as if passing on a signal. Modified organisms, Chinnying said in a low voice, and they already developed social behaviors.

This can be explained by natural evolution. After the group swam across, the submersible remained in place for 5 minutes to confirm that there was no further movement before restarting its thrusters. Where do they come from? Lynmo asked. It could be cultivated inside the fortress or it could be the product of external organisms being modified. Chennying said, "In any case, this shows that the modification process is faster than we thought.

Not only have the organisms physiological structures been altered, but their behavioral patterns have also been reprogrammed." Dot. In a fifth hour, we were still 22 nautical miles from our target. The density of suspended particles in the water was alarmingly high, reducing visibility to less than 2 m. The submersible was navigating through dense fog, requiring careful judgment for every meter of progress. The sensors began to give false alarms.

Temperature readings fluctuated, pressure data jumped, and even the depth gauge briefly malfunctioned. The shielding layer was operating at full capacity and power consumption was accelerating significantly. We need to go up a bit, Lyno said to a depth of 100 m. The particle density might be lower there. Dot.

Chining nodded in agreement. The submersible began to slowly ascend. From 200 m to 100 m, the pressure decreased and the creaking sound from the outer shell gradually disappeared. However, the water temperature rose by 6Â° C, increasing the heat dissipation pressure on shielding layer. At a depth of 100 m, the situation improved slightly.

Visibility recovered to about 5 m and sensor readings stabilized somewhat. But a new problem has arisen. Looking out the observation window, large fragments of bacterial film began to appear. These grayish white thin filmlike substances floated in the water, some resembling tattered fishing nets, others like translucent plastic sheets. They drifted with the current, occasionally tangling around the hull of the submersible.

The robotic arm extends and removes a piece of bacterial film adhering to the observation window. Under the light, tiny vascular structures can be seen inside the bacterial film, and there appears to be liquid flowing within it. Active bacterial film. Chining said they've already spread this far will affect us. Not for now, but if it aderes over a large area, it might interfere with the sensors or be identified by the system as foreign biomass.

Dining thought for a moment. We need to speed things up. Enter the fortress area before the bofilm density gets too high. The deep sea submersible accelerated to 12 knots, which is the highest speed that can be safely achieved under current conditions. 6 hours later, we were still 8 nautical miles from our target.

The submersible has 52% of its power remaining. It has 74% of its oxygen remaining. There's still time, but supplies are dwindling. The navigation system indicated that they were about to enter the fortress's direct surveillance zone. According to the shadows data, this area has a radius of about 5 nautical miles and contains a higher density network of nano particles and active detection systems.

Prepare your disguise. the shadow said. He operated the control panel and initiated a preloaded program. A set of electrodes on the submersible hall began to activate, emitting weak electromagnetic signals of specific frequencies and patterns. This simulates the signal signature of a maintenance vehicle recognized by the fortress, he explained.

The Brotherhood deciphered it from early reconnaissance data. It's not 100% effective, but it increases the probability of success. The submersible slowly entered that area of water. Almost immediately, the sensors detected a strong energy fluctuation. It wasn't aggressive.

It was more like scanning and identification. An invisible net swept across the surface of the submersible, recording every detail. Lynn Emmo held his breath. He looked at Shiening, whose finger hovered over the control button, ready to activate the emergency plan at any moment. The scan lasted approximately 30 seconds.

Then, as if nothing had happened, the energy fluctuations disappeared. The submersible continued its journey. It passed. Lynn Emmo asked. It has passed for now.

Do the shadow didn't t relax, but it might just be marked as a low priority target to be investigated to if we stay in there for too long or do anything unusual, it might trigger a second check. Dot. We are still three nautical miles from our destination. Looking out the window, the color of the seawater began to change. It gradually turned from deep blue to dark green and finally to a murky yellowish brown.

Numerous bubbles rose from the depths, carrying a faint smell of sulfur. The depth gauge indicated they were above an underwater mountain range. Below lay a rugged seabed riddled with ridges and fissures. The fortress sat in the center of the largest basin. The hidden image retrieves the final location data.

The self-insspection window will open in 23 minutes. He said the passage is located directly above the fortress at a depth of 180 m. We now need to dive and adjust to the designated position. Dot. The submersible began its descent.

150 m 160 m 170 m. In the beam of the underwater light, the outline of the seabed gradually became clear. Then it appeared that fortress. Even viewed from above, its sheer size is palpable. The metal casing reflects a dull luster under the lights.

Its surf is covered with intricate geometric patterns. Some areas are open, revealing the internal structure, resembling wounds or gaping mouths. Around it, a dense layer of bacterial film covered the seabed like a carpet. grayish white and dark red hues intertwined, reaching several meters in thickness in some places. Something was wriggling within the bacterial film.

The modified organisms crawling and swimming across the carpet as if on patrol. The submersible hovered 20 m directly above the fortress. There are 17 minutes left. The wait has begun. Chapter 146 first steps into the anvil.

There are 5 minutes left. The submersible hovered directly above the fortress, like an ant on the back of a behemoth. Looking out the observation window, the patterns on the metal hall were clearly visible under the lights. The geometric designs were dazzlingly complex, seemingly containing some kind of rule, yet transcending human comprehension. Lyn and Mo checked his equipment.

The oxygen mask was airtight, the protective suit was flexible, and the tools were secured in convenient positions. His backpack had been rearranged with the most needed items placed in the most easily accessible outer layer. He took a deep breath, feeling the cool air circulating inside the mask. Shadow was doing the same thing, but slower and more meticulously. Every piece of equipment was touched to confirm its authenticity, and every buckle was checked twice.

His expression was calm, but fine beads of sweat appeared on his forehead. "Nervous?" Lyn Emmo asked. I am nervous every time. Chining said honestly, but that means Yuri still alert. Anyone who I nervous is either crazy or dead.

There are 3 minutes left. Below, a section of the fortress's surface began to change. The previously seamless metal plates slid open to both sides, revealing a circular opening approximately 3 m in diameter. The interior was pitch black, its depths unfathomable. Blue guiding lights illuminated the edge of the opening, flashing at a fixed frequency.

The passage is open. Dot. The shadow stared at the timer. It lasts for 15 minutes. We need to get in within 14 minutes, leaving 1 minute for contingencies.

Dot. Will the passage close after entering? Yes, but it can be reopened from the inside provided we have the necessary permissions. Chennying said, "If everything goes smoothly, we can exit through the main entrance after completing the test. If not, he didn't finish speaking. There is 1 minute left.

The submersible began its slow descent, aiming at the circular opening. The distance grew closer and closer. 20 m, 10 m, 5 m. In the final moments before entering, Lynn Emmo glanced at the world outside. Above him was murky seawater with faint glimmers of sunlight filtering through.

All around him was a seabed covered in a bofilm where modified organisms swam completely unresponsive to the passing of the submersible. Then they entered the passage. Darkness instantly engulfed everything. The beam of the submersible lights shone on the inner walls of the tunnel, reflecting a metallic sheen. The tunnel was vertically downward, its inner walls incredibly smooth without any seams or bolts.

Its diameter was so precise it looked as if it had been machined on a giant lathe. The submersible shut down its external thrusters and slowly descended under gravity. The depth gauge readings began to change. 180 m, 190 m, 200 m. The passage seemed to have no end.

Decompression procedure initiated. The shadow control console reads, "The internal pressure will gradually adjust to match that inside the fortress." The process will take 3 minutes and may cause ear pressure discomfort. Swallowing or pinching your nose and blowing air can relieve the discomfort. Lin Mo felt a pressure in his eard drums like the feeling of an airplane descending but more intense. He swallowed several times as instructed and the pressure gradually balanced out.

When the depth reached 230 m, light appeared below. It wasn't lighting, but a soft, omnipresent, cold light source that diffused upward from the bottom of the passage. The light was pale blue, enveloping the entire passage in an eerie atmosphere. Weary and internal lighting range, the shadow said. Turn off the navigation lights and reduce your energy signature.

Dot. The lights went out. The submersible continued to descend in pale blue light. About 30 seconds later, solid ground appeared beneath my feet. The passage has ended.

This is a cylindrical chamber approximately 10 m in diameter and 5 m high. The four walls are made of the same metal material with finely engraved patterns on the surface. At the center of the chamber's bottom is a circular recess perfectly accommodating the submersible space. The submersible landed gently in the groove fitting perfectly. Dot complete.

Chin looked at the sensor data. External water pressure is being discharged and internal air pressure is stabilizing. At the top of the compartment, the passageway entrance was slowly closing. The metal plates closed silently, squeezing out the last drop of seawater with a soft hiss. Then it was completely sealed.

A door on the inside of the cabin slid open. Outside the door was a corridor, also bathed in pale blue light. The corridor was wide enough for three people to walk side by side and about 3 m high. The floor, walls, and ceiling were all made of the same metal material, appearing to be cast as a single piece without any seams. There was a peculiar smell in the air, like ozone mixed with some kind of organic solvent and a faint sweet scent.

The concentration of active agents is high. Chin glanced at the detector on his wrist, but still within a safe range. Don't remove your mask or protective suit. The two unbuckled their seat belts and open the hatch of the submersible. Lynn Emmo stepped out first, his feet making a slight echo as they landed on the metal floor.

He looked around. The cabin had no other exits besides the entrance and exit door. The walls were so smooth they reflected blurry silhouettes. Chenning also emerged, closed the submersible hatch, and checked the seal. I hope it's still there when I come back, he said.

They walked toward the open door. The corridor stretched in two directions, seemingly endless. Light emanated from the walls themselves. even in soft with no obvious source of illumination. At intervals on the walls were raised geometric patterns like decorations or some kind of signage.

Hidden shadow took a handheld scanner out of his backpack and aimed it at the pattern on the wall. Navigation markers do that. He glanced at the display screen. Left leads to the production and living areas. Right leads to the control center.

We should go right. Dot. Where might the wings of freedom be? Both sides are possible. Dot. the shadow put away the scanner, but they would probably prefer to stay near the living area where there are food synthesis facilities and rest areas.

The controlled area is a no-go zone for them. The defense system does not allow unauthorized personnel to enter. Then why were we able to get in? Because we're simulating vehicle signal maintenance and maintenance personnel are designed to have access to all areas. Chenning paused. At least that's how it is in theory.

We'll have to go there to find out the actual situation. They chose the right side. The corridor was long and straight without any turns or forks. After walking about 50 m, some display screens began to appear on the wall, but they were all black. Some of the screens had control panels below them, and the symbols and text on them did not belong to any known language.

The system is in low power mode, the shadowy figure observed. Most non-core functions are disabled. Only necessary modules will be woken up during the self test. After walking another 20 m, the first door appeared ahead. The door is sliding with no handles or keyholes on its surface.

There is a palmshaped groove on the wall next to the door above which is a glowing symbol. A biometric lock. Chining said it requires the palm print of an authorized person. We don't have that. Are there any other options? Yes.

Dot. Chining took a small tool from his backpack shaped like a short thick pen. He placed it against the crack in the door and pressed the button. The tool emitted a slight buzzing sound and its tip lit up with a red light. Highfrequency vibration cutters are specifically designed for this type of alloy, he explained.

But they re slow and noisy. We need to find a more discreet entry point. Dot. They continued forward going around the door. The corridor finally turned its first corner a short distance behind the door.

After turning the corner, the scenery changed. This is no longer a monotonous corridor, but a spacious area like a hall. The hall is about 10 m high and the size of two basketball courts. Several thick pillars support the ceiling in the center, and the surface of the pillars is covered with a complex network of pipes and cables. There were many doors of varying sizes and functions around the hall.

Most of the doors were closed, but a few were a jar, letting in a faint light. Some things were scattered on the ground. Lynn Mo approached and saw that there were fragments of protective suits, broken tools, and some empty food packaging. The fragments had dried, dark stains on them resembling blood, but they were black in color and sticky in texture. Someone struggled here.

Dot Chinny crouched down to examine the area. Not long, almost two weeks. Judging from these marks, it looks like they were dragged away. Dot. He pointed to the ground where there were several drag marks leading to a door deep inside the hall.

The door was half open and it was pitch black inside. Want to go in and take a look? Lyn Emmo asked. Hidden shadow hesitated. Our primary objective is to control the core, he said. But there may be survivors or clues here.

Dot. Just then, a voice came from inside the door. It was very soft, like the sound of metal rubbing together or like some kind of liquid dripping. The intervals were very regular, about once every 3 seconds. The two exchanged a glance, and Shinning gripped his vibrating blade tighter.

Linmo also drew his own sword, but did not activate the blade. They slowly approached the door. When it was still 5 m away, the sound from inside the door stopped. Silence. Lynn Emmo gently pushed the door open with the hilt of his knife.

Behind the door was a small room which looked like a storage room or equipment room. Inside were stacks of metal boxes and machines of unknown purpose. In the center of the room on the floor was something. It was a humanoid figure wearing protective clothing. However, the protective suit was severely damaged.

The face mask was shattered and part of it was exposed. The exposed part was not a human face, but a grayish white translucent substance with fine net-like patterns on the surface like mycelium. The human figure remained motionless. The shadowy figure entered the room and carefully circled around to the front. The protective suit was completely filled with that grayish white substance.

Mycelia spread out from the damage, crawled a distance on the ground, and then retreated as if breathing. He has been assimilated, the shadow said softly. The active factors invaded his protective suit and modified his body. Now he has the same thing as those bacterial films. Doc, is he still alive? I don't know.

Chining gently touched the mcelium with the tip of his knife. The mcelium reacted immediately, rapidly contracting and then slowly expanding. The contracted portion revealed something underneath a semimelted skeleton which had grown together with the mcelium. Lyno felt nauseous. He forced himself to calm down and observe carefully.

The markings on the protective suits were still legible. It was the wings of freedom logo with a line of smaller print below. Seventh exploration team. The wings of freedom. He said they explored this place and then they encountered something.

Dot. The shadowy figure searched the room. He found a handheld recorder behind a metal box. The screen was shattered, but the storage module appeared intact. He carefully removed the storage module and placed it in a sealed bag.

"There might be logs," he said. "Take them back and analyze them." Dot. As they were about to leave, the humanoid figure on the ground suddenly moved. It wasn't a large movement, just a slight twitch of the mcelium. Then, a faint sound came from the tear in the mask.

It was very faint, like the sound of the wind or like a sigh. But if you listen carefully, you can tell its language, though it's indistinct and intermittent. The system is wrong. The blueprint is incorrect. The sound stopped.

The mcelium stopped moving. The shadowy figure stared at the object for a few seconds, then turned away. Let us go, he said. There is nothing left to save here. They left the room and quietly closed the door.

The hall remained quiet with only their own breathing echoing inside their masks. That voice just now, Linimo said it could be residual neural signals or a memory replay simulated by mycelium. The shadow said in a low voice, but what he said is important. The blueprint is wrong. What does that mean? Is the system malfunctioning or he didn't finish speaking, but Lynn Emmo understood what he meant? Or if it was the mission this fortress was tasked with wrong from the very beginning, they continued forward through the hall and into another corridor.

The corridor was narrower, and the walls on both sides were covered with pipes and cables, some of which were still vibrating slightly, transmitting energy or fluid. The temperature had risen noticeably, and condensation began to appear inside the mask. Weary approaching the energy zone, got the shadow, looked at the scanner. The control core is deeper inside, but we have to get through here first. A rhythmic mechanical sound came from ahead like some kind of large equipment in operation.

The sound was rhythmic, deep, and powerful. They turned a corner and saw the source of the sound. It was a huge open space like a factory workshop. In the center were several enormous machines, strangely shaped, their specific functions unclear. The machines were running, pistons pushing, gears turning, and conveyor belts transporting unknown materials.

But the most eye-catching thing is not the machine. It's something next to the machine. There were several transparent cylindrical containers, each about 2 m in diameter and 3 m high. The containers were filled with a pale green liquid in which suspended. Biology.

Lenmo walked closer and saw clearly. Those are marine creatures undergoing modification. A shark but with extra fins growing from its sides like wings.
