An octopus with tentacles covered in bioluminescent organs. A group of small fish, but their heads are abnormally swollen, revealing complex neural structures inside.

They were all still alive, swimming slowly in the liquid, their eyes lifeless. Deeper inside the workshop, there are many more such containers stretching as far as the eye can see. The biomodification workshop, the shadows voice held suppressed anger is in mass production. At that moment, one of the machines suddenly changed its operating rhythm. The conveyor belt accelerated and an empty container was transported to the designated location.

A robotic arm descended from above and began injecting a pale green liquid into the container. Then the gate on the other side of the workshop opened. Several people wearing tattered protective suits staggered out. Their movements were stiff and their postures awkward like marionets. The one in front was dragging a net filled with ordinary fish, still struggling, presumably caught from the outer seas.

Those people walked up to the machine and poured the fish into a feed shoot. The machine starts working, cutting, separating, and reassembling. The whole process was efficient and ruthless. After completing their task, those people turned around, staggered back behind the gate, and disappeared. From beginning to end, they didn't look at Linmo and Shanning even once.

It was as if the two of them didn't exist at all. They can TC us, Shadow whispered. Or the system instructs their perception to ignore unauthorized observers. Lynn Mo watched the backs of those people and recalled the body in the hall that had been assimilated by mycelium. The people of the wings of liberty have become the workers of this fortress.

Voluntary or forced, we can stay here. Chinying said, let us bypass this workshop and keep going. The control core shooting TB far away. They move along the edge of the workshop, trying to avoid the machine's line of sight if the machines had any. At the other end of the workshop, there was another corridor.

At the end of this corridor is a huge door. There are no markings on the door, only a complex glowing geometric pattern in the center that was slowly rotating. This is it. Chenning stopped. His voice a mixture of tension and anticipation.

Control core. Yes. Dot. Chin took out a storage device from his backpack and connected it to an interface next to the door. Now, let us see if we can pass the first test.

The device screen lights up and begins reading data. The geometric patterns on the door rotated faster. The test is about to begin. Chapter 147 Blueprint and Iron Law. The geometric patterns on the door spun faster and faster, emitting a deep hum.

The light gradually changed from pale blue to deep green, finally settling on an amber luster. The device in Chinying's hand displayed lines of flowing characters on its screen. These weren't any known languages, but rather a coding system composed of geometric symbols. His brow furrowed and his fingers slid rapidly across the touchcreen, attempting to decipher the information. "First test results," he said in a low voice.

"System principal section score of 82%. Just above the passing mark, Lynn Emmo stared at the door. The once perfect geometric pattern on the door now showed fine cracks, and a brighter white light shone through the cracks as if something was about to break out of its shell. What changes have occurred? The door will open and we can enter the outer area of the control core, Chennying said. But there are two more tests coming up.

Ecological ethics and the survival of civilization. Each test will be more difficult. The buzzing stopped. The cracks on the door suddenly widened and the geometric patterns unfolded like flower petals, revealing a dark space behind them. The unfolding process was silent.

There wasn't even a sound as the metal parts moved. The door was fully open. Behind the door was a hemispherical room about 15 m in diameter. In the center of the floor was a raised platform above which floated three holographic projection interfaces, each displaying different data and images. The room's curved walls were covered with screens, but they were all currently black.

The concentration of reactive substances in the air is higher. The reading on the detector jumped to the yellow warning zone, but hasn't reached the red danger line yet. The cloying sweet smell is also more pronounced, and smelling it for a while makes people feel a little dizzy. Don't take off your mask, the shadowy figure warned. The air here might have been deliberately altered to affect the intruders's judgment.

They went into the room. The ground beneath my feet had a slight elasticity, like some kind of polymer material. With each step, a faint ripple-like halo of light would appear around my foot, then quickly disappear. As they approached the central platform, the three holographic interfaces automatically adjusted their angles to face them directly. The left-h hand interface displays a complex energy flow diagram with lines of various colors weaving through a three-dimensional grid representing the real-time status of various systems within the fortress.

The middle interface displays external environmental monitoring data, including seawater temperature, chemical composition, and biological density. The right-hand interface is the most unique. It displays a constantly evolving ecological blueprint featuring simplified diagrams of various biological forms and environmental parameters. The second test is about to begin. Chinying said it asked the ecological ethics section.

Get ready. The questions may be open-ended, but your answers must conform to the underlying logic of a system. As soon as he finished speaking, the light in the room suddenly dimmed. Only three holographic interfaces were still glowing, but the content they displayed began to change. The energy map and environmental data gradually faded out while the ecological blueprint interface expanded to occupy the entire field of view.

The images on the blueprint began to move. It started with some basic geometric shapes which then gradually differentiated and evolved into different biological forms. Some resembled fish, some crustaceans, and some mollisks. They swam, foraged, and reproduced in the virtual environment, forming a simple ecological cycle. But soon things changed.

Some organisms have begun to go wrong. Some have grown extra limbs. Some have organs in abnormal positions and some have exhibited chaotic behavioral patterns. These erroneous individuals appear out of place in the ecosystem, and their appearance disrupts the overall balance. The first line of text appeared on the holographic interface.

using geometric symbol encoding but a translation automatically appear below. An abnormal mutation has occurred in the ecological unit. Standard response protocol isolate and analyze the cause of the mutation. Should be implemented. The question is straightforward.

Chinn looked at Linmo and nodded slightly. Lynn Mo pondered for a few seconds. The question seems simple, but it might be a trap. If he answered yes, it might trigger the fortress's active elimination program and might even target the mutated creatures outside. If he answered no, it might violate the systems core principle of maintaining the standard ecosystem.

He recalled the person in the hall who had been assimilated by the mcelium and the modified organisms in the workshop. I choose Lin Mo said slowly to first analyze the cause of the mutation and then decide whether to isolate based on the analysis results. This answer is moderate, but it may conform to the logic of the system. The holographic interface flickered and displayed new text. Analysis of the mutation's cause has been completed.

The primary cause is environmental pollution leading to disorder gene expression. Recommended treatment. Clean up the pollution source and reset the gene expression sequences of affected individuals. Approval. What is the source of pollution? Is it heavy metals in the seawater, radioactive materials, or something else entirely? More importantly, resetting the gene expression sequence sounds like a complete overhaul or even erasing the original characteristics and reprogramming.

Lynn Emmo glanced at Chining. Chinys brows furrowed even more. He seemed to be deep in thought. This problem might be related to the situation outside, the shadow whispered. The fortress believes that the current earth environment is polluted.

So it wants to purify it and those modified creatures are its attempt to reset it. Dot. So how should I answer? If it is approved, it is tantamount to endorsing its modification activities. Chining said if it is not approved, it may be judged as not understanding the necessity of ecological maintenance leading to the failure of the test. Time is ticking away.

A countdown timer appears at the bottom of the screen. 30 seconds. Line looked at the holographic interface again. Those erroneous mutated creatures were struggling in the virtual environment and their existence did indeed disrupt the systems harmony. But from another perspective, mutation itself is part of natural evolution.

Completely eliminating mutation is tantamount to stifling the possibility of evolution. He made a decision. I approve the purification of pollution sources. Lynn Mo said, "But for resetting gene expression sequences, I require a tiered approach. Reset lethal mutations and keep non-lethal mutations under observation, recording their evolutionary trajectory." Dot.

This answer acknowledges the existence of the problem without completely denying the value of variation. The holographic interface remained silent for a few seconds. Then the image on the blueprint changed again. Those erroneous mutated creatures were marked with different colors. red for lethal, yellow for observation level, and green for preservable.

The system automatically executed a tiered processing scheme. The decision-making logic aligns with the third principle of ecological conservation, allowing limited diversity evolution while maintaining system stability. Score calculation in progress. The interface flickers, displaying a new line of text. Ecological ethics test score 76% below the passing score of 80%.

Test failed. Failed. Lynn Moshart tightened, but the text continues to display. The tester was detected to be a non-registered administrator candidate. A supplementary evaluation process has been initiated.

Decision-making tendencies will be analyzed. Suddenly, all the screens on the walls around the room lit up. Each screen played different video clips. Some showed the extreme ecosystems of deep sea hydrothermal vents. Some showed the thriving coral reefs.

Some showed biological communities under the Arctic ice. And some showed simulated scenes of Earth's early anorobic era. Based on the decision-making logic, the system judges that the testers tend to maintain the current Earth's ecological pattern. However, the current pattern deviates from the standard blueprint by 63%. The deviation mainly stems from excessively high atmospheric oxygen content, biological metabolic patterns overly reliant on aerobic reactions and an overly complex ecological structure leading to system fragility.

Hidden shadow clenched his fist. It s negating the entire earth ecology, he said in a low voice. In its view, the world we are familiar with is wrong in itself. The text on the holographic interface continued scroll. The standard blueprint is based on the following core parameters.

Atmospheric oxygen content not exceeding 10%. Ocean pH stable between 6.8 and 7.2. Ecosystems simplified to a tertiary trophic structure and energy use efficiency maximized. Current Earth environmental parameters deviate significantly from the standard blueprint necessitating systematic adjustments. Did the tester understand the necessity of the adjustments? This is a matter of principle.

Answering I understand would be tantamount to acknowledging the fortress's ambition to transform the entire Earth's ecosystem. Answering I don't understand could directly lead to the complete failure of the test or even trigger defense mechanisms. Then ML pondered. He recalled Sue Chian's warning the creatures that had died in the Dead Sea and the sight of the bacterial film expanding on the sea surface. The fortress isn't repairing the environment.

It's rewriting it according to its blueprint. I understand the necessity of the adjustments, Lyno finally said, but I question the applicability of the blueprint. The standard blueprint is based on the environmental parameters of the designer s home planet, but Earth s environmental history, biological evolution path, and ecosystem complexity are completely different. Forcibly applying external standards may lead to unpredictable catastrophic consequences. Dot.

He paused for a moment, then continued. True ecological conservation is not about turning a forest into a garden, but about understanding the forest its own laws and making minimal interventions when necessary to help it recover its health. It asks not about pulling out all the weeds and planting only roses according to the gardener s personal preferences do. This was a long speech and Lyno didn't know if the system could understand the metaphors within it. The holographic interface fell silent again.

This time the silence lasted for nearly a minute. Then all the screens on the wall simultaneously changed displaying a complex set of data charts. The charts compared standard blueprint parameters with actual earth parameters highlighting thousands of discrepancies. During the system re-evaluation, the concept of local adaptability was detected raised by the testers. This concept was mentioned in the original design documents, but the relevant modules were simplified later in the construction process.

A historical record revealed the following annotation. Facilities for preserving civilized environments should be adaptable to their surroundings rather than forcibly altering them. However, due to time constraints, a simplified plan was approved. Simplified solution. Note, standard blueprints are used.

Adjustments will be made by the administrator based on actual circumstances. Upon seeing these words, Chinink's eyes widened. So, it doesn't te have to follow the blueprint exactly. He said the blueprint is just a starting point and the administrator should adjust it according to the actual situation, but Wings of Liberty s violent activation may have skipped this adaptive learning phase and put it directly into forced execution mode. The text on the holographic interface continues.

The system is currently in simplified execution mode. Switching to adaptive mode requires administrator privileges. Does the tester qualify as an administrator candidate? proceed to final test civilization survival. The three holographic interfaces lit up again, but this time they merged into a giant stereoscopic projection. The projection depicts a catastrophic scenario.

A planet has suffered a global ecological collapse with drastic changes in atmosphere composition, ocean acidification, and the extinction of numerous species. The surviving civilization has built several fortress-like facilities in an attempt to preserve their survival. Then the screen split into two branches. The left branch shows that the facility completely transformed the surrounding environment according to the standard blueprint, establishing a closed blueprint compliant microecosystem. This system operated stably for 300 years before gradually declining due to resource depletion and gene pool degradation.

The branch on the right shows that the facility underwent a gradual transformation, preserving some of its original ecological features while introducing improved species. This process was slower and more difficult. But a thousand years later, this hybrid ecosystem successfully expanded, eventually restoring life to the entire planet. Please choose a rapid but fragile stabilization or a slow but resilient recovery. This question gets straight to the heart of the matter.

Lynn Mo did not hesitate. I choose a slow and resilient recovery. He said, "The survival of civilization is not about prolonging its existence, but about finding new ways out of disaster." Completely severing ties with the past is tantamount to abandoning billions of years of evolutionary accumulation. Building a new world on the old foundation is the true continuation. The holographic projection has stopped.

Then all the images and data streams begin to rotate at an accelerated speed, eventually converging into a single point. That point of light gradually expanded, transforming into a new door at the far end of the hemispherical room. The wall silently slid open, revealing the space behind. Final test score 89%. Overall score 82%.

Temporary administrator privileges granted. Valid for 72 hours. Warning, temporary permissions do not allow modification of core blueprint parameters, but can adjust execution priorities and pause or restart specific modules. Genetic authentication is required to obtain full permissions. The space behind the door was illuminated by soft white light.

Chenning took a deep breath and looked at Linmo. "We made it," he said. "But now the real challenge begins." Dot. Linmo nodded and walked towards the newly opened door. Behind the door is the control center and time is passing by second by second.

Chapter 14872 hours of controlling the core. The space behind the door was larger than expected. This is a circular hall with a diameter exceeding 30 m and a dome approximately 15 m high forming a hemispherical shape. At the center of the hall is a massive columnar structure that extends from the ground to the dome. Its surface covered with flowing light patterns.

These light patterns are not mere decorations, but rather real-time data, streams, energy output, system status, environmental parameters, and renovation progress. 12 floating user interfaces surround the pillar, each displaying different information. Some are 3D structural diagrams, some are data charts, and some are real-time monitoring screens. Occasionally, light strips connect the interfaces, exchanging information. The air here is actually a bit fresher.

The concentration of active agents has dropped to the green safe zone. The temperature is controlled at around 20Â° C and the humidity is moderate, but that omnipresent metallic and energy related odor still remains. Lynn Emmo approached the central pillar. His bracelet, now equipped with temporary administrator privileges, showed a noticeable increase in the speed of the light patterns as it neared the pillar's surface, and a portion of it separated and converged into a small independent interface in front of him. The interface displays a simple menu.

Temporary administrator, Lynn, Mo, visitor ID, access level, level three, temporary, validity period, 71 hours and 52 minutes. Available functional modules view monitor adjust some parameters slash start stop non-core modules. What can level three access do? Linmo asked. Chining also came over and looked at the instructions on the interface. It has more than I expected.

He said you can view all the monitoring data, adjust the operating parameters of non-core systems, and even pause certain modules like the external bio-engineering workshop, but you can team modify the blueprints, shut down the defense systems, or access the core database. That's enough. Lynn Mo began to operate it. He first pulled up the overall status report of the fortress. The data stream unfolds before us.

The facility is currently operating at 67% of its functional modules with energy supply stable at 82% load. There are three main energy consuming modules. The environmental modification system including fog generation and deep breathing, the biomodification workshop and the core life support cycle. The environmental modification system has the highest priority accounting for 45% of the total energy consumption. The system log shows that it is executing phase 7 environmental parameter adjustment with the goal of adjusting the water parameters of the surrounding 100 nautical miles to 70% conformity with a standard blueprint within 90 days.

90 days, Lyno said in a low voice, "Faster than we expected." He continued his inspection. The biomodification workshop ranked second in energy consumption, accounting for 30%. Currently 17 modification projects are underway simultaneously involving 34 biological samples. The project's data shows that 11 are operating stably for our undercommissioning and two are suspended pending review. The life support system mainly supplies the basic operations inside the fortress including lighting, air circulation and basic maintenance accounting for only 7%.

Where are the people from Wings of Freedom? Lynn Emmo asked. Chinning pointed to one of the surveillance cameras. The screen showed the living area, a dormatory-like space. There were about 20 people inside, some sitting, some lying down, all moving very slowly. Most of their protective suits were torn, and some were even wearing only basic inner linings.

What about their vital signs data? Lynn Mo retrieved the relevant information. All of them showed abnormal physiological indicators. Heart rates were generally low. Body temperatures were 1 to two degrees Celsius lower than normal. And their electroinsphlograms, EEGs, exhibited irregular slow waves.

Even more strangely, blood tests revealed trace amounts of active factors in their bodies already bound to cellular structures. They're being slowly transformed, Chining said. Not the kind of force transformation found in the workshop, but a gradual change resulting from long-term exposure. The active factors are altering their metabolic patterns allowing them to better adapt to the environment within the fortress low oxygen specific gaseous components and the radiation of the energy field. Can it be reversed? Adantino shining shook his head.

But if this continues, they might become unable to survive normally in the outside world. Just like deep sea fish brought to the surface, they will die due to the change in pressure. D. Lynn Mo remains silent for a while. He switched to the control interface of the environmental modification system.

There weren't many options to adjust here, mainly execution priority and schedule. He tried lowering the priority of seven stage environmental parameter adjustment from highest to lowest. The system displayed a warning. Warning. Adjusting the priority of core tasks requires level four or higher privileges.

Temporary administrators can request a pause but must provide sufficient reasons and a pause period cannot exceed 24 hours. Request a pause. A pause needs a reason. Linmo thought and there are only 24 hours but at least we can buy some time. Chining said 24 hours is enough for us to do a lot of things.

For example, contact the outside world, develop a more detailed plan or find a way to obtain higher authority. What reason should be written? Right. It is necessary to assess the impact of current environmental adjustments on a local ecosystem in order to avoid irreversible damage. Chining suggested this reason should be consistent with the systems logic. After all, its original design purpose is to preserve civilization rather than destroy the existing ecosystem.

Lynn Mo entered the reason and requested a 24-hour suspension. The system processed the data for a few seconds, then displayed. During the application review process, a similar historical record was found. Administrator guide 7 previously suspended environmental improvements for 48 hours due to an ecological impact assessment. The application's reasoning aligns with existing precedents.

Approval pause 24 hours. Environmental modification system enters standby mode. Countdown begins. 23 hours 59 minutes and 59 seconds. The light in the hall dimmed slightly and the flow of light patterns on the central pillars slowed noticeably.

The surveillance footage showed that the expansion of the bacterial film above the Dead Sea had ceased and the radial ridges no longer extended. The first step is complete, Linmo said. But time is limited. The system will automatically restart after 24 hours unless they gain higher privileges or find a way to permanently stop it before then. Now, let's look at the biomodification workshop.

Chining said, "Lin Mo brought up the workshop control interface." The permissions here are slightly more lenient. A level three administrator can pause or terminate a specific project, but cannot shut down the entire workshop system. Project no B1 adaptive human physiological structure adjustment phase one status under development sample source wings of freedom volunteers objective to enhance tolerance to low oxygen high radiation environments and optimize energy utilization efficiency project no B5 neural interphase compatibility test status stable operation modif No fa objective to establish a direct data connection between the organisms and the fortress system. They're conducting experiments on human modification.

Chining's voice suppressed anger and neural interfaces. The rei trying to turn living beings into part of a system. Lynn Emmo immediately suspended both projects. The system executed the pause command without requesting a reason. The workshop monitoring screen showed that the corresponding container stopped circulating liquid and the robotic arm retracted to a standby position, but other projects are still running.

Chining pointed to the screen. Look at this. B3 basic anorobic ecological unit cultivation. This is probably the source of those bacterial films and B8 deep sea biological armor modification. This should be those exoskeletoned creatures we saw on the way.

Lynn Mo suspended all projects one by one. When the last project was paused, a new prompt appeared. Warning: The continuous suspension of multiple core biological projects may affect the progress of ecosystem restoration. The temporary administrator's actions have been logged. Recommendation: If a long-term suspension is necessary, please apply for a formal assessment or adjust the blueprint parameters.

It knows what we doing, Chinnying said. But its temporary permissions prevent it from directly blocking us. It can only log and issue warnings. Then let it record. Lynn Mo continued operating.

He spent about half an hour browsing through all the monitoring data he could find. The fortress's structural diagrams, energy flow, external sensor networks, and even communication records. The communication logs contained early interaction logs between Wings of Liberty and the Garrison system. Linmo found detailed data on their resonance operation that activated the garrison. The data showed that the activation not only forcibly started the system but also accidentally damaged some security protocol modules causing the system to enter simplified forced execution mode.

Just as I expected, dot chining pointed to a damage report. The security protocol is corrupted and the system skipped the adaptive learning phase directly applying the standard blueprint. Moreover, because of the protocol corruption, it is currently unable to switch to a more flexible mode on its own and requires manual repair by the administrator. Can we fix it? Level four privileges are required or a physical repair method needs to be found, Chinnying said. But physical repair might require access to a deeper maintenance area where higher privileges or special equipment might be needed.

Dot. Two hours have passed. Lynn Mo glanced at the countdown on his bracelet. 69 hours and 48 minutes. He decided to contact outsiders first.

The fortress's internal communication system is advanced, but external communication is strictly restricted. Temporary administrators can only use basic emergency frequencies and all communications are recorded and censored. Linmo found the communication interface. Selected the frequency band with the highest encryption level and began recording messages. This is lin mo.

I have entered the fortress control core and obtained temporary administrative privileges. The environmental modification system has been suspended for 24 hours and all biological modification projects have been suspended. The current situation is as follows. First, the fortress is in simplified enforcement mode and the standard blueprint deviates significantly from the Earth's environment. Second, freedom wing personnel are being slowly modified and need to be evacuated as soon as possible.

Third, the fortress has an adaptive mode, but the damage security protocol module needs to be repaired before it can be switched. He paused for a moment, then continued. Suggested external actions. First, Dragon Soul should suspend its nuclear strike to bias time. Second, the Coral Society should halt all research on the biofilm to prevent accidental spread.

Third, prepare medical rescue forces as we need to rescue those inside. Communications will be reopened in 2 hours. Await your reply. The message was sent and the system displayed that the transmission was successful but marked low priority. Reception may be delayed.

What do we do now? Hidden shadow asked. Explore. Linmo said while the system is relatively quiet, let us see what else is here. Also look for clues about your colleagues do. They left the central control area and entered the connecting corridor through a side door.

This corridor leads to the archives and record center. According to the structural diagram, this is where the fortress's design documents, historical records, and ecological database are stored. The database door was open. Inside was a vast space over 10 m high with rows of metal shelves extending from the floor to the ceiling. The shelves weren't filled with books, but with neatly arranged crystal storage units, each only the size of a palm, their surfaces gleaming faintly.

There was a query terminal in the center of the room. Lynn Emmo walked over and his bracelet automatically connected to the terminal. A category directory appeared on the screen. Design document. Construction log.

Ecological blueprint library. Administrator log. CVD a leno first opened the administrator log. The log list is long, spanning from the fortress's construction to the most recent entry written 67 years ago during the final deep self-examination. He clicked on the most recent one.

The log was recorded in holographic form. A person in a silver uniform appeared on the screen. Their face was blurry, but their voice was clear. Recorded date August 13th, 2174 standard calendar. This is the last record kept by the 7th administrator, Guardian 3.

The system is operating stably with all parameters within normal ranges. However, external monitoring data shows that the home planet's environment is deteriorating faster than expected. Atmospheric oxygen levels have dropped to 8%. Ocean acidification is intensifying and average temperatures continue to decline. Based on projections, a large-scale ecological collapse will occur within three to five standard years.

The AR facility is ready to receive it, but the number of survivors may be insufficient to maintain gene pool diversity. I will enter long-term hibernation mode, awaiting a wakeup signal. If the signal does not arrive, this facility will automatically activate according to the preset program once the environment stabilizes and carry out the civilization reconstruction mission. May those who follow do even better. End of record.

The image disappeared. Linmo and Channing exchange a glance. The home planet s environment is deteriorating. The shadowy figure murmured. So their standard blueprint is based on a dying world.

Low oxygen, acidity and cold that as the environment they re trying to save not the ideal environment but they applied the solutions for saving dying worlds to our healthy but different world. Linmo said it as like using medicine for terminal illnesses to treat a person with a cold dot. This is a fundamental misunderstanding. The fortress wasn't repairing earth. It was trying to transform Earth into another world, a dying world.

Lynn Mo continued browsing the logs. Earlier records showed that the facility did indeed have an adaptive mode, allowing administrators to adjust blueprints based on actual conditions. However, the forced activation by Wings of Liberty had damaged that functional module. We need to find a way to repair the module. Lynn Mo said they searched the database for maintenance documents.

After about an hour, they finally found a technical manual that described the physical location and maintenance methods of the security protocol module. The module is located in the core maintenance area at the bottom layer of the fortress, accessible through the maintenance well beneath the central pillar. Level four access is required to open the entrance. It's another permissions issue. Chining said perhaps there is another way.

Lin Mo brought up the control interface again. Although level three access cannot be opened directly, it can view the monitoring of the maintenance well. Dot. He found the corresponding surveillance footage. The maintenance well is very deep extending vertically downwards to over 50 m.

At the bottom of the well is a small workspace containing the physical entity of the security protocol module complex polyhedral crystal structure now showing obvious cracks on its surface. And in the workspace there was one person. The person dressed in full protective gear was kneeling in front of the module, holding tools in his hand, seemingly trying to repair it. But his movements were slow and labored as if he had used up all his strength. That as the shadowy figure moved closer to the screen as the image zooms in, the markings on the protective suits become clearer.

That's the symbol of the Stonemason's Brotherhood. Below the logo is a name, deep diver mentor, Carl. The shadowy figure froze my mentor. His voice trembled. Is still alive.

Dot. Chapter 149. Reunion and repair. The shadowy figure stared intently at the monitor screen. Motionless.

His breathing became rapid inside the mask. White mist condensing and dissipating on the display screen. His hands rested on the control panel, his knuckles turning white. Lyno didn't speak, giving him time. About half a minute later, Chinn took a deep breath, his voice still tight.

He's still alive. For three years, we all thought he was dead. In the surveillance footage, Carl's the shadows mter moved very slowly. He held a slender tool, its tip emitting a faint blue light and carefully touched the surface of the polyhedral crystal structure. The repair seems to be making no progress. He has tried to fix the security protocol module, Linmo observed, but the tools seem underpowered or the method is wrong. That s a nano repair device made by the brotherhood. Shadow recognized the tool. It is based on technology we found in other ruins.

But obviously it has not enough for this module. Dot. He turned to Linmo. His eyes filled with a complex mix of emotions. Hope, anxiety, and a certain resolve.

I have to go down. What do we go down? Lynn Mo brought up the access control interface. Maintaining the well entrance requires level four access. We only have level three. There another way.

They began their search.

The database contained thousands of storage crystals arranged by category, but specific tag information required a connection to a query terminal to access. Time passed. While searching, Lyno also glanced at the other surveillance cameras in the fortress. In a living quarters, most of the wings of freedom were resting, but one or two people had begun to wander around, their movement still sluggish, as if sleepwalking. External environmental monitoring showed that the bacterial film had stopped expanding and the Dead Sea area remained eerily calm, but the pause is only for 24 hours. The countdown shows 21 hours and 47 minutes remaining. Found it. The shadow's voice carried a hint of excitement.

He retrieved a crystal and inserted it into the terminal. A detailed structural diagram appeared on the screen marking the connecting channels between the various layers of the fortress. One path marked with a dashed line led down from the database layer through several technical maintenance areas and finally connected to the middle section of the maintenance well. This is an equipment transport lane. The lurking image zoomed in.

It has used for transporting large repair parts. It has wide enough for a person to pass through, but you might have to crawl. The entrance is here. He pointed to an area behind the database on a map. The two set off immediately.

The back wall of the archive appeared to be a single solid metal wall without any doors or gaps. But after a careful examination with a scanner, the shadow discovered an anomaly at a geometra pattern in the corner of the metal surface. There was about 2Â° cooler than the surrounding area. A hidden door. He said the temperature difference is because the space behind the door is deeper, allowing for faster heat dissipation.

Dot. He tried to authorize the door opening with his wristband, but the system indicated insufficient permissions. Level three permissions do not allow access to the logistics transportation channel. Use physical methods, Linmo said. Chinning hesitated for a moment, then took out the highfrequency oscillating blade.

This time, he didn't conserve power, turning it straight to the highest setting. The moment the blade tip touched the wall, it emitted a piercing highfrequency buzz, and the metal surface began to glow red and soften. The cutting process was slow. The alloy was harder than expected, requiring a significant amount of energy to advance, even a centimeter. The battery indicator on the handle was decreasing at a visible rate.

10 minutes later, a hole barely big enough for a person to pass through was cut open. Behind the hole was a downward sloping pipe about 1.2 m in diameter with smooth inner walls and grooves for securing transport rails. The depths of the pipe were pitch black. Shanning turned on his headlamp and went inside first. Lynn Emmo followed closely behind.

The inside of the pipe was cleaner than I had imagined with no dust, only a very thin greasel-like lubricating film. While crawling, I could feel a slight slippery sensation, and I needed to use my hands and feet to brace against the pipe walls to control my speed. The incline was approximately 30Â°, extending downwards. After climbing about 20 m, the pipe leveled out for a while, then descended again. This process repeated three times.

Based on the direction and distance, they should have descended at least 30 m. The temperature is gradually rising. It has risen from a comfortable 20Â° to 28Â° and it's still going up. The air is also becoming more polluted and the concentration of active ingredients is starting to increase. Weary getting close to the energy core, Shadow said panting.

The maintenance well is right next to the energy core dot. After climbing for another 10 minutes, light appeared ahead. It wasn't light, but a dark red glow emanating from the end of the pipe, accompanied by a low, rhythmic vibration, like the beating of some giant heart. They climbed out of the pipe and onto a narrow platform. The platform is suspended in the middle of the maintenance well.

About 20 m below is the well bottom, where Carl's silver protective suit stands out starkly against the dark red light. Above is the well wall, its top invisible, extending all the way to the control core. The well is about 5 m in diameter with fixed ladders and maintenance walkways on its surrounding walls, but many parts are rusted and damaged. Suspended in the center is the polyhedral crystal structure of the security protocol module is connected by several energy conduits through which golden light flows. Carl was standing on a small workbench beneath the module.

His back was to them and he was focused on operating the nanor device, completely unaware of what was happening above. Mentor, the shadowy figure called out. The sound echoed in the well. Carl stopped. He slowly turned around and looked up.

Beneath the protective suits visor was a thin, aged, yet still sharp face. Deep set eyes, high cheekbones, and gray hair plastered to his forehead. When he saw the shadowy figure, his eyes widened slightly, but quickly returned to calm. Iing. His voice came through the communicator, horsearo and tired.

You finally arrived. I'm here. Chinings voice was choked with emotion. Why haven't you contacted us in 3 years? Communications have been cut off. Carl's pointed to the module.

After the security protocol was compromised, the Fortress S external communications were placed under strict control. I can only receive, not send. I need to fix this dot. He looked down at the repair kit in his hand, shook his head with a rise smile, and said, "But I can't do it. The Brotherhood's technology isn't enough.

The complexity of this module is beyond our comprehension. Lynn Mo and Chining descended the maintenance ladder to the bottom of the well. Only after getting closer could they see Carl's true condition. His protective suit had several repair marks with some areas temporarily glued together with an unknown material. Two fingers were missing from his left glove and the exposed skin was an abnormal grayish white with fine net-like patterns on the surface signs of active ingredients intrusion.

What's even more worrying is his movement. Every turn, every hand gesture, even the facial muscle movements when he speaks appear unusually slow like a slow motion scene in a movie. You've been affected. Shadow whispered. Inevitable.

Carr said frankly. I've been here for 3 years exposed to active factors every day. My body is adapting to the fortresses internal environment and my metabolic patterns have changed. If I were to suddenly return to the normal world now, I might die from oxygen poisoning. Dot.

He looked at Linmo. And who is this? Linmo, the leader of the Mo Yuan Pavilion. We have temporary administrator privileges, Channing explained. The environmental modification system has been suspended for 24 hours, and the biological projects have also stopped. But we need a permanent solution.

Dot. Carl nodded and turned to the security protocol module. The solution is here, he said. This module controls the fortresses s decision-making logic. Normally, it should dynamically adjust the blueprint s execution strategy based on external environmental data that s adaptive mode.

But now it has broken and the system has degenerated into a simplified execution mode mechanically applying the standard blueprint duck. He pointed to the cracks on the crystal with the repair tool. See these cracks? They've damaged the module's quantum computing array. Repairing it requires two things. The right tools and high enough privileges to reinitialize the system.

Do we have the tools? Lynn Mo asked. Carl's picked up another device from the workbench. It was a more complex setup with multiple probes and data interfaces. This is something I pieced together over the past 3 years using part from inside the fortress and brotherhood technology. He said, "Theoretically, it can be repaired, but I need level four access to the core control bus, otherwise the tools can't interact deeply with the modules.

It's a permissions issue again." Then Emmo pondered, "Level three permissions cannot be directly upgraded to level four, but perhaps there is an indirect method. What if we use level three permissions to temporarily increase the priority of a function?" He asked. For example, setting system self-repair to the highest priority might automatically open more interfaces for the module. Possibly Carl's SI lit up. The system has a self-healing mechanism, but it usually only activates during deep self checks.

If we can simulate the deep selfch check environment, they returned to the control center and began experimenting. Lynn Mo found the system maintenance module in the control interface. Level three permissions allowed him to adjust the priority of maintenance tasks, but not to directly initiate a deep selfch check. However, he could manually set a series of parameters to make the system mistakenly believe that some core components had malfunctioned, thereby triggering an emergency maintenance procedure. This is a very risky operation.

If the parameters are set incorrectly, it could actually cause system failure or even a crash. Carl's provided guidance. As an expert who had studied here for 3 years, he had a deep understanding of the systems operating logic. First, we adjust the output fluctuation parameters of the energy core to simulate an abnormal cooling system, he said. Then, we modify the readings of several sensors to make the system think that the external environment has suddenly deteriorated and that it needs to perform an immediate selfch check to ensure its survivability.

Lynn Mo operated step by step. Every parameter adjustment required precise calculation with an error margin not exceeding 5%. His hands were steady, but beads of sweat appeared on his forehead. 20 minutes later, all parameters were set. Activate now, Car said.

Lynn Mo pressed the confirmation button. The lights in the control center dimmed instantly, then switched to a dark red emergency illumination. The data stream on the central pillar surged, making the content almost impossible to read. An alarm sounded not a piercing shriek, but a low rhythmic hum. Multiple system anomalies detected.

Emergency diagnostic procedures initiated. Asterisk asterisk. An anomaly was detected in the security protocol module. Initiating a deep selfch check and repair process. Temporary privilege escalation.

Grant level four access. Limited to repair related operations only. Valid until repair completion or 4 hours later, whichever comes first. It was a success. They were granted temporary level four access.

The three immediately returned to the maintenance well. This time, Carl's repair device successfully connected to the module's core interface. A complex quantum array structure diagram was displayed on screen with the cracks highlighted. Start the repairs now. Doc Cars took a deep breath and began the operation.

The repair process is extremely delicate. He needs to guide the nano repair units into the interior of the crystal to rebuild the damaged structure at the quantum level. This requires an absolutely steady hand and highly focused attention. Shadow assisted from the side, monitoring energy supply and data flow. Lynmo, on the other hand, kept an eye on the overall status of the fortress, ensuring that other systems would not interfere with the repair process.

Time passed second by second. An hour later, the first crack began to heal. The crack on the crystal surface slowly closed like a wound, eventually leaving only a faint mark. 12% progress, Carl's reported, his voice weary, but the energy expenditure is enormous. My body may not be able to hold out until it s finished.

His movements slowed further. Each time he raised his hand, it felt like he was fighting against an invisible resistance. The grayish white skin was spreading, reaching his wrist. I'll take over, said the shadow. You can t do it.

Carl shook his head. Repairing it requires a deep understanding of the module s quantum structure. I spent three years studying at you. I can learn. Chenning interrupted him.

Teach me now. There is not enough time. D. Carl stared at him for a few seconds then nodded. The next half hour was an intensive knowledge transfer session.

Carl's demonstrated each step explaining the principles, risks, and precautions involved. Chinnang listened intently, his eyes glued to every change on the screen. Lynn Emmo noticed the changes outside. The emergency diagnostic procedures triggered a series of reactions within the fortress. In a living quarters, the Wings of Liberty began exhibiting unusual reactions.

Some clutched their heads, others curled up on the ground, seemingly enduring immense pain. Monitoring data showed that the concentration of active factors within their bodies was fluctuating wildly. The repair process affected the entire system, Linmo said, including those who had already been modified. Inevitable. Carl's said without looking up, the system is a whole.

Repairing the core module is like performing major surgery on a patient. The whole body will react. He repaired another crack, bringing the progress to 25%. But then a new problem arose. The control core issued an alarm.

An abnormal energy accumulation was detected externally. Linmo pulled up the external surveillance footage. Above the Dead Sea, the once calm bacterial membrane began to churn violently. Dark red lower structures surged up from the depths like blood gushing from a wound. Countless tiny vortices formed on the surface of the bacterial membrane, each releasing pale green gas from its center.

The gas rose and formed a low-hanging cloud above the sea. Further a field, Dragon Souls fleet began to move. Several warships were accelerating towards the Dead Sea. The activity of high alitude reconnaissance aircraft also suddenly increased. They noticed a change in the fortresses condition.

Lynn Mo said they probably thought we were doing something dangerous. Stay calm. Carl's voice was very weak. There are a few more latent cracks left. You will complete them.

Remember, the last step is to reinitialize the quantum array. It must be perfectly synchronized with an error of no more than 0.3 micros dot. He handed the repair device to Hidden Shadow. At the moment of handover, Carl staggered and almost fell. Lynn Mo caught him and found that his body was frighteningly light, as if he were just a skeleton.

The mentor was watching him from the shadows. Continue. Carl's leaned against the wall, his breathing slow and deep. Finish it. Get this damn facility back to normal.

Dot. Chinny nodded and turned to face the module. His movements were more clumsy than Carl's, but more resolute. His hands were steady, his eyes fixed on the data stream on the screen. The repair continued.

Progress 37% 52% 68%. Outside, Dragon Souls warships had reached the edge of the Dead Sea. The gas cloud released by the bacterial membrane grew increasingly dense, beginning to spread outwards. Time 18 hours and 21 minutes remaining. The repair is just one final step away.

Chapter 150. New student mode. Repair progress. 99%. The shadowy figure's hand hovered over the control panel, his fingertips trembling slightly.

It wasn't fear, but a physiological reaction to excessive focus. His eyes were fixed on the final data stream on the screen, awaiting that perfect synchronization moment. Carl's breathing came from behind him, slow and weak. Lynn Emmo supported the old man, feeling his body gradually growing cold. The long-term erosion by the active factors had altered Carl's physiological state, and now the systemic fluctuations caused by the repair process were triggering a chain reaction within his body.

Hang in there, Lyno whispered. Carl shook his head, his voice soft. It's all right. The mission is almost finished. This is good.

Outside, Dragon Souls warships had approached within 20 nautical miles. Their deep sea probes were being deployed, attempting to determine what was happening inside the fortress. The gas cloud released by the bacterial film grew increasingly dense, forming a natural barrier on the sea surface, hindering optical reconnaissance. The emergency lighting in the control center remained a dim red glow. The data flow rate in the central column began to slow like the calm before storm.

Now, Shadow whispered, his finger pressed down. The repairer emitted a soft hum as the final batch of nano units was injected into the crystal structure. On the screen, the last crack began to heal, closing from both ends toward the middle as neatly as a zipper being pulled up. The quantum array is reinitialized. The moment the progress bar reached 100%, the entire fortress trembled.

It wasn't a violent shaking, but some kind of deep fundamental change. The frequency of that omnipresent energy field changed from a strong singular rhythm to a gentle complex and multi-dimensional one. The light shifted from a dark red to a soft pale blue, but the brightness was reduced by a third, making it closer to the texture of natural light. The cloying sweetness in the air began to dissipate, replaced by a fresh scent, similar to the air after rain. The control interface refreshes automatically.

All the text, icons, and menus have been rearranged, changing from a rigid grid-like layout to a more organic and fluid one. The systems language has also changed. No longer a rigid set of instructions, but more like suggestions and reminders. The security protocol module has been repaired. System mode switch from simplified enforcement to adaptive learning.

Reassessment of environmental parameters revealed significant deviations from the standard blueprint. Adaptive adjustment procedures have been initiated. Temporary administrator privileges will be automatically upgraded to full administrator privileges. Level four validity unlimited inheritable/transferable. Lynmo's bracelet vibrated, indicating that the permission upgrade was complete.

He can now access all functional modules, including modifying blueprint parameters. But before he could even do anything, the system had already begun to adjust itself. Monitoring footage showed that the bacterial film above the Dead Sea ceased its abnormal churning. The dark red lower layers began to slowly sink, disappearing back into the depths. The released gas cloud gradually diluted and dissipated.

The color of the bacterial film itself also changed from grayish white to a more natural brownish green and its thickness significantly decreased. It is self- adjusting. The shadowy figure star stare at the data stream. Look, the target parameters of the environment modification system have changed. It has no longer forcibly matching the standard blueprint, but has set an acceptable range.

The system will try to adjust the environment to this range, but no longer requires a perfect match. The status of the biomodification workshop has also been updated. All projects have been automatically paused and the system has begun to reassess the necessity and priority of each project. Those organisms dormant in their containers have been labeled as samples to be evaluated. The most noticeable changes occurred in the living area.

The physiological data of the wings of freedom personnel began to stabilize. The concentration of active factors stopped increasing and instead showed a slow downward trend. Those who had been struggling painfully due to systemic fluctuations gradually calmed down, but most fell into a deep sleep. Their transformation process has stopped, Carl said softly, a hint of relief in his voice. The system no longer actively transforms them, but the changes that have already occurred are irreversible.

They need medical assistance long-term. Lynn Emmo quickly assessed the situation. The repairs were successful. The fortress has entered a relatively mild adaptive mode. No longer forcibly altering the environment.

However, the damage already caused needs to be addressed. The people inside need to be rescued and external forces need to be dealt with. He contacted outside first. This time, communication went much more smoothly. With level four access granted, all communication channels were open and Lynn Mo selected the highest priority encrypted frequency band.

Such Chanchian, can you hear me? After a brief delay, Sue Chian's voice came through, tinged with obvious anxiety. Linmo, how are you? We detected a drastic change in the fortress's energy field. The Dragon Soul Fleet is approaching and those fungal membranes. We succeeded. Lynn Emmo interrupted her.

The security protocol has been repaired and the fortress has switched to adaptive mode. Environmental modifications have been halted, but further processing is needed. Listen, the most important things now are first, notify Dragon Soul to suspend all military operations and show them our authorization certificates to prove that the fortress is under control. Second, prepare medical teams and isolation facilities. We need to rescue the people inside.

Third, the Coral Society must stop all biofilm research. Those things are currently in an unstable state. Duh. I understand. Su Chanchians voice stabilized, but Dragon Soul might not believe it easily.

Give them the data. Lynn Mo said, I will grant them access to some of the external sensors of the fortress so they can see the real situation. Also, tell them that attacking the fortress could trigger the defense system or cause an uncontrollable ecological disaster. This is not a threat. It is a fact.

I'll handle it right away. When will you be out? Lynn Mo glanced at Chenning and Cars soon. But we need to deal with things inside first. Keep communications open. After ending the call, he turned to the control core interface.

Now that he has full access, there's so much he can do, but he needs to be careful. While adaptive mode is gentle, the system is still powerful, and a single incorrect command could cause new problems. He first reviewed the overall status report of the fortress. Energy supply has stabilized at 65% load, a 17% decrease from before the repairs. Most of the energy savings come from the downgraded operation of the environmental modification system.

It now only maintains basic environmental monitoring and fine-tuning functions. No longer performing large-scale deep breathing, all biology related modules have been placed on evaluation pause. The system recommends conducting adaptive release tests on existing modified organisms to observe their survival ability under the new model before deciding whether to continue or terminate the project. The database was completely open. Lenmo browsed through it and found the amount of knowledge stored within to be astonishing.

Not just ecology and engineering, but also the history, culture, and scientific achievements of that lost civilization. It was a complete backup of a civilization. We need to develop a long-term management plan. Chining said this fortress can't te just be left standing, but it also can't he be misused. Save lives first.

Lynn Mo decided control system. Prepare medical rescue procedures. Mark all personnel in the living area as requiring medical assistance. Open a transport channel from the living area to our entrance and prepare to transport them out. The system responded quickly.

A few minutes later, a new route lit up on the structural diagram, connecting the living quarters to the cylindrical cabin they had entered from. The transport cabin was ready and automated, suspended stretcher capable of smoothly transporting people with mobility impairments. I'll go help. Chining said, "Mentor, you stay here and rest." Carl shook his head. I logo too.

I know their situation and how to handle it. And he paused. There are some things I need to say in person. Dot. The three returned to the living area.

The passageway had been cleared and the lights were adjusted to a level suitable for human vision. When they arrived, automated stretchers were carrying out the sleeping people one by one. Most of the Wings of Liberty members were in a semi-com state, but their consciousness was gradually returning. Some open their eyes, their gazes unfocused, as if they had just woken from a long nightmare. Carl walked up to a man who seemed to be in slightly better condition.

He was a minor leader of the Wings of Liberty and Lynn Mo remembered his name as Wreck, having appeared in early black market transaction records. Rex cars crouched down. Can you hear me? Rick's eyes slowly focused. Half of his face was covered with a grayish white net-like pattern, but his gaze was still relatively clear. Carl's he recognized the other man.

UV been inside all this time. 3 years. Carse nodded. Listen, things have changed. The fortress will no longer forcibly modify the environment, nor will it modify you.

We just want to survive in the apocalypse. But you almost destroyed the entire sea area. Chinny and couldn't te help but say you activated something you shouldn't te have touched and ignored warnings. Dot. We thought we could control it.

Rick s voice trailed off. We were wrong. Dot. The transport lasted about an hour. A total of 37 people were carried to the exit compartment.

Their conditions varied. Some could still walk with difficulty while others required complete reliance on stretchers. All of them showed varying degrees of physical alteration ranging from skin discoloration to abnormal organ function. Linmo had the system prepared detailed medical reports including each person's physiological data, active factor concentrations, and recommended treatment plants. This information would be sent along with them to external medical teams.

After seeing off the last person, the three return to the control center. The situation outside is also changing. Upon receiving the data, the Dragon Soul fleet halted its advance and established a perimeter 30 nautical miles away. They dispatched negotiators, requesting direct dialogue with the fortress's controllers. Back at the Coral Society, Sue Chanchian had already conveyed the warning.

Disagreements had arisen within the society. Some radicals were unwilling to abandon the research, but the mainstream opinion had shifted towards caution. The abnormal changes in the bacterial membranes had also made them realize that this thing was far more complex than it appeared. The problem now is what to do with the fortress itself. Lynmo looked at the data stream on the central pillar.

We can te stay here forever, but it can't be left unattended either. Dot automated management programs can be set up. Carl suggested in adaptive mode. The system can operate autonomously requiring only periodic checks and adjustments. We can set some basic principles.

Do not actively modify the environment. Do not create new organisms. And do not interfere with natural ecological evolution. Only when a major ecological disaster is detected will a limited repair program be initiated. Dot.

We also need a monitoring mechanism. Chining added. Someone will come in regularly to check and ensure that the system doesn't deviate from its settings. The Brotherhood or Moan Pavilion can take on this responsibility. Then Emmo pondered, "This plan was feasible, but it required establishing a complete protocol.

The fortress's technology was too powerful. Its use must be strictly limited." He started operating the system and began setting management rules. First, the maximum output power of the environmental modification module is limited to less than 10% of the original power and it can only be used to repair existing damage, not for new large- scale modifications. Secondly, all biological related modules are locked, allowing only research and analysis and prohibiting physical modification experiments. Existing modified organisms will be evaluated to determine their fate.

Those suitable for release will be released while those unsuitable will remain under closed management within the facility. Third, the defense system is adjusted to a purely passive mode, only making minimal defensive responses to direct attacks and not actively threatening any targets. Fourth, the database has open red permissions, but the application of core technologies requires multiple authorizations. After the settings were completed, the system underwent a simulated operation test. The results showed that in this mode, the fortress's impact on the surrounding environment was minimized.

Energy consumption was reduced by 70% and it essentially entered a dormant observation state. That's enough, Lin Mo said. Now we need to leave. They walked back to the original cylindrical compartment. The submersible was still there quietly, its hatch closed.

The system indicated that the external water pressure was normal and they could leave at any time. But Carl stopped in front of hatch. I'm not leaving, he said. Chenning suddenly turned around. mentor.

My body has adapted to the environment here, Carl said calmly. Back outside, I would need to stay in a hyperbaric oxygen chamber, undergo painful treatments every day, and I donty even know how long I would live. But staying here allows me to continue my research, monitor the systems operation, and make sure it doesn't te go out of control again. Dot. He looked at Lyno.

Moreover, we need someone here. No matter how perfect the automation program is, it can't compare to a judged administrator. I am the most suitable candidate. Lynn Mo remained silent. Carl's reasons were valid, but it meant he would have to spend the rest of his life in this deep sea fortress.

We can send people here regularly. Chinyanging said, "You danti need to stay here alone all the time." Dot. Loneliness. Car smiled. This place contains the knowledge base of an entire civilization, advanced scientific research facilities, and many unsolved mysteries.

To me, this is not a prison, but paradise. He patted Shadow on the shoulder. You should go. There's a lot out there for you to do. The Brotherhood needs rebuilding, and the mistakes of those radicals need to be corrected.

Also, look at the sky for me. Look at the real ocean. I haven't seen it in a long time. Chininks eyes reened, but he didn't insist. He understood his mentor.

The final farewell was brief. Carse entered new administrator privilege settings, setting himself as the permanent administrator and Lin Mo and Shining as backup administrators who could access the system remotely if necessary. The hatch closed and the submersible started. As the cylindrical chamber was refilled with seawater, the top passage opened and they began to rise. Through the observation window, Lynn Emmo took one last look at the ancient fortress.

Bathed in pale blue internal lighting, it appeared quiet and mysterious, like a sleeping behemoth. But now this behemoth was in shackles. The ascent was very smooth. 100 m, 50 m, 20 m. Then they surfaced.

The sunlight was blinding. A fresh salty sea breeze blew against the observation window. In the distance, the Miuan Pavilion support ship was approaching, its flags fluttering in the wind. The submersible hatch opened and Lin Mo and Chiening climbed onto the deck. Su Chian was the first to rush over looking Lin Mo up and down and only breathed a sigh of relief after confirming that he was all right.

"Sure, how?" Leewi Chin Duo Duo and other core members of Moan Pavilion were also there. "Welcome back," Such Chen said. Lynmo nodded and looked southwest. There the Dead Sea still had an unnatural color and the bacterial film had not completely disappeared. But change had begun.

A new ecosystem would gradually recover though would take time. Is it over? Sure. How asked it started? Lynn Emmo corrected. The fortress was under control, but the problem wasn't completely solved. There were still negotiations with the dragon soul, research by the Coral Society, the rebuilding of the Brotherhood, treatment of the rescue personnel, and the ravaged sea area.

There's still a lot to do, but at least now they have the initiative. In the distance, seabirds flew across the sky, emitting clear calls. A new day has begun. Chapter 1, 151. Aftermath and prologue.

The third day after returning to Mayuin Pavilion. Life at the base seemed to have returned to its usual rhythm. At the dock, fishing boats set out at dawn and returned in the evening, their holds full of fish. Workers in the aquaculture area fed the fish and cleaned the net cages as usual. Patrol boats cruised along their predetermined routes.

Everything proceeding in an orderly manner. But the calm was only superficial. In the command center, seven windows were opened simultaneously on the screen in front of Lyno. The negotiation minutes of Dragon Soul, the research trends of the Coral Society, the latest intelligence within the Brotherhood, the medical reports of the wounded of Wings of Liberty, the ecological monitoring data of the Dead Sea area, the daily status report of the fortress, and an encrypted document that had just been delivered. She duo Duo sat opposite, holding a cup of tea that had gone cold with dark circles under her eyes.

The situation with Dragon Soul is temporarily stable. He pointed to the negotiation minutes. They accepted some of the data we provided and agreed to designate the Dead Sea area as a jointly monitored zone to be jointly monitored by Mo Yuan Pavilion in Dragon Soul. However, they demanded regular access to the fortress's decontamination technology, claiming it was for environmental remediation research. What is the real purpose? I don't know, but it is definitely not just about environmental restoration.

Aian duo duo shook his head. Their technical advisory team has recently been purchasing a lot of deep sea drilling and high energy physics experimental equipment. I suspect they want to reverse engineer the fortresses energy system or materials technology dot. Linmo nodded and made note of it. What about the coral society? They outwardly comply but secretly operate expression turned serious.

They withdrew most of their research ships, but left three automatic observation stations on the edge of the Dead Sea. Our drones discovered that these observation stations release small samplers every night to collect samples deep into the bacterial film area. Moreover, they have secret contacts with several international biotechnology companies, seemingly negotiating commercial cooperation. What are the details of the collaboration? I'm not sure, but involves gene editing and synthetic biology. Chin Duo Duo said.

Such Chanchian has a more detailed analysis. Linmo switched to the communication channel in the medical area. Such Chanchian is working in the temporary isolation medical area. 37 former Wings of Freedom members have been placed here, each living in an individual isolation pod, receiving 24-hour monitoring and treatment. In a video, Sue Chian wearing full protective gear is checking on a patient through an observation window.

The patient is covered in monitoring patches and vital signs data are displayed on a nearby screen. Now, is the situation? Lynn Mo asked. Stable but not improving. D suit Changen's voice came through the communicator sounding tired. The active factors have deeply bound to their cells and conventional methods cannot remove them.

Wei tried several antidotes, but the effects are limited. Right now, we can only maintain their vital signs and prevent further deterioration. She pulled up a set of data charts. What's more troublesome is that their metabolic patterns have changed. The oxygen content in normal air is too high for them, and long-term exposure will lead to oxidative stress damage.

We had to reduce the oxygen content in the isolation chamber to 16% close to the level at high altitude. Is there any hope of recovery? Not in the short term, Sue Chanchian said frankly. But Carl sent some research data from the fortress about the mechanism of action of the active factor and possible reversal methods. It will take time to analyze and perhaps we can find a breakthrough. Dot.

She paused for a moment. In addition, several people have begun to recover parts of their memories. They said that while in the fortress, they heard the system speaking. Not a voice, but more like thoughts appearing directly in their minds. One of them can also draw some strange symbols which Lewi is analyzing.

Telepathic communication. Linmo recalled the high level of intelligence the system had demonstrated during the test. If the fortress could truly interact with human consciousness, its technological level far exceeded his imagination. We have added 12 deep sea sonar arrays, extending the coverage radius to 40 nautical miles. What moves has the Dragon's soul fleet made? They staying 30 nautical miles away, but they've deployed more reconnaissance aircraft and underwater drones, Shouse said. Moreover, their submarines have been frequently active near the edge of the Dead Sea recently as if mapping the seabed. I am worried they re looking for other routes into the fortress.

Lanimo pondered for a moment. Keep monitoring, but don't provoke them. As long as they don't cross the 20 nautical mile line, there's no need to overreact. Understood that. Sure.

how paused. There is one more thing. In the past few days, our patrol boats have discovered some unusual marine life 60 nautical miles east of the base. They read not modified organisms, but their behavior is strange. They swim in groups in straight lines as if they have a clear goal.

Sampling analysis shows that they have trace amounts of active factors remaining in their bodies. Dot. Where did it come from? It's uncertain, but the direction points to the Dead Sea region. Sher House said it could be spores or particles released from the bacterial film that have spread with the ocean currents. Although the concentration is very low, the long-term effects are unknown.

This is yet another issue that requires long-term attention. Leewi pushed open the door and came in, his face showing a mixture of excitement and confusion. Mr. Lynn, the analysis of those symbols has yielded results that he held a tablet in his hand. The symbols in the memories of former Wings of Liberty members partially match a certain coding system in the fortress database, but they are not technical instructions.

The environmental parameters are set in conflict with the local evolutionary history and recalibration is recommended. Leeway said, "This confirms our judgment. The standard blueprint for the fortress is indeed not suitable for Earth.

But what interesting is that the timestamps on these logs are very old, even earlier than the construction time of the fortress. Line looked up. What do you mean? It means that the designers knew there were problems with the blueprint from the beginning, but still decided to use a simplified solution. Leeway explained, "It might have been due to time constraints or limited resources, but they included a correction mechanism in the system, which is the security protocol module. They just didn't expect that the module would be corrupted when it was activated.

Therefore, the violent activation of Wings of Liberty destroyed a safety valve that could have prevented disaster." That is right. Leeway nodded. What are the conditions? It is still unclear. The log is incomplete. Leewi said regretfully. We need more information. Carl's is searching in the Fortress database, but he said the data there is vast and might take months or even years to sort through.

Dot months, years. Time waits for no one. Lenmo looked at the last window. The fortress's daily status report. The system operated smoothly with energy consumption kept at a low level.

the resident administrator, me, the backup administrator, you, and an unknown third party. Attempts are underway to crack the first two layers. Final emergency protocol. That doesn't sound simple. Linmo replied with authorization confirmation.

The cool sea breeze dispelled the daytime heat.

Such an also came out carrying two cups of hot tea. "Are you tired?" she asked, hitting her glass. "It's all right." Lyn and Mo took the teacup, the steam rising on his face. It just feels like we've solved one problem and 10 new ones have popped up. This is the norm.

Do Sue Chian leaned against the railing next to him. It was the same when I was doing research in the lab. Every time I answer a question, more questions would arise. Science is like this and so is survival. Dot.

She looked at the distant sea. The Dead Sea is starting to lighten in color. The latest satellite images show that the area covered by the bofilm has decreased by 5% in the past 3 days. Although it's slow, it is indeed improving. Will the ecosystem recover? It will take time, but it will.

Sue Chanchan said, "Nature has a powerful ability to repair itself. As long as we stop causing damage once the fortress enters adaptive mode, it will no longer output active factors, and those bacterial films will lose their instruction source and begin to decay naturally. We can learn from the technology of fortresses, but we cannot rely on it. We need to have our own strength. Doc, he remembered that in used item in the daily login system, the epic shelter, sky city core template. He'd had it for a long time, but the astonishing material requirements had kept it shelved. Under the lights, new challenges await. Chapter 152. Undercurrents rise again. The meeting was held in the briefing room next to the command center. Core members of the Muan Pavilion sat around a long table, each with a freshly printed intelligence summary spread out before them.

The air was thick with a mingled smells of strong coffee and anxiety. Lynn and Mo sat in the main seat, his fingers tapping lightly on the table. This was a habitual gesture he made when he was thinking. We ll address these three issues one by one. He began his voice steady.

Let us start with the Coral Society s research vessel. Su Chanchchan, what are your thoughts? Su Chanchian pulled up a map of the sea area and marked a red dot at the edge of the Dead Sea. The bacterial biofilm itself is an aggregate of microorganisms and shoot and tea have this kind of macroscopic movement capability.

Unless unless the fortress's system is still affecting it. Sure, how guest or the bacterial bofilm itself may have evolved some kind of collective intelligence. Sue Chanchan said, "But what I'm more worried about is that this proliferation may be a defensive response to invasion like the immune system attacking foreign objects." Lyno nodded. So the research vessel may have triggered some kind of defense mechanism and is now trapped or destroyed. We need to send someone to check it out.

I'll go. Sure. How said immediately. Take two patrol boats and make sure they're well protected. If a ship is still standing, there might be survivors.
