Lin Mo turned to the second question. Dragon Souls emergency meeting. Manager Chien, can you dig out more details? Chendo duo rubbed her temples, clearly having not slept all night. The inside source only knows that the meeting was of a very high level with participants including people from the Strategic Nuclear Forces Command and several senior research advisers. He said the agenda was not leaked.

But after the meeting, Dragon Souls nuclear submarine Deep Diver 3 changed its cruise route and is now moving southeast. At the same time, their satellite reconnaissance frequency has tripled with key monitoring areas, including our bases and fortresses. Southeast, Lynn, Emo drew a line on the map. What's there? A deep sea plane with no special resources, but it's only a 100 nautical miles from where the radical faction of the Stonemason's Brotherhood is gathered. Leeway interjected.

Dragon Soul might be worried that the Brotherhood's radicals might do something crazy like trying to reactivate the fortress or steal the technology. They might be considering a preemptive strike. Or they might want to take advantage of the situation to seize control of the fortress. Chiian Duo added, "After all, the fortress is relatively stable now, and we are managing it. For them, this is both a threat and a temptation to Lynn Mo ponder for a moment.

continue to monitor them, but Dante provoked them. He said, "If necessary, we can proactively contact them, provide some nonsensitive data, and demonstrate our transparency. At the same time, we should have our patrols avoid the dragon soulless activity areas to prevent misjudgment." Clear? The third question. Lyn Mo looked at Chining. What intelligence do you have about the radical faction within the Brotherhood? Since returning to Mayu pavilion, Chining has been trying to contact old acquaintances within the Brotherhood.

However, the conservatives, having seized power, have conducted a thorough purge, cutting off many channels of communication. All I know is that they assembled five ships, all of which have been modified and equipped with deep sea operation equipment, Chinyang said. Three years ago, he advocated for a forced entry into the fortress for research. And now that wings of freedom has proven that entry is possible.

He has even less likely to give up dot. When might they start there more than one maintenance access route to the fortress? The shadow pulled up a structural diagram. The one we're using is the emergency access route directly above, but according to the design, there are at least three other side entrances located at different points on the seabed. The Brotherhood S exploration over the past few decades may have already located the approximate locations of one or two of them. Lynmo suddenly spoke up. Perhaps a lockdown is not necessary. Everyone looked at him. We can take the initiative to invite them to negotiate. Lynmo said through the shadow s connections we can contact the anvil and tell them that we are willing to share some technical data but only if they give up their forced entry.

At the same time, we can let them know about dragon soulless movements. Let them know that acting recklessly now could trigger a full-scale conflict. Will they believe it? Chi and Duo Duo asked. Chenning Yuri in charge of making the contact manager Chien ULL provides some peripheral data as a sample of sincerity. True long-term stability required greater strength and a more secure base.

He pulled up another document and projected it onto the screen. That was a brief introduction and materials list for the epic shelter sky city core template. The list was astonishingly long, ranging from tens of thousands of tons of special steel to various rare elements and then to complex electronic components and energy cores. This is our long-term goal, Linmo said. A mobile, self-sufficient aerial fortress that can withstand any threat.

Only with it can we truly take control of our own destiny. Leewi's eyes lit up as he looked at the list of materials, but then he frowned. Many of these materials I have never seen before. Some exist only in theory, while others may need to be extracted from the deep sea or special minerals. So, we'll start preparations now.

Lyn Mo said, "Sue Chanchian, you'll be in charge of the biological and ecological aspects, researching the ecological cycle system mentioned in the template. Manager Chien, you'll be in charge of resource channels, seeing which materials can be obtained through trade and which we need to mine ourselves. He paused for a moment. Sure, how you're in charge of security and defense.

Building such a fortress can't be kept completely secret. Once the news leaks, it could attract the covetous eyes of various parties. We need to prepare contingency plans in advance. The tasks were assigned and everyone felt the pressure but also a touch of excitement. If the sky city were built, it would completely change their way of life.

After the meeting, Lynn Mo remained alone in the briefing room. He pulled up the fortress's live surveillance footage. The Dead Sea area remained calm and the bacterial film was slowly receding. Inside the fortress, Carse was working on the database. His vital signs were stable.

However, the decryption of the final emergency protocol is progressing slowly. Two layers of the triple authorization have been passed, but the third layer remains elusive. The system prompts that civilization inheritor certification is required. A completely unfamiliar concept. Lyno rubbed his temples.

One mystery after another. The answers always seemed so close yet so far away. The communicator rang. It was a report from the forward patrol. Mr.

Lynn Weeve found some floating debris on the edge of the Dead Sea. Sure. How s voice came through. It s confirmed to be the wreckage of the Explorer 7 that the hull is severely damaged as if it was torn apart from the inside by something. We found no survivors, but we salvaged some equipment fragments and a recorder.

Can a recorder still be read? We're trying, but the casing is severely damaged and we may need technical support from Leeway's team. Bring the wreckage and all salvaged items back. Take precautions against biohazards as the wreckage may be covered with bacterial films or bioactive agents. Clear. After ending the call, Linmo walked to the window.

Night had fallen and only a few navigation lights flickered on the sea. In the distance, the dead sea was shrouded in darkness. Even the starlight seemed to have been swallowed up. What did Explorer 7 encounter? Just how dangerous is the Bofilm's defense mechanism? What is Dragon Souls true intention? How will the Brotherhood's radical faction choose? Problems came flooding in like a tide. But Lin Mo knew that anxiety wouldn't solve the problem.

They needed to take it one step at a time, dealing with the most urgent issues, preparing for the most important ones, and remaining vigilant at the same time. He returned to the control panel and began to formulate a detailed resource gathering plan. Sky City needed a massive amount of materials and the existing reserves of Mo Yuon Pavilion were just a drop in the ocean. He would need to mobilize his connections and trading networks throughout the region and might even need to venture into uncharted waters to explore from mineral deposits. Although the daily check-in system provides a considerable amount of resources, it's still far from sufficient for such a massive project.

He must find a more efficient way to acquire them. At 11 p.m. Leewayi excitedly knocked on the door. Mr. Lynn, some of the data from the recorder has been recovered.

He held up a tablet computer. Although at s incomplete, there is a crucial recording dot. Lyno took the tablet and pressed play. First came a series of noisy electrical crackling sounds. Then a man's urgent voice.

The bacterial film is moving. It's enveloping the hull and secretreting some kind of acidic mucus. The hull is dissolving. The propulsion system has failed. In the background, screams from others and the sound of metal twisting could be heard.

Then came another voice sounding like the captain. Activate the emergency buoys. Send out all data. Tell the society that the bofilms are not passive structures. They are alive.

They are conscious. A violent tremor and a cracking sound followed. The final recording is a near whisper filled with fear and confusion. They're learning. They're learning from us.

Oh my god, they're imitating us. The recording ends here. Leeway looked at Lyn Mo, his face pale. The bacterial film is censient. How is that possible? Lynn Emmo stared at the sound wave diagram on the screen.

The trembling in that last sentence was genuine fear. Perhaps not consciousness, but some kind of distributed intelligence, he said slowly. Like an ant colony or a bee colony. The individual organisms are simple, but the collective can exhibit complex behaviors. Biofilms are composed of countless microorganisms if they can coordinate their actions through chemical signals.

He didn't finish speaking, but Leeway already understood. Then explorer 7 became their learning model, Leeway murmured. They learned about material strength from the hull structure, energy conduction from the electronic equipment, and even from the crew. He dared not continue. Lynn and Mo close the recording file.

Notify all units to temporarily refrain from approaching the bacterial film area. We will decide on the next step after Sue Chanchian finishes analyzing the retrieve samples. Also send this recording to Carl's and ask him if there are similar records in the database. Good. After Leewi left, LinMo stood alone in front of the control panel.

Outside the window, the night grew even darker. Undercurrents are stirring and they have only caught a glimpse of the tip of the iceberg. The real challenge may have only just begun. Chapter 153. The intelligence of microbial films.

Morning light streamed through the observation window into the biological laboratory, casting bright spots on the metal workbench. Su Chian stood before the protective isolation cabinet. Her hands clad in three layers of gloves, carefully manipulating the robotic arm. Inside the cabinet were bacterial samples scraped from the wreckage of Explorer 7. The sample was placed in a transparent petri dish.

Its grayish white surface interspersed with dark red veins. Under the microscope, these veins revealed a complex network structure, denser and more organized than the bacterial films collected previously. Lenmo stood outside the isolation cabinet and asked through the communicator, "Any discoveries? The structure has clearly evolved." Suchian's voice came through the speaker, tense with focused attention. Look here, there are differentiation nodes resembling ganglia appearing in the veins. Microtubules connect the nodes forming a multi-level network.

And she adjusted the focus of the microscope to magnify a local area. These nodes are actively transmitting signals. I injected fluorescently labeled ion probes and saw them move directionally within the network 10 times faster than normal diffusion. The network itself exhibits regular electrical pulse activity at a frequency of about once per second which is very stable. Lynn Mo watched the real-time images displayed on the screen.

The fluorescent markers like points of light in a stream float along fixed paths pausing briefly in nodes before continuing onward. The entire network resembled some kind of primitive but efficient information processing system. Are they really learning? It at least demonstrates complex information processing capabilities. Such Chian switched the image to show the bacterial film's response to different stimuli. I conducted several sets of experiments.

In the first set, a weak current was used to stimulate a local area and the entire network redistributed its charge within 3 seconds, reducing the voltage of the stimulation point to below the safe threshold. She pulled up the second set of data. In the second set, a small amount of acidic substance was placed on one side of the petri dish. The network mobilized alkaline metabolites to the corresponding area within 20 seconds, neutralizing the acid. More importantly, it remembered this event subsequently when the same substance was placed in the same location.

The reaction time was shortened to 5 seconds. The third group is the most troublesome. Sue Changen's voice lowered. I put a small piece of metal in a petri dish to simulate a ship hull fragment. After the bacterial film came into contact with it, it began to secrete special enzymes that specifically decompose the components of this alloy.

At the same time, the network grew new veins that wrapped around the metal piece as if it was analyzing its structure. Linimo fell silent. If the bacterial membrane could analyze material structure and secrete decomposing enzymes specifically, then the rapid dissolution of explorer 7 would be explained. Even more terrifying was that this ability was evolving. Where do they get this capability? The fortress has stopped supplying it.

There are probably two reasons. Sue Chanchian analyzed. First, the active factors obtained early on have changed the basic biological characteristics of the microbial biofilm, giving them the potential to learn and evolve. Second, the microbial biofilm itself is evolving a community of trillions of microorganisms under extreme environmental pressure could very well evolve complex collective behaviors. She turned off the microscope, stepped out of the isolation cabinet, and began to remove her protective gear.

Just like early life on Earth, from single-sellled to multisellular, from simple to complex, biofilms may now be at a critical point, evolving from passive biofilms to organized super individuals. Lynmo pondered this possibility. If the bacterial film truly evolved intelligence, even a most primitive kind, it would mean that the entire Dead Sea region would no longer be a simple ecologically polluted area, but a nent unknown life system. Does it pose a threat to us? Uncertain D. Sue Chian washed her hands, her voice tinged with weariness.

From what we can see now, its behavior is limited to defense and adaptation. But once intelligence develops, it will seek expansion and continuation. What if it perceives us as a threat or if our resources are useful to it? She didn't finish her sentence, but her meaning was clear. At that moment, Leeway pushed open the door and came in holding a tablet computer. Carl's replied, he said, "There are similar records in the fortress database regarding the intelligent phenomenon of bofilms.

During the testing phase of a standard blueprint, the designers cultivated basic ecological units, which are biofilm-like microbial clusters used as tools for environmental modification. However, these units were programmed to only execute simple instructions and lack the ability to evolve autonomously. Why do the things we encounter evolve? Carl believes that it is possible that there was a horizontal gene transfer between Earths native microorganisms and the units cultivated by the designers resulting in unplanned hybrids or leeway paused the energy shock when the fortress was activated unexpectedly increased the mutation rate of these units. In short, the current situation is beyond the design expectations dot. This was yet another unexpected consequence.

Linmo took the tablet and reviewed the complete data sent by Carl's. The data showed that the designers had imposed multiple safety restrictions on this microbial cluster, including life cycle limits, diffusion range limits, and most importantly, the development of complex swarm intelligence was not allowed. But these restrictions are now clearly ineffective. Carl's advised us to take control measures as soon as possible, Leeway said. He offered several possible containment options, ranging from biological inhibitors to targeted genetic weapons.

But these options all require production from within the fortress and would cause collateral damage to the existing ecosystem. How much collateral damage is there? If biological inhibitors are used, it could kill more than 90% of the microorganisms in the Dead Sea area, including many unmodified native species. Such Chanchian looked at the data. Targeted genetic weapons are more precise, but they require deciphering the genome of the bacterial biofilm first, which could take weeks or even months. Moreover, if the bofilm is already spread to a wider area, the genetic weapon may also become ineffective.

Time and time again, Lano walked to the window and looked at the calm sea outside. It seemed peaceful, but a silent evolutionary race was taking place underwater. First, we need to prepare an inhibitor production plan, he decided. But at the same time, we need to try to communicate with the bacterial membrane. Suian and Leewi were both stunned for a moment.

Communication. How do we communicate? Since it can process information, it should be able to receive information. Lin Mo turned around. We can try using chemical signals, light signals, or even electrical signals to send its simple messages such as harmless, threat, or boundary. Let SC if it can understand them.

and if it will respond. That is too risky. Lewi said if it interprets our signals as a threat, it might launch a preemptive attack. Therefore, we need to conduct small-scale tests in a controlled environment. Linmo said, "Use remote equipment and conduct the tests at a safe distance.

At the same time, prepare contingency plans so we can evacuate if things go wrong." Such an thought for a moment and nodded. theoretically feasible. Since the bacterial membrane network can transmit signals, it may have basic signal recognition capabilities. We can design a simple binary code and use light pulses of different frequencies or chemical concentration gradients to represent them. You design the experimental plan.

Linmo said, "Lewi, prepare the equipment. The first test will begin in 3 days." Good. After the two left, Lin Mo returned to the command center. Chi and Duo Duo was waiting for him there, looking even worse than in the morning. Bad news cut to the chase.

The Bofilm's intelligence, the Dragon Souls submarines, the Brotherhood's negotiations, the unknown inheritors of civilization, and the approaching signal source 300 nautical miles away. All the clues are like a net tightening around them.

You must find a breakthrough before the net tightens. Tomorrow, the outcome will be decided at the negotiating table. And in the more distant future, perhaps the answers they seek lie hidden in those unknown seabed mineral deposits. Chapter 154. Platform negotiation.

At 7:00 in the morning, a thin layer of mist covered the sea. The Mo Yuan Pavilion speedboat. The flying fish departed the dock and headed southwest toward the abandoned drilling platform. The engine roared low and the vessel moved at an economical speed, leaving a white trail on the calm sea. Lynn and Mo stood in the cockpit, looking through the front window at the gradually clearing horizon.

Chenning beside him checked the equipment. Two submachine guns for stun grenades and a portable signal jammer. The anvil likes to play psychological games. Chining said he might deliberately be late or set up some scare tactics. Dante get distracted.

Keep your rhythm. Dot. How much do you know about him? We worked together for 5 years. Dot. Chinyanging pushed the magazine into the gun with a click.

He asked the kind of person who s a typical tech fanatic. He believes that knowledge should be held by the elite and that the masses Dante deserve the power to change the world. In the brotherhood, he was one of the most radical members. He even thought that the conservatives were too weak. What is his attitude towards the fortress obsession? Chennying succinctly commented 3 years ago.

He advocated entering the fortress at any cost even at the risk of activation. Now he has proven right. Although the consequences were dire, he did get in. This will only make him more convinced of his own abilities. The speedboat continued its journey.

When it was 15 nautical miles from the platform, Lynn Mo initiated a signal scan. The screen displayed the electromagnetic environment around the platform. In addition to the regular communication frequencies, there were several unusual pulse signals spaced regularly resembling some kind of detection device. There an underwater sonar array. Chennying pointed to the screen.

Four transmitters covering a 300 m radius around the platform. Any submersible that gets closed will be detected immediately. Dot. The defenses are very tight. That is more like him.

Chennying said anvil likes to control every detail. The more meticulous he seems, the more it shows that he is insecure. Dot. When they were 10 nautical miles apart, an unfamiliar voice came through the communicator. horse and with a synthesized electronic quality.

Flying fish, please confirm your identity. Channing glanced at Linmo, then picked up the microphone. This is Channing here to negotiate as agreed. Mr. Lynmo is with me.

After a brief silence, the voice rang out again. Approach permitted. More at birth number three on the east side of the platform. Only two people are allowed on the platform. Weapons must remain on board.

We will conduct an inspection. Clear. Eight nautical miles, five nautical miles, three nautical miles. The abandoned drilling platform gradually came into view. It was an old-fashioned forpost platform, rusty and with obvious signs of fire damage to the superructure.

The original drilling equipment had long been removed, leaving only an empty steel frame. New guardrails and lighting equipment had been installed around the platform's edges, and several people in gray uniforms were walking on the deck. The flying fish slowly approached birth number three. A metal staircase next to the birth led directly to the upper deck. Lin Mo and Shiening left their weapons in the cockpit, taking only their communicators and recording devices.

As they ascended the stairs, two armed guards approached and professionally conducted a body search. After confirming they were unarmed, they were signaled to continue upwards. The top floor of the platform had been converted into a makeshift conference room. a long metal table, several folding chairs, and a map of the sea, and structural drawings hung on the wall. A tall man with broad shoulders and neatly trimmed short graying hair stood with his back to them in front of the map.

He turned around, revealing a sharply defined face. He was around 50 years old with deep set eyes, a hybrid nose, and a faint scar on his chin. His eyes were iron gray, and he looked at people as if he were appraising an object. Andel Shadowbringer he spoke first his voice lower than it had been over the phone. Three years have passed and UV he chosen the other side.

I chose rationality chinnying said calmly. What about my mentor? Is he all right? Carl made his choice. The anvil didn't te answer directly just as Uve made yours. Sit down to the three took their seats. Iron Anvil's gaze turned to Lin Mo scrutinizing him for a few seconds.

Lynn Mo, the leader of the Inc. Abyss Pavilion. I've seen you in intelligence reports. You look younger than in the photos. Let's talk straight, Lynn Mo, said.

What do you want? The Andel smiled, but the smile was faint and devoid of warmth. Frankness. I like that. Dot. He leaned forward, elbows on the table.

I want the fortresses complete technology database, especially the sections on ecological modification and energy systems. In exchange, the Brotherhood radicals will cease all operations against the fortress and I can provide some intelligence you need. For example, for example, dragon soulless nuclear submarines are mapping the fortresses weak points. Anvil said, for example, the Coral Society is cultivating mutant strains of bofilm in an attempt to create controllable biological weapons. For example, we detected the approaching signal of the civilization inheritors earlier than you did.

Lynn Mo remained expressionless, but a slight tension gripped his heart. The anvil possessed more information than he had anticipated. "We can't he give away the technical database," he said. "But we can share research findings regularly, provided that security is insured. As for intelligence, we can exchange other resources if you can provide something valuable." Dot.

Research findings. The anvil smile vanished. Secondhand data that has been screened, filtered, and censored. I want the original data, the designer's complete thought process, not the leftovers you've digested. Raw data is too dangerous.

The lessons of Wings of Liberty are still fresh in our minds. The Wings of Liberty are fools that anvil made no attempt to hide his contempt. They think that violence can control everything. But true control comes from understanding. Deep and thorough understanding.

I have that ability. And you don T dot. Chinning interjected. It took our mentor 3 years to barely fix the security protocol. What makes you think you could do better? Because Carl's is a scholar and I am an engineer.

Amble said scholars strive for perfection while engineers strive for practicality. I don't need to fully understand it. I just need to know how to use it. Dot. The atmosphere in the meeting room became tense.

Lynmo was silent for a moment then changed direction. What are the inheritors of civilization you mentioned? The anvil glanced at him, seemingly assessing how much to say. It s recorded in the Brotherhood s his historical records. He concluded the civilization that built the fortress left behind several inheritors before they left not people but some kind of information carrier that recorded their complete history and technology tree. When a civilization faces extinction, the inheritors are activated to find suitable recipients.

What are the activation requirements? I don't know, but the conditions are clearly met now that the anvil pointed southeast out the window. 3 days ago, we detected an unusual energy signal coming from the deep sea and then it began to move slowly. The direction was initially northwest, then turned due north and now at S facing this area. The speed is very slow, about 30 nautical miles a day, but very stable. Dot.

Have you tried to make contact? We tried but failed. For the first time, a look of frustration appeared on Iron Ambble's face. The unmanned underwater vehicles we sent out all lost contact when they got within 5 nautical miles. There was some kind of defensive field around the signal source with an absurdly high intensity. The only gain was a blurry image.

He took a printed photo from under the table and pushed it over. The photo was taken in deep sea conditions, and the image quality is rough, but a general outline can be discerned. It is a spindle-shaped object about 50 m long with a smooth surface and no obvious propulsion devices or openings around it. The seawater appears abnormally distorted as if disturbed by a strong energy field. This isn't a fortress-like structure.

Lynn Mo observed carefully. It looks more like a mode of transportation or rather a messenger. The anvil said, "If it is truly a heir, then it carries the legacy of an entire civilization. Whoever obtains it first holds the key to the next aerod." Lyno pushed the photo back. So, you want the fortress's technology to enhance your strength, so you can compete for the inheritance.

It s mutually beneficial. Iron amble. Didn't he deny it? You control the fortress, but lack the ability to explore the deep sea. We have equipment and experience, but lack core technology. If we cooperate, we both have a chance.

If we fight, the dragon soul or the coral academy will ultimately benefit. Dot. The logic was clear, but Linmo didn't believe it. A person like Iron Anvil will not be content with cooperation. He wants complete control.

We can cooperate in exploring the inheritors, Linmo said. But the conditions will change. First, the Brotherhood must cease all unauthorized fortress research. Second, all intelligence regarding the inheritors must be shared. And third, the exploration operation will be jointly commanded by both sides.

With the results shared, the ambles stared at him for a long time. Then he stood up and walked to the window. Young men, Yuvie, he got one thing wrong. He said his back to them. I'm not asking for your cooperation.

I am giving you a choice. Hand over the technology database and you can gracefully exit this game. Dante handed over Dot. He turned around, a dangerous glint in his iron gray eyes. Dragon Souls submarine is just 30 nautical miles away.

All I need to do is send a signal to tell them your location on the platform and provide some evidence proving that Mo Yuan Pavilion is plotting to use fortress technology to create ecological weapons. Do you think the LL just launched torpedoes? The shadowy figure pressed his hand on the table, his knuckles turning white. Are you crazy? that would trigger a fullscale war. The war started long ago, the anvil said calmly. You've just been pretending to be at peace.

Now give me the answer. Database or war? The conference room was deathly silent. Lynn Mo slowly stood up and looked directly into the eyes of the anvil. I choose the third path, he said. Right now, let dragon soul know your location.

At the same time, I will send all the intelligence on the Brotherhood s radicals, including evidence of your illegal exploration over the past three years to the Dragon Soul leadership and the Brotherhood s conservatives. We'll all go down together. How about that? The Anvil's expression froze. He hadn't expected this reaction. You wouldn't dare, he said, his voice lowering.

Let's give it a try. Lyn Mo picked up the communicator. Shadowbringer, contact base and prepare to send. Wait. The anvil interrupted him.

Silence filled the room. The ticking of the second hand was clearly audible. Finally, the anvil sat back down in the chair, and the smile reappeared. But this time, it had something different. Not a threat, but a complex, almost admiring emotion.

Fine, you ruthless, he said. I take back what I just said. Let us talk on your terms, dot. Over the next 2 hours, the two sides finalized a preliminary cooperation framework. The Brotherhood's Radical Faction provided the Inheritors real-time coordinates and detection data, while the Inc.

Abyss Pavilion contributed some of the Fortress's environmental technology for modifying deep sea exploration equipment. The two sides jointly formed an exploration team with command rotating among themselves and all discoveries shared. The agreement is fragile, but it at least temporarily averts direct conflict. The negotiations ended at noon. When they left the platform, the anvil escorted them to the stairwell.

Shadowbringer, he called his former colleague. Carl is still alive. I asenti he chinning stopped in her tracks without turning around. He chose his own path. Tell him.

Iron Amble paused that I have no regrets about what happened back then. But if I had the chance, I would have done it differently. Dot. After a few seconds of silence, Chennying nodded. On the speedboat back, the fog on the sea had dissipated.

Mr. Lynn, the Dragon Soul submarine, suddenly dived to its maximum depth and disappeared 10 minutes ago. Our sonar has completely lost its signal. He says the Inheritor's signal has accelerated. It's now traveling at 5 knots hour and its direction has been slightly adjusted. Heading straight for the fortress. Notify everyone. Emergency meeting. We have new work to do. Chapter 155. Beyond the firewall.

The emergency meeting of Mayuan Pavilion was held in a small conference room next to the command center. He stood in front of the map, staring at the red circle. Five knots per hour, not fast in the deep sea, but terrifyingly stable. It was like some kind of pre-programmed automatic navigation system, unaffected by ocean currents, terrain, or even time. What exactly is the Inheritor? And what are the activation conditions? Too many questions, too few answers.

At 300 p.m., Chin Duo Duo brought the first intelligence update. The signal characteristics of the inheritor have changed that he pointed to the spectrum analysis chart. In addition to the original low-frequency pulses, there are now highfrequency modulated signals like some kind of broadcast. We're trying to decode it, but the signal encryption method is very special and existing algorithms cannot crack it. Broadcast range.

Currently, it only covers a spherical area with a radius of about 20 nautical miles. But if it continues to approach the fortress, the distance between them will shrink to within 10 nautical miles. At that point, the fortress system may be able to react to it. Lynn Mo frowned. What's the reaction? I don't know, but Carr said that the Fortresses S logs mentioned the inheritor protocol, which seems to be some kind of interactive program reserved by the designers.

The specific content requires higher privileges to access and he currently only has permanent administrator privileges one level away from being available. It's a permissions issue again. Let him keep trying. Also ask him how risky it would be if we sent someone to contact the successor now. IV already asked that she duo duo smiled Riley.

His reply was not recommended. The defense mechanisms of unknown systems could be fatal. Though, this doesn't sound like good news at all. At 5:00 p.m., Such Chian and Shanning came to find Linmo with a preliminary experimental results.

In a biology lab, the bacterial film sample in the petri dish responded to a specific light signal. When Sue Chanchian flashed a red LED at a preset frequency, the network electrical pulse activity of the bacterial film significantly increased and new veins grew towards the light source. It can recognize simple signal patterns. Do Sue Chantian pulled up the data chart. It has not just a reaction but also signs of learning after the same set of signals was repeated three times.

The reaction time of the bacterial membrane shortened from 12 seconds to 3 seconds. On the fourth time, it even made preparatory adjustments before we issued the signal dot. On the screen, the fluorescent markers of the bacterial membrane network begin to redistribute half a second before the signal is emitted as if they anticipate the upcoming stimulus. This is no longer a simple conditioned reflex. Dotching stared at the screen.

It has formed a kind of expected pattern. It s like when you train a dog. You give it food every time you ring a bell and after a few times the dog will salivate when it hears the bell dot. But it s just a collection of microorganisms. Leewi said incredulously.

Ant colonies can solve complex path problems and be colonies can build precise hexagonal nests. Such an key to swarm intelligence is not how smart the individuals are, but how they cooperate. Now that the microbial biofilm has an efficient chemical signal transduction network, it is entirely possible for it to evolve into rudimentary intelligence dot. She switched the experimental log. What's more troublesome is that when I tried to convey the concept of boundary using signal combinations, for example, using a specific pattern to represent cannot be crossed, the bacterial film started actively testing the boundary.

After the third experiment, it grew tentacle-like structures, carefully protruding out of the marked area and then quickly retracting as if assessing the risk. Lynn Emmo watched the experimental videos. The grayish white bacterial film slowly writhed in the petri dish like living mucus. When it extended its tentacles beyond the boundary, its movements were cautious and purposeful, completely unlike random growth. If we establish stable signal communication with it, can we negotiate? Maybe it is possible, but it will take time, Sue Chan said.

Moreover, the premise of negotiation is that both sides have common interests or threats. What are the interests of the bacterial film right now? Survival, expansion. We dine know its goals, so we dine know what can be used as a bargaining chip. Dot. Silence fell over the laboratory.

Outside the window, the sky began to darken. At 700 p.m., Sherhow brought a report on the completion of the defense deployment along with some bad news. The patrol team spotted an unidentified submersible 30 nautical miles east of the base. He placed a photo on the table, small, unmarked, and silent. Our sonar almost missed it.

After being detected, it quickly submerged and fled. The photo is blurry. Only a streamlined outline can be seen, approximately 5 m long. It has not standard equipment from Dragon Soul. Nor is it a model commonly seen in the Brotherhood.

Chining analyzed. The Coral Society does have similar research submersibles, but they usually Dante operate this discreetly. Dot. Have you tracked it down? No. It entered the deep sea canyon area where the terrain is complex and the sonar is ineffective.

Sure house said, but judging from the direction it fled, it may have come from the southeast direction from which the inheritor came. Dot. another new variable. At 900 p.m., Carl sent an urgent communication from the Fortress. The signal strength of the inheritor is continuously increasing.

The fortress's level 2 alert protocol has been triggered. The system has automatically activated three deep sea monitoring arrays, which are currently collecting data. Preliminary analysis shows that the inheritor's energy characteristics are 73% similar to the fortress's core energy system, but the technological approach is significantly different. It may have used a more advanced energy conversion principle. Additionally, synchronized responses were detected in the bacterial biofilm in the Dead Sea region.

The frequency of electrical impulse activity in the biofilm network correlates with the signal modulation frequency of the inheritors. The two may be communicating in some way. Adelog, are the bacterial film and the inheritor communicating? Limo immediately contacted Sukianken. 10 minutes later, she rushed into the command center holding a freshly printed data chart. She right.

Such Chian spread the drawings on the table. Look here. Over the past 2 hours, the network activity of the bacterial membrane has shown obvious periodic fluctuations. The timing of the peaks and troughs corresponds exactly to the fluctuations in the strength of the inheritor s signal. The error is no more than 2 seconds dot.

Is it a coincidence? The probability is less than one in a thousand, Sue Chansian said with certainty. Moreover, the fluctuation pattern is changing. At first, it was simple synchronization, but now there's a more complex interaction. And the activity of the bacterial membrane changes first and the inheritor s signal adjusts accordingly as if in response to what does this mean? Is the mcelium actively contacting the inheritor or is the inheritor sending instructions to the mcelium? Can Carl's interpret what they're saying? Lynn Mo asked. No, the signal encoding method is unknown.

However, the system recorded a similar pattern during the early stages of the fortress's construction. The designers tested information exchange between distributed ecological units. The records at that time described it as a basic ecological coordination protocol. Basic ecosystem coordination protocol. It sounds like a communication standard designed to enable different ecosystem components to work together.

If the bacterial biofilm is one kind of ecological unit, then the inheritor is another ecological unit. Could they be different parts of the same system? Lewi suddenly asked. The fortress is the environmental transformation and production center. The microbial membrane is the ecological execution unit. And the inheritor is the information and control center.

This speculation sent chills down everyone's spine. If this is the case, then the approach of the inheritors to the fortress is not accidental, but rather a systemic reunion. When the three components reconnect, the complete system will activate and execute its predetermined final task. That mission is likely to completely transform Earth's ecosystem according to the blueprint. We must prevent them from making contact, Lynn Mo said.

But how to stop them? The inheritors reside in the deep sea. Their speed stable, their defenses unknown. The bofilm covers vast areas of the ocean and is still evolving intelligence. Although the fortress is under control, its basic programs may still be responding to the systems call. There are less than 70 hours left.

At 11 p.m., the anvil will deliver the inheritor's real-time data packet as promised. The data was more detailed than expected. Precise coordinates, depth, velocity, energy readings, and even chemical composition analysis of the surrounding water. The accompanying note was only one sentence. Sincere cooperation.

We look forward to your return. Lynmo asked Leewayi to verify the authenticity of the data. Half an hour later, Leewi confirmed that the data was reliable and more accurate than what they had monitored themselves. The anvils detection equipment is more advanced than ours. He admitted the Brotherhood does have experience in deep sea exploration.

Dot. Then let us put it to use. Linmo said, "Analyze the Inheritor S movement trajectory and predict the precise time and location when it arrives at the Dead Sea. At the same time, calculate how much power we would need to intercept it now and what the probability of success would be." Dot intercept. Sure, Hal frowned.

What can we use to intercept them? Our fleet is mainly for patrol and transportation. It doesn't have deep sea combat capabilities. Use the fortress. Everyone looked at Linmo. The fortress has a defense system and deep sea mobility, Lynn Mo said.

Although most of its functions are currently restricted, the basic defense modules are still intact. If we temporarily adjust the permissions, allowing Carl to control the fortress to move onto the inheritor's path. It s too risky to Chining shook his head. The debate continued until 1:00 a.m. Ultimately, they reached a compromise. The fortress would remain stationary for the time being, but preparations would be made for relocation at any time.

Simultaneously, a small team would be dispatched in a modified deep sea submersible to attempt contact with the inheritor from a safe distance, assessing its defensive capabilities and intentions. The team is led by Chining with Leewi providing technical support. Departure is scheduled for tomorrow morning. After the meeting, Linmo did not return to the lounge. In the distance, the direction of the Dead Sea remains pitch black. But if you look closely, you'll notice an extremely faint pulsating fluoresence at the edge of that darkness sits the bacterial film moving. Beyond the fog wall, the unknown is approaching. And every decision they make could lead to a completely different future. At 2:00 in the morning, Sue Chan found him holding a thermos in her hand.

Have something hot to drink? She handed me the cup. What are you thinking about? I wonder if we on the right track. Do Lyno took the cup. The warmth of the hot tea seeping through the cup. All the clues point in the same direction.

A larger system, more complex relationships, and more dangerous unknowns. Sue Chanchian leaned against the railing next to him. We made the choice we could at the time.

As for the consequences, we can only face them, dot. She looked out at the sea. You know, there's a concept in biology called the red queen hypothesis. It means that in evolution you have to keep running just to stay in the same place because the environment is changing and the competitors are changing. Stagnation is equivalent to extinction.

We are running now. At least we still running. Su Chian said and weary not running alone. We have a team technology a fortress and each other. Dot.

Lin mo turned to look at her in a moonlight. Her profile was clearly defined and her eyes were resolute. Thank you, he said. You're welcome. Go back and rest now.

There's a tough battle to fight tomorrow. At 3:00 a.m., most of the lights in the base were turned off. But in the biology lab, the bacterial film in the petri dish was still slowly undulating. The monitor's records showed its electrical impulse patterns becoming increasingly complex, as if it were practicing a new language. 300 nautical miles to the southeast, the spindle-shaped object was steadily moving forward in the deep sea.

Its surface was as smooth as a mirror, reflecting the cold light of deep sea creatures. Inside it, a program is running. Distance to target 68 hours and 12 minutes. Agreement status pending activation. Ecological unit detection confirmed to exist.

Environmental assessment in progress. The deep sea is silent, but change has already begun. At 4:00 a.m., the modified deep sea submersible Explorer 2 was ready. This ship was larger than the one Linmo and his team had used last time with additional sensor arrays and robotic arms installed on the hall. The interior space could barely accommodate six people, but only three were going on this mission.

Chining as the team leader, Leewei in charge of technical operations, and Lao Chun, an experienced deep sea pilot. At the dock, Sue Chian packed and secured the last batch of equipment. Chining took the instrument and checked the battery level. Any new discoveries over the bacterial film? The signal experiment is still ongoing but something is strange. Su Chanhan lowered her voice last night. The submersible slowly sank into the water. Its thrusters activated and it turned southeast. The lights at the stern gradually faded into the dark sea. eventually disappearing from sight. Lynamo stood on the dock for a while until the sea had completely calmed down before turning back to the command center.

At 7:00 a.m., the submersible had already traveled 100 nautical miles. The depth was maintained at 300 m, a depth that allowed it to avoid most surface disturbances without experiencing excessive pressure. Inside the cabin, Leeway stared at the three screens in front of him. On the left was the real-time trajectory map of the Inheritor. In the middle was the status data of a deep sea submersible and on the right was the external environmental monitoring.

All readings were within the normal range. Old Shun was a tacetern middle-aged man who had worked in a marine exploration team for 20 years. He operated the submersible with skill and precision, hardly needing to look at the instruments, maintaining course and depth stability entirely by feel. We are 180 nautical miles from the target. Leeway reported, "At the current speed, we expect to make contact in 5 hours.

Slow down to 15 knots." Chining said, "We need to be even more careful once we within 100 nautical miles." Dot. Old Chin nodded and adjusted the thruster power. The submersible speed decreased and the engine noise became almost inaudible. At 9:00 a.m., Shin Duo Duo sent the first intelligence update. "Dragons submarine has reappeared," he said in the communications channel.

It s located on the southeastern edge of the dead sea at a depth of 400 meters and it is stationary. Let them tow it away. Lyno said the wreckage is of little value now. Focus on monitoring the dragon soul submarines movements. Understood. There's one more thing.

The Brotherhood's radical fleet has started moving also southeast, but very slowly, as if they're waiting for something. Wait, wait for the successor to approach, or wait for the deep sea submersible to explore the way first. Lynn Emmo forwarded this information to Chenning. A few minutes later, Chenning replied with a brief two-word message, received. At 11:00 a.m., the submersible entered a 100 nautical mile zone around the inheritor.

The environment began to change. The temperature sensors were the first to detect it. The seawater temperature was a full 2Â° higher than expected, and this anomaly was spherically distributed, spreading outwards from the inheritor. The temperature gradient was very uniform, unlike a naturally occurring heat source. Then came the changes in water quality.

Leeway analyzed the water samples and found that the concentration of dissolved metal ions in the water was abnormally high, especially several rare earth elements with concentrations hundreds of times higher than in normal seawater. These ions formed a clear concentration gradient around the inheritor like some kind of chemical wake. It seems to be actively releasing these substances. Leeway stared at the data, but the purpose is unclear. It could be a byproduct of the energy system or it could be marking territori.

The strangest thing is the biological activity. Normally marine life should avoid areas with such abnormal temperature and water quality. But monitoring shows that a large number of deep sea bioluminescent organisms, lantern fish, deep sea shrimp, siphonophores, and so on gathered around the inheritor. They did not approach but swam around it at a certain distance like pilgrims surrounding a sacred site. The creatures are attracted.

Dot. Shinying observed the footage, transmitted from the external camera. Their swimming patterns are very regular, not random. Dot. Old Chin stopped the submersible at a safe distance and activated the hovering mode.

The hull hovered silently in the 300 me deep water like a lurking hunter. What do we do now? He asked. Observe first, Chinning said. Leeway. activate all passive sensors and collect complete data, especially that highfrequency modulation signal.

Try to analyze its pattern dot. Leewi began his work. The sensor array operated at full power, recording every subtle signal emitted by the inheritor. The spectrum on the screen was as complex as an abstract painting with lines of different colors intertwining and forming patterns that were difficult to decipher. Time passed second by second.

At 100 p.m., the inheritor suddenly changed his behavior. The faint light on its surface began to flicker regularly, the frequency gradually increasing from once per second to five times per second. At the same time, visible disturbances appeared in the water around it. Not currents, but more subtle ripples as if space itself was trembling slightly. The energy field is increasing.

Dot leeways voice tightened. The reading has exceeded the safety threshold by three times. We recommend retreating dot. Wait a little longer. Chining stare at the screen.

What is it showing? Or rather, what is it testing? Sure enough, after a dozen seconds, the frequency of the flashing lights stabilized, forming a repeating sequence. Three short, three long, three short. Leeway was stunned. This is he quickly typed on the keyboard. Morse code SOS.

No, a light signal in the deep sea. Perhaps it s a general distress signal or its indicating harmlessness. The shadow said try to respond. Send the same sequence using the array of lights weary carrying dot. Three sets of high brightness LEDs on the top of the submersible lit up.

The submersible manually controlled the switches repeating the sequence of three short, three long, and three short lights. Sending complete. Everyone held their breath. 5 seconds, 10 seconds, 20 seconds. The light emanating from the inheritor suddenly went out completely.

The deep sea was plunged into complete darkness. Only the lights of the submersible illuminated a small patch of water along with the luminous creatures that circled around it like stars in the night sky. Then a glimmer of light reemerged on the surface of the inheritor. Instead of the previous uniform glow, it became a single point, a tiny bright point. That point began to move, tracing intricate paths across the smooth surface of the inheritor.

Leeway increased the camera sensitivity to record the complete pattern. It was a geometric shaped three intersecting rings each with fine engravings inside this pattern. The shadow s voice changed. IV seen it in the fortress s archives. It as the symbol of the designer civilization and also the symbol of their highest authority.

The three rings remained on the surface of the inheritor for about 10 seconds before fading away. The light was redistributed evenly, restoring the previous state. It s identifying itself, Chining said, or verifying our identities. How should we respond? Leewi asked. We don't have the symbols of that civilization, nor do we know their verification methods.

Use the fortress's access, Shadow decided. Carl's gave us a temporary verification code for system integration in emergencies. Maybe we can use it here to He pulled up an encrypted file from the console, entered the password and opened it. Inside was a complex string of geometric symbols. Supposedly the digital signature used by the designer.

How can we send it? Light signals cannot transmit such complex information. You sound waves. Old Chin suddenly said, "The sonar of a deep sea submersible can emit modulated signals. Although the bandwidth is limited, it should be enough." Dot. They quickly devised a plan.

Leeway converted the geometric code into a soundwave modulation sequence. And Lao Chin adjusted the sonar emission angle, aiming it at the inheritor. Ready to send, the shadow took a deep breath. 3 2 1. The sonar emitted a series of crisp pulses.

In a deep sea, sound travels fast and far. The circling bioluminescent creatures were startled and scattered, but quickly regrouped. The transmission lasted for 30 seconds. Then came the waiting again. This time the response came very quickly.

Light spots reappeared on the surface of the inheritor. This time drawing a different pattern. A simple arrow pointing downwards. Is it guiding away? Lewi asked puzzled. Not below.

Dot. Shinning stared at the pattern. Judging from the angle of the arrow, it s pointing to the seabed dot. He pulled up a map of the seabed. The inheritor was currently suspended above a deep sea canyon below which lay a seabed 4,000 m deep.

The terrain there was complex dotted with hydrothermal vents and mineral veins. Where does it want us to go? Or perhaps it s tried to tell us what s there. Chining pondered. Old Shun, descend to a safe depth and carefully scan the canyon area with the terrain scanner dot. The submersible began its slow descent.

The depth gauge readings continued to increase. 400 m, 500 m, 600 m. At a depth of 800 m, the terrain scanner transmitted clear images. At the bottom of the canyon, there's a clearly visible man-made structure. It's neither a building nor a shipwreck, but a huge metallic disc over a 100 meters in diameter.

The disc surface is covered with the same geometric patterns with a central depression resembling a giant socket or connector. Around the disc, some things were scattered. Leeway zoomed in on the image and gasped. There were more spindle-shaped objects identical to the inheritor, but all motionless, their surfaces dull and lifeless. Some were intact, others were broken, their internal structures exposed.

A rough estimate puts at least 20 of them on the table. Is this a parking lot? Old Chin murmured. Or a cemetery. Chining counted the stationary objects, then looked at the still glowing inheritor. Perhaps they're all waiting, he said, waiting to be activated, waiting for instructions, or waiting to go home.

Dot. The submersible continued its descent, hovering at a height of 300 m above the disc. This distance was safe enough and allowed for clear observation of details. In a recessed center of the disc, there's a clearly visible interface structure. the shape of which perfectly matches the outline of the successor's tail.

A ring of indicator lights surrounds the interface, all of which are currently off. So, the successor is supposed to come and take over, Leeway understood. But why is it stopping here and not continuing? Is it waiting for some condition or it might be waiting for us? Chinyanging said it took the initiative to contact us and show us the location, perhaps wanting us to help it complete the docking dot. What can we do? I don't know. Dot.

Shinning shook his head, but at least now we know its purpose. It s not here to attack or occupy it. S carrying out a preset mission to go home or to deliver a message. Lyn Mo's voice came through the communicator from the command center. Chinnying, "How's the situation?" The shadowy figure gave a brief report on the discovery.

After a long silence, Lyn Mo said, "Let's withdraw first. We need to reassess. If the successor really just wants to make connections, then maybe it's not a threat, but we need to know what will happen after the connections are made. Understood, said the shadow. We'll continue its journey after we leave.

Monitoring data shows that since you sent the verification code, its speed has dropped to zero and it has completely stopped. Lynn Mo said is waiting for your response or waiting for your decision. Dot. The submersible began to surface. Before leaving, Chinning took one last look at the disc and the surrounding stationary objects.

In the eternal darkness of the deep sea, they were like slumbering behemoths, awaiting their awakening. The luminous creatures that surrounded him remained faithfully around the inheritor, as if guarding something sacred. At 300 p.m., the submersible surfaced. The sunlight was blinding, and the sea breeze carried a salty scent. On the distant horizon, the outline of the Muin Pavilion base was faintly visible.

Chining stood on the deck, looking back towards the southeast. They at a depth of 4,000 m on the seabed, a mystery that transcends time and civilization awaits its answer. And they're the only ones who can provide the answer, at least for now. Chapter 157. The mystery of the disc.

As the submersible returned to the Muan Pavilion dock, the setting sun was sinking below the horizon. The orange red light bathed the entire base in a warm hue, but the faces of the people waiting on the dock held little warmth. Linmo, Su Chanchian, sure how and Shin Duo Duo were all there. When Shining, Leewi, and Lao Chin walked onto the dock. All eyes were on them.

No one asked a question, but the question was written in everyone's eyes. The meeting room, Lyno said briefly. 10 minutes later, everyone gathered in the conference room next to the command center. Leeway had already transmitted the data recorded by the submersible to the large screen which displayed a highdefinition image of the deep sea disc and the surrounding stationary inheritors in the center. Shinning spent 20 minutes giving a detailed report of the entire contact process.

From the light signal emitted by the inheritors to their response using fortress authority to the discovery of the underwater disc, every detail was included, such as the surrounding bioluminescent creatures and the unusual aquatic chemistry. The conference room was silent except for the low hum of the air conditioning system. Su Chian was the first to break the silence. She pointed to the static inheritors around the disc. You counted them? 23.

24 including the one we came into contact with. Leeway added, "Seven of them have obvious surface damage as if they've been subjected to some kind of impact. The others look intact, but there is no energy reaction." Dot. Like a parking lot, sure said, or like a fleet on standby. Dot.

Shendo duo stared at the image, her fingers unconsciously tapping the table. Do Soul and the Brotherhood know about this? We probably don't know its exact location yet. Chining said, "Our sonar scans show that the underwater canyon where the disc is located has strong natural magnetic field interference, making it difficult for conventional detection equipment to find. The fact that the inheritor can pinpoint its location indicates that it has a special navigation method. Lynn Mo remained silent.

He stared intently at the docking interface in the center of the disc on the screen. His gaze so focused it was as if he wanted to see through the image. What will happen after docking? He asked calmly. I don't know. Chining answered truthfully.

But the inheritor s initiative in guiding us to this location indicates that it wants us to know and may even want us to participate. It's staying put and waiting for our decision is a form of invitation. Dot. It could also be a trap. Sure.

Hell warrant. Possibly Chinning didn't cheat an eye, but if it s a trap, there is no need for it to display those stationary companions. That would be more like proving its origins. Dot. Such an pulled up the latest monitoring data for the bacterial film.

At the same time you discover the disc, a new pattern of pulsating activity appeared in the bacterial film. Look here. Two columns of data waveforms are displayed on screen. The left side shows the bioelect electrical signal of the bacterial film and the right side shows the highfrequency modulated signal emitted by the inheritor. Before a certain point in time, the waveforms of the two are only roughly correlated.

But after that point in time, the waveforms are almost completely synchronized with even the slightest fluctuations being exactly the same. When does this point in time correspond to? Lynn Mo asked. It was 1 col47 p.m. Such shan said that s when the inheritor showed you the disc pattern from that moment on the signal between the mcelium and the inheritor was completely locked. This wasn't the just simple communication it was synchronization dot has the bacterial film become an extended sensor for the inheritors libeasa or the other way around such chian said the microbial membrane helps the inheritors perceive their environment.

Danty forget the microbial membrane covers vast areas of the ocean. Its microbial network can detect water temperature, salinity, chemical composition, and even biological activity. If the inheritors can read this data, then its understanding of this sea area far surpasses ours," Lin Mo added. Silence fell over the meeting room again. This time, the silence was even heavier.

Outside the window, the sky had completely darkened. The lights of the base came on one by one, outlining the buildings against the deep blue night sky. He glanced at it and his expression changed slightly. Breaking news. He stood up and projected a message onto the secondary screen.

Dragon Soles submarines suddenly began to surface half an hour ago and are now on the surface. They launched lifeboats and evacuated several people judging from their attire. They seem to be researchers. At the same time, their fleet has begun to move southeast of the Dead Seeda. What about the Coral Society? The Seeker of Knowledge salvaged some of the wreckage of Explorer 7, but didn't leave.

They're anchored in place, seemingly planning to spend the night. Chin Duo Duo paused. The Brotherhood's radical fleet is anchored 50 nautical miles away without making any further moves, but the Anvil just sent an encrypted message with only two words. How's it going? He was asking about the docking. Everyone has sense something unusual.

Sure house said although we dant know exactly what it is. A large-scale energy fluctuation in the deep sea cannot be completely concealed though. Line thought for a few minutes and then made a decision. Contact cars. He said we need to know if that disc is recorded in the fortress database.

If it is, what is its function? What is the docking protocol? And what might happen after docking dot? What if Carl doesn't know either? Suchin asked. Then we ll have to make our own judgment. Dot. Lin Mo looked at Shining. Be prepared to set off again.

But this time it is not just about observation. We need to try to establish a deeper communication with the inheritor. If it is indeed waiting for instructions, we need to know what those instructions are and whether we should help it complete the docking dot. The risk is very high. Chining said action carries greater risks.

Lynn Mo replied. There are at least four forces watching this area. Dragon Soul, the Coral Society, the Brotherhood SR radicals and a fourth party we donty know about the owner of that unidentified submersible. If the inheritor falls into the hands of any of these parties, the consequences are unpredictable. Dot.

He paused. Then his voice became more resolute. Instead of passively waiting, we should actively guide them. At least for now, the inheritors have chosen to communicate with us. Once the order was given, all departments began preparations.

Such an Xian and Leewi went to analyze the water and biological samples they brought back, searching for more clues. Sherhow adjusted the defense deployment, preparing for possible conflict. Shin Duo Duo continued to monitor the movements of all parties, especially the intentions of the Dragon Soul Fleet. Chining remained in the conference room, waiting with Linmo for Carl's reply. The reply came at 11 p.m.

Carl's voice came through the encrypted channel, somewhat distorted, but the seriousness in it was palpable. The disc is recorded in the database code named reception platform 7. Design purpose to facilitate the docking, charging, and data exchange of information carriers at the inheritor level. The interface protocol is divided into three levels. basic interface, charging and maintenance, data interface, information upload and download, and task interface, receiving new instructions or uploading task results.

According to the design documents, inheritors typically carry the following types of information: a civilization history database, a technology blueprint library, updated ecological templates, and a civilization status assessment report. Linmo and Chen in exchange of glance, a civilization status assessment report. What might happen after docking depends on the type of information carried by the successor. If it's a technological or ecological update, it might be automatically transmitted to the fortress system. If it's an assessment report, the system might adjust the priority of subsequent tasks based on the report's content.

However, there is a problem. The database shows that reception platform 7 was damaged due to geological activity in the later stages of construction and was marked as abandoned and awaiting repair. Theoretically, it should still be usable. So those static inheritors might be those who failed in their early attempts to connect. Chining asked, "The possibility is very high.

Damage to the platform could cause errors in the docking process, putting the inheritor into a dormant or damaged state. The fact that the one you've contacted is functioning normally indicates that it's either exceptionally lucky or exceptionally advanced." Lynn Mo pondered this information. If we help it connect, is it possible to fix the platform? Uncertain, but since the inheritors guided you to discover the platform, they likely carried a repair protocol or tools. The question is, what conditions are required to repair the platform? Are additional resources needed? Will it activate other systems? None of these are recorded. Another unknown.

Carl, in your opinion, what should we do? Linmo asked directly. A long silence followed. Only a faint electrical hum could be heard in the encrypted channel. My advice, approach with caution and gradually build trust. The final decision rests with you.

I'll be prepared here at the fortress. And if a situation gets out of control, I can attempt remote intervention, though the effect will be limited. Additionally, there's a theory in the database regarding the synchronization phenomenon between the bofilm and the inheritors. The ecological technology of the designer civilization is based on a distributed sensing network. Different ecological units can share sensor data through standard protocols.

The biofilm may be identified by the system as a qualified sensing node and incorporated into the network. This means that the biofilm is no longer just a microbial community. It has become the eyes and ears of the inheritors and possibly the fortresses. This is both a threat and an opportunity for us. If the biofilm can sense it may also be affected.

After the call ended, Linmo and Chinning sat in the conference room for a long time. On the sea outside the window, moonlight illuminated the waves, giving them a silvery glow. In the distance, the dead sea remained dark. But tonight, a deeper undercurrent seemed to be surging within that darkness. "What do you think?" Lin Mo asked.

Shining rubbed his face, looking somewhat tired. "3 years ago, I had a debate with my mentor Carl." He said, "When we are faced with ancient technologies that are far beyond our understanding, what is the wisest course of action? Carl's believed we should study them cautiously and master them step by step. I think we should learn to let go and acknowledge that some things are not meant for us." Dot. And now, now I understand that sometimes you dye have the right to let go. Dot.

Chining smiled bitterly. The inheritors have found us. The microbial membrane is evolving and various forces are closing in. Even if we want to hide, there is nowhere to hide. Dot.

He stood up and walked to the window. So, I agree with your decision. Taking the initiative, at least keeping the initiative in our own hands. But we need a plan, a detailed plan that takes all possibilities into account. At 1:00 in the morning, Su Chian returned with her new discovery.

She held two analysis reports in her hands, her face appearing somewhat pale under the light. Water sample analysis results. the concentration of rare earth elements in the water surrounding the inheritor overlaps by 80% with the coolant composition of the fortress's energy core. She placed the first report on the table. This is not a coincidence.

The inheritor and the fortress used the same technology and may even have been manufactured on the same production line dot. The second report is even more disturbing. We performed gene sequencing on the luminous organisms surrounding the inheritors. Su Chanchian said her voice lowering. They show signs of modification.

Not the large-scale biological recombination of the fortress, but a more refined enhancement of their nervous and sensory systems. In particular, their visual and electromagnetic sensing systems are far more complex than anything that natural evolution can achieve. Who modified them? The genetic markers point to the inheritors. Such Chanchian said it has not a direct modification but rather the release of a certain pheromone that induces the natural evolutionary direction of these organisms. This process may have lasted for decades or even centuries.

Lyno felt a chill. If a successor can guide biological evolution on a scale of hundreds of years, its potential impact on Earth's ecology may be far more profound and hidden than today's fortresses. Did it guide other creatures as well? he asked. We are expanding the testing scope, Su Chian said, but it will take time. However, we have made another discovery.

She pulled up a set of data charts. Gene sequencing of the bacterial film shows that it integrates gene fragments from at least 17 different marine microorganisms, three of which are ancient species that should have gone extinct. These integrations did not happen randomly. There are clear signs of design. The designer, the timeline doesn't team match up.

Sue Chanchian shook her head. The designer's activities took place thousands of years ago, but these gene integrations have occurred within the last 300 years. It is more like the inheritors were continuously collecting biological samples from different planets during their long voyages and then conducting synthesis experiments. here. A messenger from a civilization that had been traveling through the universe for an unknown period of time, collecting biological data along the way, finally arrived on Earth to begin its experiments.

And this experimental site is right outside their door. WLL set off tomorrow morning. Do Lin Mo made the final decision. Chianing, Leewi, and Sue Chan, the three of you will come together. Old Chim will drive.

Mission objective. Establish stable communication with the inheritor and understand its full intentions. If possible, inquire about the risks and benefits of docking. However, you must not assist it in docking without my approval. Dot.

What if it insists on docking? Suchin asked. Then tell it that we need more information to make a decision. Linmo said, "If it really has intelligence, it should be able to understand. If it can't understand, then we have to reassess its danger." Dot. At 3:00 a.m., all preparations were completed.

Explorer 2 was fully charged again, replenished with supplies, and equipped with additional communication and protective equipment. Remember, we are not exploring ruins.

We are engaging in dialogue with another civilization. Maintain respect, but also remain vigilant. The sea is darkest before dawn, but in the darkness, a glimmer of light already awaits in the depths. Chapter 158, the light speaker. At 6:17 a.m., Explorer 2 dived again.

The seawater gradually changed from dark green to deep blue, finally sinking into pure darkness. Only the submersible lights cut through the deep sea, illuminating a small patch of water ahead. The inheritor appeared on the sonar screen. It remained suspended 300 m above the disc, its surface glowing with a steady frequency like a heartbeat in the deep sea.

Slow down and stop at a distance of 500 meters. Chining said the submersibles slowly came to a stop and hovered in the water. This distance was safe enough and also made it easy to observe. The inheritors seemed to sense their arrival. The frequency of the lights flickering changed from a simple regular flashing to a more complex sequence.

Long short long short long short short long short long. This is random flickering. Lee Wayne noted the signal. It has a clear structure, but I don't understand this coding system. Try responding with yesterday's verification code, Chining suggested.

Leeway operated the control panel and sent a string of geometric symbol codes again using sonar. This time, the successor responded quickly. Its surface lights dimmed for 3 seconds. Then, when they returned, the light was highly focused, forming a clear beam in the deep sea. The beam wasn't directed at the submersible, but downwards precisely aimed at the docking port in the center of the disc.

The beam of light lingered at the interface for about 10 seconds, then moved upwards, sweeping across the stationary inheritors before finally stopping on an individual with a damaged surface. The beam moved back and forth across that individual surface as if demonstrating something. What is it telling us? Perhaps it's explaining the state of those stationary individuals, Chinny and Guest. Those that are damaged might be the result of a docking failure. The beam of light shut off.

The inheritor resumed its uniform glow, but this time the light patterns on its surface began to flow, forming dynamic patterns. First, three intersecting rings, then arrows pointing to the disc, followed by a simple diagram. A spindle-shaped object slowly descending and docking with the disc. The diagram is played three times. It's demonstrating the docking process.

Leeway understood. But why does it keep emphasizing this? Because it needs to complete the docking. Suchian suddenly said that's its core task. Just like migratory birds must migrate and seeds must germinate. Docking is the reason for its existence.

The inheritor seemed to have heard those words. Of course not. But its subsequent actions certainly seemed like a response. The light focused again, this time projecting a holographic image into the deep sea. The image was blurry.

The pixels were coarse, but it was recognizable as a schematic diagram of a galaxy. One star, seven planets, with the third one highlighted. The images shifted, revealing the surface of the planet, magnificent cities, bizarre architecture, and creatures. The creatures were indescribable, like a combination of light and geometry without a fixed form, more like condensations of energy. The designers are civilized, Chining whispered.

The images continued to shift. Anomalies began to appear on the planet's surface. First, a dramatic climate change, then intensified geological activity, and finally a spreading gray substance like mold covering the land. Cities dimmed and collapsed one after another. The luminous creatures struggled, their numbers dwindling dramatically.

The final scene, several fortress-like structures rise from the planet's surface and soar into the stars. One heads toward the moon of a third planet, while another journeys into even more distant space. Meanwhile, more luminous beings converge, forming streams of light that flow into these structures. The video ends. The inheritor's light dimmed as if he had exhausted his energy or fallen into some kind of emotional state.

Silence rained inside the submersible. The four men stared at the location of the vanished image, speechless for a long time. That was their doomsday. That Sue Chanchian finally spoke, her voice very soft. Could the gray substance be some kind of runaway biotechnology or a product of environmental collapse? It asks more like a combination of both.

dot leeway analyzed the last frame of the image. Those gray substances have a clear growth pattern like living organisms, but they can also spread on non-living surfaces. They may be a fusion of some kind of nanomechanical and organic matter. The fortress was their arc of escape. The second was an unknown star region. And the third was the solar system with Earth specifically marked. Following the star chart is a series of data, timestamps, flight path, and energy consumption curve. The last line shows 7.3% remaining energy. It s running out of energy.

Leeway understood the data. After a long journey from its home planet, it s about to run out of energy. So, it has to dock. Otherwise, it will be like those static individuals forever dormant here. D.

So, this isn't a choice. It's a survival need. The successor demonstrated the docking diagram again, but this time next to the diagram, another set of data was displayed. The minimum energy required for docking 12%. And it currently only had 7.3%.

a structural diagram of the fortress with the energy core area highlighted. Then came a transmission diagram, the energy transmission path from the fortress to the deep sea disc. Dot. Sue Chanchian stared at the data. The inheritor sent out some kind of signal, and the bacterial membrane is responding. These extensions may be going to repair the disc. Sure enough, the light on the inheritor's surface changed to a rapid flashing pattern, three times the frequency of before.

With this signal, the movement speed of the bacterial membrane extension increased again. It can't wait any longer, Chinnying judged. With insufficient energy and a docking urgent, it has begun to mobilize all available resources. The bacterial membrane has now become its engineering team. Dot.

Dot. Shining looked at the communicator. Lynmo Uve heard the situation. The inheritor needs energy to complete the docking and now it s starting to repair the platform itself. Should we assist? If we do, it might require using the fortresses s energy.
