Then Lynn Mo's voice came through calm and clear, asking three questions. First, what will it do after docking? Second, how long will docking take? Third, are we allowed to monitor and intervene during the docking process? The problem was converted into an optical signal and sent.

The inheritor's response was direct. It projected three short sequences of images. The first sequence. After docking was completed, a pillar of light rose from the center of the disc, and a large amount of data stream appeared within it. The data stream flowed in three directions.

A portion went to the inheritor, a portion went to the disc storage, and a small portion went to the fortress. The second sequence, the docking process lasts approximately 72 hours. During this time, the successor enters a low power state, primarily performing data verification and system selfch checks. The third sequence, a transparent energy barrier appears around the disk labeled isolation protection field. Outside the barrier, a permitted observation sign is displayed, but the intervention sign is crossed out.

It only allows us to look, not touch, Leeway concluded. Moreover, there will be data sharing after docking. Sue Chanchian was focused on the first sequence. Some of the data will be given to the fortress. This may be what it calls the civilization status assessment report or a technology update.

Duh. Chining pondered, "If we provide energy, what will we get in return? Just a right to observe." The inheritor seemed to have anticipated this question. Historical archives, basic technologies, ecological knowledge and local adaptation suggestions. It s offering a trade. Lynn Mo asked over the communicator. This time the inheritor did not answer directly.

It deactivated all images and returned to its basic luminous state. The light flickered slowly as if waiting. It is waiting for a decision based on trust. Inside the submersible, the four men exchanged glances. Old Chin shrugged.

The shadow finally said, "Let cars draw the bare minimum of energy from the fortress, just enough to initiate the docking procedure. Chapter 159. The pillar of light changes. 7 minutes after the energy transfer began, the deep sea disc underwent its first change. When they were 50 m from the disc, a sudden change occurred. At the edge of the disc, a damaged inheritor that had been stationary suddenly lit up.

It wasn't a continuous radiance, but rather intermittent spasmotic flashes. A dark red light emanated from the cracks on the surface of the spindle like the last heartbeat of a dying creature. Forcibly cutting it off may cause a backlash, damaging the fortress's output port. asterisk asterisk. Carl's voice carried an unusual tension. The flickering of the damaged inheritor grew increasingly rapid. Within the dark red light, something could be vaguely seen writhing inside.

spreading through the gaps in the luminous components. Those hy were absorbing the dissipated energy and multiplying at an astonishing rate. It using this damaged organism as a petri dished Sue Chansians voice tightened. It absorbs energy reproduces rapidly and then who knows what it will become. Dot.

The tremors of the damaged inheritor intensified. Suddenly, a larger crack appeared at its front end. not a mechanical opening, but more like a tear in the biomass. From the crack, a mass of grayish white substance surged out a highly concentrated clump of bacterial film. But with a denser structure and a pulsating sheen on its surface after separating from its inheritor, the mass of matter began to slowly drift in the deep sea.

It had no fixed shape, resembling a conscious mass of slime, moving towards the disc. It asked recycling materials. Chining understood. The damaged object is useless, but the bacterial membrane inside still has value. It has going to recycle these reinforced bacterial membranes to repair the disc dot.

Just as he expected, the clump of bacterial film mucus quickly merged into the bacterial film network on the surface after reaching the edge of the disc. At the moment of fusion, the brightness of the bacterial film in the surrounding area increased significantly and the repair speed accelerated by at least three times. It's learning and optimizing. Sue Shian recorded the data and it's learning very quickly. Every time the enhanced bacterial membrane is recycled, the overall network efficiency improves significantly.

At this rate, she didn't finish her sentence, but Chinny understood what she meant. At this rate, the bacterial membrane might evolve to a level that they couldn't possibly comprehend before the docking was completed. The inheritor seemed unconcerned. It had descended to a position 20 m from the disc, its speed slowing further. The guiding light at the front was thinner and brighter, like a surgical laser scalpel.

At the center of the disc, the light from the innermost ring finally shown, but it wasn't the expected gold or white. Instead, it was a deep purple. The moment the purple light appeared, the entire disc vibrated. Not a physical vibration, but more like a violent fluctuation of the energy field. The monitoring instrument also triggered an alarm.

Energy readings have skyrocketed. Leeway's voice rose 200% above the safety threshold. Carl's has the transmission power been increased. The fortress's output is stable. The disc itself is drawing energy.

It's activating some hidden system. asterisk asterisk. Purple light radiated outwards from the center of the disc, spreading rapidly along the engravings. Wherever the purple light touched the surface, the bacterial membrane contracted and detached as if scalded. However, the detached membrane did not die.

It clumped together and floated in the surrounding seawater like a school of startled fish. The ultraviolet light is repelling the bacterial film. Su Chanchian stared at the screen. No, it s not repelling. It s disinfecting.

The ultraviolet light has a bacteriaidal effect. It s cleaning the contamination on the surface of the disc. Dot. The bacterial membrane seemed to sense a threat. The entire network's activity pattern abruptly changed, shifting from orderly repair to a defensive state.

The extensions ceased advancing, and the gold lines on their surface dimmed, replaced by a dark red reactive pulsation. The inheritor stopped 10 m away from the disc. The light on its surface began to flicker rapidly, so fast that it almost became a continuous flash. At the same time, it projected a brief image towards the submersible. A warning sign see a triangle with an exclamation mark inside.

Below is a line of incomprehensible symbols, but next to the symbols is a diagram. Purple light spreads covering the entire disc and then 12 spike structures rise from the edge of the disc with energy gathering at the top of the structures. A defensive weapon system. The shadowy figure reacted immediately. The disc isn't just a docking platform.

It also has self-defense capabilities. The purple light is part of the activation program. Decoding disc data stream for confirmation. Hidden protocol. Clean protocol function removes all unauthorized biomass from the platform.

Secondary protocol defense protocol activation condition platform core functions restored to more than 30%. Carl's voice was tinged with frustration. The functionality we restored for it was just enough to trigger the defense protocol. Can we stop it? Lynn Mo asked. Higher privileges are required or authorization from the inheritor themselves is also required.

Everyone looked at the inheritor. It remained suspended there, the frequency of its flashing light revealing a sense of hesitation. It seems it didn't anticipate this situation either. The purple light had already covered half of the disc. The bacterial network began to retreat in an organized manner, not to escape, but to regroup in the areas around the edge of the disc not covered by the purple light.

These clumps merged together, forming thicker tentacle-like structures, the tips of which began to secrete a dark green mucus. When a mucus came into contact with the edge of the violet light, it hissed like cold water dripping into hot oil. The expansion rate of the violet light slowed down significantly. The bacterial film is fighting back. Sue Chanchian said incredulously, "It is secretting acidic substances to neutralize the violet light.

This requires real-time analysis of the spectral composition and adjustment of the chemical ratio of the secretions. This is not just intelligence. It has close to the ability to creatively solve problems. The struggle between the bacterial membrane and the disc reached a stalemate. The purple light could no longer expand and the bacterial membrane could not regain its lost territory.

Between the two, the inheritor floated silently like a referee or perhaps the root of the conflict. Time passed second by second. Energy transfer continues and the disc's functional recovery rate slowly climbs 39% 40%. When it reaches 41%, the first spike structure on the edge of the disc fully rises. It was a cone-shaped object about 3 m long with a smooth mirror-like surface and a spherical energy focusing device at the top.

Pale blue light spots began to gather inside the device, rotating and accelerating, their brightness continuously increasing. Defensive weapon charging. Leeway read out the data. It is expected to reach the launch threshold in 45 seconds. The target appears to be the area with the densest bacterial film accumulation.

But the bacterial film is currently in physical contact with the disc. Such an said attacking the bacterial film could damage the disc itself. Dot. Maybe it doesn't teare. The shadowy figure stared at the spike.

Maybe the clean protocol takes precedence over platform integrity. The successor finally made a move. Instead of rising or falling, it began to rotate slowly around its own central axis. It spun like a top. As the rotation accelerated, the light on its surface was stretched into a spiral band of light, drawing dazzling trails in the deep sea.

Symbols began to emerge from the band of light, not the geometric pattern seen before, but a more ancient and abstract hieroglyphic script. The characters flowed and combined, eventually forming a complete message. Carl sent the translation almost simultaneously. It is requesting root access. It wants to temporarily take control of the disk and suspend the defense protocol.

However, it requires verification of a witness. What is a witness? Lynn Mo asked. Uncertain. It may refer to the entities qualified to observe and verify this event. According to the laws or traditions of the designer civilization, certain important decisions require the presence of witnesses to ensure impartiality.

The inheritor's rotation speed reached its peak. The text in a band of light began to repeat growing brighter and brighter as if calling out or perhaps pleading. Inside the submersible, the four people looked at each other in bewilderment. It s asking us suian suddenly said, "We are the only intelligent life it has encountered. It s asking us to be witnesses." How do we do it? Olin asked.

Nobody knows. But the inheritor provided the answer. It projected the final image, a simple gesture, right hand on left shoulder, then palm facing upwards and outstretched. A gesture of respect that signifies witnessing and consent. Should we respond? Leewi asked Chinning.

Chinninging looked at the communicator, waiting for Lin Mo's decision. There was a long silence on the other end of the command center. After a long time, the first spike reached 90% charge, and the pale blue light was already dazzling. Eventually, the bacterial film began preparing for a second round of chemical counterattack. And the amount of dark green mucus secreted tripled.

Finally, Lynmo's voice came. Go ahead and do it, but only on our personal behalf, not on behalf of human civilization. We witness, but we don't endorse. Tell it that. Inside the submersible, Channing took a deep breath.

He stood up and walked to the observation window, though the inheritor couldn't see what was happening inside the cabin. Then he made that gesture, his right hand on his left shoulder, palm facing upwards. Lewi and Su Chanchian exchanged a glance and did the same. Chin nodded and raised his hand from the driver's seat. The inheritor stopped spinning.

The light momentarily subsided, then exploded outwards. It wasn't an aggressive burst, but rather a gentle inclusive wave of light that rippled outwards from its center. The light wave swept across the disc. The purple light went out. The spike structure stopped charging.

The pale blue light dimmed rapidly, and the device slowly retracted. The bacterial film seemed to sense the change, ceasing to secrete acidic mucus, and the tentacle-like structure softened, spread out, and returned to its flat state during repair. At the center of the disc, the docking interface is fully lit up this time in pure gold. The inheritor begins its final descent. This time there was no hesitation, no pause.

It precisely aligned with the interface and slowly sank in. The entire deep sea was silent for a second at the moment of docking. Then the disc burst forth with indescribable light. It wasn't a blinding intense light, but a warm dawn-like glow that filled the entire underwater canyon. In this light, the cracks on the still damaged relics began to slowly heal.

not repaired, but rather gently enveloped and smoothed. The bacterial film became transparent in the light and then gradually disappeared, not because it died, but because it merged into the seawater like salt dissolving in water. The light lasted for a full minute. As the light gradually dimmed, a pillar of light rose from the center of a disc. Within the pillar of light, data streams poured forth like a waterfall.

The successor's mission is complete. The four people inside the submersible still maintained that gesture of witnessing like four silent sculptures in the gradually darkening deep sea. Chapter 1 60 data decoding. The beam of light lasted for 17 minutes in the deep sea. Explorer 2 hovered at a safe distance.

The only sounds in the cabin, the low hum of instruments and the suppressed breathing of the four crew members. On the monitor screen, a golden stream of data poured out from the center of the disc like a waterfall flowing backward, standing out starkly against the dark seawater. Such an was the first to break the silence. The bacterial film has really disappeared completely. Not only the bacterial film on the surface of the disc, but also the suspended bacterial film clumps in the surrounding seawater and the mcelium that had previously invaded and damaged the inheritor, all gradually became transparent and dissipated after the pillar of light rose.

It wasn't death, but more like a kind of return, merging back into the seawater and becoming part of the background. The readings of the active factor on the monitor decreased synchronously, falling from the peak to near the background level. The light beam has a purifying effect, Leeway said, pulling up a spectral analyzer. It is not just about energy transfer. The specific frequency electromagnetic waves it releases can break down the polymer structure of the bacterial bofilm, allowing the microorganisms to return to their independent state.

But this requires extremely precise frequency control. Dot. Chinying remains silent, staring at the small countdown timer on the screen. Carl had previously stated that the docking process would last approximately 72 hours, but the beam phenomenon wasn't recorded in detail in the database. This unexpected situation likely meant the docking was more complex or more dangerous than anticipated.

Lynn Mos voice came through the communicator, calm yet slightly tense. Deep sea submersible reporting status. Everything is normal, Old Chin replied. The energy field is stable and there is no direct threat, but there are unusual sonar echoes underwater, not from the disc, but from somewhere further away. Positions southeast about 8 nautical miles away at a depth of 600 m.

The signal is very weak, but its characteristics are similar to those of previously discovered unidentified submersibles. That mysterious fourth party is still nearby. Maintain vigilance, but do not initiate contact. Linmo ordered any new information from Carl's side receiving data stream. The transmission rate is astonishing.

The Fortress's storage system is already at 37% capacity and is still rising. The data encryption method is complex. Initial decoding will take time. Carl's report came through an encrypted channel with the sound of rapid keyboard typing audible in the background. But one thing is certain, this is not a one-way transmission.

The disk is inputting energy into the inheritor. The inheritor is outputting data into the disk and simultaneously some data is flowing towards the fortress through the disc is a three-way exchange. What about the content? Hidden shadow asked. Preliminary analysis has revealed several tags. Civilization chronicle, technology tree map, ecological evolution record, and final message.

Final message has the highest priority and is currently being decoded first. The final message. These words made the air in the cabin even heavier. The beams of light began to change. The brightness gradually decreased, shifting from a dazzling gold to a soft white.

The visualization of the data stream also changed. It was no longer a cascading waterfall, but rather orderly categorized bands of light with different colors representing different types of data. The white beam of light lasted for about 3 minutes, then went out without warning. The deep sea plunged into darkness once more. Only the docking interface at the center of the disc glowed faintly with a blue light, flickering like breath.

The inheritor had completely sunk into the disc and was no longer visible. Phase one complete. That leeway read out the monitoring data. Energy transmission has stopped and data exchange has switched to low power mode. The disc surface temperature has begun to drop and is expected to return to ambient temperature in 2 hours.

Was the docking successful? Suchin asked. According to the fortress's confirmation, the core data packet has been transmitted completely. However, the status of the inheritor itself is uncertain. Signals from the disc indicate that it has entered deep hibernation, possibly a necessary recovery period after a long voyage. How long will the hibernation last? Unpredictable.

There are no similar cases recorded in the database. It could take days, years, or even forever. Forever. This word carries an especially heavy weight in the deep sea. Explorer 2 began its slow ascent.

The mission was complete, at least for this stage. They witnessed the docking, ensuring a relatively smooth process, and now needed to return to base to await Carl's decoding of the data. Upon ascending to a depth of 200 m, the sonar detected the unidentified submersible signal again. This time it was clearer at a distance of about 5 nautical miles in the same depth. However, it did not approach.

It merely hovered at that distance as if observing or waiting for something. It has spying on us. Oldchin said it could also be a surveillance disc. The shadowy figure stared at the sonar screen. Whatever its purpose, it has best to avoid conflict for now.

continue ascending and maintain normal speed. Dot. It was already evening when the submersible surfaced. The setting sun dyed the sea a golden red and the lights of the Muan Pavilion base in the distance lit up one after another like a string of pearls in the darkening sky. At the dock, Linmo and sure how we're waiting for them.

There was no welcoming ceremony, no unnecessary pleasantries. Linmo went straight to the point. What's your immediate impression of the data stream you've been seeing? The volume is huge, Leewayi replied. And it is highly structured. It is not like random transmission, but more like a carefully prepared database transfer.

Dot. The dissipation of the bacterial film was a pleasant surprise. Suchinian added. But I'm not sure if it is permanent. The microbial basis of the film is still in the seawater and it could recombine at any time if conditions are right.

Dot. Chining was the last to disembark. He walked up to Lynmo and said in a low voice, "I think that witness request is more than just going through the motions. It needs someone to confirm that this happened. It needs someone to remember it." Lynmo nodded without asking further questions.

"Go and rest first. We'll meet in the conference room in an hour." Carl should be able to provide preliminary decoding results then, but the break time was less than an hour. 45 minutes later, an emergency communication brought everyone back to the command center. Instead of a written report, Carl sent an audio message he had decoded a portion of the final message and converted it into a comprehensible speech format. Play.

Carl's text message flashed on the screen. Play. Linmo said. The command center fell silent. A slight electrical noise came from the loudspeaker first and then a voice rang out.

It's not human language but a translated synthesized soundneutral calm and carrying a sense of timelessness. To the person who discovers this message. If you hear this record, it means our civilization has come to an end. This inheritor carrying all our knowledge and memories set out in the final moments before the collapse of our home system. Its mission is to find a suitable new home and pass on our lessons to those who come after.

The sound paused for a few seconds as if giving the listener time to process it. We hope you will avoid the mistakes our people have made. We once believed that technology was sufficient to control nature and that modifying the environment was merely an engineering problem. We reshaped the atmosphere, adjusted the Earth's axis, and even redesigned every aspect of the ecosystem. We created a perfect, efficient, standard ecosystem that met all our needs.

Then the system crashed. It's not an invasion by external enemies, nor a depletion of resources, but a tiny mutation within the system. A type of microorganism we never anticipated, born in the cracks of the perfect ecosystem. It feeds on the energy flows we design, uses the materials we synthesize as its foundation, and evolves at a speed beyond our comprehension. We call it great devourer.

It meant no harm. It simply existed, but its existence overturned all our designs. When perfection cannot tolerate even the slightest imperfection, collapse becomes inevitable. The data carried by the inheritor contains our rac's complete technological archives as well as detailed research records on Ash Devour. Please use the former with caution and pay close attention to the latter.

Ecosystems are not machines. They cannot be fully designed, much less fully controlled. Balance is not static perfection but dynamic tolerance. Allowing variation, allowing errors, allowing imperfections. That is the true foundation for the continuation of life.

May you do even better. Message ended. Recording stopped. A long silence fell over the command center. Suchan was the first to speak, her voice trembling slightly.

Could the gray devour bacterial membrane be? They read not the same thing, but the principles are similar to Lynn Mo continued her words. They are both accidental products born in highly controlled environments. The designer civilization created the standard ecology which resulted in the emergence of gray devourer. We forced the blueprint to be enforced in a fortress which resulted in the emergence of the microbial film. Dot.

So they left behind successors not just to pass on the technology but also to pass on the lessons. Chinying said in a low voice. But Wings of Liberty only saw the technology, not the lessons. Dot. Chin Dodu rushed in at that moment, holding the latest intelligence.

Dragon Souls fleet has begun moving towards the Dead Sea. Not fast, but the direction is clear. The Coral Society's seeking knowledge suddenly stopped its salvage operation, and all personnel retreated to the cabin for unknown reasons. The Brotherhood's radical factions fleet has disappeared. Disappear? It wasn't a departure.

It was a communications blackout. The last signal location was on the southeastern edge of the Dead Sea. And then all communications were cut off. Not even the emergency beacon was triggered. Chandwood's face was grim.

The anvil might be doing something extreme. Lynmo walked to the control panel and brought up the C map. Dragon Soul, Coral Society, Brotherhood, all forces were in action, though in different ways, but their target was clearly the deep sea disc that had just completed docking. Carl's how has the data decoding progress? He asked. The technology tree map is 15% decoded and the content is astounding.

It includes energy technologies, material science, and even finite space folding theories that we haven't yet mastered. However, all the technical documents come with a warning label requires careful evaluation in conjunction with the ecological ethics section. The ecological evolution record is being decoded, primarily containing data on the ecological changes of the designer's home planet over hundreds of millions of years, as well as every decision-making step and its consequences during the transformation process. This data is enormous and may take several weeks to fully analyze. The full version of the last message is still being decoded.

Lyno thought for a moment and then made a decision. Make three copies of all decoded data and store them encrypted separately. The technical parts should be sealed off and not used without evaluation. Ecological records should be given priority for research, especially the evolution process and countermeasures of great devouring. How should we deal with dragon soul? Shh asked.

Take the initiative to contact them, Linmo said. Send them a portion of the audio clip of the last message, especially the part about the ecological lessons. also provide real-time monitoring data of the disc area to show that we have the situation under control. If they are wise, they will pause their operations. Dot.

What if they're not wise? Then let them see if a system that can instantly purify the bacterial film has any defensive capabilities. Lynmo's tone was calm, but the meaning behind his words was clear. The meeting concluded, and everyone went about their respective tasks. Su Chian Xian and Leewi went to study the newly decoded ecological data. Chin Duo Duo went to contact various forces.

Sure, how when to strengthen the base's defenses. Chining stay behind and stood in front of the control panel with Linmo. Do you think the successor will wake up again? The shadow asked. I don't know. Linmo looked at the real-time monitoring footage of the disc area on the screen, but it has accomplished its core mission to transmit information and lessons.

The rest is up to us. Outside the window, night had completely fallen. On the sea, the lights of Muan Pavilion stood steadfast in the darkness. Deep beneath the sea. The disc lies quietly at the bottom of the canyon.

Its blue light from the interface flashing rhythmically. Inside it, the interstellar traveler slumbers, carrying the last legacy of a civilization and a somber lesson. The data has been handed over. The choice now rests with the recipient. What will they choose? Nobody knows.

But at least for now, they still have a choice.
